updates.update_content:
Hey all!
We are funded! I've said it before, I'll say it again, from everyone on the team, thank you so much for backing the project and allowing us to bring the second issue of Raise Hell! to print!
As it stands, we're in the standard post-campaign waiting period as payment processes. As noted in the previous update, though, we're using that time to get ready for print so that we can get the book out the door ahead of schedule if possible.

Hey all!
Why the Majora's Mask reference up top? No clue, just felt right! And it certainly fits, as today is the last day of the campaign!
Spare a Share?
With this being the last day, our last big goal is to simply get the project in front of as many eyes as possible. As noted before, we have no official stretch goal, but the better this campaign does, the quicker and easier we can get started on bringing the next issue out. Frankly, this campaign has done extremely well for a continuation; though we're unlikely to surpass our first campaign total (though never say never!), we've managed to retain a sizeable audience while also attracting a lot of new readers. Indie comics is a tough game promotionally, so thank you for sticking with or joining us as we work to keep making more

Hey all!
I'm extremely excited to say that as of earlier this afternoon, we've crossed our funding goal! We knew going into this campaign that there was a good chance we might see some shrinkage (comics!), so it was a bit nerve-wracking guaranteeing a back-up story and raising our funding goal to match. Add to that the fact this was our first continuation/second-issue campaign, we really had no idea what to expect. Because of your support, our belief in the project was justified, so from both Ray and myself, thank you so much for joining us back in Eklund for another story of terrible teens and devious demons!

Hello all!
We're nearing the end of week two, which also means we've got just over a week left until the deadline! Fortunately, we're also sitting just short of 80% funded, so things are looking good. That said, we're always open to funding sooner, so keep sharing the link!
Back-Up Story Preview

Hey all!
We're solidly into our second week of the campaign, and while that means we're also into the expected mid-campaign slowdown, things are still on track to hit funding before the project ends! Still, if we can find ways to try and kick things up, no harm in it, so we're back with a couple of quick updates to the reward add-ons!
Finding Peace

Hey all!
With week one of the campaign drawing to a close, we wanted to check in once again and, in addition to thanking and welcoming all of our new backers, share another new peek at issue two! The world of Raise Hell! is expanding into wider, weirder realms than just the purely demonic. While our first character spotlight focused in on the relatively normal Himiko, this time around, things are fueled by black magic and witchcraft.

updates.update_userinfo: End of Week One & A New Spotlight!
updates.update_content:
Hey all!
Let's get right to it, what an amazing first day! Between the larger funding goal and this being our first continuation campaign, Ray and I came into today with plenty of nerves, so smashing all the way up to 47% funded in the first 24 hours has helped us relax a good deal. Whether you're a new backer checking out one of our catch-up reward levels or a returning reader, we're happy to have you and can't wait to share more of the book as the month rolls on!

project_data.project_name: Raise Hell! Issues 1 & 2

campaign.story:
There'll be scary ghost stories
   And tales of the glories
   Of Christmases long, long ago
- Andy Williams, "It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year" 


What is YULE? 
Yule. Geol. Weihnachten. Winter Solstice. 
Before the soda drinking bears, before the bright red suit, and before the litany of saccharine films & music that saturate every holiday season, there was cold and night and fear.  
Cover Image by Donna Black, Yule Logo by LetterSquids
This collection of short horror comics will examine Yule, Winter Solstice, Saturnalia, and a slew of other terrifying folklore from around the world, from well-known tales of Krampus to the lesser-known Mari Lwyd, and all the bizarre traditions in between. 
Art by Meredith McClaren
THE TEAMS
Contributing to this book is an all-star lineup of talent, with each team producing tight-and-terrorizing tales based on 14 different pieces of worldwide folklore:
MARI LWYD from Justin Jordan and Val Halhovorson 
KRAMPUS from Umar Ditta, Elliot Balson, Mike Maynard, and Rob Jones 
KARANKONCOLOS from Frankee White, Fell Hound, and DC Hopkins 
BELSNICKEL from Dillon Gilbertson and Matt Battaglia 
CAGA TIOS from Heather Vaughan and Jason Piperberg 
SMEE from Malissa White and Anastasia Longoria 
ELF ON THE SHELF from Kacey Flynn and J Schiek 
HANS TRAPP from Alex Schlitz and Grant Stoye 
MIDNIGHT SPEECH from Meredith McClaren 
TOES from Jack Foster 
GRYLA from Ian Mondrick and Kam White  
HUITZILOPOCHTILI from Jarred Lujan and Gregery Miller 
SATURNALIA from Joe Corallo and Elena Gogou 
PERCHTEN from Jenn St Onge 
Logo Design by LetterSquids 
Cover Art by Donna Black 
Lettering and Book Design by Toben Racicot 
Foreword by Heather Antos 
We'll also have incredible pin-up pieces from Minerva Fox, Marie Wolf, and Marie Enger.

BUDGETING
The $15,000 goal is the largest I've ever pursued, but it is to meet the compensation that each creator involved deserves: $9,000 will be going directly to the teams that made this book, with around $4,500 going to printing and shipping. The remaining costs are split between merch, design, and recouping some of the expenses I've paid out of pocket for this book.  
Art by Heather Vaughan & Jason Piperberg
Art by Alex Schlitz
Art by Gregery Miller
Art by Elena Gogou

Art by Fell Hound
What Others are Saying
NEW ADD ONs
Due to popular demand, we have created an add-on feature where you can order additional copies of YULE for friends, family, and frenemies. Also included in the add-ons is a new print from Alaire Racicot (Crown & Anchor, Sidequest):
This Krampus is only for the brave of heart
And a new print from our cover artist, Donna Black, featuring the one and only Mari Lwyd!
Do not let it in.
And for one of our higher tiers, this stunning original watercolor piece from Jack Foster's story, Bells Ring:
Art by Jack Foster, Amidala for scale
This piece measures 17x22, and it will be difficult not to worship. 

STRETCH GOALS
Every stretch goal we shoot for with YULE involves putting money into the pockets of the creators, additional shipping and printing costs excluded. 
$18,100 sees each creator involved pocket an extra hundred bucks. 
$21,500 gives each creator two hundred dollars. 
$31,000 has every creator take home an extra $500
Any additional funds go to printing, shipping, and blood sacrifices to make YULE vol 2.  
Artwork by Matt Battaglia
Artwork by J Schiek
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This book is currently 80% completed, so the only risks would be in printing (minimal) and shipping (minimal). This will be my fourth Kickstarter, with the other three each being successfully funded. 

Or that we upset an Olde God and are struck down.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Sweet Dreams
support.descp: A single dollar grants you one night of gentle dreams, sparing you from the nightmares you otherwise deserve. Use at your own discretion.

support.title: A Whispered Name
support.descp: The digital edition of YULE, thereby putting you out of harm's way this holiday season.

support.title: Santa's Little Helper
support.descp: This gets you the physical copy of YULE as well as the digital edition. Sleep well during Winter Solstice, let others harbor the cold fear.

support.title: A Stuffed Stocking
support.descp: Have you evaded the Yule Lads? Consider yourself lucky, and count your blessings: both versions of YULE, a bookmark to keep pages pristine, a sticker to denote your possession, and a temporary tattoo to mark yourself a believer.

support.title: the Matt Battaglia
support.descp: Does the image, or even the mere THOUGHT, of the Belsnickel fill you with fright? Well, in this tier the artist on our Belsnickel story, the uncanny Matt Battaglia, will provide you with a 4x6 sketch card of his wonderfully terrible design, or an interpretation of any other character in YULE, as well as the print copy of YULE itself.

support.title: the J Schiek
support.descp: When the elves observe you, you must watch your step. But in this tier, the prolific J Schiek will capture one of his frightening elves in an original postcard-sized (4x5) piece for YOU to observe, in addition to a physical copy of YULE.

support.title: the Marie Enger
support.descp: With this tier, the haunting Marie Enger sees fit to mark you safe from harm with a Krampus pin. With this, the dark Christmas beast will avoid your doorstep, but will still probably rough up your neighbor. All's fair, eh? This gets you print copy of YULE as well.

support.title: the Meredith McClaren
support.descp: In "Bliss," the amazing Meredith McClaren tells a story of a pet with a secret. Does YOUR pet have any secrets? In this tier Meredith will provide you with a 2.5x3.5 sketch card of YOUR pet, as well as a print copy of YULE.

support.title: Retailer Tier 1
support.descp: Get five physical copies of YULE to horrify your patrons and the promise of dreadful holidays.

support.title: Retailer Tier 2
support.descp: You are bequeathed 10 copies of YULE to dispense per your discretion. Try not to let the wicked power you wield infect you.

support.title: A Riddle, Answered
support.descp: EARLY BIRD - What is the best deal possible for the season of greed? A digital copy, squirrelled away, at a discounted price.

support.title: Yuletide Carol
support.descp: EARLY BIRD - get the print copy of Yule as well as the digital edition. Such a lovely choice hides your sins from the Belsnickle.

support.title: the Cabbage
support.descp: In addition to a physical copy of YULE, you also ensorcell a mythical being to do your bidding: Christa "Cabbage Comics" Harader will perform an edit on your script. You will get a first draft edit (scripts up to 25 pages) and a follow-up for clarification of notes and answering questions. Sharpen your draft for the blood-letting.

support.title: Gifts For the Tree
support.descp:
In addition to both versions of the book, you will receive a YULE ornament to adorn your sacrificial fir tree this holiday season. Guaranteed to keep the cruel whispers of the Karankoncolos out of your ears.
Also includes a bookmark & a sticker to mark your last whereabouts.

support.title: The Heather Vaughan
support.descp: There are fewer stories more unsettling than our Caga Tios tale, and with this reward tier you'll receive a unique 3x5 Yuletide log courtesy of the fantastic Heather Vaughan, priestess of the Log Muse. Will they terrify you? Delight you? Only the Log knows.

support.title: Sidequest & Frightfest
support.descp:
This tier sees you getting the digital & physical copies of YULE, and a haunch (issues 1 and 2) of Sidequest, Grant's fantasy comic. Also a bookmark, to keep your pages pure.
So many treats, only for good children.

support.title: the Anastasia Longoria
support.descp:
With this tier, you receive a stunning piece featuring YOU on a search for a Victorian ghost, courtesy of the incredible Anastasia Longoria in a linocut/woodcarving-inspired print. Also includes a physical copy of YULE.
Who knows, maybe you'll find your own ghost as well?

support.title: the Jack Foster
support.descp:
Our largest piece of YULE original art, this haunting watercolor from Jack Foster will leave you dazzled by its beauty, but in fear of who pulls the string...
Also includes a physical copy of YULE.

updates.update_content:
It's been a while between updates, and for that I apologize - life sometimes gets in the way. BUT BUT BUT, we have some pretty damn cool news to share!

First off, the art rewards are wrapping up, and they are spectacular. We REALLY think you're going to dig 'em, and hopefully you can put them above your mantle during the holidays and bask in the glow of solstices past.

Wow, it's been just over a week and it still doesn't feel real - the flood of support y'all showed has humbled every single one of us involved in this book. Thank you so, so much. 

Today I'll be working on contacting the various tier winners in regards to their rewards, so keep an eye on your mailboxes! I'll also be sending out the reward surveys, so please try to reply to those as soon as you can. 

On the book front, we have about four stories finishing up, and in the meantime, we'll be working on the arrangement of the book. When I saw "we" I mean "Toben Racicot," who is one of the most skilled comics people I've met. He's in charge of how the stories will fit together in this tome, and getting it ready for distribution via print & digital, which is yeoman's work. Also, did you know he's lettering several stories too? I swear, Toben and Lettersquids are the lifeblood for this book, and it certainly wouldn't be possible without them.

Dark tidings, fellow believers. 

Our numbers are increasing as more have heard the siren song of sleighbells - we sit on the precipice of $8,000 with a week left. This is thanks in part to a bevy of new rewards, add-ons, and news, all provided by a wonderful support system of creators. 

A Foreword Forewarning

**editor's warning: Grant is breaking the bit to deliver news, so just act scared when he talks**

BOO! 
Gotcha!

Greetings fellow folklore enthusiasts,

The blessings we have received have indeed pleased the sleeping winter spirits, as we have surpassed 25% funding for YULE! With just under three weeks to go we are in a fantastic spot to make it to our end goal, thanks in no small part to the generosity of you all. Thank you so much for your support and your belief, the latter of which always satisfies Gryla. **shudder**

Good morrow, weary travelers
The first two days of this campaign were like a ray of sunlight piercing the storm clouds above us: over 100 backers, over $2,000.  Pristine instruments to fight the cold. 
To reward your efforts, we wish to provide you a sweet Christmas treat: a page from the accursed Belsnickel tale. This story is rife with tension, so tread carefully as you set your sights below.

project_data.project_name: Yule: Dreadful Tales for the Holiday Season

campaign.story:
Outlaws seeking redemption. Cowpolk seeking revenge. Horses. Everybody loves a good western, so let's give them a bunch to read.

Cover art by Jimmy Kucaj. Temporary lettering by Brentt Harshman (not final)
Off Into The Sunset is a 120+ Page anthology curated by Brentt Harshman collecting stories inspired by westerns. Whether the story is a straight up classic western or a spy story using narrative devices popularized by westerns, a western set on a distant planet or a couple of disgraced knights trying to redeem their names, this anthology has got it all. The book is in full color, though some teams have opted to tell their stories in black and white feeling it fit their tone better.

Concept art by Skylar Patridge for story with Brent Fisher and Liana Kangas
Concept and Character Art by Kenneth Laster
Snippet of a page by Randy Haldeman for his story with Mario Candelaria

 Art by Heather Vaughan for story with David Ashburn

Page of pencils for Last Canteen by Ben Humeniuk
Character designs by Jen Hickman for their story with Brittany Matter.

Pinup by J. Paul Schiek, teasing his story with Brentt Harshman

A page of art by Armando Zanker for his story with Eric Palicki

First page of pencils by Andy Michael for his story with Brentt Harshman

Two panels from Marcus Jimenez's story

A page by Christopher Alvarez for his story with DB Andry

The first page of Chris C Hernandez and Daniel Calvo's story

NEW ADD-ONS!!!

We are excited to announce two brand new add-ons to celebrate a FANTASTIC first half of the campaign. 

First, a deluxe digital bundle of comics by contributors to Off Into The Sunset. For $5, we will send you A TON of comics straight to your inbox on top of your order.

Secondly, we are PROUD to offer a LIMITED print by KELLY BRACK. For $20 extra, you get this gorgeous piece of work to frame and hang. Only 20 of these bad boys available!

ADD THESE NOW! 

New backers: you will be offered a chance to add on additional merchandise when you choose which tier you want to back at. 

Pre-existing Backers: you are able to MANAGE your pledge, which will allow you to choose new add-ons.

Do this ASAP, because I expect the Kelly Brack prints to sell out QUICKLY.
Curated by Brentt Harshman, Off Into The Sunset features stories by today's hottest and freshest talent.



We are seeking $20,000. Normally we'd just rob a train or a bank, but we're trying to find redemption. So, here we are, on Kickstarter. 
The budget will be put towards a page rate for the contributing teams, printing costs, shipping costs, taxes and fees, and a safety cushion in case we miscalculated anything. Anything left over, or if we happen to exceed our goal, will go towards upping the page rate for the teams involved in these stories. 
Aside from a few stories offered by friends (sampled below), the book is still in production. The goal is to have the book ready for print by June. We aim to have the books shipped and into your hands by mid-July.


*I was going to make a cool genre video of me out in the desert, all western-feed...but I ran out of time so instead I made a quick trailer on iMovie
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
$20,000 is a lot, but I am confident that there is such a NEED for western genre comics that we will have no problem obtaining this goal. 

Other than that, we have been slowly building and planning this campaign to make sure it ran as smoothly as something in the chaotic world of comics can run.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Howdy! I wanted to drop by and let you all know that production for Off into the Sunset is going very well! We have received a number of completed pages from all the stories and hope to have a more substantial update for you in the coming days.

I wanted to take this moment to highlight a dramatic new campaign produced by some Off into the Sunset Alumni called FOG LINE.

Two weeks have passed and I haven't given an official update yet so here we go!

First off: THANK YOU SO MUCH! AGAIN! You all don't understand how much this means to my teams and me. We are so stoked you have taken a chance on us and we are even more stoked to get this book made and in your hands!

Secondly: the money has transferred from Kickstarter to us and we are hard at work, getting this book produced. A couple teams have finished their stories and are polishing them up, others are wrapping over the next couple of weeks. The goal is to have the stories finished and ready for print by Mid-July and, so far, we are on track to make that happen. Obviously, if there are any delays or changes, we will let you know ASAP, but right now...things are looking great!

updates.update_userinfo: ...and so the two gunmen rode off into the sunset.
updates.update_content:
With a little over an hour left in the campaign, it's time to start wrapping things up on this side of things and get to work on the production side of things.

First and foremost, thank you all so much. Without the passion of the comics community, this anthology would not have gotten funded and I am incredibly humbled. When I first started planning out this book, I had little confidence in it. I thought we'd get to around $4,000 and start to fizzle out immediately. This wasn't the case. The first day blew my mind, then each and every day we slowly continued to climb the steep mountain towards $20,000. Then yesterday happened. I nearly cried so many happy tears at work but had to hold back because the health department was at my restaurant and I didn't want to change our grade due to tears in the food.

Well damn.

we are so close, with only so little time left. if you’ve been waiting to back, now’s the time.

keeping this short and sweet. we’ve only got 24 hours left to meet our $20k goal, and we are within spittin distance.

Three days remain.

Just $5k still to go.

Wow.

It's been quite the journey, cowboy, but we're almost there. 

Seven days. Holy cow. We are SO CLOSE, to the finish line AND our goal, but we've still got a few hills to climb. We are just shy of $14k, which means we are just over $6k away from our $20k goal. Damn. Blowing my mind, we have surpassed even my expectation. We have had new backers every single day, and that's inspiring. I truly believe we can get to our goals and make this book.

Wow. Life has been...insane, to say the least. I manage a restaurant in Los Angeles and, aside from starting to open up for indoors dining, we've also started serving breakfast. My work hours have been insane. On top of that, I also spent the last few days recovering from an INCREDIBLY sore back. Life's been insane, but what's even more insane is that WE ARE HALF-WAY THERE! Half-way funded and half-way through the campaign. Thank you, everybod who has seen this project and believed in it. We appreciate you, this book cannot be made without you, and people like you.

What an incredible launch. In 24 hours we have gotten to the 35% mark ($7k) with 200+ backers. It's been insane. So, for that, thank you so much. We are incredibly excited about this project and it's wonderful seeing that excitement from y'all as well. So, to celebrate, here's some fresh art:

project_data.project_name: Off Into The Sunset Anthology

campaign.story:
BEYOND MORTAL #1 is a 64-page comic of cosmic horror and superheroics. 

Imagine the greatest heroes of the comic book realm--the equivalent of the Avengers or the Justice League--faced with the horrors of elder gods akin to the legendary Cthulhu Mythos. 

Comic book readers are familiar with the world of Bronze and Modern Era comics… stories of gleaming steel metropolises populated by daring superheroes battling for truth and justice… facing down power-mad masterminds and would-be world conquerors. But unknown to the league of heroes who protect the innocent, this world has a cancer growing at its heart. A pantheon of elder gods is starting to awaken. These timeless forces of supernature once claimed dominion over a primordial Earth… and they have returned to reclaim what is theirs. Super-powered heroes—and villains—find themselves struggling against unimaginable horror to save the planet. It is a hopeless battle.

In BEYOND MORTAL--written by Cullen Bunn, illustrated and colored by Danny Luckert, and lettered by Simon Bowland--the superheroes (and villains) of a new comic book universe will collide with a new pantheon of alien deities from beyond our understanding of reality. 

The unstoppable force of the Leviathan will collide with the immovable object of the world's most powerful superheroes in an unflinching tale of ultimate horror and ultimate sacrifice. 

Superheroes versus elder gods.
Cover A
Our heroes include COMMANDER COMET, the cosmic defender; MOTHER NATURE, the avatar of Gaia; TORPEDA, the queen of the undersea kingdom of Abyssia; DEVILX, the masked vigilante from the streets of Empire City; and THE SECRET, the master of mysticism! They are the members of the fabled ALLIANCE, a group of heroes who have banded together to face the most impossible challenges.

But the heroes aren't working alone! They can't face ultimate darkness by themselves! In order to stand against the Leviathan, they must make allies with their greatest enemies--villains like VALDERI, SPLIT-SECOND, SPRIGGAN, TOXIC, KRAKEN, and many more!

An entirely new superhero universe will be springing to life in this comic! Over the course of the campaign, we'll be introducing you to the characters through regular updates!
Concept Art for Commander Comet, DevilX, Mother Nature, and Torpeda
The Leviathan are a pantheon of alien elder gods that have set their many baleful eyes on Earth. THE UNWANTED WHISPER, THE CRAWLING PESTILENCE, THE FACELESS PROPHET, THE CHATTERING MAW, THE HORDE MOTHER, THE UNDONE CHILD, THE CALLER FROM THE VOID, and many more terrible beings are rising from the darkness between the stars!

Inspired by the Cthulhu Mythos, the Leviathan are a new group of awful deities to inspire the most horrific of nightmares!
This is a story that Danny and Cullen have been developing for years, and they are thrilled to be able to bring it to you in this format! All artwork for this issue is COMPLETE! By the time the campaign wraps up, all pages will be lettered. By the time funds are transferred, final designs will be completed and the book will be ready for the printer. That means digital versions of the book go out as soon as funds are transferred! And physical editions will go out very soon after that!

The second part of this epic story has been written, and Danny is hard at work drawing it!

Our hope is to create a universe of heroes and villains and horrors that we can visit again and again!
Page 1
Page 2
Page 9
Page 10 - 11
Page 12
We have a number of amazing variant covers and other special reward packages! We will be revealing the variant covers (which will be available in limited quantities compared to the primary cover) over the course of the campaign.  We will also have exclusive packages for retailers interested in getting these books for their stores!
Numerous terrific add-ons are available as part of this campaign! If you want additional copies of the book or specific variant covers to give your friends (or to horde for yourself) this will be the way to do it! You'll also be able to add-on books from other campaigns! One of the coolest add-ons is a LIMITED BOOKPLATE signed by Cullen Bunn and Danny Luckert! Keep an eye out for it!
We have some amazing stretch goals planned for this project as we reach certain funding milestones!
$22,500 - UNLOCKED ! - Bookmark 1 - Danny Luckert has designed some sweet BEYOND MORTAL bookmarks. We add the first to orders for all physical backers. 
$24,000 - UNLOCKED ! -  Sticker 1 - We will add a BEYOND MORTAL sticker to orders for all physical backers.
$26,000 - UNLOCKED ! - Script PDF - For process junkies! A PDF of the script for BEYOND MORTAL #1 will be added to all pledge levels. 
$27,500 - UNLOCKED ! - Bookmark 2 - A second BEYOND MORTAL bookmark will be added to all physical orders!
$29,000 - Sticker 2 - A second sticker will be added to all physical orders. 
$35,000 - New Variant Cover! Danny Luckert will design a new variant cover for the book. This will be offered at a deep discount for all physical backers and will only be printed to fulfill orders for this Kickstarter. 
$40,000 - Cover Stock Enhancement. We are currently talking to our printer about enhancing the main cover of the book. 
$45,000 - SECRETS OF THE BEYOND MORTAL UNIVERSE PDF! This will be a handbook to the heroes and villains that appear in this issue, akin to the old WHO'S WHO? or OFFICIAL HANDBOOK TO THE MARVEL UNIVERSE. Provided digitally to all backers. 
$50,000 - SECRETS OF THE LEVIATHAN PDF! This will be a guide to the Leviathan, presented as an arcane tome of horrors. Provided digitally to all backers. 
BEYOND - As we attain higher goals, we will add new stretch goals! Who knows where we'll go?

Danny Luckert and Cullen Bunn first worked together on the Image horror series REGRESSION. Simon Bowland has lettered many of your favorite comics. 

Cullen Bunn is the writer of comic books such as "The Sixth Gun," "Harrow County," "Bone Parish," "Deadpool Kills the Marvel Universe," "Shadowman," "Punk Mambo," and many more.

Danny Luckert studied illustration and cartooning at the School of Visual Arts in NYC and upon graduating, he immediately went to work making comics. He has worked on several mini-series for RED5Comics such as Haunted Vol. 1 & 2 and Riptide Vol. 1 & 2. Luckert has also worked as the illustrator on the Boom Series The Red Mother as well as the creator owned book Regression alongside Cullen Bunn at Image.

Simon Bowland is a comics letterer who has worked for Marvel, Dark Horse, Aftershock, and 2000 AD on literally hundreds of stories.
I love Kickstarter and feel as if some of the most creative and exciting comic book projects rise from this platform. This is a book--and a world--we have big plans for, and Kickstarter allows our readers to take an active part in bringing it to life!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Let's face it. Right now, the world is in a kind of uncertain place. But we are still confident in our ability to complete and fulfill this project in a timely manner. All artwork is COMPLETE and lettering will be done before the Kickstarter campaign closes. After that, all we'll need to do is final design work and we can deliver PDFs and send this to the printer. Our printer is currently still delivering assets (that could change, of course, depending on outside influences). Comic shop owner JimmyZ Johnston (Little Shop of Comics in Cuba Missouri) is dedicating space in his comic book shop, staff, and resources to fulfill and deliver physical deliverables as soon as they arrive! I've done several Kickstarters at this point, and I feel like I've learned something with every one. I've definitely learned that the unexpected happens! But we'll try to minimize that as much as possible!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hey folks! We're only a week away from wrapping up the campaign! Thank you all so much for the support! It's time to reveal the final variant cover! The Secret is our mast of the magic... but he doesn't look to be doing too well! You can get this cover as its own pledge level, as part of the "all covers" pledge level, or as an add-on item to any physical pledge!

Hey folks! We're rapidly approaching the 24,000 mark (200% funded) on our campaign! Thank you so much for the support! Soon, we'll be revealing the next variant cover!
In the meantime, here are a couple of other awesome Kickstarters that you should check out!

First up, STONED MASTER by Aubrey Sitterson and Chris Moreno looks like a load of fun! If you can't guess by the title, this is the story of a burnout martial artist and his friends defend Chavez Heights, Los Angeles from encroaching corporatization and gentrification. And, yes, his martial arts are enhanced when he is high! It's a cool Kickstarter with great art, and you can back it here -

updates.update_userinfo: Some Other Kickstarters to Check Out!
updates.update_content:
Hey folks! As the campaign rolls along, here's the BEYOND MORTAL Spotify playlist! My wife Cindy helped me put this together. I hope you dig it! 

https://open.spotify.com/playlist/3DQNb6fy7jxgPRg5lHG89B?si=9a2b6cef8e974ddd

As of this posting, we're just $10 away from $21,000 in support! Seems like a great time to reveal the MOTHER NATURE variant cover! I think this one is my favorite so far! You can get this cover by selecting the Mother Nature variant pledge. You can also add it on to any physical pledge! 
Thank you all so much for the support!

We have announced some stretch goals for this campaign! I think we have some very exciting options coming your way, from stickers to new variant covers, from scripts to handbooks to our heroes. 

If you've already backed the project, how can you help us attain these stretch goals? There are a number of ways. You could increase your pledge level. You can select some additional add-ons (I mean, they make great gifts)! You can tell your friends and family about the campaign. Anything, really, to help us move the needle.

I've always thought it was important to keep an eye on other cool comic book projects that are running on  Kickstarter, so every now and then I'll be mentioning them here. 

First up, we have The Dusk by Alex Segura, Elizabeth Little and David Hahn.  It is a modern reimagining of the superhero vigilante that flips the script on the traditional “might makes right” approach while adding the grounded, socially conscious perspective that modern crime fiction has become known for. Back DUSK here - bit.ly/theDUSK  But you only have 40 hours left!

updates.update_userinfo: A Couple of Projects You Might Want to Check Out!
updates.update_content: Here's another awesome cover reveal! Here we have Devil-X! You can select this cover as a physical reward or add it on to any other physical reward level!
Hey, hey! Kickstarter has selected BEYOND MORTAL as a "Project We Love!" We're so grateful and excited! Here's hoping this brings some more eyes to the book!

campaign.story:
From Mat Groom, the co-writer of Marvel Comics' hit ULTRAMAN comics, and artist Erica D’Urso (CAPTAIN MARVEL and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCESS) comes INFERNO GIRL RED, an all-new original graphic novel that combines the high school super-heroic drama of INTO THE SPIDER-VERSE with the dynamic storytelling and world-building of Japanese tokusatsu superheroes, and the intrigue and relationship drama of British boarding school fiction.
Art by Erica D’Urso and Igor Monti
We all need something to believe in.  Especially Cássia Costa.
An ancient cult and their army of demons have stolen Cássia’s home, Apex City.  When a magical dragon bracelet rockets into her life and affixes itself to her arm, Cássia’s the only person equipped to stop the cult from offering the entire city to their dark lord.
There's just one catch...
Inferno Girl Red by Nicola Scott (w/ Annette Kwok), left, and Valeria Favoccia, right
The magical bracelet is powered by belief, and Cássia — an intensely pragmatic, rational girl – doesn’t have much to spare. She’ll have to find something to kindle her faith, though, and fast —because she has a secret legacy to live up to. Because her mother's life is on the line. And because Apex City needs Inferno Girl Red.
Hi! My name's Mat Groom. And this story, INFERNO GIRL RED, is one I’ve been working on for about three years now. I’ve always thought it was worthwhile, but I was never certain it would work… until I met Erica D’Urso. Erica is just wickedly talented. You can see that in her work on JAMES BOND, CAPTAIN MARVEL and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCESS. But it was her energy, her tremendous passion, that made me believe. Erica loves Cássia, and Cássia’s world… and that love infuses every part of this project. There’s nobody I would rather be co-creating this world with.

Inferno Girl Red Character Design
Together with colorist Igor Monti (who has a ultra-modern and vibrant style you'll recognise if you read MEGA MAN: FULLY CHARGED), letterer Becca Carey (a real star-in-the-making) and design agency For The People (a Top 10 Global Agency, according to D&AD), Erica and I are so excited to bring you this all-new 100-page superhero graphic novel.
INFERNO GIRL RED Creative Team
Kyle Higgins is editing this book. Kyle and I have been friends for half a decade, at this point. He has mentored me, in many ways (he edited my first comics series SELF/MADE), and more recently we’ve worked as a writing team on ULTRAMAN for Marvel Comics. We share a passion for the Japanese tokusatsu genre (which was a big influence here, along with British boarding school dramas and American superhero comics). And there’s little coincidence that Cássia was first introduced to the world in the back of the first issue of Kyle’s series, RADIANT BLACK. In fact, the connections between RADIANT BLACK and INFERNO GIRL RED may run deeper than you think…
Cássia’s not shy– but bouncing around from city-to-city as her Mom bounced from job-to-job meant it was hard to make friends... and any friends she did make disappeared pretty quickly once they found out who Cássia’s mother was. So instead of socialising, she focused on learning– showing a particular aptitude for science.

Cássia Costa Character Design
 
                     Now Cássia has a chance for a fresh start in Apex City. Her impressive test scores have earned her an invitation to the world-famous entrepreneur Doctor Janine Caro’s prestigious boarding school for promising young minds. There, Cássia starts to settle in. She starts to make friends. She starts to see a future for herself.
But when a magical bracelet blasts through a window while Cássia is studying late one night, everything changes. Cássia's quickly drawn into a strange war that she previously only heard about from her mother... 
Concept Art – The Griffin and Other Manifestations of Darkness
Concept Art – Cássia's Mom, and Other Mentors
Concept Art – New Friends

Ready to experience some of the story? Check out these five preview pages: 
Erica is a native Italian illustrator and comics creator, who has worked with some of the biggest characters and brands in all of fiction-- including IAN FLEMING’S JAMES BOND and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCES for Dynamite Entertainment, as well as THE LIFE OF CAPTAIN MARVEL for Marvel Comics.
Mat is a writer from Sydney, Australia. He's the co-creator and writer of SELF/MADE from Image Comics, is a co-writer on the ULTRAMAN series for Marvel Comics, and written for DC Comics projects including the CRIMES OF PASSION anthology and the TALES FROM THE DARK MULTIVERSE series.
Igor Monti is a colorist from Treviso, Italy, known for this ultra-modern and vivid style. His recent hits include MIGHTY MORPHIN POWER RANGERS and MEGA MAN: FULLY CHARGED, both from Boom! Studios.
Kyle Higgins is a #1 New York Times Best Selling author whose past work includes RADIANT BLACK, MIGHTY MORPHIN POWER RANGERS, NIGHTWING, BATMAN ETERNAL, ULTRAMAN, THE WINTER SOLDIER, HADRIAN’S WALL and THE DEAD HAND. Kyle made his debut as a comics editor in 2018, with SELF/MADE from Image Comics.
Becca is a letterer, designer and illustrator with a penchant for the handmade approach. Her lettering work ranges from household name characters (WONDER WOMAN, BATGIRL and HARLEY QUINN for DC Comics) to creator-owned sensations including RADIANT BLACK from Image Comics.
For The People is an Australian design, strategy and storytelling agency. In 2019, they became the first Australian agency ever to crack the top 10 in D&AD’s global ‘Design Agency of the Year’ annual review, sitting alongside the in-house design teams of Apple and the New York Times Magazine, as well as multinational industry giants like Jones Knowles Ritchie and Serviceplan Group.
 You may have noticed that Image Comics logo on our header. In the event that we're funded (and only in the event that we're funded), Image Comics has agreed to publish INFERNO GIRL RED in comic shops and book store markets.  But that will be a softcover. (It bears repeating, this book will only be made if we're funded.)
This Kickstarter campaign is the only place to get INFERNO GIRL RED as an oversized, deluxe format hardcover (7 x 11 inches) with an exclusive, Kickstarter-only cover and Kickstarter-edition-exclusive concept art. 
This edition will feature 100 pages of story (concept art and informational pages are additional to this page count).
Shipping within the US – $18 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Canada/Mexico – $26 USD (approx.)
Shipping to the UK – $14 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Europe – $22 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Australia – $28 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Brazil – $22 USD (approx.)
Shipping to the Rest of the World – $77 USD (approx.)

Shipping and fulfillment will be facilitated by ONS Printing.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Erica and Mat’s first Kickstarter, but editor Kyle Higgins recently ran a successful Kickstarter for his Original Graphic Novel, THE TRAP. The entire team has had extensive experience producing comics for the world’s biggest comics publishers, to the highest professional standards and to deadline.

In the post-COVID world, shipping and fulfilment is obviously a little trickier than it once was. We've partnered with ONS Printing, an offshoot of Comics Experience run by comics professionals, to ensure it all goes off without a hitch.

Thanks for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Your Guide to the Inferno Year
updates.update_content:
That's it. Our campaign is over.
First of all, I want to welcome the (significant number) of people who joined our campaign in the final days. Welcome, and thank you.
It's been quite a journey. I did a quick search of my inbox just now to confirm, and yes-- the first emails I have that reference this are from 2018. And I'm relatively sure I have notebook notes from 2017. Some ideas take a long time to come to fruition. Some never do at all. Thankfully, this isn't the latter situation... because all of you.
What started as idea of mine, was then expanded and improved tremendously by Erica D'Urso, Igor Monti and Becca Carey... has been brought into reality by all of you.

Hi again, everyone.
These updates have just become me praising and thank you every few days, haven't they?
Well, what can I say. That's your fault, not mine. You just keep coming through for us. Case in point: we have hit our mini-comic Stretch Goal. I'm so excited-- we get to share an extra story from this world with you, dig into a history that might have otherwise gone untouched, see more of Valeria Favoccia's take on this universe... I really think you're going to love it.

updates.update_userinfo: A goal, achieved-- plus, original Erica D'Urso IGR art available!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
A quick update for you today-- we've had a few requests from retailers to add a Retailer Reward tier...  so we're doing it!

updates.update_userinfo: New reward tier, and old friends.
updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone,  a quick one from me today!

First of all-- we're really coming up on our next Stretch Goal! If I'm currency-converting correctly (and I quite possibly am not!), we're about $5,000 USD away from hitting it. I'm doing a bunch of podcasts and things this weekend to help spread the word, but we always appreciate your support -- so if you feel like letting a friend know about our campaign, or retweeting a tweet... it would be hugely appreciated, as ever, and also get us ever-closer to this very cool little extra:

Hello again everyone,
We crossed a huge milestone a few days ago-- now, whenever I send out these updates, they're going out to over 1,000 people. That's... really hard to comprehend, if I'm honest. More than one thousand people have come together to help make our little project a reality... and not make it so little. To turn out little spark into a blazing inferno.
Again, I'm not really sure how to express my gratitude, except to say that Team IGR will be working as hard as we possibly can to turn your passion and support into something compelling and meaningful.

Hi again, everyone!
We're powering towards that ashcan mini-comic Stretch Goal-- they say the middle of a campaign is slow, but the momentum you've all been bringing is astonishing. Thank you.
We're not slowing down on our end, either-- and we thought we'd give you an update on how we've been promoting INFERNO GIRL RED around the internet, in case you feel like sharing!

We did it!!
Thanks to the incredible generosity and support of you all, we've hit our second stretch goal. That's right-- we'll be adding 20 pages of story to INFERNO GIRL RED, both digital and physical editions, free for all backers.
That's a 20% increase in story content, at no extra cost.

updates.update_userinfo: A lofty goal reached, a hidden history revealed...
updates.update_content:
Every day, you surprise me.
I keep expecting things to really taper off, but instead, our campaign just continues to grow.
Then, yesterday, we released something that, honestly, we didn't know if anyone would be into. The fully-wearable replica helmets. I mean, we thought they were profoundly rad, but would anyone else share that enthusiasm?

project_data.project_name: INFERNO GIRL RED by Mat Groom and Erica D’Urso

campaign.story:
Welcome to the world of Sparrow!
This is the beginning of an epic universe of characters with deep lore and world building I've been developing since 2011. In Sparrow, we follow the story of an 18 year old high school senior, Alaina Yuen. Alaina is the daughter of legendary heroes Red Falcon and the Sentinel, founding members of a superhero team once known as the Knight Guard. When catastrophe struck, the team found themselves disbanded, the world no longer had heroes.  Present day, Alaina finds it increasingly difficult to obey her fathers wishes and ignore her legacy.  When a new threat comes to her city, Alaina finds herself in the middle of a dark mystery. She'll have to go at odds with her father as she becomes Sparrow and fights this new wave of villainy.  

  Thank you for checking out our page! Like I said before, I've been developing this universe since 2011! It's a huge passion project for me to bring this new take on superheroes to the world! SO, our kickstarter is going to printing and getting this book to you in a high quality, and paying for some awesome variant covers! I hope you all will come along on this journey with me to see how Alaina balances high school life,  crushing on the coolest girl in school, and continuing her parents legacy as... SPARROW!

FUNDED!! stretch goals time!
 So we hit our goal! It's stretch goal time now! Our first stretch goal is going to be an awesome prequel comic starring Red Falcon, the Sentinel and the Knight Guard! The goal is 4750! For this epic story I wanted equally epic artists to help me out! So, we've got @FellHound_ from Commander Rao doing an incredible cover and our amazing variant cover artist @Cemiroz doing 6 awesome pages! Both are on Twitter with those @'s! You don't wanna miss out on this awesome bonus story!

STRETCH GOAL #2
Trading cards, stickers, and bookmarks! The cost looks like $850 for the printing and paying my artists. So we're going to need to get to $5850 I reckon!  Here’s the first card for our villain Mystery Man! It is badass! This was illustrated by the incredible @cemiroz on twitter!
Mystery Man trading card
Variant cover #1

PREVIEW PAGES
What an opening! We hope that got you eager to read more! So, here's a little info on our characters, starting with our leading lady!
Alaina Yuen, AKA Sparrow is your average high school girl. Except she can bench press a car! Alaina inherited some of her mothers ( The Sentinel ) powers.  She's super strong, super fast and pretty much always super late for class. 
For years, Alaina followed her fathers rules, that she were not to pursue the life he once led. As we come to find out in issue 1, though, this rule is becoming increasingly difficult to follow. With new dangers emerging, Alaina will have to disobey her fathers wishes and drive a wedge between them doing so. 

James Yuen, AKA Red Falcon. A broken man after the loss of his wife, James retires the Red Falcon mantle and effectively the Knight Guard.  Years after the incident, James would go on to find a new way to help people, as old habits are hard to break. He establishes the Sentinel Security Organization. A new government department dedicated to protecting the world from its largest threats.  When James learns of a new vigilante, he finds his organization at odds with the person closest to him...

Ah, the villain of our story. No one knows who this up-and-comer truly is. He's dubbed the Mystery Man by the criminal underworld and the police. He's got a sense for flair and elegance in his crimes, but that doesn't mean he's afraid to get his hands dirty.  All people really know is that he's a force to be reckoned with since coming into town, and it seems like he's got very big plans. 

THE TEAM
I'm Kal Huset, a 23 year old artist and writer. Simply put, the team is mainly myself on writing and art, along with some script and editing help from my wife Alex Payton-Huset and friend Jordan Davis. I've been drawing and creating stories as long as I can remember.  And ever since I got gifted my first comic, it was one of the Tim Drake Robin one-shots before getting his ongoing, I've wanted to create my own! So to be here is extremely humbling.

WHY THIS STORY?
So, I know superheroes is probably the least indie thing you could probably do, but it's one of my passions and missions to bring something new to the scene.  And I feel somewhat obligated to get this universe started, as I have been building it since 2011.  But this initial comic has gone through a whole lot of changes throughout the years! What was initially a pretty standard superhero story starring the Red Falcon has now evolved into a legacy story about the relationship between father and daughter. 
      See, in the last few years I became the father to three awesome kids. Two are adopted and recently we had our newest son.  I started thinking, would if Red Falcon had a child? Fatherhood had such a profound effect on me, I could only imagine if these epic heroes I created had children . So was born Alaina/Sparrow! Going through just as many designs and iterations to get to this point. Alaina is softly modeled around my daughter, sharing the same name even! When Alaina(my daughter) was born, she was months early and had to spend months in the NICU recovering. This little girl has overcame so much and is the strongest little girl I've ever met, she inspires me. And that's the kind of feelings I put into writing Sparrow and the kind of feeling and response I hope to evoke in others.

REWARDS
 $1 -Thanks! I know times can be tough, I've definitely been there. Thats why I want to put anyone and everyone that donates any amount in our thank you page, because it truly means the world!
$5 -Digital copy! For 5 dollars you can have a convenient digital version of the book before it launches on other digital markets!
$7 - Bonus concept art pdf! Get this if you want the issue and a bonus behind the scenes look at designs and concept art for the world of Sparrow!
$11 - Get Sparrow in print! This one will get you a printed copy of Sparrow! We're using mixam to print, and we'll be doing 80 ib satin for interiors, and 100 ib satin with a matte lamination for the cover.
$17 - Custom Sketch card! With this tier you can get a one of a kind sketch of your choice with your copy of Sparrow!
$25 - Variant cover edition! This tier is for collectors! Allows you to pick which variant cover you want for your copy. You'll also get the standard version as well.
$50 - Producer credit! This tier is for those who like to be a bit more involved. Here you get an early look at the book and a spot on the producer page!
$170-Your own hero in the book! We have a few spots for some of the legendary heroes available! With this tier I'll help you design a new one or put in your already made hero into the book! And who knows, they could end up coming back..


 THANK YOU
If you've reached this point, thank you for checking us out! We hope you've enjoyed this little taste of the world we're building, and  we're deeply looking forward to showing you more! There's plenty more characters you'll get to meet in the book, like Hannah, Alaina's little sister! Andrew, Alaina's geeky best friend. Kayla, the coolest girl in school without even trying, also the girl Alaina's been crushing on since middle school.  And then there's Coffinmaker, Mystery Man's right hand who will... well, their name makes it pretty obvious what they do. These are just a few of the wonderful and diverse cast of Sparrow! We hope you'll tag along for the crazy twists and turns!

updates.update_content: Hey guys! This is going to be a quick one. We have three new add-ons! I totally forgot to make one for the signed copy of Sparrow last time so I corrected that. And initially the plan was for every physical book and tier sold, they would get a random trading card and sticker. And that's still the plan but I was thinking to myself that I'd like to have the whole set of cards and stickers because they look so awesome. Then I thought, man, other people would probably like that too! So I've went ahead and added two add-ons so that you can get the full set of cards and stickers! If you'd like to grab that just edit your pledge and add the add on you'd like!

Hey guys, been a little while! Apologies on the delay on the surveys, been getting settled in a new house and having MAJOR internet issues! But it's all fixed now! 

But yeah! Most surveys are out now. Only one not is variants, because I'm still trying to secure an epic artist for it. SO when I have that finalized, I'll send those out so you can choose your variant! Hope you all have been good! I'm hard at work on Sparrow and finishing it up as we speak. Oh, I'm also going to hire a letterer, so the book looks as best as it can, because while I'm getting better at it, I'm definitely no pro letterer!

We did it guys! It's over! It's been an insane month! The amount of love and support for Sparrow has been INSANE!! I am truly speechless.  Just know that this is just the beginning of Sparrow and this universe. Big things are coming!

 I wanted to take the time to answer some questions I've gotten as well about variant covers! Firstly, if you want multiple, there are add ons for them! Secondly, there's been some confusion about the variant cover tier. I admittedly worded it poorly, I meant to imply you could choose which one you wanted but I realize now it was worded very poorly lol! Hopefully you all are okay with that but if the majority of you were under the impression that you would be getting both covers, I will rectify that and do my best to make sure those backers do get all the covers.

Wow! Just wow! We've reached 200% and I'm beyond thankful guys. I said in the story section of the kickstarter that if we managed to double the goal that I would begin immediately on Sparrow #2! So...looks like that's happening! I'm so glad you guys wanna join me for this ride. Because it is going to be a ride!

      As of typing this we're 30 backers away from 400! The speed we've kept this up is actually crazy to me! I'd love to hit 400 backers so let's try and keep this going! I keep mentioning it, but I really want to get the book in more shops! So if we could do that as well, that would be amazing. Thank you all so much for the support. Like always, be safe, and peace!

Hey guys! Wanted to say thanks to everyone for still keeping this thing rolling on pretty good! Past few days we've been getting bursts of quite a few backers at once! So that's awesome. Eternally grateful to all of you for that! My goal now is to hit 400 backers with the last week and a half we've got! It'll be a heft task, but we've done some amazing stuff! So if you can, please share the kickstarter around! Tag your local store or favorite creator if you want!

We did it guys, we beat our second stretch goal! Now everyone who gets a physical copy of Sparrow #1 will get a random Sparrow trading card, sticker and bookmark! And a reminder, if you'd like the whole sticker and trading card sets, those are in the add ons now! 

I gotta thank you all again, this has been an incredible experience and we still have over 2 weeks left! You guys have truly given me such a confidence boost and it just means so much you all want to see this world. It truly means so much!!

updates.update_userinfo: Almost there! + more projects to check out!
updates.update_content: Hey guys! We’re a little under a hundred dollars away from unlocking trading cards, stickers and bookmarks for everyone! I just wanted to say thank you to allcof you for your support and excitement for Sparrow! It’s really awesome amd just blows me away. Oh, real quick, I wanted to remind you guys about our retail tiers! I’d love to see Sparrow im some stores so to anyone that wants to see that happen too, maybe share the kickstarter with your favorite local comic shop? just an idea!

Hey guys! I said an official announcement was coming so here I am! Alright, we are doing trading cards, stickers, and bookmarks! The cost looks like $850 for the printing and paying my artists. So we're going to need to get to $5850 I reckon! 

 Now, I could leave it there, but... I think you guys need some incentive to help share this thing!

Hey guys! Wanted to give an update! Sorry about not posting one in a few days, been trying to figure out this next stretch goal! But we got it figured out haha! So we're going to be officially announcing it tomorrow. But I'll tell you this much... trading cards! Stickers! More info tomorrow!
  Oh, and we also have three new tiers! Some people have expressed interest in getting a signed copy of Sparrow. I thought about this when initially coming up with my rewards but I didn't think anyone would want my signature on the book, truthfully! But if you did, now you can get it! If you just got the standard printed copy of Sparrow, you can upgrade to the signed version for just $2! And if you got any tiers higher than the standard version, when I send out the surveys I'll ask you if you want your copy signed or not.

campaign.story:
Diversity Comic Con is proud to present an anthology about race, inequality, injustice and the struggle to overcome them.
Black Stories Matter is a comic book anthology inspired by the issues brought up the tragic events and resulting unrest of 2020.
Featuring work by Beez Studio and Omar Mirza, David Branstetter, Derwin Roberson, Evan Verrilli, Stefan Jackson and Trevor Von Eeden, Jill Pratzon, Mauricio Cordero, Ramon Gil and Len Peralta and Melvin Moore.
Support this collection of thought provoking tales and help us make a difference.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The anthology is done. Written, drawn, laid out and ready to print. We are just waiting for final the quantity to order from the printer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Supporter
support.descp: Every little bit counts. Support at this level gets our undying gratitude.

support.title: The Marcher
support.descp: Get a digital download of the anthology on the day the campaign ends and we meet our funding goal. The fastest way to start reading Black Stories Matter!

support.title: The Fighter
support.descp: Receive a print copy of the anthology signed by the editor and producer and know that you not only supported the BLM movement but also these aspiring comic book creators!

support.title: The Leader
support.descp: For those who truly want to contribute to the BLM movement! As an added token of appreciation, this supporter will receive some extra rewards from the creators along with a print copy of the anthology.

support.title: The Benefactor
support.descp: Along with some extras from the creators, you will receive a copy of Scifies Greatest Hits, the complete three issue run of The Men from DARPA, and a hand-drawn commission from Ramon Gil or one of the other artists who are available.

updates.update_content:
Hello all,
Thank you for backing Black Stories Matter. We met our goal two weeks ago but I had some covid related issues to deal with. But now that I'm back, I will be adding another story to the anthology as part of the stretch goal reward. Art by Kenly Dillard!
