campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS REVEALED! 
We REALLY want Backers because we really want a LOT of folks to know about and see "Vengeance Turns: The Motion Picture" and enjoy the related Graphic Novels, etc.  To build the excitement and our backer numbers, we have just introduced a WILD NEW GOAL! It is only related to the number of backers!! If we get 300+ Backers for this campaign AND hit our modest goal? ALL REWARD-LEVEL Backers will receive FREE UPGRADE for 70+page Original Graphic Novel "Vengeance Turns: Explosions of Truth" as PDF! All stories scripted and co-written by writer/director Robert C Smith! Artwork by Indie Comics Superstar Kurt Belcher, DC Comics Eddy Newell Sr., and many more!
#TellYourFriends #OrganizeThePosse We want 300 Backers and to hit this goal!
If we blow past our goal and hit $14,000, then EVERY REWARD LEVEL BACKER will get a full color enamel pin with the "Classic" Mia Icon! (DON'T FORGET! Stretch Goal 1 is just HITTING THE 9K goal! Everyone gets the Blooper/Outtakes Reel if we hit that!)
“Vengeance Turns: The Motion Picture” 
In 1876 California, Rebecca Falcon and her family are brutally attacked and left for dead. With guidance from a mysterious tribe of "lost people", Rebecca rises from the ashes as the bloodthirsty vigilante “Mia”, hellbent on revenge.
Complete DIY Experience with about 3 person total crew yet able to deliver stunts, horses, & multiple locations.
 DID YOU KNOW?
*"Vengeance Turns" is OVER 2 Hours long!
*UNRATED-- but would be "Hard R" for Violence, Language & Nudity
*Features a Diverse Cast and Female Lead?
*Has an Original Graphic Novel coming in Winter 2021?
 The Genesis of "Vengeance Turns" ! 
We started working on this over four years ago! Robert Christopher Smith, a lifelong fan of spaghetti western movies like “A Fistful of Dollars”, “A Few Dollars More”, and “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”, wrote the basic story in late 2016. 
Co-writer Amanda Fry was originally going to also star as "Rebecca/Mia Falcon"!
The first person he ever discussed that story with was David Ruano, whom he met at a Thanksgiving party where neither really wanted to be. Ruano also had thoughts of making a western film. They sat and discussed Western movies, stories and what it took to film one, deciding that they should work together. This partnership would remain in place over time, and despite whatever else they might have worked on independently or as collaborators, “Vengeance Turns” grew and grew. 
Because Smith wanted a female lead, it was decided that the screen story and rough first draft of the screenplay would wait until a FEMALE co-writer was brought on board.
A Strong Female Lead, A FEROCIOUS Female Co-Writer: Meet Amanda Fry
Aside from various creative pursuits, co-writer Amanda founded and remains active with "The Borderland 100 Club" supporting families of fallen first responders.
 Meeting former El Paso Police Officer, Amanda Fry, proved to be exactly what the story and script needed. Instead of simply shoehorning a “male story” into one that is female-led and driven, it was important to all involved that the VIOLENCE, especially, should be considered and executed as it would by a female. When Fry was originally brought on board, it was with the idea that she would both co-develop the story and star in the leading role as Rebecca/Mia Falcon. 
Needless to say, Smith and Fry had a blast writing all this mayhem together! Some of the most brutal scenes in the movie sprang directly from the mind of Amanda Fry, on occasion even shocking Smith himself! (Wait until you see the fate of a bad guy named Bronson-- and what made it to the screen is only a fraction of what Smith and Fry originally put to the page based on Fry’s ideas for the sequence!) She directed her first  short film,  "CUT"  (and this  BTS Video ), alongside Smith and Ruano when originally scouting locations. While there, Smith shot this original  "Vengeance Turns Sizzle Reel"   with Amanda as "Mia" in Bandera, TX in 2017.
 "Vengeance Turns Radio Show & Podcast"
Four years of development led to many opportunities to refine the story, as well as exposing it to a growing number of people. Not ones to be deterred, Smith and Ruano treated the lockdown during the COVID-19 Pandemic in California as an opportunity, and revised the story again. This time, the  "Vengeance Turns Radio Show & Podcast" was born. 
The print on the right was painted by Ken Meyer, Jr. as a promotional print.
 The "Vengeance Turns Radio Show & Podcast" was a pleasant surprise! We had a lot of fun recording it over four weekly livestream shows, then RCS edited over about another month. The shows were very well received after going live, causing the largest surge of interest in "Vengeance Turns", even causing our  IMDB Page  rating to reach levels reserved for films with much larger budgets and/or "name-brand stars". This surge led to the movie being made. 
SHOT DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC & Other Challenges!
 Strangely, it was only while the world was falling apart for so many that Smith and his collaborators would finally be approached with an opportunity to get the movie on film! The budget would be far less than any of them had ever dreamed but under the circumstances, the decision was an easy one.
Challenges pursued the whole team throughout the production. The producer who got the ball rolling bailed on the project, literally sneaking away into the night only about a week before principal photography was starting! Smith, in his relentlessness, found another producer who stepped in and made promises of replacing the locations and securing funds that had evaporated with the disappearance of the previous producer. The second producer failed to live up to their word as well, also fleeing the project. This left Smith, Ruano and collaborators with a movie IN PRODUCTION, partly filmed and suddenly having all its budget and locations again ripped away.
The enthusiasm for the project from ALL involved on the cast and crew resulted in a synergistic tenacity that continued to compel the film forward. Every single person involved began to scrape up what they could, calling everyone they knew, and begging anyone who would listen to help get the movie finished.
That group effort worked and the movie was shot over 17 days during October 2020.  Even with every curveball thrown at them, the entire cast and crew even made it through in a COVID-safe manner as well. The group developed their own protocols. Each member of cast and crew was tested and provided a negative test result before filming, then stayed in their own bubbles while on call. Everyone wore masks everywhere except in front of the camera and had their temperatures taken and recorded each day. Following wrap, everyone was tested again and provided us with negative test results as they received them.
 SUCH Wonderful Locations!
 We shot the movie in Lake Elsinore, DTLA, Koreatown, Gardena, Littlerock (Old West Town), and Big Bear, CA.
Lake Elsinore, DTLA, Koreatown, Littlerock CA, and Big Bear all on a shoestring budget!
In the PICTURE above: 
 Sept 17 in Lake Elsinore. 1st day also shot opening sequence!
DTLA Warehouse-- Building our "barn" for the climactic scene.
Koreatown-- This house was built in 1912 and the Falcon's was supposed to be 1876. Just one of many compromises.
Malibu Horse Ranch-- A big part of our budget went to spending 2 days to get our shots on and around horses.
Littlerock, CA-- We also shot two days in Littlerock at an "old west town" for the general store, the saloon and the chapel (you will LOVE the chapel).
Gardena, CA -- We spent one whole day shooting all the scenes that are internal shots for the Ewa'as and tents/teepees.  All of this was in the backyard of our Director of Photography David Ruano's parents!
Big Bear, CA-- This was the most beautiful two days of the whole shoot. A lot of the external wooded scenes around the "Lost People" camp were shot here. We even shot an entire nighttime sequence with a fight scene!
Our Progress & Why We Need Your Support!
Since November, the movie has gone through two edits, and is currently undergoing its third for detail work. We really have nearly EVERYTHING done! There are two key sequences that are heavier with VFX, though and additional SFX and sound details to be completed as well.
We want you to JOIN US in submitting "Vengeance Turns: The Motion Picture" to Film Festivals, and we are very focused on making "South by Southwest (SXSW)" our Premiere!  We want to be at these events with "Vengeance Turns" and we want your name on the screen at every single one--YOUR HELP MATTERS!
DIVERSITY IN CASTING
While the intent was to produce an epic, action-filled western and never to make a "message movie", the concept of diversity in gender, ethnicity and belief has been built into "Vengeance Turns" from its inception.  The lead character "Rebecca/Mia" is of partial Kumeyaay heritage and female, played by Paola Luelmo who was born in Mexico.
As "Rebecca/Mia", Paola is joined by her co-star Azeem Vecchio who plays Simon Coletrain. Once they are among the "Lost People", they are joined by an intentionally mixed group, led by "Delicate Poison" and "Ghost with Silent Knives Protects" who are children of a Kumeyaay mother and a father born in India; they are played by Kelsey Jaffer and Nevin Millan who both have parents born in Pakistan.  The character, Gloria, is of unknown Asian ancestry-- having been kidnapped into slavery as a child; she is played by Catherine Bo-Eun Song, a Korean-American female actor.
The rest of the cast is heavily populated by females, and individuals of about every background and orientation. Smith's feeling has always been "the right person for the role is the right person for the role" going so far as to rewrite characters entirely (from gender to ethnicity and more) to better suit the actor playing them, consulting with them in the process.
MEET OUR STARS! 
Paola Luelmo plays Rebecca Falcon who after being left for dead finds new life as "Mia", a bloodthirsty vigilante hellbent on revenge!
 Paola Luelmo plays "Rebecca/Mia Falcon". Rebecca Falcon starts as a woman with strong opinions but who is somewhat reluctant to express them. In particular, she is partly of Kumeyaay heritage which she admits to knowing little about due to her father having "whitewashed" her thoroughly. This was as much for her protection as it was out of his own racial ignorance-- The Old West was a very dangerous place for Natives during the late 1800's. As is mentioned by characters in the movie, they are basically considered and treated as vermin to be exterminated. When Rebecca hears the gossip that it is Kumeyaay killing the families in their town, she tries to defend them but is so upset that she runs away. Later, we meet the murderous marauders masquerading as natives and they certainly are not Kumeyaay. After her attack, Mia is taken to a group believed to be Kumeyaay where she is healed and trained.
Paola did almost all her own stunts, and trained  (See Paola train!) for two key scenes that take place in the "Warrior's Circle" during her training.
Azeem Vecchio remarkably transforms his character, Simon Coletrain, from a victimized child to a man of honor throughout "Vengeance Turns"!
 Azeem Vecchio plays "Simon Coletrain". Simon experiences quite a transformative arc of his own in "Vengeance Turns". When we first meet him, he is so weak in the presence of his father that he literally can barely stand. However by the end of the movie, the character has grown to such a degree that he not only loses his fear of his father but confronts him unflinchingly. Simon will have audiences cheering before they leave the theater!
Nevin Millan embodied the role of "Ghost with Silent Knives Protects" through and through, learning specific spear and knife moves just for the role!
 Nevin Millan plays "Ghost with Silent Knives Protects". Ghost with Silent Knives Protects is one of the most fascinating and enigmatic characters in the film! He is half Indian/Half Kumeyaay, as is his sister "Delicate Poison" who is played by Kelsey Jaffer. Ghost with Silent Knives Protects plays a few very important roles in the movie, and will not be what viewers expected before it is all over!

Jamald Gardner will terrify you and break your heart in his role as the ultimate villain in "Vengeance Turns", Jefferson Coletrain!
Jamald Gardner plays "Jefferson Coletrain". Jamald Gardner has been involved in the project longer than any other person than Robert C Smith who he met when both worked as background actors for a Disney show! The two actors got to know each other and began discussing westerns and the fact that Smith wanted to write one-- Gardner said he had always wanted to be the "bad guy" in one... and the rest is history! Developing the character with Jamald along the way through the writing process created one of the deepest, most complex while still TERRIFYING villains ever to show up in any western movie! 
Moriah Hart has a sneaky role and plays a very SNEAKY Hester Blake-- she will draw you in early and make you feel so sorry for her, but have you seething before the movie ends!
 Moriah Hart plays "Hester Blake". Moriah Hart gets to throw one of the biggest curveballs of the whole movies at audiences as "Hester Blake"! She had one of the ultimate challenges in the movie: To present her character as somewhat weak, if not a little "Karen-y" early in the film only to return at its climax as transformed as Rebecca/Mia or Simon! Moriah Hart will leave audiences reeling as they  see her performance with Paola Luelmo as Mia Falcon in the last minutes of the movie.
Steven Ciceron brought Sheriff Cartwright to life, and brings both peril and humor to the screen!
 Steven Ciceron plays "Sheriff Cartwright". Steven Ciceron was also part of the project very early on, with Smith developing the character of "Sheriff Cartwright" specifically for him. As with Jamald Gardner and "Jefferson Coletrain", Smith worked with Ciceron over the years to build out the exact character they both wanted to bring to life on the screen. As with Moriah above, no matter what you are thinking about this sheriff right now, you are DEAD WRONG, so be ready to be surprised a few times by this character and this actor!
Aside from Writing, Directing and Producing "Vengeance Turns", RCS also found the time to play the villainous "Frank Effing Ford"!
 Robert C Smith plays "Frank Ford" (and wrote/directed). Smith said from the very beginning of writing and developing "Vengeance Turns" that there would be a saloon shootout scene and he would play a character who dies a bloody death getting shot to hell and back in it! Well, he was close! He plays "Frank Ford" and ends up spending more time on the screen than originally planned and does not get shot at all-- but DOES DIE A BLOODY DEATH at the hands of the vengeful Mia who stabs a claw straight up through his chin and out his face! Smith was careful about everyone he brought on board with this project, wanting them all to feel more like partners and true collaborators than simply pieces he moved around on a board. The results show on the screen, as you will see soon!
MORE About the Plot and Story in Vengeance Turns: The Motion Picture!
Rebecca Falcon is happily married in 1876 Blaketon, CA where her husband, Michael, works as an attorney for the primary business, Blake Industrial Gold Mining, Inc. Together, they have two beautiful, vibrant children-- one girl, Emma and her little brother, Edward.
When the movie opens, we find out that families around this small community have been murdered and there is active gossip about local Kumeyaay being involved. Unknown to anyone outside her family, Rebecca herself is part Kumeyaay with a full-blooded grandmother whom she only barely knew.
SO MUCH of "Vengeance Turns" is about the characters, and we really chose some rising stars to bring them to life in this film. Seen here, Azeem Vecchio in FX/Makeup as Simon Coletrain; Nevin Millan as Ghost with Silent Knives Protects; Stacy Marie Turner, Kate Comstock, and Moriah Hart as "The Biddies"; Steven Ciceron as Sheriff Cartwright, Nicholas Freedson as his deputy, and Robert C Smith as Frank Effing Ford!; Finally, Jess Be (who also produced and worked as script supervisor) played Mrs. Cartwright and Frank Vavounas as a bad guy named Buck!
The treatment of all natives during the late 1800’s was atrocious to an extent that they were often shot on sight, treated as and referred to as “vermin”. From his own ignorance combined with paternal thoughts of safety for his daughter, he meticulously “white-washed” her.  Rebecca laments to her husband that she “barely knew her, but picked up what she could here and there”, and cries that they are a “Peaceful People”, collapsing into his arms sobbing, after hearing some local biddies outside the local market bragging about their children killing Kumeyaay on their property.
On that very night, the murderers crash into her life, and her feelings are verified when we meet Oscar Gomez, Frank Ford, and their boss Jefferson Coletrain who brutalize the entire family, even partially scalping Rebecca before leaving them all for dead. Indeed, all are dead… except Rebecca.
She wakes bloody, broken, and vacant from the severe head injuries she suffered, crawling out of the debris and dead bodies that was once her life on autopilot and feral. In one of the first and primary twists of “Vengeance Turns”, it is Simon Coletrain (the son of Jefferson Coletrain) who finds her, rescues her and helps her escape only to run into a strange tribe full of various races who refer to themselves as the “Lost People”.
Both Simon and Rebecca find themselves at peace and at home among this enigmatic group who seem to be run by a young woman who is half Indian/half Kumeyaay named “Delicate Poison” and her brother “Ghost with Silent Knives Protects”. (Their father was from India and their mother was Kumeyaay, which is another whole story we would love to tell you!). It is here that viewers also meet Gloria, who likes to take the teeth of those she vanquishes… for a snack!
Top left, Mia is unimpressed when she first meets Gloria. Top right, Oscar Gomez reacts to Mia's method of questioning. Bottom left, Gloria has her own way of getting information. Bottom right, Delicate Poison and Gloria move through Blaketon.
Rebecca, who has been christened “Mia” by Simon for reasons you will discover in the film, is healed and trained before setting out on her quest to rediscover exactly who she really is and for revenge on the men who took everything from her. Her uncontrollable bursts of rage and the hallucinations she suffers insure a wild ride for her companions and for viewers alike.
While certainly a revenge western at its core, “Vengeance Turns” twists nearly everything you thought you ever knew about these movies almost completely inside out! Everyone involved on this film feels viewers will be right on the edge of their seats until the final credits roll! 
 Check out the TEASER TRAILER! 
PLAY

  EXPANDED UNIVERSE-- not just an indie film! The "Explosions of Truth OGN is coming in Winter 2021!


Supporters of this film may be surprised to learn they are NOT supporting just a single film but the launch of an entire world! As Robert C Smith and Amanda Fry wrote the original story and first draft of the screenplay, they would often stop to discuss the motivations for certain characters which would lead to longer conversations. This resulted in their decision to do more than capture any important moments in their "Story Outline/Bible", and chose to compose short stories that would be told as comics at a later date. 
One major advantage of the story taking longer to get to the screen than anticipated was having a lot of artwork completed over the past four years. Some stories such as "Growing Pained" featuring the character Simon Coletrain are 100% complete and ready to go! Kurt Belcher is working right now on the main story that will appear in an Original Graphic Novel being released in Winter 2021 (with story and OGN) called "Explosions of Truth". This story acts as a DIRECT SEQUEL to the film, while the other shorter stories like "Growing Pained" serve as glimpses into key moments of our characters lives leading up to the events in the film. 
This will be a DOUBLE-PAGE Spread in the featured story in an Original Graphic Novel called "Vengeance Turns: Explosions of Truth"!
 We have developed so much material, and even have other writers now approaching us to pitch stories about the characters, that we know there are years and years of other exciting "Vengeance Turns" stories to tell in other films, short films, comics, graphic novels, podcasts and much more!
 REWARDS 
 IF we break our modest goal, we have some awesome stretch goals and rewards ready to go! Links to “Behind the Scenes” Videos, Outtakes/Bloopers, COMIC BOOKS, and much more!
**500 BACKERS GOAL: IF WE HAVE 500 BACKERS BY April 6, EVERY REWARD-LEVEL BACKER WILL RECEIVE PDF OF "EXPLOSIONS of TRUTH" STORY which is direct sequel to the film (written by Robert C Smith)! 21 Pages and FULL COLOR with ART BY KURT BELCHER (see sample double-page spread above)!!!!
CHECK OUT ALL OUR REWARD TIERS! (SOME ARE VERY LIMITED!)
Receive our sincere gratitude and have a shout out on Social Media (FB, IG & Twitter)
Read the Screenplay that the cast and crew had with them on location for the whole shoot!
Receive a note of THANKS from writer/director RCS on this postcard w beautiful Rob Moran Artwork!
We DEFINITELY want you to be among the 1st to see "Vengeance Turns: The Motion Picture"! Please share this reward with everyone you know! We will be unlocking a very cool stretch reward based on getting 500 DIGITAL STREAMING BACKERS!
How would YOU like your name to appear in the final credits of the movie? All of our Supporters at this level and above will have their names appear as the very final credits! Since you will want to see it, you also get a link to the movie! Your name will ALSO appear in the Graphic Novel Credit List THANKS! This is a GREAT VALUE!
This High Quality T-Shirt is beautiful and badass! Based on the actual "WANTED Poster" utilizing the image of Paola Luelmo as Mia Falcon, the "Desert Witch"!
This DVD features exclusive artwork from Ken Myer, Jr. and will be LIMITED in the number that are made available!
Just like the DVD, this BLU-RAY is exclusive to this Kickstarter campaign but this one lovely noir artwork by Rob Moran!
This BUNDLE is for fans who really want the best deal! Get the T-Shirt and the Blu-Ray for one superlow pledge!
This is a cool reward! Choose from a list of our real props! MORE WILL BE ADDED!
Want to attend the Cast-Screening Party with the cast and crew? We are going to invite ONLY the first 10 backers! VERY Limited!
Want to discuss writing or directing "Vengeance Turns"? Want to talk about other movies? Comic books? Limited to 4!
OUR Biggest Reward! JOIN our team completely! You will have your name in the opening and ending credits as "Co-Executive Producer" and will be listed on IMDB as well. LIMITED to 2!
STRETCH GOALS are coming! We will be offering rewards like BEHIND THE SCENES and BLOOPER VIDEOS, COMIC BOOK STORIES & MORE!
Our FIRST Stretch Goal? Just hit the modest goal we set for the campaign!
BLOOPER/OUTTAKE REEL SAMPLE !
PLAY

"Vengeance Turns NOIR" EXCLUSIVE artwork by Rob Moran will be featured as Cover for Blu-Ray and on the Postcard!
How will these funds be used? 
All of this film has been shot and passed through two complete edits! Some FX Work has been done... BUT a LOT MORE IS NEEDED!
1) FX Work for 2 Key Sequences ("Voice In Darkness" and "I'm A Rolling" along with some other blood, gunshots, etc.)
Two FX Sequences will be the focus for most of the funds from the primary goal on this Kickstarter! On the left, you see something only known as "Voice in Darkness" which is part of a key sequence in Rebecca's overall transformation from Rebecca into Mia. On the right, you see Jamald Gardner in a sequence that was inspired by the dream sequences in "The Big Lebowski" believe it or not. Mia is knocked out and while unconscious, she watches Jefferson Coletrain and friends perform "I'm A Rolling".
2) Final Coloring/Film Look
3) Final Sound Effects, Sound Design and Music
4) Film Festivals:
     a) South by Southwest
     b) Sundance
     c) Tribeca
     d) Los Angeles Indie Film Festival
     e) Los Angeles Women in Film Festival
     f) Hollywood Reel Independent Film Festival
***AND MORE!
5) EXPANDED UNIVERSE: Comic Books, Short Films & More! Since "Vengeance Turns" has been in development since 2016, Robert C Smith has put a lot of work into developing the whole world in which this story takes place. Already, there are short comic stories 100% DONE and waiting for others to be completed. Later in 2021, an Original Graphic Novel "Vengeance Turns: Explosions of Truth" will be released! It will contain a 21 page SEQUEL to the movie, picking up exactly where the movie ends! There will also be 5 other shorter stories that focus on the lives of Jefferson Coletrain, Simon Coletrain, Delicate Poison, and Hester Blake before and leading up to the events in the film! We have TONS of ideas for MORE-- We just need the funding to produce the books and other films!
Our Week ONE Backers received a FREE PDF of this 6-Page Comic "Growing Pained" featuring Simon Coletrain
FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA!
Facebook.com/VengeanceTurns
 Twitter @VengeanceTurns 
 IG @officialvengeanceturns 
We have maintained a frankly unbelievable ranking on our IMDB page for over 6 months!    Vengeance Turns IMDB Page! 
Check out the Original Podcast! "Vengeance Turns Radio Show & Podcast"  https://open.spotify.com/episode/0PgaPdverEpsrDMmbCjKGy?si=39a45f4a359d4d5c
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Clearly, there are always risks associated with any artistic project-- especially film. However-- Every frame of this movie has already been shot! The edit of the Rough Cut is complete! Visual FX and Sound FX has begun... And the rest is ready to go! What this means is that not only is this movie very close to the finish line, we have already targeted the first 5 Film Festivals to which "Vengeance Turns: The Motion Picture" will be submitted. Additionally, an Original Graphic Novel called "Vengeance Turns: Explosions of Truth" is nearly complete as well and slated for release before the end of this year!

Right now, we are very confident that the movie will be complete, ALL FX-- visual and sound-- EVERYTHING! Everything is on track to be done by July 2021. As we begin submitting to Film Festivals, we will also begin sending the movie out to all of our faithful fans and backers who helped make sure that not only did the movie happen, but all of you helped to make sure we released the absolute best version of the movie possible at every level!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Vengeance Turns Posse!
Bobby Smith here with one final update and really just wanted to say THANKS to all of you for trying to help us with this campaign. We really got very close, and honestly that makes it all the more painful. However, over the four years I have been developing and working on, and finally filming "Vengeance Turns: The Motion Picture" this amounts to nothing more than one more "bump in the road"! I truly appreciate every bit of support I received from you backers, family, friends, and fans. This has really been a tough month and having all of you in my corner has meant the world, and helped me weather this storm.

Hey Vengeance Turns Posse!
Bobby Smith here again, and I wanted to first of all say "THANK YOU" to each and everyone of you for the support you have shown this film and our campaign here on Kickstarter!
With the support of incredible fans, friends and family members like you, we have achieved 30% of our goal! While this is exciting, we  only have 7 days to go and must hit the goal of $9,000 or we will receive nothing and then face problems with our final edit of "Vengeance Turns" and our ability to even submit, or qualify, for higher level film festivals like Sundance and South by Southwest (SXSW).

updates.update_userinfo: Free Poster? Special Deal as Challenge for Backers ONLY!
updates.update_content:
Hello Vengeance Turns Posse!
Bobby Smith, writer/director, here again, and I have a special offer and a challenge that is for you guys-- our backers ONLY!
You may have seen or heard me trying very hard to build our number of backers up to 300 or more through the #VT300Club posts I have made.

updates.update_userinfo: How DID MIa WIn Her Fight? Watch & Find Out NOW!
updates.update_content:
Hi VT Posse! It's Bobby Smith here again!
Earlier in the week, I posted a partial clip where you got to see Paola Luelmo as Mia Falcon in a training scene. Between her clearly outmatched size and skill level combined with her persistent injuries, she seemed destined to lose her fight with "Ghost with Silent Knives Protects". Watch this clip to find out how adept Mia is at assessing the shortcomings of her enemies... AND exactly how far she will go at any time to WIN!

updates.update_userinfo: SPECIAL Update! Meet Our Star, Paola Luelmo!
updates.update_content: Hey VT Posse! Bobby Smith, writer/director of "Vengeance Turns", here with a very special update today.  This movie is a difficult story on many levels, dealing with the murder of a family, questions of identity, justice and control. Over the four years that we worked on and developed "Vengeance Turns", THOUSANDS of actors submitted for this role, and it was only when we met Paola Luelmo that we KNEW we had the person who could bring every aspect of this character's very dynamic existence to life!

updates.update_userinfo: What Happens Next? Check out this clip of Mia Fighting!
updates.update_content: The transformation from shy Rebecca Falcon to the bloodthirsty vigilante called Mia reaches a critical point during Mia's training when she chooses to fight "Ghost with Silent Knives Protects" in the Warriors' Circle to prove her readiness. She is warned by Delicate Poison and by Ghost himself that she will not "survive him", yet Mia is not one to take "no" for an answer as you will see here. What you will NOT see here is how the sequence resolves. What do YOU think happens? Share it with your friends! See what they think! We will post a longer version of the clip this weekend! Don't miss it!

updates.update_userinfo: TWO Edited Unfinished Clips from "Vengeance Turns" for Backers only!
updates.update_content:
Hello Vengeance Turns Posse! 
As some of you already know-- some have contacted me directly to make sure that I knew-- our campaign for FINAL VFX and Film Festivals on "Vengeance Turns" launched this afternoon... one whole week early!
BUT instead of looking at it as a problem for us, we wanted to make it a BONUS for YOU GUYS!

campaign.story:
NEW! 
Stretch goal revealed and new Serenity Rose ADD-ON! Read on for details!
Come join us, won't you?
Front Cover
The Volume 1 re:VISION of The God Machine series sets the stage for an ongoing epic!
Guy Salvatore is stricken with sadness and guilt. His world no longer makes sense. His girlfriend has died and he’s seeing monsters. Are they manifestations of grief or something more? A strange man in a graveyard tells Guy that his girlfriend is indeed alive, floating in and out of the “Dream Worlds” and that only Guy can save her! However, the Gods stand in his way of happiness. Could this be the uniting of young lovers, or the end of everything else?
Welcome to The God Machine, a dark comedy that delves into one boy’s struggles with depression and the supernatural. Populated with crazy Gods, terrible monsters, and offbeat goth friends, let us take you on a trip, around the world and back…
:::For mature readers. Strong sexual content, nudity, and language:::
Back Cover
Who's that creator girl?
Hi-o everyone, it’s me, Chandra Free, creator of The God Machine! I am an artist/writer/creator who’s worked with SYFY, Jim Henson, Archaia, Image Comics, Storm King Comics, and many more! I’ve done numerous album covers, storyboards, character designs, and I was the art director for BLAM! Ventures. Pronouns: she/her.

Backstory! The God Machine was originally published in late 2010, but it’s origins date back to 1999, my senior year of high school. I have been formulating this epic for decades, maturing it from a high schooler’s tale to a science fiction-horror-fantasy epic full of mystery, conspiracies, and deep lore.
Original Cover for the Graphic Novel Published in 2010
The God Machine had its first outing as a preview comic in 2009, followed by a hardbound graphic novel in late 2010, then-published by Archaia. After a slew of publishing changes in the years to follow, I finally procured the rights to my creation in 2019. With The God Machine back in my hands, I decided to bring it to Machina Corpse, the spooky new comics company I formed with my partner, Stephen Emond. Here I plan to relaunch the series with The God Machine Volume 1 re:VISION and follow it up with volume 2 and beyond!

Wait, who are these new characters?!?

The God Machine is now back in my hands, allowing me to give you a whole new experience, a definitive version of the book with new content throughout! I'm calling all the shots! Whoa!

BUT! Not only will this be a tasty treat to original fans of the book, but a perfect entry point to new readers! 

I started with a bold new logo for a new era, created by Phil Balsman (Eisner and Harvey Award winner for logo and book design for Attack on Titan, Akira 35th Anniversary, Magic Knight Rayearth, All-Star Superman, Witch Hat Atelier).


 I then hired prolific comic book letterer Taylor Esposito (DC Comics, Marvel, Vertigo, Vault, IDW and more!) to bring new life to the pages. 


Personally, one of the most exciting things that I've included is all-new text and refined dialogue throughout. The entire volume has a new level of polish to it. There’s stronger characterization, removal of some poorly aged content, and more overall clarity in the writing.


Scenes have been extended, new pages have been drawn, new characters debut. A new prologue sets the tone for the series. This truly is a re:Vision. In addition to all this, there’s a new forward, and a new intro from myself.


The breakdown of what's in the book:

New covers front & back
New logo by Phil Balsman 
re:Lettered by Taylor Esposito  
New foreword by mystery person extraordinaire!
re:Vised text - questionable content gone, stronger story & characterizations!
re:Vised art assets
Extended scenes 
New comic pages 
New prologue 
Art galore 
Author’s intro
Originally 160 pages, now 180!
What’s not included from the original graphic novel? Character bios and pin-ups from guests.
Returning, however, is the original foreword by Venture Brothers’ own Doc Hammer.

Get yo' coin purse out!
Money raised for The God Machine Volume 1 re:VISION kickstarter will be going toward the printing of the book in hardcover with some bells and whistles, as well as prints and reward items. It will also go towards paying for new lettering, for shipping, materials, taxes and Kickstarter fees, as well as bonus rewards and stretch goal production.
Note! Credit Cards are ONLY charged if the project succeeds on the last day of the campaign. This is an all or nothing campaign. Meaning if we do not make our goal, this project cannot move forward, and you will not be charged. 

It’s full steam ahead though if we make our goal! God Machine is a go!

NOTE: Please keep an eye out for updates and backer surveys after the campaign is funded. If you do not fill out your backer form within 6 months of its issue you will not receive your rewards and your pledge will count as a donation. 

SHIPPING: Shipping on all reward tiers is free in the United States. Add-ons have shipping, as do territories outside of the US.
Magic... well, not really!

The book is 90% finished. The only things left to do are some of the new page colors, the re-lettering, minor art tweaks, and the packaging of the book. The printing, lettering, extra goodies and shipping are top priority!
The goods!
 The main event, the reason you are here, The God Machine Volume 1, re:VISION! 

 But wait, there's more! 
We have some goodie packages to meet your immediate needs, but tons of add-ons to customize and give you exactly want you want!  (Scroll down for ADD-ONS!)

First, The Packages: 
Book + Bookmark + PDF
Book + PDF + Bookmark + 2 Enamel Pins
Book + PDF + Bookmark + 4 Mini Prints
Book + PDF + Bookmark + Large Print

Book + PDF + Bookmark + Back Cover. + Signature

Book + PDF + Bookmark + 4 Mini print set + Large Print, + 2 Enamel Pins + Signature
Book + PDF + Bookmark + 4 Mini print set + Large Print, + 2 Enamel Pins +Signature + Beginnings Page1, Custom Large Painting + Special dedication
Book + PDF+ Bookmark + mini print set+ large print + 2 Enamel pins + Beginnings Random Page + Signature + Special Dedication in book + Custom Large Painting

ADD-ONS
A new feature on Kickstarter is ADD-ONS! You can get an ADD-ON with almost anything after you select your reward tier. 
Example: You happen to choose the book + pdf + bookmark tier, and then you can select an add on like "Signature" at check out for an additional cost! Super easy! Mix and match!
Here's a list of ADD ONS that are available:

Bookmark (2x7 inches) $5
NEW! Serenity Rose Omnibus PDF! $10
Enamel Pin- Good God & Guy Sparkly  $15
Enamel Pin- The God Machine Logo  $15
Signature $25
please check if your package includes signature already
Mini Print Set of 4 (5x7 inches) $30 
Large Print (11x17 inches) $30
EXTRA copy of The God Machine vol 1 re:VISION : $35
Custom Painting Medium $750 & Large $1,300
Get an original CUSTOM Chandra Free painting for your wall! Acrylic on canvas!
Pick between LARGE (approx. 30x40 inches) or Medium (approx. 24x36 inch) painting sizes, then choose a subject you want painted, and let Chandra do her magic! She’ll take your subject, and add abstractions and other fun stuff for a unique and strange piece of art to call your own!

 The God Machine: Beginnings Page (Chosen randomly) $150 
The God Machine: Beginnings --Original pages from Chandra's first attempt at doing The God Machine issue 1. Dating back to 2000-01, Chandra was 18-19 years old when she did these pages. She inked, and shaded these pages, and blue lines are still present! Tears, and growth form from these pages. A real struggle was fought through depression and a dream to make her book happen. These are unpublished and unseen pages, till now. You too can own a piece of Chandra's early history. Pages are on 11x17 comic paper. Pages are chosen at random & signed.
 Inked Pages from TGM issue 1 (Chosen randomly)  $100 
Pages 2-7 from chapter 1, inked (unlike the rest of the chapter) on 11x17 inch comic paper. Randomly selected.
Penciled Page from TGM issue 1 (Chosen randomly) $75
Penciled pages from chapter 1 of The God Machine volume 1 on 11x17 inch comic paper. Randomly selected from pages 8-36.
 UNPUBLISHED God Machine Issue 2 Pages (Chosen randomly)  $100 
Inked pages that didn't make the cut for chapter 2 of volume 1. These one of a kind pages are on 11x17 inch comic paper, unpublished and ultimately redrawn. There's a lot of charm to these earlier pages. Get them while you can! Randomly selected.
The extra goodies!
UNLOCKED! The Art book!
We have a special little something we want to present to you!
The God Machine coffeetable artbook! Softcover, 32 pages of gorgeous art, and the making of The God Machine.
Cover design not final
Go to ADD-ONS to add it in addition to your existing pledge!

Conclusion
We can only do this with your help! Pledge to get your book, and don’t forget to share with family, friends, and the internet! Get the word out and share the love!

Thank you!

-Chan

KickStarter Video Credits
Art: Chandra Free
Additional art: Stephen Emond 
Animation, Direction & Production: Stephen Emond
Script: Chandra Free & Stephen Emond
Voices: James Urbaniak (Venture Brothers) as Devil Kitty  & Dana Swanson (Toonami) as Angel Kitty
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are only 2 of us behind this project (Chan & Steve) and it’s a massive undertaking of shipping and getting rewards out to everyone. We learned a lot from our last campaign, and are ready to take on this special project and get it into your hands as soon as possible. We are working to get you the best product we can get!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Blake has been dreaming of the Black Dog.
In fae folklore the Black Dog is an omen of death.  Terrible and inevitable.  But is it only a dream, or a portent of things to come?  What does the dog want?

CW: Death of children, mild gore
SERVANT OF THE BLACK DOG is self contained, 71 pages, full color, digest size comic.  It follows Blake as she tries to distinguish if the black dog she is seeing in her dreams is the 'real' thing, or just an overactive imagination.  And if it is real, how can she make it leave?

Funding would provide print and shipping costs for the book.  As things stand now, I'm only printing the book.  But if the campaign should do fantastically well, I will think very hard about possible stretch goals.  Otherwise, I just want this baby printed and out there for people to read.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The story is done, I just need to run it by someone who is better at grammar than me. So all we'd be waiting on really is the printing. I've factored in a pretty conservative estimate of how long it should take to print and ship, but as I say with every Kickstarter, things be crazy. I've never missed a Kickstarter deadline before, but anything could happen. Even so, I will try my level best.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to "Tales of the 399!"
 Hi! Thanks for taking a look at “Tales of the 399.” 
We’re students at Moravian College, a small liberal arts school in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. We are a class of English majors and minors, and we all have passion for writing. Some of us have made comics before, while others have not. Throughout this semester, we’ve learned a lot about the creative process of comic-making in our Comics and Graphic Storytelling class, or English 399. This collection showcases our new skills.
“Tales of the 399” is a collection of memoirs, each written by one of us. When choosing a personal experience to illustrate, we focused on the theme of family. Some of our stories are lighthearted, while others are more serious, but each of our unique views of family bind them together.
We’ve never attempted to publish a book on this scale before, and we’re excited for others to see and read our work! We’d greatly appreciate your support, as this means a lot to us as students and as authors. Our ultimate goal is to be able to print full-color copies of our collection, to distribute copies directly to you, and to gain meaningful experience in promoting and publishing our creative labors. Putting our work out into the world for the first time is scary and exciting at the same time, and we would greatly appreciate your contribution to our journey.
Previews
Here's a look at some of the eight stories included in this inaugural issue:
"The Art Kids" by Grace Gilbert
"Luke 15:20" by Sam Riley
"The Half-Beating Heart" by Evan Yandrisovitz
"Same Old New Year's" by Anna Litofsky
Rewards
Our best reward, we hope, is the book itself! We've got both digital and print options available. In addition, we're working on making pins, stickers and prints to offer for something extra. We're also offering a limited number of signed and remarked editions. If you choose this reward, you'll received a signed book with a small head sketch on the cover from one of the artists!
If we reach our initial goal, we'll have a few stretch goals, too!
About the creators:
Caroline Flora (“Distant Whistle”) - Caroline is a senior majoring in English. She loves writing, reading, cherry blossoms, and playing board games.
Grace Gilbert (“The Art Kids”) - Grace is a senior majoring in English and Spanish and minoring in Art. She enjoys drawing, reading, running, and learning new things.
Chelsea Hill (“The Seventh Grade” ) - Chelsea is a senior majoring in Environmental Science with a separate degree in Philosophy. She enjoys film and spends a good amount of time outdoors. Oh, and she has a cat too.
Anna Litofsky (“Same Old New Year’s”, cover illustrator) - Anna is a junior majoring in Graphic Design and English. She loves drawing, writing, and escaping into the worlds of video games, animation, and of course, comics.
Seth Rappaport ("Island of Value") - Seth is a senior majoring in English. He likes watching movies, sleeping, and burns a lot of calories by running away from his responsibilities.
S. Riley (“Luke 15:20”) - Sam is a senior majoring in English with a writing arts certification. She enjoys writing, crochet, sleeping, and photosynthesizing when the weather’s nice.
Evan Yandrisovitz (“The Half-Beating Heart”) - Evan is a junior majoring in English. He enjoys watching movies, television shows, and playing video games in his free time. His favorite genre is horror.
Jeff McClelland teaches the class.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I'm very grateful for everyone's support for this book, which reached its funding goal on Thursday! The book is currently at the printer, and I anticipate getting those print copies back within the next two weeks.
For anyone who has backed a print copy of the book, make sure you fill out the survey that should be in your inbox. All we'll need is a shipping address for when the books arrive.
For those who backed a digital copy, I've sent messages with links that you can use to download your copy of the book. You won't need to fill out any surveys!

Hello everyone,
Thank you all so much for supporting this project. As we head into our last day, it appears that we'll have the funding necessary to publish this book and to create our other rewards, too! I'm very excited for you all to read the book; I know that the students in English 399 all created unique stories that they should be proud of, and they learned about storytelling and publishing in the process! It's a big deal, for me at least, to be able to print this book.

campaign.story:
The Monuments is a 140 page, sci-fi fantasy graphic novel epic that we have been collaborating on for a few years now. 
On the remote island of Mehndria, four warring city-states are forced to come together to face a common enemy: giant mysterious mechs. These robotic invaders show up without warning, destroying everything in their path. 
Then, right before wiping out the entire civilization, the mechs all power down for no clear reason, leaving the survivors to rebuild their world together. 800 years later. The world has moved on. The city-states are now united as one nation: a land littered with massive robotic relics that serve as monuments to a long-forgotten war.

After centuries of dormancy, one of these long-frozen mechs suddenly powers up, revealing a man who is confused, misplaced in time, and still very much alive.
THE PAST...
We journey alongside a band of knights quested to find answers to the origins of the massive mechs, encountering more dangerous machinations as they slowly discover the truth of the monuments.

THE PRESENT... 
Aided by a young woman, our enigmatic man is frantically trying to find his home, all the while being chased by religious zealots who have monitored the Monuments for centuries, waiting for them to return. 
This genre-bending story is full of interesting characters, epic robotic designs, exciting action, a carefully plotted mystery that is sure to hook you.

CREATORS
Michael S. Bracco (The Creators, Novo) - Art/Script/Story
Oliver Mertz (First Law of Mad Science, Maybe Someday) - Script/Colors/Letters/Story
Mike Isenberg (First Law of Mad Science, FUBAR) - Story
After working together for years, collaborating on comics in a multitude of publications, we decided to make it official, and combine forces to create a full graphic novel together.  The entire process has been a collaborative blast and we can't wait to work on more projects in the future.

REWARDS 
PLAY


Digital downloads of FIRST LAW OF MAD SCIENCE VOL. 1: WORK UNTIL YOUR FAMILY IS SAD and THE CREATORS VOLUME 1: IMAGINATION IS POWER will be given to all backers now that we have hit those stretch goals!
All backers (at the physical reward levels) will receive a 4" "Malcolm Machine" sticker now that we have reached that stretch goal!
 All backers (at the physical reward levels) will receive a 4" "Mech Fight" sticker now that we have reached that stretch goal!

We've all run several successful Kickstarter campaigns before and we're confident that we'll be able to deliver with this project.

That's right, the money has been collected and the reward surveys have gone out!  That means a few very exciting things...
Now you can download and read the PDF and we can't wait to hear what you think!!
It also means that we can get things rolling with the printer ASAP.  We can't wait to pay that bill and send off the files...and then wait all summer to see the books.
Once your surveys all come in, Mikey can order blank tees and start printing up all 200 of the monuments tee shirts that you ordered!

updates.update_content: As of 12:01 this morning, The Monuments campaign came to an end with an astounding $49,635 and 1,316 backers who put their faith into a book that our little team has been working so hard on for the past 5 years.  This has been an incredible journey and the 3 of us are just so incredibly grateful to you all. We still have a lot of work to do as we have to send out backer surveys, send files to the printer, coordinate with the fulfillment center, wear Mikey's fingers down to little nubs drawing hundreds of bookplates, and so much more, and we couldn't be more excited to get to work on it all.

Hello Everybody,
Well, this has been quite a ride. There are only 3 days left in our Kickstarter campaign. We want to sincerely thank all backers (over 1,000!) for helping to bring the Monuments to life. We are incredibly thankful for your support and can’t wait for you to read the book. 
As we gear up to close out the campaign, we wanted to let you know about our next stretch goal. If we hit $40,000, we’ll include a brand new single-page comic in the back of the book. This new short will be set in the world of the Monuments.

updates.update_userinfo: Reward Surveys Have Been Sent Out!

Wow!  We are just flabbergasted (I love having a reason to use that word) at hitting $30,000.  Our little team really never saw this coming and our smiles just keep getting wider every day.  Thank you so much!  We are talking over what our next stretch goal is and will reach out again soon but until then we had some fun news that we wanted to share with you
Pile Of Craft

New Stretch Goals Revealed
Hey folks.  Mike here to give you some info about the next level of stretch goals, and then some more detail about the 3D-printed sculpture we have on offer as a reward.  Our next stretch goal unlocks at $25,000, which blows my mind to even type; we're all so grateful that such an amount is even fathomable for our little book about big robots!  And we've actually got a two-fer on offer, as we'll be unlocking some improvements for the book itself, as well as for the 3D-printed sculpture reward.

campaign.story:
What Is The Project?
Hello and thank you for checking out my comic book zine! This is an incredibly personal project that spun out of a realization I had years ago: There are some days that the most horrific thing I could think of would be to sit, quietly alone with my own thoughts. I live with depression and anxiety on a daily basis and it took me a long time to get somewhere that I felt somewhat comfortable with that and started learning how to not feel like I was always alone. It took friends to help me get out of that way of thinking. Now I want to be your friend by making this awesome zine to show you that you're not alone either.

Who Am I?
I'm Justin Richards, writer of the critically acclaimed comic book series Finger Guns from Vault Comics. I spend my time writing comics, trying to be a good family man, playing video games and giving my dogs too much affection.

TL/DR:
It's a 16 page, variety, comic zine featuring:
 Five (5) page comic story written by Justin Richards with art by Gavin Guidry (Going to the Chapel, Deadly Living) and colors by Val Halvorson (Finger Guns, The Sequels)
 Five (5) pinup images from some of the best artists in the industry today! Including Daniel Warren Johnson (Wonder Woman: Dead Earth, Murder Falcon, Extremity), Liana Kangas (She Said Destroy, Trve Kvlt), Val Halvorson (Finger Guns, The Sequels), Megan Hutchison (Rockstars, Devil's AdvoCATES), and Chris Koehler (Legend from Z2 Comics, Mondo)
 Two (2) original poems by Brent Fisher and Justin Richards
 One (1) original "Sad Lib" activity by Justin Richards
 Six (6) affirmation cards written by Justin Richards and designed by Aviva Maï Artzy (avivamaiartzy.com)
 One (1) letter page from Justin Richards to you the reader!

Where will the money go?
All funds will go toward this project. Some will be to cover expenses of making the book up to this point. The rest will be for producing and fulfilling your rewards.

40% - Printing and reward production
30% - Shipping and materials
20% - Development costs
10% - Kickstarter taxes & fees
Page 1 by Gavin Guidry & Val Halvorson
Page 2 by Gavin Guidry & Val Halvorson
Page 3 by Gavin Guidry & Val Halvorson
Affirmation Cards by Aviva Mai Artzy (Some tiers include protective sleeves to cut these out)

Is There Any Swag?
Most definitely!! Everything from back issues of Finger Guns (all signed by Justin Richards!), 5" x 7" prints of our pinups and a GLOW IN THE DARK enamel pin designed by Val Halvorson!
5 x 7" Mini Prints of All Pinups
Enamel Pin Add-On Designed by Val Halvorson (IT GLOWS IN THE DARK!!!)
Featured FINGER GUNS Tiers! Get Caught Up or Add to Your Collection!

I am highly confident that rewards will be going out and in your hands by June at the latest.

updates.update_userinfo: Books (And Everything Else!) Are On Order!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! I know it's been a while and I'm sorry if anyone has been eagerly waiting for an update. Between getting vaccinated, home-schooling my son, traveling to visit family for the first time in a over a year, waiting for Kickstarter and a death on my wife's side of the family things have been pretty hectic to say the least! BUT! There's good news to share as well:

EVERYTHING IS ON ORDER!! YAY!!! I've received the funds from Kickstarter and have placed orders for the book, pins, prints, packaging/shipping materials and everything else to get this book in your hands asap!

We crossed the finish line!! Thank you again to every single one of you. You've helped make my first campaign a success and I'm so grateful.

I've had some questions rolling in already and I'm working on figuring those out. Kickstarter can take up to 2 weeks to review and transfer funds to me, but I'll let you know as soon as I've got it and have the books on order! I'll let everyone know what kind of timeline we're working with once they're ordered as well.

We're funded!! And I couldnt be more thankful! I want to see if we can squeeze some more swag for y'all. If we reach either 200 backers (only 10 more!) or $6700 in these last 15 hours every backer will get FREE stickers of our pinup gallery! I can't thank you all enough for supporting this project and I can't wait to get it in all your hands!! See you on the other side!

I just wanted to send out a quick message to say YAAAAAAY! We did it! We've reached 100% funding! Thank you all so much for helping me prove that we're not alone! I can't tell you how excited I am to get this zine in your hands. 

I can't wait to see these last 65 hours and see how far we can push this campaign. I'm trying to cook up some stretch goals as we speak, but I'm not sure what's gonna come together while I celebrate my son's and wife's birthday while traveling this week, but this will be the first place to find out when/if I pull anything together. Thank you all so much again! I love you all and I'll bug you more soon!!

I've officially added 10 more glitter covers to the add-on inventory. If you want one they're likely gonna go pretty quick, so jump on them while you can! At the end of this campaign, everyone who gets one will be one of only 20 people to own them signed by Val and myself! Best of luck to those who are wanting one!

- Justin

campaign.story:
ThoughtScape Comics is an anthology series serving up sci-if action, thrills and chills in the tradition of 2000 AD, Black Mirror and The Twilight Zone. 
Anything is possible in these taut tales of trauma and transformation, of people pushed past their limits by the gods and monsters they meet - or become - at the edges of reality.
Each issue will run approximately 44 pages and feature both serialized and self-contained stories written by me, Matt Mair Lowery (Dark Horse Comics’ Lifeformed), and drawn by some of the most compelling artists in indie comics today. Oh, and each issue will have a killer cover from one of my favorite artists. And gorgeous graphic design/packaging from one of my oldest friends, multimedia artist John Larsen. The series is planned to run eight or more issues (with a Kickstarter for each issue).
THOUGHTSCAPE #1 HAS HIT ITS FUNDING GOAL, but we're not done yet!
*** STRETCH GOAL ***
If we can hit $10,500 before the KS ends, I'll add a FIFTH STORY to TSC #1! THE GRIEVER, drawn by Jacob Edgar and colored by Lesley Atlansky! This story is of my favorite things I've ever written, and I'd LOVE to add it to the very first issue of ThoughtScape Comics. Here's a peek (the art is all done, I just need to letter it)...
More about ThoughtScape Comics #1!
Here’s what I’ve got lined up (completed and ready for print!!!) for issue #1:
A beautiful, bonkers cover from JENNA CHA (Vault Comics’ Black Stars Above):
 ThoughtScape 2319: Part 1 
Odessa Query, a Thought & Information Service Collection Officer, patrols her deep space beat, collecting thoughts harvested from the ether at the edge of the galaxy. When Odessa investigates a grisly crime aboard a space church, she begins to uncover a demonic, trans-dimensional conspiracy. Glorious water-colored art by DAVE LAW (The Space Odditorium). (Ongoing serial, 7 pages)
ThoughtScape 2319 Preview Art
A Spy Without a Face
A group of assassins gets more than they bargained for when they attack a secret laboratory in this hardboiled, balls-out extreme violence suspenser. I wrote this one specifically for master of comic book action TYRELL CANNON (ERIS, Beef Bros.) to go absolutely nuts with, and he go nuts he did… ten glorious, viciously beautiful black and white pages. (Self-contained story, 11 pages)
A Spy Without A Face Preview Art
Adorable Orphans
Meet the season’s hottest toy trend: LifeTech’s Adorable Orphan android dolls... just don’t turn your back on them. Eye-popping art from LISA NAFFZIGER (TAKING BACK TOKU). (Self-contained story, 10 pages)
Adorable Orphans Preview Art
 Ex Post Facto: A Dash Varrick Misadventure, 
Part 1
A bit revolutionary, a bit private investigator, tormented Dash Varrick travels across thought and time to unravel unsolved crimes and the mysteries of his own strange past. Or does he? Mind-bending mixed media art by KARL SLOMINSKI (Scout Comics’ Cult of Icarus). (Ongoing serial, 7 pages)
Ex Post Facto: A Dash Varrick Misadventure Preview Art
As you can see, ThoughtScape Comics is eclectic by design. The main driver of this project is my interest in exploring the wide-ranging storytelling possibilities of comics and working within as many styles and approaches as possible - plus, I want to collaborate with, and share the work of, some of the most talented comics artists I’ve come across - so variety is a big part of the mission. 
Speaking of those great artists and their work, issue #1 of ThoughtScape Comics is already complete and ready to print. So, once we hit the goal, the book can hit the presses, and be in your hands post-haste.


WHAT FOLKS ARE SAYING ABOUT THOUGHTSCAPE...
"ThoughtScape Comics is the quintessential, beautifully packaged and expertly made serialized sci-fi anthology that comics needs right now." -Liana Kangas: Trve Kvlt, She Said Destroy, Black AF: Devil's Dye
"Fantastic, artistically diverse and engaging stories of a cool far future world, all tied together with prodigious panache by writer Matt Mair Lowery.  I appreciate the creative use of swearing in the sci fi world of LifeTech." - Farel Dalrymple: THE OFTEN WRONG, Proxima Centauri, IT WILL ALL HURT, Pop Gun War, The Wrenchies, Prophet, Omega the Unknown
"A brilliant and beautiful distillation of the best things in both sci fi short stories and comics! ThoughtScape Comics is as captivating as it is haunting, each story building another cluster of characters and concepts that'll keep you thinking for days to come. I want precisely another 99 issues of this, please." - Ryan K Lindsay - Everfrost, Eternal, Deer Editor
"In rapid, percussive bursts of subversive energy, ThoughtScape tells stories of co-opted thoughts, programmed individualism, and unknown privacy in an infinite universe. Matt Mair Lowery and a startling array of artists have produced a splatter painting of the present in the colors of the future. This is a breath of endorphin-spiked, synthetic pseudo-air pumped in directly from a suffocating hereafter." - George Pendle, journalist and author of Strange Angel: The Otherworldly Life of Rocket Scientist John Whiteside Parsons
“It takes a Herculean effort to develop new comics, especially when you’re going it alone, where you’re responsible for everything from finding the right collaborative talent to handling the logistical nightmares of crowdfunding and fulfillment. And then along comes Matt Mair Lowery, delivering an entire anthology of new work—groundbreaking, thoughtful new stories to make the rest of us look bad.  I HATE YOU, MATT MAIR LOWERY!!!”- Eric Palicki, Writer (BLACK’S MYTH, ATLANTIS WASN’T BUILT FOR TOURISTS, NO ANGEL). Ringo-nominated editor (DEAD BEATS, ALL WE EVER WANTED).
“A poignant new sci-fi anthology series, Thoughtscape delivers evocative artwork and does what great science fiction is supposed to, which is make you think.” - Zack Kaplan, Writer, ECLIPSE, PORT OF EARTH, LOST CITY EXPLORERS, JOIN THE FUTURE.
“[ThoughtScape 2319] is next level. You're drawn in with the science fiction, but then you get sucker-punched when you realize it's actually a horrifying story.” - Pulp 716, Will Eisner Spirit of Comics Nominee comics retailer, Buffalo/Niagara Falls

REWARDS
ThoughtScape Comics #1
As previewed above. 44 pages of sci-fi action,  thrills, chills and mind games! 
PDF Process Zine
Go behind the scenes on all the stories in ThoughtScape Comics #1. Branding and graphic design development! Character sketches! Script pages! Art process from thumbnails to final pages! If you're a comic creator, or love process and commentary, or just want some wonderful bonus art, you'll want to grab this. Here's a peek at the kind of material you'll find in the zine...
Character designs, like this early ink sketch of Odessa Query from ThoughtScape 2319 artist Dave Law!
Raw Tyrell Cannon pencils!
Layouts from Lisa Naffziger!
A script page from me and Karl's Dash Varrick story!
ThoughtScape Trading Cards!
A moment from each of ThoughtScape Comics #1's four stories, captured on a trading card inspired by the Star Wars and Battlestar Galactica card packs I bought as a kid (I'm old). I can still remember the smell of bubblegum and newsprint... Anyway, great art on the front, fun info and/or process art on the back. 
ThoughtScape Trading Card example
Posters!
ThoughtScape goodness for your walls! Two posters! Jenna Cha's glorious cover for ThoughtScape #1 and Dave Law's title image for ThoughtScape 2319, Part One, both at 11"x17".
Two from Tyrell Cannon: DRONES
Own a piece of ThoughtScape history! TSC was born out of a series of short comic stories I originally printed for sale at cons in 2020, including DRONES, a fantastic piece of Tyrell Cannon drawn/inked/toned/lettered goodness (script by me). If you're a Tyrell fan or completist, you'll want a copy of this standalone, limited-run version of our 14-page story (fair warning/full transparency, this story may show up later in a ThoughtScape Comics issue).
Hey, kids! ThoughtScape PLUS Lifeformed
ThoughtScape for you AND something to read with your kids: a 14-page comic with two short stories featuring Cleo, the hero of me and Cassie Anderson's YA sci-fi series Lifeformed. 
 ** JUST ADDED! ThoughtScape PLUS LIFEFORMED GRAPHIC NOVELS!!! ** 
ThoughtScape for you AND EVEN MORE to read with your kids: TWO 200-PAGE GRAPHIC NOVELS! LIFEFORMED: CLEO MAKES CONTACT and LIFEFORMED: HEARTS AND MINDS - from the critically acclaimed YA SCI-FI series by ThoughtScape writer Matt Mair Lowery and artist extraordinaire Cassie Anderson.
Lifeformed: Cleo Makes Contact
"Orphaned in the wake of an alien invasion, 11-year-old Cleo must leave behind the life she knew to fight for her own survival and the Earth’s future. With the help of a rebel alien posing as her dad, Cleo learns how to survive and strike back against the invaders. Battling their way through the wreckage of the apocalypse, these two unlikely companions bond, ponder what it means to be human, and search for reasons to carry on." 
Lifeformed: Hearts and Minds
GET IN TOUCH
Have a question not answered above? Or maybe you're interested in covering this project in print, web or podcast? Drop me a line at mattmlpdx@gmail.com. I'd love to chat it up.

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING
I'm not offering shipping outside of the U.S. as part of the Kickstarter this time, but feel free to reach out if you're wanting a physical copy of any of the rewards and we'll work something out: mattmlpdx@gmail.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges
As I mentioned above, ThoughtScape Issue #1 is complete, and packaging/printing (and getting it into your hands) is all that remains. In addition to releasing two books through Dark Horse comics, I've been printing and shipping comics on my own for the last couple years and anticipate no issues with fulfillment. If any challenges come up due to COVID or other unforeseen issues, you'll know ASAP. I'm nothing if not an over-communicator, just ask my collaborators.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey ThoughtScapers, 
I'll keep this REAL brief since I just did an update the other day, but I wanted to share a peek at the hard copy proof sheets I received this very morning. I am quite in love with the uncoated 70lb paper stock for the interior pages. 
Enjoy!

Hello ThoughtScape Backers!
A quick note to let you know the hardcopy proofs for the comic are in transit, on their way to me so I can review and approve the issue for press. Pretty exciting and I am anxious to see how things look on paper (that didn't come out of my functional but ancient inkjet, of course). 

Did I ever show you all those homemade proofs?

Hello ThoughtScape Comics backers!
A quick note to let you know that this week I approved the electronic proof of ThoughtScape Comics #1 from the printer, and now it's on to some hard copy proofing. This stage of the process has taken a bit longer than I anticipated (mostly due to last minute tweaks by yours truly and copious amounts of repeated proof-readings), but it's in the interest of making a hopefully slightly unique book (old-school, uncoated paper stock!), and something that will serve as a template for the future issues, so I think it'll be worth it. Here's a peek at what a spread looks like in the e-proof stage, if that's something in your wheelhouse...

updates.update_userinfo: Ex Post Facto artist Karl Slominski launches EVERMORE FALLS Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hey ThoughtScape backers! Happy Friday!
Just a quick note to let you know that Karl Slominski, artist of ThoughtScape Comics' Ex Post Facto, just launched a great new Kickstarter you should check out...
EVERMORE FALLS!

updates.update_userinfo: TSC #1 files to the printer TODAY! Plus EVERMORE FALLS from Karl Slominski!
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday, ThoughtScape backers!
I'll keep this REAL brief, as I am deep in the doing of last minute tasks related to getting the files for ThoughtScape Comics #1 ready to send to the printer TODAY, but I wanted to let you know about Karl Slominski's upcoming Kickstarter for EVERMORE FALLS!
Karl is, of course, the amazing artist of ThoughtScape Comics' Ex Post Facto: A Dask Varrick Misadventure, and EVERMORE FALLS is the first of a bunch of solo projects Karl is releasing this year. Go give it a follow so you can be among the first backers of this excellent original ALL-AGES fantasy graphic novel about saving the world from MONSTERS! You don't want to miss this. I mean, look at that teaser image!

Hello ThoughtScape Comics gang!
First, the big news, KS funds made their way into my bank account this morning. For the crowdfunding process nerds or creators among you considering or running a Kickstarter, here's how the $ breaks down for TSC #1 (fellow KS campaigners, watch out for dropped pledges, I caught on too late to effectively follow up with a few folks to have them try and update their payment methods) ...

Hey all!
Just a quick note to let you know what's up with ThoughtScape Comics #1!
I think I'll be receiving funds from KS next week. In the meantime I am doing the pre-press work, prepping files for the comic for print. A lot of time in Adobe InDesign.  Shouldn't be too much longer before I have this thing all set for the presses.

Wow, was it really only Monday that the campaign ended? I guess this was a long week...
I'll keep this brief, or try to, because I have files to prep for print.
Status report:
We're in the middle now of the two-week window during which Kickstarter collects pledge payments. Funds will make their way to me in another nine days or so it sounds like.
Update coming this weekend, in the meantime I thought I’d share some sick inks from Luke Horsman for our story Out of the Mouths of Babes, slated for ThoughtScape Comics #4! Enjoy!

We did it!
Thanks to all of you, ThoughtScape Comics #1 was successfully funded, and then some. AND OVER 400 BACKERS! This being my first Kickstarter, I really had no idea what to expect... and my mind is blown. I really appreciate all of your support.
The final numbers...

project_data.project_name: ThoughtScape Comics #1

campaign.story:
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 is the first issue (24 pages) of a 4 part comic series inspired by 1930's and 40's pulp adventure comics and art deco imagery.  As a comic fan, there are so many cool design elements and visuals in golden age stories that always capture my attention- but sometimes the stories aren't quite up to 2021 expectations. I wanted to find a way to dust off all the good stuff there and bring it into a modern story... and hopefully throw in a few twists that will surprise!
Cover to We Are Scarlet Twilight #1

Enter the story's hero-- Captain Lancet. He's a 1930's All-American crime buster* who accidentally creates the world's greatest villain before waking up a century in the future. He'll need to adjust to a strange new world-- Fritz Lang's Metropolis with some cyberpunk dystopia sprinkled in-- if he wants to overthrow the totalitarian vampire cult that now dominates the future.

*some of these things are not, strictly speaking, the truth

The Team for We Are Scarlet Twilight … is well, just me- a jack of all trades commercial artist who loves putting together comics.  My previous comic,  August: Purgatory Underground is completed and coming out soon from Action Lab’s Danger Zone imprint. While it’s great having a publisher and team to work with, it seemed like the time was right to get into crowdfunding- the freedom of being able to control my book and schedule, through pandemics and other chaos, was a huge draw.  And there are so many great looking books from indie creators coming up now in the Kickstarter comics community... I wanted to be a part of it!

This campaign is my first, so I’m trying to keep it my goals modest- enough to cover producing the 24 page comic, an alternate cover and a few fun extras that are a cool way to support production! Being as it’s my first time out, I want to keep things simple as I find my crowdfunding sea legs, so I’m printing these on demand at KaBlam, who'll ship them to you in a Gemini mailer. If this is a success- and I hope with your help it will be- for the next campaigns I’ll have a better idea of what to expect, and can get these printed up in bulk and get the physical issue cost down! That all said, I'm a newish creator, We Are Scarlet Twilight is a new book, and you have a lot of other cool options for your entertainment dollar! I want my book to get out there as much as it can, so I'm keeping my digital prices at $2.
Variant Retro Cover for We Are Scarlet Twilight #1
While I want to keep a few of the plot points under wraps... I'm sure you want to see what the interior pages look like! Pages 1-5, and a few out of sequence extras that give an idea of the atmosphere but don't give away the story can be found below!
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 1
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 2
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 3
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 4
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 5
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 14 (Unlettered)
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 16 (Unlettered)
We Are Scarlet Twilight #1 Page 24 (Unlettered)

If you're a fan of Buck Rogers and Flash Gordon serials, Fleischer Bros Superman cartoons, Golden Age Comics or old school horror and crime stories, We Are Scarlet Twilight is made for you!  I hope you'll check it out!

One more thing... I guess it wouldn't be a good kickstarter without some kind of fun reward option. Did some research. I've seen some things you people wouldn't believe: apparel, pins... something called a waifu pillow I cannot unsee. 

But that's not cool. You know what's cool? 

Aprons. 

Check out the addons to get YOUR very own Captain Lancet apron.
Holy ##@%! Your very own Captain Lancet Apron!!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with just about anything the last year or so, stuff can come up. I'm estimating it'll take about a month to finish the art on #1, and then the weeks it'll take the printers and USPS to do their thing!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Quick update- will be talking to the printer tomorrow to see if we can start things up without it becoming two separate orders (still missing about 80 responses), if that will work I'll get that process rolling! In the same vein, I'm going to finalize the "thanks" list tomorrow, so I'll be using the name on the pledge unless specified differently in the response. 

A couple of you had managed to pledge for the US version but are overseas- I've had the issue open with KS support for a while now but not getting much of a response. I'll keep on that.

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR Scarlet Twilight News for Thursday, June the 3rd, 2021
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! All the surveys are out, and the files are ready to go to the printers when we have all of those responses! 

In the meantime, to give me something to do draw we're waiting- a stretch goal! The first of these was some origins comic strips that fill in the backstories of some of We Are Scarlet Twilight's supporting characters. I'll be sending these out as updates, and the first installment is below in this very update! Hope you enjoy it!

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR Scarlet Twilight news for Saturday, May 15th!
updates.update_content:
Hey, All American-Lancet Legion!

Wanted to share a quick update, and a preview of some art! 

Getting the issue ready to send out to the printer (who's also handling fufillment), which should happen aroudn the 24nd-29th. I'll be sending out the fufillment survey early next week to get all the info for them together!

First off-- I want to thank everyone for all their support over the last month!
So now... Kickstarter will be doing their pledge thing over the next 2-3 weeks, and I'll be ... can it be true?... DRAWIING again as I wrap up the issue!!! Huzzah!
I'll be posting updates with in progress, non spoiler art and story clues- hopefully it'll be fun to follow along!
