updates.update_content: Hey everyone, I need to keep you all up to date on the developments with Major Holmes & Captain Watson #3-4.  So far things are going very well, but sadly they aren't going as quickly as we planned. It looks now like the final art won't get sent to the printers until the beginning of July, and this will delay shipping until late July. But rest assured, we're working as fast as humanly possible, and more importantly we're making some beautiful books, which is really the better goal, right? Just to prove how beautiful... here's a tease of issue #4!

Hey everyone! I just wanted to reach out to let everyone know what's happening. Major Holmes & Captain Watson rewards are rolling into my office from our suppliers, and work continues apace on issue #4. We're not expecting any changes to the current timeline of late June shipping, but as always we'll keep you posted. In the meantime, if you still want one or two spare 6th Special Intelligence Service Officer's Field Notebooks, handy for writing down important clues or coordinates (or just doodles) we have plenty! Add them, or any other awesome stuff you missed out on, to your rewards package here!

updates.update_userinfo: Jeff's (sorta) got a new Kickstarter launching, plus MH&CW Updates.
updates.update_content:
First up, some Major Holmes updates
Big thanks to all the backers of Major Holmes & Captain Watson #3-4 on Kickstarter, we love y'all. I wanted you to know things are progressing nicely. The vast majority of rewards that are not the books themselves are in hand or on the way, and that will make fulfillment that much faster. We had a little snag with our supplier of the 6th S.I.S. Officer Field Notebooks, but we found a new manufacturer and the switch is going to work out in YOUR favor!

updates.update_userinfo: A Quick addendum on the prose short stories
updates.update_content: This is a little something we intended to feature in the previous update today, but I forgot. One of the items in the Add-On store is  listed as "The NEW Imogen Watson short prose story." We wanted to be clear - this is the SAME story that was a part of this campaign, previously listed as a Sheffield Holmes Mystery. As the story comes together, I decided that an adventure that gives the reader a little background on the new "Watson" in our duo was going to be way more fun. When I first built the campaign I hadn't decided this yet, but that's how it turned out.

updates.update_userinfo: Add-On Store re-opened! Plus a shipping update
updates.update_content:
Thank you all one more time!
OK, I'll stop gushing, but we're just so excited that so many folks are interested in this book. We couldn't be prouder of it, and can't wait to get it to you. In the meantime, we've opened up our post-campaign Add-On Store for backers only! While Kickstarter does now have an Add-On feature, it didn't come online until the middle of our campaign, so a lot of our early backers may have missed out. This store allows us to get you extra copies for a friend, let's you pick up any of the "Brick Series" of alt-covers you might want, it's the ONLY place to get the special 6th S.I.S. cloth uniform patches just like those featured in issue #4, and much much more. So take a peek at the link below, and use password: T   for exclusive access.

First, more big thanks, we've crossed $7000!
This is an amazing level of support for Major Holmes & Captain Watson, not to mention a personal record for any of my campaigns, so thanks again to everyone who has pre-ordered the books.  We're grateful for everyone who came back for more, for all the new readers, and all the shares on social media and with friends. I've talked before about how our approach to Kickstarter has always been to make the books first, mostly so that delivery times are really fast. That's true, but these successful campaigns also help us fund the books, and this level of support is a huge leg-up on getting an all-new story arc of Major Holmes & Captain Watson up and running. We've got plans involving some of the biggest events in WWI and in world history for the 6th S.I.S. to get mixed up in, and as you'll see once you get your hands on these issues, there are challenges ahead for the new Holmes & Watson.

updates.update_userinfo: Some MORE great Kickstarters to follow, plus... $7000?!? WOW!!!
updates.update_content:
Check out the Limited edition "Brick" series Alt-cover for issue #3, by Michael Dorman and Anthony Lee
Brick got SHOT, and he's not happy about it. LOOK OUT!

updates.update_userinfo: We've got new art to preview!
updates.update_content:
We're launching Add-Ons right on the platform and that means more Major Holmes goodness for you!
We crossed the $6000 mark today, and that means we're opening up the Add-On section of the campaign. In the past, we've used a specialized site for this, but Kickstarter has built new Add-On accessibility right into their platform, so you can now put additional cool Major Holmes & Captain Watson swag in your pledge packages right here on the site. If you're a new backer, they'll be available as part of the checkout process. If you already backed the campaign, but there's a reward from a different tier you were interested in, simply go to MajHolmes.com and choose "Manage My Pledge" at the top of the page. It's just a few easy steps from there (we threw a quick video at the end of this update so you can see it screen by screen. Big thanks to my wife Carla for all her help!)

project_data.project_name: Major Holmes & Captain Watson #1-4: Detective series FINALE!

campaign.story:
THANK YOU, EVERYONE!!!
This campaign exceeded our wildest expectations. We’re thrilled beyond belief that so many of you joined us in White Ash to get to know Glarien. If you missed this kickstarter, we’ll be back again soon with more White Ash.

Hello everyone, we're thrilled to be back on Kickstarter for the 8th time to launch GLARIEN, an all-new comic book miniseries for mature readers set in the White Ash Universe. 
Written by Charlie Stickney, with art by Romina Moranelli, colors by Fin Cramb and letters by Conor Hughes, the 40 Page first issue of Glarien follows the early days of White Ash's most dangerous elf, as told through the eyes of Rachel, a young woman living in 1970's New York City.  Think Red Sonja meets Taxi Driver... but with Elves and demons.
Glarien: Chapter One cover by series artist, Romina Moranelli
If you’re returning to the White Ash Universe, THANK YOU so much. We owe everything to our Kickstarter community. If you're new to White Ash, WELCOME.  Glarien is a stand alone miniseries where you don't have to be well-versed in White Ash lore to enjoy the ride. But, if you want to get caught up on all things White Ash, we'll have tiers for that, or you can grab the single issues directly from Scout Comics. 
So beyond the tagline, what's Glarien about?  
Glarien follows the stories of two women and the different paths they take to overcome life-altering tragedies. Jumping from the elf realm of ancient Alfheim to the gritty streets of New York City circa 1971, two seemingly-unrelated tales will slowly weave together to reveal a critical piece of White Ash's complicated past. Oh, and because Glarien is involved, expect carnage... lots and LOTS of carnage. 
For those readers coming from White Ash, we do want to reiterate, Glarien is a more MATURE book.  White Ash follows Aleck and Lillian, two PG-13 characters in an R-rated world.  Glarien is an R-Rated character... in an R-rated world.  And as such, to appropriately tell that story, there are themes that are intrinsic to her character that need to be explored. But perhaps the best way of showing you all what Glarien is all about is to jump right into an...
 EPIC 15 PAGE PREVIEW 
 That's a good question.  And you'll find that answer inside...
We appreciate the motto, "Go big or go home." All of our books are solid reads.  Not wanting to buck that trend, Glarien: Chapter One clocks in at --  FORTY-FREAKING-PAGES.  And that kind of content deserves a premium paper weight.
We print DOMESTICALLY (so you get your books quicker) on a heavy 80 lb glossy paper stock with a cover on 100 lb glossy cover stock. When you pick up one of our books, you'll feel the  difference.
To help introduce Glarien to a larger audience, we've brought in a slew of talented women (and White Ash's Conor Hughes) to do variant covers for us to showcase her stylings. 
The first variant cover is a virgin variant from Rosi Kämpe (Spider Gwen, Extraordinary X-Men, Destiny NY) focusing on the dual worlds narrative of the Glarien storyline. 
Rosi Kämpe Variant Cover
Our second variant comes from the jaw-dropping color pallet of Liana Kangas (Star Wars Adventures, 2000 AD, TRVE KVLT, She Said Destroy).
Liana Kangas Variant Cover
Up third, we have a haunting, Rachel-centric cover from White Ash's Conor Hughes. 
Conor Hughes Variant Cover
And last, but certainly not least, from Yishan Li (Hellboy, Buffy, Swing), a virgin variant of Glarien in action.
Yishan Li Variant Cover
JUST UNLOCKED.  A COVER BY IVAN TAO
Ivan Tao Variant Cover
This stretch goal cover is even more limited.  We only have 35 available to backers as a reward tier.  However it CAN be selected as part of the Pick Two reward and comes as part of the ALL FIVE (now six) COVERS reward.
We love packing our campaigns with extra goodness.  IN ADDITION to Glarien: Chapter one, our reward tiers are filled with goodies.  Here's what you can get this time around.
All backers receiving physical rewards will get a 6" x11" print of our kickstarter page banner image on glossy card-stock.  On top of that, Conor will sign & number copies for the first 300 print backers.
Get to know Glarien.  All backers will receive this digital bundle of Glarien's previous appearances (White Ash 1/2, Glarien 1220, and Glarien 1880).
Heads, NYC. Tails you're in Alfheim. No matter how it lands, you win, as ALL physical backers in the Variant Cover Tier (or higher) will receive this limited edition, 1.5" commemorative Two Worlds Coin. It can also be added on to any physical tier.
New to White Ash?  Catch up in style with our 200 page, oversized (7.75" x11.25") hardcover collecting the first arc of White Ash.  That's over 2lbs of White Ash goodness delivered straight to your door.  This is a beautiful book you'll be happy to have on your coffee table or adorning your shelf. 
Get a sketch cover of Glarien: Chapter One  drawn by White Ash series artist, Conor Hughes.  Conor will take (reasonable) requests as to the subject mater. There are ONLY 20 of these available. A must have for collectors.
We know what it's like to open up a package and find a mangled Kickstarter comic inside. We pack our books with the care that we used in making the comic and the love that we have for our backers.
Each comic is bagged, boarded front and back and sent in stay-flat packaging. Multiple issue orders will be mailed in our custom-made, comic boxes. Made in White Ash means everything from the content, to the mailers we use, meets our standards of quality.
We LOVE stretch goals.  And if we're lucky enough to reach our initial funding goal, we'll unlock a slew of really cool mystery extra rewards for our backers.
Stretch Goal #1 ($15,000) Thank you, thank you very much UNLOCKED
Every physical blacker will receive a 6x9, custom Glarien Pin-up by Yasmín Flores Montañez commemorating the campaign reaching its funding goal. 
Stretch Goal #2 ($20,000) Stuck though you UNLOCKED
Every physical backer will be receiving a contour-cut sticker based on Glarien as she’s featured on the cover of the Scout one-shot.
Stretch Goal #3 ($25,000) Step by Step UNLOCKED
This one is for all the process junkies. Every backer will receive a behind-the-scenes PDF showing the different stages of 16 curated pages from Glarien as they go from script, to layout, to inks and finally to color.
Stretch Goal #4 ($30,000) Might I Have Some More, Sir UNLOCKED
Every backer will receive an extra, all-new, digital Glarien short story drawn by the incredible Emily Pearson. This will be added to the haul you’re already taking home. 
Stretch Goal #5 ($36,500) Cover Upgrade, UNLOCKED. 
We are adding a spot UV finish to to the main Romina Moranelli cover.
Stretch Goal #6 $40,000 Get to know us faster UNLOCKED
If you back at a catch up tier, we will be mailing those books out first.  That way, you can dive into the White Ash universe and have something to read while we're getting Glarien ready for print.
Stretch Goal #7 $46,000 Who wants another cover UNLOCKED
A new cover by Ivan Tao has been unlocked.  You can select this as a reward.  It also can be selected as part of the pick two package.  And our ALL FIVE covers is now our ALL SIX.  Anyone who pledges at the ALL FIVE COVERS Tier will automatically get this one as well. 
Stretch Goal #8 $52,000 MYSTERY STRETCH GOAL
Will This Series Be Available Through Stores?
Yes!  But not for a while (at least until mid-2022).  We LOVE our partnership with Scout Comics.  Scout has expanded the reach of White Ash, putting us into shops across the country.  In fact, we're betting some of you reading this now, may have just picked up the Scout Glarien one-shot last week. (NOTE: THIS SERIES is all new) But we also have a very loyal audience here on Kickstarter that's been with us since the beginning.  And we want to honor that legacy by bringing new White-Ash related content to you first.  
Through limited-runs and exclusive-editions on this platform, we're able to put together the high-quality content that our fans are used to, and make sure our collaborators are paid wages commensurate with their talent.  Simply put, without Kickstarter, we (and many other creators working today) couldn't afford to make these issues at the level of quality the story deserves.  
Meet the team.
Charlie Stickney is Co-Publisher of Scout Comics, and writer of comic books like White Ash, The Game and The Adept.  A twenty-year veteran of the non-comic Entertainment Industry, Charlie produced the award-winning documentary The Entertainers and helped create the animated series Horrible Histories and Cosmic Quantum Ray. 
Charlie’s career in comics started with an internship in the editorial offices of Marvel.  After a prolonged dalliance creating stories with pictures that move, Stickney has happily returned to his favorite medium. Charlie lives in Los Angeles with his amazing wife and two (mostly) lovely children. 
Romina Moranelli is an Italian comic artist. First published in France by Editions Clair de Lune (the one-shot volume Jade), then she started working for US publishers as interior and cover artist. Recently she illustrated the first issue of Siria Underworld Pimp Hustla written by Vince Hernandez. Also, she collaborated with PaperFilms, Aspen Comics, Disney, Space between Entertainment, Action Lab. She has contributed to the series White Ash before, with a variant cover for chapter three and a short story for the White Ash one-shot Glarien.
Fin loves all things comics and can usually be found happily working into the wee, small hours in his studio in Edinburgh, Scotland. Fin's previous credits include working on Savant(Dark Horse), Planet of the Apes (Madefire), Peter Pan the Graphic Novel (Birlinn) and the Johnny Cash Project.
Give Fin a shout on Twitter @Finsomniac.  
Malissa White is a writer, editor and producer from Los Angeles, CA. Her credits include co-producing Comics Creators Club on YouTube, editing Stake Presents: Jessamy and Chase the Moon. Her works include Vessel, Nightmare, and The Wood In The Reeds: A Wailing Blade Tale. She loves bringing queer women of color to the forefront of horror, science fiction and fantasy, black coffee, and singing too loudly in the shower.
Conor Hughes likes to draw comics and his breakout work has been the popular Kickstarter comic White Ash and The Game.    
You can troll him on twitch at twitch.tv/conorhughes where he can often be found making comics as well as Hopewell NJ, with his amazing wife and giggle monster baby girl.

Our amazing GLARIEN SCORE was composed by the incomperable  Seth Podowitz.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our EIGHTH Kickstarter. We've always delivered, and if we're ever delayed, we find ways to make it up to our backers. If you look at our backer numbers and comments, you'll see a happy and growing bunch. We also PRINT DOMESTICALLY to ensure that there are less ways for unexpected delays to arise. And sure, things can ALWAYS go wrong. But if they do, and there are any problems or delays, we'll be in touch and we'll find a way to make it right.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone, 
Just wanted to post a quick update and say thank you for filling out your surveys so quickly.  In less than a week, 86% of you have already turned yours in.  So to hold up our end of things, we've sent out out your Glarien Digital Shorts bundle and White Ash Volume One PDFs (for those of you who backed at the catch-up  level).  
We have also begun mailing out the White Ash hardcovers.  The first 40 hit the mail today.  We hope to get the rest of those (and the single issue, catch-up bundles) out by the end of next week.  That way, it won't be that long of a wait for those of you who'd perfer to read a print copy.

updates.update_userinfo: Catch up materials and PDFs are on their way.
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Our Glarien surveys should be on their way to your inbox now. If they don't reach you by tomorrow am, feel free to shoot us a DM and we'll send you a direct link.  They should be reasonably straight forward, but let us know if you hit any bumps when filling them out. We're planing on sending out the catch-up portion of the rewards as soon as we have most of the address in.  So please answer the survey as soon as you have a chance.

Hello everyone,
Surveys should be out in the next day or so.  We're just waiting on Backerkit to give the approval.  This process used to be a couple of hours.  But now it seems to take a couple of days.
*sigh*
Hello White Ashians/ Glarien fans.

updates.update_userinfo: Where Do We Go From here?
updates.update_content:
WOW!  Thank you White Ashians and Glarien fans,
This campaign blew the doors off any expectations we could have reasonably had. We can't tell you how much this outpouring of support on Kickstarter and on social media has meant to us.  We'll be back tomorrow with a substantial update, laying out our timeline and production workflow going forward. 
But today, we just wanted to post a quick note of appreciation... and a reminder to check your credit cards in case they didn't go through:)

Happy Monday White Ash/ Glarien fans,
We've got just two days left in this incredible campaign. Thank you so much for all the amazing support.  This has been and continues to be such a wild ride.
Just a couple reminders as the campaign draws to a close. The GLARIEN (all caps) 20% off discount code, applicable for any comics or trades at Scout Comics, will expire when the campaign ends. This was Scout's way of saying thank you to any of the Scout fans who'd come aboard this campaign.  So feel free to take advantage of that if it's of interest to you. (Reminder: the Glarien one-shot Scout has on sale is comprised of 3 shorts that you'll all be getting digitally as part of this campaign.  It is not the new series you all have just backed.)

Hello White Ashians/ Glarien fans,
We ran out of the capacity to be blown away about three updates ago.  If we did still have that ability, we'd be spending the afternoon picking our collective jaws up off the floor.  The insane pace of backers both returning and new, that continue to flood to the Glarien campaign is truly special.  We're on pace to be one of the most backed single-issue (non-trade) comic book kickstarters of all time.  So again, thank you so much.

updates.update_userinfo: Another Stretch Goal down and a LIVE EVENT coming up
updates.update_content:
Hello White Ashians/ Glarien fans.
We hope you're all having an incredible weekend.  This campaign continues to blow away all our expectations.  So much so, that we're just about out of our Hardcovers we had allotted for this campaign. (We will have a couple available post-campaign in backerkit, but only a couple.) So, because we want to make sure there are ways for new backers to catch up with what we've done before, we're breaking open the vault and releasing a small number of the just about gone inventory (in some cases, less than 15 copies) we have remaining of the original White Ash Kickstarter 1-5 floppies in a new high-end catch up tier.  These books are all first prints (With the exception of White Ash #1, that's low-print run 2nd print featuring the Hughes variant cover) and for most of them, this is the last time they will be offered as part of a kickstarter.

project_data.project_name: Glarien of White Ash #1: a fantasy series for mature readers

campaign.story:
new for our final week!
Planet Comics is back for a second issue!
Issue #2 regular cover by Adrián "Bago" Gonzalez
 Planet Comics #2 is a new, 40+ page, full-color, oversized comic anthology that pays homage to the original 1940s pulp magazine!
Issue #2 Kickstarter exclusive cover by Andrés Muños Setz
Hi everyone! My name's Jeff McClelland, and I write books like The Tick and the Kickstarter-funded Black Terror: Social Insecurity. In 2020, I funded the just-shipped Planet Comics #1 right here on Kickstarter. That was such a blast that we're here to do it again with the all-new Planet Comics #2!
Planet Comics pays homage to the original 1940-'53 title from Fiction House, which featured futuristic stories of daring heroics with a mid-century design. This new series is presented in an oversized, magazine format, with lots of room for high adventure!
The book
Some talented friends and I have gathered back together to share some new stories with you. Issue #1 led off with "The Bulwark" from Andrea Schiavone and myself, and we continue this story in our second issue! Here's a preview of the new story:
The Bulwark preview
The Bulwark preview
In this issue: an original Grumble story!
This issue also features a very special original "Grumble" story from the entire crew - Rafer Roberts, Mike Norton, Marissa Louse and Crank! This story is all new and has never been published anywhere else!  
Grumble preview
 Continuing from issue #1 is "The Old Man and The Sea of Love" by Jeff McComsey!
The Old Man and The Sea of Love preview
And debuting this issue is a story about the coolest dog you've ever met, "Badges O'Keefe, Canine Time Thief" with Dani Grew and Larry Franks!
Badges O'Keefe preview
This issue also features another in-depth article by Diana Krueger on the life of Matt Baker, Golden Age artist and designer, plus a few more items that I hope to add if we get past our initial goal!
Rewards
The biggest reward for this campaign is, of course, the book itself. Whether you go in for the physical copy or digital, I hope you'll feel that your pledge is well spent on these new sci-fi tales.
This issue comes with two covers: a regular cover with art by Adrián "Bago" Gonzalez, and a Kickstarter-exclusive variant cover by Andrés Muños Setz! You can order just the regular cover, or both at the same time.
In addition, everyone who pledges at the $8 level or above will get a copy of an electronic "making of" publication, with a behind-the-scenes look a the creation of this issue. You'll also get your name printed in a "thank you" section in the book, and you'll get a digital copy an original Planet Comics issue from the 1940s!
There are some other, limited, physical rewards that you can get from this campaign. Here are a few!
There'll be a short run of hand-screened shirts that'll look something like this:
accessorize!
 There are also some acrylic pins to be had!
it's a pin!
You can also stock up on some other book that I've been involved with!
Get a bunch of comics!
There's a limited crochet alien reward that goes well with the last campaign's rocket ship!
I mean, look at this guy.
Bulwark artist Andrea Schiavone is drawing a limited number of social media profile images as a special, limited reward! They'll look something like this:
look just as fashionable!
And if you've ever wanted to see your furry pal in a comic book, this is your chance! Artist Dani Grew will draw your dog in the "Badges O'Keefe" story if you choose this very limited reward!
*Also! The first 30 backers - at any physical level - will receive this Planet Comics fridge magnet with your order at no additional charge!*
stick it on your fridge!
The campaign goal
My first goal with this campaign is to be able to pay the creators a decent rate for their work. After that, I hope to offset some of the printing and shipping costs that otherwise might be prohibitive. 
If this campaign exceeds its initial goal, all of those extra funds will be funneled directly back into the book, adding pages and helping us get started with issue #3!
Follow me online!
If you're looking for more content, progress reports or just to see pictures of my dog, you can always follow me online by clicking the images below:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have completed and fulfilled rewards for several previous campaigns, including issue #1 of this title. There are always challenges when it comes to the physical act of putting a book together, but I'm dedicated to finishing, printing and distributing this book in a timely manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I wanted to send out a quick note to thank you all for supporting the project! We reached our goal on the 28th and LET ME TELL YOU – it was a good feeling. I’m excited to bring this book to all of you. Like I’ve said from the beginning, it’s my hope to publish at least four issues of the book, so I’m working on not just this second issue, but ones further down the line, as well.
What’s next?

Hello everyone,
There are only a few hours left in the campaign, but I've gotten a couple questions yesterday and today about add-ons and I'd like to address them while there's still (a little) time.
Add-ons are a great option for Kickstarter, and they would've prevented me from creating the vast number of different reward combinations that I did this time around, but they've only been available for a few weeks - they were still in the testing phase when I launched this particular campaign. So we're kind of running at half-steam, with a few add-ons available (like pins), but not for some of the more limited rewards, since I can't edit reward options after they have backers.

Hello once again, everyone!
We're nearing the end of our campaign, and I can't thank each and every one of you enough for all the support you've shown this project. We still have a little further to go to reach the goal, but I do believe that it's possible. I'm really excited to see this move forward! I appreciate your help in getting the word out.

Hello everyone!
Thank so much for your support of this project! With three weeks to go, we’re over $2000 and are about 70% to our goal! Things have slowed down a bit this week, and I’m curious – does anyone think that five weeks is too long for a campaign? Should I have shortened the length at all? If this campaign goes well, I’m hoping to come back with a third issue, so I’m asking for your advice for the future. If we do an issue three, should I run a shorter campaign? If you have an opinion, I hope you’ll let me know!

updates.update_userinfo: We're off to a great start!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
I want to welcome all of you to this new Planet Comics campaign! I’m happy to see that a number of you from the first campaign have navigated your way over here for the second issue – that’s wonderful!
What’s also wonderful is that in just two days, we’re already almost halfway to our overall goal! There’s still work to be done but I’m cautiously optimistic that we’ll get to where we want to go.

project_data.project_name: Planet Comics - issue #2!

campaign.story:
PROJECT Big Hype is a manga sized 300 page collection of stories modeled off Shonen Jump. We wanted to provide western creators and audience an experience that we felt was lacking in the current comic landscape. Featuring 24 stories from 72 creators, we think that you will find a new favorite series within these pages. The best part is, the whole book is completed! We are raising funds for a print run of the book and once we hit our goal all backers will get a digital version of the comic as we take the book to print.
PLAY

*For size comparision. Laid next to an issue of Shonen Jump!
“I can’t lie, I showed up for Project Big Hype because J. Michael Donohue is a fantastic writer and I wanted to see what he had cooked up. What I found was a MASSIVE tome filled front to back with diverse talent; each providing unexpected delights. I’m floored by the quality and range of the work here. 
Oh yeah, Donohue killed it again; as expected.” -Michael W Conrad (Wonder Woman, Midnighter, Tremor Dose)

"David and Sam’s work on SOUL has it all: impeccable design sense, powerful themes, and plenty of killer karate strikes to the head. Check out this story, and be excited for what these creators do next." -Zack Quaintance, Comics Bookcase
 "David and Sam have crafted a timeless tale of rebirth and revenge that should appeal to readers of all ages!" - Tony Gregori
 Here’s a look at some of the great creative teams you’ll see in the book
300 page black and white plus greyscale, perfect bound book. Manga sizing is 5 inches by 7.5 inches. We are using a matte 130 lbs. paper for the colored cover. With a 70 lbs. paper for the interior. 
All handles are for twitter. Please follow!
ERIC PALICKI- Eric Palicki writes and edits from within the safe confines of his secret headquarters in Seattle, Washington. His work includes, Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists (Scout Comics), No Angel (Black Mask), and the upcoming Black's Myth (Ahoy Comics). As an editor, Eric has twice been nominated for a Ringo Award, for the anthologies All We Ever Wanted and Dead Beats, both from A Wave Blue World. @ericpalicki

SAM PROWSE- Sam Prowse is a comic and background artist who grew up at the New Jersey shore, daydreaming about traveling the world. He’s the creator of multiple webcomics, including Jupiter Runners and Mostly Food. When he’s not at his desk scribbling away, you’ll find him out leading hikes or making a mess in the kitchen. @sprowse_comics
ERIC PALICKI-  Eric Palicki writes and edits from within the safe confines of his secret headquarters in Seattle, Washington. His work includes, Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists (Scout Comics), No Angel (Black Mask), and the upcoming Black's Myth (Ahoy Comics). As an editor, Eric has twice been nominated for a Ringo Award, for the anthologies All We Ever Wanted and Dead Beats, both from A Wave Blue World. @ericpalicki

MAXIMILLIAN MORESI- Maximilian is an artist who has been making steady inroads into the field of comics since 2017, having previously focused his attentions on fine art and illustration, with an intensive focus on algorithmic expressionism, before returning to his childhood love of cartooning.  He has so far created a horror anthology, "Utensil", the supernatural thriller "Chimeras of Holden County", and the one-shot short "The Wallflower Guild", as well as being a frequent contributor to the Comic Jam.
DAVID PEPOSE- A former crime reporter turned comic book professional, David Pepose is the Ringo Award-nominated writer of the Spencer & Locke Trilogy and Going to the Chapel at Action Lab Entertainment, The O.Z. on Kickstarter, Scout's Honor at AfterShock Comics, and more. Beyond developing stories for comics, TV and film, David has worked for CBS, Netflix, DC Entertainment and Universal Studios. Raised in St. Louis, David now resides in sunny California, where he lives his understanding partner, their rambunctious terrier, and at least six deadlines. @Peposed

JORGE SANTIAGO Jr.- Jorge Santiago Jr. started drawing comics in high school, his obsession with manga driving him back to the art table he left behind in middle school. Graduating with a Sequential Art Master's Degree from the Savannah College of Art and Design in Atlanta, Jorge wants to create comics and tell stories that capture the magic that first entranced him to reach for his pencils again. Jorge lives in the Atlanta area after moving there from his hometown in El Paso, Texas. His most well known comics are his thesis story, "Curse of the Eel" and his work with David Pepose on the Ringo Award Nominated series, "Spencer & Locke." @JorgeSantiagoJr
HELLEN MULLANE- Helen Mullane is a comic writer and dog musher. Her OGN NICNEVIN AND THE BLOODY QUEEN is out now on @humanoidsinc. Helen lives in Sweden where she spins fantastical yarns & trains sleddogs across miles of frozen tundra. She is the subject of audio doc #TheLongRun on @RTEdoconone. @Supermegabot

GABBIE SCANLON- Gabbie Scanlon is a Comics Artist from the North of England. She is the Line Artist for STONEWOOD MOUNTAINS currently on Kickstarter. She is hitting the anthology scene hard with her work appearing in PANDEMICS IN PANELS, and due to appear in COMIC SCHOOL ANTHOLOGY: INSPIRE and BLACK HOLE COMICS - A COLD DARK UNIVERSE. She is drawn to comics as the ultimate medium for storytelling and brings scripts to life with traditional ink and bold colour. She will never learn the value of a neat and tidy workspace.
@gabbiescanlon
JARRED LUJAN- Jarred Luján is a Mexican American comic writer from Texas, most notably of the mini-series Dry Foot. When he's not writing comics, he's usually ranting about hip hop or existentialism. @jarredlujan

J PAUL SCHIEK- J. Schiek is a comic book artist (and sometimes writer) currently living in Southern California. His work has appeared on various popular webcomic sites including Hyper Epics and 3 Panel Crimes. If he’s not working on at least six projects at once, he’s probably dead. @schiekapedia


MARIO CANDELARIA- Mario is a stand up comedian and comic book writer based out of the Philly Suburbs. He’s also a Knicks fan, but we don’t talk about that. @TheOtherMarioC

A.I MILLER- A.I.Miller is a comics artist and illustrator, who has work published in dozens of anthologies in the USA and UK. He's currently slowly writing a graphic novel about Creeps, and is also slowly working on a webcomic titled The Cup King (http://thecupking.com).@AAIMILLER

*will not be in color in final product

MATT HARDING- Matt Harding is a California-based comics writer and artist, having worked on publications such as Stan Lee’s Lucky Man, Guns Akimbo, and Gwar. He’s been self publishing titles such as the Not Forgotten Anthology and Popapocalypse for a decade in the San Francisco comics scene. @Stilltsinc

MARK SIMMONS- Mark Simmons is a San Francisco-based freelance artist. His cartooning and sequential art work includes comics for publishers such as Capstone, Behrman House, Madefire, and Rebellion; animation and advertising storyboards; and animated graphic operas. He also teaches classes in comic art, figure drawing, and wildlife illustration for the Academy of Art University and local zoos and museums. For more information, see his website at http://www.ultimatemark.com or consult his badly neglected social media accounts. @toysdream
JOE DONAHUE- J. Michael Donohue is a comic book writer whose life-long love of horror movies and comics has shaped him into the storyteller he is today. His work has been featured on Hyper Epics and multiple anthologies, and include such titles as, Together Forever, Mary Hall, Crushed, and Rebecca: Tales of Resonant. @JMichaelDonohue

SINNERMAN- Sinnerman is a potato sack. Two holes for the eyes. @SinnermansSkull
DANIEL GORDON- Daniel Gordon is a contributor to The Comic Jam website and creator of The Wolf and the Crow comic series published by Action Lab. He survives on coffee and em dashes—but mostly coffee. @watchdanwrite

ESZTER O.- Eszter will occasionally stagger out of the primordial ooze to draw comics with strangers of ill repute. She enjoys emphasizing dynamic gestures, and her favorite project to date has been illustrating the adventures of her D&D group.
CASSIE PARKES- Hi Doug, here’s my bio: “Cassie Parkes is a writer from the UK who works in the games industry. When she’s not writing, she loves baking cakes and learning about the past. You can find all of her work at http://CassieParkes.com.” @CassieParkes

TERESSA DEL PILLAR- Teresa is a freelance cartoonist based in Madrid (Spain). When she's not teaching or working on comissions she works on her ongoing graphic novel "Graduation Nightmares" which she publishes on the webcomic plarform Webtoons. You can also find her making youtube videos (Teresa del Pilar) or on instagram (Teresa_del_pilar).

LAN PITS- Lan Pitts likes watching, talking, and writing comics about wrestling. He has mapped every great taco spot in the DC and Baltimore areas. He lives with his partner and their menagerie of pets who are utterly perfect in every way. @pittsed_off

LARRY WATTS- Larry Watts is a Florida based illustrator - Best known for his work on Robyn Hood (Zenescope) and the Army of Darkness and Evil Dead 2 Comics. His past credits include work for Valiant, Aftershock, Dynamite, Spacegoat, Zenescope, Top Shelf, Alternacomix, Full Moon, and more. @larryewatts_art

LESLY JUILEN- Lesly Julien is a comic writer. A husband. A stay-at-home dad. A collection of positive nouns and adjectives, carbon, and so much pizza. He enjoys writing stories that touch on the absurd like BIZARRE RIDE, that examine life like GRATITUDE, and that plague his thoughts like how a company might market to supervillains, ROGUE MARKETING. Lesly is a proud Marylander who moved across the country to San Diego, California for a short time, but now lives in Omaha, Nebraska because kids are expensive. Lesly writes because he wants to see different stories being told. He is driven to create and share his own in an era where representation is improving, but still lacking. Find him on social media @LesWrite

RACHEL DISTLER- Rachel (@redtiebear) got her start making Garfield comics at the age of 5, until Toonami happened and decided anime and graphic novels would be a more lucrative career choice. She was wrong. Now, she spends most of her time kissing her wife, her cats, thinking about James Kochalka’s divisive “Craft is the Enemy,” and washing her hands. @redtiebear
BRENT FISHER- Brent (they/them) is a comic writer that shares their central Ohio home with their wife Magan and two old miniature Dachshund siblings, Hansel and Gretel. In addition to creative pursuits that also include other forms of short fiction including poetry, Brent sits on the board of an LGBTQIA+ youth advocacy organization and collects Captain Marvel memorabilia with unrepentant zeal. @carolcollector

FELLHOUND- Fell Hound is a queer, Asian-Canadian cartoonist from Toronto, best known for her love of drawing badass women. She made her debut with self published titles such as Do You Believe in an Afterlife? and Commander Rao. When not drawing cool stuff, she likes to drive ambulances for fun. @FellHound_
BEN HUMENIUK- Ben Humeniuk is a cartoonist and educator whose graphic novels include WAKING LIFE (Comicker Press) and THE MAGNIFICENT MAKERS series (Rosen Publishing). He lives in Texas with his wife and their three kids, and seeks to create work that evokes empathy and understanding. @BenHumeniuk
KELLY LATHAM- Kelly is an illustrator creating all-ages content, and especially enjoys making comics. She is fond of limited color palettes, fun stories, and in-depth environments. Kelly has drawn for 20+ zines and anthologies and likes meeting new creatives. In addition to drawing, Kelly loves traveling and collecting rubber ducks. @SleepyHeadKL
DANIEL KALBAN- Daniel Kalban is a Brooklyn, NY based writer. He is the creator/writer of American Dreams, published by Short Fuse Media. When not working on comics, you can probably find him rushing around New York City as an office assistant/messenger for a major metropolitan law firm. @DanielKalban

DEREK CHASE- Derek L. Chase began his career by attending The Kubert School, a strange, unnatural place dedicated to the study and production of comic books.
Since then, his work has led him to becoming the Brand Identity Developer for a small company, working as a graphic designer, and starting the podcast Comically Pedantic. @DerekLChase
DAVID LYONS- David Lyons is making his published writing debut in the Big Hype anthology. Currently in Maryland, he is married and has two sons. He has completed the first issue of his kids' comic, Destructor (story of a boy who turns into a robot to battle the pains of growing up), which he is preparing for digital release. @lyonswrites

SAM OWENS- Sam Owen is a freelance comic artist and character designer with a focus on making fantasy and science-fiction comics geared towards young adults and kids. His work is heavily inspired by shonen manga. @dsamowen
VERONICA V. JONES- Veronica V. Jones loves to tell stories through her art, first for tabletop RPGs before moving into the children's book market. She has created artwork for several MG novels and picture books. Currently, Veronica is developing an original graphic novel, OPERATION: ESCAPE VELOCITY @vvjonez
ALAN FLORES- Alan Flores: Robot programmer by day, comic book writer by night. @Alias078

DIEGO DE LA ROSA- Diego de la Rosa: Second generation self-taught artist from Northeast Mexico. @diego.de.la.rosa (Instagram)

NATHAN CHIO- Nathan Chio is a comics writer and teacher of history. His recent work has been published in Always Punch Nazis vol. 3 (Nazi hunters & Dinosaurs!), the Local Haunts anthology (Spiritualism & THE GOD MACHINE!), and Elsewhere vol. 2 (Little Old Lady Take up a Life of Crime). He’s on Twitter @NathanChio.

CRAIG FLORENCE- Craig Florence is a self-taught artist and illustrator specializing in traditional line art. His work has been included in several anthology collections including “Local Haunts”, “Topia: A Bonfire Anthology”, “BORDERx: A crisis in Graphic Detail” and numerous others. Craig’s work can be found on Instagram at c.r.florence. 
NICHOLAS SLOVER- Nicholas Slover is a clump of space dust from NJ that makes comics. He takes inspiration from some of the indie comics from the 90/00's, zines, lyrics, foggy mornings, and the things you see when you flip over a big rock.
KEVIN MAHEDO- Kevin Mahadeo is a comic book writer and pop culture podcaster whose stories have appeared in comic anthologies including Lilies Vol. 8, Recondite Hill, Kayfabe Vol. 3, Monster Mash-Up, and Life Finds a Way. You can find out more about him, and check out his work, on his website themahadman.com @kevmahadeo

JAVIER MARTIN CABA- Javier Martin Caba is a Granada, Spain based comic book artist and illustrator. He has drawn several indie comics, including Blood Brothers (Two-Head Press-Dynamite Entertainment), Lucha Brothers (Chido Comics), The Atomic Victory Squad and Social Fiends. Javier has also published some short stories in a few anthologies. @monopilas
KATRARINA JÜNEMANN/ANNA FOUBERT- Anna Foubert and Katharina Jünemann are a Canadian/German duo. Artist Anna has worked on a variety of projects, including Shane Smith's series Undad. Katharina is new to the world of comics, having spent her time studying German philology as well as writing and editing fiction. @annafoub
DOUG WOOD- this is Doug’s first time being a supervisor please forgive him. Don’t follow him on twitter

DANNY GORNY- Danny is a writer and editor from Toronto who makes comics at the RAID studio. His first book, House of Doom, was released right around the beginning of the pandemic, which sucks. His graphic novel, Sleepwalkers, is now updating weekly on Tapas. In his free time he reads medieval manuscripts. @DJCrashOverride

KEVIN LINTZ- Kevin D. Lintz is a comic book letterer and editor from Fort Worth, TX. He was trained in Comics Experience and The Comic Jam and has worked with dozens of creators to help comic projects come to fruition. His biggest project is his all-ages comic book, Team SLUG, in which he was writer, letterer, and editor. @ArtfulD0dger

ALBERTO RAYO- Alberto Rayo is a comic book writer and editor from Perú. He has written for Ascend Comics, Power & Magic Press, Capstone and Heavy Metal. He's probably reading a comic right now. @RayoInTheBottle

FRANKEE WHITE- Frankee White is a Chicago based comics writer & editor known for 20 FISTS, BROKEN BEAR, & PROJECT: STARLESS DAYDREAM. When not writing, you can find him on Twitter @frankee_white

HONEY HAM- From acquiring an animation degree and having dreams of game design, to working odd jobs in warehouses and factories, Honey F Ham's life did not lead towards the career of an editor, and truth be told, this is her first time, though she does the job with gumption. She hopes this will the be the start of a new chapter in her life, and hopefully a new career. @ComicsExalted

TOM WOODMAN- By day, Tom works as a fiction editor.  At precisely twilight, he writes comics, currently working with Alex Moore and Paul Peart-Smith on new projects. His first graphic novel, Future, is out now from Cast Iron Books. @TomMayoWoodman

GARY MOLONEY- Gary Moloney is a lawyer by day and vigilante writer by night from Cork, Ireland, known mainly for his work in comics. His debut anthology, Mixtape, was named Best Irish Anthology by ICN in 2018. When not locked to his desk, he enjoys windsurfing and arguing with Chaz, his aging King Charles Spaniel. @m_gearoid

SARA HARDING- Sara Harding (she/her) is a freelance editor and writer based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Over the last several years, she has worked with various writers and artists in the indie comics scene as they craft their imaginative worlds of wonder. Some notable editorial projects include "The Not Forgotten Anthology", "A Cold, Dark Universe", and currently a yet-to-be-revealed project through Comixology. In her personal work, she is continuing to write a book series with hopes to publish within the next year. When she's not staring at a screen, she enjoys spending time with her comic book artist and writer husband, Matt, and their two spooky cats, Mulder and Scully. @bansheeriot

TRAVIS HILL- Travis Hill is the writer of Thorn, a comic about Black vigilantism. He is also the creator of Mustard Seed, a semi-autobiographic comic about teenage homelessness. He is currently a PhD candidate at the University of Texas at Dallas with concentration fields of African American Literature Studies, US Religious History, and Comic Book Studies. His academic work in comic book studies includes a chapter in the forthcoming volume Theology and Spider-Man in the Pop Culture and Theology Series from Lexington Books and Fortress Academic, as well as the presentation Thorn, A Darker Knight: Black Vigilantism in an Anti-Black World. He currently lives in Dallas with his beautiful wife Bridget and his two dogs, Albus and Remus. @travisbhill5

JORDAN PATRICK FINN- Jordan Patrick Finn is a comic writer and editor from Ajax, Ontario, Canada. With support from Kickstarter, Jordan has written and self-published two graphic novels: Death Kanji & Hellcraft. Jordan is also a licensed pilot, and spends his days on cross-country flights with his wife, Meagan. @jordanpfinn
SISTER PROJECT:
Hey we have teamed up with another Kickstarter for cross promotion. We have a ton sci-fi here but if you want a straight injection take a look! 

Ever wonder about the paths we didn't take in life? About what could have been? What if the multiverse is real and every choice you didn't make actually happened in another reality? An infinite number of choices/realities. THE TESSELLATION is a comics series about all realities, side-by-side. Issue #1 plays with that conceit and then takes it a step further: What if you could visit these other realities? Where would you go? To one where you're a millionaire? To some post-apocalyptic wasteland? Maybe spy on yourself in a reality where your life has imploded? The rabbit hole is deep and it beckons... What's more, the issue's four stories are all told on the same page, in rows, throughout the issue. Weird enough for ya?
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/martianlit/the-tessellation-1
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1 - All the work is complete, ready to print!

2 - Although this is our first time wrapping our arms around a project of this size we are committed to making you the best looking book we can and getting it to you as quickly as possible. We are still in the midst of a pandemic and shipping and other supply lines are subject to fluctuation we will be 100% transparent if these result in any delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hi everyone! I have been hard at work shipping those books to all of you. I am so excited to see all books have arrived safely to their new homes. That said, I still have 50 or so rewards to fulfill. Whether they be physical or digital. If you have not, please fill out your reward survey so that I can get you your rewards. If you have not received your physical copy yet and have filled out your survey and you have not received a tracking number, please message me. I will get you a tracking number right away! I hope every one is digging what we accomplished.

updates.update_userinfo: Books Are Here! Shipping Has Begun!
updates.update_content:
HI everybody! I have all the books resting in my house. Well I did...until I shipped out the first 50 books this morning! I would have got to more last night but the power went out. haha. I am so ready to get these into your all hands. My family has taken off tomorrow to help me get through them all. Trust me I have a large family. 

Extra exciting news if you missed out on it, I have started putting together Big Hype vol 2 after the success of this one! We already have some incredible names attached. 
Michael W Conrad (Wonder Woman)

Hi everybody! Sorry for the delay to this update. I wrote a few weeks back when I sent out a majority of the digital copies of the book to backers, that I expected the physical books to arrive at my house by last Monday the 19th. Unfortunately, there was a bit of delay and the books should be arriving to me this Thursday the 29th. I already have the confirmation that they have shipped. 

I will be spending the rest of the day making sure that all people that responded to the surveys received their digital copies of the book. If you have not received it by now please message me and I will fix that right away.

Start off by apologizing for taking so long to make this update. I am terribly sorry. I am excited by all of you that helped us reach an incredible amount of people. We would not have done this without support. Right now we are in a holding period of a couple weeks until the funds make it into the account. From there I will be able to send the file to the printer and the pdfs into the boxes of backers. Special shout out to Kickstarter Comics Outreach for taking a chance on a new comer like us. Their help really impressed many to join. 

KICKSTARTERS WE LOVE:

updates.update_userinfo: Last Day! Now Kickstarters Project of the Day!!
updates.update_content:
The end is here, but before we wrap up we have been blessed with one more opportunity. We are Kickstarter's Project of the Day! I can't believe it and I am excited. I am not taking this lightly, expect me to be promoting everywhere you will be today! Please help me in making Kickstarter proud they chose the right pony to back. Help spread the word Please?! Thank you for joining us! Let's finish strong!


Other Projects We Love:

What a run this has been, thank you all for coming along for the ride. As of last night we past my previous Kickstarter record, so I am even more ecstatic. Remember all monies collected now go directly to the creative teams. Tell your friends and help out the future of our comics industry!!! 

I mainly come to you today to show off some friends that I believe need spotlights on their Kickstarters. If you have the means, please give these incredible books a peep!

 Comics You Might Love!

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! 100% funded in a week!!!
updates.update_content:
Wow! Thank you all so much for backing this book. The team is in complete shock that we funded this so quickly. Special love to the creators on the book for doing this with me. 

Speaking of loving the creators of this book, I am wanting to do stuff to reward them for their work. We hope to soon add reward tiers that money will go directly to the creators after the Kickstarter. Things like original pages of art, prints, writer zoom calls, or even script reviews for you aspiring creators! Please keep an eye out as we roll those out in the coming days!
OTHER KICKSTARTERS I LOVE:

Wow less than 12 hrs and we have already hit half our goal! Thank you all for backing and spreading the word! Let's get everyone in on this huge book!!! There have been some questions and suggestions that I wanted to clear up here!

Q: You have not followed a single Kickstarter, how can we trust you to produce? 
A: This is actually my (Doug Wood) second account. I made this second account to house the Big Hype Comics products, but if you look at my account I have back a few projects. Plus many attached creators have backed into the hundreds of projects. This book is complete. I have a sample as shown. I hope that will prove I can make this happen.

project_data.project_name: PROJECT: Big Hype

campaign.story:
Mia Raven. The thief who became a detective who became a thief, 
only this time she steals from crooks.
 Mia Raven: swarthy, strong-willed woman who cares less about the law than she does recovering stolen items. Mia Raven: gun-toting feminist icon with a troubled past, bad attitude and tattered psyche. Mia Raven: CEO and founder of Recovery Incorporated, a company that will help you get your (valuable) stolen item back when the police can't. Or won't. For a hefty price, of course.
Recovery Incorporated is a 24 page, over-sized 9x12 inch European formatted comic, part 1 in a 4 issue mini-series.
 My name is Michael Penick and I've been a professional artist and writer for over twenty years now, a freelancer in the advertising, film, illustration, comic book, motion graphics, and interface design industries. A jack of all trades, really, but my first love has always been visual storytelling, and at 51, I'm tired of letting all the stories I've been developing and writing languish alone in my imagination and on my computer. 
Thanks to all the wonderful and generous support I've received so far, its time to interrupt this regularly scheduled kickstarter page and introduce some stretch goals! If so many stretch goals seem generous, then you're just going to have to live with it! 😉 I'm so grateful for how my campaign has gone so far that I want to help you get as much extra stuff as I can!  
 Recovery Incorporated - Another Day At The Office marks the beginning of my journey to bring those stories to you. It's the first of a four issue mini-series. I've been working on issue 02 since the beginning of the year. If you'd like to keep up with my progress, you can sign up for my newsletter here.
The first issue of Recovery Incorporated is finished. In fact, it's been finished since 2012! I was hired, at the time, to create a story for a British magazine. I brought my long time friend and writing partner Dean Deckard along with me to help in the creation process. The story would unfold in eight page increments each month. 
 Unfortunately, the financier of the magazine, who lived in Eastern Europe, had trouble getting funds to the UK, which meant the editor there couldn't get funds to me! In light of that, I felt i had no choice but to stop my comic from running in the magazine. It was only a few months later that the entire magazine folded. It was a sad, but not uncommon affair, in the comics world.
I "shelved" the story at the time because, well, I really needed to find work and make up for the months I had just spent working for no pay, but I also felt it wasn't really something American comic book readers would be into. In the time between then and now, however, the independent comic book market in the US has truly flourished, as has the Kickstarter platform. So here I am.
 Because I've been around. Ive seen what the publishing world looks like and what the contracts look like. I think, more and more, that Kickstarter is the future of comics and, potentially, publishing. I think this is the place to be. Even with an industry publisher I'd have to do my own marketing if i really wanted my book to be successful, so why not just do the rest of the work while I'm at it? And if I'm really, brutally honest with you, my ADD makes it easier for me to work for myself than under the deadlines imposed by the comic book industry most of the time. I'm a self-motivated guy - I don't require artificial stimulation to motivate me. Kickstarter provides me with the one link that was missing in my ability to complete my own production chain.
To answer that, let me ask yet another question: what makes Mia Raven different from all the other Femme Fatales you've seen in recent years? A lot of things. 
 First off, she's a thief, not a spy. 
 Second, she's into using her brains far more than she is using guns or sex. 
 Third, unlike other people in the modern world of storytelling (think storytellers whose names rhyme with Bay Bay Haybrams), I like to plan ahead - I know what happens to Mia through each of the 4 planned story arcs. I know her character arc from before issue 01 begins through where we leave her on the final page of her saga. 
     You know what allows me to do? It allows me to put clues in issue 01 for which you won't see a payoff for another 10 issues. Those are the kinds of stories I love reading, so those are the kinds of stories I endeavor to write. 
 I also like to do my research. Everything you'll find in these stories - every piece of tech, every security system or vehicle or any other such thing - either exists or is technically plausible. I love science, so I love to get it in wherever I can. I also hate when stories do ridiculous stuff I know is impossible - I don't write 80s Bond films, okay? 😉 
     To up the ante even further, I served in the army, in the infantry, for a little over 4 years. I fast-roped out of Black Hawks, skydived out of all manner of military aircraft (even at night), trudged through the jungle on moonless nights wearing NVGs with an IR laser attached to my rifle - I got to do a lot of high speed stuff in my 4 years, stuff that not only allow me to bring a lot of knowledge and accuracy to my stories, but authenticity to my characters and the things I put them through.
 I've just shown you the first eight pages of my comic. Why? Because this is like the opening scene in Raiders of the Lost Ark - it introduces you to the character and the kind of thing she does, but the actual plot of this story doesn't begin until the next page.
     One thing you might notice about Recovery Incorporated is that it's not drawn to typical American comic book proportions. It was commissioned for european standards, which I love, so that's the way I plan to print it. That means Recovery Incorporated will be printed at 9x12 inches, making my comic as wide as typical American comics are tall. I want the work to be presented the size it was intended to be shown. Not only will you be getting a larger comic than normal, but you're getting more story per page than typical American comics. There's plenty of story left in 16 pages, and I plan on having issue 2 ready to go once you get issue 01 in your hands. 
     A word of caution, however...
     While there's no nudity in Recovery Incorporated, there's adult language and reference to adult situations. This isn't for kids. It would be irresponsible for me to not let you know that up front.
     So what are early readers saying about the first issue of Recovery Incorporated?
 Andy Jenkins - "It's a polished book with some really fluid dynamic art and well thought out panel and page structure... it's exciting, builds up the characters well and has enough little twists and turns to keep you reading and looking forward to the next issue."
Randy Stone - "I knew going in that with Michael Penick's art, this would be a great looking book, but I was equally impressed with the story he did with co-writer Dean Deckard. The ideas were fun and the pace was exciting. This is a blockbuster on the page!"
Mark Freeman - "Recovery Incorporated is everything I love about independent comic books. The story itself is fresh and different. The characters are written as real people with real-world issues. The artwork is crisp, clean and easy to follow, while the writing has layers of complexity. This makes for a fun and engaging read. I can’t wait to see what happens next."
Danny Gorny - "The action is compelling. It's a pleasure to read a globetrotting heist story with such an elegant setup. The art and colouring are great - featuring excellent use of dramatic shots during the exposition scenes, and the backgrounds and setting are exciting. The colouring choices, especially during the flashbacks, is inspired."
Gabriel Hernandez - "Recovery Incorporated starts strong and gets stronger with each page. It's a refreshing update to  the 'Gentleman Thief' legend for the 21st Century."
I'm not asking for a lot. I'm keeping it simple because I want this to succeed. If i can pass my funding goal, I'll shoot for some simple stretch goals like a nicer cover stock and a couple of other things I'll introduce later in the campaign. What I am asking for is covered in the graphic here:
As you can see, there's nothing fancy here. No thrills, no frills - nothing outside what it costs to run this campaign, print the books, and get them to you.
Here's what you can expect from me once the campaign has ended. You can see the plan right here; I'll keep backers up to date as each step here comes to pass so you'll know everything is going as scheduled. If there are any hiccups, I'll let got know immediately and tell you how that will affect the schedule.
2/11 - Campaign ends 
2/26 - Receive funds from Kickstarter 
3/1 - Place ptint order
3/15 - Receive print order at my house 
3/29 - All orders packed and shipped
5/23 - Domestic orders received by mail
Media mail can take 8 weeks to arrive - that's why the long shipping window. Many packages may arrive quicker than that, but I'd rather have you're package arrive earlier than I told you than later. During this time I will be busting my hump to get issue 02 pencilled, inked, colored, and ready to go so that I can launch the campaign for issue 02 right on the heels of you getting issue 01 in your hands. If you want to follow my progress along the way, my newsletter is the best place to do it! If you missed it before, you can sign up for it here.
I'm offering three covers for my first issue of Recovery Incorporated. The main cover, drawn by me, will be used everywhere. The two alternate covers will only be available here on Kickstarter, possibly only during this one campaign. I will never offer them anywhere else - that's a promise. So let me show you the covers:
     As I mentioned before, my longtime friend and co-writer Dean Deckard helped me create Mia Raven and the story that covers this first mini-series. We’ve been the closest of friends for 30 years now. We challenge each other over everthing, make each other think, and work well as writing partners because neither of us care about ego. All we care about is story.
     My only other collaborator on this issue was the Eisner award winning colorist John Rauch. I can't begin to tell you what a joy it is to get pages back from John. I've worked with him on several projects and never once have I had to fret over a single thing. Its like he reads my mind, but more clearly than I can. My biggest hope for this campaign, in fact, is that I can raise enough funds to hire him to color issue 02 for me as I get the pages ready - that will allow me to get issue 02 to you in the shortest time frame possible. That's one of those stretch goals I mentioned a second ago.
     Now let's take a look at the pledge levels I'm offering up. I've tried to keep them as simple and easy to understand as I could. 
 Update: Funding goal bonus reward - all backers at every level will now receive free access to an audio commentary of me talking my way through issue 01 as both a writer and an artist 
Allow me to take a moment and explain the "Prior Work Bundle" limitation. I don't have 10 bundles in reach of the three tiers I'm offering it in, I have ten total. If a person pledges for one in one tier, it reduces their availability in all three tiers together. To reiterate: I only have 10 Prior Work Bundles in total. 
On top of these support tiers, you can add any of the following items to your pledges (in case you're wanting to build your order in a way I haven't thought of in the tiers, want more of one thing, or even two forms of original art):
For the sketch cards, pin-ups, original pages of art, and covers, I will contact each person in the order that they pledged to choose which piece of art they want from the available choices. 
Thank you so much for your time, and, if I get your support, for helping me get this ball rolling. You are an essential element of my future and I value you more than I can say. Every day when i get up and work, I will endeavor to make sure i have given you more than your money's worth.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As far as risks and challenges go, the book is ready to go to the printer, which I've already chosen, and is here in the US, so turn around time will be quick. I'll pay for insurance on the shipping so if anything were to happen, I'll be covered to get another print run done. That just leaves getting your packages to you. I've taken lessons from the most experienced kickstarters and have gotten the best materials to make sure your books reach you as safely and perfectly as possible, and while this is only my first kickstarter, I've been a professional artist and writer delivering jobs on time for over 20 years now - you don't stay in business if you don't communicate well, get your work done, and delivered on time. I'll keep you posted on the post production process and get your goods to you in as timely a manner as humanly possible. That's a promise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: My book is officially in the print queue and ready to run. That's the good news. The not so good news is that I was informed there'd be no way to get the order in my hands before the 20th or 21st of June, so the print orders are going to be running right up against the very end of June getting to you - some of them might be going into July (I can only package the physically orders so fast, even with help). I will get the digital rewards to you before that, however. I'm working on getting the big sketchbook together now. It's going to cover a little bit of everything - stuff from my days in advertising, some film work, illustration work, and comics, of course.

I've been silent for a while. I've just been trying to get everything done. I was dumb enough - read that as smart enough - to hire an editor. I thought it would basically be for spelling and grammar checks, but I was wrong. We went through each page very meticulously, moved balloons around, made small changes to art here and there, and even shuffled a few pages around.
     The up side is that you're going to get a book that is much better than it was before. I'm really excited about this fact. The down side is that it's taken me so long to get it all done and ready to go to the printer. The reason for this is that this all happened after the book was, well, finished and the kickstarter had run. All this editing usually takes place on the end, and usually before I create the finished art. That's what will happen from here on out, thankfully, but for this first issue it seems I'm having to do everything the hard way. It's been a real steep learning curve for me - one I will be happy to put behind me.

I thought I might never get done, but it's finality happened! The pages are in the hands of my colorist, so while they're being colored I'll be inking and coloring the 7k bonus print and getting the rest of issue 1 ready for the printer so that when I get the colors back (in a week, we've agreed), off the book goes! 
     Getting the rest of the book ready includes getting everyone's names put into alphabetical order and added to the back (which I'm pretty sure is going to include adding more pages - I feel certain I can't get 550 names on 1 page, even at 9x12 inches). 😄 It also includes getting my editor to proofread the book and me making spelling and grammatical corrections based on that proofread. Then there's getting the front and back inner covers done. Not too terrible, but a very busy week while the colors are happening.

updates.update_userinfo: Art link and update on schedule of events
updates.update_content:
So the first two pages of the prologue are inked. I will have the second two pages inked by the end of this coming weekend. While the pages are being colored I will be correcting the mistakes my editor points out regarding spelling and grammar. I'll also ink and color the 7k stretch goal bonus pin-up. Everything will then go to the printer on Monday, April 26th and should be back in my hands two weeks from that date. 
     As soon as the book goes to the printer I can finally turn my attention to all the sketch cards and 9x12 inch pin-ups that still need to be inked! I shouldn't have any problem getting those done in the two week window that the book is being printed and shipped to me. I will also get the digital rewards all put together during that time period, so that once the physical books arrive at my house, I'll be ready to send out all the digital rewards - everyone will . Oh, and

updates.update_userinfo: Couple of goofs with Backerkit! I'm learning the hard way there. 😕
updates.update_content:
Thanks to everyone for the prompt responses and feedback from the Backerkit surveys! I've gotten almost 2/3 of the responses already and it's only been 24 hours since the full slew of surveys went out! So here's the two goofs I made:
     1 - I completely forgot to ask what name everyone wanted to have in the back of the comic book!!! Aaarrrggh!!! What a derp move! The easiest way for me to deal with this is to send a second survey out through Kickstarter with just that one question, so that's what I'm going to do. I'm so sorry I forgot this and  that you're going to get a second survey from me. I feel like there's a giant stupid sign on my forehead. 😬

updates.update_userinfo: BackerKit surveys are on the way
updates.update_content:
Super short update here - just letting everyone know that the Backerkit surveys have been sent, so they should be arriving soon! Yay! That's one big step taken. Now to get this flippin' prologue finished so i can get the book to the printer!
Michael

updates.update_userinfo: Backerkit surveys are finally starting to roll out! And some art!
updates.update_content: So when you use BackerKit, once your surveys are ready, you start with what’s called a ”smoke test.” They send surveys out to 5 percent of your backers across all pledge levels. I was finally able to hit the button for that this morning, so a few of you will see the survey’s showing up today. Once the BackerKit team and I see that those go well, everyone else will get theirs. I have to hand it to the BackerKit team - they’re very thorough and responsive. They’re not a nameless bunch of bots who don’t really interact with you much; quite the opposite. They are very hands on and willing to get into your survey setup with you and get quite detailed. I’ve been nothing but impressed. I wasn’t expecting to need the services of such a company on my very first campaign, so it’s been a pleasure to need them and to find that they’re a great company so far to work with.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick update - ATTENTION - Those who backed at any original art level
updates.update_content: If you backed at any original art level, please be on the lookout for messages from me. I'm trying to get you to select the art you want prior to sending out the Backerkit surveys. I will try for a reasonable time before I have to move forward anyways. I'm trying to contact people in the order they pledged to choose sketch cards, pin-ups, and original pages of art. If you're paying attention and haven't heard from me, don't worry, I'll get to you - I'm just trying to get earlier people on the list to respond. Some people don't respond as well as others, I'm learning! 😄 😬 Maybe this will help? Only time will tell...

updates.update_userinfo: The reason they tell you to build extra time into every step of your planning process
updates.update_content: Let me tell you, Murphy's Law loves me. I mean it sits around and waits over my should at every turn in life. If I didn't know better I'd think Murphy were simply a code name for Michael. I'd laugh about it if it didn't make me start crying at the same time. Case in point: the simple task of re-lettering issue 01. The first half went easily enough, but now that I'm onto the half where I had the help of an amazingly talented colorist, who obviously made a simple mistake that in most cases no one would ever have known about, I'm now dealing with that tiny little sliver of not-most-cases.

Hey, everyone! Hope you've all had a wonderful week. I have! I've been busy bouncing back and forth between all kinds of odds and ends, all of them fun and all of them oriented towards stuff directly related to my campaign. I've berm getting Backerkit stuff set up, working on my Kickstarter post mortem, which might sound a little gruesome, but it's just a report you do to tske stock of all the numbers to help you know how things went so you can analyze them and use them to help you grow in the future. Not only that, but got take mental stock as well. That side was very easy for me - things have gone so amazingly well that there's little to no downside to this entire experience. I'm have all of you to thank for that!

project_data.project_name: Recovery Incorporated #1 - action, drama, crime & sex appeal

campaign.story:
FEBRUARY IS FOR FLOPPY COP! BE THE FIRST TO FEAST YOUR FUNNY BONE ON THE FLOPPIEST FOLLOW UP IN ALL OF FLOPSTARTER! (footnote: Kickstarter may not actually have agreed to change its name to Flopstarter, we're looking into it.)
Cover by Seth Damoose with colors by Anthony D Lee!
WHAT IS FLOPPY COP? It's a hilarious, absurd, pun-tastic comic about a bizarre cop who is bending over backwards to fight crime...literally, because he's missing all the bones in his spine! But don't call him a pushover because - as Floppy likes to say - "you don't need a spine to have balls."
In Volume One, Floppy and the WTF PD battled the most absurd villains imaginable and became an indie comic hit, instantly getting scooped up by Source Point Press!
Volume Two only gets crazier from there! Floppy and the gang meet a new enemy obsessed with remaking the world in his own carbo-loaded body image! Floppy Fans, meet - - - - - - PRETZEL FACE!
Pretzel Face with Hover Pretzel and Blubber Gun!
Floppy and the gang get help in the form of a new cop on the force, a perfect specimen of human being nicknamed Stiffy Cop! And if there's one thing Floppy and Pretzel Face have in common, it's that they can't stand how damn perfect he is!
Look at that hunk! What a dreamboat!
Who IS Pretzel Face? Could he be fellow officer and pretzel fetishist Kyle Barnaby?
Hello, my name is Kyle Barnaby and I'm addicted to pretzels.
Solve the mystery and bust your gut laughing in this 152 page graphic novel written by Dan Dougherty (Beardo, Touching Evil) and illustrated by Seth Damoose (Savants, Brathalla) with colors by Milena Deneno and Lacie Barker and a foreword by Ryan Browne of Curse Words and God Hates Astronauts infamy! GAHHH!
There are all kinds of cool merch and perks to this campaign but hold up a second because PRETZEL FACE IS ATTACKING AGAIN, DUCK AND COVER!
That's Doctor Pirate there, who received his degree in pirating from Harrrrrrrrrvard.
And we're so sure you'll enjoy this, we're offering a chance to read the first issue of this five issue story here RIGHT NOW! Just click on this link below!
 CLICK HERE to read the first issue as a PDF for FREE! 
Okay, ONTO THE EXTRA STUFF!
There's an option to get BOTH volumes of Floppy Cop as well!
And then there's a limited amount of Seth Damoose commissions open!
And there's also a limited amount of Dan Dougherty commissions open!
AND THEN THERE'S A CRAZY TAG TEAM SUPER LEVEL WHERE SETH AND DAN DRAW TOGETHER!
Let's talk STRETCH GOALS!
UPDATED STRETCH GOAL LIST!

And in case you're wondering, THE BOOK IS DONE!! Here's a tiny thumbnail of all of it!
Here's the whole book, too small to read unless you're a microscopic comic thief!
From the very beginning, this book would not have existed without the fans. We debuted Floppy Cop at Motor City Comic Con in 2018 and sold nearly 200 copies at that show, and that began what we now affectionately call us and our fans - "#teamfloppycop." Thank you for helping us make this happen, and always remember to stay floppy.
Your bearded buddies,
Seth and Dan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There's a lot of good news in this department!
- The book is done! Seth and Dan already finished their work, we already fronted the funds to get coloring and lettering done, and everything is ready to go to press! So no worries on waiting on any of that!
- We have all of the proper printing and fulfilling channels in place thanks to the help of our publisher Source Point Press!
- While this is Seth's first Kickstarter that he's out front on, Dan has run three already and has been a part of several more, so we have the experience and know-how to run things smoothly.

That said, if there are any "acts of god" that present challenges or slow down the process, we will keep you updated regularly so you know the status of your reward! We've also backed a ton of Kickstarters too, so we know how it goes and will strive to create the best experience possible. We're striving!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
