updates.update_userinfo: Where have those bearded buggers been?!
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon my Floppy Friends!
I want to start with an apology for not having an update sooner. It's been crazy around here. Between the day job, end of the school year, urgent family trips, and just plain old confusion, I just had not made the time to keep everyone in the loop. Thank you all for your patience. 
The books are PRINTED! I've been told that the print books are in the states and will be on their way to me in the next few days! This means we'll start putting things together to get it all sent out at once.
Dan here! First things first, we gotta address the 900 pound pretzel in the room!

Hey Floppy Friends! as you may have seen, surveys went out today with all kinds of questions, some relevant, some ridiculous. Seth and I have been working hard to make sure the book looks great, to that end we’ve reviewed the final PDF as well as talked to SPP who researched the best and fastest printing option. Looks like we’re going overseas for this one, which means roughly 10-12 weeks turnaround. so we are still on schedule, and looking forward to getting this book in your hands.

updates.update_userinfo: Ryan Browne is funny as hell
updates.update_content:
Hey Floppy Friends, Dan here laughing his ass off. I just got the final piece of the Floppy Cop 2 puzzle - the foreword by Ryan Browne. It is funny as hell, I was laughing so hard that my kids asked me to read it aloud and I had to break their hearts because it's incredibly inappropriate for their tender brains. WAY TO BREAK MY CHILDREN'S HEARTS, RYAN BROWNE!
If you don't Ryan's work, your life has a great big hole in it that needs filling. In fact, Ryan Browne kicked the door in to let Floppy Cop exist, in that he makes comics that are funny. There aren't a lot that do that these days, which bums me out. If only there was something to cheer me up. Oh that's right, there IS and a lot of them are made by Ryan. I'm talking shit he's even done books you don't even realize he's done because he's a maniac who exudes raw comic out of his pore holes. It's a medical condition complete with balms and ointments not approved by the Comics Code. None of it is street legal, and that's just the way Ryan likes it.

Hey floppy friends! I hope you’re all safe wherever you are. I wanted to let you all know that I was notified that Kickstarter is sending us the funds as of this afternoon. 
This means we’ll be sending out surveys hopefully later this week  One step closer to putting the book in your hands! Yay!! I honestly dodnt know this part took this long. Now I know for the next one.

Dan here. As I'm sitting here looking at the PDF of Book 2 getting assembled, I want to say a big THANK YOU for helping us make this book a reality.  This is a hilarious comic, it's also really weird and unconventional and that's just the way I like my comics. I like reading new ideas, and when Seth and I cooked up Floppy Cop we wanted to give people the kind of comic we'd want to read. Something to get the laughing to "out loud" mode. We hope this does that for you.
Next steps are to get the foreword from Ryan Browne who was generous enough to write that, I'm getting him a compiled PDF. That's good timing, because Kickstarter usually takes a week or two to get us the funds from the campaign, which will then be put towards the printing. Good news is it will be printed in Canada, so that will take less time than if it were overseas. Hopefully that puts us in an even position than we planned. But everything is good to go, and we are extremely grateful to all of you!

We did it! Thank you to alm our Floppy Friends (old and new)! I am truly greatful that you all decided to get on board with our silly/fun comic! Thank you! The book and rewards just meed to be printed and to you now. Thank you❤️

updates.update_userinfo: WE CRACKED OPEN ANOTHER STRETCH GOAL!
updates.update_content: Dang, everyone! We cracked 8K! That gets everyone at $10 or above a PDF of Volume 1, and puts us closer to some NEW Floppy content! Honestly, who knows what will happen in the final eight hours, we could suddenly have a burst on the commission levels and crack 10K, which would guarantee a tattoo of Floppy Cop on Garrett Gunn’s behind, unlock a new floppy story by Victor Dandridge, and unlock the BONUS full issue by Seth and myself! So if you have any ideas, lay it on me because I’d love to be able to give you all as much free bomus content as possible!

Yowzers, I can't believe the campaign is almost over! We have less than 24 hours to go, we've unlocked 2 stretch goals,  we might unlock a third, and it is confirmed that you all are awesome. Seth and I are super proud of Floppy Cop 2 and can't wait to get it to you, we're going to make one last push here and then the fun work begins of making this book happen!
Tonight Seth and I are going to be on Brian K. Morris' wacky podcast Clever Title Pending  so if you want to tune in you can hang with us as we talk about all things Floppy! It's at 7pm CST/8pm EST, and here's the link:

project_data.project_name: FLOPPY COP VOLUME 2 GRAPHIC NOVEL!

campaign.story:
A new 120-page original graphic novel from The Pride & Glitter Vipers writer Joe Glass, Elk Mountain's Vince Underwood, Vagrant Queen's Harry Saxon & Eisner Award-winning editor and letterer Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou about superhero refugees, and deep family secrets.

The Miracles is a brand new, 120 page original graphic novel. It tells the story of high school senior Elliot Morgan: a massive comic fan with graduation and Major Voltage Adventures on his mind, when he's astonished to discover he has superhuman abilities of his own. 
When he almost immediately goes out and makes a public display of his new superheroic abilities, he's amazed to be confronted by his favourite comic book characters staring him down in the real world. As if that wasn't crazy enough, they reveal the truth about themselves - they're his parents and they reveal that they are refugees from the world of his favourite comic book escaped to this world when he was just a baby. 
What follows is revelation after revelation, after more and more of the family's secrets come to light. Just how many secrets can one family be keeping?
The Miracle Family by Luciano Vecchio
Elliot Morgan aka Miracle design by Vince Underwood
Elliot Morgan a.k.a. Miracle - Elliot is an average teen boy, and a bit of a geek. He’s an outward optimist but harbours within him some anger. Elliot's anger seems to revolve around the idea that so much about himself was kept secret from him, but there's more that he's keeping inside himself. He is a believer in taking a responsibility for his home with his new capabilities, and with those newfound reality-warping abilities, there's little that he can't do.
Ayden Morgan a.k.a. Empath design by Vince Underwood
Ayden Morgan a.k.a. Empath - Elliot’s younger in age but bigger in size brother, Ayden is much more quiet, introverted and sullen than Elliot. Ayden has been dealing with intense mental health issues, that may be connected to his empathic abilities, and he has to learn to come to terms and learn to live with them.
Evan Morgan a.k.a. Major Voltage design by Vince Underwood
Evan Morgan a.k.a. Major Voltage - Elliot’s father, Evan was his world’s leading superhero. Proud, tough, but with a warm, open heart, he’s always been troubled by the fact he and his wife kept their kids’ true nature from them. Defending his family has been his sole purpose since taking refuge in this world, so he now has a less ostentatious profession than 'superhero' to help stay hidden. However, he holds some pride in his son taking up his old line of work.
Kate Morgan a.k.a. Ms Phantom design by Vince Underwood
Kate Morgan a.k.a. Ms. Phantom - Kate is Elliot and Ayden’s mother, and is the one responsible for hiding their true natures from them using her telepathy. She’s almost the opposite of Evan in that she’s quieter, seems sadder, and the escape to their new home and what it led to took its toll. However, she is fiercely protective of her family, and would go to any length for them.
Jessica Lectron a.k.a. Superia design by Vince Underwood
Jessica Morgan a.k.a. Superia - Elliot’s cousin, Evan’s niece, Superia was another great hero of their home reality. She was bright, bushy tailed and brash, but in the ‘real’ world has become more serious, grimmer and reserved. Much of this comes from the trauma of the move over to the new world, and she has withdrawn from the main family significantly, implying there might be more to her pull away from both the family and from her previous life as a superhero than is known.
Elliot Morgan is your average teenage outcast, keeping his head down as best he can to get through High School. One thing that's been a source of comfort to him all his life has been his love of comic books, particularly one comic book: the mysterious final issue of Major Voltage Adventures. An issue written by a reclusive British comics writer, that sees the heroes in a tense stand-off with their arch-nemesis Maestro during a reality-shattering Catastrophe. The story is left unresolved and is a major topic of debate and theorising for decades. Elliot doesn't know why he's so obsessed with it, but it's the one comic he comes back to read again and again. 
Then one day, the strangest thing happens: Elliot starts exhibiting unnatural, superhuman abilities. From there, Elliot's world is turned upside down, with revelation after revelation, not least of which being his parents are Major Voltage and Ms Phantom, and his family came to this world from the fictional world of his favourite comic book. 
Superia designs by Andrew Sebastien Kwan
Now deciding to use his great gifts for good in the 'real' world, just how will that work for a superhuman refugee from a comic book? And what other skeletons are the Morgans keeping in their closet?
We're going for a mix of soap opera drama and large scale superhero action adventure. Think The OC crossed with The Incredibles. Fantastic Four mixed with 13 Reasons Why. This Is Us meets X-Men, by way of Invincible. 
Empath/Ayden design by Zoe Thorogood
The Miracles is a story I've been working on and wanting to tell since I started writing The Pride. The Miracles has been a comic series, a book, a mini-series, and over the years I've worked with numerous artists to develop the idea including Gavin Mitchell, Kris Anka, Zoe Thorogood and Andrew Sebastian Kwan. Now, having found the perfect team to finally make this project a reality, we'll bring it out as an Original Graphic Novel so everyone can finally have this tale of families, broken realities and the secrets we keep. While we touch on a number of issues including refugees, the role of a hero in the world, personal responsibility to one's home, whether born there or found, the main core remains family and secrets. 
Original Character Designs/Sketch by Kris Anka
Joe Glass - Writer
JOE GLASS - Writer - Joe is the writer and creator of LGBTQ+ superhero team series, The Pride. Originally self-published, The Pride was the first ComiXology Submit title that got upgraded and continued as a ComiXology Originals series. He's also released superhero political thriller Acceptable Losses and glitter noir, queer grindhouse revenge fantasy, Glitter Vipers. A staunch advocate for inclusion and representation in comics, Joe does whatever he can to make that happen. Joe lives in South Wales, UK with a belligerent cat named Oliver. You can follow him on twitter and YouTube. 

Vince Underwood - Artist
VINCE UNDERWOOD - Artist - Vince is an American comic book artist. His credits include Elk Mountain and Page Turn (both available on Comixology). He has also done comics work for transmedia horror company Cold Room Entertainment and illustrated for NBC Sports and the San Francisco Giants. Vince lives with and by the grace of his wonderful wife Hannah, their two dogs Cassie and Millie, and their cat Derek. You can follow him on twitter. 

HARRY SAXON - Colours - Harry is an illustrator and comics colourist from Greece. He is currently 38 years old and irreversibly trans. You might know his work from titles such as Vault Comics’ Vagrant Queen and its successor Vagrant Queen: A Planet Called Doom and Test and Black Mask’s Sex Death Revolution. If you don’t know his work, this is an excellent way of getting started. You can check his website and follow him on twitter. Friendship and discounts offered if you’re into Doctor Who.
HASSAN OTSMANE-ELHAOU - Letters - Hassan is a British/Algerian letterer of comics. He's worked on things like Quantum & Woody, Undone by Blood and First Knife. He's also the voice behind Strip Panel Naked, and the editor of the Eisner-winning PanelxPanel magazine. You can follow him on twitter and YouTube. 

We'll also have a cover by amazing artist, the fabulous Kevin Wada, and the logo has been designed by the incomparable Dominic Xavier Crewe.
Cover Artwork by Kevin Wada
The book is still being made as we speak and raise funds, and we are planning/expecting to have it ready for release and posting to backers for the third quarter of 2021, looking at October 2021. We're about 10% complete as of now, and are on schedule to hit this goal. 
We want as many people as possible to be able to get and read The Miracles. As such, we are keeping a cheaper digital option available for those on a budget who still want to read our action-packed, amazing superhero family story. 
Mock-up for the Kickstarter Exclusive Hardcover edition
We also want collectors to feel like there's something extra special for them too. As such, there'll be a very limited edition hardcover version of the book, for those that want something a bit more special to sit on their shelves, that will be exclusively available to Kickstarter backers. Containing the 120 pages of story, plus further behind the scenes pages and designs, creating an overall book size of 160 pages!
SPECS:- 282 x 185mm hardcover, 160 pages plus end pages and cover, matt lamination outer cover, 170GSM uncoated endpapers, 130GSM silk main pages, full colour throughout
Mock-up for trade paperback edition
On a larger print run, we'll have a trade paperback version available too, filled with the 120 page story, plus extras and more, such as design work and sketches making for a 140 page book. 
SPECS:- 282 x 185mm trade paperback, 140 pages, 300GSM silk and matt laminated cover, 130GSM silk internal pages, full colour throughout
Sticker
We'll also be making a sticker of the main The Miracles logo, so this will be available on a number of rewards tiers.
Enamel Pin
There's also an enamel pin, of a stylised version of the series' emblem. A nice, shiny little mark of being in The Miracles Family. 
There are also a couple of retailer tiers too, so if you are a store and would like five or even ten copies at a discount price, please check out those tiers! NB: It will be the TPB version of the book in those tiers, the hardcover is Exclusive to the Kickstarter only. 
We even have been given access by Kickstarter to allow ADD ONS, which will include some of my back catalogue of titles, including superhero political thriller Acceptable Losses; glitter noir queer grindhouse revenge fantasy Glitter Vipers; and the last few copies of the original, limited edition self-published The Pride collection, collecting the first ten comics made before the series was picked up by ComiXology Originals. 
This is a BIG project, possibly one of the biggest I've ever done, and so we need all the help we can get to cover this. The total of this campaign goes to paying the creative team to make the art and design, and to cover printing costs and delivery. It's a high goal, but with enough support, we can do it.
We're also teaming with a fulfilment company in the US to help bring down costs for international backers, and speed up fulfilment too! White Squirrel will be helping us deliver speedily and cost effectively, handling the US backers. I've found that the largest part of my audience is based in America, so I've taken this measure to help keep postage costs as low as possible for the region, as well as helping me keep costs down for all other regions too.
A rough breakdown of how the funds are distributed

Most of the money raised is going on production on the book, specifically the art team. The next biggest chunk will be for printing and postage. These are big expenses, and always increasing, but with your help, we can do it. 
If we manage to surpass our goal, we'll look into Stretch Goals too, but for now, our main focus is hitting our goal. 
I am so excited about this story and bringing it to you all, I think it's one of the strongest stories I've ever created. 
But don't just take my word for it! Check out some early pages below!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my third campaign run during the pandemic, as well as my ninth campaign overall, so by now I have a lot of experience with running these things. 

That being said, postage/shipping is something that can often catch people out, myself included in the past. So, for this campaign, being my biggest campaign to date, I've partnered with a fulfilment company to handle the US backers, which will also mean we can keep the price down for those international backers that are the most expensive to ship from the UK too. 

Life factors can sometimes delay production, even in the midst of lockdowns and the like. I've done my best to factor those in, but as always, some things can never really be planned for. However, if and when anything like that happens that will cause a delay in production or delivering rewards, me and the team will communicate that to you right away. 

Ultimately, barring any huge, sweeping changes to postage costs or with the pandemic situation itself, this will all be handled on time and with professionalism.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Fam!
So we've had a few questions about things, and wanted to share a bit more info about The Miracles, and also give you another chance to put a face to the project. So here is a short video answering some of our most frequently asked questions!

updates.update_userinfo: BACKERS UPDATE - A Study in Masochism
updates.update_content:
Hey fam!
So we're hard at work on The Miracles and it's coming along gorgeously, thanks to your incredible love and support making this happen! But there's plenty more amazing comics projects live right now that need some of that love and support too, so here's a collection of just some fantastic projects out there needing your backing now!
THE DUSK- Alex Segura, Elizabeth Little and David Hahn present comics' next great crimefighter, The Dusk, in an original hardcover graphic novel. That's some absolutely incredible creators, and the project looks real fun, with a fabulous visual style. I'm backing this one, and I really think you all should too!

Hey fam!
Bit of a little weird one, to be fair, but I'm trying to get something important onto comic shops stands!
So in case you missed it, DC are doing a rather peculiar thing where they are presenting a number of pitches for the public to vote on in competition with each other, to decide which one pitch will get made.

updates.update_userinfo: Art Update and A Look At The Process!
updates.update_content:
Hey fam!
Well, what a wild ride that was, eh?
I’ve never before had a campaign that ran so close to the line before finally hitting goal; the most nail-biting finish I’ve ever seen on this platform!
And so many of you joined us for that, watching as we inched closer and closer on here and via social media (particularly twitter). But if nothing else, that showed not just how much of a desire there was to see this book and its success, but people coming together from comics readers to other professionals in the industry alike to make this project happen.

updates.update_userinfo: GREAT KICKSTARTERS TO BACK AND SUPPORT!
updates.update_content:
Hey fam!
With just 6 hours left to the campaign, this update is for the hundreds of followers who are watching but still not backing.
There’s SO many of you that if even just half of you backed, we’d smash our goal! A quarter of all followers have backed already, just half or less of those remaining unconverted would send us over the goal!

campaign.story:
See the BACKER GOALS AND STRETCH GOALS section at the bottom of the page for more details about each tier!
And, as we get more backers, we'll have more Backer Goal rewards, too!

An all-new 120 page graphic novel starring globetrotting aviatrix Athena Voltaire!
"Steve Bryant resurrects the classic era of high adventure in Athena Voltaire. With stylish storytelling and gorgeous rendering, he makes a genre that has in recent years been relegated to the back shelves of entertainment fun and compelling again. I can't wait to see what he and Athena have in store for us." — Mark Schultz, creator/writer/artist, Xenozoic Tales  |  writer,  Prince Valiant  |  illustrator, Conan of Cimmeria 
"Athena Voltaire is a wonderful pulp throwback. A return to the heady days of the adventure comic. Swords, guns, airplanes, sand, jungles, dens of villainy, conspirators, cutthroats, treasure, and all 36"- 24"- 36" of the most dangerous woman in the genre." —Tim Bradstreet, cover artist, The Punisher, Hellblazer
In the knuckle-dusting style of classic pulp adventure comes Athena Voltaire, the globetrotting aviatrix who takes on Nazis, secret societies, zombies, and unspeakable occult creatures! From sunken galleons to haunted mountain-top lairs to hidden jungle temples, our heroine faces peril at every turn as she races to save the world!
Launched online in 2001, the series has earned an Eisner Award nomination, a Russ Manning Award nomination, and three Harvey Award nominations, and has had a publishing home at Ape Entertainment, Dark Horse Comics, and, currently, Action Lab Entertainment. 
Athena Voltaire and the Terror on the Orient Express finds the heroine reconnecting with an old friend during a personal trip on the famed train line. When an old foe sets a plan in motion, the voyage turns deadly, as Athena must find the source of horrific slayings that are terrorizing the passengers!
Planned for issues 9–12 of the Action Lab Athena Voltaire ongoing series, the prologue follows Athena on a mad dash to the train station. This sequence serves as a framing sequence to tell tales of the adventuress' past.
Once onboard, it's apparent that something is wrong, as passengers begin to perish at the hands of a creature who stalks the train. 
Obviously, someone has to do something...
Like every other volume in the series, Athena Voltaire and the Terror on the Orient Express works as an excellent introduction to Athena and her world. Each volume tells a self-contained adventure. Of course, when combined with the other volumes in the series, a larger story begins to take shape. 
Best of all, Athena Voltaire and the Terror on the Orient Express is already written, drawn, and lettered, and the colors will be completed by the time that funding is completed! 
 LET'S LOOK AT THE REWARDS! 


Money raised will go toward artist and colorist fees, printing, backer rewards, and shipping.
SHIPPING AND PACKAGING
If you support a Kickstarter campaign, the last thing you want is for your books to arrive damaged! With that in mind, all of our physical packages are being shipped in Gemini Comic Mailers. These things are practically nuke-proof, insuring that your comics arrive in great condition!
The Collector's Box and the Mystery Box will each be shipped, bubble-wrapped, in Priority Mail boxes.
And oversized original art rewards will be placed between 2 sheets of masonite, bubble-wrapped, and shipped in 12x18x2" corrugated boxes, to insure they won't be bent. (The 17x22" artwork will be shipped with masonite and bubblewrap in 18x24x2" corrugated boxes).
 BACKER GOALS AND STRETCH GOALS
There are two ways for our backers to get even more stuff!
First, BACKER GOALS! The more people who back the campaign, the more stuff you get!
How high will it go? As more people keep backing the campaign, we'll keep adding new Backer Goals!
Next, it's STRETCH GOAL time! 

I've finalized the line-up for the first DIGITAL COMICS BUNDLE—and so many talented friends responded, that we'll have multiple Digital Comics STRETCH GOALS!
Here's the line-up for DIGITAL COMICS BUNDLE #1 ($17,500 STRETCH GOAL):
• Ghoul Scouts: Night of the Unliving Undead #1 by Steve Bryant, Mark Stegbauer, Jason Millet, Drew Browne, and Chris Murrin
• The Catch #1 by Steve Bryant, Ismael Canales, Roger Surroca, and Chris Murrin
• Impossible Jones by Karl Kesel, David Hahn, Tony Avina, and Comicraft
• Sam Hell by Karl Kesel, Jeremy Colwell, and Comicraft
• Dead Man’s Hand by James Heffron, Rowel Roque, Luis Czerniawski, Nelson Pereira, Leandro Huergo, Jason Millet, and Chris Murrin
• F.O.R.C.E. by Shawn Pryor, B. Alex Thompson, and Jay Reed
• Biff Stone Monster Hunter for Hire by Barry Gregory and Dell Barras
• Simone & Ajax by Andrew Pepoy and Jason Millet
• House of Fear by James Powell, Jethro Morales, Mike Erandio, James Hislope, Josh Jensen, and Matt Krotzer
• Like Father, Like Daughter by Kat Calamia
• Acts Of Contrition by Michael Heitkemper, Ariel J. Fulcher, and Rohvel Yumul
• Diary of Night by Will Allred, Gene Gonzales, and Rus Wooton

Here's the unlocked $20,000 STRETCH GOAL, the SIGNED BOOKPLATE (print/physical backers only):
And the $24,000 STRETCH GOAL, the 3"x3" Always Punch Nazis sticker—now unlocked (for print/physical backers)!
And here's the second Digital Comics Bundle, unlocked at $25,000!
Here's the line-up for DIGITAL COMICS BUNDLE #2 ($25,000 STRETCH GOAL):
• Highspotby Rob Jones
• Future Girl by Patric Lewandowski and Sebatian Piriz
• Deadskins by Clay Adams
• The Last Ember by Brant Fowler, John Wilson, Rudi Sucipto, Lisa Moore, and Cary Kelley
• The Dancerby Kat Calamia and E.V. Cantada
• Prom of the Deadby Dave Dwonch and Santi Guillen
• Morte by Kevin Joseph and D.A. Bishop
• Robin Hood: The Legend of Sherwood by Jeff Douglas Messer and Chris Geary
• Sunmaker by Liam Hayes, Ryan Kroboth, Rachel Deering, Lisa Moore, and Dave Lentz,
• Dr. Goyle by Mark Stegbauer
• Night Wolfby Robert Multari, Oscar Choquecota, Carlos Herrara, and Ross A. Campbell
• Hellbillies by Jon Westhoff, Bryan Boles, and Sean Fagan

Here's our second 6"x9" Art Print (for all print/physical backers), unlocked at $27,000!
 We unlocked a second sticker (for all print/physical backers) when we hit our $29,000 Stretch Goal:

And we unlocked the $30,000 Stretch Goal, Digital Comics Bundle #3:
Here's the rundown of this batch of digital comics:
• Undead or Alive by Steve Bryant, Jason Millet, and Chris Murrin
• Maximus Wrecks by Steve Bryant, Jason Millet, and Chris Murrin
• Gangs of Camelot by James Heffron, Vicente Cifuentes, Machine Gun Dojo, and Juan Torres
• Wahoo Morris by Craig Taillefer
• Sian by Craig Taillefer
• The Ever-Incredible Funnyman by Barry Gregory and Luis Rivera
• Banjax by Ryeland Grant, Fabio Alves, Edson Ferreira, and HdE
• Holmes and Watson by Jeff Rider, Ismael Canales, Roger Surroca, and Justin Birch
• Celestial Falcon by Chris DiBuduo, Brant Fowler, Lucas Santos, and Lisa Moore
• Apocalypse …Meh by Jon Westhoff and Bobgar Ornelas
• Red, White & Broke by Mike Spring, Dennis Tirona, Thyago Brandao, and Jim Whiting
• Freedom Fighter by Michael Heitkemper, Ariel J. Fulcher, Rohvel Yumul, and Micah Myers

Now unlocked, the $32,000 Stretch Goal, a set of three "tourist" postcards for all print/physical backers!
The $35,000 Stretch Goal is a cool plastic Athena Voltaire Adventure Club membership card for all print/physical backers! NOW UNLOCKED!
 If we hit our $40,000 Stretch Goal, print/physical backers get this snazzy Orient Express boarding pass! and it's NOW UNLOCKED!

At $43,000, all print/physical backers receive a third 3" sticker (this time, it's round!)!
Our $45,000 Stretch Goal is a third 6"x9" print for all physical/print backers!
THE CREATIVE TEAM
I'm joined on the main story of the book by penciler/inker Abel Cicero and colorist DC Alonso, with additional pencils by Unai Ortiz (inks by me), and edited by Chris Murrin and Nicole D'Andra. For the prologue, Chris Murrin writes the framing sequence (and I draw it), with additional art by friends Gary Carbon, Jun Bob Kim, Jason Millet, Jim Nelson, and Juanma Aguilara. I have some inks throughout, as well as writing the bulk of the book. 
BUZZ ABOUT ATHENA VOLTAIRE
"Athena Voltaire is just my kind of glorious pulp epic. A comic lover's comic book if there ever was one, full of everything that makes comic books worth loving." — Matt Fraction, writer, Invincible Iron Man   |   Uncanny X-Men    |    writer/co-creator, Casanova
“…the next best thing to finding a trove of long-lost adventures from the 1930s.” – Javier Grillo-Marxuach, writer/producer, The Middleman  |  The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance  |  Blood & Treasure
"Is it sick for a man to love a comic strip character? Too damn bad, because I'm already in love with Athena Voltaire! If loving Athena is wrong, I don't want to be right!" —Mike W. Barr, co-creator/writer The Maze Agency  |  Camelot 3000  |  The Outsiders  |  writer, Batman, Detective Comics
"You don't just read this story, you practically fall into the panels and have the adventure with her." — Tad Stones creator, Darkwing Duck  |  producer, Hellboy Animated
 "Athena Voltaire is an amazing adventure series. It captures the feel of vintage 1930's Republic serial film cliffhangers, with a stylized look and action budget they could only dream about. If you like The Rocketeer, you'll love Athena Voltaire."
 —John Siuntres, host, Word Balloon podcast
"A terrific pulp adventure story with great pacing, interesting plot twists and solid dialogue combined with simply beautiful artwork equals something we would sell armloads and armloads of. ..I would like a trade paperback of Athena Voltaire to sell in my store, please. The sooner the better." — James Sime, owner Isotope: The Comic Book Lounge
“I love this… totally Indiana Jones and Laura Croft had a baby and named her Athena.” —Steven Leitman, Reading with a Flight Ring
"It's the pulp adventure you've been waiting for…" —Stephen Schleicher, majorspoilers.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks and unforeseen issues. With that in mind we're applying lessons learned from past campaigns.

I'm committed to delivering the best possible experience to our backers, so we're investing in top-of-the-line shipping materials, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house. This will eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition. Most importantly, I'll address every question personally. The buck stops here.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
I have a delivery estimate from the printer. I'm told that the books will be loaded onto the ship with a set-sail date of "early July," and an estimated delivery date of mid-August. I'd prefer to have them sooner, of course, but I'm glad to have some rough estimates of dates, at least.
In other news, the copies of the Athena Voltaire back catalog have landed at Aw Yeah Comics in Muncie, Indiana.

Hi, everyone!
Thanks so much for your support and for filling out your surveys. If you haven't gotten to it yet, no worries...there's still some time.
I'm trying to pin down when the books will be arriving, so I can answer your questions about delivery.
There's one snag I hadn't considered. Between the various reward levels that have the signed book + title page sketch, I have around 200 head sketches to draw! I'll try to turn them around as quickly as I can while maintaining quality, but I hadn't considered the response that I received when I launched the campaign.

Hi, everyone!
I'm in the process of sending out reward surveys. For those of you with T-shirt orders, here's the size guide from the T-shirt provider:

Hello, everyone!
Thanks for your patience, and for supporting Athena Voltaire and the Terror on the Orient Express.
I have some great news! Action Lab got back to me at the beginning of last week and put me in touch with the print rep. I got all the specs, outputted and uploaded the files, and approved the print PDF yesterday.

Hi, everyone!
It's been a week since my last update, and the big news is that we're still waiting on Action Lab for a response. 
DC Alonso continues to turn in brilliantly colored pages. I've got the completed pages in an InDesign document, ready to save as a PDF to the printer's specifications as soon as I have all the pages and receive the green light from Action Lab.

Hi, everyone!
The waiting really is the hardest part.
I'm still waiting to hear back from Action Lab. Basically, about two weeks ago, I got tired of emailing without getting any response and called the person I'd been emailing, Action Lab publisher Bryan Seaton. Bryan told me he's stepped away from Action Lab and passed me on to Vito DelSante, who's taken over as editor-in-chief at the company. I emailed Vito my questions and heard back today that he's forwarded my email to...

Hi, everyone!
I apologize for the radio silence. As I believe I mentioned in a previous update, my mom passed away in early January. My dad passed in 2007, but with both parents gone, there ended up being a lot more estate-related stuff for my brother and me to close out this time. I hadn't anticipated that.
It was compounded by my decision to run the Athena Voltaire and the Terror on the Orient Express campaign in late January. I felt the need to hold firm to my plan to run the campaign at that time, in the event that San Diego Comic-Con would take place this year. Having books, particularly one "new to the con," is key in covering the cost of a trip to a convention like that. Of course, within a week of the campaign wrapping up, SDCC cancelled their July show.

updates.update_userinfo: While funding is processing, here are some cool projects...
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
Thanks again for backing Athena Voltaire! I promise a longer update soon, but the last two months have been a mad scramble and I'm focusing a little on some stuff I've neglected. But I promise I'll be sharing more info very soon.
In the meantime, I wanted to quickly share some fantastic projects I'd like you to take a look at you may like:

Hi, everyone!  
I apologize for not posting immediately after the campaign ended. I had a list of tasks and errands I had to tackle this afternoon (typical domestic stuff), and I didn’t want to rush through this message.   
I’m still kind of stunned. I’m stunned by the final number that this campaign generated. I’m stunned by both the number of Stretch Goals we unlocked and by how quickly it all escalated as the campaign neared its conclusion.

project_data.project_name: Athena Voltaire and the Terror on the Orient Express

campaign.story:
If you were the best friend of the world’s greatest superhero...
... wouldn’t you livestream his every adventure too? Welcome to SUPER BEST FRIEND, an exciting new comic series from Ringo Award nominated writer Jason Inman (Jupiter Jet & Super Soldiers), artist George Kambadais (The Black Ghost & Vampire Diaries) and letterer Taylor Esposito (Jupiter Jet & Beef Bros) that will examine Silver Age comic adventures through a modern lens. Debuting on Kickstarter with a 48-page comic, this is an enthusiastic story about a superhero’s sidekick / companion. Fans of Superman, Booster Gold and Spider-Man will not want to miss out on SUPER BEST FRIEND.
 WE ARE FUNDED! NOW ONTO STRETCH GOALS!
Regular Cover (Cover A)
UNLOCKED - Digital Comics Bonanza - 7 BONUS Digital Comics for every Backer!
UNLOCKED - FOIL VARIANT COVER & B2rian LS Digital Art for Every Backer!
CHECK OUT THE STRETCH GOALS SECTION BELOW for full details...
If you are having problems doing Kickstarter add-ons when you pledge, no worries! We will be using a survey tool called BackerKit after the campaign. All of our add-ons and more will be available to add to your reward during the survey. 
WELCOME TO TOMORROW CITY!  Where young Mattie Moore has always had many friends, including the renowned Captain Terrific, the world’s greatest superhero! Because of this close shared friendship, Mattie is always the first man at any crime scene they call Captain Terrific to. He records the captain’s acts of heroism for the world to see on a channel lovingly called “SUPER BEST FRIEND.” These videos have garnered Mattie fame, celebrity, and friendships with all the superheroes in the world. However, it’s Mattie’s friendship with Terrific that means the most to him. 
Captain Terrific chats with his best friend, Mattie.
However, everything changes when Mattie makes a grave mistake! He records Captain Terrific during a personal moment, accidentally revealing his secret identity, Calvin Cobb, to the entire world!

HORRENDOUS! Villains attack Terrific’s friends and families, tearing his life apart. But what can Mattie do? He’s no superhero. It’s up to Mattie to restore his friend’s secret identity through any wacky means necessary.  Can the young Mattie Moore repair the clamorous situation? 
It’s time for the sidekick to become the hero.
UPLOAD BEGINNING... an sensational comic preview of our book is about to BEGIN!
Teaming up with the amazing George Kamdais on inks and colors, the marvelous Taylor Esposito (Jupiter Jet, Beef Bros, Constantine) on letters, and the astounding Brittany Matter for edits (Miranda in the Maelstrom & Jupiter Jet and the Forgotten Radio), SUPER BEST FRIEND is an entertaining adventure about friendship and finding your purpose within a world of superheroes.
FUN FACT: Captain Terrific is a character I created back in college in 2006. It wasn’t until 2018 that I started writing this story and convinced George to draw the adventure of Mattie and Captain Terrific. My time hosting DC All Access inspired this idea of online media consumption and superheroes. So as you can see, SUPER BEST FRIEND has been a book long in the making! 
In 2021, we're all SUPER FANS of superheroes, and we'd all be STREAMING supers just like Mattie Moore. This comic is my story dive deep into the mythos of heroes and their connection to their biggest fans.
The Villains of Super Best Friend!
Captain Terrific zooms away to save the day!
Who's this fun looking bunch?
NEWSFLASH! The inks for SUPER BEST FRIEND #1 are already complete. The book is currently 75% colored and 50% lettered. So, we’ll be able to ship this book out to the printer and to backers faster than any previous Kickstarter campaign I’ve ever run.

Issue One will be 44 pages of story with 4 pages of BONUS MATERIAL. If our super friends fly this campaign to the moon, Issue One will be the first of the three issues of SUPER BEST FRIEND (each one containing 44 pages of story).

SUPER SURPRISE: since we’re super friends, your comics deserve a premium paper weight. We’re printing Super Best Friend DOMESTICALLY (so you get your books quicker) on a heavy 80 lb glossy paper stock with a cover on 100 lb glossy cover stock. PLUS, we'll be bagging and boarding every issue front and back plus mailing the comics in GEMINI Flash Mailers to ensure the comics arrive as mint as possible. Most domestic shipping will use Priority Mail Flat Rate Envelopes for speedy delivery. 
The Gemini Flash Mailers we'll use for shipping.
WHERE THE FUNDS WILL GO...
Money raised will go toward printing, backer rewards, shipping of this issue and Issue Two of SUPER BEST FRIEND. And if we're lucky enough to surpass our goal, any additional funding will be put directly back into the book as additional rewards and production of future issues. (Maybe even Issue 3?)
No one is looking to get rich here. (Otherwise we wouldn't be doing comics. Really, we wouldn't). Independent comics not created by the "Big Two" companies are labors of love. But to make a high-quality comic, we need the support of our fans and Kickstarter to make SUPER BEST FRIEND a reality!
 UNLOCKED AS A STRETCH GOAL! It's my 90's Comic dream come true! You can now scoop up this PAINTED FOIL VARIANT COVER by b2rian LS as an ADD-ON or as the Book - FOIL VARIANT COVER tier!
REGRAM THIS! Find both Variant Covers at the Book - Variant Cover Tiers. 
We also have TWO KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE variant covers from fan-favorite artists starting with Cover B by the shockingly talented Travis Mercer (Red Hood & The Outlaws), with colors by Elizabeth Kramer (Going to the Chapel & Jupiter Jet & The Forgotten Radio).
And CHECK OUT this fantastic Cover C variant from artist Sarah Leuver (@Comickergirl, Teen Titans Go! & Real Science Adventures).
All three covers of Super Best Friend!
BUFFOONERY ALERT: We love to add extra goodies in our backer's packages! You may find an extra print or trading card in your package included with the goodies below. 
Here's just a taste of some rewards we're offering for your support. For the full list, THROW YOUR PEEPERS to the long column on the right of this page. 
DIGITAL PDFS: Every backer will receive DIGITAL PDFS of TERRIFIC (the 6 page first appearance story of Captain Terrific), co-written by Ashley V. Robinson (Science!), and drawn by Nick Robles (DC's The Dreaming). Plus the complete first issue of the Ringo-nominated JUPITER JET (over 22 pages), co-written by Ashley V. Robinson and drawn by Ben Matsuya.
Headshots by George Kambadais
ART COMISSION: SUPER BEST FRIEND Artist George Kambadais will draw you an original 6x9 BLACK and WHITE digital headshot of any character of your choosing! Look at the art above and tell me you don't want one! This tier is limited to THREE BACKERS, so hurry!
NOTE: George will finish this art digitally, and I will print a HIGH QUALITY art print of your commission to package with your comic. Backer will also receive the HIGH-RES File of their ART. 
ADVERTISE ON GEEK HISTORY LESSON: At this tier, you can have Jason Inman and Ashley Victoria Robinson promote your product, book, comic, Youtube Channel, Kickstarter or more on their popular and Podcast Award nominated show -- GEEK HISTORY LESSON. (Each episode on average is downloaded by over 20,000 people.) This is a podcast with a faithful audience and over 350 episodes! LIMITED to ONLY 8 BACKERS! 
NOTE: **Ad must be all-ages, and we may refuse any promotion and ask you for an alternate ad. Scheduling of PODCAST AD will take place after KS funds have cleared. Please keep that in mind for your AD scheduling purposes.**

And if you haven't read my other work, you can catch up with the PRINT COMIC BONANZA level! (All three of these comics were also funded and created by Kickstarter Backers like you)!
JUPITER JET: Following the death of her father 16-year-old Jacqueline "Jacky" Johnson inherits a jetpack with a mysterious power source and together with her brother, Chuck, and their cat she must protect her home from a threat that may - or may not - be from this Earth! Co-written with Ashley Victoria Robinson, this series was nominated for Best Kids Comic / Graphic Novel in the Mike Wieringo Comic Book Industry Awards.
"Pure awesome comics. From page one, I felt like I was with Jupiter Jet, soaring and smiling, eager for the next adventure."
               Tom King (writer, Batman & Mister Miracle)

And there's the sequel! JUPITER JET & THE FORGOTTEN RADIO: When the mysterious Black Flyer arrives in orbit and threatens her world, Jupiter Jet finds out that her “hero skills” may not be up to the task. Being a hero requires more than just a jetpack. Does Jupiter Jet have the courage to save her entire planet?
"You had me at jetpack! I know a little something about building heroes, and this is how you do it -- with heart and humor and high adventure."
Ron Marz (Green Lantern, co-creator of Kyle Rayner)

Jupiter Jet rocketed to the sky so fast that even The Hollywood Reporter announced the second volume!
EUREKA! Don't forget to check out SCIENCE!
SCIENCE!: The Elements of Dark Energy: Science! is the story of Tamsin Kuhn Trakroo, a fourteen-year-old girl who is already the smartest Theoretical and Applied Physicist in any room. Tamsin's really cute roommate, Garyn, is the only one that she can trust right now. However, Garyn's just discovered a dangerous energy source that could win her the Prometheus Institute Award for Superior Science, or it could tear a hole in the very space/time continuum!" Co-written with Ashley Victoria Robinson, they also nominated this series for Best Kids Comic / Graphic Novel in the Mike Wieringo Comic Book Industry Awards.

TIRED OF COMICS? WELL, WHY NOT PICK UP MY NON-FICTION NOVEL WITH YOUR PLEDGE?
SUPER SOLDIERS (189 pages): A veteran of Operation Iraqi Freedom, author Jason Inman re-discovered his childhood love of comic books during long days at the Tallil Air Base in southern Iraq. He started to wonder about the phenomenon of superhero service members. What kinds of soldiers were these fictional characters? And how were they changed by war?
Yes Virginia, I can hold books with the best of them!
Also, want to get inside the brain of Jason Inman? Well, here's your chance!
 SKYPE SESSIONS: We can chat about my experiences working for Rhett & Link, Honest Trailers, DC Comics and CBS Television! Or you can pick my brain for advice on your comic, Youtube channel or podcast! YOU CHOOSE... what we chat about!
 SCRIPT REVIEW: I'll be happy to review your comic, television script or pitch document and provide you with detailed feedback! I'm certain my experience as a Ringo-nominated comic writer, WGA Veteran's Program Alum and my past 2.5 years working in a CBS Television Writer's Room can boost and improve your stories!
We LOVE Stretch Goals as much as we love KITTENS! And if we're lucky enough to reach our initial funding goal, we'll unlock a slew of really cool extra rewards for our backers. STRETCH GOALS HAVE BEEN UNLOCKED!

UNLOCKED - Stretch Goal #1 - $9600 - DIGITAL COMIC BONANZA!
All backers will receive several PDF files of some of the coolest digital comics. Bonanza include comics by Ryeland Grant, Karl Kesel, and more!  
UNLOCKED - Stretch Goal #2 - $12K - NEW FOIL VARIANT COVER
All backers will receive a BONUS ART print of B2rianLs's NEW VARIANT COVER. (Digital print for digital backers, Physical for physical backers) New Variant Cover will be available as an ADD-ON and NEW TIER!
Stretch Goal #3 - $15K - MATTIE STICKER & JASON SINGS A SONG! 
All physical backers will receive a BONUS STICKER of Mattie's selfie with Captain Terrific and Lady Samurai! Plus, as thanks for double funding the campaign, creator Jason Inman will record himself singing The Beatles - "With a Little Help From My Friends" because there's no way we could have done this without our SUPER FRIENDS! We hope you will enjoy the SHOW!
Stretch Goal #4 - $18K - To be revealed!!!
Stretch Goal #5 - $20K - To be revealed!!! 
WRITER: Jason Inman is a Kansas farm boy who read too many comics and science fiction novels as a child. Luckily, he turned that into a career. His latest book is co-writing the follow-up to the Ringo nominated Jupiter Jet comic series - Jupiter Jet and the Forgotten Radio for Action Lab Entertainment. 

Jason is also the author of Super Soldiers, a non-fiction book about the secret connection between comic book characters and soldiers in the military that Dan Aykroyd called “vivid and entertaining.” His written work includes co-writing Science!: The Elements of Dark Energy graphic novel and a piece for the DC/IDW Love is Love Anthology. Besides hosting the Geek History Lesson podcast, Jason was the host of DC All Access, DC Comics’ official web series for over three years. On top of having written for several comics and entertainment websites, Jason has produced and written for web shows including Good Mythical Morning and Screen Junkies.

Prior to becoming a writer, Jason served in the US Army and the Kansas Army National Guard deploying as part of Operation Iraqi Freedom. He currenlty lives in Los Angeles, California and works for CBS Television. You can find him at http://www.jasoninman.com

ARTIST: George Kambadais is a comic book artist from Greece. He’s worked with DC, IDW, IMAGE, DARK HORSE, BOOM and others. Right now he’s doing the art on THE BLACK GHOST for Comixology Originals and variant covers for the FIREFLY series for BOOM. You can find him at http://www.gkambadais.com/

LETTERS: Taylor Esposito is a comic book lettering professional, owner of Ghost Glyph Studios and teacher at the legendary Kubert School. A former staff letterer at DC and production artist at Marvel, he has lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws and Constantine; Interceptor, Heavy, Finger Guns (Vault Comics), Exorsisters, Jook Joint (Image), Babyteeth, Hot Lunch Special, Knock ‘em Dead (Aftershock), and No One Left to Fight (Dark Horse). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Caster, Backchannel) Dynamite (Elvira, Red Sonja and Vampirella meet Betty and Veronica, Green Hornet), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).
Editor: Brittany Matter is a comic book editor and writer and is currently creating content for Marvel.com. In addition to her work at Marvel, she has worked for publishers Fantagraphics Books and Image Comics. Brittany has edited titles such as Jupiter Jet and the Forgotten Radio (Action Lab Entertainment), Miranda in the Maelstrom (Action Lab), The Intrepids (Image), Cobble Hill (215 Ink), The Secret of the 5 Powers (Parallax Press), and The Comics Journal (Fantagraphics). She has written and self-published comics such as ReincarNation and Martial Law, both available on Gumroad, and co-wrote Spitting Image (Nashville Review). You can find her at http://www.brittanymatter.com.
A huge thank you for all your support and special kudos if you read this far. You're a superstar.
Email us at info@jasoninman.com for any questions or inquiries.
NOTE: If you contribute to this project you acknowledge that the comic and any other perks you receive come "as is", and may not look exactly as presented here as some designs may change over the due course of the production.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my SIXTH crowdfunding campaign, and all of the creators involved in this project are professionals with years of experience and excellent records in making tough deadlines. Most of the kinks have been worked out. If you look at our backer numbers and comments from previous projects, you'll see a happy and growing bunch of super friends. 

Of course, unavoidable personal mishaps, acts of God, global disruption, pandemics or dumb mistakes could throw us off schedule, but we will keep Kickstarter backers updated if we do encounter any delays. Especially any delays caused by aliens, because those are the worst!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Superfriends! 

As of today - 95% of all Super Best Friend rewards have been shipped worldwide! Which basically means that shipping is COMPLETE!

Hey SuperFriends! 
I'm shipping off the physical books/rewards for Super Best Friend #1 starting today! The printed books look astounding! Here... look for yourself!

Hello Super Friends!
We've received some excellent news -- the printed comics are on their way! So while I wait for those printed beauties to arrive at my home, I have sent out the notice from BACKERKIT to LOCK ALL BACKER ADDRESSES. Once I get the comics, I'm going to slowly start shipping them out, and that means I need your final addresses.

updates.update_userinfo: The Print Issue Proofs Are Here!!
updates.update_content:
Hello SUPER FRIENDS!
I got something very cool in the mail the other day... ... ENOUGH TEXT! 
Video Jason must speak directly to you! (Please ignore the unflattering thumbnail).

Hello ASTOUNDING Super Friends!
You have smashed through another STRETCH GOAL! And that unlocked the B2rian LS FOIL VARIANT COVER! I'm beyond jazzed. I've always wanted to make a foil variant cover, and you all have made that possible. Here are the new TIERS that allow you to scoop it up. 
$27 - The BOOK - FOIL VARIANT COVER!
$35 - ONE STANDARD & ONE FOIL COVER

You wonderful SUPER FRIENDS! 
Yesterday, I challenged you to RT this tweet over 30 times, and YOU DELIVERED! 
So I'm a man of my word. Here is the FULL IMAGE of the B2rian LS FOIL VARIANT COVER, which will be unlocked at #12K.  (We're only about $500 away!)

updates.update_userinfo: SBF DAY 25: Another STRETCH GOAL Unlocked & NEW TIERS!
updates.update_content:
Hey Super Friends!

As we hit the 2 week mark on this SUPER campaign, the amazing folks on Kickstarter named us the FEATURED COMIC PROJECT OF THE DAY! If you go click over to the Kickstarter Comic Main Page, you'll see Mattie and Captain Terrific's lovely faces over there. I can only assume it happened because of your amazing support. From the entire team, WE THANK YOU.

project_data.project_name: Super Best Friend #1: A Superhero Adventure by Jason Inman

campaign.story:
I'm in love with Monsters. 
I'm raising funds to create 100 Monster Drawings. 
You'll get to see in real time the creation of each drawing as It's made and can own the original art by backing this project. We'll be doing many livestreams over the course of the project to give backers a deeper look and participation.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Timeline for creating original art can vary greatly but the funding from this project will buy me time to complete them at a faster pace then my usual 2 to 3 hours a day.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Steven Russell Black
6 created · 20 backed
Artist with an obsessive compulsion to champion the odd, fringe, or otherwise unappreciated. questions email...See more

updates.update_content:
This Project is now canceled. 
I've decided to cancel this project to persue some other things that will take me closer to my long term goals. Everything takes you closer or farther away from your goals and this project ultimately is now part of where I want to be. 

Thank you for supporting what I do and I hope you'll come back for the next one.

campaign.story:
/// WE'RE FUNDED! ///
Scroll down to the bottom of the campaign to see our stretch goals. Thank you for supporting Thirsty!

THIRSTY is a graphic novel made up of four sexy stories that overlap in fun, exciting ways.

Imagine a date that ends with an enlightening discovery behind your date's closet door...
Imagine a sex shop of the future, where you can customize your desires...
Imagine a woman setting out to create her own sexy videos, on a quest to find just the right partner for the job...
Imagine a late-night drive in a car designed to read your deepest fantasies...
These four comics, drawn by some of comics' top talent, make for the spiciest graphic novel you'll read this year. If you're a fan of comics like Sunstone or Smut Peddler, you'll love THIRSTY's hilarious, emotional, exciting, character-driven erotica.

THIRSTY is a 56-page graphic novel from the team that brought you DESTINY NY, PRISON WITCH, and more. We are writer team and married couple <3 Pat Shand and Amy Shand, and this is our 17th Kickstarter. 
Here are normal, everyday pictures of us.

We think that stories about sex can be every bit as nuanced as stories about love, stories about fantasy, any kind of story, and we are excited to bring these new ideas to you with THIRSTY.

We will be writing THIRSTY specifically for four incredible artists:

 CHIARA COLASANTI: After working together on DESTINY, NY Chiara's delicate but strong style made us excited to tell more stories with her.

 DAPHNE RED: A newcomer to erotica comics, she will be delivering a lush, soft, romantic style to a funny tale about how sex and anxiety can collide.

 KELSI JO SILVA: Kelsi submitted some of the spiciest sample pages we have ever seen and we fell in LOVE with her art. We can't wait for you to see her take on an online entrepreneur! Kelsi has also supplied the artwork for our two SWEET and SPICY prints.

 ELENA OMINETTI: Elena takes on a story about how the customization of a sex shop in the future leads to a real-life romp.
...and JIM CAMPBELL, who has lettered and designed every book we have done to perfection from the start!

That's not all, though. In addition to our standard cover by the incredible Romina Moranelli (pictured above), we have a Kickstarter-exclusive version of THIRSTY with an incredible variant cover by superstar artist JENN ST-ONGE.

JENN ST-ONGE VARIANT

And we have TWO prints by the amazing KELSI JO SILVA who also does the interiors.
 "SWEET" PRINT
"SPICY" PRINT
PREVIEW PAGES!
Here's a preview of each story in "Thirsty" with certain areas *~*~*~*flower emojied*~*~*~* for Kickstarter. 
"Art Dolls" illustrated by Elena Ominetti
"Only Friends" illustrated by Kelsi Jo Silva
"Cascading" illustrated by Daphne Red
"Automatic" illustrated by Chiara Colasanti
In addition to the main tiers, you can manually adjust your pledge to add these awesome items. 

Now, add-ons have been added officially through Kickstarter, so you can do this ON YOUR PLEDGE with a new menu!

Here is everything we have available.
First, is the main series I fund through Kickstarter, my long-running Destiny, NY graphic novels. This series follows Logan McBride, a girl who was the subject of a prophecy as a child. She completed this prophecy when she was just 13, and now she's entering her 30s trying to find meaning in her life post-Destiny. That's when she meets Lilith, the last surviving daughter of a mystical crime family... and from this point on, their lives will never be the same.
You can see more about each volume through the original campaigns;
Destiny, NY Volume 1
Destiny, NY Volume 2
Destiny, NY Volume 3
Destiny, NY Volume 4
Destiny, NY Short Stories Collection 1
 Gangster Ass Barista (A Destiny, NY Spinoff)
And now, earlier this year, we funded a new spinoff, Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer.
All of these can be added to your order!

In addition to Destiny, NY I have funded two other series along with a few standalone graphic novels on Kickstarter. In doing this, I have formed the company Space Between Entertainment to produce these comics, a podcast, video content, and more. Here's our current slate of available graphic novels that you can add to your order:
 Prison Witch: A mystical thriller about the magic that happens behind bars at a women's prison. Two volumes so far, with more to come. Volume 1 has a cover by Jenn St-Onge, and Volume 2 has a cover by Natasha Alterici. Written by Amy Shand & Pat Shand, illustrated by Erica D'Urso.
 Afterglow: A post-apocalyptic epic about a girl and her giant, radioactive cat. Written by Pat Shand, illustrated in full color by K. Lynn Smith.
 Spooky Girls: A full-color, graphic novel made up of 4 new monster comics, each written by Pat Shand and illustrated by different artists: Jenny the Werecat, Vicky Slime, Punk Teen Demon Queen, & Tarantula Twins.
 Modern Dread: A horror anthology about modern anxieties. Created by Ryan Fassett & Pat Shand, including contributions from ARMY OF DARKNESS artist Larry Watts, THE WALKING DEAD (TV Series) writer LaToya Morgan, & more.
 Clonsters: A young Earth Nugget attempts to find her lost Splat in this all-ages adventure about monsters made out of clay. Written by Amy Shand & Pat Shand, with illustration by Vanessa Cardinali. Two Volumes so far!
 Vampire Emmy & the Garbage Girl: In this horror/rom-com, a vampire falls in lover with her sanitation worker who has a secret of her own.

And you can also add-on any of the items from the campaign:


 $13,000 (UNLOCKED!): Now, each story will get its own illustrated cover page in both the digital and print versions of Thirsty.
 $16,000 (UNLOCKED!): Major upgrade! Now, the standard cover of Thirsty will be treated with spot gloss so it really pops in your collection.
 $20,000 (UNLOCKED): NOT FINAL ART IN GRAPHIC. All print backers will receive a saucy bookmark illustrated by KATE KASENOW! 
 $25,000 (UNLOCKED): Finally, our ultimate stretch goal... a brand new comic. DESTINY, NY: THIRSTY will be a digital-only, full-color (for the first time) exclusive featuring our Destiny, NY characters made specifically as a Thirsty tie-in! In this story, Logan dreams of the... memorable early days of past relationships.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between this and the projects I've funded over at our collaborative Space Between company page, this is my 17th Kickstarter campaign. In a creative endeavor of this size, possible challenges could be delays in production or printing depending on the current situation with the quarantine, considering we ship overseas. However, we have successfully Kickstarted multiple projects before as creators AND as a team, which has given us the utmost confidence that we'll meet and exceed your expectations, no matter what is happening in the world. When hiccups are hit, we send updates. When we receive our shipment, we get them our to backers immediately without delay. I mean, why would we want to hold onto the books when we're so eager for YOU to read them?

One thing that we can't control is customs charges and the price of international shipping. We pay more for international shipping than we charge, but some countries will charge an extra customs fee based on the prices of the items included. Our advice there would just be to be aware of that.

Our backers deserve the absolute best, and we promise to deliver the highest quality, the best communication, and all questions answered quickly -- ALWAYS!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I've been on Kickstarter since 2016. We created the team of Space Between Entertainment with me (Pat Shand), my wife and collaborator Amy Shand, and editor Shannon Lee. Now, we're offering every title we've ever produced as a digital bundle.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #10: Wait, what?! Jenn St-Onge... INTERIOR ART!?
updates.update_content:
Hey Thirsty backers!
We have MAJOR, major good news to share. But first, let's get you a comic.

Hi Thirsty backers!
The bonus digital story that you've all unlocked is completely illustrated! This weekend, the incredible Kelsi Jo Silva (who is also illustrating a story in the book and the prints) submitted full colors over the weekend. I'm sending to letterer Jim Campbell now to get this lettered so we can get you this spicy story quicky! First, though, a preview, censored for the sensitive eyes of Kickstarter.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #8: New Kickstarter, digital bundles sent, tell me if you have add-ons!
updates.update_content:
Hi Thirsty backers!
So, a brief breakdown of this month's rewards that have been sent out. We have had some digital add-ons and bundles go out. This will mostly be for those who backed the "Space Between Digital Library" level, BUT if you did an add-on of a book that ISN'T Thirsty, please read this!

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #7: Writing process & timeline for Stretch Goal story
updates.update_content:
Hi Thirsty backers!

Whew, been a wild month. For those who follow my other campaigns, we've just sent Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer off to print and fulfilled our digital backers' rewards while the shipping port that has kept Destiny, NY Volume 4 and Prison Witch Volume 2 un-shipped since February has FINALLY re-opened and sent books. It was a LOT to happen in one month, but all very exciting! On the Thirsty front, we push on, coming to the end of the writing process. Once things are written, that gives us a better idea of when we can deliver on the bonus content... in this case, the bonus story which is actually the first time EVER that we're doing a comic in color.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #6: The Tale of the Huge & Lewd Bookmark
updates.update_content:
Hey Thirsty backers,

So last time, I got in-depth on what goes into producing and ordering merch for a Kickstarter. This time, I want to keep things light by spotlighting a bit of merch that has since arrived to the Space Between team. This is what the great philosopher Bob Ross once called a "happy little mistake."

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #5: THIRSTY merch ordered + production begins!
updates.update_content:
Hi THIRSTY backers!

So, first a note on the way that I handle these updates. While in production, I do a monthly update showcasing what has been done and, as we move forward, spoiler-free artwork.  Beyond that, here is a very brief breakdown of what you may want to know:
BACKERKIT: I don't use BackerKit currently. I like to keep everything in one Kickstarter portal so that I can keep track of everyone's needs, which Kickstarter has helped us AMAZINGLY with this time with their new add-on feature. If you want to add anything on, the lack of BackerKit isn't a worry. You can always contact me for a custom order and either I, Amy, or our editor Shannon will help you out immediately!

Hey THIRSTY backers,

So, here we are. In a place that is hard for me to believe. We've done it, multiple times over. We've unlocked the final stretch goal, a goal that I couldn't have dreamed of when first launching. We've become my most backed campaign of all time, after almost TWENTY of these things. My most funded as well, beating out the previous title holder of DESTINY, NY. This is wild to me but it shows our team that there is an audience hungry for the stories we want to tell. Or, should I say...

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #3: Stretch Goal announced... plus a DESTINY, NY tie-in!?
updates.update_content:
Hi THIRSTY backers!

So... about those stretch goals.

Hey all!
So, we were planning the second update to spotlight all of our add-ons... and then, Day Two, we funded! We switched gears and began a major update about Stretch Goals way before we thought we'd get there and then... we surpassed the first Stretch Goal we planned as we were working on the graphic! You all are absolutely AMAZING for making this such a great campaign, so we are going to introduce more stretch goals in our first block than initially planned. The first of these goals will be automatically unlocked!
