campaign.story:
HOLY WEST: an Old West adaptation of the Quest for the Holy Grail. 
28 page comic book written by Seth Jacob and illustrated by Daniel Irizarri.
"A disgraced gunslinger goes on a spiritual quest for the Holy Grail before an unhinged outlaw can find it first and turn the Old West into a Wasteland."
The first issue in a five issue series that takes you on a surreal odyssey across the Old West...all for the Grail. 
The Good, the Bad, and THE GRAIL
In the wilderness of the Old West, a surreal castle appears to saints and madmen before melting away like a mirage. As a young deputy, Percy walked its halls, he saw the mysterious Fisher King within whose mystical wound makes the West a Wasteland...and he saw the Grail. It changed him forever.
Now: it's 1886. A deadly winter that went down in history as "The Big Die Up" ravages the country. Percy is no longer a lawman, but a disgraced gunslinger who has hunted the castle for decades. He longs to return there, to see the Grail again, to heal the Fisher King where he once failed. And to restore the West from the wintry Wasteland it has become.
But Percy isn't the only one after it. An ex-Union, Colonel Kurtz-like war criminal known as The General leads an outlaw army in his holy war for the Grail. Percy nearly dies dueling him...but is saved by three new unlikely allies. Grant, a deputy sheriff who's as noble as he is naive. Fire Eyes, a Sioux bounty hunter hellbent on killing the General. And Rosa, a devil-may-care Mexican outlaw who double-crossed the General.
Percy, Fire Eyes, Rosa and Grant embark on a quest across the Old West for the Grail. The General and his outlaw army hunt them every step of the way. The deputy, bounty hunter, and outlaw must overcome their differences and learn to work together with Percy who's played all three parts in his time. Or die in the vast frozen Wasteland of the West. 
Holy West is an adaptation of the quest for the Holy Grail. It's loosely based on Parzival, but draws from all of chivalric romance, from Grail stories which involved pursuing the highest spiritual ideal: compassion. It's also a love letter to Westerns, to those cowboys and gunslingers who are the American equivalent of Britain's Arthurian knights.
Holy West explores the bloody history of the frontier and how we made it a Wasteland. The West is where the American soul was forged, for better or worse. At the same time, we drape a veil of magic over the West, just as medieval romance mythologized British history.
Holy West is magic realism meets Spaghetti Western. Sergio Leone meets David Lynch. It's an action packed, psychedelic odyssey through the Old West; a visionary quest across the vast wilderness, all to heal the spiritual Wasteland of 1880's America. All for the Grail.
The Grail calls to you. Come find it with us. 
HOLY WEST #1 PREMIUM EDITION
Variant cover by Simon Roy for Holy West #1 Premium Edition, colors/design by Daniel Irizarri
Holy West #1 Premium Edition has a variant cover by Simon Roy, Image Comics writer and artist (Protector, Prophet). Simon's original art for this cover is available as a reward.
The premium edition comes with over 10 extra pages of bonus material. Including: a back up comic with art by Vlad Legostaev, a short prose story with a Dime Novel cover by Goran Gligović, and even more narrative content that enriches the story of this issue while revealing new clues to the mysteries of Holy West and what we'll see in future issues.  
Dime Novel cover by Goran Gligović, included in Holy West #1 Premium Edition, colors/design by Daniel Irizarri
This is Goran Gligović's cover for a Dime Novel story that will be included in Holy West #1 Premium. It'll be written in the style of an authentic, 1880's Western themed dime novel, and uncover new secrets behind the occult phenomena that surround the Grail Castle and the wounded Fisher King who dwells there.
If some generous high roller backs the "Good, Bad, and the Grail" reward tier and our funding exceeds 6K, I will write a novella length, 25,000 word version of this short story that will come with this cover and go out as a print copy to every backer above the digital tier.
HOLY WEST: T-SHIRT EDITION
MOCK-UP version of the T-shirt, design by Daniel Irizarri
MOCK-UP version of the T-shirt, design by Daniel Irizarri
THE SEEKERS
Writer: That's me: Seth Jacob. I wrote Astrobiology #1, a sci-fi comic with art by Tyrell Cannon which we successfully Kickstarted and shipped to backers. I also wrote Heart of Weirdness, a one-shot psychedelic sci-fi comic with art by Alchemichael (M.L. Macdonald). Both comics are available through the campaign. 
Artist: Daniel Irizarri drew, colored, lettered, and did graphic design for Holy West. He illustrated Judge Dredd at IDW, a short story in IDW's Star Trek: Waypoint Special 2019, Cloudia and Rex at Lion Forge, and the back up story Greetings from Verde Luz which appeared in the Image Comics series Prophet. He also colored Astrobiology #1 as well as his own work on Cloudia and Rex. Daniel's personal collection of sci-fi art and comics called "Otherworldly" is available through the campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Comics take a long time to make. Once we're funded, it will take several months just to make the comic book itself. Also: the pandemic might slow down the printing and shipping process. 

That having been said, I have every confidence that we'll be able to get this comic to you, and we'll do it as fast as we possibly can while making sure that the quality lives up to our standards. You deserve the best, and we want to give it to you. It's possible that we won't hit our estimated delivery date, but we will get this comic and your rewards to you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Half Page Advertisement
support.descp:
Do you have a saloon, an upcoming comic book of your own, a podcast, maybe even a comic book store? Do you you need to get the word out to a targeted audience of the most discerning comic book readers?
You can get a half page advertisement in Holy West #1 Premium. The ad will be done in an authentic, 1880's Wild West style, with art and graphic design by Daniel Irizarri. I'll work with you to write the ad copy to your specs. I'll be your own personal Don Draper, except more handsome and mysterious. The ad will look like it's straight out of a newspaper from the height of the Old West. And it'll run in copies of Holy West #1 Premium forever...that's a lifetime of advertisement for $250. A steal!*
It would also be great for sharing on social media, as well as printing up and using for flyers.
*However: we reserve the right to refund your money and decline to advertise your product if it's obscene, unethical, or offensive.

support.title: The Good, the Bad, and THE GRAIL 2
support.descp:
Okay, at this tier, you're clearly not messing around. So I won't either: I'll write a 48 page novella set in the world of Holy West, doubling the size of the 24 page novella promised by the stretch goals. The story will explore the occult mysteries of The Grail, the Grail Castle, the Fisher King, the magical phenomenon that interlinks them all, and the many spiritual seekers who have searched for The Grail over the centuries.
I reserve the right to reprint the story in the future (for fun and profit), but you'll get the original manuscript, signed by both me and Daniel Irizarri.
If someone backs this tier and we reach a funding goal of 12,000: EVERY BACKER FROM THE PRINT PREMIUM EDITION AND ABOVE will get a printed copy of this 48 page novella with the Dime Novel cover by Goran Gligović. It'll be like reading an authentic, Old West Dime Novel.
INCLUDES:
48 Page Novella set in the world of Holy West
Holy West #1 Print
Holy West #1 Print Premium Edition
Holy West T-Shirt
Print copies of Astrobio #1, Heart of Weirdness, and Otherworldly
Digital extras: Astrobiology #1, Heart of Weirdness, Otherworldly
Holy West #1 PDF

support.title: The Commission Caboodle
support.descp:
We got a high roller here, huh? Okay, hotshot. At this tier, you get a 9 x 12 commission by Daniel Irizarri. You also get the whole kit and caboodle: Holy West #1 Print, Holy West #1 Premium, the T-Shirt, all the digital extras, and the trail library. You're living large now.
INCLUDES:
9 x 12 commission by Daniel Irizarri
Holy West #1 Print
Holy West #1 Print Premium Edition
Holy West T-Shirt
Print copies of Astrobio #1, Heart of Weirdness, and Otherworldly
Holy West #1 PDF
Digital extras: Astrobiology #1, Heart of Weirdness, Otherworldly

support.title: Original Comic Art by Vlad Legostaev
support.descp:
Get a page of Vlad Legostaev's original art for the back up story in Holy West #1 Premium. Vlad's an up and coming artist who is destined for comic book superstardom...you heard it here first. Snag a page of his comic book art early, before he's ascended to the status of comic legend and they become worth more than their weight in gold.
INCLUDES:
Original Art by Vlad Legostaev
Holy West #1 Print
Holy West #1 Print Premium Edition
Holy West T-Shirt

support.descp:
Okay, at this tier, you're clearly not messing around. So I won't either: I'll write a 25,000 word novella set in the world of Holy West. The story will explore the occult mysteries of The Grail, the Grail Castle, the Fisher King, the magical phenomenon that interlinks them all, and the many spiritual seekers who have searched for The Grail over the centuries.
I reserve the right to reprint the story in the future (for fun and profit), but you'll get the original manuscript, signed by both me and Daniel Irizarri.
If someone backs this tier and we reach a funding goal of 6,000: EVERY BACKER ABOVE THE DIGITAL TIER will get a printed copy of this novella with the Dime Novel cover by Goran Gligović. It'll be like reading an authentic, Old West Dime Novel. If we're in that 5,500 range, you could be a hero to all those hundreds of backers and bring them 25 k words of glorious extra story.

updates.update_userinfo: Another sneak peak at HOLY WEST and: Stoned Master!
updates.update_content: Hey everyone, just wanted to do another quick update to let you know that we're making good progress on HOLY WEST #1, and give you another sneak peak at the book:

Hey, everyone. I just want to give you another quick update: we're working very hard to complete HOLY WEST.
I know we're very behind on our estimated delivery date, and I apologize for that. But I just want to reassure you with some more new art that HOLY WEST is coming together.
Hey everyone, I hope you're doing well and staying safe. I just wanted to give you a quick update: HOLY WEST is coming along nicely, and we have some new art to show you.

Hey everyone: I hope you had a good holiday season and New Years, and that your 2021 is off to a relatively good start (despite all the crazy stuff going on). 
I just wanted to let you know that we're working hard on completing HOLY WEST. I'm sorry to say that we aren't going to hit our January 2021 delivery date. But we've been hard at work on the comic, and we're doing everything that we can to get you the book and your rewards as soon as possible.

updates.update_userinfo: The Quest Continues and: BEEF BROS!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone: I hope you've been doing well since we last spoke, and keeping it together during this insanely intense 2020. 

I just wanted to check in, and to let you know that we're making progress on HOLY WEST. I haven't forgotten about you. Far from it. I've just been very focused on making HOLY WEST #1 and all of your rewards. This is a project that means a lot to me, that I've been working on for a long time, and will continue to work on for a long time to come. For me, it's the Grail or bust.

Hey everyone: now that the campaign is over, I just wanted to thank you again for backing HOLY WEST. Nearly 500 of you helped bring us to 238% of our funding goal. We're humbled and encouraged by the response to HOLY WEST. And Daniel and I can't wait to get this book into your hands. 
To celebrate, here's a little sneak peak at Vlad Legostaev's artwork from his short story in the Premium edition:

Hey everyone:
HOLY WEST was fully funded within 48 hours of launch! And only one week into the campaign, we're more than 145% funded and have nearly 270 backers. Thank you so much...your support means the world to me and Dan. We can't make comics like this without you. You made this comic a reality. 
And we can't wait to tell you this story. So to celebrate, we're announcing a few stretch goals:

project_data.project_name: Holy West

campaign.story:
Update: July 9th
We've made our minimum goal, and we're so thrilled! We're firming up some great additions to the book that we'l might be able to do if we hit some stretch goals, and we'll let you know about those soon. For now, raise a glass and get ready to bring DASH home this Fall!
Artwork by Vinnie Rico
 Los Angeles, 1940. 
It all starts with Zita Makara's plea for help recovering an ancient artifact. Even though private eye Dashell Malone knows something's fishy, he takes the case anyway, for the promise of a big payday. He'd be more game for the case if he didn't suspect the man he's sweet on—Johnny “Plink” Plinketts—has been keeping secrets from him and might be mixed up in all this somehow. 
Artwork by Delia Gable
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Delia Gable
When Zita is tied to the scene of a shocking murder, Dash begins to see that the seemingly unrelated parts of his life are connected in ways he never anticipated. The pieces to a much larger puzzle come into focus that could spell the end for Dash and everyone involved! 
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Delia Gable
Aided by his wise-cracking secretary, Cindy Crenshaw, and his pal on the police force, Sal McGillicutty, Dash must confront the monsters of the past and ﬁnd the only thing capable of stopping a terrifying future! 
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Vinnie Rico
The Case of the Mysterious Zita Makara  
The gay, noir detective comic series DASH was written by Dave Ebersole and drawn by Delia Gable and Vinnie Rico. Northwest Press is shipping issue six to comics stores at the end of this month to close out the first story arc, a love letter to noir crime and classic horror pictures.
Now we're collecting that first adventure, "The Case of the Mysterious Zita Makara", into a deluxe, 224-page graphic novel with a cover by Tana Ford!  
Cover artwork by Delia Gable
In addition to the main story, the collection will also include three brand-new stories:
"The Case of the Man Behind the Mask", a 20-page story drawn by Sean Von Gorman. Dash takes a case in which he has to dig into the life of Hollywood’s biggest up and coming stars, and finds a piece of his past there.
From "The Case of the Man Behind the Mask", art by Sean Von Gorman
"The Case of the Best Friend on the Police Force", an 8-page story drawn by Vinnie Rico. Officer Sal McGillicutty discovers his best friend has been hiding a huge secret from him, what will he do with the truth?
"The Case of the Wisecracking Secretary", an 8-page story drawn by Vinnie Rico. Cindy Crenshaw broke and about to give up on LA, finds a car pulled over on the side of the road in the middle of the night, which could be just the opportunity she’s been looking for! 
From "The Case of the Wisecracking Secretary", art by Vinnie Rico
We're proud that DASH will be the 20th book published by Northwest Press, and a great way to celebrate our tenth anniversary publishing great LGBTQ comics!
More About the Cast  
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Delia Gable
Dash Malone was a rising star in the LAPD before he was outed in headlines on every paper in L.A. Managing to elude jail, Dash fought back by becoming the only thing lower in society’s eyes than a homosexual, a private investigator.
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Vinnie Rico
Now, spending his days looking through other people’s dirty laundry, Dash has developed a shield of cynicism and a gumshoe's jaded attitude. When a new tragedy strikes unexpectedly, Dash starts to think there's nobody in this world he can trust.
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Delia Gable
Dash must somehow put his trust in a fantastical mythology in order to stop a killer, and will have to lean on the people he’s closest to in order to get to the truth… and he's never been good at leaning on anyone. 
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Delia Gable
 Zita Makara attempts to hire Dash to make an exchange for her. Zita has an ancient, stolen artifact she's looking to sell, but Dash sees right through her. Concerned she's just another femme fatale in need of a sucker, Dash finds out he already knows the man he's supposed to meet.
Zita knows more about Dash than she's letting on, and she's involved in something far more dangerous than just dealing in antiquities.   
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Vinnie Rico
Cindy Crenshaw, Dash’s feisty secretary, has been with him since he opened his firm, after he was kicked off the police force and outed to the world. She’s determined to help Dash make the business succeed in the face of all the hate thrown their way. (Maybe she's even more determined than Dash, himself. Where else will she get paid to hate-read Gone with the Wind all day?)
With a mind even sharper than her quipping tongue, Cindy often catches on to the secrets bubbling under the surface long before Dash does.
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Vinnie Rico
Johnny "Plink" Plinketts is a former crook who Dash caught conning rich, elderly people into buying fake antiques from his “collection.” But when he nabbed him, before him down to the station… Dash ended up taking him home. 
Artwork by Delia Gable
Dash doesn’t know that Plink is a smuggler of antiquities, mostly stolen, who's determined to make one final score. Plink wants to use the money to get himself and his lover far away from the seedy underbelly of L.A. But can he get Dash to trust him long enough to make his plan work?
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Delia Gable
More Great Rewards!
The main rewards in the campaign feature copies of the graphic novel itself, in print and digital, but there are some other great rewards you can choose. (For instance, you can chip in just a few bucks for the "taster" version: a copy of DASH #1, the comic book that started it all.)
All rewards over $25 include a signed print, tucked into your graphic novel! You'll get a "Stop the Hate, Stop Fascism!" print featuring Dash smashing a symbol of hate, signed by artist Vinnie Rico.
Artwork by Vinnie Rico
You can opt for something more unique, a one-on-one script review with Dave Ebersole, co-creator and writer of DASH! Discuss your comic book script, a screenplay, your short stories, or a longer prose project. It’s up to you!
Portrait by Vinnie Rico
Both main DASH artists are offering a limited number of custom portraits for backers of the campaign. Vinnie Rico is offering up original digital portraits in the vintage 1940s style, perfect for your profile picture on social media or for printing and framing.
Portrait by Delia Gable
Delia Gable will create a beautiful 11"x14" art pencil portrait of you from reference photographs and we will send you the original piece. (Only two portraits from Delia will be available!)
Original DASH pages by Delia Gable
You can also pledge to get a page of original artwork used in the DASH graphic novel, by artists Delia Gable or Sean Von Gorman. These one-of-a-kind rewards are extremely limited, so if you're an art collector, throw your hat in the ring quickly! After we fund, you'll get your choice of art pages by the artist you chose, on a first-come-first-served basis.
About the Creators
Dave Ebersole is also the writer of other comics work, including One Shot Horror: The Casket Girls, Trudy and Chep Save the Day, and the anthology This Nightmare Kills Fascists. Also a theater director and playwright, he’s had his work produced in Philadelphia, New York, and Las Vegas. Most recently he’s earned his MFA in writing for the stage and screen from Point Park University. He lives right outside Philly with his Yorkie Ernie, who is a jerk sometimes but it’s ok because he’s cute… sometimes. Find him on Twitter at @debersol.
Delia Gable is an artist, musician, cat lover and voracious reader who specializes in figure drawing, portraits, and comics. She is inspired by faces, hands, the intersections of human, animal and plant life, and the sensuality of being. Illustrations include various published comics, print novels and album covers. Her art has been exhibited in several NYC galleries and at special events on both coasts, and she has also led workshops, been a featured guest on comic con panels, and participated in live drawing events. Delia graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and the School of Visual Arts. A native New Yorker, she relocated to Tacoma in 2015 and is all about keeping it weird and feared. Find her on Twitter at @dcgable. 
From Fake Empire #1, Written by Eric Palicki, Art by Vinnie Rico
Vicente Rico is a Mexican comic artist who's very interested in social issues and pizza. In addition to DASH, he has collaborated on comics like The End is Totally Nigh, written by Kara Barrett, and Fake Empire, written by Eric Palicki. Find him on Twitter and elsewhere at @ricomics.  
Art by Tana Ford. "Silk" © Marvel Comics
 Tana Ford has graciously agreed to create a brand-new cover for the collection! Ford received a Prism Queer Press Grant for her lesbian road-trip graphic novel Duck!, and the sequel Duck! Second Chances was a finalist for the Lambda Literary Award. She was nominated for a Hugo Award in 2019 for her work on Nnedi Okorafor's Black Panther: Long Live the King from Marvel Comics, and is an Eisner-nominee this year for her work (again with Okarafor) on LaGuardia, for Dark Horse. She's also worked on series such as Silk, The Amazing Spider-Man, Guardians of the Galaxy, New Warriors, Jem and the Holograms, Star Trek, and Livewire. Find her on Twitter at @tanaford.
"Toe Tag Riot", created by Matt Miner and Sean Von Gorman
Sean Von Gorman is an New York based comics illustrator and writer. He is known for co-creating Toe Tag Riot (Black Mask Studios), Secret Adventures of Houdini (Alterna) and Pawn Shop (Z2 Comics). He has also contributed art for Rocket Girl (Image), Neverboy (Dark Horse) as well as the Occupy Comics Anthology which included such comics legends as Alan Moore, Mike Allred, and David Mack. In addition to his comics work, Sean has also contributed art for Neil Gaiman's Neverwear and several features for Alternative Press Magazine. He is also a brilliant guerrilla marketer who has been known to handcuff himself to things and escape straitjackets to promote his comics. Find him on Twitter at @vongormanart. 
Narration in our Kickstarter video was done by Peter Zielinski, and the original music was created by Christopher Tolomeo with Mick Loro. Titles, editing, and production by Zan Christensen. 
Written by Dave Ebersole, Art by Delia Gable
The Budget
We're raising $15,000 to produce DASH: The Case of the Mysterious Zita Makara. This will be a 224-page full color trade paperback printed by Marquis Imprimeur in Quebec and distributed through Northwest Press in Seattle, Washington.
Here's how the funds will be spent:
$2,500 for a royalty advance for the creators
$1,600 for new artwork for the collection
$1000 for artwork for rewards for the campaign
$6,000 for printing 
$600 for shipping from the printer
$1000 for Kickstarter and credit card fees 
$2,300 for fulfillment costs (postage, packing, returns)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Northwest Press is celebrating its 10th anniversary this year, and has been creating LGBTQ Kickstarter projects since 2011. We work with a great printer and have a pretty good setup for fulfillment. We've set the fulfillment date to September to allow extra time for quality control and unforeseen delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
DASH is now a podcast! 
The trailer for the show as well as the first episode are now live, and you can listen to them through Apple Podcasts. Check it out here:
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/dash/id1572907016

Hi all! I had a few secondhand reports of books that haven't arrived. One of them I have shipment info for, and the other I need more info to check on it. If you're in the same boat, please let me know so I can track it down. I got books shipped out to everyone, but there were some missing surveys, and possibly some address changes as well, so it's possible you're among them.
If you didn't get your book, let me know!
Also, congrats to Dave Ebersole and Vinnie Rico on the successful Kickstarter project for TOMMY DAKOTA AND THE SHOOTOUT AT THE BURGUNDY TEN! I'm super jazzed for the book and am excited that I was a backer for it.

Hi all! 
Just a quick note to let you know that yesterday I shipped out the last of the outstanding books, as well as the signed prints that were part of some backers' rewards but were shipped separately from their books.
Thanks for your patience while we got everything sorted out, and I hope you love your stuff!

Hi all! 
Sorry for the delay in providing an update, but I wanted to get a better handle on what remained to complete—and when it would happen—before the project fulfillment is totally done.
If you haven't downloaded the digital edition and your pledge included one, the link to download the digital edition is here: https://northwestpress.com/dash_KS

I paid the final invoice to the printer to release the printed books, and they told me the shipment date of the books to Seattle was October 7. Usually freight shipments take 7-10 days, so it won't be long until I have them in hand and can start packing them up for shipment to you!
Sorry we were delayed a bit, but it won't be much longer now.

It's taken a little longer than expected, but the book has finally been sent to the printer and is in production! They're estimating a ship date in mid-October.
The delays have been to make the book even better than originally planned, and we hope you think it's worth the wait. We added 16 pages to the book (for a total of 232 pages).
We've given each chapter room to breathe, with elegant chapter headings and closing icons.

Hi all!
We're down to less than two weeks before we go to print, and we've gotten responses to about 73% of the surveys we've sent out. That means there are 150 or so people who haven't let us know their address and any other info that we need (such as whether you want to be thanked in the book, and how your name should appear).
Check your email and look for a survey link from BackerKit. They'll be sending out automated reminders as well, with new links.

updates.update_userinfo: 91% of surveys in. 28 backers' info missing!
updates.update_content:
Hi all!
I've set up our surveys on BackerKit and have just sent out a "smoke test" to a few backers to make sure the surveys are clear and don't have any problems with them. Once I've got the all clear, I'll send them out to everyone.
Even though we won't be shipping books for another five weeks or so, please complete the survey as soon as you can. We need to collect all the names that will be thanked in the book before we can go to press. I'll leave two weeks for surveys to get answered, and will go with Kickstarter names for those folx who haven't responded with a custom name or asked to be omitted.

project_data.project_name: DASH: The Gay Noir Graphic Novel

campaign.story:
One of the bloodiest battles in the history of warfare - collides with an ancient and hungry evil.
WAR IS HELL.  
P.J. Holden's cover image
Madius Comics and Mad Robot Comics are proud to present Hell In Stalingrad - the first collaboration between writers Rob Jones (Griff Gristle, Tragic Tales of Horrere, Paperbacks and Inkstains) and Matt Hardy (Murder Most Mundane, Cadavers, Last Exit to Brighton).
 With an eye catching cover by 2000AD and BattleTanks artist P.J. Holden - and gritty, realistic art from Horrere alumni Russell MacEwan. 
Hell in Stalingrad is an 80-page pulp horror graphic novel, in the vein of classic war story comics such as DC Thomson's Commando.
It is a complete story - told in one A5 sized, softcover or hardcover collection - utilsing black & white and single colour artwork. 
Set in the midst of the Battle of Stalingrad - with the Soviet Kessel slowly engulfing the German forces. We follow the story of a German soldier, Ernst, andVassily, his Russian counterpart, as they must set aside vast ideological differences in a bid to thwart an otherworldly threat. 
 UNCOMICMAS - "The story is highly addictive...[the] art is certainly daring and risky..."
FANDEMONIUM - "Like Commando Comics, but viewed through a blood-smeared lens."
THE DREAM CAGE - "It says War Is Hell on the cover but rest assured the comic looks absolutely heavenly." 
 BIG COMIC PAGE - "what you’d get if Event Horizon was set in the middle of one of the bloodiest most horrific battles in the history of modern warfare."
AP2HYC - "anachronistic horror makes [Hell in] Stalingrad colourful and twisted and brutal..."
THE VALKYRIES - "The writing, along with the artwork is gritty and just as dark. Full of dark humor and characters that feel both well rounded and fully believable...I’d be amiss if I didn’t mention the frankly immense artwork from Russell McEwan. It’s so multi-layered and intense, each page shows so much horror, movement, and energy."
Can these two men from such radically different backgrounds, caught up in one of the bloodiest battles of the Second World War, prevent a demonic force from crossing over and plunging the world into the fires of Hell?  
Complete with lettering by Jones (his lettering credits include 24 Panels for Image Comics, Nicnevin and the Bloody Queen for Humanoids and multiple issues of Commando Comics - including the reissued Ramsey's Raiders) - this is a must have for fans of horror and war comics alike. 
 *NOTE* - Just for clarification, we would like to take this moment to say that none of the creators involved support the oppressive ideologies which are prevalent in this book, such as Nazism or Stalinism. The context of the story came about due to the ferocious nature of the battle in and around Stalingrad, which is why we felt it would be a good setting to choose for our story. The idea of War breaking down the barriers between our reality and the kingdom of Hell seemed most apt in the theater where Nazism and Stalinism clashed so brutally. The idea of two men on either side of such atrocious ideals, thrust into a war they did not wish to wage, at the behest of those with such extreme viewpoints, seemed like an interesting story to explore.
BOOK PREVIEW 

'Vassily' print by Russell MacEwan
Interior artist Russell MacEwan's variant cover.
A DRM free Digital copy of the comic.
Digital artbook of process work from Russell MacEwan
A physical copy of the graphic novel.
GUEST PIN UPS FOR STRETCHGOAL PRINT PACKAGE (ALL UNLOCKED!)
Print by guest artist Lucy Sullivan (Stretchgoal Print Package)
Guest Pin-Up Print by artist Iain Laurie (stretch Goal Print Package)
Guest Pin-Up Print by artist Russell M. Olson (Stretch Goal Print Package)
Guest Pin Up Print by Paul Moore (Stretch Goal Print Package)
Rob Jones: - is a writer and letterer of comics. Alongside longstanding [suffering] writing partner Mike Sambrook he has written numerous comics for their comic collective, Madius Comics, most notably Griff Gristle, Tragic tales of Horrere and Papercuts and Inkstains. Rob has lettered such comics as 24 Panels for Image Comics, Nicnevin and the Bloody Queen for Humanoids, Yasmeen for Scout Comics, DC Thomson's Commando Comics, The Broons and Oor Wullie, most of Mad Robot Comics works such as Cadavers and Murder Most Mundane and many, many more. He and Matt have routinely threatened each other with working together...this is the product of those threats.
Matthew Hardy: Help - I’m tied to a chair with barbed wire and Rob is making me watch Enemy at the Gates on endless loop whilst writing pages with my teeth. In a past life I was the writer of the Cadavers series, author of Madhouse, Last Exit to Brighton, Murder Most Mundane and the Arts Council adaptation of A Study In Scarlet. Also a trustee of the Gaming Vs Cancer charity and founder of Mad Robot Comics. But that was before the war……
Russell MacEwan: is a Glasgow based artist and lecturer. He runs his own concept and art studio, Black Sun Studios. His comic credits include Horrere and From Hell's Heart: An Illustrated Celebration of Herman Melville.
William McLaughlan WASM: WASM is a UK-based creator who made the transition from film to comics after facial reconstructive surgery left him unable to make as much tea and coffee as crews require. He likes one-shots and hot-takes over continuity and crossover events. His most anticipated future event is watching Zack Snyder’s Justice League in 2021. He can be found on: https://wasm19.wixsite.com/mysite
PJ Holden: is a Belfast based comic artist whose work has appeared in 2000AD for nearly two decades. How this state of affairs has come about remains an enduring mystery. He likes drawing monsters and war stuff. This let him do both.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Rob and Matt are veterans of at least a dozen Kickstarters between them, and have delivered them all successfully. However, as with life, every Kickstarter comes with its own unique risks and challenges. We're all facing something pretty unprecedented in modern times, a global pandemic. We know that postal services are working overtime under stressful conditions.

The comic is fully written and Russell is tearing through the pages. Thankfully as a platform Kickstarter allows us to reach you speedily.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!  
Just a quick update to say that our co-publisher MADIUS COMICS is currently live on Kickstarter with THE INCREDIBLE BUN!

The next event in our Mad Robot 2021 publishing line-up is live on Kickstarter now. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/153289885/bete-noir-books-2-and-3
PLAY

To everything there must come an end.
Hopefully by now everyone has their copies of Hell in Stalingrad. We’ve had some amazing feedback from you guys - and a number of glowing reviews from comic-book websites. We even made it into the Pipedream Top 50 Indie books of the year.
https://pipedreamcomics.co.uk/best-indie-and-small-press-comics-2020-40-31/
You should all be receiving your copies of Hell in Starlingrad shortly. With over 500 books to send - we'll be doing them in batches.
Very quick update to show you this: -

We've dotted the I's, crossed the T's, used up all the blood red ink in the world - and sent Hell In Stalingrad to the printer.
It’s a few weeks later than intended. Writer/Letterer/Book formatter Rob Jones decided to move house whilst balancing a care job directly impacted by the COVID resurgence. That, along with our addition of Hardbacks to the print run - threw a small delay in the works.
But the sentient printing machines of Comic Printing UK now have the finished book and we eagerly await the final product.
With Russell bringing the final pages of Hell in Stalingrad to a demonic, screaming finish...

Funds have all cleared and surveys are in the wind!
If you backed for digital only rewards - we don't need your postal address and so no need for a survey.  We will send your digital rewards to the email you use for Kickstarter (please email us if you want us to change this). 
If you backed for original art or art commissions, you'll receive a survey - but we will also be in touch directly.

project_data.project_name: HELL IN STALINGRAD

campaign.story:
The early 2000s were such a weird time, right? Technology was advancing at an unparalleled pace, the world was becoming more connected than ever before, and demons were finally becoming accepted as a regular part of society. Hmm? You don’t remember the demons? No, trust me, they were everywhere. It’d been a rough few decades since the portals opened, what with the supernatural suddenly unleashed upon the mundane world, but it had gotten so much better! Lesser imps were little more than brimstone pigeons, old superstitions were suddenly a lot scarier, and an untold number of hell dimensions had become just another series of exciting vacation spots. Truly, the world was a much more magical, if infernal, place!
But being a broke teen is the same in any reality, so what good are cursed relics and ancient evils when you can barely afford gas money? Desperate for any opportunity to bring some devilish delight into their lives, best friends Victor, Miri, and Reeves buy a cheap, do-it-yourself summoning circle from a mall kiosk. Their goal? To call forth their own personal demon and bind it to their souls. Because really, what better way is there to end summer vacation in style than a blood sacrifice between friends?
Cover Art
Created by Jordan Alsaqa and Ray Nadine, Raise Hell! is a coming-of-age comedy about the confusing emotions, messy relationships, and strange explorations that come with the last few years of high school. Also, demons. Oh, so very many demons.
Raise Hell! follows the adventures of Victor Beck, Miriam Elrahal, and Ashley Reeves, a trio of high school juniors just trying to survive to graduation in the city of Eklund. Victor is an excitable goof around his friends and mom, but he's riddled with social anxiety and easily embarrassed in class and on his own. That doesn't stop him from rambling on for hours about his love of ska and the infernal, or from Naruto-running everywhere unironically. Reeves is skeptical of just about everything, and her temper has a way of getting the better of her, especially around her seemingly unflappable stepmom, Karen (UGH... Karen...). Call her by her first name at great risk to your personal well-being. And Miriam is a voice of reason among the insanity, a keeper of the peace within her friend group and in the world at large. That doesn't make her any less quick to freak out over a rare anime import DVD or at the possibility of her devoutly religious father learning about her occult interests.  
Our lovable teens
This unlikely trio of punk teens think they're ready for whatever the underworld has to throw at them, but nothing can truly prepare them for the mischievous imp Alistair that the hellfire spits up...
With this campaign, our goal is to raise funding to complete and print a physical copy of Raise Hell!. As a thank you for supporting the project, we have a number of reward levels, including digital and physical copies of Raise Hell!, previous books from Jordan and Ray, stickers, an enamel pin, art prints, script edits from Jordan, and physical commissions from Ray. At the top level, you can even appear in the book enjoying a meal at the Eklund Park Mall's food court!
Included below are several preview pages from early in the book as our heroes head to the mall to make their fateful purchase!
Click the image to better read the pages!
Writer Jordan Alsaqa is an N.C. State graduate with a degree in Creative Writing. He’s successfully funded numerous comics through Kickstarter, including Terminal Protocol, Finding Peace, and We Have to Go Back. His current comic, Welderkin, is published digitally by Comicker Press. His work can also be found in numerous anthologies, including Alloy Anthology: Electrum from Ascend Comics and You Died from Iron Circus Comics. Jordan’s high school years were spent playing video games, creating a ridiculously complex stick figure comic mythology, and listening to way more third-wave ska than any teen probably should’ve in the late 2000s. You can keep up with Jordan's other projects on Twitter and at his website.
Artist Ray Nadine has been drawing since they could hold a pencil, and has been making comics since 2013. They're currently working on a graphic novel that they're contractually obliged not to say much more about, and also illustrated Messenger on Webtoon. They've had stories featured in a handful of anthologies, notably Everything Is Going Wrong (edited by Mark!) and Local Haunts, edited by Kara Lais.  Ray's also created the webcomic Dollhouse, and several short comics including Anchored, The Collector, and The Ties That Bind. When Ray isn't working, they're playing too many video games, cooking, or rough-housing with their cats. Their favorite band is My Chemical Romance and they still listen to all the same crap they listened to in high school. Keep up with their art and projects on Twitter and their website.
Editor Mark Bouchard is a non-binary writer/editor in Chicago, by way of New England who has been self-publishing comics since 2016. They are the editor and creator of EVERYTHING IS GOING WRONG: Comics On Punk & Mental Illness, and their writing has been published in a number of comic anthologies including A Wave Blue World’s Dead Beats. They are currently writing a horror graphic novella due out in early 2021. Outside of comics, Mark enjoys curry and black coffee, often at the same time. They also write satire for The Hard Times and Hard Drive. You can follow them on Twitter for updates on their work and their dog, Juicebox. To read their short comics, and learn more about their past work, visit their website.
For funding, $500 will go towards paying Ray's remaining page rate for drawing, coloring, and lettering the story. Roughly $800 will go towards printing the book itself, with an additional $300 going towards producing the additional campaign rewards; got to get those swanky stickers, pins, and art prints! $700 will go towards shipping and fulfillment costs, while the final approximate 10% will go towards Kickstarter fees.
Below, you can get the full rundown of all the various reward levels available for this campaign. Each backer is taking a chance on this very personal passion project, and we plan to give it our all to show our thanks at every level. Domestic US shipping is included in each total, with international shipping costing an additional $15. And for the first 48 hours, the Physical Copy and Enamel Pin levels are available for a special early bird price!
At the Supporter level, in addition to our personal thanks, you'll be included in the Thank You section at the back of the book. You'll also have access to any behind-the-scenes material posted for backers in the campaign updates.
At the Digital Issue level, you'll receive a PDF copy of Raise Hell!. The digital copy will include all the same material as the physical book, including all pin-ups and stretch goals.
With the Digital Collection level, you'll receive additional PDFs of stories either written by Jordan or written/illustrated by Ray: Finding Peace by Jordan Alsaqa & Marie Enger, We Have to Go Back by Jordan Alsaqa & Sally Cantirino,  A Wolf in Sheep's Clothing by Jordan Alsaqa & Kacee Navarro, Dollhouse by Ray Nadine, Anchored by Ray Nadine, and The Ties That Bind by Ray Nadine.
At the Physical Issue level, you’ll receive the print edition of Raise Hell!, signed by writer Jordan Alsaqa. You'll also receive a Raise Hell! sticker!
At the Art Print level, you’ll get a special 8.5"x11" riso print of the Raise Hell! cast, designed and printed by Ray Nadine!
Art not final
At the Enamel Pin level, you’ll get a special 1.5" hard enamel pin of Victor's GREATEST SKA MIX OF ALL TIME cassette tape.
All horns, all the time
And now that both alternate pins have been unlocked, EVERY TIER that includes an enamel pin will now be able to choose which of the three pins (Victor, Miri, or Reeves) that you want included in your reward package. For the current Enamel Pin tier, if you should want two or three of the pins, we've added two new reward levels, the Double Pin tier ($40) and Triple Pin tier ($50), so you can simple upgrade your reward tier to assure you receive all the pins you want.
For all higher level tiers, as well as the Early Bird Enamel Pin tier, you just need to add an additional $10 to your pledge total for each pin. For early birds, this will maintain your initial savings while still allowing you to receive all three pins.
The Art Print tier and below WILL NOT be eligible to add pins on. You'll need to at least pledge at the initial Enamel Pin tier in order to receive any pins.
Lastly, given the popularity of the pins themselves, we've added a Just the Pins tier ($30) 
At the Back Issues level, you'll receive physical copies of several past works from Jordan and Ray, including Finding Peace by Jordan Alsaqa & Marie Enger, We Have to Go Back by Jordan Alsaqa & Sally Cantirino, Flame & Flood Atop the Mountain by Jordan Alsaqa & Christine Skelly, Dollhouse by Ray Nadine, Anchored by Ray Nadine, and The Collector by Ray Nadine.
At the Editor level, Jordan will work with you to help edit and refine either a comic script (max. 24 pages) or pitch document that you’re working on. This includes two rounds of edits and the option for an hour-long web or phone call. Jordan has eight years of previous editing experience, including numerous comic script and pitch edits, as well as work-for-hire rewrites. 
Want a Ray Nadine original to add to your collection? At the Art Commission level, you can do exactly that, commissioning an original 5"x7" traditional art piece from Ray. The artwork will be pen, ink, and spot color Posca. When you back at this level, you’ll be contacted to make sure Ray is comfortable with the subject you’d like to have drawn. You can see an example of this level right below!   
Finally, why not enjoy a meal of… middling quality with your comic? At the Food Court Cameo level, you can appear in the book as one of the customers of the Eklund Park Shopping Mall! In addition, you'll receive a social media icon drawn by artist Ray Nadine.
This could be your face
The initial funding goal has been reached! Time for... STRETCH GOALS! 
UNLOCKED! - Stretch Goal #1: At $4000, we'll be producing an additional six-page story that'll be included in both the print and digital editions of Raise Hell! The short will follow Victor as he works his part-time job at the local used bookstore and ends up having a chance encounter with... the Demon Lord of Ska!
UNLOCKED! - Stretch Goal #2: At $4500, we'll include a variant pin design! This one features Reeves's mixtape to go along with Victor's. Just some bands you've probably never heard of. When we send out the backer questionnaire, we'll ask which pin you'd like. If you'd like multiple pins, just add $10 per pin to your pledge! 
UNLOCKED! - Stretch Goal #3: At $5000, we'll include a second variant pin design! This one features Miri's mixtape, full of her favorite anime openings. Same as the other pins, we'll ask you which pin you'd like in the backer questionnaire, and if you'd like multiple pins, just add $10 per pin to your pledge!
Stretch Goal #4: At $6500, we'll be including two additional guest illustrations from artists Skylar Patridge and Vivian Truong in the book! Below, you can find examples of Skylar and Vivian's work, and more specific details on the stretch goal in the latest project update!
Skylar Patridge
Skylar Patridge
Vivian Truong
Vivian Truong
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk is the possibility of pricing changes for services such as printing and shipping that could affect estimates. However, the current campaign estimates are built with a significant buffer to account for this possibility, and our goal is to begin printing rewards as soon as the funding hits our account. Jordan and Ray have collectively run and fulfilled five successful Kickstarter campaigns and have put their full effort into making sure this campaign follows suit.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Like it says in the title, Raise Hell! has returned to Kickstarter for issue 2!

This one's as simple as the headline makes it out to be; the pre-launch page for issue 2 of Raise Hell! Is live! Give us a follow and be the first to know when issue 2 goes live on April 20th.
And to go along with that announcement, here's a look at the full issue 2 cover!

Hey all!
Just a quick update to touch on a few points related to the campaign!
SHIPPING
For shipping, almost everything has been sent out at this point, and it looks like the majority of you have received your reward packages; we hope you're all enjoying the book! However, with the ongoing post office issues here in the U.S., we've had some bounce backs and know that some packages have been stuck in transit for a while. Unfortunately, there's not a lot we can do to push the post office forward, but if you've still not received your package by the end of March, please let us know, and we'll see what we can do about sending out a replacement that will, ideally, not also end up stuck.

Hello all!
At this point, we've shipped rewards for everyone who has filled out their surveys, so hopefully you've all had a chance to read the first issue of Raise Hell! and get to know Victor, Miri, Reeves, and Ali! There are only a few of you left who haven't filled those surveys out, so please do soon so we can get those last rewards sent.
Looking forward, our goal for 2021 is to move full-steam ahead with the book and continue the adventures of our rowdy teens and their troublemaking demon. Production on issue two has begun, and we're aiming to launch a new campaign in April. With summer break all wrapped up, the kids have to figure out exactly what the first day of school looks like when you've got a demon bound to your soul!

Hey everyone, it's Ray!

I'm nearly done shipping out all the physical rewards! Taking a load of packages to the post office today, and after that only the Editorial Review, Art Commission, and Food Court Cameo tiers are left to ship. We miscounted how many of Jordan's back issues we would need to fulfill all the orders, so he's mailing some more to me so I can take care of those last few packages. Thanks for your patience everyone. I'll be mailing signed bookplate stickers to the physical reward tiers that didn't have signed copies this week too!

Hey all!
This update is coming a bit late, so this may already be obvious to some of you, but as the title says, we've begun the process of shipping books!
Specifically, if your package did not come with an enamel pin reward, it should already be shipped and on the way to you, if not already there! The other packages are all set to ship as well, we've just had a delay on the pin production side. Ideally, those will ship to us in the next week or so and we can get the rest of the packages sent before the end of the month.

Hello all!
It's been quiet of late, but we're back with the best news: the book is off to the printer, and digital rewards are now being sent!
Specifically, we're currently waiting to receive a physical proof of the book to make sure there aren't any major errors in the PDF. Once we get that (and barring any issues), we should be all set to receive the full order and begin fulfillment by November as estimated!

Hey all!
Just a quick update to say that surveys have been sent out! For the majority of you, it'll just be a simple address and email question, as well as a question about enamel pins if you qualify. There are just a couple notes beyond that.
For some levels, backers added additional funds to receive an additional pin or two. If you pledged to get all three, you're all set to go; if you pledged for one additional pin, please answer the additional question asking which second pin you want. This question is optional, so if you only pledged for a single pin, you can simply leave that question with no response.

Hey all!
Thank you all so much! Thanks to all of you, not only is Raise Hell! funded, but we've got a bunch of extras both in and out of the book to enhance the experience. I know I've said it a lot, but we've been absolutely blown away by the support for the book, and we're so excited to deliver it to you!
To that end, we wanted to give an update on our planned production schedule. At the moment, we're simply waiting for funds to clear. This process includes a grace period for any errored backers to update their payment information, so make sure your card info is correct! During this three-week waiting period, we are going to be getting final quotes for everything, as well as finishing up the bonus story and final PDF. Skylar and Vivian are also at work on the pin-ups, so as it stands, none of the additional stretch goal material should cause any delay to production.

project_data.project_name: Raise Hell!

campaign.story:
DRAGON is an original graphic novel by Eisner Award-winning writer Saladin Ahmed and acclaimed horror artist Dave Acosta. Presented exclusively as a deluxe format oversized hardcover, it's a dark, atmospheric tale set at the dawn of the Ottoman Empire -- a rich, grisly world of dazzling arts and brutal massacres, opulent palaces and bloodthirsty kings. 
DRAGON tells the story of Adil, a fallen old Muslim warrior, and Marjorie, a zealous young Christian nun, two scarred heroes who must overcome inherited bigotries and mutual distrust to hunt a demonic creature that wears the skin of a prince -- Vlad the Impaler, known to history as Dracula. 
A NOTE FROM AUTHOR SALADIN AHMED
I can't tell you how excited I am about this! 
DRAGON is the Dracula story I've wanted to tell for years, full of everything that matters to me -- horrific creatures, rich history, wildly different characters coming together to confront evil. It's a story centered on the sorts of heroes that are usually pushed to the margins -- heroes who must reach across gulfs of culture and faith to face down the world's most terrifying monster.  
Certain stories scream for certain artists, and as soon as this tale began to form in my head, I knew I wanted Dave Acosta to draw it. The way he goes from period details through pulp horror and classic comic influences is just breathtaking. He's outdoing himself with DRAGON, bringing to life Ottoman palaces and haunted forests in a way that will completely immerse the reader.  
What you see here is just a taste, and I can't wait for you to experience his art -- along with Chris O'Halloran's dazzling colors and Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou's brilliant letters and design -- on massive, gorgeously printed pages. 
A STUNNING BOOK, A SIMPLE CAMPAIGN
For years readers have been asking me to launch an original story on Kickstarter, and I've finally taken the plunge! DRAGON is a story that demands total control by the creative team and begs to be rendered as a beautiful physical object. And Kickstarter is the ideal  way to maintain that control and get such an object directly into fans' hands.
This will be a lavish book, published as a Kickstarter exclusive. An oversized, slipcovered deluxe format hardcover printed on high quality paper and crammed with extras from creators' notes to concept art to script and pencil pages.
There are currently no plans to release DRAGON in trade paperback or digital. For now, this special event hardcover is the only way to experience the story! 
We're offering a discounted early bird reward tier for those who support the project in the first 24 hours, but our campaign for DRAGON is deliberately very straightforward, with no bells and whistles. It's all about making a jaw-dropping book that showcases an intense story, and getting that book straight to readers.
OUR TEAM  
SALADIN AHMED won the 2017 Eisner Award for Best New Series alongside Christian Ward for Black Bolt. His short fiction has been anthologized by George RR Martin and performed by LeVar Burton. His novel Throne of the Crescent Moon was nominated for the Hugo Award and was cited in the Dungeons and Dragons Player’s Handbook. Abbott, his creator owned comic with Sami Kivela, was nominated for the Bram Stoker award. Saladin currently writes Miles Morales: Spider-Man and The Magnificent Ms. Marvel for Marvel Comics. 
DAVE ACOSTA is a sequential artist from Metro Detroit, known mostly for his work on Elvira: Mistress Of The Dark for Dynamite. Dave has also illustrated Vampirella, The Shadow, Doc Savage, and the serial killer-thriller Twelve Devils Dancing.
CHRIS O'HALLORAN is a colorist from Cork, Ireland. He colors Ice Cream Man from Image and has worked on books for Marvel, Dark Horse, Boom, Dynamite and others.
HASSAN OTSMANE-ELHAOU is a comics letterer, half from Algeria and half from England. He's lettered cool comics like Red Sonja, X-O Manowar, and Protector. He's also the voice behind Strip Panel Naked, and editor of the Eisner-winning PanelxPanel magazine.
NATE COSBY is an editor and writer, that's worked on Thor The Mighty Avenger, Red Sonja, Jim Henson's The Storyteller, World War Hulk, Spider-Man Loves Mary Jane, James Bond, The Wonderful World Of Oz, Flash Gordon and sooooooooo many more. 
**A VERY IMPORTANT NOTE ON SHIPPING**
Shipping fees are not included in your pledge. Rather, all shipping will be charged after the campaign ends, just before the book ships.
This allows us to make sure you are paying the lowest possible shipping fees. Backerkit will send surveys to each backer requesting their address and calculating shipping fees -- which we will do all we can to minimize!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any project has its risks in creation, manufacturing delays, and the unexpectedness of the world. But we've all got years of experience meeting monthly comics deadlines, and we've given ourselves plenty of time to bring you an incredible book.

DRAGON is written and art is underway. Letters and colors will be completed by the end of 2020. Our delivery date may seem far in the future, but it reflects the realities of production. The book will be printed in early 2021, and we've added a cushion to our delivery date to ensure we are on time!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Planet Comics is a new, 40+ page, full-color, oversized comic anthology that pays homage to the original 1940s pulp magazine.
Issue #1 regular cover by Pietro
From 1940 through 1953, Fiction House published the first comic dedicated exclusively to science fiction: Planet Comics! This anthology title featured futuristic stories of heroic adventurers with a mid-century aesthetic, and it is well-loved to this day, often for its lush, high-quality, imaginative covers. Just look at this winner from issue 71: 
Planet Comics #71 from 1953
Hey everyone! My name’s Jeff McClelland, and I write comics like The Tick and the 2019 Kickstarter-funded Black Terror: Social Insecurity. With this new iteration of Planet Comics, I’d like to tell fun, imaginative stories under a sci-fi umbrella. To that end, I’ve asked some of my friends to help out and I’m really happy with the result. If you agree, then I hope you’ll help us send this issue to print! If the campaign for this first issue is successful, I’d like to publish a total of four issues on a (roughly) quarterly schedule.
As an added throwback, this issue will be presented in an oversized, magazine format, leaving lots of room for wide landscapes and immersive action!
The book
So what’ll be included in this first issue? First, we’ve got “The Bulwark”, from myself and artist Andrea Schiavone. This story will be the book’s continuing feature, told in serialized chapters along the way. Here’s a quick preview!
The Bulwark preview
The Bulwark preview
Next up is “The Old Man and the Agean Sea” from my good friend and frequent collaborator, writer/artist Jeff McComsey (Honcho; Grendel, Kentucky). Jeff brings an aesthetic to this tale that is somehow both foreboding and warm, and this complete story features some of his best work yet.
The Old Man and the Agean Sea preview
Then we’ve got “The Night Tanya Tucker Uncancelled Earth” from Jennie Wood (Flutter; A Boy Like Me) and Duane Redhead (2000AD; The Tick), both wonderful, creative people. I’m thrilled that Planet Comics will be the venue for their first collaboration, and this complete story is so wild – I can’t wait for everyone to see it all! 
The Night Tanya Tucker Uncancelled Earth preview
Also included is an article by Diana Krueger on one of the pioneers of the original Planet Comics: Lily Renée! Diana highlights the life and times of Renée, one of the most prominent female artists from the mid-century run.
I’ve got a few more (secret!) plans to add some pages to the book if we get past our initial goal!
REWARDS
It's a space ship!
The biggest reward for this campaign is, of course, the book. Whether you go in for a physical copy or electronic, I hope you’ll feel that your pledge is well spent on these new sci-fi tales.
This first issue comes with two covers: a regular cover with art by Pietro, and a Kickstarter-exclusive variant cover by Matthew Dow Smith! You can order just the regular cover, or both at the same time.  
Planet Comics #1 Kickstarter exclusive cover by Matthew Dow Smith
In addition, everyone who pledges at the $8 level or above will get a copy of an electronic “making of” publication, with a behind-the-scenes look at the creation of this issue. You’ll also get your name printed in a “thank you” section at the end of the book, and you'll get an electronic copy of an original Planet Comics issue from the 1940s!
There are a few additional, limited, physical rewards that you can get in this campaign. The first is a neat vinyl sticker of this updated Planet Comics logo, designed by Alan Gallo!
I’m also offering up prints of Matthew Dow Smith’s variant cover image, sans logos or other text.
And you'll have a chance to get one of the last few copies of Black Terror: Social Insecurity and maybe a few other books I've written!
The Black Terror: Social Insecurity
*Also! The first 30 backers - at any physical level - will receive a signed copy of The Tick 2020 FCBD Special!* 
Free to the first 30 physical backers!
THE CAMPAIGN GOAL
My first goal with this campaign is to be able to pay the creators a decent rate for their work. After that, I hope to offset some of the printing and shipping costs that otherwise might be prohibitive.
If this campaign exceeds its initial goal, all of the extra funds will be funneled directly back into the book, adding pages and helping us get started with issue #2!
Follow me online!
If you’re looking for more content, progress reports or just to see pictures of my dog, you can always follow me online by clicking the images below:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re currently about 75% finished with the art for this book. There are always challenges when it comes to the physical act of putting a book together, but I’m dedicated to making this work and have published several books in the past.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi again, everyone!
It's the last weekend for the Planet Comics issue #2 campaign! In under 48 hours, the book will be funded or...not funded? Impossible! Unthinkable! I'm holding out hope, folks. But if you're thinking about backing the next issue in the series, these are the last days to do it! I hope you'll consider checking it out if you haven't yet. Here's the link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jeffmcclelland/planet-comics-issue-2/description

updates.update_userinfo: Planet Comics #2 campaign is now live!
Shipping update! Digital reward downloads! Get ready for issue 2!
Books have arrived! Update your shipping addresses if they've changed!

updates.update_content: What a time to be alive! We hit our goal and then some. I wanted to send a quick note of gratitude as we cross over into the next stage of this project: now it’s time to finish the book, get it off to the printer, and get it into your hands (electronically or otherwise). Kickstarter even tossed some digital confetti around when the campaign ended:

Hello everyone!
I hope that these weekly updates haven't been too annoying for you. There won't be too many more, because we're in the final days of the Planet Comics campaign! As we wind down, I want to once again thank each of you for your support and help in sharing the project.
I'm happy to announce that we've checked off two items from our list of stretch goals! As of right now, everyone who pledged at a physical level gets a Bulwark trading card! Yippee! Also, the book grows by a few pages as it'll now include a new short story from myself and Ian Nichols! We're perilously close to the third stretch goal, as well - here's hoping we reach it in the next 48 hours!

campaign.story:
American Dreams!
GREETINGS FROM OLD NEW YORK!
Hey, everyone. I'm Daniel Kalban, and I'm the creator/writer of AmericanDreams. Now you may ask yourself "What the heck is American Dreams?" American Dreams is a superhero comic set in New York City at the turn of the Twentieth Century. With my publisher, Short Fuse Media Group, LLC., I have released two issues of this series. Working with me on this book is the amazing art team of Dody Eka (pencils), Tebe Andry (inks), and Warnia K. Sahadewa (colors), with Matt Bowers (letters). Netho Diaz (GI Joe) provides the variant cover, and Tommy Shelton colors both the main and variant covers. 
Today, we're bringing you the opportunity to get all caught up on this amazing series while also offering issue #3 for the very first time. Short Fuse Media Group helped get the issue #1 released after some issues with a previous publisher and we released issue #2 direct at Baltimore Comic Con last year!!! With comic conventions shut down due to Covid-19, I decided to hop into the driver's seat and bring the entire series to Kickstarter. If you like superheroes, alternative history, or both, you are in for an exciting read.
Greetings From American Dreams!
THE STORY SO FAR
Jake Gold is a poor Jewish immigrant living on New York's Lower East Side with his parents, siblings, and grandfather in 1900. He's a worker in a sweatshop by day; by night, he's fighting as part of a never-ending turf war between rival ethnic gangs for whatever scrap of the territory they can get. For him, the American Dream is a fairy tale; one a poor immigrant can never live.
Page from American Dreams issue 1
Thomas Edison, however, truly believes in the American Dream; and he's made sure to get his way to the top by any means. He has found an old design by his old employee-turned-rival, Nikola Tesla: a machine to harness the energy from the stars. 
Page from American Dreams issue 1
With JP Morgan's financial backing, Edison sets up his machine in Central Park and throws the switch.
Page from American Dreams issue 1
That, of course, is when everything changes for Jake, Edison, and the rest of New York City. And dark forces will do anything to take power in the midst of chaos.....
Page from American Dreams Issue 2
Surrounding Jake is a cast of characters with names both unfamiliar and world-famous. This is the time of Harry Houdini, Emma Goldman, and other characters from this turbulent time in American History.
Set against the backdrop of the Gilded Age, American Dreams is superheroes-meets-historical fiction in an action-packed adventure. It also speaks some harsh truths of the realities of that seemingly long ago era...and how things might not have changed as much as we have liked.
A SNEAK PEEK INTO THE PAST
Let's take a dive into American Dreams, shall we?
Page From American Dreams Issue 3
Page from American Dreams Issue 3
Page from American Dreams Issue 3
Page from American Dreams Issue 3
SO WHY KICKSTARTER?
Your Kickstarter contributions help fund future issues of American Dreams! These funds help me make the books, and they help Short Fuse print them! Plus I love backing books on Kickstarter (I've backed over 100 projects), and I love being part of the community. Short Fuse's Motto is WE ALWAYS DELIVER, and I know I will be delivering to you a quality product that is full of action and adventure. 
WHERE YOUR FUNDING GOES
The books have been produced 100% so the funding will go towards printing and shipping rewards so we can get these books into your hands with any additional funding going towards recouping those initial production expenses so that production on new issues can continue as well.  
REWARDS TO SATISFY EVEN JP MORGAN
We can't do this without your help! But don't think we'll leave you empty-handed! We have a bevy of rewards for you to choose from! These range from digital and physical copies of the book, catch up bundles, t-shirts, action figures, and more! 
For $5, get your choice of issues 1, 2, or 3 in PDF Format!
For $10, get your choice of a physical copy of issues 1, 2, or 3! And as a bonus, you'll get the PDF of your chosen issue for free! Any tier where you get a physical book will also come with the PDF for that book!
American Dreams Issue 1 CVR A
American Dreams Issue 2 CVR A
American Dreams Issue 3 CVR A
Or, for $10, get digital copies of issues 1 through 3! In addition to those, you can choose three bonus issues from the Short Fuse Media catalog as well!
For $15, get a signed copy of American Dreams issue 3!
For $20, get a signed copy of issue 3 AND a bonus print!
For $25, get American Dreams issues 1-3, all signed!
For $30, get issues 1-3 AND a copy of issue 3 Variant Cover by Netho Diaz!
American Dreams Issue 3 CVR B
For $35, get your choice of any American Dreams issue, plus this great t-shirt!
For $45, get issues 1-3, AND the t-shirt!
For $70, get issues 1-3, their variant covers, AND the t-shirt!
American Dreams Issue 1 CVR B
American Dreams Issue 2 CVR B
For $100, I, Daniel Kalban, will help you with your own comic script! I'll give advice, and help you with your comic script writing over Zoom or Skype! You'll also get issues 1-3!
For $150, Short Fuse Media will help you create your own custom cover for American Dreams #1! We will take your original character, your loved one, or even yourself and make a one of a kind comic book cover for you to have in your collection! Plus, get issues 1-3!
For $375, you will get an official Liberty action figure from Indieverse Unlimited! Plus, get the comics!
Concept sheet for Liberty figure
For $750, Indieverse Unlimited will bring your own creation to plastic life! That's right, your character will become part of the Indieverse Unlimited Action Figure lineup! Get your character's action figure AND issues 1-3!
Indieverse Unlimited Invulnerable Figure
All the books and the t-shirt are ready to go, so we can get them to you fast! For custom rewards and action figures, it will take a little longer to get them to you.
In addition, we got this lovely crossover print starring Liberty and Invulnerable from Kathryn Calamia's Like Father, Like Daughter series. If you pledged to Kat's recently funded Kickstarter for issue #6 of Like Father Like Daughter or if you pledged to the Collected TPB that we successfully funded, you'll automatically get a copy of this print! It was done by the American Dreams art team of Dody Eka and Tebe Andry, with colors by Tim Brown. 
Liberty and Invulnerable from Like Father Like Daughter
To show appreciation for your support of this project, Daniel will be writing out personalized Thank You Post Cards to each backer that receives physical rewards. 

We'll be providing a coupon code for every backer to redeem ANY 3 comics from our online catalog!!! 

Every backer getting a physical reward will get this AWESOME print that was illustrated LIVE by the Publisher of Short Fuse Media Group, LLC., Michael Watson on his show "Chat and Draw".  
Every physical backer will get a physical copy of the Chat and Draw Season 1 Art Book with a special American Dreams Variant cover!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is complete, so we can get the book out quickly to you! Other rewards might take a little while longer, but it should not be that much of a delay.

However, this is a time of uncertainty, and uncertain delivery times, due to the COVID-19 pandemic. While we hope to deliver your rewards promptly and on time, there might be some hiccups due to unforeseen (and out of our control) issues once it is in the hands of the United States Postal Service.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
First of all, Happy Thanksgiving in advance to those who celebrate it.
Now onto the reason why I'm updating you all.
While mostly everything has been sent out and delivered, we have had issues with the T-shirts.

Just wanted to do a quick follow up to Daniel's post on fulfillment.
At this time we have shipped out over 80% of the rewards. T-shirt rewards arrive separately as they are shipped directly from the manufacturer to you.  We typically send the International Rewards and the customized rewards last as a different shipping process is used and/or rewards may not be ready to be shipped. 
If you pledged to any of our campaigns in the past, you may recall receiving an email notification with your tracking numbers. As we employ a new process that allows us to ship in bulk, the email notification is not an option anymore. However, if something does come up, we DO in fact have the tracking numbers and can track any packages.

Over the last few days, since last week in fact, Short Fuse Media has been shipping out rewards to you wonderful backers! So keep an eye out for them!
I'd love to see pics of your rewards, and hear your thoughts on the comic as well, when they arrive!
Thanks again!

"What's in the box?!"
It's all these great comics I have to sign! :D So I'll get started on signing these tomorrow and hopefully they will be soon coming to you!
STAY TUNED!!!
-DK

Hey Guys,
Just wanted to pop in with a quick update. With the digital rewards sent off we have finally placed the order for the physical books as we had to wait on the Chat and Draw Season 1 stretch goal Art Book to be formatted before we could finalize our order.
We tried something new, so you guys get to be the "pilot program" of sorts. The digital (PDF) version of the Chat And Draw Art Book actually has ACTIVE links to to the episodes of the show that each illustration took place on. You can click on the link to watch the image being illustrated directly from the PDF of the book. We thought it would be something nifty to try out as we continue to look for ways to make our digital offerings hold even more value. So if possible, drop us a comment and give us some feedback on what you thought of that feature as it is something we may explore in more detail on future releases.

Hey everyone!
Digital rewards will be out tomorrow for all you wonderful backers!
I'm excited for you all to get these rewards, as well as to hear your thoughts on the book(s)!
Some quick housekeeping, there are people who haven't filled in their rewards surveys, so please do so ASAP if you haven't done so already.

Hey all!
Surveys were sent out earlier today, so please fill them out so we can get your rewards to you as fast as we can!
Thanks again!
--DK

Hey all!
So, just a few updates for you guys. 
Surveys will be sent out on Monday. We're just finalizing the cover you unlocked for the Chat And Draw art book. In the meantime, some big news!

Thank you all for your generous support!
Without you, this would not have been successful.
Once again, thank you so much! And keep soaring.
-DK
