campaign.story:
This is a merch line made for fans, by a fan, to celebrate to return of a band who defined a generation and gave us all the will to keep on living. This one's for all you rock n' rollers, all you crash queens and motor babies: Listen up, and check out the campaign below!
The original goal is to fund 8 pin designs. There are two pins representing each era, but you can choose any number of pins in any combination as your reward!
Pins have gold metal plating are soft enamel with epoxy coating (AKA the look of hard enamel, but with more detail!) They vary slightly in size, all between 1.6" (40mm) and 1.75” (45mm). All pins come on a backing card with rubber pin backs, and all pins have 2 posts for stability.
You can select any number of, and any combination of pins in your reward.
Check out the Stretch Goals to see what other pins and merchandise can be unlocked once the original goal is reached!
After the original goal is reached, stretch goals can be unlocked at these levels:
PIN SETS • UNLOCKED!!
Pin sets have the same specs as the original 8 designs. Each set includes two pins.
LAST WORDS SET HAS UNLOCKED at $4,500 and includes both pins shown below. 
 SUMMERTIME SET HAS UNLOCKED at $6,000 and includes both pins shown below. 
The cost of each pin set is $20.
STICKERS • UNLOCKED!!
Stickers of the original 8 designs HAVE BEEN UNLOCKED at $7,500.  
Each sticker is around 3x3" in size and is holographic. They're also weatherproof! 
Stickers will be available at:
 $5 each
 $30 for a set of 8 (Save 25%!)
*PLEASE NOTE: There is an error in the copy for the Three (3) Pins reward tier. The set of 8 stickers does NOT come with that reward. I'm so sorry for the confusion!*
T-SHIRT • UNLOCKED!!
The Lady of Sorrows t-shirt HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $10,000.
Details of the Lady of Sorrows shirt design (with watermark).
Shirts feature a small pocket design on the front and a large back design. Each shirt is individually silkscreened with off-white ink onto a black fashion tee made of 100% combed ring-spun cotton (that means they're suuuuper soft).
Each Lady of Sorrows Shirt is $30.
Shirts are unisex sizing and available in sizes XS - 3XL. Size chart available below:
PENNANT • UNLOCKED!!
The Not Okay pennant HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $12,500.
Detail of the Not Okay pennant (with watermark).
These traditional pennants are made of black felt with a white and red screen printed design. Pennants are 9x27” in size.
Each Not Okay pennant is $25. 
Mock up of the Not Okay pennant as wall decor.
TOTE BAG • UNLOCKED!!
The To The End tote bag HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $15,000. 
Tote bags are made of black heavy-weight canvas (12oz as opposed to the thinner 6oz) and feature an off-white screen printed design. Each bag is 15x16” in size.
Each To The End tote bag is $20.
Detail of the To The End design (with watermark).
BANDANA • UNLOCKED!!
The Art is the Weapon bandana HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $17,500.
Two views of the Art is the Weapon mock up.
Bandanas are made of 100% cotton, black fabric with a yellow screen-printed design. Each bandana is 22x22” when fully unfolded. They can be worn as an accessory and even look good hung on a wall!
Each Art is the Weapon bandana is $15.
Detail of the Art is the Weapon bandana design (with watermark).
BASEBALL T-SHIRT • UNLOCKED!!
The To The End baseball tee HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $20,000.
Shirts feature a front design on a baseball-style t-shirt. Each shirt is individually silkscreened with white ink onto a black-and-white tee made of 52% combed ring-spun cotton and 48% polyester. Shirts feature a black base with white collar and sleeve detailing.
Detail of the To The End design can be found under the Tote Bag section.
Each To The End baseball tee is $40.
Shirts are unisex sizing and available in sizes XS - 2XL. Size chart available below:
BANNER • UNLOCKED!!
The House of Wolves banner HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $22,500.

These banners are made of black felt with a white and yellow screen printed design. Each banner is 18x24” in size and has two grommets for hanging in the top corners.
Each House of Wolves banner is $55.
Mock ups of the House of Wolves banner as wall decor.
Detail of the House of Wolves banner mock up (with watermark).
 FREE STICKER • UNLOCKED!! 
The To The End sticker HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $47,500.
The To The End sticker is a holographic sticker that will be included FREE with every pledge! The sticker is approximately 3x4" in size, black with holographic detailing, and is also water-resistant like the other stickers in the campaign.
LIMITED EDITION PINS • UNLOCKED!!
The Limited Edition Colorway Pins HAVE BEEN UNLOCKED at $60,000.
Pins have the same specs as the original designs, but with a limited edition red-dyed metal color way. These pins will ONLY be made for this campaign.
RETURN PIN • UNLOCKED!!
The Limited Edition Return Pin HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $75,000.
The Return pin comes in both gold and red color ways with similar specs to the other pins in the campaign. Backers who pledge $75 or more (before shipping) will receive a Return pin FREE with their pledge.
Backers will also be able to choose the Return pin as an individual pin if they have not backed for $75 or more. The Return pin will automatically be added to pledges that include the All Pins or All Pins + All Pin Sets in the corresponding color to the set that you choose.
FREE STICKER • UNLOCKED!!
The Return Holographic Sticker HAS BEEN UNLOCKED at $80,000.
The Return sticker is a holographic sticker that will be included FREE with every pledge! The sticker is approximately 2x3" in size, black and white with holographic detailing, and is also water-resistant like the other stickers in the campaign. 
DAD HATS • UNLOCKED!!
The Look Alive Sunshine and Not Okay dad hats have been unlocked at $85,000.
Hats are soft cotton in the popular “dad hat” style with embroidered detailing. The Look Alive Sunshine hat is black with yellow and white embroidered detail. The Not Okay hat is black with a red brim, and has red and white detailing.
Hats are sold separately. The cost of each hat is $20.
PLEASE NOTE: Hats are NOT included in the “All Merch” bundle, as they were added late after the bundle was created. To receive a hat, you must add the necessary costs to your existing pledge (use the Pledge Calculator below to help!) or pledge at the Dad Hat tier.
Look Alive Sunshine dad hat mock up.
Not Okay dad hat mock up.
Can't find the perfect tier pledge for you? That's okay! I've put together this Pledge Calculator to help you figure out how to pledge for the merch you want. The instructions and calculator chart are below.
STEP 1: Select the reward tier for the most expensive item that you want. Example: If you're interested in an enamel pin ($12), a tote bag ($20) and a banner ($55), choose the banner ($55 + $8 shipping) reward tier to start.
STEP 2: Now you'll be adding the funds needed for the rest of your items. The guide shows each item and their cost + shipping. Add the necessary funds for each item you choose to pledge for. Example: An enamel pin is $12 and shipping is free. A tote bag is $20 + $5 shipping. $12 + $20 + $5 = $37 gets added.
STEP 3: Add all your numbers together. Starting reward tier + additional item total + additional shipping total = PLEDGE TOTAL. Example: $55 starting (+$8 shipping) + $32 (added item cost) + $5 (added shipping cost) =  $100 TOTAL.
Have any questions? Do the numbers not quite add up, or does your shipping seem off? Send an email to deadkickstarter@gmail.com and I'll help you sort it out!
ADD ON ITEMS COST:
 July 24 - Kickstarter campaign ends.
 Mid-August - Surveys sent out after funding.
 September - Production of rewards.
 October - November - Fulfillment and shipment to all backers.
Please keep in mind: This predicted timeline is based on turnaround estimates given by manufacturers and my own experience in fulfilling Kickstarters and pre-orders.
 Your pledge will go towards:
 Production of rewards - 60%
 Shipping and shipping supplies - 30%
 Taxes + Fees - 10%
These percentages may change slightly as stretch goals are reached.
Any questions, concerns, or just want to give me a shout on social media? Here are all the places you can find me and my work:
Website | Twitter | Instagram
Feel free to shoot me an email at deadkickstarter@gmail.com and I'll get back to you as soon as possible!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second Kickstarter campaign, my first over 750% funded with all rewards sent out on schedule. I'm very familiar with the pin production process and have a reliable manufacturer I work with. The stretch goal products will be new ventures for me, but I'm working closely with the small businesses helping me bring this project to life and am confident they'll help me through any issues. 

COVID-19 may affect production and shipping times, but I've tried to account for any delays in my timeline and hope to stick to it. All buyers will be kept informed throughout the process and will be aware of delays for any reason.

The images used in this campaign are digital mock-ups of the final products and minor adjustments to the design may occur during production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping is Almost Complete + Restocks and Brand New Merch!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers and Friends,
It's with much excitement (and relief) that I announce: Shipping on Back From The Dead is almost complete! I can't believe this project began eight months ago and is coming to a (near) close with over 2,000 packages being sent out to all of you. As one project wraps up, another can begin... We'll get into that more in the update, though.
Shipping Update as of November 20th

updates.update_userinfo: Pins are Here! Shipping Update + New Merch Line Coming Soon!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers and Friends!
Since you've probably gleaned the important info from the title of this update already, let's jump into it: The pins have arrived! They are here, beautiful and shiny and plentiful, to say the least. Now that I have the pins in-hand, here's what it means for the shipping timeline:
Shipping Update

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping is Starting! Everything You Need To Know
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers and Friends,
I can't believe I'm finally saying this: Shipping will begin on October 2nd! It's been a long road to get here, but I'm so excited to get these merch items into your hands and hope you'll find it was well worth the wait.
In the interest of full transparency– and I mean full, after reading this update you will know everything that I know– I'm going to outline everything about what I'm doing on my end, so you know what to expect from this part of the process. Please read everything if you can find the few minutes to spare, so you know what's coming up in the next month and a half.

updates.update_userinfo: Production is Underway, Cards are Getting Charged + a Pin Sneak Peek!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers and friends,
August 31st was the official last day for surveys and pre-orders, which means we get to move into the next exciting phase of Back From The Dead. But first I wanted to say thank you again to all of you who filled out your surveys, added on items, shared and ordered from the pre-order store: You helped get this project just shy of $180,000. There aren't words for what I feel when I realize that 2,088 of you helped make this merch line a reality. Thank you for all of your support, in the many ways you gave it.
Production on the merch is underway!

Hey Backers and Friends,
As we get ready to move into the next phase of the campaign, we first have to wrap up this one...
 This is the LAST CALL for surveys + survey updates!

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys are Coming 8/10 + A Secret Menu Item!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers and Friends!
Exciting but (relatively) short update for you today, becaaaause...
Surveys are coming on Monday, August 10!
It's time! Starting on Monday, August 10th you’ll receive an email with a special link to your personalized BackerKit survey. , since I need the information gathered from surveys to start production and fulfill rewards!

updates.update_userinfo: The End. (But Really, Just the Beginning!): What Comes Next
updates.update_content:
Hey backers and friends,
It was 2013 and I was two months shy of graduating from art school when my favorite band in the world broke up. Back then my dream was to make a career designing t-shirts, posters, any kind of art that was both unique and affordable, but at the very, very top of my bucket list? Design their merch. Though I'm grateful to have made many cool things and accomplished a lot in my career, I'd long since made peace with the fact that I probably wouldn't ever get that dream opportunity.

updates.update_userinfo: Dad Hats, Free Pins + Stickers, and One Week to Go!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers and Friends,
We're staring down the final week of the Back From The Dead campaign, and I couldn't be more grateful: There are over 1,000 of you now– which is blowing my mind– and together we've raised well over $80,000 to bring all sorts of merch to life. With one week left to go, I can't wait to see where these last few days take us.
With that in mind, here are some things you should know about the home stretch:
The Final Stretch Goal: Dad Hats

updates.update_userinfo: New Pins and Stretch Goals + Seeking Promotional Help on Your Favorite Platforms!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers and Friends!
Here we are at Update #2 with three weeks left in the campaign. I don't want to bombard you guys with updates, so I'm trying to space them out and wait until I've got a bunch of things to talk about at once. 
First and foremost: Thank you to all of the new backers that have come on since my last update, and thank you again to everyone who's been here from the jump! There are 765 of you now who've put over $64,000 into the campaign– I don't even know how to comprehend those numbers, my mind is just blown. Every single pledge matters and I can't thank you enough for making this merch line possible.

campaign.story:
What Is It? 
Hitting the streets of Manchester and bashing back against the haters
 Glitter Vipers is the 60 page story of Manchester drag queen Bi Phallicia and her friends who find themselves victims of an awful hate crime and decide that they are going to fight back. So they strap up, hit the streets and are ready to fight back against bigotry with a sequin baseball bat and some bad ass righteous fury! 
The fabulous Bi Phallicia
Follow the most fabulous street gang in the world as they patrol the Gay Village, step up to bigoted politicians and bash down the bashers. And in the midst of it all, they discover there's a conspiracy behind it all!
They're sick of being seen as victims! Sick of having crimes against them ignored! The Glitter Vipers are here to fight back!
The story is a brisk 60 pages, with a few behind the scenes extras thrown in too to give you a great little package in a glitter grindhouse revenge fantasy!
The gang's all here! Art by Katie Fleming
Who Are the Glitter Vipers?
 Bi Phallicia  - Bi Phallicia, real name Jason Filson, is a Manchester drag queen of some repute, who as well as her weekly shows runs a support group for those that have been victims of abuse, bigotry or hate crimes. Unfortunately, she finds herself becoming not just the organiser but also one of the members. She takes on the lead in the Glitter Vipers gang when they decide to fight back. 
Jesus Moretti - Jesus is a Colombian immigrant living in Manchester, UK and close friends with Bi and her group. He's dating Anton Bakunin. He's a broader, tougher looking man who came to the UK to live a more open and free life as a gay man. 
Anton Bakunin - Anton had a rough upbringing, finding it a lot harder to hide who he is as a gay man. An Eastern European immigrant who fled his home where being gay can result in being 'vanished', Anton came to the UK to try and find peace. Unfortunately, homophobia isn't just something that happens 'somewhere else'. 
Melissa 'Mel' Carter - Mel is a garage worker in Manchester, and is dating Bri. They are attendees of the support group after the pair were attacked by homophobes on a tram.  Mel is very tough, and has been harbouring a lot of anger over the surprise attack they suffered, and is eager to make sure nothing like it ever happens again.
 Bryony 'Bri' Stonehouse - Manchester born and bred, Bri has been dating Mel for nearly two years now. She also felt more anger than anything else after they were attacked, but she abhors violence entirely. Instead, Bri uses her smarts and community spirit to build the community support group stronger than ever before. 
Callum 'Cal' Wilkes - Cal came out much later in life, as his life in a biker gang didn't feel like the safest place to be openly gay. In fact, it turned out he was right when he did get outed to his gang and he wound up kicked out and alone. Struggling at first to find his tribe after this rejection, Cal is now a regular of Manchester's leather scene and brings his gruff, take-no-guff attitude to the local queer community. 
Queenie Iwobi - Queenie is a trans woman from a Nigerian family, she moved from her home in London to Manchester for council work years ago. Now, she takes part in the support group as a way of managing the daily micro-aggressions she faces as a proud trans WOC in this world, and to help support others like her. Also not a fan of violence, she joins Bri at the homebase, creating a helpful, safe space for the community and using her skills as a community support worker. 
Albert 'Alby' Prince - a 16 year old trans masc kid, Alby has been sneaking out to the gay scene for a while to find a safe space to be their authentic self, away from their home where they are not out. Alby became a big fan of Bi's shows, and Bi took them under her wing so she could make sure Alby was having a safe experience. Alby prefers he/him or they/them pronouns, but is not yet out to their family.
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Content Warning
We are aware that the topic of hate crimes, bigotry and assault are sensitive topics, that we as a queer community often face far too often. Sensitive to this, the book will contain content warnings so that readers can be aware going in what to expect. 
We are also aware that it can be annoying to be seen as just the victims all the time. And while there can be a lot of emotions that are discussed after these kind of things, one emotion is often overlooked or swept-under-the-rug: anger. 
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Sometimes when we see these things happen, or when they happen to us, there can be a strong sense of justified anger, and we look at that through the medium of revenge fantasy grindhouse action and explore what sense of resolution or satisfaction can be found there. 
All the while telling an entertaining, thoughtful action story in a very modern world. We'll have fun, but won't be making fun. 
Who's It For?
Have you ever seen the news and just felt so angry? Then you, for sure. 
But seriously, I think anyone who has felt that kind of strong reaction to things that happen in the world, whether it be a story of injustice they've seen in the news, or an article of a hate-fuelled attack, or worse, have had personal experience with that; I think anyone who relates to that will find something to relate to in Glitter Vipers. 
Queenie Iwobi by Katie Fleming
Anyone who has stood up to or is aware of organised hate, systemic violence and bigotry in this world can maybe find something in Glitter Vipers that speaks to them. We've all felt angry: this is about our right to that rage, and finding an outlet for it.
We all get told that we should not let that anger rise, that we don't have the right to our anger or how lashing out is wrong, but see the same things happen again and again. Glitter Vipers will explore that anger, it's justification and how it too can have a role in recovery, for good or ill.
Generally suitable for teens aged 16 years of age or older, the book has some light use of course language, violence, and as mentioned, sensitive topics around bigotry, hate crimes and assault. If you are buying for someone else, please do bare that in mind. 
Cover by James Gifford
Who's Making It?
One thing that we wanted to achieve with this book was the keep the whole creative team as queer identifying people. It's an LGBTQIA+ focused story, so it only felt right to have it be made by LGBTQIA+ people. 
The team is as follows:-
Joe Glass - Writer
 Joe Glass - Joe is the writer and co-creator of popular LGBTQ+ superhero adventure series, The Pride, now a successful ComiXology Originals series. He's also the writer of Acceptable Losses, a mature, political thriller with a dark edge. Most recently, he's worked with RuPaul's Drag Race star Manila Luzon on a countdown Instagram comic for her single, Robbed! Joe lives in South Wales with his family, and a petulant cat named Oliver. You can find his website here. 
Katie Fleming - Art
 Katie Fleming - Katie Fleming is a queer artist from Dublin, Ireland.  She began creating comics with her Partner with their LGBTQ+ comic '100 Times' and '100 More Times'.  since then she's worked on numerous anthologies and comics, such as 'Heart of Steal', 'The Black Rubric' and the webcomic, 'Ship Wrecked'. Glitter Vipers is her first graphic novel and she's super excited. When she's not making comics she's spending her time as a Werewolf. Her work can be found here. 
 Kelly Fitzpatrick - Kelly Fitzpatrick is known for her work on books such as: Bitch Planet, Supergirl: Being Super, Wonder Woman: Tempest Tossed, Shade the Changing Girl, DC: Bombshells, Archie, and Josie and the Pussycats. Nominated for the esteemed Hugo awards, she is also a past nominee for Autostraddle, Ghastly & Prism awards and has worked on titles nominated for the GLAAD and the Harvey awards. Her client list is available on her website and includes such prestigious publishers as DC Comics, Archie Comics & Dark Horse Comics. 
Lucas Gattoni - Letters
 Lucas Gattoni - Lucas Gattoni is a seasoned graphic designer and typesetter now pursuing his dream job of comic book lettering. He has lettered GLAAD nominated Liebestrasse for ComiXology Originals, Twin Worlds for Action Lab, Eskimo Kisses for Scout Comics and is currently lettering the Spanish version of Sonic The Hedgehog for IDW. He lives in his home country of Argentina with his husband and their three unnamed goldfish (oops, make that two now). His website is here.
Ted Brandt - Editor
 Ted Brandt - Ted Brandt is best known as an inker, working with his partner Ro on the Eisner- and GLAAD-nominated CROWDED from Image Comics. He likes long walks on the beach, and eating too much pizza. Ted is using his editorial hat on Glitter Vipers to help make the book the best it can be. 
James Gifford - Cover Artist
 James Gifford - James Gifford is a cis gay illustrator and storyboard artist who lives in London. He's a wayward pirate, plundering whatever illustration jobs he runs ashore on, never resting in one spot for long. A lone creative, a side-spitting gunslinger. The moment you think you have him pinned, he slips through your fingers like smoke. He's earned coin from Cartoon Network and Marvel comics and is currently creating content for Dungeons and Dragons in his spare time. You'll chip your teeth on his tough exterior, but deep down his heart is gold. His website is here. 
Spire Eaton - Spire is a graphic designer, artist, animator and comic creator based in Florida. He designed the Glitter Vipers logo for the book. That fabulousness is all down to him! You can check out his work here.
How Far Along Is It?
At time of launching the campaign, the book is entirely written, final inks are done for about roughly 20% of the book, with a further dozen pages ahead prepped too, and colours and cover work is starting in conjunction as the rest of the pages are drawn.
Alby Prince by Katie Fleming
We estimate that by the end of the campaign the book will be half way or more complete, and have allowed a roomy space of months between campaign end and delivery in an effort to ensure prompt delivery of the finished product. 
By following and/or backing the campaign, we will keep you updated with new pages and art as they happen, so you'll be the first to see more as it comes!
 How is the Money Spent?
A Breakdown of How the Goal Amount is Split
The majority of the goal amount is to pay for the art production of Glitter Vipers: this includes the drawing/inking, the colours and the design elements of putting the book together. 
The next biggest elements are the printing costs (currently based on a modest-to-large print run) and the shipping costs of sending copies out to those who back for physical reward tiers. Costs of shipping have been worked out based on impending Royal Mail price changes taking effect on July 1st 2020. Due to COVID-19 and changes in legislation for USPS in America, international shipping will be rising significantly, but we are baring this in mind in the planned goal amount and postage prices. 
The smallest element is to go on extra rewards elements, like the stickers. 
As such, the greatest overall chunk of the the goal amount we are asking for is to cover the production cost and to make sure our art team get a good, speedy payment for their hard work. 
Sample colours by Kelly Fitzpatrick
What Can I Get?
Well, naturally we are looking to provide both digital and print options of the book as reward tiers. In this day and age, there's no excuse to not offer both options to backers, so both will be readily available. 
There is also a tier to get multiple copies of the book, at a discounted price! This is primarily for comic stores that would like to support and stock the book, but also libraries and heck, if a group of friends all want to support but are on a budget, or you think you know a group of friends or family who'd all be interested in a copy, you can back at that level to get multiple copies at discount. This level is limited.  
There are options to get signed copies of the book, signed by writer Joe Glass, but again these are limited due to the time and energy taken in signing a lot of books can take.
We also have Glitter Vipers stickers available, so you can grab reward tiers with those included. 
Sample of the Embroidered Patch
Or, why not grab an embroidered Glitter Vipers patch! This is a very limited reward tier, so once it's gone, it's gone. Get it while you can! 
Plus, there's just the positive energy of knowing you've supported a great, queer focused comic project by queer creators, and that's worth everything, right! 
Finally, we have been sure to include the price of postage so when you back, you'll know exactly how much it will be in total. We've based the postage prices on the updated Royal Mail pricing coming into effect on July 1st, 2020, based on the planned sizing of the book and estimated weight.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sometimes life gets in the way, and unforeseen obstacles pop up causing a delay in getting the products shipped in time. In this campaign, we have estimated a lot of time for completion and printing, so all things being equal there shouldn't be a delay to the books going out, but as ever, it is an estimate. 

Likewise, as far as postage goes, we have sourced good, strong, tough packaging that should withstand any handling from delivery services. Similarly, we have taken into account the new postal rates for sending to the United States from the UK, and have priced accordingly. This does mean International postage costs are higher, but with the changes in USPS and increases in general post costs due to COVID-19, it is worked out to be as fair and cheap as possible, while still maintaining a relatively speedy and well-handled delivery. 

The biggest challenge is the goal amount: while it can seem large, the goal is what it is to allow for making sure the team are all paid fairly for the books production, the printing of a good sized print run and shipping. The biggest help to overcome this challenge is to share and spread the word of the campaign, so for all of you deciding to support, we hope you can help us in spreading the word too.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

At this tier, Joe Glass will work as an editor on your (up to) 22 page comic project. He'll do script reads, look for spelling and grammar errors, make suggestions and provide an outside insight for your project. You will still be in charge of creating your project and working with collaborators, but Joe will provide editorial assistance to help give you another set of eyes and feedback to build it.
You'll also get a signed copy of the book, a digital copy, sticker and embroidered patch too!

If not, he'll request you alter your chosen pledge/reward to free it up for others. The agreed upon project is what will be worked on at the end, unless mututally agreed upon to change.

updates.update_content: Hey gang!

Hey gang, 
So here's something to tease you all about the next big comic book project from me; coming in 2021, prepare for The Miracles!

Hey gang!
The book has just arrived from the printers! Huzzah!
I’m going to immediately start working on shipping these out to folks, so start keeping an eye out for Glitter Vipers fabulousness now!
If you need to update your address, please make sure you do so now!

Hey gang, 
So Glitter Vipers is fast-approaching completion, so I imagine digital editions will be very soon. We'll be sending to the printers around the same time, and I'm going to try and tie-in some time off from the day job (I'm a key worker, so I am working during the lockdown restrictions here in Wales) so I can focus on packing and shipping the physical rewards as quickly as possible. It's looking good for that to be happening end of October, start of November, so Glitter Vipers will be bringing the Gay Rage to keep you warm as the nights get cooler.

campaign.story:
Welcome to THE ADEPT Kickstarter campaign. We are grateful to walk this path with you.
THE ADEPT is a new comic book series written by Tasha Huo and Charlie Stickney from an original story by Peter Shiao and featuring artwork and colors from Yishan Li and letters from Gabriela Downie. The 42-page first issue tells the deep and personal story of a young woman who begins a journey to become the adept to an ancient martial tradition which has been lost to the ages. It is a story of action, transformation and mystery, but at its core it is about homecoming. And what’s homecoming without a chance for redemption?  And you know what ALWAYS comes with redemption…?
KUNG-FU - ok not always. But ours does! 
We couldn’t be more excited to kick off this limited series, the first in the Immortal interconnected Wuxia content universe.
It might sound unfamiliar, but Wuxia has influenced contemporary pop culture's most impactful stories from Crouching Tiger to The Matrix to Star Wars.  Wuxia is a fantasy genre of romanticism and poeticism from the East. It is the realm of the outsider, the wandering hero, who is compelled by circumstance to stand against injustice and champion the common person.
Welcome to... 
THE ADEPT is about Amy, a young Chinese-American who runs away from an abusive home, destined to be another orphan street thug. 
But then she is visited in her dreams by a Shaolin Kung Fu Master, who begins to train her in the wilds of this Dreamscape, preparing her to face an unnamed evil that he'll never speak about.  The dreams give her meaning – purpose – the training empowers her – and she learns to cope.  But why her?  
Then, with no warning, the dreams just stop. And just as suddenly as he came into her life, he's gone.  Was he just a figment of her imagination?
It’s now been ten years and Amy comes home again, hoping to rekindle the relationship with Ali, the younger sister she once abandoned. Ali has had her own trauma and pain in that time, but she covers it up with a carefree, carpe-diem attitude.  If you don't think about your pain, did it ever really happen? 
Amy scores tickets too a benefit concert for Ali's favorite singer - Sasha True. An international sensation, famous for catchy lyrics, flashy dance moves and a beat with a killer hook.  (Sasha is more than what she seems, and when the going gets tough her "true" colors will be revealed)   
What could possibly derail the reunion of the estranged sisterhood?
Bad guys. When a kidnapping attempt targets Sasha, Amy has no choice but to break out her Shaolin skill learned from her dreams.  But this is no amateur kidnapping, it's a well-organized attack from a shadowy operation. 
And then, among the commotion…a surprise. She comes face to face with the Shaolin Master from her dreams. Wu-what indeed.
We can’t wait to introduce you to Amy, Ali, Fa Sheng, and Sasha and we’ve got much to unpack over this series. Where has Amy been? Why did the dreams choose her? What is this shadowy organization and how is it connected to the Shaolin Master? And hold up, the Shaolin Master is real?  
Standard Cover by Adept #1 Artist Yishan Li
THE ADEPT is the first project from Immortal Studios, a new comic-first content studio.  We are creating an interconnected universe of modern and elevated Wuxia stories. Ours are stories of transformation, a content ethos built on empowerment, self-discovery, and connection with the world around us. We are setting these stories in today's world - full of diversity, modern concerns, and reflective of the moment. Our “superhero” stories are guided by one core principle: in each of us is a hero of our own choosing.  Let's Awaken the Hero in Everyone. 
It’s fitting that our ambitions get, well, kicked off with a Shaolin story. Shaolin is the birthplace of kung fu as we know it today and really grounds us within this world where physical combat and spiritual enlightenment are one in the same. This is what makes it different from mixed martial arts, boxing, or a street fight. 
It is a 1500 year old tradition that has been carried right into modern day as the source of contemporary pop culture fascination with martial arts – from Bruce Lee to the Last Airbender. We are excited to be adding to that tradition with our own take that really goes to the transformational roots of this legacy.
What we hope will really set this series apart is the attention to the authenticity of Shaolin forms depicted in our panels.  To recreate the intricacy of the forms, we learned from Gene Ching, a 32nd generation layman disciple of the Shaolin Temple and master of martial arts, who worked with Conor Hughes to meticulously plot and layout the action sequences. 
We are proud to present here fourteen pages of Adept #1.  These pages are the result of a lot of life experience, hard work, and collaboration from a talented bevy of artists and teammates, old friends and new friends, and now hopefully you - our community.
Um, do you want to be a rockstar?
We’ve got some awesome things lined up. Variant covers from two amazing guest artists, collector’s items, and…you know whenever you’re like ready to be world famous we hear there are some openings in Sasha True’s Band.
First, the variant covers...
THE KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE is brought to you by the imaginative hand of guest artist Zi Xu.  We love this perspective from the baddies as they charge Amy and Fasheng, poised in their martial stances.  And with that look in their eyes, I think I'd sit this one out.  Zi Xu is an illustrator, concept artist, and matte painter who has worked in film, advertising, and games.  Check out more of her work at https://www.zixu.co/ 
The Adept Kickstarter Variant Cover by Zi Xu
Our 2nd Variant hails from a little town called White Ash.  We were gobsmacked by the work Sam Beck did on White Ash #5 that we didn't think we could pull her over to our corner of the universe.  And oh, does she have a doozy of a concept for you.  Starts with a DIE and ends with a HARD.  The cover is still in the works, but you can see that aforementioned White Ash cover below.  Check out more of Sam's work right here - https://sambeck.ca/ 
Variant Cover by Sam Beck
In addition to these hot variants, we've cooked up a few other tricks to pull you into the world of The Adept. 
 All of our backers receiving physical rewards will receive a commemorative Sasha True Benefit Concert ticket, the most exclusive ticket in town and a major setpiece featured in Issue #1. For the first 100 print backers, the ticket will be signed by one of our creatives.  And...who knows...what’s a ticket if it can’t eventually get you into something… 
Yeah, essentially our bat signal.  This collectible pin of the Immortal logo is molded in hard enamel and will be at least 7/8th inches long.  Wear it proudly.  Who knows,  if we ever cross paths and you’re wearing your pin and we're wearing ours…well what a meeting that could be. Each pin comes with a laser etched number.  Someone out there is getting #1.
We are super proud of this set of Adept Trading Cards featuring authentic Shaolin forms. We have tried really hard to make Shaolin tangible, meticulously researching and integrating real forms into the pages of our issues. This set of three cards will feature authentic Shaolin forms that are featured in Issue #1. On the front of the card is the move in its dynamic form from actual panel art. On the back will be a step-by-step progression of the form and a introduction to the history and significance. We hope we can convey the intricacy and history of this ancient martial art. New trading cards will be issued with each issue. Collect them all.
Would you like a piece of original art?  Yishan Li will create by hand a 6x9 fully colored and inked exclusive just for you.  Choose from one of your new Adept friends - Amy, Ali, Fa Sheng, or Sasha.  Want to see yourself in art?  No problem.  Want Yishan to do a character from ANOTHER universe?  We won't feel too hurt.  Speaking of Yishan...
The Sasha True Benefit Concert Package.  This is essentially our everything package. You get the book, you get the variants, and the pin and the trading cards. But also some exclusive items. We're making a poster and a t-shirt out of this fabulous depiction of Sasha by Yishan.  It’ll feel just like you spent a sweaty night at a Sasha True concert...minus the kidnapping attempt from a nefarious global organization...spoiler alert.  We’re only printing a limited number of posters and t-shirts and we have very big plans for Sasha, so let these items prove you were on the Sasha train from the beginning. 
 Well, there is only one other way you can get closer to Sasha. Join the band. In this most exclusive of packages, we will draw your face on one of the band members for Sasha True. You got to be ok with us taking a bit of a pop rock interpretation of you, but we promise that you'll be recognizable to all the Sasha fans in your life. What’s more Sasha and her band are in line to play quite a roll throughout the Adept series, and there you’ll be for the full of it.  We apologize in advance: music agents can be quite the annoyance.
Our final last most exclusive can't get it anywhere else premium-est reward.  We'll gather together Peter and Charlie and (schedules permitting) any of the other creatives for a video conference chat about the making of Adept #1.  You will have unfettered access to the creative minds behind the story as we go page-by-page through the issue reminiscing about the inspirations, choices, and kung fu that went into making The Adept.  Learn how the team translated the intricacy of Shaolin form to comic panels.  Hear about the beginning of Immortal Studios and the future of the martial arts storyverse.  Have your own questions about the biz?  Launching your own project?  We're happy to share our experience and advice.  
We are so grateful for this all-star lineup of incredibly talented creatives who have brought this project to life.  Allow me to gush.  (Starting with Conor Hughes, who did these sweet portraits) 
 You might know Charlie Stickney from White Ash, the astoundingly successful independent comic book that started right here on Kickstarter (prob with the help of many of you). He is a writer/producer residing in Los Angeles who’s been fortunate enough to work for companies including: Sony Pictures, Revolution Studios, Universal Pictures, Hulu and Scholastic Productions. He’s developed and created animated shows like Cosmic Quantum Ray and Horrible Histories. While in college, Charlie interned in the editorial offices at Marvel. 
 This was Tasha Huo's first big dance in the comic book world, and boy did she learn the steps and teach us some as well.  Tasha was an assistant at Universal when her spec script DARKNESS was chosen as the first project for a Warner Bros / Black List partnership.  Tasha has written for EuropaCorp, Gaumont, and Ubisoft where she adapted CHILD OF LIGHT for television.  And ooooh, if I could just utter one little word about her next movie project...  
 If someone can explain how we were able to pull Yishan Li, please end the mystery - email contact@immortal-studios.com We're bowled over by this match of style and content.  As you can see, this entire page is a paean to her style and finesse and you haven't even seen the issue-ending boss sequence.  She has worked for DC and Dark Horse (something called Duffy or maybe Buffy the Vampire Slayer, perhaps you've heard of it).  She also wields the creator pen, having summoned Sugar  for Top Cow and Paradox Girls for Image. 
 Peter's vision infuses everything we do.  Peter Shiao is Founder and CEO of Immortal Studios and career-long innovator in entertainment and media ventures between East and West.  Peter spent his childhood reading Chinese Wuxia novels and took to core those transcendent martial knights.  Steeped in the sphere of politics, Peter pivoted to a new career in media as a means of expressing his mission for social transformation through stories.  He founded and built the US-China Film Summit, founded the first Hollywood-China investment fund, and produced the first US-China film co-production.  He was chosen by the Shaolin Temple to be their brand builder and has worked with Shaolin on content development.  His original idea was developed into The Adept.
Immortal is committed to authentic depiction of Shaolin, and Gene Ching brings the authenticity.  He is a 32nd generation layman disciple of the original Shaolin Temple.  He was the publisher of Kung Fu Tai Chi, the largest newstand magazine devoted to Chinese martial arts until it ceased printing.  He is also a military Provost master at Fencing and the author of Shaolin Trips. Gene served as a weapons expert for the TV show Man at Arms: Art of War, appearing alongside Danny Trejo and Robert Rodriguez.
 Another steal from the town of White Ash, Conor Hughes translated the intricacy of Gene's choreography into layouts for the martial.  Conor's breakout work has been the popular Kickstarter comic White Ash. Previous to that he was one of the winners of the Millarworld art contest as well as being published in the Anthology Graphic Canon and Twisted Savage Dragon Funnies.
You can troll him on twitch at twitch.tv/conorhughes where he can often be found making comics as well as a home in Hopewell NJ, with his amazing wife and giggle monster baby girl.
Our letterer, Gabriela Downie, was born and raised in Los Angeles, daughter to Central American immigrants, and is at the helm of diversity and inclusion in the comic book industry. Her skills range from print production, digital illustration, world-buidling development, writing, graphic design and lettering. There’s not a component in comic book crafting she hasn’t tackled. Her name can be seen on the shelves of every comic book store, and even listed on the New York Time’s Best in Comics. Her goal is to spread the message of love, forgiveness and inclusion, for all artists, of every color, background, age or gender.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Well, what a moment we’re in. Certainly when we started this journey, we had no inkling of what would hit us all by March. And while on the day of this writing, life begins to nudge towards normalcy, it is uncertain what the future brings. We urge all of our family – artist and vendors and you readers – to return to your own normal at your own pace. That being said, we have some really dedicated people behind us who want to see this thing breathe as much as we do. We will continue to monitor the situation and will communicate at every step of the way.

Of course this is our first Kickstarter. And though we are learning a bit as we go, we couldn’t have a better Kung Fu Master in Charlie. This will be Mr. Stickney’s eighth Kickstarter campaign and he has been an absolute champion in teaching us all the moves. (But any mistakes are ours alone!)
The script is finished because Tasha is a PRO and Yishan is already well into the art. We’ve got our rewards vendors lined up and Charlie has walked us straight into some of the most reliable printers in the biz.

Whatever goes down, we’ll keep you informed. We overcommunicate (honestly, how long have we been scrolling here?). We are available to answer questions and concerns. We want you to be with us for the long haul. We feel so strongly about what we can create together and we are poised to do what we can to earn and keep your loyalty. Really, we just see this as the beginning of loooong relationship. And, goodness, if you’re still paying attention, maybe…could it be…mutual?!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Would you consider being an owner of Immortal?
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
In this forum, we've been largely quiet about our funding campaign that is happening over on Wefunder because we have not wanted to take away from the main focus on the books - both The Adept and Chronicles of the Immortal Swordsmen.
But with the campaign closing on June 30th, we wanted to throw a little awareness its way.  Wefunder is a non-profit that allows individuals to invest in startups under Regulation Crowdfunding laws, where recently they could not.
If you are interested in our work and want to support our expansion, we'd love to welcome you as partial owner!  Not only would you be a shareholder, but certain tiers will grant you free copies of all of our titles - even future titles!  The minimum amount that Wefunder allows is $100, so it is not for everyone, but it is as good a company crowdfund platform as we have seen.

Over the past several weeks, we have been busy putting together our effort to support AAPI Heritage Month.  Tomorrow we are hosting a one-day event Amplifying AAPI Representation in Entertainment & Media.  We will be joined by Crazy Rich Asians director Jon Chu and Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D actress Chloe Bennet among many other prominent AAPI creators, artists, industry leaders, elected officials, tech innovators, journalists and more.
Within the day-long program, we have slotted an hour discussion specifically about what we are doing at Immortal Studios to push forward the cause of representation.  We're packing it with a slew of Immortal talent including co-writers and and artist .  They will be chatting Issue #2 and where we are going with the story!

updates.update_userinfo: Get a signed copy - 1 hour to go!
updates.update_content:
We just crossed 700 backers at the Immortal Swordsmen campaign!

There is just ONE HOUR remaining to get your signed and numbered copy as previous backers of The Adept.  To do so, please sign up here and then back a physical tier of Immortal Swordsmen.

If you haven't yet, get on over to Immortal Swordsmen and consider backing that campaign.  We are down to the fiiiinal day.  Variant covers by Javi Fernandez (Spawn) and Bernard Chang (Superman, X-Men, Cable).  An exclusive Bernard Chang poster.  And of course - get yourself drawn into the Immortal Storyverse with our Draw-Me-In Tier.
Check it out here!
Thank you.

updates.update_userinfo: Two Days Left over on Immortal Swordsmen
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday all!
There are just two days remaining over on our Immortal Swordsmen campaign.  We are pushing to our $30K stretch goal which will unlock the Charlie Stickney-Yishan Li Adept crossover ministory.  We also still have a few of our exclusive covers left as well as our uber-tier - a chance to sit in with the Immortal comics advisory.
We have been so encouraged by our returning backers and the new ones - some of whom are also picking up copies of The Adept.  Remember, we have an exclusive offer for returning backers to receive signed copies of Immortal Swordsmen.  Check that offer out and then come back to pledge.  We welcome you deeper into this martial arts fantasy universe and look forward to meeting our commitment of delivering a great book to you.  Help us finish strong!

updates.update_userinfo: You're Invited - Hang out with Kickstarter creators
updates.update_content: We are thrilled to be amongst a group of legend Kickstarter creators hanging out with also-legend Wizard World.  We're doing a virtual campaign swap with free giveaways and a very exclusive offer - more on that below.  But first, check out this group:

We're up to 400 backers over on Chronicles!  And we just dropped our new Javier Fernandez cover (below).
But I mainly want to remind you of our Adept/Chronicles signed cover offer.  Since you participated in a physical tier of Immortal Swordsmen, we will sign your physical copy of Immortal Swordsmen.  To get started,  please click here

updates.update_userinfo: The Adept / Immortal Swordsmen Mini Story
updates.update_content:
Over on our Immortal Swordsmen campaign, we just announced our stretch goals INCLUDING (!!) a The Adept / Immortal Swordsmen crossover mini story.  If we can break $30K over there, we'll dust off (but he's already shiny) Charlie Stickney to put the writing to it and bring back Yishan Li for the art. 
We're super excited to give you a taste of how these two books can crossover.
If you haven't already supported, please jump over there and see if it piques your interest.  The campaign is off to a great start with many of you already supporting.  As always, thank you!

updates.update_userinfo: Immortal Swordsmen Funded! Final Hours for Early-Bird Deals
updates.update_content:
We had a great first day over on our campaign for Chronicles of the Immortal Swordsmen.  Not only did we meet our funding goal, but we also received the "Projects We Love" tag from Kickstarter.  
Thanks to the many of you who joined that campaign, but also and if you haven't, you're also to thank because it all started here with The Adept.
If you haven't, please come over and support Immortal Swordsmen - there's only a few more hours left for our Early Bird deals and we have some great variant covers from the likes of Bernard Chang ( ) and Javier Fernandez (  And of course the work of lead artist Gabe Sapienza.

campaign.story:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Cover for MAYBE SOMEDAY
MAYBE SOMEDAY: STORIES OF PROMISE, VISIONS OF HOPE is a full-color anthology featuring over 25 inspiring stories about a brighter future. It is also the sequel to the New York Times featured and Ringo Award Nominated anthology, ALL WE EVER WANTED.
Like its predecessor, MAYBE SOMEDAY features stories full of hope. Instead of focusing on dystopian fiction, these stories help show the path forward to a better world. It is edited by Matt Miner, Eric Palicki & Tyler Chin-Tanner and published by A Wave Blue World.
Cover art by Max Dunbar with colors by Espen Grundetjern. Logo and cover design by Tim Daniel.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Anthologies can be tricky to put together because of all the creators involved, but we're seasoned veterans by now. This is our 6th anthology and the 3rd working directly with Matt Miner & Eric Palicki. Not to mention we've already gotten a head start: all the scripts in hand and the artwork for every story is underway, if not already completed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: NEW ANTHOLOGY! Dead Beats 2 now on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Thank you so much for backing MAYBE SOMEDAY. If you've enjoyed our anthologies, we've got a new one funding on Kickstarter right now!
DEAD BEATS 2: LONDON CALLING is the sequel to the original Ringo-Award nominated Dead Beats we published a couple of years ago. This one promises to be just as much fun and it's filled with amazing creators. I'd go on more about it, but you can find all the information on the campaign page, so head on over: bit.ly/DeadBeats2

Hello everyone,
Hope you've all had a pleasant start to 2021 and enjoyed reading Maybe Someday.
Wanted to let you know that nominations have opened for the 2021 Ringo Awards.
It's open to both fans and pros alike, so spread the word and go nominate some of your favorite creators and projects from 2020.

Hi Everyone,
Just a quick note before the weekend to let you know that we've been working hard to mail out everyone's rewards. It takes a while to get through them all, so I thank you for your patience. It's been extra challenging with the pandemic and the issues with the post office.
Most everything will be shipped by the end of November, which was my goal. The only rewards that will be remaining by then will be international and the signed bookplates. Those have been making the rounds with the creators and should be back to me soon.

Well, at least that's a wrap on the campaign. We still get to go make the book, which is the fun part!
A huge thanks to all of you for supporting the campaign. I promise you won't be disappointed with the final result. This will be our best anthology yet and we'll keep you updated along the way.
And if you're looking for another active Kickstarter campaign to fill that void now that Maybe Someday is done, may I recommend a great looking project by one of our contributors, Joe Glass.

campaign.story:
Aeonian: A Brief Synopsis  
Standard cover, Art by Stan Yak and colors by Robert Nugent
Aeonian is an ongoing series following a family that has found a way to extend life. They have become jaded after decades of this and due to the rules they must follow to keep their longer lifespan. We join them as they begin to unravel and push forward with a plan that they believe will allow them to live forever, free from any constraints. The key to it all is hidden in their basement...can they unlock eternal life before it's too late?

Aeonian 3 picks up where issue 2 left off. After learning the struggle the family is going through and their wish to live forever by any means necessary, we dive deeper into the dynamics that drive the children and the parents' relationship. Betrayals and plans unfold in this issue of Aeonian, as well as more background into the guest that Phillip is growing strangely close to. 
Does blood really bond them together, or is it more likely to tear them apart? Find out more in this issue of the time spanning horror drama Aeonian 3. 
This campaign is to get funds to print issue 3 as well as fund issue 4, the last in the series arc. All funds go into the project. 
NEWS
Since our last campaign I was extremely lucky to have many of my books, including Aeonian, picked up by Rocket Ink Studios. To find some of my other work and some really amazing creators, please check them out HERE.  
Lettered original cover
 Let's take a look at the art, shall we? 
Page 1
Page 3
Page 11, dream sequence
Page 16
REWARDS
There are many cool rewards to choose from, including these below!

Lettered Variant Cover
Enamel Pin designed by Misty Bondy
STRETCH GOALS!!
There are plans for the first three stretch goals! Here is the first one:
1. A bonus story in the comic written by Stefani Manard when we hit 3k!
2.  UNLOCKED AT 4K



CREATOR
Stefani Manard is a writer and editor from Detroit,  Michigan. She works in prose and comics,  and has had works published by Behemoth, Source Point Press, and Rocket Ink Studios, as well as publishing under her own company, Scapegoat Press.  She has also worked in blogging and podcasting in support of independent artists for many years with the Podcast Detroit network and beyond. When she isn't writing she can be found at local dives around the city or lazing about with her rottweilers.
For more information, please go to www.stefanimanard.com
Visit www.podcastdetroit.com to listen to her shows on the network: 
The Way Station, Shot of History, 15 Minutes of Maim, and Another Page Turner

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out Aeonian 3 on Kickstarter. I really enjoy writing this series and have you to thank for your continued support! I plan on writing several more arcs in this world and I'm so glad to have you along for the ride.

updates.update_userinfo: All Rewards Going To Post Office Today
updates.update_content:
Good morning!
I've spent the last 2 days prepping all rewards to go out and I am glad to say that I am finally finished! The last stop is lugging all these boxes to the post office, which I will be doing this afternoon. I do hope that these reach you in a timely manner and that they arrive intact. I used Gemini boxes and taped them well so there should be no issues, but if anything does arise please let me know and I will be glad to resend any damaged items.

Good morning! Just wanted to update you and let you know the stickers are set to be here Thursday and I will start mailing rewards out on Friday. There are still a few backers that need to fill out their surveys, so be sure to have those in by Thursday if you can. 
Those of you that have the Flash Fiction tier will receive your physical rewards first and when I complete your story I will email that directly to you. 
Again, thank you for all of your support for Aeonian. This series is just getting started and I look forward to completing this arc and bringing you more horrifying goodness in the years to come :)

Happy Friday, all! 
I'm waiting on UPS to deliver the metallic covers as we speak, and my other printer has emailed me to let me know I can pick up all the other covers on Monday! I'm only waiting on the stickers to arrive at this point so hopefully I can start shipping next week. Be safe and have a great weekend :) 
Much Love,

Good morning!
I just emailed all the digital backers their rewards. Please let me know if you haven't received them or if you have any trouble downloading them so that I can fix it right away for you. 
I am including the link with a digital copy of Aeonian 3 and the 5 bonus comics here for every backer, so please be sure to check it out if you are interested and check out the PDF of Aeonian 3 while waiting for your hard copy.

updates.update_userinfo: Backer surveys have all been sent out!
updates.update_content:
All surveys have just been sent out so please return them as soon as possible so I can get everyone their product in a timely manner :) All orders have been placed so now I am just playing the waiting game for product to come in. 
I will update everyone when product arrives! Thank you all so much for your support and have a great day!
Much Love,

The bonus story is here and we are ready to send everything to print. I will have the pdf ready to go Friday and will get digital rewards out. 
I usually have a 2 week turnaround with my printer so I'm hoping to have product in my hand 2 weeks from this Friday. I will begin shipping as soon as I receive product. 
If there are any snags I will let you know. I'm hoping for smooth sailing :)

I hope everyone had a safe holiday weekend! I wrote the bonus story and sent it to my letteter who should have it back to me this week. I have to add this file before I send the comic to print so my hope is to have every order in by Friday. 

Thank you for your patience as we move forward into the printing phase of our project.  As soon as the story gets back to me I will also be able to deliver digital rewards to everyone who is supposed to receive them. Again, hoping for Friday for this. If that changes I will let you know asap.

We did it! In 30 days we blew our goal out of the water and unlocked 2 stretch goals.
I am incredibly thankful for all of the support everyone has shown this project. I love this story and am so glad you do too!
Funds release in 2 weeks but I'm going to be sending the printing order in before that to ensure we get these books to you asap. I will be finalizing the files and sending them to print on Friday. I will also be putting in the sticker order as well. I will keep everyone updated as product comes in so you know when I will be mailing everything out!

What an incredible month for Aeonian 3! I want to thank everyone for supporting this passion project of mine. I truly appreciate it!
I have all the packing supplies ready, the enamel pins are in, and I am writing the bonus story for the comic today so that as soon as I get a count of how many of each issue/cover I need to print I can send the order straight out! My goal is to get these mailed out within 3 weeks of the KS finishing up and I have everything set up to meet that goal.

campaign.story:
All they know is that there's something wrong in their building... and that there's no escape.
Darick Robertson cover art with colours by Tony Aviña
We've been crashing through stretch goals so now the comic is 44-pages and all backers will get free pin-ups/art prints by John McCrea, Iain Laurie and Warwick Fraser-Coombe.
We're going for our final stretch goal now, which is to add a bonus 3-page comic story to the book with art by Luke Parker, J Francis Totti and legendary Marvel Zombies, Hellblazer and Criminal artist Sean Phillips. 
Here's Craig Paton showing the kind of beautiful art you can expect in this comic
QUARANTINE is a 40-page wild sci-fi, one-shot comic with a different incredible artist every page. Including the cover that is 28 of the best artists working today all in one book. However, that's not all. This special edition prestige format version of the book will feature tonnes of wonderful making of material showing how the book came together, sharing with you many of the artists' stunning design work as they prepared their page.
Gustaffo Vargas gives good goo



Gavin Mitchell kicking the story off in style ZAP!
The Lewn family - David and Lucy, their kids Grace and Peter and Scraps the dog – look out the large window of their Ballard Apartments’ lounge. Outside a perimeter has been formed around their home that buzzes with electricity. An unseen person then informs them that 'something is wrong in the building’ and they will be temporarily quarantined in an alternate universe.
ZAP!
Characters lovingly designed by Russell Mark Olson
Next thing they know the view out of their window shows stars and planets instead of parks and swings as they drift in space. Thus begins their quarantine. 
Portraits by Chris Matthews
They are kept in their apartment by Guard-Bots that patrol the halls. All their food comes courtesy of the Goo dispenser in their kitchen (purple is tastier than blue). They can watch one channel on the TV and they have no way of contacting anyone back on Earth. Tempers flair and Peter swears he saw a giant space slug fly past his window. However, all this soon becomes the least of their problems as their bodies start to change and they become a lot closer as a family than they've ever been before... 
Benjamin Filby wants you to stay inside
Andy W Clift revels in red
We are also incredibly excited to have DARICK ROBERTSON (THE BOYS, PUNISHER:BORN, TRANSMETROPOLITAN and HAPPY) providing the cover for the book. 
 Darick is also kindly allowing us to sell his original cover art as part of the campaign.
Examples of some of Darick Robertson's previous covers - spectacular!
CREATORS' BACK CATALOGUE
Most of the creators on the comic have released numerous previous comics, a large bunch of which we're excited to be able to offer you in our CREATORS' BACK CATALOGUE reward tier. Get 22 amazing comics previously released by our wonderful creators as well as the new QUARANTINE comic for £45-50 - that works out at less than £2 per comic. 
All the back catalogue digital comics are ready and waiting, so they can be with you as soon as the funds clear to keep you going through the rest of the lockdown.
Here's a selection of what you'll get - one hell of a bargain
WHAT IS PRESTIGE FORMAT?
Prestige format is most famously associated with the original run of Frank Miller's Dark Knight Returns. It's higher quality than a standard comic with a stiffer cover and a perfect bind more or less like a trade paperback or OGN - basically, it's going to be really cool. 
Edward bentley hopes you have a lovely day
HOW DID THIS MADNESS HAPPEN?
It was a strange time. Me (Jordan) and just about everyone I know was in self isolation. The planet was in lock down. I needed something to do to keep occupied. First I grew a sweet beard. Once that was complete I spent a bit of time on Twitter and noticed that a lot of my wonderfully talented artist friends were also looking for things to do.
Rory Donald warned you about standing too close to the glass
Then it hit me. A comic where a different artist draws each page of a script. And we could get the whole thing completed during the lock down period - a comic conceived and drawn in less than two months. 
Russell Mark Olson is available for family portraits
I fired off a message to a group of these artists. Thinking they'd tell me to 'get lost - we're busy with our own super awesome projects'. But they didn't. They all said 'yes'. That's when the panic struck. I really had to make this happen. Now here we are. It's happening. I've even manged to beg, blackmail and badger many other incredible artists to be involved and they're all delivering spectacular art. 
Now we just need you to help us get it into print. 

£2,500 - GARY ERSKINE INTERIOR PAGE ADDED TO THE COMIC - UNLOCKED
Some examples of Gary Erskine's incredible work
If we hit £2,500 then a page of the story drawn by the one and only Gary Erskine (Dan Dare, Hellblazer, Sabrina The Teenage Witch) will be added to both the physical and digital versions of the comic.
 £3,000 - SHAKY KANE INTERIOR PAGE ADDED TO THE COMIC - UNLOCKED 
Some examples of Shaky Kane's amazing work
If we hit £3,000 then a page of the story drawn by the legendary Shaky Kane (Judge Dredd, Elephantmen, Image Comics' The Beef) will be added to both the physical and digital versions of the comic. 
£4,000 - IAIN LAURIE ART PRINT - UNLOCKED
If we hit £4,000 then all backers of the book will receive this beautiful art print by Iain Laurie in either physical or digital form depending on whether they backed a physical or digital tier.
£5,000 - AN ADDITIONAL 4 PAGES ADDED TO THE COMIC - UNLOCKED
If we hit £5,000 then we will extend both the physical and digital versions of the comic by 4 WHOLE PAGES. These pages will be filled with a bunch of the incredible designs and sketched created by the artists whilst making the comic, giving you even more insight into how their stunning art work came to life.
£6,000 - WARWICK FRASER-COOMBE ART PRINT - UNLOCKED
If we hit £6,000 all our backers will receive an art print by the awesome WARWICK FRASER-COOMBE commissioned especially for Quarantine in either digital or physical form depending on whether you backed a physical or digital reward tier. 
And here is the print!
The original line art by Warwick is also available to buy!
Here is the original Line Art by Warwick which is available to buy!
£7,000 - JOHN McCREA ART PRINT - UNLOCKED 
If we hit £7,000 all our backers will receive an art print by the legendary JOHN McCREA (Hitman, Judge Dredd, Superboy, Spider-Man, The Boys) commissioned especially for Quarantine in either digital or physical form depending on whether you backed a physical or digital reward tier.
John is also kindly allowing us to sell his original pin-up artwork as part of the campaign. 
£9,000 - BONUS 3 PAGE COMIC STORY W/ ART BY LUKE PARKER, J FRANCIS TOTTI & CRIMINAL AND HELLBLAZER ARTIST SEAN PHILLIPS - UNLOCKED 
If we can make £9,000 then we will add a bonus story to the book in the form of a 3-page comic. Like the main story this comic will have each page drawn by a different artist. Luke Parker (Merrick the Sensational Elephant Man),  J Francis Totti (Prey For Us, Big F#@k Off Worms) and Marvel Zombies, Hellblazer & Criminal artist Sean Phillips will be providing the art for this story.
Sean is also very kindly going to donate his original page of artwork to the campaign which you can buy now as the 'QUARANTINE WITH SEAN PHILLIPS' reward tier.
As part of the campaign we're also offering you lucky people the chance to own some of the original inked pages of art work from the comic as well as some very cool pencil art and rough sketches from the planning stage. Each artist has only done one page so this is an especially unique chance to own something special.
For the most part, we're not sharing the whole of anyone's page so if you are interested in a specific artist's original page but want to see it before purchasing, just message me directly and I can share it with you. Below you can see a few examples to understand what you will receive.
Darick Robertson's original cover artwork available to own!
Here's a section of what to expect from Gustaffo's original page
Here's a section of Russell Mark Olson's original page available to purchase
Here's what you can expect in your Packwood Pack
Here's what to expect from Clara Meath's beautiful original pencils and rough page layout
We're also very excited to have Gary Erskine selling his original page and process and character sketch pages as part of the campaign. Gary has also very generously included a signed version of his sketch book SK01 as part of these rewards. Check out the sketch book here.
That's Gary's actual hand.
Example of a page from SK01
We're also offering some cool Quarantine merchandise. As all the merch will feature art from the comic in some form or other we can't give you the finished versions currently (some is still being finished, some is just too darn spoilery) but we can promise they will look awesome and if you like the art you've already seen posted on this page then you will be thrilled with what you receive.
These will be covered in amazing art from the comic
THE ARTISTS
This amazing group of talent is why you're all here: 
Ahmed Raafat is an Egyptian artist based in the UK known for el3osba and Gorilla My Dreams. Ahmed also likes drawing naked people.
Instagram & Twitter

WRITER - JORDAN THOMAS
Here's how Jordan has mostly been spending his self isolation
Jordan has written and successfully launched all four issues of the mini-series FRANK AT HOME ON THE FARM. He really likes dogs and Old Fashoineds. When not writing comics he would ideally being drinking an Old Fashioned whilst sitting with a dog (although he has been known to combine all three).
Instagram & Twitter
LetterSquids will be providing the lettering for this project. He always delivers top work and we're very happy to have him onboard the project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the artists are already working on their pages so the comic should be completed before the end of our campaign - or very soon after.

I have the experience of delivering all four issues of the comic series FRANK AT HOME ON THE FARM so I am confident you can trust us to deliver a stunning book that exceeds your expectations.

Obviously, we are living in an uncertain time, so there is potential for delivery of the physical items to be delayed because of the ongoing Coronavirus pandemic, however we don't envision this to be a major problem as our printer is still working as normal. The digital content will arrive promptly following the completion of the campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
