updates.update_userinfo: Shaky Kane's new project The Silver Squad!
updates.update_content:
Hey Quaranteenies,
I hope everyone is doing OK.
I just wanted to drop in to let you all know about a Kickstarter campaign running currently with art by our very own SHAKY KANE!
I'm also working with Shaky on a new project currently so I know the amazing work he does very well, meaning I can greatly recommend checking out...

Hey Quaranteenies,
Happy Friday! I hope you all have nice plans for this weekend. I just got a new dog called Lucí from a shelter here in Granada so we'll be taking our first trip to a nice big park for her to play in.
In the meantime I just wanted to let you know about another cool project one of our fabulous artists has live on Kickstarter currently...

  by Craig Paton

updates.update_userinfo: FINAL 48 HOURS to back mine and Chris Matthews' comic MUGSHOTS
updates.update_content:
Hey Quaranteenies,
Just a quick one to let you know that my latest comic is into it's final 48 hours on Kickstarter. If you haven't checked out MUGSHOTS yet, it's a one-shot British crime comic about Danni, a gambling addict who ends up in debt to a London crime boss and is forced to choose between sacrificing her current love, Em, or her first love, Jamal.

updates.update_userinfo: Our Quarantine artists have been busy!
updates.update_content:
Hey Quaranteenies,
I hope you're all well. It seems that a whole bunch of the artists that worked on the comic have been busy. Sean Phillips had a little book called PULP come out and Darick is enjoying some success with a little TV series by the name of THE BOYS but I'm here to focus on Kickstarters currently running.

- Chris Matthews (and me)

updates.update_userinfo: My new comic MUGSHOTS is live!
updates.update_content:
Hey Quaranteenies,
I just wanted to drop in and let you know that my new comic Kickstarter campaign is now live. You can get your hands on mine and Chris Matthews one-shot crime comic MUGSHOTS here.

Hey Quaranteenies,
I hope you've all had a relaxing weekend. With all the rewards posted out and hopefully most of you having received them (I know that the international poster buyers may still be waiting for their rewards but they're extremely well packed and on their way, I promise) I thought it was a good time to let you know about my next comic project coming to Kickstarter.
MUGSHOTS a 32-page neo-noir, one-shot comic book will be launching on Kickstarter Tuesday at 7pm UK time.

updates.update_userinfo: Time for a lie down a.k.a everything has been posted
updates.update_content:
Evening Quaranteenies,
After many weeks of posting turmoil I can happily announce that every reward has now been posted. 
There's bee some ups and down. Finding out the boxes I'd gotten to fit both the poster tubes and comic in were indeed 'the maximum size for a small parcel' as advertised, but then receiving a call from the post office to let me know this only applied to domestic postage and the boxes were 4cms too big to class as small parcels for international postage, being the biggest set back (and the one that took me closest to crying). This led to me having to reopen and redesign the boxes with tape and a Stanley knife to avoid paying £40 postage per box - so apologies to our wonderful poster backers whose package may not be as handsome as I'd like (but hey, it's what's inside that counts, right?).

Hey Quaranteenies,
I'm mainly here to point you in the direction of a very cool new project by two of our artists, but first just a quick update that I've now posted around 75% of the rewards so hopefully lots of you have received the comic and the rest of you will have yours in the post shortly.
DARKBOY & ADLER #2

project_data.project_name: QUARANTINE. 1 Story. 28 Artists. No Escape.

campaign.story:
Chip Mosher and Peter Krause invite you to Kickstart BLACKING OUT – A Tale of Fire and Murder in Southern California presented as a Deluxe Oversized Hardcover Graphic Novel.
BLACKING OUT follows a drunk ex-cop looking for redemption as he attempts to solve a murder during the Southern California fire season. 
(Case wrap with Tom Muller logo & art direction and art by Peter Krause)
Comics industry veteran and writer Chip Mosher and legendary artist Peter Krause (The Power of Shazam!, Irredeemable) present BLACKING OUT, a 56-page graphic novel presented in a deluxe oversized hardcover in the European album tradition. BLACKING OUT also showcases the amazing talents of colorist Giulia Brusco (Scalped, Django Unchained), letterer Ed Dukeshire (Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers), and designer Tom Muller (X-Men) .
 Kickstarter rewards include a print Lobby Card set from acclaimed artists Francesco Francavilla, Eduardo Risso, Jamal Igle, Emma Ríos, Mirka Andolfo, Jacob Phillips, Dan Panosian, Ryan Kelly, Patric Reynolds, Elise McCall, and Peter Krause. 
Bottom line for backers: 
The graphic novel is complete and the Kickstarter is looking to raise the last bit of funds needed for printing to get this book in your hands. That said, a digital version of the book will be sent to you as soon as possible once the Kickstarter is funded and complete!  Every tier with a reward will get the book! With the exception of the retailer tier, every tier over 40 bucks will get the printed signed and numbered book with the main Lobby Card set and the digital bundle. Higher priced tiers get more!  Yes, we have more goodies. So keep scrolling  and don't miss out!
Table of Contents:
     What's The Story...?  
     Why The Oversized Hardcover Format?
     Digital Rewards
     Lobby Cards 
     Stretch Goals
     A Word About Shipping
     Creative Team
 What's The Story...? 
PLAY

(Chip and Peter discuss Peter's contribution in detail during this special video shot a month after the main one, as Pete was not able to make it to Los Angeles.)
 Disgraced ex-cop, Conrad, seeks redemption by unraveling an unsolved murder during Southern California's fire season. Connie follows a lone clue—a discarded crucifix—to unravel the death of Karen Littleton, whose body was found amid a blaze that scorched 10,000 acres. The search leads Connie to clash with the victim's father and prime suspect, Robert Littleton, as well as hostile former colleagues on the local police force. All the while, Conrad combats his consuming alcoholism and fading faculties.
We're confident that you'll love this book as much as we do. But why take our word for it? 
 “Blacking Out is as dark as the smoky California skies that fill its pages. And like smoke, this noir clings to you. Redemptive, surprising, & bleak.” - Brian Azzarello, 100 Bullets, Moonshine 
 “A tasty comics noir for your lockdown reading. A fast-paced page turner that really delivers.” - Derf Backderf, My Friend Dahmer, Kent State 
 “A compelling story that moves like a rocket and artwork that’s stunning. When is award season, again?” - Mark Waid, Kingdom Come, Irredeemable 
 “Start with the inky atmospheric drawings. Take the narrative familiars: bad cop seeking redemption, small town with big secrets, people wanting what they can’t have. Toss them in the spin cycle.” - Betsy Willeford
Why the oversized hardcover format?
(Case cover proof direct from the printer. Check out the spot gloss! SoCal foliage in the background not included.)

Having the privilege to attend the Angoulême International Comics Festival in France this past decade, writer and co-creator Chip Mosher has not only fallen in love with the oversized European hardcover format (~12.5" x 9.5"), but also the creative aesthetic of what the French call bande dessinée or BD. Whereas American comics release on a monthly basis and demand tight deadlines, the standard 48 page BD album is drawn over 6 months or longer, allowing the creators to spread their wings and put their best work forward. 
 “Blacking Out is a hard drinking, hard boiled mystery with a finale that lands like a ton of bricks—do not miss it.”  - Gerry Duggan, Dead Eyes, Deadpool, Marauders 
With this approach in mind, co-creator and artist Peter Krause worked on BLACKING OUT over several years, toiling over each page to create a tight 56-page graphic novel. (Note: Chip needed some extra pages, so not keeping it to the standard French 48-page standard is his fault! - Pete.) Working "Marvel-style" (the writer providing the artist a script with no panel breakdowns), Peter was able to exercise complete artistic control over the pacing of the story, a rarity in American comics. Chip then followed with a final lettering draft after Peter finished drawing all of the pages. This creative process ensured a deep collaboration between writer and artist... true co-creators in every sense.
 "Blacking Out is a taut, nasty thriller about people you don't want to know, but will love watching. The slow burn (pun intended) leads to a gut punch that will leave you reeling. Well-done.” -Marc Andreyko, Supergirl, Manhunter, Torso 
Ed Dukeshire then lettered the project with Scalped alumnus Giulia Brusco providing colors. Finally, Tom Muller designed the logo and the cover, working directly with Peter. In the spirit of the project, each contributor was guaranteed as much time needed to provide their best work.
In total, the team spent more than three full years creating this graphic novel. No expense was spared, no shortcuts were taken. This graphic novel was crafted without compromise; an unrushed, immaculately sculpted book with few peers. 
( Letterer Ed Dukeshire crafted hand-drawn, custom balloons and manipulated fonts for word mood and emphasis.)
 “Hardcore characters in search for what they can’t name on a road they shouldn’t travel. A gut punch of crime fiction by Mosher and Krause.” -Gary Phillips, The Be-Bop Barbarians 
(Giulia Brusco's amazing color work on one of Chip and Peter's favorite pages.)
 "A rural crime tale with more twists and turns than a backcountry road.” - Ed Brisson, Sheltered, Old Man Logan 
(Tom Muller's distressed logo for the graphic novel.)
 “The writing is sharp like a razor, the sort of sharp that you don’t feel when it cuts you. It’s only when you see the blood begin to pool that you realize that you’re reading a really good book.” - Shannon Wheeler, Too Much Coffee Man, The New Yorker 
Digital Rewards
With the book completed, a PDF of BLACKING OUT will be immediately available to those who backed tiers including a digital copy of the book; all backers who receive any digital reward will immediately be able to read BLACKING OUT as soon as the Kickstarter is funded and complete.
(Cover for PDF version of BLACKING OUT ready to send to backers once the Kickstarter ends.)
There are two additional digital items available: the Blacking Out Photo Reference PDF and a PDF of Chip's previous graphic novel, Left On Mission, co-created and drawn by Francesco Francavilla.
While writing BLACKING OUT, Chip Mosher took numerous pictures to serve as inspiration for the book. Traveling around Southern California, Chip took pictures of active forest fires in and outside Los Angeles and he then created collages of places that he imagined would serve as the setting for BLACKING OUT. This PDF served as inspiration for the art and coloring of the final work.
(Photo collage by Chip Mosher for inspiration in the making of BLACKING OUT.)
As a special bonus, Chip Mosher’s previous graphic novel with co-creator Francesco Francavilla, Left On Mission —which debuted in 2008, and is currently OOP — is included digitally within certain most tiers. Left On Mission recently reverted to co-creators Chip and Francesco, who are excited to get this critically acclaimed, but little seen, work in the hands of more people. 
(Title page for LEFT ON MISSION co-created by Chip Mosher & Francesco Francavilla. Colors by Martin Thomas. Letters by Marshall Dillon.)
Chip and Peter wish to thank Francesco for letting them include Left On Mission as part of this Kickstarter.
The Lobby Cards
The BLACKING OUT Kickstarter allows Chip and Peter to celebrate the traditions of film noir by offering 12 cinematic lobby cards from today's most acclaimed artists, with a special card drawn by Peter himself. Lobby cards are miniature movie posters used to promote films in the lobbies of theaters in Hollywood's golden era. Noir films historically offered some of the most vivid imagery of the medium, inspiring this reward tier. Chip and Peter reached out to some of today's greatest comic artists to provide their interpretations of scenes within BLACKING OUT. These artists include:
 Francesco Francavilla (Afterlife with Archie), Eduardo Risso (Moonshine), Mirka Andolfo (Mercy), Dan Panosian (Slots), Emma Ríos (Pretty Deadly), Jacob Phillips (That Texas Blood), Patric Reynolds (The Mask), Ryan Kelly (Saucer Country), Jamal Igle (The Wrong Earth), Elise McCall (Spy Island) and Peter Krause. 
 Our lobby cards will be a smidge smaller than the book (~12.5" x 9.5").
UPDATE: Since hitting $29K we've added an additional card by Peter Krause, inspired by Robert Fawcett. See below.
(Lobby Card by Francesco Francavilla)
(Lobby Card by Eduardo Risso)
(Lobby Card by Jamal Igle. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Emma Ríos)
(Lobby Card by Mirka Andolfo)
(Lobby Card by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Dan Panosian)
(Lobby Card by Ryan Kelly. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Patric Reynolds. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Elise McCall. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(UNLOCKED $29K Stretch Goal additional "Robert Fawcett inspired" Lobby Card by Peter Krause)
(The "rarest" Lobby Card by Peter Krause with colors by Jacob Phillips! Only available to those pledging "NAKED" LOBBY CARDS + 1” $200 tier and the "LIVE AND NAKED" $300 tier.)
Each lobby card will be printed on card stock and sized to ship within the book to ensure delivery in perfect condition. Additionally, backers can opt for a tier of "naked" versions of the lobby cards, sans any kind of BLACKING OUT branding. This tier includes a special card drawn by Peter Krause and colored by Jacob Phillips.
Stretch Goals
We originally wrote: "Maybe we can add some bells and whistles to the book, but for now, we’re happy to let this smolder." And it has. So as a special thanks, we're adding these Stretch Goals:
STRETCH GOALS: Every backer of the $40 and up will receive these rewards once they are unlocked!
 UNLOCKED: $29K - Digital Wallpaper + Robert Fawcett inspired Lobby Card by Peter Krause.  
 UNLOCKED: $30K—Bookmark Ribbon
 UNLOCKED: $32K—Gilded Pages
 UNLOCKED: $35K—Sticker of Francesco Francavilla's Lobby Card. Gonna be smoking hot!
(STRETCH GOAL: $35K - Sticker of Francesco Francavilla's Lobby Card Art, undressed or as we say NAKED!)
 UNLOCKED: $40K—First Exploratory Piece drawn by Peter Krause & Colored by Jacob Phillips (See below). Those getting the "Naked" tier will get this undressed version too!
$50K – Pin of the Blacking Out logo (See below).
$60K – Pin of the Blacking Out logo—black-light edition (See below).
  (STRETCH GOAL: $40K - First Exploratory Piece drawn by Peter Krause & Colored by Jacob Phillips. Those getting the "Naked" tier will also this undressed version.)
Blacking Out Pins - Regular (top ) & black-light edition (bottom)
 “Blacking Out is not a romance.” - Kim Krizan, Before Sunrise 
A Word about Shipping
We've cut this to the bone for a HC oversize book that is relatively heavy. (See size comparison below.) We are planning to ship media mail domestically and USPS First Class for all international. We look to provide each backer with a shipping confirmation email with tracking. 
(Check it out! Standard US comic/trade size vs BD album. It goes without saying... this book is going to be massively cool!)
The Creative Team
 Chip Mosher
Chip Mosher currently serves as Head of Content for comiXology, overseeing the comiXology Originals line of exclusive content. In its first year, comiXology Originals garnered an Eisner Award for Harvey Kurtzman’s Marley’s Ghost. For the past 9 years at comiXology, Mosher has worn a variety of hats in the marketing, communications, and business development departments. Previously, Mosher ran BOOM! Studios’ marketing department, helping catapult the company into a top 10 direct market publisher.  During his tenure, Mosher brought home BOOM!'s first Eisner win by acquiring and editing Shannon Wheeler's cartoon collection I Thought You Would Be Funnier. In 2007, Mosher co-created the comic book Left On Mission with Francesco Francavilla.
Peter Krause
Peter Krause has worked as an artist in comics for over 30 years. Past credits include Power of Shazam!, Metropolis S.C.U., and Star Trek: The Next Generation—all for DC Comics. His work with writer Mark Waid on Irredeemable (BOOM! Studios) and Daredevil: Road Warrior (Marvel Comics) garnered several Eisner nominations.  Most recently, he helped reimagine the Archie gang as teens during World War ll in Archie: 1941, and drew the adventures of two disparate superhero universes in Dragonfly and Dragonman for Ahoy Comics.
 Giulia Brusco
Giulia Brusco is Italian and lives in London. She has colored comic books since 2000, working on titles such as Scalped, Django Unchained, and The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo. 
 Ed Dukeshire
Ed Dukeshire is the founder of Digital Webbing and co-creator of Fist of Justice. He's a Harvey nominated letterer currently working for BOOM! Studios and indie creators.
 Tom Muller
Tom Muller's work across graphic, digital, brand, and product design is informed by Modernist principles infused with a contemporary design sensibility that blurs the boundaries between creative disciplines—delivering design that is relevant, resonates, and inspires its audience—winning him global recognition as an industry leader in his field.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is done and we only need a small amount of money from the Kickstarter campaign to go to print. We are printing overseas so the biggest risk here is a delay with international overseas printing due to Covid-19. With the book complete, printed proofs in hand, this is a very low risk project. Once the Kickstarter is complete, digital copies of the book will be sent to backers. Chip Mosher, who is running this Kickstarter, is a seasoned vet of the comic industry and also assisted his wife, Kim Krizan, in completing her Kickstarter in 2013. Covid-19 is the biggest risk here and how it may or may not inhibit physical production and shipping times. But this will get done, come hell or high water.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Nicole Brown Simpson? Chip knows. Where Ellroy's mother's body was found? Chip's been there with Ellroy himself! Hillside strangler? Yeah, you know the answer now! Spend a couple of hours with Chip and hear how Kato Kaelin ended up buying him a round of drinks for his 30th birthday.

*If you're SUPER nice, he might take you to lunch at The Old Place in Malibu, where his great Uncle's murderer turned himself in when it was a post office circa 1943. https://oldplacecornell.com/

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOAL #1:  $8500
When I first met Bob Salley, long long ago, he was already well known in the independent comic scene as the guy who was self-publishing an ambitious 12 issue science fiction maxi-series called SALVAGERS.  At the same time, Source Point Press was starting to grow and make a little bit of noise in the independent publishing and convention circuit.  Bob first approached me over Facebook messenger.  I assumed he wanted me to take on SALVAGERS for distribution.
Nope.
Bob had a completely new idea.  He pitched me a story about monsters and corruption and the desire for anonymity in a cool science fiction/mystery shell.  I was intrigued.  It had great art from Francesco Tomaselli.  We decided to move forward with the book as a webcomic, publishing one page per week.  It was a cool book with an interesting premise and great art.  It slowly started to pick up a following and we launched a small Kickstarter to print the first issue in a very limited edition when it wrapped.  Everyone was really happy!
In the meantime, Source Point had signed a deal with Bob on SALVAGERS and had him hard at work finishing the second volume for a wide release and the next planned issue of Shelter Division fell to the wayside.  One thing led to another.  One pitch led to another.  From OGRE to OGRES to STARLIGHT TAVERN, Bob kept bringing new and exciting projects to the table.  SHELTER DIVISION kept hitting the back burner.  
Enter Ken Perry, a Massachusett's fireman who had done the art for a book called WRETCHED THINGS (written by Devon Wong) that we loved.  He was looking for something new.  Ken read the first issue and was immediately on board.  Now that we had a dedicated artist cranking out pages,  SHELTER DIVISION was back and all of us at SOURCE POINT PRESS are thrilled to be able to offer KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE printings of the first 3 issues individually and in a beautiful HARDCOVER collection.  Thanks for checking this campaign out and getting behind SHELTER DIVISION!  
REWARDS!!!
 **Shipping will be charged during the pledge manager of the campaign!!**
LIMITED TO 30 - EXCLUSIVE HARDCOVER WITH BOB SALLEY'S BROKEN GARGOYLES #1 FIRST PRINTING!!
CREATORS!!!
With a love of comics and storytelling, Bob embarked on his journey to combine the two with his Science Fiction adventure SALVAGERS. With the scripts written, and waiting for the art to be completed, Salley started getting an itch and began writing SHELTER DIVISION. Mixing his love for mystery, spies and horror into a Men In Black like adventure series.
Ken is a professional firefighter and artist which allows him to use some of the crazy things he sees at the fire dept in his art. He also works in painting and sculpture and has works in public installations and private collections.  He lives in Massachusetts with his wife and Frisbee stunt dog Jack.
 Source Point Press publishes books, comic books, and graphic novels. Working with both industry legends, and new talents on the rise, we strive to bring you the best storytelling in horror, sci-fi, pulp, true crime, the occult, and supernatural.


SYNOPSIS
Issue 1 - Agents of a secret government organization stumble upon a heist of scientific technology with the possibility of opening portals between other dimensions. An organization that uses the abnormal to hunt the abnormal. As we see the son of Bigfoot, the Roswell alien and Emrik Chaplin, a man who has been alive since the 17th century have no place among us, they have dubbed this government project SHELTER DIVISION.
Issue 2 - As Emrick and Biggs make their way back to headquarters, time is running out for the evil genius Ramos and his plot to build a bridge between his world and ours. No one is safe from his rage and there is nowhere to hide.
Issue 3 - With Emrick captured and separated from his bionic limbs, Ramos now has the power to bring his army into our primitive world. Time is running out and no one will be able to take shelter from the storm Ramos’ army will bring!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Source Point Press has successful fulfilled many past campaigns and regularly publishes monthly comics and graphic novels. We are aware of the pitfalls and have both taken steps insure against issues and have the know-how to get over and hurdles that come our way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Check out Butts in Seats: The Tony Schiavone Story
updates.update_content:
Keep one eye on your mailbox, awards are out! All but a small handful have shipped already, and those that haven’t are being packed up now. 
A big thank you once again from Source Point to everyone who backed Shelter Division, and we hope you’ll be interested in our next major campaign. Tony Schiavone, legendary wrestling commentator for promotions such as WCW, WWF, WWE, and AEW is making a comic - and it’s live on Kickstarter NOW!
BUTTS IN SEATS: THE TONY SCHIAVONE STORY is a ten chapter graphic novel retrospective of Tony’s whole life and career, with each chapter illustrated by a different artist handpicked to best portray that stage of Tony's life and career -- both inside and outside professional wrestling!

We've been shipping out the rewards and are happy to see backers are receiving!
I personally want to THANK YOU all so much for your patience and support and truly hope you enjoy the book. SIDE NOTE: The next Shelter Division story is in production and I'm so thrilled to have brought on a good friend of mine Fred Kennedy to co-write it with me.

After many delays, SHELTER DIVISION is tracked to arrive Monday.  
We will be fulfilling immediately. There are still a few Backers who have not filled out their surveys. 
Please do so now so you can get your reward!
As always, Thank you for your patience.

updates.update_userinfo: Books WILL 100% Be delivered as Promised!
updates.update_content:
I realize we are waaaaay late on the projected Delivery Date... and I am a liar about the books being delivered before Christmas. Unfortunately, this is out of our control as far as books being received at the warehouse. The projected delivery date to the warehouse is now mid-January and we are committed to working day and night to package the orders up so we can get them out to you.

Again, I apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate everyone's patience.

Hey Everyone, 
Just wanted to share another interesting Kickstarter. Our good friends at Stranger Comics, known for their heroic elven fantasy series, Niobe, have some new heroic elves… in a hilarious and cheeky  comedy caper: RUINING CHRISTMAS. It’s "an irreverent tale about the spirit of giving taking it…  for far too long... from a 10-inch yule log." 
LINK: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/sebastianajones/363951896?ref=4nnre5&token=7d147103

Hey all, just wanted to let you know that the WARCORNS campaign by our friend Garrett Gunn and Last Wolf Legion is down to its last 20 hours.  It's an awesome military-comedy starring some pretty bad ass unicorns.  Go check it out!

Hey Everyone, 
As always, thank you so much for your support of this book and this team!  Today, I'm locking down what orders have come through the backerkit and have charged cards.  There's still 39 backers who've yet to respond and I just sent reminders to your Kickstarter email.  Again, if you need help, have questions, or need it sent to a different email or would like a link, please simply reach out!

Hi folks, just a quick note to let you know that we're still on track to have this book's art finished this month and be fulfilling rewards on time.  There's still about 40 of you that haven't filled out your backerkit surveys.  Please do those!  Right now, we're planning on closing it down at the end of July to go into production.  If you need any help, have questions, need a new link, etc, please just shoot me a message!  Thanks all!
In the meantime, check out a cool campaign that's about halfway through by our friends Guerilla Publishing!

project_data.project_name: Shelter Division

campaign.story:
ERIS is a sci-fi action comic exploring violence, consciousness, power, and masculinity.  The story is planned to span three 32 page full color issues.
The story follows a team of super-powered humans on an assassination mission to the edge of the known universe. Each member of this elite unit must wrestle with their role in the power structures of earth as they are pushed to their mental and physical limits.
PREVIEW:
Here's a preview of ERIS to give you a taste of the insane world we've built:
We designed ERIS to capture the energy of 90’s comics, the thought-provoking formalism of alternative comics, and the excess of 80’s sci-fi action films. 
ERIS is 100% complete and ready to print!  This means when we hit our goal, the book can be immediately sent to the printers and ready to ship as soon as possible.  You won’t be waiting months and months for your reward to arrive, which we know is a huge bummer!
Here's what other comic creators are saying about ERIS:
"With ERIS, Tyrell is bringing a new voice to science fiction with a dynamic and blood fueled tale.  GET THIS!" -Daniel Warren Johnson, creator of Murder Falcon, Extremity and Wonder Woman: Dead Earth.
"ERIS is sci-fi action comics as they were meant to be: Big ideas and even bigger muscles." - Aubrey Sitterson, co-creator of No One Left to Fight and The Comic Book Story of Professional Wrestling
"This comic is hot as shit. No one draws like Tyrell Cannon." - Isabella Rotman,  co-creator of Wait What? A Comic Book Guide to Relationships, Bodies, and Growing Up and creator of This Might Hurt Tarot Deck,
...
ERIS theme song by J.L. Shioshita
ERIS title animation by Jonathan Lamantia
...
WHO WE ARE:
ERIS is created by the Cannon brothers, Tyrell & Logan.  They grew up on a steady diet of Arnold Schwarzenegger movies and Rob Liefeld comics in the golden age of Saturday morning cartoons!  Logan is an actor and writer, bringing his penchant for awesome movie lines to the ERIS script.  Tyrell is a comic artist and illustrator who has been making comics for over 15 years.  He is known for creating the ground-breaking sci-fi anthology Speculative Relationships, cover art for comics like Murder Falcon, as well as his own comics Victus and Gary.   Most recently, his DOOM-inspired inktober comic IDKFA lit up the internet with it’s brutal demon-killing action.
There is a lot of uncertainty in the world right now, especially in the comics industry.  We feel that what we can do is: KEEP MAKING AWESOME COMICS. ERIS is our gift to you during this crazy time.
...
 REWARDS
A high resolution PDF of ERIS #1. 32 Pages, full color.
A high quality, full size, staple bound copy of ERIS #1.  32 pages, full color.  Signed by Tyrell Cannon.  Early bird discount, so get it while it's hot!
The main event!  A high quality, full size, staple bound copy of ERIS #1.  32 pages, full color.  Signed by Tyrell Cannon
All previous rewards, PLUS 1 ERIS Logo sticker for you to put literally anywhere.
We love our local comic shops and we want to see our books on their shelves!  This includes 4 copies of ERIS #1 at a discounted rate.  Retailers only please.
A physical copy of ERIS #1, PLUS an original black and white 9x12” commission of your choice by Tyrell Cannon.  Below are some examples of Tyrell's commission work: 
A physical copy of ERIS #1, PLUS a piece of original art from the comic!  Pages will be chosen by backers in the order they contribute.  Each page is 11x17”, black and white ink, signed by the artist.  Here's a look at some of the original pages: 
...
 STRETCH GOALS
If we go over our goal, we add value for all backers, as well as bringing more content sooner. I firmly believe in stretch goals that provide more content and focus on the actual comic, rather than throwing in a bunch of unrelated knick-knacks.  In that spirit…
$4k: Artist Edition
As comic and movie fans, we LOVE special features.  Hearing from makers how they create expands the work, giving readers another level of appreciation for the book.  When this stretch goal is unlocked, we will offer an Artist Edition PDF of ERIS #1 to all backers.  This Artist Edition will include things like:
Thumbnail sketches of each page
  Raw scans of the artwork
  Color process guides
  Script pages
  Commentary on each page by Tyrell & Logan
  Development sketches
  A video walkthrough of each page of ERIS, with commentary by Tyrell
  We really want to make this available to readers, so let’s hit that goal!
$6k: Issue #2 Fast Track
WE WANT YOU TO READ ERIS #2 AS SOON AS POSSIBLE! Issue 2 is completely written and the thumbnailing has already started.  It is shaping up to be an insane action-packed issue.
Issue #1 of ERIS was drawn over the course of a year, in my “spare time” between my paid illustration and comics work.  It is a labor of love that I want to spend more time and attention on going forward.  When we hit this stretch goal, the funding will go towards making ERIS #2 my full-time focus for the 2 months directly following the campaign (and after orders are all shipped).  This means the story will continue without waiting another year!  Backers would get sneak peeks into the process during this time, followed by another kickstarter campaign to facilitate the costs printing/shipping of issue #2.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I (Tyrell) have run 4 successful kickstarter campaigns to date, delivering rewards safely and on-time to backers. I’ve self-published over 20 of my own comics, exhibited at many shows across the US, and am an organizer of the Chicago Alternative Comics Expo. This is, as they say, “not my first rodeo”. I know the many challenges of putting a comic together and getting it into the hands of readers. I will always meet these challenges with planning and communication.
The Covid-19 pandemic has already created many issues for comics and everyday life. We have checked with our printer and confirmed that they are operating and ready to go. We also have looked into multiple shipping options to have a plan for delivery. No doubt, more challenges could arise due to the current pandemic, but we will always be communicative and forward with our backers about the status of the project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello ERIS backers!
Tyrell here with a quick update on our progress and a heads up on other projects.
ERIS #2 Progress
ERIS #2 is back in full swing, now that I've completed all the other gigs that got shuffled due to covid.  We are happy to report that there are 20 pages inked, and colors are already going!  Here's a few snippets:

Hello ERIS fans!
Happy New Year!  We hope you all had a safe and enjoyable holiday season.  To start the new year off right, here's a quick update on ERIS #2!
Over HALF of the issue is completely inked.  Tyrell is having a blast drawing these pages and going full steam for all of December! This issue is packed full of action that will blow you away!
Here's a little sneak peek in the form of a timelapse video of Tyrell's thumbnailing process for a page, as well as a couple inked panels:

Hello ERIS backers!
Tyrell here.  I wanted you all to know about a bummer of a situation: Despite our best efforts, my family and I recently contracted covid.  The good news is, my wife and I have fully recovered from our symptoms, and our little Quinn showed almost no symptoms.  The illness and taking care of each other put us out of working condition for about 2 1/2 weeks.  I'm finishing my quarantine period today, and was finally able to get back to the drawing table yesterday.

updates.update_userinfo: ERIS #2 Thumbnails complete & BEEF BROS campaign update!
updates.update_content:
ERIS #2
Thumbnails are complete!  Hoo boy we are excited about this issue!  Action galore!  Here's a small WIP of one panel from the issue:

Hey ERIS fans! 
Two updates for everyone:
BEEF BROS
BEEF BROS#1is now LIVE on Kickstarter!  What is BEEF BROS, you say?  It's the new gonzo action superhero comic written by Aubrey Sitterson and drawn by ME, Tyrell Cannon!  This comic is WILD and I think fans will dig it.  Here's the cover:

updates.update_userinfo: Post Campaign Update 7: Final Commissions and Shipping
updates.update_content:
Hey backers!
Quick update here...
SHIPPING
Shipping is COMPLETE.  If you have not either received your rewards or a shipping notification it means 1 of 2 things:

Shipping
All orders have been sent out to backers who filled out their surveys as of 8/4!  Woohoo!  If you haven’t already received your order or a shipping notification, chances are you haven’t filled out your survey. Please take a minute to complete your survey and we’ll get the last ones sent out. Contact us if you're having any issues.

Shipping
Shipping has been going full steam all last week and the majority of orders have gone out.   There are still some left at the higher tier reward levels, which will go out in the next round of shipments.
We also want to remind you to fill out your surveys!  If you don’t fill yours out, your order will not ship.  The next round will go out in about a week and include any backers who filled out their survey after July 20th.  We really appreciate that so many of you filled yours out so quickly.  It made a HUGE difference to us for fulfillment!

updates.update_userinfo: Post Campaign Update 4: Digital Downloads and Shipping!
updates.update_content: Printing Complete!

Printing Update
Printing is still underway, and we’re hoping to get the books in the next week or two!
Like A Hurricane
Tyrell recently did some illustrations for another great book on Kickstarter now- Like a Hurricane: An Unofficial Oral History of Street Fighter II.  The book covers the creation of the classic video game and Tyrell is set to do illustrations of each person interviewed.  They are off to a great start and we highly recommend you back this project!

campaign.story:
”I first read this as a screenplay. Having myself experienced what can happen when a screenplay becomes a graphic novel, to say I'm excited by this Kickstarter is very much an understatement!” — William Gibson
MADI is a 260-page road trip graphic novel set in the near future, by film director Duncan Jones (MOON, SOURCE CODE) and writer Alex de Campi (BAD KARMA, BLADE RUNNER), and drawn by some of comics’ most exciting artists including Glenn Fabry, Simon Bisley, Duncan Fegredo and Pia Guerra. Each artist tackles a 8-30 page section of the story, bringing to life one location.
See for yourself: Download the first 19 pages of MADI here! Includes both the Fegredo/Phillips and Shimizu covers.
 This project is EU/UK shipping friendly! We are drop-shipping to a UK distributor so shipping is affordable to our huge and beloved European fanbase. Estimated maximum shipping costs for a single book are: US: $10 / Canada & Mexico: $15 / UK: $20 / Mainland Europe: $25 / Rest of World: $55. Shipping costs will be collected at checkout (after the campaign ends) via Backerkit, where you’ll also have the chance to add on additional books or upgrade to a higher-tier book. 
Madi Preston, a veteran of Britain’s elite special operations J-Squad unit, is burnt out and up to her eyeballs in debt. She and the rest of her team have retired from the military but are now trapped having to pay to service and maintain the technology put into them during their years of service.   They're working for British conglomerate Liberty Inc as  mercenaries, selling their unique ability to be remote controlled by specialists while in the field, and the debts are only growing as they get injured completing missions. We meet Madi as she decides she’s had enough.  She will take an off-the-books job that should earn her enough to pay out her and her sister, but when the piece of tech she’s supposed to steal turns out to be a kid, and she suddenly blacks out... she finds herself on the run from everyone she’s ever known. 
In a globe-spanning adventure from Shanghai to Soho, Madi has to stay one step ahead of the giant corporations closing in on her from all sides. 
MADI is the third and final story in the “Mooniverse,” an anthology of independent stories that take place in a shared future. You don’t need to have seen MOON or MUTE to fully enjoy this standalone book.
The full roster of line artists are: Dylan Teague, Glenn Fabry, Duncan Fegredo, LRNZ, Ed Ocaña, André Araújo, Simon Bisley, Rosemary Valero-O’Connell, Tonci Zonjic, Pia Guerra, James Stokoe, RM Guéra, Chris Weston,  Rufus Dayglo, Annie Wu, David Lopez and Christian Ward. Our amazing colour team includes: Matt Wilson, Nayoung Kim, Chris O’Halloran, Adam Brown, Jacob Phillips, Raúl Arnaiz, Giulia Brusco, Sergey Nazarov and Kelly Fitzpatrick. Lettering is by Alex. 
Every artist has been paid their full asking rate and is also getting royalties on the project. As freelancers ourselves, we believe in being the change we want to see in the industry.  
The book is almost finished being drawn and is currently being lettered. It will be sent to backers in early November, and comes in your choice of a luxe 7¼ X 10 ½” paperback, a 8.3” x 12” hardback (the original art size), or an oversize 10 x 14½” cased hardback with over 40 pages of back matter. The paperback cover is by Duncan Fegredo & Jacob Phillips, and the hardback cover is by Yuko Shimizu. 
Duncan Fegredo and Jacob Phillips' beautiful wrap cover for the paperback edition
Because both Duncan and Alex have big fanbases in Europe we are doing our damnedest to make sure shipping is as inexpensive as possible while maintaining safe and careful mailing of these extremely nice, high quality editions. We're working with drop-shipping to UK distributors so European buyers won't have to pay airmail from the US.  Backerkit is handling all our pledge management and will be charging shipping at the end, once the campaign is over (you'll also be able to add on books or upgrade your pledge at that time, if you want). Z2 has its own warehouse, so US fulfillment can be handled easily and professionally in-house. 
No digital version of MADI will be made available at this time, or indeed maybe ever.
Stores, you will be able to order MADI for retail sale at your fine shops a few weeks after Kickstarter fulfillment.  
Yuko Shimizu's luscious cover for the hardback edition
A model of Yuko's cover on the hardback, without logos (why interrupt the pretty until you have to)
The deluxe slipcase edition is truly a magnificent book, with the art reproduced at luscious 10” x 14.5” size (a 20% blowup on the book’s original art size of 8.3” x 12”) and with over 60 pages of extras, process, and essays from Duncan and Alex, along with surprise bonus art from friends like Colleen Doran and Jeffrey Veregge! See a scene go from original screenplay through Alex’s handwritten breakdowns to comic script, pencils, inks, then colours! Pore over the thumbnails and rough layouts of masters like Duncan Fegredo and RM Guéra! Enjoy all the character sketches and development work that went on behind the scenes (there was a lot, this project was super complex to produce) such as Annie Wu’s amazing Kitty Cop concept art, below! (The whole Kitty Cop origin story is pretty great, too, it basically involves Alex + too much sugar.) 
The Madi deluxe edition with diecut slipcase
The slipcase edition features Yuko’s gorgeous wrap cover without logos, inside a diecut slipcase that allows Yuko’s illustration of Madi to show through. This slipcase edition will not be available for retail sale; if you miss it here, maybe we might have a few at the Z2 Comics table at a convention, but maybe not. 
Annie Wu’s concept art for our Kitty Cops, or: “kawaii, but make it fascism”
Duncan Fegredo's lovely wrap cover for the softcover edition, before its colours by Jacob Phillips!
A Simon BIsley warmup sketch, as you do; another of the sort of extras that only come in the deluxe slipcase edition
Also, neither Duncan nor Alex have ANY chill so we'll probably post lots of lettered pages in the updates.... but only for backers.  
Duncan's last "Free the 156" stickers from MUTE, for the first 50 hardcover backers
 Who we are:
Man; made Moon & more
Duncan Jones is a British advertising and film director, best known for his BAFTA winning film MOON, epic game-based fantasy movie WARCRAFT and his other science fiction films SOURCE CODE & MUTE.  He is presently staying safely locked up at his home, waiting for it to be safe to go out and make ROGUE TROOPER of 2000AD fame with Rebellion Studios.  Duncan is answerable to his wife, Rodene, his two kids, Stenton 4 and Zowie 2, and his dog, who takes her privacy very seriously after a scamming incident, and wishes to remain anonymous. 
Woman; made books
Alex de Campi is a novellist and comics writer, best known for her noir graphic novel BAD GIRLS and her love anthology TWISTED ROMANCE, both of which were nominated for three Eisner awards last year. She has also written some episodes of Shinichiro Watanabe’s BLADE RUNNER anime (on Toonami next year) and worked with Masamune Shirow on a GHOST IN THE SHELL comic for Kodansha. Her debut novel, medieval suspense thriller THE SCOTTISH BOY, comes out at the end of the month and you can preorder it here in the UK or here in the US. You can read her action-thriller comic BAD KARMA anywhere in the world right now, as it is pay-what-you-wish on lovely webcomic site Panel Syndicate. Alex is answerable to her daughter Lorelei and her deafblind pit bull Tango, and they’re all answerable to the darn cat. Her little family is currently enjoying being the only people left in Manhattan.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are very few risks, the book is already paid for and most art is finished. MADI will come out but there can always be printing delays, a massive economic depression or a meteor hitting earth.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Mainland Europe: All of the books are now shipping, however the last part of the process is the DHL notification. You may ask if they started the process Friday the 7th why is it taking so long well May 13th is a national holiday in Germany and the fulfillment center was closed for it and the 12th. That said everything is almost all packed and DHL notifications will start going out as the last part of the process. Apologies on this, but of the fulfillment this is the hardest part as we are dealing with a 9 hour time difference, a language barrier, and multiple software systems


UK: We are interfacing with our shipping company about all missing and damaged orders to get that fixed. We do need a bit of time especially with damages as we do not handle directly ourselves.

Backerkit: Now we noticed recently there was a surge of people filling in their Backerkit incredibly late. If you did so you will get your books, but we based out warehouse allocations on the Backerkit data. With Z2's normal shipping operations we can pull it automatically but with Backerkit we manually have to refresh pull and put in our system. ( It's why we sent out so many notices on it). In other words, if you JUST paid your Backerkit, your books will be a couple weeks behind everyone else’s books that are already paid / in the system.

If there are any issues with an individual order please email rather than message the Kickstarter or comment we have people there ready to help and it will go a lot quicker than commenting. When you mail support, please provide your name, your full mailing address, and what you ordered / what’s missing. If it’s about a damaged book, please include a photo of the damage.

Thank you all for your patience

updates.update_content:
Hellloooooo!
UK hardback, deluxe, and bundles are shipping! Yay our distributor! There are a bunch of you, but books are starting to go in the mail today! I don’t believe they’re emailing tracking numbers (the issue with working with a distrib is sometimes I don’t have 100% transparency on what is going on with them) but UK friends, keep an eye on your mailboxes! I should imagine the first of you will start getting your books on Friday and then it’ll continue all next week. Please please please do not email support right now asking for UK tracking numbers, we won’t be able to give them, but your books are on their way!

Early next week, will be sending NEW KICKSTARTER SURVEYS to confirm mailing addresses for all hardback, deluxe, and bundle backers in the UK and Europe! Yes, we already sent one, but it was a while ago, and a bunch of you hae moved.  Please click the suurvey, CHECK YOUR MAILING ADDRESS IS RIGHT, then confirm or fix ASAP! updates.update_userinfo: UK & Europe: look out for a survey! We’re re-confirming your addresses and then ✨ it’s book time ✨
updates.update_content:
Hey All

So there really is nothing new to report given our warehouse is snowed in till Thursday. That said going to be limiting these updates to once a week on Fridays now as we've gotten most of the problems figured out and to spare all of your inboxes.

Hey All

So got some substantive updates this time

UK- Good news here we found a UK based distributor to help us with fulfillment, given the developing COVID situation ( UK has a great vaccination program going), fairly confident we will get these out to you early April* I am putting the Asterisk because who knows that can happen that said barring a boat getting taken over by pirates, some national disaster/ a mutant covid variant that causes  zombie we should be good. This will also spare you guys duties/tariffs and damaged books

project_data.project_name: Madi: Once Upon A Time In The Future

campaign.story:
$130K DONE AND DUSTED!! Hope you like t-shirts, because you will now have the opportunity to acquire kick-ass tees that say "CURSE WORDS" on them through our Backerkit survey store, and everyone will think you are so edgy and cool! (Nudists, they make lovely dishcloths or art objects, and people will still think you are edgy and cool.) That’s not all, either: SO MANY UNLOCKED STRETCH GOALS added to your order! The value of your pledge is crazy high! This all ends Sunday June 7 at 10:30 AM EST... there's only one more big goal to unlock, a physical LP of the concept album at $150K! LET'S GET THERE!
UNLOCKED STRETCH GOALS!
• The Hardcover now features a full-length new story by Charles and Ryan, a sewn-in ribbon bookmark, a deluxe soft-touch cover finish, an awesome bookplate featuring the story's villains, WHICH WE WILL SIGN... and all backers get their backer name listed in the book!
• Everyone gets a digital teaser of the NEXT Charles and Ryan comic - what they're making to follow up CURSE WORDS! Plus a digital Ryan Browne Sketchbook and a digital scan of Charles' CURSE WORDS idea notebook! Super classified insight on how the book was made!
• Every buyer of the physical book gets a PDF of the whole thing, plus sticker, the Curse Words EP written and performed by Charles, and a PDF of Ryan's rescripted version of Curse Words 1-- CURSE SWORDS 1! AND, Ryan and Charles will create an audio drama read-along version of CURSE WORDS #1 for all backers!
• Three lucky backers at random win a page of original art from the Curse Words series!
• CURSE WORDS full-length concept album with all-new original tunes from Charles and his musical friends!
Read on for info on the project, details on locked & unlocked stretch goals, and MORE!
FOR THE VERY FIRST TIME ANYWHERE... 
...Charles Soule and Ryan Browne present the incredible, magical comics saga that is CURSE WORDS in one volume – THE HOLE DAMNED THING – along with incredible extras and an all-new, never-before-seen tale set in its world, with art and story from its creators. This is the definitive edition of CURSE WORDS, and my oh my it is pretty. Look for yourself!
WHAT IS CURSE WORDS? It’s a beautiful, hilarious, action-packed, magical comic, a 768-page epic which tells the story of an evil wizard named… WIZORD, sent to Earth from a hellish dimension called THE HOLE WORLD to destroy our existence. Wizord, being fickle, decides he likes Earth better than where he came from, and disobeys his boss, the demon SIZZAJEE. Instead of ending our world, Wizord reveals himself to humanity, telling everyone he’s a good wizard. (He’s lying. In a big way. And things go straight to hell.)
CURSE WORDS was originally published across twenty-eight single issues by Image Comics from 2017 through late 2019, telling the full story of Wizord, his talking koala assistant Margaret and their pals. Created by superstar creators Charles Soule (Darth Vader, Death of Wolverine, Undiscovered Country) and Ryan Browne (God Hates Astronauts, Quantum & Woody), the series debuted to enormous fanfare and fabulous reviews. Over its run, it garnered a devoted fanbase, a cross-country Wizard Van tour to promote the book and a television development deal. IT IS TERRIFIC STUFF. But don't take our word for it - listen to NY Times bestselling author Joe Hill:
"Terrific, terrific stuff." –Joe Hill, NY Times Bestselling Author
"Overall fantastic and tons of fun… Harry Potter can suck it, Wizord is the wizard we need." –nerdist.com 
Massive two-page spreads from Curse Words!
All 28 issues of the hit Image Comics series are in The Hole Damned Thing Hardcover!
One other great bit - we are fulfilling all orders through our friends at Challengers Comics + Conversation in Chicago. They'll make money on every single package we ship through the Kickstarter, so by pledging, you're helping out a great store in these tough times (and means we don't have to do it ourselves. Win-win!)
What you see below is how CURSE WORDS - THE HOLE DAMNED THING will look in its current incarnation, but we've also planned all sorts of Stretch Goals to spruce it up even more. List below the image... and they're just the start!
Just 10 of the 768 (!) pages you get in this massive collection!
STRETCH GOAL ZERO (UNLOCKED!) $27,000: PDF IN DA HOUSE! Everyone who bought the physical hardcover will now get a PDF of the hardcover for when you want to read the book, but you want to hold a little old IPad instead of a massive 4 pound tome! 
STRETCH GOAL ONE (UNLOCKED!) $30,000: HARDCOVER UPGRADE! Your book now has a fabric ribbon bookmark! You weren't going to read all 768 pages in one sitting, were you?
STRETCH GOAL TWO (UNLOCKED!) $35,000: HARDCOVER UPGRADE! Your book now has a deluxe soft-touch finish. So nice to hold--perhaps you'll never put it down?!
STRETCH GOAL THREE (UNLOCKED!) $40,000: HARDCOVER UPGRADE! Your book had a 5 page new story--NOW IT HAS A 10 page new story! Wonder how long it can get--lets keep backing and find out!
STRETCH GOAL FOUR AND ONE THIRD (UNLOCKED!) $42,000: THE NEXT BIG THING! Every pledge at the $10 level and above will now include a free sneak peek of the next Charles Soule/Ryan Browne comic project! It's totally new, and you'll be the very first people to learn anything about it! WOW!
STRETCH GOAL FOUR AND TWO THIRDS (UNLOCKED!) $46,000: DIGITAL RYAN BROWNE SKETCHBOOK! This book is enormous--way too enormous--so some of the behind the scenes stuff has ended up on the cutting room floor. This is a pdf of sketches and commissions that Ryan has done that y'all have just got to see!
STRETCH GOAL FIVE (UNLOCKED!) $50,000: PEEK BEHIND THE CURTAIN! Charles planned and outlined every issue of Curse Words in a Moleskine notebook - it's all there. All his outlines, all his planning, his terrible sketches and dumb ideas - the ones he discarded and the ones that made it into the book. Now, every backer at $5 and above gets a PDF of the entire notebook, every page scanned in high-end hi-res. A must for process junkies!
STRETCH GOAL FIVE AND A HALF (UNLOCKED!) $52,500: GET A STICKER, YO! Everyone loves stickers--AM I RIGHT!? Well, you get a Curse Words sticker. Tell your friends!
STRETCH GOAL SIX (UNLOCKED!) $55,000: HARDCOVER UPGRADE! THE STORY WILL NOT END! Remember that 10-page new Curse Words issue you unlocked many thousands back? Now it's a 20-pager! That's right, an entirely new issue of Curse Words will be included in the book and available in the AFTER WORDS single issue.
STRETCH GOAL SEVEN AND A HALF (UNLOCKED!) $60,000: OH BOY! SINCE YOU MADE THIS ALL HAPPEN, YOU SHOULD BE THANKED! Everyone's Kickstarter backer name will be listed in the book! That's right! Hope you have a cool backer name--cuz it's going in the book. YOU'RE A PART OF CURSE WORDS LORE!
STRETCH GOAL SEVEN (UNLOCKED!) $65,000: TIME FOR SOME FUN! WHAT IF RYAN HAD WRITTEN CURSE WORDS #1!?!? Well lets find out! Introducing CURSE SWORD #1, a pdf download that everyone will get where good ole Ryan will take all the art from the first Curse Words issue and rescript it the way he would've written it! I'll change all the word balloons and use the same art--thus making a "new" "comic" for you to read! Boy is Charles gonna be mad!
STRETCH GOAL SEVEN AND A HALF (UNLOCKED!) $70,000: THE CURSE WORDS THEME SONG! Years ago, Charles (an accomplished guitarist and songwriter among his other accomplishments) wrote a theme song for the series: Mr. Magic Man! Only performed once live, at the Wizard Party launch event for Curse Words at NYCC 2016... now every backer at $5 or above gets a free digital download of an all-new recording of this classic tune! IT ROXXX!
STRETCH GOAL EIGHT (UNLOCKED!) $75,000: THREE lucky Curse Words fans (who buy the physical book) will be chosen at random, and Ryan will send them an original piece of Curse Words art! That's right! Some lucky gal or guy will own an original page from the hardcover book! INCREDIBLE!?!?
STRETCH GOAL NINETY MINUS EIGHTY-ONE (UNLOCKED!) $85,000: VILLAIN BOOKPLATE! Ryan will design and draw an all-new, beautiful bookplate for the hardcover featuring the villains of CURSE WORDS, from Jacques Zacques to Cornwall and everyone in between! ONE PACKED WITH EACH PHYSICAL COPY OF THE BOOK.
STRETCH GOAL TEN TIMES ONE (UNLOCKED!) $95,000: READ-ALONG! Charles and Ryan will create an audio drama version of CURSE WORDS #1, a digital download for all backers that you can listen to as you read the comic. They'll do all the voices and sound effects themselves - and you have not LIVED until you've heard Ryan voice a teenage female koala.
STRETCH GOAL TEN POINT THREE ONE FOUR ONE FIVE (UNLOCKED!) $100,000: SIGNED VILLAIN BOOKPLATE! The beautiful new villain bookplates from the $85K level will now be signed by both Ryan and Charles - this will be a challenge, with all the shipping back and forth and signing and shipping again... but you have earned it, and we will do it! FOR YOU! ONE PACKED WITH EACH PHYSICAL COPY OF THE BOOK.
STRETCH GOAL ELEVENTY-FIVE (UNLOCKED!) $110,000: MORE SORCEROUS TUNES! You're already getting the theme song of CURSE WORDS, "Mr. Magic Man." Well, now it will be joined by FOUR MORE SONGS, to create an entire CURSE WORDS EP, written, recorded, produced and (mostly) performed by Charles! Available as MP3s for all backers at $5 and above!
STRETCH GOAL INFINITY (UNLOCKED!) $120,000: THE CURSE WORDS CONCEPT ALBUM! Oh my goodness. Now it's not just an EP, it's a FULL ALBUM of songs about Wizord and the gang. Featuring such classics as "The Ballad of Ruby Stitch" and "Jacques Zacques Rock," you might just listen to it... FOREVER. Available as MP3s for all backers at $5 and above!
STRETCH GOAL INFINITY + INFINITY (UNLOCKED!) $130,000: THE CURSE WORDS T-SHIRT RETURNS! If we hit 130K (!!!), then Team Curse Words will make a new edition of the long out of print Curse Words logo T-Shirts! SO RAD! These shirts will **only** be available for purchase only through the BackerKit survey as add-ons to your current order.  We weren't going to do T-Shirts at all, but y'all have twisted our arms with your wonderful support!
STRETCH GOAL INFINITY TO THE INFINITE POWER (LOCKED) $150,000: THE CURSE WORDS VINYL RECORD! Once Charles finishes recording the entire Curse Words-inspired concept album, we will get it pressed on special limited edition vinyl and offer it for sale during the add-on phase of the survey! So limited and so special! We want to do this so badly! AH!
"Updates a whole host of fantasy tropes with glee in twisting them just a little bit more than you might expect."–Wired.com
NOW, THIS ISN'T ONE OF THOSE "WAIT A COUPLE YEARS FOR THE BOOK" KICKSTARTERS. THIS THING IS DONE--SO MANY PAGES! Here it is, all laid out!
SEE? DONE! ALL THAT'S LEFT IS THE FINAL STORY!
"(Curse Words) exists to amuse and astound the reader who never imagined something so absurd coming into being." –NPR.org
This collection contains every variant cover from the series including art from: Skottie Young, Chip Zdarsky, Paolo Rivera, Tradd Moore, Jamie McKelvie, Ryan Stegman, Andrew Maclean, James Harren, Steve Seeley, Jenny Frison, Tula Lotay, Buster Moody, Zander Cannon, Daniel Warren Johnson, and Ramon Villalobos! IT ALSO features three seasonal special issues featuring guest artists Mike Norton and Joe Quinones! Curse Words is a powerhouse of gonzo fantasy that'll melt your eyes with hypercolor wonder!
Want a closer look at the gorgeous art you'll see on every page of CURSE WORDS - THE HOLE DAMNED THING? Scroll on, friend, scroll on!
We want to send this exclusive edition direct to you, whether you’re already a fan of Wizord and Margaret or meeting them for the first time. And since the whole thing's done, this campaign is about printing, assembling and shipping the book, nothing more. We’ve assembled some great, fun extras we think you’ll love over in the rewards section. Don’t forget to check the FAQs if there’s anything we didn’t explain here, and you can always reach out to us via the contact tools on the Kickstarter, too.
"Charles Soule and Ryan Browne have conjured up one heck of a fun yarn." –IGN
Your continued support and die hard enthusiasm is why CURSE WORDS exists in the first place. We are forever in your debt, and hope you will join us one last time in making the definitive edition of our blood, sweat, and Charles tears.
All right… let’s get magical! 
-Your magical pals,
Charles & Ryan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges are minimal! Ryan has completed 5 separate Kickstarters and is a master of planning projects like this. CURSE WORDS - THE HOLE DAMNED THING is completely finished except for the new story--which has a length that will be determined by stretch goals--and will be drawn in the month after this Kickstarter is finished. We've set everything up to ensure that the book will be in our hands and shipped off to you by this August: we have quotes from the printer, shipping has been calculated and we have a great fulfillment partner - the amazing Chicago-based comic shop CHALLENGERS COMICS + CONVERSATION. CHALLENGERS is a wonderful operation; seasoned veterans in handling and shipping comics. Ryan Browne has run a series of highly successful Kickstarters, and everything he learned on those makes him more than prepared to handle this one (and he won't let Charles near anything important). Ryan will be working with Challengers to make sure you get your book in pristine condition using heavy tabbed boxes, shrink wrap, bubble wrap and USPS mail.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: FINAL DAY TO GET RYAN BROWNE'S OTHER OMNIBUS, GOD HATES ASTRONAUTS!!!
updates.update_content:
HI CURSE WORDITES! 
It's Ryan here with quick heads up about my other Kickstarter hardcover omnibus, GOD HATES ASTRONAUTS! The campaign ends in 24 hours so if you want a companion heavy ass book to co-destroy your shelf with Curse Words, now's the time to jump on it! 
GOD HATES ASTRONAUTS OMNIBUS

updates.update_userinfo: NEW RYAN BROWNE KICKSTARTER IS LIVE! BEHOLD! THE GOD HATES ASTRONAUTS OMNIBUS!
updates.update_content:
HOWDY CURSE WORDS BACKERS! THE NEW KICKSTARTER IS LIVE! My (Ryan's) other great large book GOD HATES ASTRONAUTS is now live on KS and I'm letting you know first! Here's the link! IT'S GREAT! 
GOD HATES ASTRONAUTS!

Well, it’s been quite a ride, but Ryan and I are beyond thrilled to finally be able to announce that all packages have been shipped for the CURSE WORDS - THE HOLE DAMNED THING OMNIBUS Kickstarter.

Now, that does not necessarily mean all packages have been *received* yet. Some had to travel quite a distance, through the air and over oceans and so on. That said,we think  everyone should have everything within the next few weeks. If you don’t have your stuff, and would like an update, please message Ryan and he can look up your order status.

updates.update_userinfo: Almost done and what comes next!
updates.update_content: After all the drama and unresolved tension from our last update, we want to pass along some good news - we have set up our new fulfillment situation for the remaining third of the Curse Words packages, which will allow us to be extremely hands-on with the process in a way the former solution did not. The pallets with the remaining materials - almost two tons worth! - will be arriving at the new fulfillment station at the end of the first week of March, and we will begin coordinating the re-pack and shipping process immediately thereafter. Ryan and I will be directly on top of it - no more third parties getting between you and your heavy, beautiful books.

updates.update_userinfo: What's in the box? Whaaat's innn the booooxxxx? Why, it's the CURSE WORDS OMNIBUS!
updates.update_content:
Friends!
Time for your next exciting update on where things are with shipping for the CURSE WORDS - THE HOLE DAMNED THING omnibus! STRAP IN, PALS! 

At this point, about 2/3 of the packages have been shipped by the fulfillment company we hired to assist us with that part of the process. That includes nearly all of the domestic packages, and none, unfortunately, of the international packages. Some of the packages that were shipped had errors in their contents, or suffered mild damage in the shipping process (which is not unusual - an errors/damages rate of 1-5% is typical with a complex Kickstarter, especially with a heavy book, or so we are told.) Ryan and I did a lot of organizational work early on and during the process to minimize those problems, but it's just a ton of moving pieces. Some slippage is inevitable.

updates.update_userinfo: We finally got our *ing books back! (* indicates Curse Word)
updates.update_content:
Howdy, gang! 
Ryan here with a quick update about the shipping process. Currently this fulfillment company has shipped 886 of the 1467 packages with about 95 percent accuracy--which is good-ish. It's exciting to see so many books out in the wild and we feel sorry for your shelf and it's new defined sag.

Howdy, gang!
Quick and considerably better update for y'all! Books are in transit as we speak and many have already arrived. Love seeing the posts of happy heavy books on your poor, poor shelves--so keep them coming! Books in the US are being sent via Fedex (you'll get tracking) and internationally I think it's DHL.

campaign.story:
The Story
After a botched rescue attempt by the crew of the 101, Jack finds himself with Silver, a hyper-intelligent gorilla, lost in the conduits of time. Brock, losing his life yet again, reconstitutes in his present with a fractured psyche and an interest in self improvement through furthering his experience with manufactured immortality.
 With Jack trapped in a nightmare future and Silver finding unlikely aid from Camille, Deacon, and Reese we travel ever closer to the end of Ancient Noise! 
The Team
Writer - David Crispino - Co-creator. Credits include Taft Sturgeon, Malediction of Maxwell Fitzsimmons, Ancient Noise, and The Adversary. When not sweating profusely, lifting heavy things, and taking pictures of his cats and comics, you can find him attempting and failing at social media on Twitter @davidcrispino; instagram davidcrispino; facebook @davidcrispinocomics
Artist - Tony Gregori - Fellow co-creator. Credits include Deuce of Hearts, Karma Police, Taft Sturgeon, Malediction of Maxwell Fitzsimmons, Ancient Noise, Doctor Crowe. You can find Tony bare chested and in his underwear on Twitter: @tonygregori; instagram toekneegregori
Colorist - Simon Gough - Simon Gough is a digital colourist hailing from the sunny seaside town of Brighton, UK. Colouring in comics for over 10 years now, with published credits on titles such as 'G.I Joe','TMNT', 'Transformers', and many other books across the publishing range. Facebook; Deviantart; Twitter; Instagram
Simon also creates monthly horror content, and comic shorts, with a small dedicated team over at Techni-Horror on Patreon...
Letterer - Lauren Norby - An artist and comic book letterer. When not busy making comics, he also does set dressing for film and television.  Credits include Enormous, Spiritus, and Malediction of Maxwell Fitzsimmons. You can find him on Twitter: @Lauren_T_Norby ; Instagram: @laurennorby ; Tumblr: @l-t-n
Production - Mike Riley
Production  - Rafter Roberts - Writer and Artist who has worked  in printing for over twenty years. You can find him online at Plasticfarm.com
Editor - Jimmy George - Screenwriter & Script Consultant. Producer of 7 Feature Films. Twitter@JimmyRGeorge Website https://scriptbutcher.com/services/
The Campaign and What we Have so Far
Our campaign is straightforward--Ancient Noise #3 and #4 to your door. We're able to provide you with our back issue catalog and Tony's commission work as well. Since we're launching this Kickstarter during a trying time for many of us, we're keeping our funding goal low. This Kickstarter is solely aiding us with  Shipping and offsetting Printing Costs for both issues. 
Ancient Noise #3 and #4 have finished production, printed, and are ready to be shipped out with your support. 
Rewards
**Ancient Noise #3 and #4**
The comics of course! Below are some sample pages from each issue!
Ancient Noise #3 Cover
Ancient Noise #3 Page
Ancient Noise #3 Page
Ancient Noise #4 Cover
Ancient Noise #4 Page
Ancient Noise #4 Page
**Back Issues**
We're offering Ancient Noise #1 and #2 just in case you missed them and all of our past collaborations as well!
Ancient Noise #1 :  A 26 page sci-fi adventure exploring the origin of a hyper-intelligent ape and how he meets his time traveling human companion! 
Ancient Noise #2 : 22 page sci-fi adventure. The crew of the 101 have lost one of their own, Jack, on a routine time seeding mission. Little do they know, Silver, a hyper intelligent gorilla, has brought Jack to his workshop and is attempting to coax him into completely re-writing the course of human social evolution.
The Adversary : An 18 page sword and sorcery tale about the perils of adventuring and the differences between perceived heroics and villainy.
The Malediction of Maxwell Fitzsimmons : An 18 page Lovecraftian coming of age tale. A young boy’s horrific discovery. The madness that infects him and the strength to overcome it.
Taft Sturgeon : A 35 page sci-fi comedy where an intergalactic social worker does his best to save kids.
**Commission**
9 x 12 or 11 x 17 Fully Inked commissions by Tony Gregori. Below are a few samples of his more recent works.
**PAGE REWARDS**
All pages are 11 x 17 and fully inked by illustrator and collaborator, Tony Gregori. A link will be sent to the backer of all available pages. First come, first serve.
**ADD-ON REWARDS**
With the help of John de Campos we were able to put together a fun little add-on for those of you in the CCG market! We've created our own 3/3 Beast token for use with your favorite removal spells in Magic:The Gathering!
3/3 Beast Token by John de Campos.
To receive this item add a $1 per card token to your pledge amount and we'll take care of all the specifics in the survey at the end of the campaign! 
To change your pledge amount, visit the project page and click the “Manage your pledge" button that appears next to your pledge amount and then select "Change your pledge" on the following page.
From here, you’ll be able to adjust your pledge amount or choose a new reward tier you'd like to pledge for and your pledge amount will update automatically. If you don't want to receive a reward, select "Make a pledge without a reward" and enter your new pledge amount. Alternatively, you may change your pledge amount within the reward tier modal.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Ancient Noise 3 and 4 are printed and in hand, ready to be shipped to you after the end of the campaign. 

I've run seven successful Kickstarters; I learn something new each time and continue to grow and make subtle and effective changes to every project I work on.

Tony and I (David) have been working on projects together for a little over 6 years now and we are, if anything, consistent with problem solving and delivery.

Of course there can be unforeseen setbacks, but as you know I'll be honest with you if anything happens that would impact our shipping date. I guarantee your receipt of backed items regardless of any production issues.

Thanks again for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

First and foremost, Ancient Noise 5 is half way through the coloring process and looking incredible. Here's a nice page for you all with a little bit of yucky in it.

Starweed debuts tomorrow on Kickstarter! Make sure you back it and keep the comics coming.

Ancient Noise 5 is currently being colored and I should have some pages to share with you soon.

Hey all, just wanted to let you know that a majority of rewards have been shipped. We're still waiting for a few survey responses and if you're part of that group, no big deal, get to it when you can. You've been patient with us and we're patient with you.
For those of you who are still waiting on your rewards, we'll be shipping all page rewards and commission rewards together. Tony is nailing these.

campaign.story:
In 1895, legendary genius and inventor Nikola Tesla had a fire that burned his lab to the ground; he later claimed that this tragedy set his work back 50 years. In the world of Electropunk, this fire never happened. So, by the beginning of our story in 1910, Nikola Tesla is one of the wealthiest and most influential men in the world. As a byproduct of his wealth and scientific progress, he makes a shocking discovery: there are, in fact, things that go bump in the night. He discovers that there is some truth to most of the world’s myths and legends, and there are all manner of creatures preying on an unsuspecting humanity.
So, Tesla takes matters into his own hands.
He starts by raising his orphaned niece and nephew, twins Ruthie and Chuck, to be mankind’s sword and shield. Tesla designs suits of enhanced armor to protect both their bodies and their identities. In short, they have to become monsters to combat monsters.
PLAY

Our goal of this project is to produce a full-color 8.5 x 11 graphic novel with more than 100 pages of beautifully detailed illustrations. The original product will be a physical graphic novel with several upgrades available as stretch goals listed below are unlocked.  As the stretch goals are unlocked the physical books will be upgraded for ALL backers that have pledged $25 or more. For instance, when we unlock the $45,000 stretch goal, all physical backers will receive hardcover editions of the book, etc.
Good news everyone: We're doing the Audio Drama we had planned as one of our future stretch goals NOW! and ALL Backers at $50 and above will automatically have this included in their Rewards!
Ruthie and Chuck leap off the page brought to life by legendary voice actors Lauren Landa and Jason Charles Miller!
Born and raised in Los Angeles, CA, Lauren began acting at an early age. For over a decade, in the world behind the mic, Lauren has appeared in over one hundred Anime and video game projects and has worked with productions such as Aniplex of America, Viz Media, Netflix, Nintendo, and more!
She is most known for roles such as Kasumi in Dead or Alive 5;  Kyoko Sakura in Puella Magi Madoka Magica; Yan Leixia in Soul Calibur V;  Squigly in Skullgirls; Leia in Tales of Xillia; Annie Leonhardt in the hit anime series Attack on Titan, Female Robin in Fire Emblem and Super Smash Brothers, Sailor Neptune in VIZ Media’s Sailor Moon, Merlin in The Seven Deadly Sins, Karin Kanzuki in Street Fighter V, Juno in Beastars and many more!
Jason Charles Miller is a critically acclaimed and highly accomplished singer/songwriter. As a voice actor, Jason has appeared in over 100 animated series and video games. Highlights include Gundam: Iron-Blooded Orphans (Ashton), Attack on Titan, Neverwinter Online (Drizzt Do’Urden), Avatar: The Last Airbender, The Legend of Korra, World of Warcraft, Kingdom Hearts III, Mafia III, Final Fantasy 7 Remake, Final Fantasy 14, and Hearthstone. A life-long Dungeons and Dragons enthusiast, Jason hosts the Geek & Sundry show Starter Kit and is the host and creator of On Tour With Dragons, which appears on the official Dungeons and Dragons YouTube and Twitch channels.
And that's not including B. Dave Walters and some other surprise friends who might show up to help!
Exclusive Electropunk Copper Metal Dice: A $160 value! and ALL Backers at $250 and above will automatically have this included in their Rewards!
We've partnered with Level Up Dice to create new exclusive dice that won't be available anywhere else!  Yes, these are copper dice that will go green over time! Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with a very high thermal and electrical conductivity that Tesla used extensively!
These Copper Metal Dice are CNC machined and then engraved with a special font only available on this limited run.
Announcing all-new exclusive Referrer Gifts!
Through our partnership with Level Up Dice, we've developed some new swag that will never be available anywhere else!
These will be exclusive thank you gifts for any of our backers who refer someone else who then becomes a backer.
First up: This 6063 Precision Aluminum D20 has been CNC Machined, Anodized, and Laser Etched with the Electropunk Logo!
We'll be revealing more thank you gifts as we get the prototypes finished!
The second Referral Gift is a 4d6 set that comes together inside of a magnetized case, forming the faces of the Electropunk heroes Ruthie and Chuck!
PLAY

PLAY

A concept artist and illustrator with over four years of experience in the video game industry, Natalia has a deep passion for creating worlds, designing and solving problems, and loves bringing great ideas to life in a beautiful way.
https://nataliabacetti.com/
PLAY
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There's one variable we can't control: The COVID-19 Pandemic! Most affordable printing options are out of China, and it is impossible to know when the factories will reopen, or how backlogged they will be. We are compensating for this by delivering digital editions as soon as they are available, but we have no way of knowing when we can deliver the physical products. 

We have carefully calculated the production and shipping costs pre-pandemic, and we will communicate with you as soon as we have firm timeline estimates. 
While there are many things we can plan ahead of time, we realize there are inevitably unforeseen circumstances that may arise when working with printing and fulfilling a large number of orders. We will be transparent about the status of the project along the way so backers will be the first to know if complications come up.

In order to keep backers up to date on the project, we've included the "project status" as well for extra transparency. We want this to be a journey we take together!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi Everybody!!

However, Electropunk has still been humming along!  When we get a chance, we'll give you all a more detailed update.  But for now,  here's a couple panels of bg paints from recent pages...  as usual Natalia is just killing it!
