project_data.project_name: Electropunk: Children of the Future

campaign.story:
The High Concept: Independent professional wrestling's hottest stars brawl with malicious hackers and sinister cosmic forces in a MacGruber-style  parody of an early 1990s action film. Wrestler and mercenary-for-hire WARHORSE encounters a local wrestling champion with terrifying hypnotic power, and must enlist unpredictable demon Danhausen and his former partner Allie Kat in order to save reality.
WARHAUSEN core cover by Lauren Moran
Breakdown of Base Goal:
50%  Remainder of Art Costs 
50% - Reward creation and campaign fulfillment
Any overrun from the base goal will go toward expedited fulfillment of rewards and recouping the total production cost.
The demon within Danhausen emerges at the Devil's behest.
 The Story:
Metalhead warrior WARHORSE only has two goals in his life - to bang heads and rule ass! Following a successful mission saving the world from a nuclear threat, Warhorse receives a mysterious message requesting he be present for "bookings and signings" at a pro wrestling event at an iconic Southern California arena.
His opponent is no ordinary tomato can, but instead the mighty Mr. Impressive, the only pro wrestler approved by the Comics Code Authority. The devil himself, recognizing that WARHORSE is outmatched by this cosmically powered grappler, dispatches his unwilling apprentice Danhausen to even the odds. However, Danhausen discovers that WARHORSE must resolve his issues with former tag partner Allie Kat, or this plane of existence may be lost forever.  
Why was WARHAUSEN Created?
I (Jason) am a lifelong wrestling fan, first falling in love with it during the classic WrestleMania VIII event and becoming a fan for life during the Bret Hart vs. Owen Hart feud in the mid-1990s. I have written for multiple wrestling websites, including  socaluncensored.com and the now-defunct thesmartmarks.com as a reviewer and interviewer, but have always been looking for a more creative way to give back to the community that has provided me with so many memories and friendships.
I was inspired to do a character profile comic by recent works like Chido Comics' Joey Ryan: Big in Japan and Luchaverse series, but had not found the right muse until I came across the trio of WARHORSE, Danhausen, and Allie Kat. These three are tireless creatives, and are at the forefront of bringing larger-than-life, colorful characters back to independent professional wrestling. Plus, they are genuinely good people and I wanted to reward the bright lights in the industry. My longtime friend Mr. Impressive, a Southern California-based wrestling champion, was a natural Silver Age foil to "wrestling's wildest renegades."
A new meaning to the term "splash page."
I am thrilled that Megan Huang was so enthusiastic when I pitched this idea to her, and equally delighted that Lauren Moran, who has created so many incredible pro wrestling illustrations, joined this project as the cover artist. Rob Jones, one of the top letterers in UK comics, has also joined the comic and is currently doing a fantastic job making the dialogue pop! We hope you enjoy what we're putting together, and that you feel it does justice to WARHAUSEN!   
Warhose enters the Gateway to Oblivion
Who Will Love WARHAUSEN?
Pro wrestling fans who love the independent scene
Anyone who has enjoyed genre parody films like The Naked Gun, Hot Shots!, Robin Hood: Men in Tights, and Spaceballs.
Comics readers who enjoy off-the-wall humor series like Gwenpool and the classic Justice League International  
The grandest stage of them all!
Creative Team  
 Jason Doring, Co-Creator/Writer: Jason is a member of the North Shore chapter of the Boston Comics Roundtable, and holds a Bachelor's degree in Film and Television from Boston University as well as a MA in Integrated Marketing Communication from Emerson College. The debut issue of his first ongoing series, The Naked Eye, was released in August 2019 following a successful Kickstarter campaign. His anthology contributions include Little Heroes Comics Charity Anthology Vol. 3 ,and the upcoming STARBOUND and Boston Powers series from the Boston Comics Roundtable. 
Megan Huang, Co-Creator/Interior Art: Megan is an accomplished Toronto-based sequential artist whose credits include the upcoming Jia and the Nian Monster from Dark Horse Comics, Double Jumpers and Princeless from Action Lab Entertainment,  a backup story in the Image Comics series Tartarus, titled Life, and a backup story in IDW's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles spin-off series Jennika. Megan is also a concept artist, most notably creating concept work for Chapterhouse comics. Her full portfolio can be viewed at http://meganhuang.daportfolio.com/ 
Rob Jones, Letterer - Rob Jones is a prolific comic book writer and letterer based in Eggborough, England, and is a part of the Madius Comics production house. A winner of the Ashcan Letterer of the Year Award, Rob's impressive CV includes The Phantom: Strikes by Lightning Strikes Comics, Freedom Bound by BHP Comics, Masque by Ovation Comics, and Herd by Floating Rock Comics. His portfolio can be seen at his WordPress page. 
Lauren Moran, Cover Artist:  Lauren is an illustrator and licensed graphic apparel designer residing in Manhattan. Her designs can be seen in stores across the US, including Hot Topic, WWE Shop, and Target. Her illustrations have also been featured in the WWE Topps SLAM trading card app. Lauren also creates promotional artwork for independent professional wrestling promotions in her spare time, and she drew the iconic bloody print of Becky Lynch during Lynch's rise to WrestleMania superstardom. Her portfolio can be found at https://artoflaurenmoran.carbonmade.com/
Praise for the Creative Team: 
"Mr. Doring is clearly enjoying himself with this comic...[he] is, it seems, very good at juxtaposing humour with disturbing content...there is craftsmanship in the plot, dialogue and artistic layout." - DG Stewart, World Comic Book Review
"The characters are nuanced & emotive, and Doring offers up a line-up that makes it very easy to invest yourselves in their lives..." - CJ Pendragon, Sirens of Sequentials
Megan Huang's art is a perfect complement to the storytelling, it brings out the nuances with the body language and expressions of the cast. There is a joyous lightness to the art that never softens the impact of anger or violence, it places it firmly in its context. - Conor Carton, Dancing with Skeletons
Rewards
This project plans to offer unique rewards for fans of WARHORSE, Danhausen, and Allie Kat. Lauren's cover will be available as a metal print AND a t-shirt, both of which will only be available during this Kickstarter. 
Backers will also receive a "Special Thanks" credit in the book, and a shoutout from the @comicwarhausen Twitter account! Premium tiers include the opportunity to be drawn into the book itself and have their characters interact with the WARHAUSEN team!
We are also proud to announce a variant cover drawn by Megan, which will only be available during the Kickstarter and Megan's future convention appearances. Check it out below!
Megadeth-inspired variant cover by Megan Huang!
I (Jason) am in constant contact with WARHORSE, Danhausen, Allie, and Mr. Impressive to brainstorm reward tiers that may take place during the Kickstarter, including stickers, pins, and signed 8x10s. Stay tuned to this page and check your email for updates on new rewards during the campaign!
Allie Kat Stickers and Signed Photos!
WARHORSE Signed 8x10s! Backers in this tier will receive one of these photos!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The WARHAUSEN script is complete, and Megan Huang is in the process of completing interior art. One of the goals of this Kickstarter is to provide her remaining compensation, but this will be paid out of pocket if the Kickstarter does not meet its funding target. The wrestlers involved have already been compensated for this project and it has their official endorsement.

The target completion date for this project is late August/early September, but there may be delays if there are sudden changes to Megan's other professional responsibilities, or COVID-19 hinders reward production going into the summer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
FINALLY, all physical rewards have shipped!

Thank you to all backers for your patience in receiving your goods, as I know we ended up several months behind schedule due to a huge variety of factors - some personal, some logistical. We hope you have enjoyed what you've received and the WARHAUSEN team delivered on expectations. Lessons have definitely been learned for any future campaigns to make fulfillment much faster going forward.

Hi everyone,
I sent out the good news on Twitter yesterday - all physical rewards for the Kat's Meow tier, and US backers of the Ultimate Fanhausen tier, have had their packages shipped!
This leaves 6 backers with physical rewards left to send out. 
The 2 non-US Ultimate Fanhausens
4 more from Stuck on Warhausen
For the 2 Ultimate Fanhausens, the only reason those are not out yet is I ran out of metal prints (my inventory management has admittedly been crap) - I put in an order from Printique to get them out.

Hey all,

I hope everyone is getting ready for a fun and safe night watching the Big Game (I don't want to get sued), and if you're a backer outside the US, hanging in there as we head to the deep freeze of winter.

updates.update_userinfo: Latest on Fulfillment and Sequel Announcement Coming!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,

I sent out the latest batch of rewards today - if you backed Kat Scratch Fever (Allie Kat autograph tier) they are all on their way! 50% of the Championship Package (WARHORSE autograph tier) have also gone out, with the rest shipping later this week.

updates.update_userinfo: December 5th Fulfillment Update - Holiday Rush Check
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Fulfillment is still ongoing, with the next round focusing on the T-Shirt and Heavy Metal tiers. I apologize for this taking so long - we lost a month from the planned delivery date due to last-minute writing/art fixes, and since I'm the only one fulfilling the orders with no outside support, while still handling job and family duties, it's taking much longer than expected.

Hello everyone!
Thank you for your patience regarding fulfillment. Here is how it is currently progressing.

I have sent out 77 of the physical rewards packages thus far. If you have pledged to the following, filled out the survey, and I have your most current address, you should have it in hand within the coming week (if you live in the US - international shipping may take longer).

Hi all!
If you're an active follower of our Twitter page (@comicwarhausen), you found out that all of the books have arrived!

Hi everyone, 
Since the digital version was initially released at the beginning of the month, we have updated the content twice to correct typos and some minor story elements. If you want to see the final version of the story, you can re-download the comic from your Google Drive.
Printing Update:

Good news everyone!
Digital Get Down!
The backers' digital edition of WARHAUSEN is now LIVE! You should have received a Google Drive link in your inbox earlier today. If you have any trouble accessing the file, please let me know.

project_data.project_name: WARHAUSEN: The Official Comic!

campaign.story:
So, a high school necromancer and a girl destined to die go on a road trip...
Meet Cherry Gilbert. She's the best senior necromancer at Destiny University, but she wishes she could break away from it all. She finds herself haunted by death, and she wants that to change. Now.
Enter: Meadow Katz. She's a sophomore who used to be the most happy-go-lucky girl in school, until she found out that she is destined to die. Soon. She may still be a Pumpkin Spice Latte feueled motor mouth, but she shares a darkness with Cherry that will take them on a dangerous journey.
Oh, and the bird? That's Craven. He's a spirit, and they are not allowed to have him, so keep that quiet.
CHERRY GIBLERT: NECROMANCER is a 70-page graphic novel written by Vita Ayala (X-Men, Nebula, James Bond, Morbius, Supergirl, Wonder Woman, The Wilds) & me (Pat Shand, writer/creator of Destiny NY, Afterglow, Breathless, Little Girl, Snap Flash Hustle and more) and illustrated by Matteo Leoni (Titanium: Blade). 
Here's some of Matteo's scarily beautiful interior art for the book:
In addition to our haunting main cover by the amazing Joanna Barnum, we have a special, super limited variant cover by superstar artist Jenn St-Onge.
JENN ST-ONGE VARIANT -- ONLY THROUGH KICKSTARTER!

Both covers are unique and beautiful in their own ways, including the way they were made. Watch this timelapse video of Joanna painting the main cover to see Cherry come to life!
PLAY

CHERRY GILBERT: NECROMANCER was introduced in my series DESTINY, NY... an ongoing graphic novel saga about what happens to a prophecy girl AFTER she completes her foretold destiny.
If you want to catch up on Cherry's past, you can also get all four volumes of DESTINY, NY through this Kickstarter! They are available in print and digital.
We have completed the entire first (of three total) chapters of Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer. We will continue production through the end of the summer, at which point we will prep for print with plans to deliver to backers in December. 
We always pay extra during production for extremely high-quality books with thick, velvety paper quality. Here's a glimpse at how the Destiny, NY books came out.
PLAY

Keep reading to check out our amazing rewards, including:
the graphic novel itself
the chance to get drawn into the book
enamel pin
behind-the-scenes PDF
signed bookplate
and more!
**This reward includes Cherry and Destiny, NY Volumes 1 - 4 in both paperback and PDF form** 
 Message me or comment to customize your order! Add the amounts below to get these awesome rewards.
Now, I wanted to give backers the chance to add on any non-Destiny, NY Universe book that you've missed. This includes every book I've Kickstarted so far, all of which you can now add-on. As a collective, we call ourselves Space Between Entertainment, and this is our library!
Add on any of these books that we at Space Between Entertainment have successfully Kickstarted!
 Prison Witch: A mystical thriller about the magic that happens behind bars at a women's prison. Two volumes so far, with more to come. Volume 1 has a cover by Jenn St-Onge, and Volume 2 has a cover by Natasha Alterici. Written by Amy Shand & Pat Shand, illustrated by Erica D'Urso.
 Afterglow: A post-apocalyptic epic about a girl and her giant, radioactive cat. Written by Pat Shand, illustrated in full color by K. Lynn Smith.
 Spooky Girls: A full-color, graphic novel made up of 4 new monster comics, each written by Pat Shand and illustrated by different artists: Jenny the Werecat, Vicky Slime, Punk Teen Demon Queen, & Tarantula Twins.
 Modern Dread: A horror anthology about modern anxieties. Created by Ryan Fassett & Pat Shand, including contributions from ARMY OF DARKNESS artist Larry Watts, THE WALKING DEAD (TV Series) writer LaToya Morgan, & more.
 Clonsters: A young Earth Nugget attempts to find her lost Splat in this all-ages adventure about monsters made out of clay. Written by Amy Shand & Pat Shand, with illustration by Vanessa Cardinali. Two Volumes so far!
For the multi-volume series (Destiny NY, Prison Witch, Clonsters) please be sure to list if you want to add-on the full series. If not, please specify which volume you'd like to add.
A little more on these:
 STRETCH GOAL #1: UNLOCKED! Every single backer will receive this stunning art card by Destiny, NY artist and co-creator Manuel Preitano! Print backers will receive a thick, glossy, cardstock art piece and digital backers will receive a hi-res downloadable file. Take a closer look at the artwork below.
 STRETCH GOAL #2: UNLOCKED! We will add spot gloss to the cover AND back cover of the standard edition of Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer, making the book even more beautiful. 
 STRETCH GOAL #3: UNLOCKED! The book expands! We add a bonus prose story written by Pat Shand that directly connects Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer to the main, ongoing Destiny, NY series. (This will be new reader friendly for the unfamiliar, while also giving longtime Destiny, NY readers something new and special.)
 STRETCH GOAL #4: UNLOCKED! We will add illustration to the new bonus story! Welcome artist EVE MAE to the book for this extra surprise!
 STRETCH GOAL #5: When we hit $20K, we have one last surprise... you've unlocked a bonus, full-length audio commentary to Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer by Pat Shand... and maybe a few secret guests. The audio file will be posted to Soundcloud and YouTube.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between this and the projects I've funded over at our collaborative Space Between company page, this is my 15th Kickstarter campaign. In a creative endeavor of this size, possible challenges could be delays in production or printing depending on the current situation with the quarantine, considering we ship overseas. However, we have successfully Kickstarted multiple projects before as creators AND as a team, which has given us the utmost confidence that we'll meet and exceed your expectations, no matter what is happening in the world. When hiccups are hit, we send updates. When we receive our shipment, we get them our to backers immediately without delay. I mean, why would we want to hold onto the books when we're so eager for YOU to read them?

One thing that we can't control is customs charges. We pay more for international shipping than we charge, but some countries will charge an extra customs fee based on the prices of the items included. Our advice there would just be to be aware of that.

Our backers deserve the absolute best, and we promise to deliver the highest quality, the best communication, and all questions answered within 24 hours or less -- ALWAYS!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #22: Books are at port, just waiting to receive
updates.update_content:
Hey Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer backers,

Not too too much to share, but I saw through Kickstarter's new feature that a couple of backers were requesting an update, so I figured I'd expedite this one. I'm happy to share the news I have here, which again, while not much, is something. I reached out to PrintLore to follow up on their last email which, in mid-May, told me that our books were due to hit the United States port on May 26th. Sam at PrintLore confirmed that the books are indeed here:

Hey Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer backers!

I received an update from the printer yesterday! According to PrintLore, the books are scheduled to hit the United States port around May 26th. This is actually quicker than usual, so I was happy to hear this. Now, what this doesn't mean though is that books arrive to ME by that date. With my last shipment of Destiny, NY Volume 4 and Prison Witch Volume 2, they were backed up at port for some time before finally shipping to me. That, though, was when COVID was much worse and the port even briefly shut down, so I expect much less of a wait now. My hope is that the next update will be able to confirm shipping has begun.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #20: Digital copies of CHERRY GILBERT: NECROMANCER have been sent!
updates.update_content:
Hi Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer backers!

A short update this month, as it will still be a good while until we hear back on a timeline from the printer now that the files are sent. I'm here to let you all know, though, that digital copies of Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer have been sent! If you backed at the digital level, you should have a download link in your Kickstarter messages. If you backed at that level and don't have it, please message me and I'll reply with the link. (Just please check your pledge to be sure it includes digital before you do so, though!)

Hey Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer backers!

We've slipped a bit from the schedule I thought we'd be on last month, but the truth is that we've been doing a LOT of fine-tuning on the lettered proof. Sorry, I just want to make sure it's PERFECT! We finally have the book to where we're all super thrilled with it, both Vita and I have given our final notes, we are IN LOVE with this book, and we're sending it to the printer on Monday! (This comes JUST IN TIME for me to double down on focusing on shipping books, as and are set to arrive to me this coming week -- don't miss those updates if you backed those campaigns!) In the next few days, likely between Tuesday and Thursday, digital backers will be receiving : as a downloadable link right here on your Kickstarter messages! Thanks to everyone who made this possible -- we are now in the endgame!

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #18: Ready for print! Complete proof, digital copies imminent
updates.update_content:
Hey Cherry Gilbert backers!

Okay, so, we have a print date. I'm asking the printer if we can print on Monday, March 8th. We have a completed, edited proof but the creative team needs a week to go through one, final dialogue and copy edit. Once that is done, two things happen:
We send to the printer (currently, the only thing we're waiting on from them is to come back with info regarding printing location, either Taiwan or Canada, so we can instruct you on an exact shipping time, as these two locations yield very different shipping speeds)

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #17: Final art update, sending to print, merch
updates.update_content:
Hey Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer backers,

All right, so first up, the artwork for Chapter Three is DONE! We've asked for a few final edits, but that's it. We're at the end of the road and it has been a very fun and, in our final chapter, VERY creepy one. When I was looking at certain scenes, I thought, "Damn... we wrote this!? We're messed up."

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #16: Artwork, Letters, Production Finishing -- Our BIGGEST UPDATE yet!
updates.update_content:
Hi Cherry Gilbert backers!

Here we are with our December update, closing out 2020. I hope everyone had a happy holiday and, of course, please be safe if you're celebrating the New Year in any kind of way.

In this update, I have new art to show you from both the main story and the bonus story, as well as news regarding our progress. In order to keep it brief, let's bullet-list it up:

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #15: Chapter 3 artwork, Destiny NY Vo 4 PDFs sent
updates.update_content:
Hey Cherry Gilbert: Necromancer backers!

Hope all of you who celebrate had an amazing Thanksgiving. We're back here with the November 2020 update. The whole team has been working hard on getting this book done, and it's looking like mid to late-December is going to be our finish line. I coordinated with Jim Campbell (our incredible letterer and designer) and he's working on getting us done by this time. Meanwhile, while Matteo draws Chapter Three, he's also going back to make some changes to Chapter One to make for a beautiful and consistent graphic novel. The Chapter One changes are very minor stuff, just little tweaks to make sure certain supporting characters are consistent.

Hey Cherry Gilbert backers!

I have an art-centric update for you this time. The incredible Matteo Leoni has finished the full greyscale shading of Chapter 2 and is going right into our third and final chapter, which we will be completing in November. We appreciate your patience in allowing us the time to get this story right, as it means quite a lot to everyone on the team. Now, as we get close to ending the production of the book, we'll begin to send out surveys so we can collect your information, but those will go out closer to our print date to make sure everyone's addresses are up to date. I'm estimating that will happen around this time next month, likely a week or so before that.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #13: Finishing Chapter 2, scheduling the end of production, new campaign!
updates.update_content:
Hey CHERRY GILBERT: NECROMANCER backers!

This update is a bit narrative-focused. I shared this on social media but wanted to tell this story here, too. The way that Vita and I write CHERRY has pretty much been that we'll talk out the rough shape of a chapter, pick scenes, and then Vita will write their portion, and then I'll pick up from where they left off and finish. Then, I'll send it to Vita and we'll continue that same process. When discussing the very end of the book, though, we had an awesome moment. We had a call set to do the same thing, just essentially work out the rough shape of how we'd do the ending... but basically, we were so HYPED about what we're doing in the end that we essentially verbally wrote it on the phone together. We worked out, beat for beat, an ending that stays true to the original plan while also delivering something fresh that I think you're going to love.

project_data.project_name: CHERRY GILBERT - NECROMANCER by Vita Ayala & Pat Shand

campaign.story:
We're excited to announce the return of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman  in Puppets, the new 3 issue story arc from writer Tom Ward and artist Luke Parker, with letters from Micah Myers. 
Still reeling from the shocking revelations in Monsters, Merrick stumbles into a trap set by the broken and maniacal Punch and Judy. Meanwhile, friction between Dr Frederick Treves and his friends comes to a head over his disastrous dabblings in the dark arts, and old enemies make an unwelcome return.
As always, thanks to our returning backers for your continuing support, we couldn't do this without you. And if you're new to our comic, a warm welcome to the sensational adventures of The Elephantman, the most remarkable human being ever to draw the breath of life! 
Puppets is a perfect jumping on point for new readers, but you can also check out the series from the beginning by downloading issue #1 for FREE.
ISSUE #9 PREVIEW
Check out the cover for issue 9, and the opening pages, all drawn by Luke. If you love them as much as we do, the artwork is available as pledge rewards.
ISSUE #10 COVER
ISSUE #11 COVER

THE WORLD OF MERRICK
Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman is a Victorian penny dreadful pulp adventure comic set in 1880s' London. Based on a fictional version of the life of Joseph Merrick, it steps between historical facts and turn of the century folklore juxtaposed with the superhero comic conventions of super powers, masks, secret identities and fantastic adventures.



QUALITY COMICS
If you've encountered any of our physical issues of Merrick I'm sure you have noticed the print quality and the nice distinctive feel they have, it's something we feel really passionate about.
We're striving to make every issue of Merrick something special, an item that you will want to keep. These are not disposable comics.
Both issues are beautifully presented, full colour, standard US size comics printed on heavy stock 120GSM uncoated bond paper. Issue #9 is 24 pages, #10 is 20 pages, #11 is 28 pages, all plus covers.
As with all single issues of Merrick, issue's #9 - #11 will be limited numbered runs of 500 never to be reprinted with the same cover.
A maximum of 2 print runs for each issue.
All single issues are shipped bagged and boarded to ensure they reach you looking as great as they went out.
We'll also send you digital versions of each issue in .pdf and .cbr formats so you can enjoy issues of Merrick on the move on your tablet, smartphone or PC.
Although issue #1 of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman is completely sold out, there is still a chance to build an impressive collection of single issues by picking up copies of #2 - #8 with less than 60 copies of Merrick #2 left!
Don't worry about missing any of the story, you can download issue #01 in .PDF/.CBR absolutely free. 
Getting up to 11 issues is a huge achievement for any comic series. We're super excited to be making more books. Everything we've published to date is available on this Kickstarter.

THE TEAM
Tom Ward: Writer and creator of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman. Tom is also co-creator and writer of Doc Dino and has been published in Comichaus, The Grime, British Showcase Anthology and has a story in Rum Row later this year. @highbrowtrash  
Luke Parker: Artist, colourist, designer and co-creator of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman. You may have also seen his work on SEX, or The Winternational (Image Comics), or Halloween Eagle (Dark Horse Comics). @artofparker www.artofparker.com 
Micah Myers: As a freelance comic book letterer, Micah has lettered a host of comics for Image, Dark Horse, IDW, and many more. @micahmyers
Clare Lenton: Freelance editor and senior content designer, with a Masters degree in English Literature, specialising in Gothic literature. @ClareLenton
THANK YOU
Thanks to the amazing Kickstarter community, we have been able to create and release the first 8 issues of Merrick, a one-shot spin-off; Treves: A Restless Night and a special cross-over issue; Merrick & Crowe: Birds of Prey. 
We love making this comic, and we think it keeps getting better as a series as we learn and improve as creators, and we have you guys to thank for that for giving us these opportunities.
Now it's time to continue Joseph Merrick's story so we've returned to Kickstarter to hopefully fund the fourth arc.
All our books, plus prints and t-shirts, are available at our webstore www.merrickcomic.co.uk or digitally over at Comixology. 
WHAT THE REVIEWS SAY
"In each issue, you can feel the love, sweat, and tears the team put into their work. Although the art and some story beats take inspiration from Mike Mignola and some Hellboy, it stands apart creating its own history in indie comics, and it'll carve out its own slice in your heart and brain, making you crave more of the world." - www.comicbookyeti.com
"the art and story in Merrick grows with confidence in every issue and with each arc Ward and Parker find their voice more and more – as well as feeling free to experiment with where the story is heading. The artwork also becomes more imaginative and iconic (and less derivative), with Parker creating this dark and angular style which manages to perfectly evoke Victorian London, but also has a modern edge to it at the same time. A book that really definitely deserves the use of the word sensational!" -www.pipedreamcomics.co.uk
"Merrick started off as a character surrounded by myths who I felt I had half an idea of where this adventure could go – but the creative team have surprised me time & again and that’s made me come back to the title to re-read, rediscovery and enjoy.  A great character that has been filled up with endless potential thanks to Tom & Luke and eight issues in there’s still so much more for it to give.  Can’t wait for issue nine and beyond." - ComicsAnonymous
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not my first, second, or indeed third rodeo, this is my EIGHTH Kickstarter.

I have delivered on all my previous projects, and things are a fairly well oiled machine at this point. The art for issue #9 is already completed, and will be heading to be lettered as I type this.

I've scheduled in plenty of breathing room on the completion date and I will always keep you updated on our progress.

I love making this comic, it really is a passion project for me and I am 100% dedicated to getting it finished and out to you all.

Obviously the COVID-19 pandemic is currently making things somewhat unpredictable. Currently the UK post offices are still open and our printer is still working, but these things could change. Digital issues will of course go out as they are ready. If there are any unavoidable delays I will keep you promptly updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi guys

Thanks again for backing our Puppets story arc. I really hope you've had time to read and enjoy the comics.

This is just a real quick update to let you know that we have just launched a new campaign for the second collected edition trade paperback of Merrick, that contains issues #5-8, and the out of print Merrick & Crowe cross-over.

Hi guys
I have now finished dispatching the last of the pledge rewards for the campaign, and it seems packages are also starting to turn up!

Thank you so much for being part of this Kickstarter and allowing us the opportunity to make more comics. I really hope you enjoy the comics and are pleased with your decision to back us.

Hello everyone.

Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #11 is back from the printers. It came out perfect!

Hi!

Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #11 is finished!

The .PDF and .CBR files are in your Kickstarter inboxes now! (Unless you pledged just for VOL.1)

Hi guys
I've had a request for an update on the campaign, so here's just a quick out to let you know where we're up to on issue #11

MERRICK #11 PROGRESS

Hi guys
Hope everyone is doing OK.
UK backers should now all have received their copies of Merrick #10. I hope you've enjoyed it!

Hi everyone,
Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #10 is back from the printers. As always Comic Printing UK has done an outstanding job and the physical books are looking great.

Hi guys,
Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #10 is FINISHED!
The .PDF and .CBR files are in your Kickstarter inboxes now! (Unless you pledged just for VOL.1)
The files have also been sent to the printers. That stuff will all get finalised this week, and I would hope we will have the books back and begin shipping next week.

Hi guys
Just a quick update to keep you in the loop.
Because of the current COVID-19 situation my post office is currently extremely busy and dealing with extra strain from other offices in the area being closed. This means they're currently only letting me send out 10 packages at a time, which is absolutely fair enough and completely understandable, but it does mean it's taking me a little longer to get copies of issue #9 out to the UK backers. I've sent a fair chunk of the parcels out already, and I'm also sending everyone a message to let them know when their book has been dispatched, hopefully I should have all the copies of issue #9 out by the end of  next week.

Hi guys
Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #9 is back from the printers and looking great. Once again Comic Printing UK has done an amazing job. I'm so excited to get these books out to you guys.

campaign.story:
THE CATCH is a 3-issue comic book mini-series written and lettered by Steve Bryant, with art by Ismael Canales, colors by Mireia Girbau, and edited by Chris Murrin—the first of many mini-series. If you backed our previous campaign, thank you very much! We’re incredibly thankful to our Kickstarter community and we're going to do our best to pack each campaign with as many cool exclusives as we can for you. If you’re new to the book, thanks for checking us out!  
This campaign is to raise funds to print issue #2 and hopefully hit a couple of Stretch Goals. (We have some exciting ones lined up that we’re dying to tell you about.) If you were with us for issue 1, the story continues here. If you're new to THE CATCH, both issues are avilable in this campaign, and here's a quick overview ...
When super-villains like Galactoid, Dron the Conqueror, or Professor Kill are defeated, they're sent to a government maximum security facility. But what about small-timers like Phileas Frost, The Grappler, or the random jump-suited agents of H.A.R.M.? What happens to the bank robbers, jewel thieves, and anonymous henchmen? 
They post bail. 
And sometimes, they skip town afterward. That's where Lucy Chase comes in. 
 Lucy comes from a family of law enforcement folks, but spends her days working for bail bondsman Leon Tilman, chasing down costumed criminals who jump bail. Keeping super-powered lowlifes in line is a dangerous job; especially when you don't have super-powers yourself. Bounty hunters who specialize in supers are few and far between, keeping Lucy in high demand. 
Deputy U.S. Marshal Jack Devlin is Lucy’s on-again, off-again love interest. Jack’s assigned to the Federal Powered and Supernatural Crimes Joint Task Force, but he sometimes provides unofficial backup when Lucy has a bounty. 
So far, Lucy and Jack have crossed paths with some interesting criminals who are very interested in their activities.
Issue #2 finds new adversaries crossing Lucy and Jack's path.
And now everyone—criminals, the authorities, and Lucy & Jack—are all on a collision course. 
 Money raised will go toward artist and colorist fees, printing, backer rewards, and shipping. If we're lucky enough to exceed our goal, all additional funding will be put directly back into the book in the form of additional rewards and production of the next issue.
In English... 
 And in Español (digital)…
 Main cover by Ismael Canales and Mireia Girbau.
 Variant Cover by Steve Bryant and Jason Millet.
 "Movie Poster" Variant Cover by Ismael Canales and Jason Millet.
We have a wide variety of rewards lined up, from digital comics, to physical comics and variant covers, to"Catch-Up" combos that  bring new readers up to speed, to Collector Boxes, to original art, and more!
 If you support a Kickstarter campaign, the last thing you want is for your books to arrive damaged! With that in mind, all of our physical packages are being shipped in Gemini Comic Mailers. These things are practically nuke-proof, insuring that your comics arrive in great condition!
 The only physical reward levels that won't come in these mailers are the Collector Boxes which are wrapped in bubble-wrap and shipped in Priority Mail medium boxes, and the original art & "Draw Me In" rewards, which are shipped flat between multiple sheets of corrugated cardboard, insuring no bending.
 • Fans of super-hero crime comics, like Gotham Central, Jessica Jones/Alias, or Powers.
• People who like heist or caper movies, or TV shows like Justified or Better Call Saul.
• Indie comic collectors looking to get in on the ground floor of a new book, filled with action, clever dialogue, and great visuals. 
 The Catch #2 is a 32-page standard-sized American comic, printed on high-quality paper.
The extra-sized first and second issues include 24 sequential pages of action, along with some great concept art. 
All backers will also receive TWO digital versions of issue 2: digital versions in English and Español, as well as being listed in the digital edition of issue 2.
 Stretch Goals! If we exceed our funding target, these stretch goals are milestones where you, the backers, get even more stuff!
Stretch Goal #1 ($9,000) Stick Around!: A sticker logo with the awesome logo for The Catch will be included in all physical/print reward levels!
Stretch Goal #2 ($11,000) Keep In Touch! An oversized postcard featuring the "movie poster" variant cover art from The Catch issue 1!
Stretch Goal #3 ($13,000) An Irresistible Attraction!
Stretch Goal #4 ($15,000) Mystery Stretch Goal!
Backer Goals! As more people back The Catch #2, we'd like to reward you with  additional incentives to reach our funding goal. If we reach our goal, and have the listed numbers of backers below, we'll add on even more stuff for you!
100 Backers: Audio Commentary! : UNLOCKED!
200 Backers: Super-sized Digital "Director's Cut!": UNLOCKED! The scripts for issues 1 and 2, as well as Ismael's black-and-white art for each page will be included in super-sized digital director's cuts of issues 1 and 2!
250 Backers: Super-sized Digital "Director's Cut!": Super-supersized versions of the director's cuts will include all of Roger and Mireia's unlettered color pages, as well!
300 Backers: Digital edition of Athena Voltaire and the Volcano Goddess: 80 pages of action and adventure starring a butt-kickin' 1930s aviatrix as she takes on Nazis and occult horrors!

STEVE BRYANT (writer/letterer/variant cover artist)  Steve Bryant is the Eisner, Manning, and Harvey Award-nominated writer/artist of Athena Voltaire from  Action Lab Entertainment, and the writer/co-creator of Ghoul Scouts, also published by Action Lab. He has also completed projects for Dark  Horse Comics, IDW, Boom! Studios, Ape Entertainment, and others, as well  as extensive work in the roleplaying game industry.
ISMAEL CANALES (artist)  Ismael Canales was born in 1980 in La Roda,  a small town from Spain; he was graduated in Fine Arts in the  Politechnique University of Valencia, majored in Drawing and Animation.  He has completed work for Spanish horror anthologies and magazines, as  well as comics for U.S. publishers ECV Press and Action Lab  Entertainment. He lives with his girlfriend in his hometown and still  wears geek t-shirts.
MIREIA GIRBAU (colorist)  Mireia Girbau was born in 1996 in Sabadell, a city near Barcelona (Spain). She was graduated in Illustration in Escola Illa and Graphic Arts in Escola Joso. Since 2018, she has designed book covers, board games, and worked in comic book projects for Planeta Comic, Paper de Ceba and El Huevo Eterno. She's currently illustrating a deck-building card game, Last Forest, and loves playing roleplaying games all the time.
CHRIS MURRIN (editor)  Chris  Murrin has been writing and editing comics and prose for over  fifteen  years. In addition to working with Steve Bryant on both Athena Voltaire and Ghoul Scouts  for Action Lab, Chris edits numerous titles for both Arch Blue and  LawDog Comics. When he’s not pestering authors with his notes, Chris  works with the marketing team at FX Networks, editing promos for both  movie presentations and shows such as Archer, It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia,  The Simpsons, and You’re the Worst. You’ve probably seen his work go by in a pixelated blur on your DVR.
 "THE CATCH is the kind of gleeful, clever deconstruction of a genre that can only be pulled off by creators who secretly love it. The freshest take on super-heroes and super-villains in the "real world" since POWERS. I'm mad I didn't think of it myself!" – Phil Hester, cartoonist
“THE CATCH is a superhero crime caper that blends the best of both genres to create something wholly new, engaging and memorable. Bryant, Canales, Surroca, and Murrin expertly weave a story that evokes greats like Elmore Leonard, Greg Rucka and Ed Brubaker without feeling like a carbon copy. As someone who enjoys all things noir and super-powered, THE CATCH is a perfect match.” - Alex Segura, acclaimed author of BLACKOUT
“THE CATCH is a great looking book with a fun premise. The team of Bryant, Canales, Surroca, and Murrin have a winner on their hands.” – Jamal Igle, co-creator of THE WRONG EARTH from Ahoy Comics.
“A little bit sci-fi, a little bit superhero, and a little bit good-natured procedural on top of it all, THE CATCH is such an obvious idea, I'm mad I didn't come up with it myself! Engaging, fun, and with a ton of potential -- you're gonna like spending time with Lucy Chase.” – Erik Burnham, IDW’s GHOSTBUSTERS
"Lucy Chase is a new era Karen Sisco in this action-packed and thrilling take on bounty hunting super-villains. Full of finesse and suspense, you won't be disappointed reading THE CATCH!" – Shawn Pryor, CASH + CARRIE
“THE CATCH is a fun, sexy caper in the style of 70s classics like THE THOMAS CROWN AFFAIR. Sleek and slick.” – Wendi Freeman, DOUBLE PAGE SPREAD
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks and unforeseen issues. With that in mind we're applying lessons learned from past campaigns.

We're committed to delivering the best possible experience to our backers, so we're investing in top-of-the-line shipping materials, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house. This will eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition. Most importantly, I'll address every question personally. The buck stops here.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone!
Thanks again for backing The Catch. The campaign for issue #3 wraps up in an hour. If you liked the first two issues, please consider backing and sharing: bit.ly/catchcomic3
Regardless, from the entire creative team, thank you for backing the book. I'm gonna go see if I can push this a little more on social media...

updates.update_userinfo: Issue #3 is funded and we're working on Stretch Goals
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
Thanks again for backing The Catch issue #2! As I type this, we have 44 hours left on the issue #3 campaign. We reached our funding goal earlier this afternoon, and are working our way upward toward more Backer Goals and Stretch Goals. Will be reach these goals? I sure hope so!
If you've enjoyed The Catch so far, but haven't taken the plunge yet, please consider backing the campaign for issue #3. You want to know how the story ends, right?!
Thank you so much for your support. Please stay safe and healthy.

updates.update_userinfo: THE CATCH #3 Kickstarter campaign ends Friday!
updates.update_content:
Hello again, everyone!
Thanks again for backing the campaign for issue #2. Aside from a few rewards where I'm waiting on shipping info/surveys, the rewards have shipped.
I hope you enjoyed the first two issues of the series. And I hope we've piqued your curiosity for how the story wraps up.

Hi, everyone!
As you read this, most of you have received your rewards. The remainder will be shipping this week.
Thank you all so much for your belief in and support of this book. I hope you enjoyed it, and I hope that you'll join us for issue #3—the conclusion of this first story arc. The issue #3 campaign is just went live. Check it out here: bit.ly/catchcomic3

Hi, everyone!
Bags and boards have arrived, so shipping will begin soon!
I'm also finishing up the digital rewards. If you'd like your name included in the digital edition of The Catch #2, please fill out your survey before midnight tonight (U.S. Central time).

updates.update_userinfo: Here are the Digital Rewards! Plus, Printed Rewards are shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone!
The books are here! I'm waiting on bags and boards (I forgot that we ran low at the end of last campaign), but they should arrive on Friday and I'll start packing up shipments over the weekend.
Truth be told, I was really worried about the intentional slowdown of the U.S. Postal service, but it sounds like that's being turned around. I hope it won't affect our shipments. You should be receiving your books in late August – mid-September...well ahead of our projected delivery date of November 2020.

Good morning, everyone!
I hope to have another update on the shipping/delivery status of The Catch #2 in the next few days (we're still way ahead of schedule!). But today, I'd like to talk about a Kickstarter campaign that I'm super excited about. 
Dead Man's Hand #1 launched on Kickstarter this morning. The book comes from my friend Jim Heffron, and the creative team includes my frequent collaborators Jason Millet (who colors the covers, our webstrip, and has colored many of the variant covers for ), and Chris Murrin (who edits all of my comics).

I'm so excited! Issue #2 is at the printer
This means that we'll be 2–3 months ahead of schedule, in terms of you receiving your rewards. Thank you all so much for your support on this book. I can't wait to share issue 3 with you.
Speaking of issue 3, since it's looking good for us being ahead of schedule, I may be creating another campaign while issue 3 is in production. If I do, I'll let you know.

project_data.project_name: The Catch 1–2 (comic)

campaign.story:
KITH + KIN will be a gorgeously illustrated, limited color, 104-page anthology that unearths what lies beneath the family tree, exposing the devilish behaviors knotted at the root.
Written by Brittany Matter and Heather Ayres with 10 artists across 10 stories, KITH + KIN brings together the monstrous family drama of Mary Shelley’s Frankenstein with the dark shades of sadness and heartwarming messages of Tim Burton’s Big Fish.
Putting family relationships under a microscope, KITH + KIN examines the complex bonds between loved ones and the wave of emotions that we must choose to rise above or succumb to their swell. From vengeful grandmothers who leave the grave and ancient demons seeking to continue their lineage by any means necessary to monsters in the machine that tear cousins apart, each short comic tackles the fallout that ripples through generations when individuals give in to their darker desires. All of KITH + KIN's comics are already edited by David Brothers (Darker Than Blue Vol. 1) and Nicole D'Andria (Road Trip To Hell).
Here’s our projected roster of creators:     
KITH + KIN Coloring Pages by Tom Napolitano, Caroline Autopsy, and Erik Whalen
***Take a peek inside the pages of KITH + KIN with this preview of SPITTING IMAGE. Immortal twins Natalia and Olenka are bound to be together forever. Will their closeness be their ultimate undoing? Find out in this gothic comic featuring art and lettering by Sally Cantirino!***    
$3,901 -- After we hit this stretch goal, we will add TWO additional stories to KITH + KIN! In MONSTER’S MILK and ROAD FAMILY we explore the found families that fill those 40 pencil-pushing hours each week–that’s right, we’re talking about co-workers. You don’t live with them (most of the time), but in these comics we delve into how you can’t live without them. Literally.
MONSTER’S MILK
Written by Heather Ayres with art by Tom Napolitano: A 20-page, full color experience showcasing the jaded world of Office Space (1999) that takes a fantasy-filled dose of corporate kool-aid in this dark-humored take on the 9-to-5 grind.
ROAD FAMILY 
Written by Brittany Matter with art by Caroline Autopsy: This 13-page full color adventure features the mysterious monster-hunting of Supernatural (2005) and the Scooby Gang of Buffy the Vampire Slayer (1997) trying to survive life and work on the road with...golems!?
We are excited to be working with the printer Avenue4 who has 60 years of printing experience and prints in the USA! Their clients have included Image Comics, Marvel, Vault Comics, IDW, and more. Fulfillment will be handled by Cenveo, Avenue4’s fulfillment partner. They are a world leader in the distribution of print materials and will help us achieve our fulfillment goals in the fall of 2020.
Detailed below is a breakdown for our funding goal which is the minimum we need to cover our costs. The pie chart includes printing and fulfillment costs, the pages rates for all 10 artists and our collaborators as well as the Kickstarter fees and taxes, which when all combined will help us make this book a reality.  
Videographer Cameron Keleher compiled and edited our Kickstarter video! The video's music is "A Mystical Experience" by Unicorn Heads. Graphic Designer Deron Bennett of AndWorld Design managed the art direction of our logo and cover art, and introduced us to logo and cover artist, Tom Napolitano!
NOTE: In supporting this comic and any other rewards, please be aware that some designs may change from what’s presented here over the course of the production.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this Kickstarter campaign is our first on the platform, we ran a successful campaign on GoFundMe and got 110% funded! We also have a head start in that all the scripts are completed and edited and each have creators who are eager to start drawing to their heart’s content and get you these stories by the fulfillment date! Of course, we do know that all of our creators have lives and sometimes life happens and impacts the meticulous schedule, but we would keep backers updated should delays occur–especially if delays are caused by natural disasters and COVID19, or any supernatural entities, such as zombies, golems, ghosts, demons, or others not listed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Brittany Matter
First created · 53 backed
Writer. Editor. Marvel.com contributor. Comics and coffee are her lifeblood. Follow her on Twitter @brittanymatter!See more

updates.update_content:
Hello everybody,
After a hiatus, we have reconvened and decided that we're not moving forward with KITH + KIN for the foreseeable future as we're currently unable to pursue funding it. It saddens us that we were unable to reach the goal amount last year, however, we thoroughly appreciated the support and kindness that you showed us, that you all believed in KITH + KIN in the first place, and each and every one of you has our eternal gratitude!

updates.update_userinfo: The Journey Isn’t Over, So Stay Tuned
updates.update_content:
Hi everybody,
Unfortunately, we didn’t hit the goal that we set. Heather and I are working on a plan to figure out what’s next for KITH + KIN, and we’ll definitely keep y’all in the loop when we have more information to share.
For now, we’re going to take it easy. Running a Kickstarter campaign took the wind out of us! Plus, it’s a good time to reflect and practice some self-care. We hope everyone is also remembering to take care of themselves, especially with the pandemic going on.
We have so appreciated your support during these strange times and have thoroughly enjoyed all the positive reception we’ve received from backers, the press, and other creatives who have been following our journey thus far.

updates.update_userinfo: New Reward: Cameo and Credit in KITH + KIN!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
Thanks to all who participated in our #20WordFamilySecrets game night! Check out the winner's secrets below:
Frank Martin on Twitter
The previous homeowners never wanted to leave, so we renovated our new house by mixing the plaster with their bones.

updates.update_userinfo: FINAL DAYS - KITH + KIN Upgrades and Add Ons
updates.update_content:
Howdy everyone!
We’ve got one last entry from our family photo album series! We’d like to introduce you to one of our characters by pulling a page from their baby book, giving you an exclusive look into their lives between the pages of KITH + KIN. We’ll include a short synopsis of the comic they’re from followed by the entry.
Without further adieu...meet Raquel Simpson from MIRROR, MIRROR: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. For Claire, the eye of her mother, Raquel, is fixed squarely on her own image. Obsessed with every reflective surface she comes in contact with, Raquel is distant and narcissistic. Claire grows up yearning for the love that has been stolen by the woman in the mirror. When her mother disappears, Claire becomes overwhelmed by her traceless absence until one day she is sucked into the very mirror that captured her mother’s attention.

updates.update_userinfo: KITH + KIN Makes A Top 10 List!
updates.update_content:
Howdy Backers! Don’t forget that TODAY is the last day to share your #20WordFamilySecrets on social. Post them today before 11:59 PM EDT to be eligible for the Mystery Goodie Bag of free comics.
Reminder how to play: Post your family secret (real or make-believe) with 20 words or less and the #20WordFamilySecrets hashtag.
We’ll be announcing winners tomorrow!

campaign.story:
WE ARE FUNDED & ON TO STRETCH GOALS 
(Note: the Ultra Pin & Deluxe HC Catch Up tier now also includes the Balboni Variant. For a full list of stretch goals, scroll to the bottom.)
 White Ash is an ongoing comic book series written by Charlie Stickney, with art and letters by Conor Hughes and colors by Fin Cramb. Thanks to our amazing backers and fans, we’ve ridden the success of six amazing Kickstarters to a distribution deal with  Scout Comics and become a mainstay at some of the largest comic book conventions in the country. (Yes, we'll be back exhibiting at San Diego Comic Con again this summer).
If you’re returning to White Ash, THANK YOU so much. We owe everything to our Kickstarter community and we're going to continue to make our campaigns packed with exclusive KS goodness just for you (Feel free to scroll down and check out the rewards). If you’re new to our town, WELCOME.  We can’t wait to show you the place.
This campaign is to raise funds to print the 40 page comic White Ash: Chapter Five and hopefully hit a couple of Stretch Goals along the way to give you even more bang for your White Ash buck.  
NOTE: For those of you here off reading the Scout Comics version of White Ash, the KS numbering is different. This comic takes place directly after the first Scout arc concludes with #6 (in June). More on this below. 
Welcome to White Ash, a small smudge of a mining community in Western Pennsylvania, where the secrets are buried even deeper than the coal under the mountain. If you’re a fan of Supernatural, Twin Peaks or Lord of the Rings, you’re going to love getting to know our mysterious town.  
In Chapter One, we met Aleck who'd been counting down the hours till he could get the hell out of town and head off to college.
But an apparent accident at the mine stalled his exit, setting him down a life-altering path.
One that brought him into the orbit of the enigmatic Lillian Alden.
And from there, things got CRAZY.  We can't really tell you too much without getting into heavy SPOILER TERRITORY.
What we can do, is show you this spoiler-free "get to know our town" video, made by the White Ash Chamber of Commerce. 
PLAY

And if after that, if any of you first-timers still need a little more convincing before you pledge, you can download a 25 page ashcan (a FREE comic book) of Chapter One HERE. so you can check White Ash out.
Now, if you happen to like spoilers, don't worry, we've got you covered too.
***HERE COME THE SPOILERS***
Shortly after the accident, Aleck discovered that nothing about White Ash or his life is what it seemed; and that there’s a reason he’s short, stubborn, and can grow a beard in a day — he comes from a family of...
Yep Dwarves.  And if that wasn’t enough of a kick in the head, Lillian, the young woman he’s just fallen for, isn’t just the daughter of the owner of the White Ash Mining Company, she’s also an elf.
So there you have it. White Ash is just a simple tale, old as time, of forbidden elf/ dwarf romance, set against the backdrop of the oncoming war with The Brood... which we kinda neglected to mention earlier.  The Brood is a race of dragon/human hybrids whose origins harken back to how the Elves and the Dwarves got here (White Ash) in the first place.
Sadly, if it were only as easy as overcoming a blood feud that started when the Earth was still young, an army of dragon/human hybrids, and some overly-opinionated relatives, Aleck and Lillian would already be on their way to living happily ever after. But as this is White Ash, bad things have a habit of happening to good people. 
But we don't want to give away any more. For those of you who are new, we have plenty of ways you can get up to speed on White Ash. (See the catch-up tiers below).  
And for those of you who have patiently waited for us to return, WE'RE BACK!!!  And it's time to kick this story into overdrive.  
VRRRRRRROOOOOOM!  
Stay tuned after the campaign to find out how you can get the original art for Conor's cover.
Why is Katlyn speeding off into the night? Where is she going? You're still going to have to wait a couple of months to find out. But if you're feeling a little impatient, you can WATCH CONOR finish the book in real time on Twitch. FYI, MAJOR SPOILERS lurk.  (We here in White Ash, like to be upfront about everything).
And speaking of being up front, you don't have to wait till Conor's streaming to see some of the book, we're happy to catch you up on the going ons in White Ash right now with a little peek from Chapter Five...
 Oh, and in case any of you had been wondering how's Seth's been doing..?
Turn's out, he's had better days.  Let's not dwell on that and move on to... 
Money raised will go toward artist fees, printing, backer rewards and shipping of the fifth issue. And if we're lucky enough to surpass our goal, any additional funding will be put directly back into the book in the form of cover upgrades, additional rewards, and production of future issues (Or paying for those extra shipping costs that always seem to hit). No one is looking to get rich here. (Otherwise we wouldn't be doing comics. Really, we wouldn't) We just want to ensure that we can produce an amazing high-quality comic book series that our backers will enjoy for years to come. 
We LOVE our partnership with Scout Comics.  Scout is expanding the reach of White Ash, putting us into comic shops across the country.  In fact, we're betting some of you reading this now, only know White Ash from what you've seen in the shops. So let's clarify a few things. 
The issues that we Kickstart will eventually be distributed by Scout Comics. (About a year later).  But there are a couple of differences.  The biggest is, we often Kickstart oversized issues on KS, (40-52 pages). These issues are then broken down and remastered for Scout.  So White Ash CHAPTER ONE (52 pages) on Kickstarter, eventually became Scout Issues #1 AND #2. To make this work, we added additional pages. So while 90% of the story is the same, these are not straight reprints.  We also have White Ash covers exclusive to Scout.  We're trying to make both experiences something special and unique.  
So when you're choosing a tier, if you're looking to catch up, you can do so either by grabbing the single Scout issues in your LCS or on their website Scoutcomics.com. Or if you'd prefer, we have a Hardcover option that collects all the previous kickstarter issues into an oversized volume filled with pin ups and additional content.  
Speaking of additional content, that's what our Kickstarters specialize in.  So let's get straight into the rewards, starting with... 
As we've mentioned, these books are HUGE. Chapter One was a fifty-two page beast. Chapter Two and Three are both thirty-two pages long. And like Chapter Four, Chapter Five is --  FORTY-FREAKING-PAGES.
And that kind of content deserves a premium paper weight.
We print White Ash DOMESTICALLY (so you get your books quicker) on a heavy 80 lb glossy paper stock with a cover on 100 lb glossy cover stock. When you pick up one of our books, you'll feel the White Ash difference.
This campaign we are beyond thrilled to announce that Sweeney Boo (Captain Marvel, Sabrina, etc.) took time out of her VERY busy schedule for a trip to White Ash so she could draw up this cover depicting the town's most complicated love triangle. 
We will print a MAXIMUM (depending on interest) of 300 copies.  And this will be exclusive to Kickstarter.
And we JUST unlocked a new variant
Claudia Balboni (FairLady Image Comics, Star Trek IDW, etc.) created this jaw-dropingly gorgeous and sensual cover featuring Lillian. 
Colored by White Ash's very own Fin Cramb, we will only be printing 150 copies of this variant.  This variant will  automatically included with the following tiers:
Ultra Pin & Deluxe HC Catch Uo
Original Art
Sketch Cover
 Draw Me In. 
If you haven't pledged at one of those tiers, we've just added two new reward tiers where you can get a copy.  Additionally, there will be a limited number of copies available post-campaign as add-ons in Backer Kit. 
We know what it's like to open up a package and find a mangled Kickstarter comic inside. We pack our books with care that we used in making the book and the love that we have for our backers. 
Each comic is bagged, boarded front and back and sent in stay-flat packaging. Made in White Ash means everything from the content, to the mailers we use, meets our standards of quality.
We love packing our campaigns with extra goodness.  IN ADDITION to White Ash: Chapter Five, our reward tiers are filled with goodies.  He's what you can get this time around.
We're back, and to celebrate, all backers receiving physical rewards will get a 6 x11"print of our kickstarter page image on glossy card-stock.  On top of that, Conor will sign & number the copies for the first 300 print backers.
In our Hardcover, we included an all-new story about the early days of White Ash that featured Thane and Glarien. A lot of you who'd just backed the single issues, had asked for a copy. So here you go, a PDF will be included with every pledge tier.
One of the most requested rewards, has been for a White Ash Sticker.  And we aim to please. EVERY print backer will also receive a 3" glossy vinyl, logo sticker.  It's perfect for laptops, folders or covering up those small holes in your wall that somehow appeared after an evening of celebration.  
Want to smell like White Ash?  We've got you covered.  We know it's a bit of a drive for most of our backers to get to our town, so we made the trip to the Double K for you.  Katlyn and Kyle cut us a deal on some of their signature air fresheners.  And even better, they've promised to discount their gas by 20 cents a gallon to anyone who pulls up to their pumps with one of these beauties hanging from their rear-view mirrors.
The White Ash air freshener is included with EVERY physical pledge tier.   
The most requested and (until now) unavailable reward, has been for us to mold a custom White Ash pin.  Well, BOHOLD this beauty.  Thanks to Conor's design skills, you can now get pinned to that special someone, White Ash style.
(To clarify, the good White Ash style based on the warm, but gruff dwarf love, not the bad "cut off your head and eat it," White Ash style).  These pins will be at least 1" in length and molded with a hard enamel.  
 New to White Ash?  Catch up in style with our 200 page, oversized hardcover.  That's over 2lbs of White Ash goodness delivered straight to your door.  This is a beautiful book you'll be happy to have on your coffee table or on the shelf.
Want a piece of original art? 
Conor Hughes will sketch you a 6x9 drawing of a character from White Ash or The Game. Choose from Aleck, Lillian, Katlyn, Eli, Irs, Kimberly... or another one of your favorites. Conor goes above and beyond on these.  You don't want to miss out on a deal like this. 
 We have never offered sketch covers before.  This campaign changes all of that.  Get a sketch cover of Chapter Five (more detailed than what's above)  drawn by Conor Hughes.   Conor will take (reasonable) requests as to the subject mater.  If you're a true White Ash collector, you have to have one of these. 
 Under Conor's careful eye, a background character will be designed to look like you.
(NOTE: These are probably not speaking roles, just cameos. But every now and then, if we find the right person, we'll make you an actual character in the comic. So be forewarned...)
We LOVE stretch goals in White Ash.  And if we're lucky enough to reach our initial funding goal, we'll unlock a slew of really cool extra rewards for our backers.
Stretch Goal #1 ($16,500) Thank you to the moon and back.
As a sign of our appreciation we’re going send every backer who’s getting a physical reward, a 6x9 print of this thank you illustration drawn by White Ash's own Conor Hughes.
Stretch Goal #2 ($18,000) Traded Again.
With Stretch Goal #2 in the dust, every print backer will now receive three a brand new White Ash trading card.  And every backer at one of our Print Catch Up tiers will receive 13 cards -- the original 12 + the new one. 
Stretch Goal #3 ($21,000) We've Got You Covered
UNLOCKED -- The Balboni cover is now available.  NOTE: It also comes as part of the Ultra Pin & Deluxe HC Catch Up tier.  (Even though it's not listed on the reward).
Stretch Goal #4 ($24,000) Glarien Returns
UNLOCKED -- Every backer will receive an all-new, digital Glarien story drawn by the incredible Romina Moranelli. 
Stretch Goal #5 ($26,500) Keeping you Posted.
If we hit $26,500, ever print backer will receive an all-new, White Ash post-card showcasing one of the many attractions our town has to offer.
Stretch Goal #6 ($29,000) Mystery Stretch Goal.
Meet the team.
Charlie Stickney is a writer/producer from Los Angeles who’s spent the last 20 years creating film, television, animation and music videos. I’ve produced content for companies including: Sony Pictures, ITV, Universal Pictures, Revolution Studios, and Scholastic Productions.
While in college, Charlie interned in the editorial offices at Marvel. And were it not for a job offer in LA, the plan after graduation was to move to New York to write comic books. About three years ago Charlie brought White Ash to Kickstarter, finally fulfilling that dream and hasn't looked back.  #comicsarethebest
Conor Hughes's breakout work has been the popular Kickstarter comic White Ash. Previous to that he was one of the winners of the Millarworld art contest as well as being published in the Anthology Graphic Canon and Twisted Savage Dragon Funnies.
You can troll him on twitch at twitch.tv/conorhughes where he can often be found making comics as well as Hopewell NJ, with his amazing wife and giggle monster baby girl.
Fin loves all things comics and can usually be found happily working into the wee, small hours in his studio in Edinburgh, Scotland. Fin's previous credits include working on Savant (Dark Horse), Planet of the Apes (Madefire), Peter Pan the Graphic Novel (Birlinn) and the Johnny Cash Project.
Give Fin a shout on Twitter @Finsomniac.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our SEVENTH Kickstarter. At this point we've worked out most of the kinks. We've hit our scheduled delivered date on FOUR of our LAST FIVE Kickstarters (Full disclosure, we were just over two months late on our last one... it happens to the best of us). If you look at our backer numbers and comments, you'll see a happy and growing bunch. And sure, things can ALWAYS go wrong. But if they do, and there are any problems or delays, we'll be in touch and we'll find a way to make it right.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
