updates.update_userinfo: Just THREE DAYS left to grab a copy of Glarien
updates.update_content:
Hi White Ashians,
Happy Sunday.  We just wanted to say thank you again.  So many of you have joined us on our White Ash spin-off Glarien campaign, making it by far our most successful one yet. If you haven't had a chance to check it out, and you wanted to, this is your gentle reminder that the campaign ENDS in about 70 hours. 
You can find Glarien HERE.

updates.update_userinfo: More thank yous and more from the world of The Adept
updates.update_content:
Hi White Ashians,
We really want to thank you again. Kickstarter's internal metics show us how many of you have come on on board to make Glarien such a huge success right out of the gate.  Glarien continues to be a juggernaut of a campaign. We've already shattered our first 4 stretch goals and there's no sign of slowing down.  If you haven't gotten a chance to check it out and see some of Romina's beautiful panels...

updates.update_userinfo: Only a couple hours left to grab a Glarien early bird special
updates.update_content:
Hi White Ashians,
I want to thank you again for coming out in such force for Glarien over the last couple of days.  This has been by FAR our biggest launch ever and so much of that is because of you.   If any of you are still planing on backing Glarien, and haven't yet had an opportunity, I wanted to remind you that there are only a couple of hours left to grab an early-bird special.  We put those out for you, our returning backers.  And we want to make sure that you have a chance to get one before time runs out.

Hey White Ashians,
The next chapter in the White Ash Universe is LIVE.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/thegamecomic/glarien-of-white-ash-1-a-fantasy-series-for-mature-readers?ref=6s44hl

updates.update_userinfo: Less than a week till Glarien drops.
updates.update_content:
Hi White Ashians,
I'm so excited.  We're close now, very close.  Just 6 days till the Kickstarter for the new Glarien mini-series launches (Monday, the 22nd, 9 am PST).  The pages that I've been getting in from Romina are just stunning. I can't wait to show you the world of Alfheim through her eyes. Prepare to be blown away. 
But part of the fun of Glarien is that it's a story of two worlds. And today I want to give you an exclusive peek at Conor Hughes' 1970's NYC/ Rachel-centric, variant cover.

Hello White Ashians, 
Happy New Year/ February.  I hope you are all doing exceedingly well.  By now, everyone should have their rewards from Chapter Five.  If you don't, shoot me a DM and we'll see where things are at. But we're not here to talk about last year's, business, but instead all the exciting things we have cooking for you in 2021.  To start with, this will be launching in a roughly three weeks...
Glarien of White Ash #1

Hello White Ashians,
Check your inboxes, we've just sent out a link to the last stretch goal from the campaign -- another digital Glarien story.  This one is draw by the incredible Yishan Li who absolutely killed it.  We hope you enjoy the short.
Some of you have reached out and asked if there would be a way to get these shorts in physical form. I looked into the possibility of doing a kickstarter to finance a small print run and make them available to you all.  But after weighing those costs, I talked to Scout Comics about seeing if there would be interest there in putting out Glarien as a one-shot.  They were very interested, and so we quickly moved ahead to put things into motion.   So I'm thrilled to announce that these Glarien shorts (the ones drawn by Romina and Yishan) along with the Glarien short illustrated by Conor and Fin (that was part of the White Ash hardcover) will be available in comic shops everywhere this February.

updates.update_userinfo: Glarien of White Ash is coming to Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hello White Ashians,
When I hit the post office on Monday, packages will have shipped for every backer (domestic and international) who didn't pledge at the sketch cover or original art level.  Those packages will be going out in the next two weeks. (Conor is finishing up the very last of the sketches now).  If you don't have a shipping confirmation for your book by the end of this coming week, please free to reach out so we can get you that information.

project_data.project_name: White Ash #1-5

campaign.story:
20 Fists is a three chapter black and white comic best described as a queer Romeo & Juliet meets The Warriors. Two women sort through the rubble of their relationship in the illegal fight league that runs rampant throughout their city. 
It was desire at first sight, Billie saw Chel across the battlefield pummeling in Keelan's face. Chel's smile made Billie's heart skip a beat. It was right then and there that she knew she had to have her. For a bit things were good, but unfortunately it's hard to navigate a budding relationship and two crews who are constantly butting heads. Something had to give. Now, with their crews about to meet up for another battle, Chel & Billie need to decide once and for all...to make love or war?
This Kickstarter is to raise funds to reprint Issue #1 and print Issues #2 & #3 of 20 Fists. You'll be able to back the whole story and get three amazing issues (86 pages!!) of rough and tumble romance! 
CW: 20 Fists #3 contains strong interpersonal violence and is not intended for children.
Stretch Goals!
(UNLOCKED) Stretch Goal #1 - At $1200 we’ll be adding 8.5”x11” prints of Kira Okamoto’s Round #1 variant cover & Kat Baumann’s Round #3 cover for all physical tiers! Images shown below.
(UNLOCKED) Stretch Goal #2 - At $1500 we'll be commissioning Kira Okamoto for variant covers for 20 Fists #2 & #3 that will be released as additional 8.5"x11" prints!
Stretch Goal #3 - At $2000 we’ll be adding a four page backup all about everyone’s favorite eternal mascot, FERRIS WHEELER!!!
STRETCH GOAL #4 - ($3000) ???
Okay, Tell Me More!
A note from Frankee White, writer and co-creater of 20 FISTS:
"20 Fists is a sparse book to put it mildly. It’s 86 pages with a script under 12k words. Most of my script has 0-2 lines of dialogue per panel. I want the reader to be able to sit down and read the whole thing in one sitting. This is by design. A quick punch to the gut. It was a challenge to myself. How could I hook a reader emotionally while dropping them in the middle of a story & providing zero interior information? No narration, all info comes from what is seen & heard over the course of one night + two flashback interludes.
Thankfully, I have artist Kat Baumann & letterer DC Hopkins, who are exceptional visual storytellers. Kat completely understands the nuance of body language and how to maximize expression out of a gesture. Not only that but she is an amazing creative partner. Make no mistake, Kat HAD to do the heavy lifting on this book for it to work, but her pages constantly had me in me awe. DC’s lettering perfectly meshes w/Kat’s line work, but still stands on its own AS art. SFX are a huge part of the script. They are, in a sense, the sound design. You need to “hear” the cracks, the crunches, the heavy breath for the action and emotion to come alive. Without either of these two fantastic creatives, 20 Fists wouldn't exist and I'm extremely grateful to them for their partnership.
Ultimately, 20 Fists is a story of independence & self-understanding wrapped in action, romance, & drama. We’ve made a tough little book that I’m extremely proud of & I hope Chel’s overnight journey resonates with readers. Thanks for all the love & support along the way. xoxo"
20 Fists #1 (Cover Art by Kat Baumann)
ATTENTION: All single issues of 20 Fists are strictly LIMITED. These black & white copies WILL NOT BE REPRINTED once they sell out. With that in mind, Kat Baumann's original cover from 20 Fists #1 is limited to only 33 copies left from our previous print run. So you'll want to hop on our early bird special to ensure you get a copy!
However, I'm pleased to announce that we we will be reprinting the first issue with a brand new cover by Kira Okamoto! Kira is an exceptional artist based out of Seattle, WA whose dynamic style is perfectly suited for 20 Fists! You can find more of their work at www.kiraokamoto.com!
20 Fists #1 Variant (Cover Art by Kira Okamoto)

Meet the Crews
The No Names (L-R: Chel, Wayne, Cory, Rei, Brian. Designed by Kat Baumann)
The No Names are new to the 20 Fists Fight League and are only beginning to cut their teeth when the worst possible thing happens: their leader Chel falls for Billie, the leader of their rival crew The Big Jackets. This creates tension among the inexperienced group as not everyone is a fan of this newfound relationship.
Chel - The defacto leader of The No Names even though she's not so good at leading. She's not as independent as the vibes she puts out, but she loves to fight and won't hesitate to knock you on your ass if you cross a line. 
Wayne - Loves Westerns and not-so-secretly wants to be a cowboy. His real name isn't even Wayne. He also has not-so-secret crushes on two other members of The No Names. 
Cory - The group's curmudgeon. Hurt his knee in the last battle against The Big Jackets so he takes pills to manage the pain. He's one bad day away from saying "I'm too old for this shit."
Rei - Attached at the hip to her beau Brian. She's ultra competitive and a bit full of herself. While she's not opposed to Chel's relationship with Billie, she doesn't want to deal with any of the drama.
Brian - An artist. Not much of a fighter. He loves Rei more than anything so he joined The No Names with her. 
The Big Jackets (L-R: Billie, Keelan, Yuli, Mack, KT. Designed by Kat Baumann)
The Big Jackets are named after the big jackets that they wear (no one said they were clever). They've been around the block a bit and are an experienced crew within the 20 Fists Fight League. Due to how tight knit they are, they don't care much about whether Billie and Chel date as long as Billie can keep her business and personal life separate. 
Billie - The unquestioned leader of The Big Jackets. She loves to be in control of any situation. When she feels like she's losing her grip, she gets defensive and angry. Will do whatever it takes to get what she wants.
Keelan - A major projector. Him & Chel have history. He acts hard because he's secretly a bit of a softy, but he doesn't want anyone to know. He's been known to dip in and out of fights, but even his own crew mates don't know why. 
Yuli - Best friends with Mack. Strongly opposed to Billie & Chel's relationship because she's convinced it's going to get in the way of The Big Jackets rise in the 20 Fists Fight League.
Mack - They are the heavy hitter that tips the scale in any fight and the reason why The Big Jackets are building a rep as winners. They are business first and take fights very seriously. Despite this, they don't particularly like fighting. They just like hanging out with their friends and only try so hard because they don't want to let them down.
KT - A bit of an enigma. Not much is known about her besides that she's always ready to go for a fight and most of the stuff she owns she's stolen. 
Covers & Excerpt
20 Fists #2 (Cover Art by Kat Baumann, Logo/Lettering by DC Hopkins)
20 Fists #2 (Page 1)
20 Fists #2 (Page 2)
20 Fists #2 (Page 3)
20 Fists #2 (Page 4)
20 Fists #2 (Page 5)
20 Fists #3 (Cover Art by Kat Baumann, Logo/Lettering by DC Hopkins)

Testimonials
"20 Fists is the sort of romance John Carpenter would direct. 20 Fists is the sort of comic each one of The Warriors would have on their pull list. It’s sweet, violent, sad and relentlessly entertaining." - Alasdair Stuart, The Full Lid
"20 Fists is the rare comic that captures you on all sides of the emotional spectrum: love, rage, frustration. You can come for the fist fighting, but you'll stay for the romance. A perfect book for those who want to make love...AND war." - Jarred Luján, writer of Dry Foot (Mad Cave Studios)
"While the action is enjoyable, the rare but impossibly cute moments between the characters is what I found myself going back to. The powerful theme of identity, White’s lovable characters and Baumann’s superb art style has the potential to turn this into a cult classic." - William Tucker, But Why Tho?
“A tale that is both highly entertaining and very thoughtful...The amount of intimate detail and the linework given to each frame shows the effort that Kat Baumann put into this project.” - Eric, The Pullbox
“Fuck Rom-Coms, Read 20 FISTS! John Hughes meets The Outsiders in this cathartic relationship exercise. The best comix must be unearthed, not just buying what's on the shelves.” - Gravely Unusual Magazine
“Fun action and even more fun romance, interesting characters that you want to get to know better...and that ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL ART.” - Jaime Grayson, Comic Book Yeti
“Artist Kat Baumann crafts a grungy and broken world in 20 Fists...The buildings are cracked and dilapidated, with a steeple looming in the background. The sky is black and starless, as if a dark cloud hangs just above.” - Michael Fromm, Monkeys Fighting Robots
“A story that will punch you in the mouth and a romance that will punch you in the heart." - Geek Network
“20 Fists may be the closest we ever get to a gay Double Dragon comic. Buy it.” - Jordan Patrick Finn, writer of Hellcraft
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks for this project are fairly low. We ran a successful campaign for 20 Fists #1 and had all of our rewards shipped out earlier than anticipated! 20 Fists #2 is already completed and ready to go to print, while 20 Fists #3 is already halfway done with interior art and finished cover. The biggest potential risk is related to printing and shipping getting to us, but we had zero issues in that regard with our previous Kickstarter. Based on our current work pace and shipping times we're expecting to have the books at your door by no later than July of 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: 20 FISTS RELEASING VIA SOURCE POINT PRESS
updates.update_content:
Hey y'all, hope you are all doing well and that 2021 has been kind to you so far. 
It's Frankee here reaching out to let you all know that 20 FISTS has been picked up by SOURCE POINT PRESS for release as a mini-series this year! This version is not in black and white and instead features colors done by Gab Contreras (sample pages below)! She did an amazing job and I'm very excited for everyone to see her work.
Issue #1 releases on 4/28/21. Pre-orders due by 2/18/21. 
https://www.previewsworld.com/Catalog/FEB211517

Hey y'all! I hope everyone is enjoying their Summer and trying to take advantage of good weather while staying safe! I wanted to let all my backers know that I'm running a new Kickstarter for a brand new book called PROJECT: STARLESS DAYDREAM. It's what I'm calling a "narrative zine." With the help of over 30 creatives, we are telling one comprehensive story written by me and edited by Danny Lore through mostly black & white consecutive art, pin-ups, double page spreads, character profiles, and journal entries in a softcover trade. It's an homage to the mech genre that I love while still pushing trying to push the concept, story, and themes in new directions. All net proceeds will be donated to The Trevor Project, the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ young people under 25.

Hope everyone is having a good week so far! There’s a few people who haven’t submitted their surveys yet. Please do that so I can send you your physical copies of 20 Fists!
First wave of books shipped yesterday. I’m waiting on some more mails and should hopefully have the rest out by the end of the week!
Frankee

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kickstarter for my first art book. I'm Erica, also known as HookieDuke, an illustrator and occultist. This book features a selection of my art from past five years of my work in music posters, album art, tabletop games, personal pieces, inktober drawings, and more. Contains some material considered to be 'mature content' as well as LGBT+  friendly drawings.
Ritual is a hard bound and approximately 8x10.667"
A brewing storm on the horizon, flashes in the distance, the cut of a knife, the dream settles in. Ritual is the collected art works of Erica Williams, a 170 page hard bound book spanning dreamscapes and obsessions. Please join my world of the occult, demons, and creatures of lore in this collection.
Rewards include original ink drawings, a metallic art print, holographic stickers, an intaglio art print, and an enamel pin. Five select original ink drawings are also available.
Ritual includes textless versions of my work for musicians like Metallica, Dave Matthews Band, Mastodon, and Ray LaMontagne among many others. In addition to music posters my work on album and book covers, Magic the Gathering, and Mondo is also included.
 Special Kickstarter only pricing on original drawings and intaglio prints.  
8.5x10" 12 color limited edition screen print "Edge of Light" on metallic gold foil. Edition of 425.
Enjoy the shiny <3
Planchette Creature enamel pin
Delight, a limited edition intaglio print is available. Intaglio is a traditional style of printmaking made from a copper plate with the art etched onto it. Edition of 20.
Peony, a limited edition intaglio print is available. Intaglio is a traditional style of printmaking made from a copper plate with the art etched onto it. Edition of 15.
50 available
Early Pledge Special. 50 Available
Unsigned Book Set. 150 Available
Signed Book. 100 Available
Five Available
Original Ink drawings - 1 of each available
 *All designs are subject to minor change due to production*
Thanks to Kickstarter's platform if certain milestones in funding are reached new rewards will be available for everyone. These high quality rewards include a bookmark, mini print, notecard set, and an additional 10 pages of process and insight into my work bringing the total page count to 180. These are automatically added to all pledges when the corresponding funding milestone is reached.
  I am honored to have spent the last several years sharing my work with the world and for the opportunity to bring my work alive through art prints. This new chance to bring so much of my work together in one place and to share it with new and existing fans alike means the world to me. Please accept my sincerest thanks and love for allowing me to do so and for supporting this new book!
Preview video music: "Mechanisms" by Adam Welle
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been operating an online shop for 6 years with experience in producing high quality merchandise with eco-friendly packaging. I will be hiring experienced help for fulfilling all pledges to make make sure that everything is completed smoothly and without issue. This is my first Kickstarter, which means some new challenges to overcome. There is always a room for human error, but I will do my absolute best to concisely and clearly explain any issues or delays that may arise. 

To ensure rewards are delivered on time, extra time has been included for book production. Quality checked during production and all made with love and care. <3 
Spread of Covid19 has been taken into account and hopefully will not affect the timeline, however if it will all information relating to the delay will be immediately and clearly relayed to all project backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Happy Holidays!

It is official! Ritual Kickstarter pledges have shipped! Thank you so much for the patience as we worked though the issues of damaged copies. The time it took to sort through them was longer than expected, there was just a lot of damage and we wanted to make sure that everyone received rewards that were in good condition and lovely.

Ritual has arrived, a little late due to a freight issue, but all books have safely landed.

This update is a little delayed as I have been moving, and the ill timing complicated things, so my sincerest apologies on that. However, everything ha settled down and rewards will start shipping out on October 26th! Tomorrow!!!

Hello everyone! Hope you are having a fabulous day. <3 
Wanted to share an update on Ritual, estimated shipping times, and information for changes of address. 
Firstly, and my sincere apologies, the book is a little behind. However they are all bound and now we are just waiting on them to make their way here so they can be sent out to everyone. I tried extremely hard to keep the September timeline, but the books are not due to arrive until the first week of October. Fulfillment will take 2-3 weeks, which means they should start arriving just in time for all the good spooky vibes! If there are any other delays I will let you know right away, but hopefully this is the only one.

updates.update_userinfo: August Update - ETA shipping and arrivals
updates.update_content: Enamel Pins have arrived! They turned out fantastic. These will be shipping separately from the book, so you may get a survey soon requesting your address be updated. Keep an eye on your inbox. <3

Thanks so much for your patience everyone! There hasn't been a lot to update as the process of getting the book put together and approved is a slow one, but this past week I did get in a new sample and wanted to share with you. <3 Right now there is a small delay on the book due to a color issue, but overall it still is on track to be arrive in September and be sent out to everyone at that time. So good news is there are no significant delays!

The first of the rewards for Ritual arrived today. "Edge of Light" prints are here and looking so pretty. The metallic foil is incredibly hard to photograph but is really stunning. I Just wanted to share with you!

Sorry this is late the day got away from me. But here is a small video I recorded! (It's awkward. It's me. That's just how it is)
Seriously though I said this entire time I was shocked and amazed and I didn't think this would go so well. I didn't think I would hit more than 400 pledges. It has over 1300!!! This has been the most empowering and positive experience for me. THANK YOU. Now to bring this into the physical realm. <3

updates.update_userinfo: WE DID IT!!! <3 The best finish ever.
updates.update_content:
Wow! WOW! I can't believe we met the final stretch goal and it's not even the last day of the campaign?!
This is so huge to me and I can't thank you enough. This has been my first Kickstarter and I had no idea what to expect and wasn't sure this was a thing people were even interested in. Every part of this process and the reaction it received and having it perform this well has left me in awe. I can go over how entirely mushy and floaty i am feeling and how this has been teaching me a lot about how supportive and amazing people can be but I will end up crying and just ramble on.

project_data.project_name: Ritual: Art Collection of Erica Williams

campaign.story:
*** FULLY FUNDED DAY 1!  FINAL DAY! 8 STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED! ONLY 29 BACKERS AWAY FROM THE NEXT STRETCH GOAL! ***
After burying her only daughter, the deadliest bounty hunter in the galaxy discovers her next job will jeopardize the only thing She has left... her secrets.  


SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a brutal, action-packed sci-fi graphic novella from award-winning writer Ryan K Lindsay (Eternal, Chum) and illustrator Chris Panda.
Who Will Love SHE?
Fans of action packed, heart-infused, high-concept sci-fi like EAST OF WEST, BLACK SCIENCE and SAGA.
Collectors of glorious, original, and sexy-as-hell hardcover graphic novels.
Process junkies who will love taking a deep dive into the creative process with Lindsay & Panda's delicious back-matter.
What Exactly Do You Get When You Travel to the Tower of All That is Known in This Campaign?
 SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a 64-page OVER-SIZED FORMAT hardcover graphic novella, featuring a special DIE-CUT translucent helmet cover, sure to be unlike anything you've seen in the galaxy.
All backers $7+ will receive loads of bonus content, including an original SHE theme by George O'Connor, digital deluxe process pieces taking you deep into the SHE universe.
Higher pledge levels will have access to campaign exclusive collectibles and merchandise, included enamel pins, custom toys and much more!
And for serious fans of the standard single-issue comic format, we'll be making a special limited edition variant of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known available. This will be a 48-page, staple-bound comic with a metallic foil cover by Chris Panda, with a special homage to the classic THE UNCANNY X-MEN #141 "Days of Future Past" cover by John Byrne.
This special foil edition variant is included in the Collector's Box and will be limited to 100 copies! 
Back With Confidence, As Ryan K Lindsay & ComixTribe Have a Perfect Track Record for Delivering on Kickstarter!
 Here's what fans of Ryan's work have been saying:
 In these uncertain times, there is one thing that you CAN count on... it's that Ryan, Chris & the team at ComixTribe will deliver one helluva a comic into your hands!  
AND HERE'S THE EARLY COMIC INDUSTRY BUZZ ON SHE...
Ryan K Lindsay writes comics.
He has partnered with artist Eric Zawadzki to produce: ETERNAL through Black Mask Studios, and HEADSPACE, with Sebastian Piriz, through Monkeybrain Comics/IDW.
He has partnered with artist Sami Kivela to produce: BEAUTIFUL CANVAS through Black Mask Studios, DEER EDITOR through his own ‘Four Colour Ray Gun’ imprint and a handful of Kickstarter successes,  and CHUM through ComixTribe.
He was selected as a participant in the DC Writing Workshop group of 2016.
His other comics include: Aurealis and Ledger Award winning NEGATIVE SPACE with Owen Gieni through Dark Horse Comics,  GLOVES with Tommy Lee Edwards in the Vertigo CMYK anthology, as well as EIR with Alfie Gallagher, INK ISLAND with Craig Bruyn, and STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET with Alex Cormack through Kickstarter for ‘Four Colour Ray Gun.’
He’s written/edited analytical texts, including THE DEVIL IS IN THE DETAILS: EXAMINING MATT MURDOCK AND DAREDEVIL through Sequart, and has had essays published in Criminal, Godzilla, Sheltered, Strange Nation, and Crime Factory.
He is Australian and when not being a family man he hones his writing skills by sacrificing blood wombats to the outback spider fight clubs.
Chris Panda is a French illustrator and comic artist living in Berlin.
He's been working as an illustrator since 6 years and decided to move to the comic book world 4 years ago.
He mainly have worked as an interior and cover artist with american publisher IDW on title like MICRONAUTS, ROM, STAR TREK vs. TRANSFORMERS and TRANSFORMERS/GHOSTBUSTERS. And also had published his own comic book WONDERLAND RESISTANCE via Kickstarter.
If you’ve been following Ryan K Lindsay’s career over the past decade, you know that he likes to dig into the emotional core of big genre stories and is passionate about making creator owned comics.
You also probably know Ryan has a keen eye for talent, and in Chris Panda has found the perfect partner to bring this action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage tale that doesn’t shy away from big ideas & emotions to life.
Here at ComixTribe, we’ve built a reputation for producing some of the slickest hardcovers in the world of comics… but we’re not content to rest on our laurels.
And that’s why we decided to partner with Sam Amborn at Printlore to do something truly special with this cover.
First, we decided Chris' big visuals needed more room, which is why this book is large format (7.75” x 11.25”) which is 30% bigger than your standard comic book!
Watch This to See How That Awesome Die-Cut Translucent Cover Works:
PLAY

We wanted to replicate the appeal of the visually stunning mask SHE wears by creating a special Die-Cut, transparent, layered image that will turn heads all across the galaxy.
Our goal is to create a stunning, original graphic novella package that’s beautiful inside and out! 
Creator owned comics live and die on the support of readers like you.

A Kickstarter launch lets us reach sci-fi comic fans around the globe and raise the substantial amount of funding we’ll need to fire up the press and create this one-of-a-kind hardcover, unlike anything you’ve seen before.
 Funds raised above and beyond our modest goal will go into project stretch goal enhancements for our backers as well as be invested back into the series.
 Want a Peek? Take a Look at These Pages Inside the Book... 
Want to See More Before You Ascend the Tower?
If you'd like to read even more of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known before you back this campaign, we invite you to download this extended ashcan preview.
💀 CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE EXTENDED ASHCAN PREVIEW 💀

The SHE team has been working on this project for well over a year. The book is done, our printer is already working on the finer details of our custom book, and we're ready to roll as soon as this baby funds! 
As usual for ComixTribe campaigns, US shipping is FREE… 
...but given that many of Ryan's fans are AUSSIE based and how rough the past few months have been due to wildfires, hailstorms, flooding and of course, viruses... 
...we’ve also decided to make AUS shipping free as well on most pledge levels!
 (Your welcome, mates!)
Here's How We Protect Your Rewards in Transit So Books Arrive in Great Condition for Collectors:
It's so not cool when you back an awesome Kickstarter campaign only to have your books damaged upon arrival, right?
To prevent that, we package our books with collectors in mind, and use Gemini Comic Mailers to protect and secure your books during transit.
And our Collector's Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.

Once this project funds, we’re going to get right to firing up the presses so we can get it on your shelves as soon as possible.
Please know that the entire creative team has been working on this for over a year, and we’re dedicated to ensuring all backers receive more than just a story, but an experience with SHE.
And if you love her as much as we do, there will be more SHE stories in the future.
 So if you’re a fan of action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage, and big ideas & emotions in your comics,  then scroll down our Kickstarter page, find the pledge level perfect for you and join us for the wild ride.
And after you back, please take the time to share the link somewhere you use your voice for good.
Click to Share on FB
Click to Share on Twitter
Tell the people you know that #SheIsComing and they are going to want to get on board!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The support of backers on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of ComixTribe since our very first project back in 2012 and Ryan K Lindsay, who has been launching projects since 2014. 

Our success would not have been possible without the support of thousands of backers like you over the years...

So you better believe we take the trust of our backers very seriously.

We've taken a number of actions to mitigate risk associated with this campaign, including completing the creation of the book prior to launching and establishing a strong relationship with a quality printer who has done great work for us in the past and known for a hands on attention to detail and quality craftsmanship.

Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks, unforeseen hiccups, and lessons learned...and we've certainly learned valuable lessons from every past campaign.

During this time of global uncertainty, we realize that steady communication with our backers throughout the campaign and fulfillment process is key... and should any unforeseen issues cause delays, our backers will be the first to know. We're all going to get through this! 

We're committed to delivering a superior reward delivery experience for our backers, so we're investing in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house, to eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

ComixTribe and the SHE team have a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we enjoy so much support from returning backers is testament to that.

So we invite you to back with confidence, as we want to be entertaining you for years to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: EVERFROST - A New RKL Sci Fi Comic - Preorder Now! :]
updates.update_content:
Heya! It's me, Ryan K Linday, the guy who wrote this book. I really hope you enjoyed SHE Vol. 1 - I've snuck in under ComixTribe Publisher Tyler James' watchful eye to craft my own update to the campaign because I'm superexcited about something, and I think you'll want to hear it.
If the sci fi insanity, wrapped around the pulsing heart of emotionally weathered souls, and completed with gorgeous world-building art of SHE was your jam then I think you 100% need EVERFROST in your life, and this is the week where you can preorder my latest comic through your local comic shop. Read on to make June a better month for your comic reading habit!

updates.update_userinfo: Study Up! SHE Study Guide is here!
updates.update_content:
Hey friends! Tyler James from ComixTribe here. It's been a crazy last 30 days.... Halloween. Election Night, and week, and whatever this period is, pandemic, Thanksgiving coming up... it's A LOT. 
Throwing our most ambitious Kickstarter launch ever into the mix... well, it's really a lot. But we love what we do and really love what we had the ability to create.

updates.update_userinfo: Last Day for Another Die-Cut Hardcover from ComixTribe, Plus Live Hang Out Tonight!
updates.update_content:
Hey, SHE backers! We wanted to jump in and share some cool news that recently dropped, and at the same time remind you that there's just 11 days left to add another die-cut hardcover to your collection in the form of WAILING BLADE: HEADTAKER which is live on Kickstarter. 
Now, the SHE team of artist Chris Panda and Ryan K Lindsay have already been discussing a follow-up volume of SHE... but we're also thrilled to announce that ComixTribe is planning another new project with Ryan and artist [REDACTED] that we have planned for 2021.

updates.update_userinfo: A Preview of Ryan K Lindsay's Next Launch With ComixTribe
updates.update_content:
Shortly after we delivered the SHE: At the Tower of All That Is Known deluxe die-cut hardcover to you and all the rest of our outstanding backers, we got right back on the phone with our printer and said, "Hey, SHE came out awesome... let's up the ante with our next book!" 
Game on!

Hey, friends! 
Just wanted to say how thrilled we are to see copies of SHE popping up around the globe!

updates.update_userinfo: It's Here! Download your SHE Creator Commentary with Ryan K Lindsay MP3!

Hey, friends, we're excited to let you know that shipping has commenced for SHE! 
Hundreds of copies landed in Australia for our Aussie backers, which Ryan K Lindsay will be handling the packing and shipping of directly.

Hey, friends! Hope you're all doing well, and getting ready for the start of summer!
Just wanted to let you know that everything is still on track and smooth sailing for SHE fulfillment. 
A bunch of cool SHE stuff has come in...

Hey, friends! Hope you're hanging in there. 
First, we need to thank you all for being on the ball with surveys. 96% of them are now complete, which means we've got pretty solid counts on everything fulfillment wise.

campaign.story:
Two Swords Til Mercy is a spaghetti western set in a medieval realm created by Brentt Harshman, J. Paul Schiek, A.H.G., and LetterSquids that tells the story of one man’s quest to avenge his murdered brother and how this affects the entire realm of Mercy after the death of one of its prominent leaders. 
When the King of the Northlands is assassinated and a note reading “no more monarchs” is left on his corpse, his best friend, an elderly monk named Aldus Berryann, must travel across the realm to deliver the news to the Queen of the Southlands. However, unbeknownst to him, his guide and bodyguard, Lamond Yohe, is also on a journey to avenge his brother by hunting down and killing all the former cultists who took his life.  
Two Swords Til Mercy is a five-issue miniseries written by Brentt Harshman with line art by J. Paul Schiek, colors by A.H.G., and lettering by LetterSquids. Imagine if Sergio Leone directed an episode of Game of Thrones, and you'll come close to what we picture with this book. 
We are asking for $5,000 which will be split between production costs, kickstarter fees, printing, and shipping. 
WHO WILL ENJOY TWO SWORDS TIL MERCY?
- Fans of Tarantino, Sergio Leone, and Game of Thrones.
- Readers of Crone, East of West, and Once & Future.
- People who enjoy high octane action and engaging dialogue. Strong characters...oh, and bloody revenge. 
The point of this kickstarter is to raise funds to produce the first issue (of five) of a new comic book series. That's the main reward...but that doesn't mean there aren't other goodies outside of digital and physical copies of the books.
We will also be featuring original sketch cards, prints, pieces of art, other works by the creative team, short stories and watercolor sketches by EASTIN DEVERNA of SAMURAI GRANDPA fame, a custom printed map of Mercy, an alternate cover by J., variant covers by friends who also happen to be AMAZING artists, as well as stickers, shirts, buttons/pins, and coffee mugs as stretch goals if we surpass our goal of 5,000 dollars. 
Our first variant cover is an alternate cover by creators of the book J. Paul Schiek and Brentt Harshman!
Another variant cover comes to us from ANDY MICHAEL, friend of the team and artist on books such as sLAsher and Of Space!
 The third variant cover comes from SACHI EDIRIWEERA and colored by ELLIE WRIGHT. 
Our fourth variant cover is by Lane Lloyd (God Puncher)
and our final variant cover is by Emily Pearson (The Wilds, Bonding, SnapFlashHustle)
Mainly, we just want to make our book. I'm a firm believer that the product should sell itself, not gimmicks, so that is what we are showcasing. For $5, you get a digital copy of the book. For $15, you get a print copy of the book. While there are other goodies, the book is DAMN good and DAMN deserving of your investment.
I mean, who doesn't want to see a drunken mercenary stab a dude in the eye with a broken sword in the name of vengeance?
Cheers!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Comics are expensive to produce, so cost is the main hurdle we face. This book is the first of five chapters, each one costing around $5,000 to produce, print, and ship. While this is a daunting number, we believe it is doable and we believe we have a wonderful product that you will love.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We are limiting this to three backers, but we might open up another tier later for three more backers if we sell out. You'll also receive everything from the previous tiers: your name in the back of the book, a pdf of the book, pdfs of other books by the team, a signed copy of the book, and a sketch from the Two Swords Til Mercy team.

updates.update_content:
Wow! What a first week! We got to 30% of our $5,000 goal. While we still have quite a ways to go, we have gotten much farther than I anticipated. I believe in us and I believe in you, keep getting word out there and let people know how excited you are for this book!
Also, as a way to celebrate our success so far, we will be launching a NEW REWARD TIER tomorrow! An alternate cover by J. Paul Schiek, with colors by Brentt Harshman.
Check it out and get stoked...more variant covers soon to be revealed!

Seriously. To all our incredible first day backers, thank you for coming out and showing your support. We are in some tough times and we are ALL dealing with some ****, so your support means the world. Thanks to all of you, we surpassed the $1k/20% mark in a single day and that is incredible. We still have a ton of mountain left to climb, but this was a great start. Keep spreading the word, lets get this book funded and made!
Also, while you are on Kickstarter, make sure you check out the campaign for Issues 1-3 of 20 FISTS by Frankee White and co. It’s an incredible book and they are SO CLOSE to their goal! Help them out!

project_data.project_name: Two Swords Til Mercy: Chapter One

campaign.story:
Do you enjoy comics like Tokyo Ghost or films like The Matrix and Blade Runner? Perhaps you enjoy anime like Ghost in the Shell or TV shows like Black Mirror? If so, Peace of Mind could well be for you...
The Human Cost of the Corporation's Greed
Hello to new potential backers and welcome back to those that helped make the first two issues a reality! This campaign is to fund the trade paperback printing run for Peace of Mind, totalling around 96 printed pages that are in full colour. 
Peace of Mind is a Sci-Fi dystopian comic book series set in the-not-too distant future where VR addiction is rife and consumers struggle with adapting to reality. As hyper-capitalism creeps in, poverty becomes epidemic as addicts struggle to pay for the Corporation's VR Service, for nothing is free... especially your peace of mind!
Join Mickey, Suzy, Leroy and 57762D in their journey from the depths of the sewers to the Corporate City, as they evade PMCs, combat their own apathy and flee from a sentient firewall... 
PLEASE NOTE: Due to Coronavirus and other things out of our control, we’ve pushed the due date to August as a contingency. However, there was some miscommunication and not all the tier reward due dates reflect this. Please accept our apologies for this. 
 We recommend Peace of Mind to readers who are young adults and older, due to some dark and suggestive themes, and strong language.
Peace of Mind - The Complete Story
Peace of Mind - Page One
Peace of Mind - Page Two
Below are a collection of reviews for issues 1 and 2, see what reviewers have to say about the series so far!
"The book is a pretty breathtaking achievement..." -2G1Review
"... well-chosen emotional moments, subtly told, that will stick with me..." - Comics Worth Reading
"In just a few pages the reader is brought into the world of PoM and introduced to some intense psychological, emotional and logical ideas." - Super Serious Comics
"Writer Callum Fraser and artist Emiliano Correa have created a really slick and smart sci-fi thriller" - Pipedream Comics
"Every page of Peace of Mind has at least a few things in it (and often many more) that are worth stopping and thinking about." - A Place to Hang your Cape
"...this is a really smart and ambitious piece of small press sci-fi that has the potential to be something very special" - Pipedream Comics
"Dark but still with striking colors, Correa sets a visual tone that is at once ominous and paranoid as well as warm and hopeful – much like the characters" - Comic Book Yeti
Check out the reviews from readers on the Comichaus app:
User Reviews on Comichaus
Callum Fraser - Writer, story: Twitter, Instagram
Emiliano Correa - Art (pencils/ink/colours): Twitter and Instagram
Rob Jones - Letters: Twitter and Facebook
Christa Harader - Editor, Issue #3: Twitter and Website
Grym Comics - Label: Twitter, Facebook and Instagram
Angus Medford - Creator of Maya: Instagram
Hannah Baber - Illustrator: Portfolio 
There are several reward tiers up for grabs, including digital, physical and a mix of both! Please note that postage will be applied via our pledge manager system, BackerKit, so there will be an additional charge when you fill our your surveys. At time of writing, we anticipate that they will be:
£2.00 for the UK | £4.00 for the EU, US and Canada | £5.00 Rest of the World.
The main reward is the Peace of Mind Trade Paperback - 96 printed pages long and contains the entire story arc, which is 2 standard issues and an extra long finale. 
"Wait, but where's issue 3?!" - We took the decision to save on printing costs by combining every issue together. Whilst pricing up Issue 3, we found that the sale price would not be much less than a Trade Paperback. Issue 1 will also have 'reduxed' artwork where Emiliano sees fit, as per his request. 
Additional items and comics can be purchased via our pledge manager once the Kickstarter has run its course.
What comic Kickstarter campaign would be complete without some A4 prints? We have up to four up for grabs. Our artists are Emiliano Correa, who is also the artist for Peace of Mind, Bristol based illustrator Hannah Baber, and Callum Fraser. Take a look at them below:
Peace of Mind Trade Paperback Print - by Emiliano Correa
J.E.N.K.I.N.S. - by Hannah Baber
Dancing Under Surveillance - by Callum Fraser
57762D - by Emiliano Correa | The cover for Peace of Mind #2 | Digital Heart - by Hannah Baber
Whoa there, we were funded in less than 48 hours! That means we really need to think about them stretch goals. Here is our roadmap:
"What do you mean 'Callum gets paid'?" 
To keep costs down, Callum has not taken a page rate for writing Peace of Mind nor has he been paid for the admin behind the scenes. This stretch goal will mean he gets a £5 per written page rate.
Founded by Peace of Mind writer Callum Fraser in the embers of summer 2017, Grym Comics is a small indie label specialising in the weird and wonderful.  
We use Twitter, Facebook and Instagram, as well as a mail list to keep our readers up to date, so check us out!  We also go to Comic Cons across the UK, so if you see us, be sure to say hi!
Our stall at Nottingham Comic Con - 2019
For full transparency: per unit (incl. the trade paperback, bagging and envelope) it will cost us £6.44, at time of writing. This does not include labour costs (i.e. creator fees and man-hours for admin), which will be fronted by Callum, or postage. As mentioned previously, postage will be applied after we are funded via BackerKit. 
Additionally, Kickstarter takes a 5% cut of the total project as well as a small % per pledge. 
NOTE: Tax is the responsibility of the recipient. From our experience, we sent the first issue all over the Americas (Argentina, North America and Canada) and Europe without issue. However, as we've grown, we've decided to open shipping up to more countries (South Africa, Russia and Japan for example). Please be aware that your country may apply an import tax to your pledge.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Quite small. The biggest risk stems from the fact that we are a small indie label, so lack the exposure of bigger names - this is our fourth crowdfunding campaign, so we're slowly gaining exposure! Second biggest is a delay - we are all human, and if the creative team needs to slow down a bit, then that's a decision we will make to safeguard the health of the creative team.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello all,

A quick one to say Happy Easter to you and we hope you are well. Look what the Easter Bunny brought us:

Hello all,

Callum here. Welcome to March. Printing Month.
It's been a long road, too long, and I want to thank you for your patience through all our delays. At time of typing, we're at a level of surveys completed (86%) where we can look to give a "lock in" date so we can prepare to receive the comics and ship them out to you.

campaign.story:
Haven't read the previous issues? Get caught up here! Kickstarter Promo Cover. Not Actual Cover For Issue #3
What Is Midnight Tiger About:  The story revolves around young high school senior  Gavin Shaw, a disillusioned teen living in the crime infested city of Apollo Bay, California who's lost faith in the heroes he admired growing up. After attempting to save the life of the gravely injured hero known as Lionsblood, Gavin finds himself waking up in a hospital bed days later with amazing new abilities. He becomes Apollo Bay's very own superhero, MIDNIGHT TIGER , and becomes an inspiration to his community!
Awesome MIDNIGHT TIGER by Comics Legend Ron Frenz with inks by Marc Deering and colors by Ross Campbell!
Overall Theme: At its core, it's a character driven series that is part coming of age story and part hero's journey. A fun teenage superhero action-adventure told in the Silver Age style of comics that chronicles a young hero's rediscovery of his childhood dreams versus the reality of realizing them in order to help the people of his city rediscover theirs.  MIDNIGHT TIGER will examine the idea that in order to truly save a life, sometimes you have to inspire people to live. In issue #3 we begin see how he plans to make that happen within the Apollo Bay community.

PREVIOUSLY, AT THE END OF ISSUE #2: 
QUITE THE CLIFFHANGER!! Easy To See Why Fans Want To Know What Happens!!

DESPITE THE HIATUS, OUR HERO STAYED BUSY:  During the time after issue #2 when production stopped on the mini-series, MIDNIGHT TIGER continued his adventures! Teaming up with Vito Delsante and Sean Izaakse's STRAY, Jamal Igle's MOLLY DANGER, Anthony Ruttgaizer's F1RST HERO, Shawn Gabborin and Chad Cicconi's VIRTUE from FRACTURE, and more to save the world in Action Lab's ACTIONVERSE crossover. Then, later coming back home to Apollo Bay in MIDNIGHT TIGER: STRONGER! Those events take place between the end of issue #3 and the beginning of the second half of issue #4.  That's why we have to get these issues completed!
MIDNIGHT TIGER Helps Save the ACTIONVERSE and Comes Back to Apollo Bay to Some Big Life Changes!
THAT'S WHY THIS KICKSTARTER IS SO IMPORTANT: SInce the cliffhanger of issue #2, and thanks to ACTIONVERSE, Comixology,convention appearances, and local comic shops, MIDNIGHT TIGER's fan base has grown! Fans not only want to know what happened after issue #2, but wanted to make sure I came back to finish the story myself. After working as a freelancer the last 6 to 7 years...I'm now in a position to take the reins and tie up those loose ends!

MIDNIGHT TIGER #3 TEXTLESS 5-PAGE PREVIEW: We're 5 pages into issue #3 already! Here's a preview...
MIDNIGHT TIGER #3 PG1
MIDNIGHT TIGER #3 PG2
MIDNIGHT TIGER #3 PG3
MIDNIGHT TIGER #3 PG4
MIDNIGHT TIGER #3 PG5
WHAT THE KICKSTARTER WILL PAY FOR: Though our Kickstarter's rewards are mostly digital the proceeds will pay for our Editor, Letterer, & Colorist, the shipping costs for the 18 physical deliverables (ORIGINAL ART!!) and convention appearances to promote the book with merchandise like prints, stickers, and other promotion items. As the Creator, Writer, Artist, and KS Campaign runner, despite the amount of time and effort needed to run a KS and produce a full comic, I've taken myself out of the base goal amount. Making sure the book is done and the creative team is paid is my number one priority.  Any additional proceeds past the goal will help pay for my own time away from freelance work, additional production costs, and if it's a significant amount...might just also pay for all the production costs of issue #4!! Killer stretch goal, right!? That would be awesome!
Just to put things in perspective, the average production cost to produce a single comic issue is around $7000. That would pay for a Writer, Penciler, Inker, Colorist, Letterer, and Editor at a decent rate. All before printing, advertising, and distribution costs get added! This is my reason for going 75-80% digital. I can create great comics, pay my creative team a decent rate, which only consists of an Editor, Letterer, & Colorist since I'm taking up the Writer/Artist mantle, all for a base goal of $3000 per issue! If this succeeds, this will be the template for which I produce all my creator-owned content.

OUR CREATIVE TEAM:
Ray-Anthony Height (Creator/Artist/Writer)grew up in Compton California. He's been freelancing at Marvel Comics for over a decade on titles like X-Men Blue, Miles Morales: Spider-Man, Marvel's Voices, and Moon Girl & Devil Dinosaur. In 2016 he also worked as a storyboard artist on Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy Animated Series and more recently worked for Archie Comics on Archie 1955 with Brian Augustyn and Mark Waid. He likes to wear flatcaps.
Vito Delsante (Editor/Writer of MIDNIGHT TIGER: STRONGER) has written for DC Comics, Marvel Comics, Dynamite Entertainment, AdHouse Books, and Simon & Schuster, among others and his stories have been reprinted in other countries. He's also the co-creator of Tribute: The B.U.t14u7 1s (or, The Beautiful Ones) and STRAY. Both here on Kickstarter. He also lettered issue #2 of the original MIDNIGHT TIGER. He lives in Pittsburgh with his family and wears glasses. Find him if you can and say, “Hello.”
Erica Schultz (Letterer) is a comic book writer and editor best known for writing Xena: Warrior Princess and Charmed for Dynamite Entertainment, her participation in DC Comics' first Talent Development Writers Workshop, and the award-winning, creator-owned crime series, M3 with artist Vicente Alcázar. Her latest work includes the Daredevil Annual for Marvel Comics with artist Marcio Takara and Twelve Devils Dancing with artist Dave Acosta for Action Lab Danger Zone. She also lettered the FCBD issue of the original MIDNIGHT TIGER. She just might be the Jersey Devil.
Paul Little (Colorist) is a Canadian artist  who has worked primarily as a comic book colorist since 2007. His work has appeared in titles from publishers including Image Comics, BOOM! Studios, Dark Horse, IDW, Joe Books, Ahoy Comics, and more. Projects include the Eisner Award-nominated series Morning Glories, licensed titles ranging from Darkwing Duck to Sons of Anarchy, and anthologies including the Eisner Award-winning Little Nemo: Dream Another Dream in addition to being the original colorist on MIDNIGHT TIGER mini-series. 

SHOUT OUT TO FORMER CREATIVE TEAM MEMBERS: DeWayne Feenstra (Co-Writer), Matt Wieman (Inker), *Paul Little (Colorist), Eric Van Elslande (Artist of STRONGER), Wilson Ramos Jr. (Colorist on STRONGER), Justin Birch (Letterer of STRONGER), Nicole D'Andria (Editor on STRONGER), Nate Lovett (Colorist on MIDNIGHT TIGER: ACTIONVERSE), Shayla Height (Editor/Awesome Wife of Creator)

MORE ON OUR HERO:
MIDNIGHT TIGER TURNAROUND
MIDNIGHT TIGER/ACTIONVERSE SOURCEBOOK ENTRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF A FEBRUARY LAUNCH: It's Black History Month! Though representation and diversity have been the strongest it's ever been, it's sad to say that MIDNIGHT TIGER is still one of the few comics out there with a Black teenager as the title character. Our goal is to still have Gavin be a positive character for any reader picking up the book, but it's so very important that young Black Americans see themselves represented not just as integral characters, but as heroes. Heroes inspires us to be better and nothing helps to get that point across stronger than someone who looks like you.  That said, peer pressure, parents, school, dating, the future, and finding one's place in the world are things all of us can relate to!

THAT'S IT, FOLKS! LET'S DO THIS! A KICKSTARTER VIDEO IS CURRENTLY BEING EDITED AND SHOULD BE UPLOADED LATER IN THE WEEK! CHECK AT LEAST ONCE A WEEK FOR UPDATES!!
WOO HOO!!
Issues 0-2 PDFs UNLOCKED!
We're off to an AMAZING start!!
  By hitting the halfway point before the first day ended you've unlocked an addition to Backer rewards of $10 or more! Some of you have been asking if issues 0-2 would be available as part of a rewards tier and it was like you were all reading my mind! Guess you guys know me too well! You can't have issues #3 without the previous issue, right?!?! I HAD to do it! Figured it was the perfect benchmark of the campaign's progress, too. Thank you all for making DAY-1 great!!
So, what's our next goal? Glad you asked...
If we knocked out half the goal within 24 hrs....What could we do in a WEEK!?!
  WE GOT THIS!!
Great question! I personally think we can get it done! Well, here is some incentive to help us get there:
If we manage to hit our goal by the end of this Friday I will give every Backer who pledges $20 or more a voucher for a FREE inked head sketch that'll be redeemable at any convention I attend! A $40 value!! That voucher works for large sketchbooks or sketch covers. As long as you have that voucher when you approach me for a sketch at a convention you will go IMMEDIATELY to the top of my commission list and I will redeem it. Here is a sample of what you get...
LETS KEEP IT GOING & MAKE IT HAPPEN, FOLKS!!

$3500 STRETCH GOAL
JOHN'S BEAUTIFUL COLLABS WITH NICK BRADSHAW, JORGE JIMENEZ, RYAN OTTLEY, & SANFORD GREENE!
$3500 STRETCH GOAL - ISSUE #3 COLORED BY JOHN RAUCH!!
John is one of the best and most sought after colorists in comics! John has worked with comics superstars like Nick Bradshaw, Ryan Ottley, Jorge Jimenez, Sanford Greene, and many more! A collaboration with him on the MIDNIGHT TIGER #3 cover would be a treat for both the backers and myself!! 

$4000 STRETCH GOAL
A SAMPLE OF CHUCK'S INCREDIBLE CONTRIBUTIONS TO COMICS AND ANIMATION!!
$4000 STRETCH GOAL - VARIANT COVER BY CHUCK PATTON!
Co-Creator of DC Comics Vibe & Gypsy, regular penciler on JUSTICE LEAGUE OF AMERICA, Animation Director of TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES, G.I. JOE, Netflix's KULIPARI: Dream Walker, & Todd McFarlane's SPAWN...for which he won an Emmy. Chuck is a personal hero of mine and with a list of accomplishments as long as his, needless to say that having him contribute to the MIDNIGHT TIGER Kickstarter would be a complete honor!
WE HIT BOTH OF THESE STRETCH GOALS AND EVERY BACKER WHO PLEDGES $5 OR MORE RECEIVES THEM!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In all honesty, the only risk would be to just not do the book at all, but that's definitely not going to happen! Midnight Tiger has been my baby for more than 7 years and his first mini-series deserves to be completed. Which is why I've taken time off from freelance work just to make it happen. Also,we're already a quarter of the way done and with 75% of the rewards being digital, not only does it reduce production costs, but almost completely eliminates one of the biggest issues of most KS. Delivery of rewards! We only have 18 rewards that would require any physical shipping. 

With weekly updates (if not more) all the way through the campaign and long after, backers will see the issue come to life every step of the way!

The production will be on a roughly 10-week schedule after launch. That will provide wiggle room for the creative team to juggle their other assignments, mishaps, & personal lives. We all want to do our best and give the Midnight Tiger fans new and old a quality product.

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

cover art by Shawn Daley
                    (W) CJ Pendragon | (A)(Letters) Brian Middleton Jr. | (E) Bob Salley
                                           | The Story |
GRANNY GOLEM #1 is a 24-page, full-colored comic book that follows Ariela, a young girl living in a childhood nightmare. 
Her parents are divorced, and sometimes, that seems like it's worse than the constant screaming. But when she suffers a great loss in her personal life, and her father can't ignore the state of her neglectful home with her alcoholic mother any longer, Ariela is forced to say good-bye to the only life she's ever known. Uprooted to a new state, a new house and an estranged relative, Ariela is struggling to cope with the structure of her new home and the big, complicated feelings she has towards both of her parents.
But it doesn't take long for Ariela to realize there's something... special... about her new home.
When old folktales spring to life around her, she learns to cope with the anger inside her and how to rely on others with a bit of supernatural guidance from an unexpected source.
Granny Golem takes a little bit of influence from several folklore tales over the entire run but its main inspiration is Judaism. Ariela's maternal side is Jewish and the primary folklore in the story is derived from a version of their lore.
Brian Middleton Jr, on the creation of Ariela.
                                       | The Inspiration |
The writer and creator behind GRANNY GOLEM, CJ Pendragon, grew up in a broken home. Her parents divorced when she was young and it was not an amicable split. She and her siblings spent a few years with inconsistent visitation, an unreliable father figure and too much exposure to the world of adults. Her father did, and does, struggle with substance abuse and inherently selfish nature, similar to what we will see in Ariela's mother. She also experienced the pain and betrayal of an absent parent when he later disappeared from their lives altogether. 
The story for GRANNY GOLEM started out as an idea her husband proposed a few years ago. Over time, it has evolved from a floundering prose tale to a personalized comic script that hit all of her own past wounds. CJ used writing GRANNY GOLEM as an opportunity to heal herself and let go of some of the overwhelming, dormant emotions she still carries two decades later.
Divorces are very common in our society, and often we don't realize the impact it has on the children involved. Children of divorced parents are often less healthy, physically and mentally, and deal with very big, negative feelings and a lot of "What if's?" 
CJ hopes that GRANNY GOLEM, targeted towards a middle-grade audience but written for everyone, can help kids like her learn to verbalize and resolve their feelings about parental absenteeism and addiction instead of internalizing it into a festering wound. Children caught in divorce tend to blame themselves. Too often we forget to tell kids that their feelings are valid, even if they are mistaken.
"I have poured so much of myself into this story that it's nearly killed me at times."
- CJ
Brian Middleton Jr. on the golem's design.
With the Jewish folklore mixed in, CJ was able to see the world through a child's eyes again. The magic and wonder of everything around us, the connection with loved ones. The path and capacity to cry and heal and live.
You can read more about CJ's personal thoughts behind GRANNY GOLEM here:
https://www.comicbookyeti.com/post/an-interview-with-cj-pendragon-writer-of-granny-golem
                                       | The Story So Far: |
Take a peek at Brian's interiors! We won't tell if you don't!
Page One
Page Two
Page Three
Page Four
....let's skip ahead, shall we?
Page Fifteen
         How Influential is Judaism on the rest of the story?
One of the most challenging parts of GRANNY GOLEM, and the most rewarding, has been the research put into Judaism lore and history. CJ worked closely with several friends, family and community consults to ensure that Judaism was weaved into Ariela's story with respect and authenticity. She has hired a translation firm for English to Yiddish translation, has employed a sensitivity reader and has taken care to add little touches of Jewish culture to Ariela's character and surroundings.
Bubbe, the grandmother, is an important part of the GRANNY GOLEM universe and is the titular character. Bubbe is named and modeled after CJ's own step-grandmother.
                                    | MEET THE TEAM |
CJ Pendragon is a married mother of three with a mini-menagerie of children, cats, dogs and chickens! This is her first comic project but she owns and runs the comic book review site, Sirens of Sequentials.
Brian Middleton Jr. is married with two beautiful daughters and six cats! Brian is the creator behind Wulfborne, an indie comic published through SCOUT COMICS. You can read the entire trilogy in trade!
Bob Salley is our editor. He's also the writer of the renowned series OGRE with Source Point Press! Bob is credited on other titles as well, including BROKEN GARGOYLES, SALVAGERS and SHELTER DIVISION. He recently wrote a children's book!
Shawn Daley is our cover artist! The artist and co-creator on OGRE with Bob, Shawn has credits all over the place to his name. He's co-creator of SAMURAI GRANDPA, creator of TERRAQUILL and you should buy his work.
                                 |    REWARDS   |
The fun part, oh boy! The rewards for GRANNY GOLEM are all carefully selected for the level of personalization it adds to the experience. CJ and Brian will be working hands-on with the rewards in an effort to provide the highest quality of work possible to backers. The few they are not directly creating themselves come from vetted sources.
Take a look at the handmade golem plush backers can purchase at one of our higher rewards levels!
Sticker Design; Brian Middleton Jr
GOLEM plush! Limited reward tier from Jenn Marshall
                                       | FINAL WORDS |
Our team at GRANNY GOLEM believes in making comics for everyone. GRANNY GOLEM is CJ's effort to bring the limelight to real troubles affecting a large portion of the population in a fantastical, relatable way. It is also an attempt to pay homage to a rich, beautiful culture that has a history she feels needs more attention.
We are excited to put this project together and bring it to life. We cannot thank you enough for your support in our journey and are eager to hand you the finished product as soon as we possibly can.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have selected a printer and are working with a very talented editor, Bob Salley. Time will be our biggest challenge but CJ and Brian are both wholly dedicated to GRANNY GOLEM #1 and the completion of our project in an efficient and quick manner. We plan to stay in touch weekly to keep you updated as we go!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We're winding down! What a fun ride :D

We are sitting at 30% funded right now and I know we can close this over the next several days with your continued support <3 
Brian and I are working through script touch ups and knocking out the pages quickly (the man is a machine and I am beyond lucky to have him on board for this!). We're dedicated to getting this book to y'all ASAP but we need you to keep telling your friends about us!

updates.update_userinfo: Tips & Tricks from Brian: How a Page Comes Together
updates.update_content:
Thank y'all so much! The first few days of this campaign for GRANNY GOLEM #1 has gone better than I could have hoped for, and we only have y'all to thank for that!
The amount of support from backers and our friends on social media has been overwhelming and extremely motivating. Brian and I cannot wait to get this campaign funded so that we can get our book into your very deserving hands.
Brian finished up some art after launch, and I'm going to share some of the progress with y'all :p

campaign.story:
What is THE HATED?
Equal parts spaghetti western and blaxploitation thriller, THE HATED is a new comic book written by David F. Walker, drawn by Sean Damien Hill, colored by Mx. Struble, lettered by Becca Carey, and published by Solid Comix.
THE HATED cover art by Sean Damien Hill with colors by Mx. Struble
It is 1872, and the war between the North and South is over. Neither side won. After years of bloody conflict, both sides entered into a truce, resulting in the formation of two nations, the Union States of America, where blacks are free, and the Confederate States of America, where blacks are still enslaved. Araminta Free is a former slave turned bounty hunter. She specializes in crossing the border into the Confederacy, and liberating slaves. She also tracks down Confederate war criminals, which has made her a woman with a price on her head in the southern nation. When a group of Confederate Raiders illegally ventures deep into the Union to kidnap free blacks and sell them into slavery, the stage is set for a deadly showdown between Araminta and the men who want her dead.
Imagine if director Sergio Corbucci (DJANGO, THE GREAT SILENCE) made a western starring Pam Grier as a badass, gun-slinging bounty hunter. Now imagine the story takes place in a world where the Civil War ended differently – instead of a victory for the North, there is a truce, and what had been one country is now two. This is THE HATED.
The first issue of THE HATED is 100% drawn and inked, and is currently being colored. Here are some samples of the amazing work by artist Sean Damien Hill and colorist Mx. Struble.
WHAT ARE YOU FUNDING?
This campaign is funding the first issue of THE HATED, a mini-series written and published by David F. Walker, drawn by Sean Damien Hill, colored by Shaun Struble, and lettered by Becca Carey. This will be a full color, 40-page comic book plus cover.
30 pages of story
10  back-up pages
Standard sized comic
The purpose of this campaign is to fund the production and printing of THE HATED #1, fulfill all backer rewards, and cover the cost of shipping and handling for all reward tiers. Because THE HATED is more pages than ONE FALL, the cost of printing and shipping is more, for that reason, we have set our goal higher this time. But all of the money is going towards the costs of producing and delivering all rewards, any remaining/extra funds will go toward the production of THE HATED #2.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We wanted the freedom to create a series on our own terms, and at a pace that works for our schedules. The first issue of THE HATED is drawn, inked, and partially colored and lettered. By the time this campaign is over, the first issue will be 100% complete and ready to go to print. The money raised from this campaign will go to fund printing and productions costs of the first issue of THE HATED, production of other rewards, and shipping. Any money raised over the target goal will be used as seed money for the second issue of THE HATED.

THE HATED #1 - We've got some great rewards for this campaign, starting the the comic itself. You will have a choice of a digital comic or a physical copy. There are multiple options for covers of the physical copy, including the main Cover, and the variant Cover B (image only, no text). 
THE HATED #1 - David Mack Variant Cover - since a picture is worth 1,000 words, we'll just show it to you...
David Mack variant cover
THE HATED #1 Black and White Limited Edition - Solid Comix is pleased to offer a limited edition, black and white version of THE HATED #1. This is the exact same comic as the color edition, only without the color. This edition will have a limited print run for Kickstarter. There will be no second printing. The black and white edition will only be available here on Kickstarter (and at conventions if any are left) -- no digital copies, not available online, and no retailer copies. Once these are gone, they are gone. 
pages from the Black and White Limited Edition
 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!!! This amazing sticker (2"x3") featuring Araminta Free is included with all physical copies. Not available anywhere else, this is special thanks to everyone supporting Solid Comix and THE HATED. 
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!!!
BadAzz MoFo's Book of SPAGHETTI WESTERNS by David F. Walker - every order of THE HATED comes with this FREE digital of David F. Walker's book about spaghetti westerns, reprinted from the pages of his 'zine BadAzz MoFo. This digital book features reviews of more than 40 films and a historic overview of the Eurowestern genre -- 114 pages, including reviews of DJANGO, THE GREAT SILENCE, A BULLET FOR THE GENERAL, and many more. This is special thanks to everyone supporting Solid Comix and THE HATED.
ADD-ONS
The Joelle Jones 8.5”x11” pin-up is now available as an add-on to all print copy reward tiers for $10 each (sorry, not available with digital only). This was supposed to be the $20k stretch goal...but since we likely won't hit that goal, and since this is such an amazing work or art, and because I appreciated all the support everyone has shown to this campaign, it is being made available. 
To add the pin-up to your existing reward tier click the “Manage your pledge” button (it should be on the right side of your screen). This will take to a page called “Change Your Pledge.” Change the “PLEDGE AMOUNT” to reflect the adding of the pin-up or any other add-ons. EXAMPLE: If you pledge $8 to get a print copy of Cover A and you want to add the Joelle Jones, you would add $10, making your new pledge amount $28.
Joelle Jones 8.5"x11" pin-up
MORE ADD-ONS
ANOTHER NEW TIER!!!
We’ve just added a very special reward tier. Let’s call it the “I Love Indie Comics” tier. This is a special bundle that includes The Hated #1 (Cover A) along with three indies titles that I really like – Harriett Tubman: Demon Slayer #1, Crescent City Monsters#1, and Is’Nana the Were-Spider: The Ballads of Rawhead & John Henry.  All three are comic projects they I have backed on Kickstarter, and I want to share them with a select group of backers. You get physical copies of all four of these comics for $20, as well as the Kickstarter Exclusive Stickers and a PDF of BadAzz MoFo’s Book of Spaghetti Westerns. Limited to only 10!!!
 NEW TIERS ADDED!!! (UPDATE - All gone!!!)
I’m very happy to announce two new reward tiers. I have a limited number of BITTER ROOT #6 variant covers – both the ‘Do the Right Thing’ tribute cover and the ‘My Neighbor Totoro’ tribute cover. Both are extremely rare, and going for upwards of $100 on eBay. I have eight copies of each cover, and once they are gone, they are gone. This reward tier includes ONE copy of BITTER ROOT #6 (either the ‘Do the Right Thing’ cover or the ‘Totoro’ cover), a printed copy of THE HATED #1 (Cover A), Kickstarter Exclusive Sticker, and Free PDF of BadAzz MoFo’s Book of SPAGHETTI WESTERNS.
SORRY...All of these rewards are gone.
$20k Stretch Goal -- Joelle Jones 8.5"x11" pin-up, colored by Mx. Struble. 
This pin-up will be available as an add-on with print copies of THE HATED #1





THE CREATORS
David F. Walker - writer/publisher
 DAVID F. WALKER is the co-creator of BITTER ROOT (Image) NAOMI (DC) and  author of THE LIFE OD FREDERICK DOUGLASS (Ten Speed). He has written for Marvel, Dark Horse, BOOM!, and Dynamite.
Sean Damien Hill - artist
 SEAN DAMIEN HILL is an illustrator of comics, graphic novels, who also dabbles in the realm of concept art, character design and graphic design.
Mx. Struble - colorist
MX. STRUBLE is a writer and colorist working out of Dallas. In their free time, they like to make musi
Becca Carey - letterer/designer
 BECCA CAREY is a designer and illustrator with a penchant for the handmade approach.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there are risks and challenges involved with any Kickstarter campaign, THE HATED runs very little risk of hitting any problems. The art is complete, and the budget has been calculated to cover all costs, including shipping. Our first campaign for ONE FALL was successful, it came in on budget, and rewards were sent ahead of schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
