updates.update_content:
I've heard from some of you that your rewards never showed up. Replacements are going out in the mail this week. Now, if I may vent for a moment...
As many of you know, the United States Post Office has been facing difficult times, due in no small part to efforts to dismantle that agency. At the risk of getting too political, the damage wrought on the USPS by the Trump administration has been mind-boggling. I have been using the post office as my main source of business shipping for more than 25 years. In that time, I've had more problems in the last six months than in all those years combined. There have been more copies of The Hated that have simply disappeared than anything else I've ever shipped. In most cases, tracking shows that these packages were delivered, even though they weren't. And only a small handful have been returned. Who knows what happened to all of them?

updates.update_userinfo: Last Call for Reward Surveys in 2020!!!
updates.update_content:
There are still a few of you that have not filled out reward surveys, as well as a few of you who just filled it out within the last few weeks. Backers who recently filled out the survey, your rewards will be shipping within the upcoming week.
The deadline for filling out a reward survey AND getting your rewards shipped to you in 2020 is Monday, November 30, 2020. I will still ship rewards in 2021, but not until after the new year.
As of now, ALL rewards have been shipped that can be shipped. What does that mean? Well...if you have not received your rewards, it is either because you haven't filled out a reward survey OR your package was lost in the mail. Please contact me via direct message if you have not received your rewards.

UPDATE: Okay...I've checked the status on every reward package that has been sent out. Of the 900+ packages that have been sent out to folks in the United States, there are exactly 15 that have not been delivered. Some were sent Priority, some were sent Media Mail, and according to the Unites States Postal Service, all are still in transit...though all are delayed for reasons unknown. I'm preparing to send out new packages to the 15 of you still waiting. My only hesitation is that I suspect the new packages will take as long as the initial packages. That said, if a reward package isn't delivered this week, I'll start sending replacements over the weekend. I'm sorry this has taken so long.

I know some of you are frustrated that your rewards have not arrived yet. Trust me, I'm frustrated too. Without getting into politics (or political conspiracies), the United States Postal Service is a mess at the moment. Just do a Google search of "USPS delays" and you'll see what's going on. At the moment, there are about 20 packages that have not been delivered in the United States, which is down from more than 30 last week -- so they are getting delivered. Foreign deliveries have started arriving, primarily in Canada (which is surprising). For those of you waiting on your rewards, please, be patient. I am checking the tracking every day.

updates.update_userinfo: THE HATED #1 is now available to everyone!!!
updates.update_content:
We now have a store where you can buy both physical copies and PDF copies of THE HATED!!!
https://gumroad.com/solidcomix

Several people have reached out to inquire about their rewards. All rewards have been shipped to backers who provided their mailing address before July 23rd. If you provided your address after the 23rd, it has not yet shipped. Here is what I can tell you about orders that HAVE NOT ARRIVED...
Between July 10th and 12th, I shipped over 300 reward packages. Approximately 40 of those have not been delivered yet. I've checked the tracking, and most appear to have been delayed at mail processing facilities in either Portland or Seattle. All are currently "in transit." If you live in the United States and still have NOT received your rewards by the end of this week, please email me directly.

Hey folks, everyone outside of the United States waiting for me to come up with a creative way to handle the unexpectedly high cost of shipping, I've come up with the solution...I paid the postage rates (it's only money). Honestly, I could've flown to Europe, and hand-delivered comics for about the same money. I was actually supposed to do a book tour in France this summer, and I could've made trips to several other countries to deliver comics in person...but the damn pandemic ruined everything!!!
Speaking of the pandemic...I hope you all are doing your best to stay safe and healthy.

updates.update_userinfo: Attention Backers OUTSIDE of the United States!!! (and Damaged Copies!!!)
updates.update_content:
If you are a backer outside of the United States, I have sent you a private email to the address you provided. If you don't see it in your inbox, please check your spam folders.
The problem I am currently having is related to shipping costs. The cost of shipping two comics plus pin-ups and stickers to most countries in Europe is $11.26. The cost of shipping three comics plus pin-ups and stickers is $24.40, and the cost of shipping four comics is even more. The cost difference has to do with weight restrictions. I am working on a solution, and will have this all figured out in a few days. Thank you for your patience.

updates.update_userinfo: Missing Rewards & Damaged Copies & Foreign Orders
updates.update_content:
MISSING REWARDS - Hey everyone, now is the time that rewards should be showing up. I've checked the tracking numbers on a bunch of packages, and some have yet to be delivered. If you are in the U.S. and your reward package has not shown up by July 23rd, send me a message.
DAMAGED COPIES - If your rewards were severely damaged in the mail, please let me know, and I can replace it*. It has come to my attention that some copies of the comic that shipped were damaged prior to being sent (this was something that occurred at the printer). I will replace these as well. Just message me.

If you are a backer who lives outside the United States, I wanted to share this update. Because of COVID-19, the United States Postal Service has implemented various new policies for mail leaving the U.S. It is my understanding that USPS is no longer taking paper customs forms, but the website is for electronic forms is inaccessible. All of this is to say that there will be a delay in shipping foreign orders. I hope to have everything resolved within the next few days. Thanks for your patience.

project_data.project_name: THE HATED #1

campaign.story:
About this campaign
GET IN THE GAME is a collection of 8 page comics based around a simple prompt, video games. Ten different creative teams have worked over the past year to bring their stories to life. Clocking in at 110 hit points...err pages of content we are happy to bring this anthology to you!
The creative teams run the gamut from first time creators to indie comics veterans. The first-timers are hungry to prove themselves and the veterans have been amazingly supportive in the process, creating an incredible product that is full of heart!
Ryan Lee (MOUNTAINHEAD, XO: MAN OF WAR) lends his considerable talents to the standard cover of GET IN THE GAME, while watercolor master Corinne Roberts (CAFE MACABRE, OUT AND ABOUT, TRIP TO TREKKA) provides the beautiful Kickstarter Exclusive cover.
Standard (retail) version cover by Ryan Lee (MOUNTAINHEAD, XO: MAN OF WAR)
Kickstarter Exclusive cover by Corinne Roberts
About the stories!
Let's face it, this is what you want to see: The stories in this book, what makes them so special, and what they're about... so let's get to it!
LOGGING OUT
The first story we are featuring is written by first-timer Corey Maslowski, with art by Seth Damoose (FLOPPY COP, TALES OF MR. RHEEE), colors by Stephanie Varga, and letters by Jim McClain (SOLUTION SQUAD, POE AND THE MYSTERIADS).
LOGGING OUT is a story about the effect you may have on a person you  have never met in person, and how you never know what may be happening  on the other side of the screen.
DEAD BATTERIES
Our next story is from first time comic writer Dave Herndon with art duties by Travis Bramble(SIDE QUEST COMIC, BLACK MUSEUM). DEAD BATTERIES is a unique look at the unforeseen dangers of losing yourself in a video game.
SOLID STATE
Our next story comes from the mind of Dean Mason Jr. (ARCTIC) with art by Dan Finley. Editor Drena Jo (HAUNTED HIGH-ONS, BROKEN GARGOYLES), and colorist Isaac Bergmann round out the team to bring the story SOLID STATE to life.
 Solid State takes place in a dystopian future where human lives have  become little more than a commodity for a corporation to use as  entertainment for the masses. But what happens when the safety of those  commodities is threatened?
STARSHIP: PRECURSOR
From dual threat writer/artist Jarett Walen comes our next story  STARSHIP: PRECURSOR. A prequel story to his new book "The Wait of  Gravity", it focuses on heroine Captain Nora Fox and her battle with the  notorious Lizard Admiral Kokrondo!
UNDER THE ROOT
From the mind of poet Michelle Joy Gallagher (THE REJECTED, CAFE MACABRE) and with art by Emily Zelasko (SOMETHING, SOMETHING ADAM, EDME) comes UNDER THE ROOT with letterer extraordinaire Jim McClain (SOLUTION SQUAD, POE AND THE MYSTERIADS) lending his talents to complete the picture.
UNDER THE ROOT is an intensely personal story about a girl, her relationship with her father, and how he used video games to help teach her about life.
STAR PILOTS
J.R.Woodland (UNTOLD WORLDS, MONSTER MASHUP) wrote our next story, while relative comics newcomer Isaac Bergmann handles the art duties.
It's a buddy cop show meets an epic space battle in STAR PILOTS. Follow along with two ace pilots as they battle through wave after wave of invaders. How will this battle for survival resolve itself?
THREAT STRIKE BATTLE ZONE
Gene Hoyle takes us on a trip through the life of a young man who may not be what he seems on the surface. Brad Gischia (BLACK MUSEUM, UNLAWFUL GOOD) uses blues and greys to paint an amazing picture of the life of our young protagonist, and Michael Waggoner completes the story with phenomenal lettering!
THE WAIT
Written by Pat Kawula with art, colors, and letters by C.R.Warner (THE TRIALS OF BEATRICE), THE WAIT is about the pain so many gamers know all too well: Waiting for that new game!
GET GOOD
First time writer Sam Chestnutt brings us a story about what it means to persevere to achieve your goals and the fact that the road to those goals can be paved with mistakes. 
Jonathan Fisher(A SEED LIKE NO OTHER, IN THE MOUTH OF RALPH) takes this story to a beautiful and sometimes terrifying place. Colored by Isaac Bergmann, and lettered by Jim McClain (SOLUTION SQUAD, POE AND THE MYSTERIADS) this story demonstrates a team effort to GET GOOD!
SAVE & CONTINUE
A dark look at video games and life, SAVE & CONTINUE comes from writer Rob Humphrey(PUNCHING THE CLOCK, GUNSLINGERS) and artist K Lynn Smith (PLUME, HOPE). Demonstrating how imagining life as a video game can get you down or lift you up, SAVE & CONTINUE is a story that can't be missed.
Additional Rewards
This book is jam packed to the gills with amazing stories and art, but what would a Kickstarter be without a few awesome extras? There are a number of amazing commission options from the artists which can give you a one of a kind collectible from an incredible group of creators, but we wanted to go a bit further and bring some of the stories off the page and into the real world.
"Pre-Order" Swag #1
An enamel pin inspired by the story STAR PILOTS designed by artist Isaac Bergmann
Pins will be 1.25" NOT 1"
"Pre-Order" Swag #2
An enamel pin inspired by the story DEAD BATTERIES designed by Travis Bramble and Dave Herndon. 
Pins will be 1.25" NOT 1"
 "Pre-Order" Swag #3
An enamel pin inspired by the story UNDER THE ROOT designed by Emily Zelasko 
Pins will be 1.25" NOT 1"
Retro Gaming
A replica NES cartridge as it is portrayed on the cover of the  story "Save & Continue". Only 50 of these cartridges will ever be  made!
 ADD ONS!
Want to get more than one of the awesome pieces of swag from the campaign? It's easy, just add the following amount to your pledge and shoot us a note about what you are adding. We will also verify during the campaign surveys, but it never hurts to over-communicate. 
Enamel Pins: Add $8 per pin to add.
PDF copy of the book: $10
Extra copies of the standard cover: $20
Extra copies of the Kickstarter Exclusive Cover: $25
Save & Continue NES cartridge: $15
Addons MAY affect the price of shipping. 
LEVEL UPS!
We are talking about video games here, so we don't worry about stretch goals, we worry about LEVEL UPS! So let's talk about how we level up this campaign!
$7000 - Get in the Game vinyl sticker
If the campaign reaches $7000 in funding, every backer at the Premium Edition pledge level or above(plus the Early Adopters!) will get a vinyl sticker of the Get in the Game logo that was designed by DEAD BATTERIES artist Travis Bramble!
$8000 - Signed 6"x9" print of the standard cover by Ryan Lee
If the campaign reaches $8000 in funding, every backer at the Premium Edition pledge level or above(plus the Early Adopters!) will get a signed 6"x9" print of the Get in the Game cover with art by Ryan Lee!
$9000 - Book Level Up! An additional story by Rob Humphrey and Jeff Manley
If the campaign reaches $9000 in funding, the book will be Leveled Up to a 11 stories! With the new story being created by the team behind the hit webcomic Punching the Clock, Writer Rob Humphrey and artist Jeff Manley!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being the first project I ever created, I was sure to speak with many people I trust about running a Kickstarter and producing a book. I believe this reduces the risks of the project greatly. In addition, the core 10 stories are completed. Barring any additions from stretch goals, the book is print ready.

Potential challenges include printing delays or delays in the creation of additional content or other logistical events that cannot be planned for.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As I am watching the tracking on the packages traveling across the country, I wanted to take a moment to thank you all again for the support on this project. This has truly been a labor of love and I am thoroughly enjoying seeing people get their rewards and dig into the stories. 
As I can see, there are only a few packages that have not made it to their final destinations. So please let me know if you are missing anything. I did my best to double check everything but accidents happen.

Its official! The books have reached the Source Point Press warehouse and word from my sources is they look fantastic. 
I will be making a trip down to the warehouse on Monday to retrieve the books and will begin packing your rewards next week. 
Thank you all for your patience and understanding as we worked through the bumps and hiccups of this crazy year. I promise the wait will be worth it.

Hey everyone. 
I just got word from our friends at Source Point that the books have arrived in the U.S. and are headed to the warehouse in Michigan. Once they arrive at the warehouse i will make the trip to retrieve them and begin fulfillment. 
That means i should be packing stuff up and shipping within 2 weeks or so. I am truly sorry for the delays but we are in the home stretch now!

Hi everyone! 
You have all been so patient during this process that I wanted to be sure to give everyone a little treat. Every backer is getting a PDF copy of the book as long as you backed at the PDF level or higher. 
Thank you all for your patience during this. We are excited to get your physical rewards to you as well and will let everyone know when we have information about their progress!

Get in the Game is OFF TO THE PRINTER!!!!!
It has been an incredible journey and now we just have a little longer to wait. A huge thanks to my good friend Jason Plowman for getting the combined file ready to gice to the team at Source Point Press where they put on the finishing touches and sent it to the printer!
Thank you all for your support! And for the few that haven't filled put their BackerKit please do so ASAP!

Hi GitG backers.
A huge thank you to everyone that has filled out their Backerkit surveys so far. For those of you that have filled them out, I will be locking the surveys tonight which will allow you 48 hours to make changes to your orders. You will still have the opportunity to change your shipping address if you need to even after the order locks.
If you purchased add-ons, your card on file will be charged Monday.

Hey GitG Backers.
We have been sitting on a big announcement for a week or two while details were finalized and everyone on the teams were notified.
I am excited to announce that Get in the Game has been picked up by Source Point Press! At this point, this does not affect you. We will still be fulfilling your orders, but once your friends check out the book and want a copy of their own Source Point will be the place for them to go!

Hey everyone! Thank you all for your response to the Bakcerkit so far! We have gotten so many responses back so far. Just an FYI, the survey will lock on April 30th, and any outstanding balances for addons will be charged for on May 1st. So please get those filled out as soon as you can! If you are missing your Backerkit email just shoot me a message here and I will get you the link to your survey.
Thank you all!

campaign.story:
Believed to be the embodiment of an ancient Incan prophecy, United States counter-terrorism soldier Rayne Santiago is forced to return to her South American homeland of Martagal when she receives word that her brothers have been abducted. 
Exiled from her country years ago for abusing her own innate pyrokinetic abilities, Rayne must win back the trust of her people and overcome her fear of the powers that lay dormant inside her in order to rescue her brothers from the regime’s sinister commander, Dr. Alexis Bane. 
Descendant was first published back in 2009 through Image Comics. Due to the printing costs at the time, three issues wasn't enough to produce a Trade Paperback of the series. As the printing industry has changed, so has our ability to produce a trade for Kickstarter!
Original cover to Issue 1: Art By Tyler Kirkham
With the book currently being adapted into a screenplay and its single issues practically sold out across the country, it felt like the perfect time to collect this series into an 80-page trade paperback. 
Descendant by Mariano Navarro
Best of all, the proceeds from the Kickstarter, after the cost of printing, shipping and the products for other rewards will go to artist Mariano Navarro who worked above and beyond to create something truly wonderful.
Issue 2 and KICKSTARTER Exclusive Variant cover by Tyler Kirkham
Written and created by Michael Dolce & Marcus Perry, with art by Mariano Navarro and covers by Tyler Kirkham, Descendant is a super-powered espionage thriller!
BONUS MATERIAL
The Descendant Trade contains 12 pages of BONUS material you can't find anywhere else, including the original sketches and TYLER KIRKHAM sketch cover art for all three issues. It also shows you the original COSTUME DESIGNS by Dan Leister, a friend and frequent collaborator to Sire Studios.  And takes you inside the pitch that got us published at Image Comics/Shadowline.
AND... if we reach out goal, we can beef this trade up with some more BONUS content including pencil art, scripts and more!
 PREVIEW THE FIRST FIVE PAGES
Descendant Page 1
Descendant Page 2
Descendant Page 3
Descendant Page 4
Descendant Page 5




If you have any questions about these rewards, you can contact me  through Kickstarter OR sire@mikebooks.com and I will answer you immediately! 
In  addition to our rewards, we're looking ahead toward what we'll add for backers if we begin to reach past our initial goal. 
Also, if you see an item from a different tier that you want to add  to your order, you can absolutely do that! Message me for details!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book itself is DONE and just waiting to be sent to the printer with the list of names to thank! So no risks. We can begin shipping about 3 weeks from close date. This will be my 5th Kickstarter. I genuinely love creating for the Kickstarter community, and know that I can successfully ship Descendant to backers when we are funded!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: Descendant Volume 1 Trade Paperback

campaign.story:
We're so excited to present to you Mariner: An Ancient Rime, the next collaborative project from author Michael Dean and artist Jonathan Marks Barravecchia! 
Mariner is an idea which we have been kicking around for almost a year now, and after the success of our first book Fever Dreams we felt confident not only in our working relationship, but in our audience's support for these comics which we are so excited to make!  
NOVEMBER 29TH UPDATE! THANKS TO ALL OF YOUR SUPPORT, WE HAVE JUST REACHED OUR FUNDING GOAL AND ARE NOW GOING FOR THE STRETCH GOAL OF $25,000 - WHICH WILL ALLOW US TO PUBLISH AN EXPANDED EDITION OF MARINER! NOW OVER 100 PAGES WITH BACK MATTER MATERIAL INCLUDING PAGES FROM MICHAEL'S ANNOTATED SCRIPT, AND SKETCHBOOK STUDIES AND UNUSED PAGES FROM JONATHAN!!  
Our Mariner expands upon Samual Taylor Coleridge's original lyrical masterpiece The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, exploring the themes of Choice and Regret through a more contemporary lens, but with a cast of characters throughout the architecture of time: the 30's, 80's, 1800's, today, and beyond. Their fears are realized in surrealist and somewhat spooky circumstances. 
One of our already complete pages featuring a couple of my favorite characters!

Mariner is a fully painted 90 page graphic novel, which will be delivered to you, beautifully printed in an oversize format with a French Fold cover design!  AND- we're excited to be offering FREE domestic shipping for the books!
A French Fold protects the raw edges of your book. (Different than a French Tuck, but just as classy, thanks Tan!)

Don't know the original poem? No problem! Mariner does certainly reference Coleridge's text, but ours is a stand-alone story with no homework reading required. (But, if we reach our stretch goals, we will include the original poem in our printing as well! More on that later.)  
My name is Jonathan Marks Barravecchia, I am an artist and illustrator who has worked for companies such as Marvel and Aspen comics, and have shown my work in galleries in the US, UK, and Australia. 
Jonathan is a cool boy.
I vividly remember buying my first comic at a shop next to my grandmothers house (a reprint of Uncanny X-Men 169!), and I was hooked.  I love comics. I love making them, I love reading them, but as Ive grown more into my own artistic style Ive come to appreciate that my work does not necessarily fit on all books. Thats cool, comics can look like anything (!), so I've started to focus more on telling my own stories in ways which are visual honest and resonant to me. Hence, self-publishing, and now, Kickstarter! 
Michael Dean is a writer, filmmaker, and performer raised in the Mohave Desert. He has always loved bringing a vulnerable humanity to conceptually wild premises, be it in various Festival selected films, theater productions, or as co-creater / producer / writer of the cult favorite audio series Hollow Public Radio. 
The beauty of Michael's works is owed to the incredible collaborators he's been fortunate to have again and again, and Jonathan is no exception to that. To see ideas of both cosmic existence and individual emotional distress treated with the same amount of artistic care and craft is what this book's writing strives for, what Jonathan's art realizes, and is exactly why Michael fell in love with comics as a child (spending, honestly?? too many hours in the comic section of the public library). 
Making comics is hard work! Its' a fun job, but it's still a job, and at the end of the day, both Michael and myself are freelance artists who are paid per project.  This makes prioritizing creator-owned or passion projects difficult simply due to the fact that there are only so many hours in the day! Fever Dreams was literally done after and inbetween other jobs we were working on - and while that can work (clearly), it simply takes exponentially longer to get anything done and out on the shelves.  Mariner is a significantly larger (literally) undertaking, and we have chosen to turn to Kickstarter to help fund this so as to be able to put Mariner first, and turn around to get it out to you as quickly as we can!  
While it is technically Jonathan's first Kickstarter, (aw! Baby's first crowdfund!) Michael and our editorial team have been a part of a number successful crowdfunding campaigns, raising money for everything from comic books, to stop motion projects, to even a full improv theater!! Trust that this team has the track record to deliver to you a beautifully made product, as they have again and again! 
The majority of the funds from your pledges and pre-orders simply go to printing and shipping costs both to get the physical book back to us, and then out to all of you.  A portion of our budget will go towards realizing and shipping the rewards, and Kickstarter fees and taxes; and a portion will ostensibly be acting as our 'page-rates', in order to allow us to continue prioritizing and completing the book in the time frame which we have outlined.
In addition to the actual book, we are so excited to be able to offer Kickstarter exclusive rewards, including comic book collector standards such as signed and numbered editions and remarqued sketch editions, as well as original art, and a limited edition (only 10 printed!) collectors cover exclusive to Kickstarter!
Jonathan's commissions gives you the opportunity to have a bespoke image of your favorite characters!
Thumbnail previews of the limited edition variant cover featuring our character Samsara!
We're also happy to be collaborating with sculptor Alex Klein for our coolest reward, a 1:10 scale figure of The Mariner!  ( Plus, more talents will be collaborating with us for some pretty exciting stretch goals! But more on that later.) 
Sculptor Alex Klein painstakingly crafts every one of his pieces with incredible detail.

Please tell your friends (and enemies too I suppose) and share this project with everyone!  Thank you all so much for your support, we cannot wait to share Mariner with the world!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Making comics - making anything - is hard work. While Michael and I are both professionals, there are always risks and components with publishing which we cannot control. 
Some potential risks include printing and shipping delays, particularly with an overseas printer, which could include anything from bad seas to dockworkers strikes.
There are also the day to day challenges such as, If I get too sick to work for whatever reason, then there is no one else who can step in and finish pages. 
Having said that though, not only are we already ahead of the game with pages (and even some rewards!) done, but Michael and I will be working simultaneously on art, editing, and lettering (Michael hand-letters every page!), so that Mariner will be print ready almost as soon as the final page is dry.
I can also assure you that, while this is my job, it is also my passion (however healthy or unhealthy that is I do not know), and drawing and painting everyday is truly something I love to do. The funding which we receive through this Kickstarter platform will allow us to not only create this book which means so much to us, but to prioritize it in a way which we were not able to previously.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Mariner backers!  Hope all is well with you and 2021 has been good so far! 
Some of you may have already seen, but I am working again with author Allan Amato to complete our creator-owned comic book PUNCH, and the second half of our story launched on Kickstarter last Friday!

updates.update_userinfo: New illustrated novel campaign from Jonathan!
updates.update_content:
Hello Mariner backers!
I am just writing to let you know I just launched a new campaign with writer JT Krul for an illustrated fantasy adventure novel called The Ivory King!

Hello Mariner backers! As always thank you for your support and patience through this little adventure. Most of you should have received your book by now! Some have taken longer than others as they had to go east coast to west coast for signatures, but I’ve been seeing more and more on social media so hopefully they are one their way to you if you have not yet received it. There are a handful of you though for whom I do not have an address, or who I have reached out to directly for confirmation on one thing or another. Please do check your emails and get back to me ASAP so I can get your book in the mail. That’s it for now! Hope the fall is treating everyone well!

updates.update_userinfo: Print editions are on their way!
updates.update_content:
Hello Mariner backers! After much (too much) ado, Mariner books are on their way out to their forever homes!
Thank you all as always for your support and patience. When we launched this campaign at the end of last year I never would have guessed what 2020 would bring: Coronavirus, the whole west coast now on fire looking like a John Carpenter film, a cross country move for me... Anyway, thank you all, really and truly for the support! If you ordered a regular print version of the book, they are going out this week, if you ordered a signed/numbered/remarqued/message in a bottle (sneak peek of some of those sketches below!) they are on their way to LA for Michael Dean’s signature, and then he’ll be the one to turn them around and send them directly to you! Digitally copies are going to be coming from Michael too - and are also imminent! We literally could not have made this book without you so thank you again! More comics are coming soon from me, so watch this space and keep up w any announcements via Instagram @jonathanmarksart !

Hello Mariner backers! I’m so excited to (finally) be able to announce that Mariner is here! It looks great and I’m so happy to finally see it and so excited to be able to share it with all of you soon! The next step is gonna be organizing the mailings, and getting the remarqued and signed copy’s done. Michael and I started this project in LA but we are actually bi-coastal now, so, sorry to ask, but please bear with us one more time as we get your copies out as quick as possible in this crazy year of 2020. Hope this message finds you all well and safe, thank you all as always for the support! - Jonathan

Hello Mariner backers! Thank you all as always for the support and patience throughout this whole process. So excited to announce that Mariner has cleared customs and is on its way to me this week! I will send another update as soon as they are in my hands! Currently assessing my shipping options to get the books out to all of you as soon as possible. Given the current state of the USPS, it may (again) take a little longer than we initially thought, and again, truly, thank you all for your patience! Next update will be me surrounded by boxes of books!!

Hello Mariner backers! So, 2020 has been a crazy year so far...thank you all for your support and your patience through all of this. Good news: our printer in China has caught up with orders and I am scheduled to get my final look on pages to approve for printing tomorrow! Obviously the books are delayed past the dates set out in the Kickstarter schedule, but again, thank you for all of your patience and understanding with this.
Barring any (new) unforeseen issues, the books should be in my and then your hands by September - and if I am able to give a more specific timeline after speaking with the printer tomorrow I certainly will pass that info on to all of you.

Hello Mariner backers! Hope this final (ish) update finds you all well. Just a quick reminder to please respond to the backers survey ASAP if you have not already done so! Michael and I are finalizing all the files to get to the printer and if we don’t have your names then you will not be included in the thank you section! We are so excited to be getting the book to the printers this month and then off to you! Digital copies will be emailed this month, and physical copies will be mailed as soon as we get them back (I will certainly be keeping everyone updated on that schedule too). Hope everyone is staying safe and sane and socially distant! Thank you as always

Hello backers! So, the world is clearly in a crazy and frustrating and scary place right now and I hope everyone is doing ok (as ok as you can be at least), sheltering in place and keeping healthy - and keeping a little bit of sanity and normalcy as well! The art for Mariner will be all done and scanned this week! Michael is wrapping up the lettering and then we’ll be formatting and getting the files to the printer ASAP as well. Like i said last time, obviously, things have changed globally, so when the actual physical book will be back in our (and your) hands is a little up in the air, but I will keep you all posted as soon as I know anything! Backers surveys will be going out at soon as I’m finished with this update; get those back to me as soon as you can too, so everyone is included in the ‘thank you’s in the book! (That’s also how I’ll have your addresses for mailing the books when they are ready). As always, thank you all for the support, I really do hope everyone is doing well in these strange days. Best, - Jonathan

Hello Mariner backers! Hope all is well with everyone.
Wanted to reach out quickly and share that I am down to less than 20 pages of art to paint - It still sounds like a lot, but with over 70 pages done, it really is the home stretch!  Michael is also at just over halfway done with the lettering, and the book is looking great! I will be sending out backer surveys in the next week or so, so keep an eye out for those.
Importantly, I also wanted to update everyone with news from our printer - who IS located in China. I’ve attached PrintNinjas statement below, but the broad strokes are really just that they are, obviously, dealing with significant delays as a result of the Coronavirus. I will certainly be keeping everyone posted as soon as we get all our pages to the printer and they are able to give us an updated timeline for production - but digital copies will obviously not encounter any Corona delays!

campaign.story:
J. Gonzo, Claire Napier, and Bernardo Brice and I have finished our part. Now it's time to share the rest of the story with the world. We're back to publish the last chapter of La Voz De M.A.Y.O. This will be a full color, 24-page comic book detailing the important accomplishments by my great-grandfather Ramon Jaurigue and the Mexican, American, Yaqui, and Others organization. 
I always try to offer something completely unique for every campaign. We are teaming up with CREAM Forever to make Si Se Puede tote bags and 3X3 iron-on-patches exclusive to this Kickstarter. But the LatinX hat has been resurrected for one last time.
The official story
 La Voz De M.A.Y.O. is the true story of Ramon Jaurigue, an orphan and WWII veteran who co-founded the Mexican, American, Yaqui, and Others (M.A.Y.O.) organization, which successfully lobbied the Tucson City Council to improve living and working conditions for members of the local Pascua Yaqui tribe. Largely due to Ramon’s activism, both in M.A.Y.O. in and with Model Cities Program, Yaqui were successfully integrated into the expanding metropolis of Tucson: families bought property, roads and sidewalks were built, and sewage systems installed. Ramon and his colleagues even founded a night school to help adults learn English and established the region’s first low-cost clinic to offer birth control.
Utilizing newspaper clippings, interviews with surviving MAYO members, and Ramon’s authored articles, La Voz De M.A.Y.O. dramatizes the remarkable life and achievements of my great-grandfather—and in so doing, tells the story not just of a single man, but of a family, a tribe, a nation.
Preview
La Voz De M.A.Y.O. #3 Page 1 by Henry Barajas, J. Gonzo, Bernardo Brice, and Claire Napier
La Voz De M.A.Y.O. #3 Page 2 by Henry Barajas, J. Gonzo, Bernardo Brice, and Claire Napier
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
La Voz De MAYO is not only about my family's history, but, this is the history of a tribe of people and my hometown: Tucson, AZ. My graphic memoir is about people of color; specifically, Native Americans and Mexican Americans that are finally getting documented in the history books. It's important to me to publish something that will inform and empower people that look like to look like me.

We are making sure the artists, letterer, and copy editor are compensated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey, friends.
Just wanted to provide an update!
Issue 3 should arrive on the 17th end of business day.
The totes are done! I hear the patches should arrive sometime this week, so we’ll get the merch from CREME FOREVER soon.

Here’s a little secret: we lose an average of $150 when the campaign is done due to outdated payment information. It’s the nature of the beast. So, please make sure your cc info is up to date.
If you haven’t already, please share kickstarter link so we can strive to hit stretch goal.
Feel free to share this:

We've seen a huge surge in pledges and support.
Thank you so much for stepping up. 
We've updated our project image to reflect our support for Kickstarter to Unionize. Click here to learn more about their efforts.
If everyone can send this link to one or two friends we will smash our goal before the 28th! If they pledge above $8 we will cross the finish line—and release these lost Mexican & Native American voices from the shadows.

campaign.story:
Granny Golem cover by Shawn Daley
 CJ Pendragon (W) Shawn Daley (CA) Brian Middleton JR (A) Bob Salley (E) 
Granny Golem: Book One is the first book of a trilogy. It follows a young girl named Ariela as she struggles to learn how to cope with her parents' tumultuous divorce, her mother's addiction and the loss of her grandmother, the only source of stability Ariela has ever known.
When Ariela's father is forced to admit her living conditions with her alcoholic mother are less than ideal, our young heroine finds herself whisked off to a small town in Kentucky, armed only with the ashes of her beloved Bubbe. Angry, defiant and hurting inside, Ariela soon comes to realize there's something special about her new home. When old folktales spring to life around her, she learns to cope with the anger inside her and how to rely on others with a bit of supernatural guidance from an unexpected source.
Granny Golem takes a little bit of influence from several folklore tales over the entire run but its main inspiration is Judaism. Ariela's maternal side is Jewish and the primary folklore in the story is derived from a version of their lore. CJ worked closely with several practicing Jewish consults to make sure that Granny Golem stayed respectful and authentic.
Granny Golem will be a total of 56-pages, including a 44-page comic and a 4-page illustrated prose one-shot.
                      *                   *                     *                     *                       *
              Why a story about a grandmother turned golem?
What Brian said above is why: love. 
It's a central part of this story and when he mentioned highlighting it in the character design, it just made sense. Love is, after all, what drives us to make the best and worst of our own choices.
This idea was first presented to me by my husband, who had it rattling around his head for many years before he asked me to write it. With a few false starts to a prose story, it became, almost overnight, my first comic script.
And I have poured so much of myself into this story that it's nearly killed me at times.
My parents divorced when I was young and it was not amicable. My father suffered and still does, with substance abuse, selfishness and a general lack of caring about his children. I lived a lot of my life with anger and pain and misplaced blame. While there are many blatant differences between Ariela and myself, my emotions are hers. The absence of a parent. The tears. The confusion. And I felt like this was a good story to tell because there are a lot of children blaming themselves and no one tells them that their feelings are valid, even though they're wrong. 
With the Jewish folklore mixed in, I was able to see the world through a child's eyes again. The magic and wonder of everything around you, the connection with loved ones. I wanted a strong little girl in an underrepresented demographic to get the chance to be the focus of a world, any world. 
Brian and I, with a lot of help from Bob, have worked hard to make Ariela's story one that is relatable and connective despite the fantastic elements of the story. 
It will appeal to readers of all ages with an inclusive cast introduced over the series' run and mature themes applied in kid-friendly and honest ways. I have cried writing this a dozen times, and over the course of a comic script, found my own path to healing old wounds.
Sample Pages: 
Take a sneak peak at what we've been doing! Here are the first two pages of Granny Golem and a preview of the middle of the story.
page one
page two
page 22
*                             *                          *                               *                          *
                                        Meet the Team:
CJ Pendragon is a married mother of three with a mini-menagerie of children, cats, dogs and chickens! This is her first comic project but she owns and runs the comic book review site, Sirens of Sequentials.
Brian Middleton Jr. is married with two beautiful daughters and six cats! Brian is the creator behind Wulfborne, an indie comic published through SCOUT COMICS. You can read the entire trilogy in trade!
Bob Salley is our editor. He's also the writer of the renowned series OGRE with Source Point Press! Bob is credited on other titles as well, including BROKEN GARGOYLES, SALVAGERS and SHELTER DIVISION. He recently wrote a children's book!
Shawn Daley is our cover artist! The artist and co-creator on OGRE with Bob, Shawn has credits all over the place to his name. He's co-creator of SAMURAI GRANDPA, creator of TERRAQUILL and you should buy his work.
                                              REWARDS
We have so many fun rewards for those of you who toss their hats in the ring with us! An exclusive print from Katherine Finn, character art from both myself and Brian, stickers with this cute little golem on them and handmade character plushies! 
Sticker Art: Brian Middleton Jr.
Plushie <3
Backers of physical copies will also receive a four-page illustrated prose story that will never be printed anywhere outside of Kickstarter editions!
Let's Talk Budget:
We realize the amount we're asking seems like a lot! Let me break it down so you can see exactly where we got our figures from:
Direct Impressions Printing: 56 page full color staple-stitched comic book
Artist Fees: Brian does the art, colors and letters!
Shipping: We have set aside 2k for optimal shipping supplies. All physical copies will be bagged and boarded!
Backer Rewards: Though we are doing many of these tiers ourselves, we have snagged a few special rewards! Our friend, Jennifer, with the crocheted characters and the fabulous Katherine behind the print!
Kickstarter Fees: 5% Kickstarter Fee & 5% Processing Fee + Taxes
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have selected a printer and are working with a very talented editor, Bob Salley. Time will be our biggest challenge but CJ and Brian are both wholly dedicated to GRANNY GOLEM: BOOK ONE and the completion of our project in an efficient and quick manner. We plan to stay in touch weekly to keep you updated as we go!

The cover and three pages are complete as of now. The script had been laid out, outlined and is almost finished as well.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey, y'all! I just wanted to reach out to once again thank y'all for the support and encouragement we received both during the campaign and afterward. It meant so much to everyone! 
We have decided to try again and on February 1, 2020 we will be relaunching GRANNY GOLEM as a new campaign. I am including a link below that you can click and be notified through when the campaign goes live. No scrolling social media, it'll go straight to your email! I hope to see some of y'all follow us on the next step of our journey, but regardless, I truly appreciate those of you who took the first step in believing in our project here. <3

And that's way more than I ever thought would happen!
I feel like I let several of you down personally but I want to let you know that I have no intention of giving up! Brian and I are still working hard to get pages down. I'm tweaking the script to have more elements of the different themes we're drawing from for the story.

updates.update_userinfo: Q&A On putting your work out there
updates.update_content:
The moment I hit "launch" for Granny Golem was amazing.
I've spent so much of my life writing stories for myself, and a few others, so taking that first step into actively trying to make space for the stories I have to tell was terrifying and exciting. It was only a small step, the real work has yet to be done in the creation of the actual comic, but it was huge!

WE DID IT :D
we hit 100 backers this afternoon! That's an incredible amount of support and belief in this project, and I can't thank you enough.
you're all amazing <3

We have 13 days left to go until the Kickstarter campaign is over! <3
We're still far off from our goal but this has been such an amazing adventure and a huge opportunity for me in terms of learning how to market myself and how to run more business-like affairs! Thanks for being part of this journey thus far and your unwavering support
Unfortunately, it's not over!

updates.update_userinfo: How A Panel Comes Together: Words from the Artist
updates.update_content: Step 01 - Layouts

...and what a day, indeed!
We're 20% funded and y'all are the most beautiful people on the planet! I'm working on finalizing script edits to send over to Bob to look over but I feel like we're really close to having the first issue completely scripted out! Woohoo!
Please continue sharing with family, friends and across social media! Your furthered support in publicizing our campaign is what's going to make Granny Golem a slam-dunk success. I can't wait to put the story in your hands!

I can't thank y'all enough for this overwhelming support! I've been so excited to launch the Granny Golem campaign and it's incredibly humbling to see so many of y'all share in the excitement with me.
The first day is far from over and we've made incredible progress!
So while people are checking me out, I want to bump another project! DEATH TRAP has less than 40 hours to go and could use your support to make the leap to 100% funded. It's an incredible project from a talented team and there's nothing else like it in the market!

campaign.story:
SKYSCRAPER is a procedural crime story from Ryan K Lindsay and Mitchell Collins that weaves in elements of the weird putting it somewhere between THE BLACK MONDAY MURDERS, LOST, and PAPER GIRLS.
When the VP of KDP flies out the top floor and dives into the pavement out the front, there are a lot of questions to answer. Enter: Keene, an independent contractor brought in to help figure out how and why she died. What unfolds is a mystery spanning decades that becomes less about why one woman dies and more about why a building would conspire to make it happen.
This 24 page one-shot utilises a central conceit that can only work in comics - every single page is framed exactly the same way, it’s a front shot of the KDP building, but different panels and tiers of the page can jump around through time. Collins’ expressive and intricate inkwork delivers us characters and moments through zoomed panels and cutaway areas so each page jumps around in time to build a truly epic story.
This comic is nearly completely finished and ready to deliver.
NEWSPAPER SIZED PRINT STOCK
This comic is something special. The detail and care Collins put into every page needed more than the US standard sized comic could hold. You deserve to be able to spread this out and drink it in, so we’ve decided to print this as an extremely oversized edition. At over twice the size of a regular comic, this is more like a newspaper in your hands.
The nature of the size means the comic will be folded to be posted to you, but this isn’t a CGC affair anyway, this is the kind of thing you rattle with your hands with every read, the kind of thing you share with your mates, and the kind of thing that deserves to live.
We hope you agree.
DIGITAL OPTIONS
There is a digital option for this comic, if you want to take it in as a PDF, but you will naturally forego that size element that makes this something special - unless you read it on an iPad Pro, or perhaps an interactive tv screen. 
FIRST DAY BACKER PARTY
For those who back in the First 48 Hour Window, well, do I have some goods for you.
Early believers get their hands on some extra digital swag, where you'll be instantly linked to:
A PDF of BEAUTIFUL CANVAS #1 [art by Sami Kivela], and
2 PDFs of my short comics about a prison for supervillains and a guard with size manipulation powers, LITTLE MAN IN THE BIG HOUSE [art by Paul Tucker, and Francesco Iaquinta]
PLEDGE LEVELS
$4 - Building Schematic
A PDF of the comic with the script in a separate document.
$10 - Talking Building
A PDF of the building with a speech balloon or caption poorly lettered on, downloaded as jpeg, and emailed to you. Also includes the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$15 - ~EARLY BIRD~ Foundation Stone
AUSTRALIA ONLY
The first 50 in get a massive discount on a print copy of the comic, mailed to you, with Free Postage. Also includes the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$20 - Foundation Stone
AUSTRALIA ONLY
A print copy of the comic, mailed to you, with Free Postage. Also includes the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$25 - ~EARLY BIRD~ Foundation Stone
INTERNATIONAL ONLY [outside Australia]
The first 50 in get a massive discount on a print copy of the comic, mailed to you, with Free Postage. Also includes the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$30 - Foundation Stone
INTERNATIONAL ONLY [outside Australia]
A print copy of the comic, mailed to you, with Free Postage. Also includes the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$50 - RKL Building Sketch
Ryan K Lindsay [the writer] will complete a sketch of the KDP Building and post it to you. Also includes the print comic [mailed to you], and the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$50 - Mitchell Collins Sketch
Mitchell Collins will illustrate an inked sketch of a character of your choice on A4 paper and mail it to you. Also includes the print comic [mailed to you], and the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$50 - Annotated Scripts
A print copy of the SKYSCRAPER script, with stains and red pen annotations by Ryan K Lindsay. Also includes the print comic [mailed to you], and the PDFs for the comic and the script.
$80 - Retailer Pack
AUSTRALIA ONLY
10 copies of the comic for your store, postage included.
$100 - Retailer Pack
INTERNATIONAL ONLY [outside Australia]
A print copy of the SKYSCRAPER script, with stains and red pen annotations by Ryan K Lindsay. Also includes the print comic [mailed to you], and the PDFs for the comic and the script.
Now, you need to trust me, you want more Mitchell Collins art in your life!
Here are some examples of pin ups he's done.
STRETCH GOALS!
UNLOCKED! $6000 - You get a free pdf of STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET from me and Alex Cormack, as well as a pdf of my second D&D Adventure: ESCAPE FROM WEN KROY
UNLOCKED! $7000 - Mitchell Collins and I got busy straight after this comic, so we've been slinging a new pitch around, and you can see the pdf of this new book, TREE - it's like Veronica Mars meets John Constantine.
$8000 - You get a free pdf of FATHERHOOD, a one-shot I made with Daniel Schneider years ago, and, AND, I'll also include an "RKL Motivational Comics Quote" in every parcel on paper and in my awful handwriting!
$9000 - You get free pdfs of these two short comics: TO SQUID AND DIE IN LA with Boy Akkerman, and BEFORE THE CHERNOBYL JOB with Alfie Gallagher
$10,000 - If we double our total, I will include a print copy of INK ISLAND [my all ages one-shot with Craig Bruyn] in every single parcel. That's right, more paper in your parcel, more comics for your hands.
These are our exciting Stretch Goals, so we hope you are pumped to bring others in, share the link, talk about the project and what excites you about it, and hopefully we'll hit all of these goals.
CREATIVE TEAM
Ryan K Lindsay - I wrote this funk, and maybe you’ve read other books by me like the Kickstarter successes; DEER EDITOR, INK ISLAND, EIR, and/or STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET. I’ve also worked with Vertigo, Dark Horse, IDW, ComixTribe, and Black Mask to release comics like ETERNAL, NEGATIVE SPACE, BEAUTIFUL CANVAS, CHUM, and HEADSPACE.
Mitchell Collins - Mitch Collins is an Australian comic book artist. He loves to tell all sorts of stories, bringing pictures to the words. His credits include being part of Gestalt Comics TALGARD and featuring in the upcoming UNDAD VOL 3 and this comic here. He also works in storyboarding for short films, animations, UI & UX concepts. When MItch isn’t working, he usually enjoys a nice cold one and a cigar out by the pool.
Simon Robins - Simon's keen interest in comics was sparked by 2000AD as a young teen and has grown consistently since. He graduated from the Victorian College of the Arts with a Bachelor of Fine Arts majoring in photography where he created sequential photographic collages for his final porfolio and RMIT with a Masters of Design focusing on the visual communicative power of comics. Changing his career direction from design to comic book colouring, his career in comics started a little later than many. Simon draws on the skills and experienced gained from two decades working in the design and photographic industries to inspire his comic book colouring. Now a professional colourist he has worked with both mainstream and independent publishers/creators. Outside of comics he maintains sanity by screaming in a grindcore band, frequently cheats death on a mountain bike, is endlessly inspired by his wife and two daughters and takes solace in long walks on the beach with his slightly mad mutt Macey.
Simon--Ryan--Mitchell
5 PAGE PREVIEW [unlettered]
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This comic is 100% getting made and completely ready to deliver. Inks are all done, colours are rolling in, and we'll do letters during the month of the campaign.

I have also previously run 7 successful comic Kickstarter campaigns, raising over $20,000 across 4 years on this platform, I've yet to fail, and I always deliver. Sometimes I even over-deliver by rolling out unlocked rewards and stretch goals just because you're amazing.

The only problem is me going all Billy Walsh on it, which probably won't happen.

Everything else should be apples.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: EVERFROST - my new comic for preorder now!
updates.update_content:
Hi! You supported this creator owned comic on Kickstarter, so I thought you might like to know I've got one coming up that you can preorder through your local comic shop now! The details are below, I really hope you like the sound of what I've got coming because I'm very excited about this comic!

EVERFROST is a brand new sci fi miniseries from Sami Kivela and Ryan K Lindsay, the smash hit team behind DEER EDITOR, CHUM, and BEAUTIFUL CANVAS. And I gotta tell you, it’s great to have the band back together again. I’ve been making comics with Sami for nearly a decade, and it’s always exciting and makes me a better writer.

If you want more brutal sci fi from me, I have just the comic for you!
SHE IS ON KICKSTARTER RIGHT NOW!

updates.update_userinfo: SHE: At The Tower Of All That Is Known is Live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content: New comics coming your way!

Hey all,
So, we got a few days of the bushfire smoke clearing, I've bought some supplies, and the postal service is back to an operational position.
This means I'm going to start sending out packages very soon, been working away at this so far, and filling in addresses got me thinking:
Is anyone currently bushfire affected?

Hi all,
Just dropping a quick line to wish everyone a great 2020, I really believe we have great things in front of us all.
I say that, with all honesty, even though I also bring the following mildly disappointing news:
My plans to start shipping our copies of SKYSCRAPER have been delayed due to circumstances completely out of my control.

updates.update_userinfo: Delivery Shall Begin - Anyone Bushfire Affected?
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Just an update to let you know Simon has completed his colours, and he's done some next level work on this beast. He's also just given in a first round of letters, which I've given notes on to mostly fix the things I got wrong at the script level in the first place, and then that will be wrapped.
Simon, bless him, is then prepping this all for the printer, so hopefully we can send that off relatively soon.

project_data.project_name: SKYSCRAPER: a newspaper sized mystery comic

campaign.story:
Sometimes it snows in April...
Two weeks prior to April 21, 2016, I was in a car accident after a freak snowstorm created rough conditions and my car lost control on black ice. I hit into the back of a car. As I was on the phone with my wife, explaining what was going on, another accident occurred just feet away from me, and one of the cars came within inches of hitting my car. I walked away unscathed. The car had to be totaled. For a couple of weeks, I was using my wife's car and in that time, I started to listen to Prince. Specifically, the song alluded to above. It resonated with me because...well, he was right. Sometimes, as rare as it actually is, it does snow in April. I was alive and all I could think about was how resonant that song was to me.
And then the news came.
I am not blessed as an artist. My gift is storytelling, words...which, yes, is an art unto itself, but when someone of such magnitude dies, when their art has ceased, your first instinct (or mine, anyway) is to paint something. I'm just not gifted in that way. So, I came up with a story, a story told to me via a specific playlist, a specific order of Prince's music. Arranged by title only (no music or likenesses of Prince appear in this comic), the songs created a story of its own. Something that, maybe, could have been a Prince song that was left unwritten. Or something that has always existed. I did something similar a few years ago for a Nine Inch Nails anthology that we decided to pull at the last minute. For the first time anywhere, I present, HYPERPOWER, by Ricardo Venâncio (art), Alejandro Bruzzese (colors), and me (script and letters). As you'll see in HYPERPOWER and in TRIBUTE, it's a very non-linear style of telling a story, but it doesn't skimp on storytelling. I have this view about music that has always had a universal truth to it; music can reach everyone. Like the emotion of love, music is something that we all have within us, whether we can sing or dance, or not. Everyone has the hum of the universe.
That's how it started. 
And then I was introduced to Vasco Georgiev.
Vasco is a once in a lifetime talent (currently working on Dynamite Entertainment's XENA: WARRIOR PRINCESS), and I'm grateful to Sean Izaakse (my co-creator on STRAY) for introducing us. I had ideas of what I wanted to write for him, but for some reason, TRIBUTE kept coming up whenever I saw his art. We reached a common understanding about the project, and he CLEARLY knocked it out of the park.
So, here we are. As of right now, only five or six people (besides Vasco and myself) have seen the book. We're ready to share it with everyone.
What's TRIBUTE about? 
TRIBUTE is a classic "boy-meets-girl" story...but in this case, the boy is an androgynous alien from a planet where silence is golden. The alien (whom is unnamed in the story) is a rebel, and has continually snuck off his planet to experience music and life. Which comes into direct conflict with his father's orders.  
That's when the B.U.t14u7 1s are brought in. Cold and unfeeling, the B.U.t14u7 1s have the ability to silence entire worlds. The alien is undeterred. Knowing his time is short, he seeks out a special girl and finds her...here on Earth.
Wanna see more? Click here for a ten-page preview!
Rewards
The Creators
Vito Delsante is a comic book writer, graphic novelist, editor, letterer, and the co-creator/writer of STRAY with Sean Izaakse, and THE PURPLE HEART with Dean Haspiel and artist, Ricardo Venâncio. He’s written for DC Comics, Marvel Comics, Image Comics, AdHouse Books, and Simon & Schuster, among others, and his stories have been reprinted in other countries. He lives in Pittsburgh, PA with his wife, Michelle, his daughter, Sadie, his son, James, and his pitbull, Kirby.

www.incogvito.com
Vasco (“Vasil”) Georgiev is a comic book artist, writer, and the creator of the comic book series, SHIFTED. His kinetic art style is has drawn comparisons to Paul Gulacy, Jorge Jimenez and Guido Crepax. When he’s not drawing comics or working as an architect, he’s cruising around on his road bike. He lives in the French part of Switzerland with his wife, Victoria.
https://www.diamondagecomics.com 
(NOTE: IT MUST BE STATED OVER AND OVER AGAIN THAT PRINCE'S LIKENESS AND MUSIC DO NOT APPEAR IN THIS BOOK, AND ANY SIMILARITIES ARE PURELY COINCIDENTAL. TRIBUTE WAS INSPIRED BY HIS WORK, BUT IN NO WAY DO WE APPROPRIATE ANY OF HIS WORK OTHER THAN THROUGH INSPIRATION.)

updates.update_userinfo: From the bottom of my heart...
updates.update_content:
...thank you all so so much. There are two hours left, and we may see a slight uptick, but it doesn't matter. I'm absolutely grateful for all 81 of you (at the time of this writing, but all of you). When I wrote the last update, I didn't even think we'd get any new backers. A nicely timed mention in a Bleeding Cool article brought some new folks in, or, at the very least, got new eyes on the book.
So, moving forward, please don't pull your pledge. When I relaunch (probably not until the new year), I want to be able to let you, the folks that believe(d) in this Kickstarter/book, know first. If you can, please click on my Profile and follow me.

It's Been Quite Some Time.
That's kind of what I want to talk about; time. I've been absent since my last Kickstarter, TRIBUTE, failed. I think, in many ways, I have been licking my wounds, and more importantly, wondering where I went wrong. Especially with THE GOLDEN GUARD. This will be my albatross for some time.
There's that word again.
However, this country is currently caught up in a panic over COVID 19, or the coronavirus. My kids are home from school for at least two weeks. Some of you may be taking the safe road and staying home. Maybe some of you have caught the virus and are ill. Whatever the case, I wanted to help you pass the time, if possible, and maybe get your mind off of the madness out there.

I was going to write this earlier, but I'm glad I waited.
See, I just finished watching the movie, YESTERDAY. It was irresistibly charming, poignant and all around beautiful. I don't think it's too much of a stretch in logic or imagination to say that there are a lot of similarities between that movie and my comic here. Both were obviously created with love and affection. I say all this because...I love music. There's a really great line in the movie, ALMOST FAMOUS, that comes just before the movie ends. William Miller, the teenage freelance reporter, asks Russell Hammond of the band, Stillwater, what he loves about music. Russell answers...

First, thank you everyone for joining our little party. 55 backers so far, and I'm grateful to every one of you.
Just wanted to put this out there real quick; It seems like the Purple cover was the more popular of the two comic covers, so I decided to make that one unlimited, too. Haven't decided to limit the white cover yet, but I may.
Also made the Gold Standard reward unlimited, too, as we only had one left as of this update.

Because it's what Prince would do. Looking at all of the Minneapolis bands that he had a hand in shaping, and all the music and songs he gave away ("Stand Back" by Stevie Nicks, for one), I think sharing is totally in the spirit.

I'm sitting here, listening to Jeff Buckley (surprising, I'm sure), and I felt like sharing a few things. 
First, I wanted to show you the thing, the piece of art, that inspired me to write this story:

project_data.project_name: Tribute: The B.U.t14u7 1s (or, The Beautiful Ones)

campaign.story:
FULLY FUNDED!
With great power comes... no responsibility.    
If gifted superpowers, would people really dawn capes and tights, then go out fighting crime? 
That's the question.
HEROES ACT #1 is the first issue in a three over-sized issue arc called GIVE AND TAKE, and part of what could become an ongoing series.
It asks questions of a certain uncle's famous quote “with great power comes great responsibility.” Or does it? 
The Story
When a meteor shower blankets Earth with purple rocks, thousands of people become endowed with abilities. But they aren’t fighting crime. They use their powers for personal gain or worse—for the mundane. They fly to work. Congress drafts a bill to pay these powered individuals if they act when the need arises—they sign into law the Heroes Act.
Blake Barnhart, your average teenager, believes he doesn’t have these abilities. His best friend, Jeff Adams, does—the ability to move objects with his mind.
After the two boys witness a bank robbery, Blake convinces Jeff to start using his abilities through the Heroes Act initiative. But when Blake's own powers manifest,  they change everything. 
Preview
Cover
Page One
Page Two
Page Three
Page Four
Page Five
Page Six
Variant Covers
Gedeon Variant Cover
Caval Variant Cover
Rewards
Hero in a Halfling Reward
The Team
William Tyler Davis - Writer/Co-creator
A lifelong comics fan. Tyler started collecting Batman sometime in the mid-90s and hasn't really stopped. He's completed a trilogy of fantasy novels and four cozy mystery novellas. They can be found on Amazon.
Daniel Caval - Artist/Co-creator
Daniel is an up-and-coming artist from Brazil and HEROES ACT co-creator. Most characters are of his design. Check him out on Instagram.
LetterSquids - Letterer/Design
For lettering request and a sample of other work check out the website.
Christian Galli - Colorist
Christian is an artist from Italy. Check Christian out on Instagram.
Jason Gussow - Editor
Jason and Tyler worked together at a bookstore in college. A shared love for books and comics brought them together.
Over the past few years, Jason has served as the chief beta reader--the developmental editor on Tyler's prose work. And he's as well-versed in comics as any person, making him the perfect editor for HEROES ACT.
Contributors
Mary Safro designed our rocking cover. She is the illustrator and co-creator of Drugs & Wires.  
Little Corvus is a Seattle based, queer nonbinary latinx comic artist and illustrator. They have illustrated work in STAR WARS: WOMEN OF THE GALAXY. They were nominated for an Eisner Award in 2017 for their work on the webtoon DEJA BREW, and published their first full-length graphic novel, THE BRIDGE, with Peter Tomasi in 2018.
They contributed our amazing print. You can find more of their work here.
Print
Every pledge level over $10 gets the 6x11 print.
Juan Gedeon, artist on VENOM #16, provided us one of our variant covers (unlocked as stretch goal #2). Check him out on Twitter.
Naomi Franquiz, artist on UNBEATABLE SQUIRREL GIRL (41 and 42) and MISFIT CITY (seriously go check it out, we'll wait), has graciously agreed to provide a few commissions for us. Check out her work here.   
Add-ons
 You're also welcome to add-on items by adjusting your reward level!
Additional copies of #Issue 1 are $8
Additional copies of the Mary Safro variant cover are $12
Additional Little Corvus prints are $5
You can add up to 5 print items total without any additional shipping cost. If adding more, please add $5 for shipping.
Stickers (with Heroes Act logo) are $3
Additional shirts are $20 plus another $5 for shipping
 For the fantasy inclined...
You can also add one or a set of paperbacks from my EPIK FANTASY series. All books can be signed and personalized.
 HERO IN A HALFLING: $12
EPIK FANTASY SET: HERO IN A HALFLING, KNOWING IS HALFLING THE BATTLE, and SIGHT BEYOND EPIK SIGHT: $30
Or you can add one or more cozy mystery novellas.
 MARVELS, MOCHAS, and MURDER: $8
COMICS AND COFFEE CASE FILES SET (all four novellas): $30
Why Kickstarter?
 HEROES ACT #1 has been fully written with over half of the line art complete and the rest commissioned to be done by the end of the campaign. The first six pages are complete--colored and lettered (you just saw them).
This kickstarter will give us the funds necessary to have the remaining 24 pages of the first issue colored and lettered. The rest of the the funds are for printing and shipping your rewards.
Breakdown
Cost Breakdown
Stretch Goals
UNLOCKED at funding:
Everyone receives a digital PDF copy of FADING, the short story Daniel and I worked on prior to HEROES ACT. 
Stretch $2500
Stretch 2
Stretch 3
Stretch 4 Locked
We have more lined up...
$3,500
$4,000
...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main challenge is the book isn't going to be colored until the campaign is finished.

While Christian has etched out time to produce a quality book, there's no guarantee that a roadblock doesn't present itself, delaying the art.

Additionally, there could be publishing or manufacturing delays on the book or merchandise due to unforeseen circumstances. We've padded our estimate by a month or so, to ensure we meet the deadline. And we'll keep you informed at every step of the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Issue 2 will be here before you know it. Sign up to get a notification as soon as it goes live!
Today, I shipped the last of international packages. And I got something else... would you like to see?

Today, I shipped to almost all of the backers who’ve yet to receive their rewards.
I’ve still got to ship about 5 packages overseas. Sorry, folks, the post office was just too insane for that today. But I’ll get them out soon.
I’m still missing addresses from two people. So, if you see this...
Anyway, it’s been a pleasure. I hope you enjoy the comic. Have a happy holidays. A happy new year. Issue 2 Kickstarter in February.

You might’ve noticed a surprise waiting in your inbox. The digital version of HEROES ACT issue one is done!
I just ordered the print copies of all variants. I expect to get them in about two weeks, then begin shipping.
In honor of Halloween, I wanted to highlight a really fun looking book. With only hours left, they could really use our help to get funded.

Hey all,
I wanted to give you a quick update. First and foremost, the line art is finished! I only need eight more pages of color before it goes to get lettered. I believe that’s going to be all said and done by the end of the month.
Then I’ll get everything to the printer. It’s between a 2 to 3 week turnaround from there.

campaign.story:
Rockabilly-infused vaudeville mixed with Quentin Tarantino's Death Proof and shot out of a circus cannon, DEATH TRAP follows Ollie and her quest for revenge on the father-murdering bastards of Davenport Amusements.  Together with her adopted circus sideshow freak family, she's got the pedal to the metal in her haunted muscle car and nothing but vengeance in her headlights. 
Sure, DEATH TRAP is loaded with fun, freaks, and paranormal grindhouse action, but at its heart the book is about trying to make problematic and distant parents proud of you, something I know way too much about.
Grab the "Trade Waiter" tier for the whole 96 page graphic novel, or an exclusive issue 1 if you like floppy comics! 
 Matt Miner (words) - GWAR, Poser, Liberator, All We Ever Wanted
 Christopher Peterson (art) - Grindhouse: Doors Open at Midnight, Mayday, Broken World
 Josh Jensen (colors) - GWAR, Lab Raider, House of Fear, Doctor Crowe
 Matt Krotzer (letters) - Strayed, Retcon, Lab Raider, House of Fear
 Eric Palicki (backup story writer) - Atlantis Wasn't Built For Tourists, No Angel
"Death Trap feels like the best kind of 1970s action road film, with razor sharp, fast paced dialogue and visceral car mayhem." - Max Dunbar, Dungeons & Dragons, Baldur's Gate, Micronauts
"A punk rock, high energy, in-your-face adventure with undertones of camp and nostalgia. Baroque and modern, this intense and action-packed new comic-with-an-attitude is breaking rules and careening around the corner on two wheels!" - Katy Rex, Sweet Valley High, Jade Street Protection Services
"Death Trap is an intense, muscle-car powered freakshow, jam-packed with enough insanity and action to make any comic reader happy." - Rich Douek, Road of Bones, Wailing Blade, Gutter Magic
"Christine ain’t got nothing on a Mercury Cougar possessed by a dead dude and driven by his badass daughter." - Erica Schultz, Daredevil, Twelve Devils Dancing, M3
"A relentless tale full of guns, girls, ghosts, and gasoline, Death Trap starts your heart pounding on page one and does not stop. Matt and Chris are about to take you on one hell of a ride. Buckle up!" - Eric Palicki, No Angel, Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists, This Nightmare Kills Fascists
"A high-octane adventure that will have you tearing through the pages!" - James Maddox, Metaphorical HER, Dead Legends, All We Ever Wanted
 NEW CHARACTERS to be added periodically!
click the images to learn more about Bloop the clown and Aerwyn the fish-girl!


Kickstarter exclusive cover A art by Chris Peterson & Josh Jensen!
Kickstarter chase variant cover, art and color by Darren Lo (@DLo168)














While Death Trap has a great publisher who will ultimately bring the project to comic stores, the artists on the book need to keep the lights on while they draw, color, and letter.  The Kickstarter is 100% here so artists can be paid.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Matt Miner has 5 successful Kickstarter projects under his belt, all funded and fulfilled to backers. So while the biggest risk to most projects is flaky Kickstarter creators who don't know what they're doing, that's not the case here.

Printing and distribution is a challenge for a lot of peoples' projects, but that's not the case here, either. Death Trap has a great veteran publisher ready to take the book on so long as we fund creative costs through the Kickstarter!

We are incredibly comfortable with the Kickstarter platform and what it takes to deliver to our supporters and we have a long track record of success to prove it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We came so close, but it's not over yet.
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
First:  Thank you to the 349 backers who believed in DEATH TRAP and wanted to see this book happen.  We love you, we appreciate you, and although we're bummed for us, we're more bummed to let you, the backers down.  
I want to also thank every member of the DEATH TRAP team, for all the extra work they put in on this thing.  I don't know if anyone noticed, but the reward slug design was SUPER nice and meant to harken back to a sideshow-poster feel.  That was all 's doing, and it was hours and hours of work for him.  Those character designs and the main images we used in the campaign as well as the little icons that broke up the sections on the main page - that was all of extra work for and .  Also a special thanks to for the amazing chase variant cover, and , who made that incredible Kickstarter teaser video - her music combined with her video artistry combined for something really special.  The team utterly rocked it and together we made a campaign page to be proud of.

Hey watchers - if you haven't backed, please do!
Hey backers - thanks for your support!  Want to add extra copies or another reward on to your pledge?  Email me at mattminerxvx@gmail.com and we can do that!

We have some ground to cover, but today's pledges have been heavy, and we could actually pull this off!   Holy smokes!

updates.update_userinfo: 5 days to go for DEATH TRAP (gulp!) and a book you REALLY need to check out!
updates.update_content:
Hey all, 
5 days left to make it happen!  The whole team is so grateful to everyone who has backed already and to everyone who's waiting to back in the last few days and be our hero.  But hey, if you're seeing this because you're watching the project but haven't backed yet - you have 5 days, but wow it'd be great if you'd hit it up sooner?

Hey everyone, only 6 days to go!  We can do this!  Suuuuuper grateful to everyone who's already here, and if you have friends who you think might like this bananas story, send 'em our way!
Haaaaave you met Bob?  Bob's not Bob's real name, but a nickname because this sadistic mf'er has a thing for bobblehead dolls.  Want to be one of Bob's bobbleheads IN THE COMIC?  Keep reading!

updates.update_userinfo: 8 Days Left! Share! Pledge! Help us bring it home!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, only 8 days left to go!  Probably going to do daily reminders so the folks watching, but not backing, don't forget to back Death Trap while they can!
This morning Daily Grindhouse posted an interview with me & artist Christopher Peterson.  We talk grindhouse movies, comic soundtracks, Sid Haig, and, of course, DEATH TRAP!  Check it out!  Share it around?  We love you!
SOMETHING I ALMOST MISSED

updates.update_userinfo: Over halfway there! Let's keep it going!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
We're past halfway!  Holy crap, thank you so much to everyone for all your support and love.  All of us are so grateful to each and every one of you!
If you haven't pledged, please pledge!  This wild ride can't take off unless we cross that finish line!

updates.update_userinfo: Unique rewards allow YOU to become part of the book! Check this out!
updates.update_content:
Hey y'all,
People have reached out and we've listened.  We've lowered the price point on some of the very cool and super unique rewards that allow YOU, the reader and beloved Kickstarter supporter, to appear in Death Trap!
Please check it out, and upgrade your pledge today before someone else grabs your spot!  Because you're already backing the project, you're hearing about this first and have first crack at putting your own mark on this book!

updates.update_userinfo: Welcome Eric Palicki to DEATH TRAP!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
If you haven't backed yet, and you're seeing this message because you're watching the Kickstarter - please pull the trigger and back the project!  
We are down to the wire - please pledge and share!  Thank you to everyone who already has!
