Hey everyone,
First, the business:
We need all hands on deck if we're going to make this book!  Click one (or more!) of the links below to tweet out a message of support and get your Twitter pals activated!

project_data.project_name: DEATH TRAP : A paranormal, sideshow freak, grindhouse story!

campaign.story:
20 FISTS is a queer Romeo & Juliet during a break-up meets The Warriors.  It's a tale as old as time. Two women, who met on the battleground, find themselves sorting through the rubble of their relationship in the illegal and unlicensed fight league that runs rampant throughout their city. Issue #1 features two chapters: Round One is the first part of the fight between The No Names & The Big Jackets. Following Round One is a flashback that sets up the growing friction between Chel, Billie, and their crews.
This is ultimately a story about doing what you love and not allowing yourself to be controlled by the people in your life. It's something I think we can all relate to and strive for even if you've never been in an underground city-wide fight league.
STRETCH GOAL - If we hit $800 before the end of our campaign, I'll include a whole extra chapter (21 pages!) with the rest of the comic! So instead of 35 pages of rough and tumble romance you'll get 56 pages at no extra cost!
This Kickstarter is exclusively to fund printing of Issue #1, 35 pages of black and white comic with a color cover. Everything has already been paid for out of pocket and now we want to bring our little story directly to YOU. See below for the cover and some sample pages!
20 FISTS Cover
Meet the Team
Frankee White is a writer who’s had work appear The Literary Journal of the Kurt Vonnegut Memorial Library, ran a successful Kickstarter for his children’s poetry book THE WACKY ADVENTURES OF WEIRD BEARD, and had his debut fantasy/horror graphic novel, BROKEN BEAR, release this year (Caliber Comics – 2019).
Kat Baumann is an illustrator/designer/storyboard artist/animator/cake dominator from Southern Minnesota. She has studied at the Perpich Center for Arts Education in the department of Visual Arts and received a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from Bethany College in 2013.
DC Hopkins is a professional letterer/designer for IDW, Dynamite, LionForge, BlackMask, Disney, Tor, Red 5, and more.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The entire first issue is finished. If the campaign is successful, Issue #1 will be sent off to print. The only risks are potentially due to shipping problems.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: 20 FISTS

campaign.story:
Incident Report takes place in a world where super powers are a mundane part of life. People don’t have secret identities and vigilante night jobs. They become teachers or firemen. They work 9 to 5. Some fly to the office, but most take the subway.
Humans with enhanced abilities are called Chimerans. They are registered with the International Chimeran Administration, a global organization dedicated to helping Chimerans integrate into society. They work to minimize harm caused by dangerous or destructive abilities and provide support and training to super-powered kids and their families. 
 Ten years ago Anne walked away from the dangerous life as an ICA agent to start a family. Anne can shoot fire from her hands, but her true calling is helping kids like her get the support they need to grow up. When an old friend is mysteriously killed in the line of duty, Anne finds herself pulled towards the life she left behind. Along the way she encounters Vladimir Markov, a Russian ICA agent sent to investigate the murder.   
 What You'll Get: 
The Comic itself is 25 pages
The Digital Deluxe and the printed editions of the comic will have 11 pages of additional content. The content will be a mixture of setting information and more background on how the comic came to be. 
Fans of Heroes, Powers, Misfits, Alphas and other stories of superhumans' real world impacts on society
People who like to read alternate history and crime drama
Lovers of comics about civil and social responsibility and Science Fiction!
Finding Home | La Voz de M.A.Y.O. Tata Rambo
We’re comic book fans. We’re also gamers and one of our favorite pastimes has been interactive storytelling in tabletop RPGs. Playing in a long term superhero game, aside from being great fun, taught us to challenge the roles of heroes and look at their worlds with a critical eye. More than ever before we wanted consistent storytelling with repercussions when heroes took action. We wanted their worlds to be impacted by their choices. No reboots and do-overs. Having superpowers has very real-world implications, and we wanted to explore. These are characters and stories that we've shared with each other and built on for years. We want to give you the chance to fall in love with them too. 
Life is the ongoing accumulation of stories, and the best place to get them is from the people all around you. In homage to the fiction we’ve spun around the table with friends and mountains of dice, we’ve brought together a group of seasoned professionals and dedicated amateurs to craft the foundation of a unique superhero setting that can be shared and added to over the years. The central comic and collection of short stories have been made with love and care through countless revisions. We hope you’ll enjoy the great tales inside.  
This campaign isn’t just to raise money to print our book—we want our future fans to be involved in bringing this world to life. Since the very beginning, Incident Report has been a collaborative story. This endeavor started with creating characters at the game table with our friends but quickly became something much bigger than we had ever imagined. We weren’t ready to walk away. Soon, we we were spending late nights commandeering auditorium whiteboards in college, writing notes and power-sets on loose sheets of paper or on the back of study guides trying to build the foundation of this world. But for all of this work we still need one final piece to finish our story: you. 
We've already completed the book, so we're raising all of the funds for printing and rewards. Here's the breakdown!
 Once the KS is backed, we will send out backer surveys
 We’ll send out the digital version of the book once all of the files are compiled for the printer —the book is complete, so this should be shortly after the Kickstarter ends.
 Printing can take 2-3 months to complete. 
 Once everything physical is assembled, we’ll begin shipping. We’ll be sending out updates during each step of the process to keep everyone in the know.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Printing can be difficult and shipping can be complex. It's a lot of work to ship all these books. But much like the creation of Incident Report, we've made it a group effort. We have a team of friends standing by to help us with the shipping. 

Because we like to be prepared, we joined the ComixLaunch group to work with creators like Tyler James from ComixTribe, Ryan Kroboth from Sunmaker and others to learn the ins and outs of how to deliver on Kickstarter.

The book is already completed, so the only thing we need to do is ship it to you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The moment you've waited for is here!
We are 94% fulfilled. Keep an eye out for your packages in the mail; most of you will be receiving your orders soon. We are so excited to finally be sending these out!
The remaining 6% of orders are waiting on IDs and badges.
The Badges Are Ordered:
This is the last reward we’re missing. They should arrive in the next two weeks and then we can ship the last of the orders. We’ve messaged each backer who ordered a badge directly, so if you’d rather not wait, please let us know.
Last Call for ID Photos:

Hey everyone!
Quick update to let you know that we've officially begun to ship out rewards! Our goal was to have all pledges shipped out this month and we're about 25% of the way done so far. We'll send another update once we're 100% shipped!
Also, please look through your e-mail and spam folders for the digital rewards! We've sent out all of the digital rewards with the exception of the Audio Commentary and the digital script. We'll be sending those out as soon as we finish a last pass on both of them.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping has Begun! Digital Rewards Sent!
updates.update_content:
We know we’ve been a little it quiet lately, but we have the update you’ve all been waiting for:
The books have arrived!
Yesterday, Mary, Brian and Cici travelled to a galaxy - er, city - far far away to pick up the physical copies of our books as well as our art prints.

Hello honored backers, patrons, and supporters!
We are pleased to announce that all the unlocked bonus content has been finished! We’re currently finalizing the layout before we send it to the printer.
By now you should have received an email that we'll be locking orders in 24 hours - so if there's anything you want to grab, do it fast!  All the art prints and physical rewards except the custom ID cards, because we needed to collect some information for those first. The rewards should be arriving in the next few weeks. We’re so excited to see them come in!

Hey Everyone!
We're hard at work getting all the rewards ready, but wanted to make sure everyone knew that the surveys were out! We've got about 77% of surveys completed so far, which is great! That being said, uf you haven't received your survey link yet, feel free to comment or message us. We want to make sure we have everyone's info right so that we can begin sending out all the rewards!
Thank you for your support!

Hey everyone!
The Surveys Are Almost Ready!
You should receive them in the next 48 hours. We were actually planning on sending them out before this update, but BackerKit does a manual check which we did not anticipate. Once the manual check is done we’ll be sending the surveys out right away. Sorry about the extra delay, but be on the lookout for your survey!
Exciting Reward News

Welcome back everyone! 
We’re sure you've all been champing at the bit, wondering when we’ll start sending everything out now that the campaign is over.
Right now, we’re still waiting for all of the pledges to get fully processed. Kickstarter says that it should be another week or so before everything gets closed out.

project_data.project_name: Incident Report Issue #1

campaign.story:
Weekend Warrior Comics is a new digital and print magazine specializing in superhero comics. We're raising funds to print our pilot issue for the series, a 36-page installment featuring 5 comics stories, one prose story, and an exclusive interview with cartoonist Michel Fiffe! 
Our magazine exists as a space for a diverse range of creators of different races, artistic sensibilities, genders, experiences, and sexualities to explore the superhero genre. It's not always easy taking part in the genre when it seems to belong to an industry that is either forgetful of or downright hostile towards your existence! We're here to offer a space for creators to tell their stories in the genre, whatever those may be.
Cover Art by michi // chrysanthemumskies
Fortunately for our prospective backers, Weekend Warrior Comics #1 is complete thanks to the hard work of our crackerjack creative teams and dynamic designer! We're ready to send our files to print the moment we receive the funds to do so, making this Kickstarter one that is prepared to focus on fulfillment once the campaign has ended.
We believe in the book that we've put together, but don't just take our word for it when we say it's great:
"You are gonna want to keep an eye on this one, friendos." - Ted Brandt (Crowded, Princeless)
"Superheroes don't belong to companies, the concept of them belongs to the world, and with Weekend Warrior, we get a bit more movement on proving it. A smart, fun, collection of comics sprawls across the pages here, showing what superheroes can be, in new ways. This is a glimpse into what the future can be." - Adam P. Knave (Amelia Cole) 
"It’s great to see a superhero anthology that manages to capture the hope, thoughtfulness, and spirit of adventure that Weekend Warrior Comics stuffs in each of its stories. The teams here have all accepted the responsibility of challenging the status quo, and delivered comics that celebrate the medium with a sense of optimism that both refreshes and inspires. I can’t wait to be surprised by more issues in the future." - JK Schmidt (ComicBook.com)
"This book gives me warm fuzzies. It reminds me of the times I'd get together with my weird friends after school and make comic strips. Unfettered, optimistic." - Emmett Helen (My Riot!)
Contents!
Our lead story is the titular Weekend Warrior by Anne Marcano and Mark O. Stack with Danny Djeljosevic. It follows Jamie, a young non-binary office worker who toils away at their day job so they can save up to travel to an alien world where they're a superhero!
 Blue Moon Brawl by Colt Hoskins and Rachel Stevens, a snappy story about a triad of queer women who take their superheroics to the moon to battle the neo-Nazis who tried to indoctrinate one of them!
 Kind of Blue, a prose story by Christopher M. Jones (Written in the Bones) in which a father reflects on the choice that led to his daughter leaving home to join a super-team.
 Off-Duty by Beth Barnett (Hallo Spaceboy) examines the events that affect a superhero when they're out of costume.
 Stop Time with Me by Ten Van Winkle (VERTOSCOPE Anthology) and Francesca Lyn (Flower Girls) with John S. Troutman tell the story of a couple struggling to find time for themselves as one partner's superhero career takes over their life.
Chase Magnett (ComicBook.com) interviews Michel Fiffe (Copra, Bloodstrike: Brutalists) about working within the superhero genre and on material that has a long legacy.
And finally, we have Knife Girl by Julia Cartales, the comedic tale of a young master of disguise who runs into unexpected trouble after burning down the set for the latest Law & Order spin-off.
To find out even more about our magazine and see full-page previews, please read the feature/interview published over at Women Write About Comics.
Funding
As detailed previously, our book is already complete and we're raising funds for printing. So that leaves our costs at printing, packaging materials, and shipping which you can see broken down here:
 We've already worked to find the right publisher for the magazine and have worked with them to create a test printing to confirm that this magazine will be as gorgeous as promised:
Any additional funds raised past our goal will be evaluated and divided between our creative teams, so tell a friend or two!
With your support, we'll find out if there's an audience for continuing our brand of independent, creator-owned superhero comics that prize diversity on and off the page!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our risks are minimal as production of the issue has already been completed. However, printing and shipping aren't always the smoothest process, so there may be delays involving that which we will endeavor to keep you updated on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Issue two is in the planning stages! It's the very next project I plan to tackle if my current Kickstarter is successful. In preparation for all that, we have a fancy shmancy cover from our contributor Anne Marcano, and it reveals what our theme is this time around...

Our next issue is in pre-production with teams and pitches in various states of being either locked or in development. We’ve managed to lock our theme and our cover, created by previous issue contributor Anne Marcano!
I’d love to reveal that cover to you all, but unfortunately that’s locked until the Kickstarter for ALL THIS TOO SHALL PASS (now one of Kickstarter’s Projects We Love!) hits $1,500 in funding.
If you help push us there, you’ll unlock the cover and receive some great new comics from the Weekend Warrior umbrella: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/wwc/all-this-too-shall-pass
My new comics campaign has just unveiled one of its covers!

Hello!
My schedule changed, and the Kickstarter for my next project has launched a little earlier than initially planned! I've already told you all about it, but I'll remind you that it's continuing a lot of the work started in Weekend Warrior Comics #1 while offering a lot of fresh, NEW books at a great value.
Check out the great art that we've put together for these wonderful books, and please consider backing our campaign to help make them a reality:

Hello all!
I want to thank you all again for making Weekend Warrior Comics #1 possible. We're currently doing work to get the second issue ready to launch later this year. Right now, however, we have a new side project on the deck that is preparing to launch next week!
The campaign is for two new graphic novellas. The first, All This Too Shall Pass, is created with some Weekend Warrior alums in addition to some new faces. It's a 54-page story about heroes trying to find hope in the face of a world that breaks regularly. We're really struggling with what it means to "save the world" in this era. And the second book is . You can think of it as a Wonder Woman-type story of a Jewish golem woman who goes searching for a soul in the 100 years that she lives. When I found out that Patricia Highsmith had pitched to take over Wonder Woman, I couldn't not image what it would look like if was a superhero-adjacent comic book.

Estimated delivery date is in one week, so be sure to check your mail next week!
Also: there are still about six or seven of you who haven’t answered the reward survey which means you won’t be receiving your copies along with everyone else. Please, go through your emails and answer the survey or personally message me through the Kickstarter page with your mailing address!
Thank you all again for your support. You’ve helped get this project rolling in a big way, and I’m excited to show you all the plans to come. Until then, though, enjoy our first issue!

The printing process appears to be going a little slow right now!
I placed the order on 10/4/19 when I had the Kickstarter funds dispersed to my bank account. (I also ordered the shipping containers which have already come in.) They didn't get a proof to me for approval until 10/10, so I'm a little skeptical of them meeting the regular 14-day production timeline but in fairness they did say "14 days or more." 
With that in mind, I'll update you all again when I receive the tracking info when it's shipped! As soon as it comes in, I'll be packaging and then shipping immediately. I live a short walk away from a post office, so that helps!

As the title says, please answer the survey that I sent out last week! There are thirteen people left who haven't responded, and I'd really like to get y'all your digital copies ahead of printing the book.
Thank you!

Digital copies have gone out today to 87 backers! We're using WeTransfer for this, so you have one week to use the link to download your copy. Act fast!
Also, we still have 34 backers who need to respond to the survey we sent out during the week so that we can get you your rewards! Please, check your spam folder/promotions/etc. if you haven't noticed it in your inbox.

Surveys for rewards went out yesterday, but we still need some responses to ensure that everyone is able to receive their digital copies ASAP! So please, check your email for the survey email so that we can get those out to you immediately.

campaign.story:
As a blizzard descends upon a remote distribution center, a mysterious package is delivered. The three man night crew will be witness to unspeakable horrors born from within the TOMB OF THE WHITE HORSE. 
TOMB of the WHITE HORSE final cover - Cover art by Kim Myatt
Snow falls, tensions rise, and the presence of this package pulls the crew closer to the abyss of insanity. Blood will be spilled, sacrifices made, and by dawn humanity will be privy to what lies within THE TOMB. 
TOMB OF THE WHITE HORSE is a 36-page full color one-shot comic that is both a standalone story and the first of a four part horror series. 
Benjamin and I share a love of horror.The Thing, The Shining, and Hellraiser are a just a few we keep close to our hearts. Likewise, the otherworldly eeriness of The Twilight Zone, Tales from the Crypt, and reprints of EC Horror Comics were also objects of our affection. Equipped with an armful of this malevolent, bleeding love, we set our jaws and fashioned it into a comic.  
Page 01: Inks - Benjamin Æ Filby, Colours - Lesley Atlansky, Letters - Zakk Saam
TOMB is a story of isolation, gore, and high strangeness that I hope will connect on more than a surface level. We wanted the struggle between our characters resonant with the divisive times in which we live. It's important to care about the people we're terrorizing, and without giving away too much, we wanted the reader to feel the pain of Sam, the rage of Taylor, and the smug security of Noah, instead of making them 2-dimensional cannon fodder.
Page 02: Inks - Benjamin Æ Filby, Colours - Lesley Atlansky, Letters - Zakk Saam
 The project has been a labor of love for some time. We distributed the first TOMB OF THE WHITE HORSE preview at NYCC in 2018. Then an updated version at C2E2 in early 2019. While working on a third re-write, we grabbed an opportunity to have my script reviewed by Danny Lore, (Queen of Bad Dreams, James fricking' Bond) and their notes transformed our work-in-progress into the chilling tale we have in store for you. 
Our goal of 3500$ is to pay for colors, letters, printing, fulfillment of rewards, and shipping to our backers. Value and turnaround time are important to us, so we've included free shipping in the US & UK, and our time goal is to have the book in your hands before the last day of October. 
 As co-creators of TOMB, Benjamin and I are not taking a page rate for this book. We wanted to keep the goal low and ensure we could pay for the awesome letters & colors Zakk and Lesley are providing. The rest of the funds raised will go to production costs, printing & fulfillment/shipping of the final products. Any renumeration for us will come from stretch goals & will be duly noted as the campaign goes on. 

One of our main priorities for this comic is to make it our own - we want the book to stand out, and be an object of substance in its own right. We've worked together to curate the high quality materials that fit the art and subject matter of TOMB - a 200gsm matt laminated cover to showcase Kim Myatt's fantastic painted cover, with 150gsm uncoated interior pages, giving the comic a tactile quality so you can FEEL THE HORROR!
 BENJAMIN Æ FILBY 
 More of his work can be found at benjaminaefilby.com
IAN MONDRICK
You can find him on twitter @Ian_Face. 

LESLEY ATLANSKY
More of her work can be found at www.lesleyatlansky.com

ZAKK SAAM
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're determined to make this book! But bringing enough people together to generate life in a project like this is always our main concern. 
Benjamin and I have worked hard to make sure our budget is tight and responsible, but the only thing that keeps us up at night (besides the strange dragging sound emanating from the basement) is that our reach isn't wide enough to "get the word out" appropriately. The best solution is signal boosting from our fans and friends. 

So please, even if you're not able to back the book, take a moment to tweet or post about TOMB OF THE WHITE HORSE on your social media feeds. 

Tell your friends at the comic book shop, office, or the Overwatch league you play in Wednesdays, Fridays, and alternating Sundays. Any mention helps, and you'll have our sincere thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

(back tomb of the red horse here! campaign ends at midnight on Halloween!)
We'd like to take one more opportunity to thank you for your support for last years' campaign. TOMB OF THE WHITE HORSE was made real because you believed in the project, and everything that comes after, every issue, every new story, gained some momentum from your backing of our spooky little book.

updates.update_userinfo: The TOMB OF THE RED HORSE has opened...
updates.update_content:
so much has happened in the last 12 hours...
The TOMB OF THE RED HORSE campaign launched at midnight, and in that short amount of time we've amassed over one hundred backers and are 50% funded!
Something evil pulses below the streets of Sin City. A son, a father, and the man sworn to protect them both find themselves inside a beating heart of greed & power. The only thing more horrifying than what lies inside THE TOMB...is what someone would sacrifice to open it.

updates.update_userinfo: THE END IS NIGH: TOMB OF THE RED HORSE ON KICKSTARTER 10/2/20
updates.update_content:
As dawn breaks, so does the world. 
TOMB OF THE RED HORSE, the second story in the TOMB series begins funding on FRIDAY, 10/2 at MIDNIGHT (EST). We're so proud & excited to bring this to you, and we want all three-hundred and thirty-four of you to know that we would NOT be at this point without you and your generous support.
Hi all, Benjamin here - Whilst a follow-up to Tomb of the White Horse is underway, I'd like to give everyone a peek into what I've been up to!

Packages will be going out ASAP. I’m still waiting on envelopes for the prints, but provided they arrive shortly, there shouldn’t be much of a delay.
Thank you again for the tremendous amount of support you’ve shown us throughout the campaign. (And HUGE thanks to Benjamin for shipping these so well, AND for overseeing specs on the books/rewards, as they all look exquisite!). We’ll update again when all rewards have been shipped.

campaign.story:
About The Project
Aeonian #2 picks up where issue 1 left off. We delve deeper into the lives of the family and learn more of just how twisted they have become. The family is still searching to make life eternal by any means necessary, running Hewitt and Myman down in the process. Do they get any closer to unlocking the potential of their guest? Read the next chapter and see. 
If you love horror, drama, sci-fi, or mythology, this story is for you. If you missed the first issue we do have a catch up tier that includes both issue 1 and 2. 
Cover for Aeonian #2
Lettered cover
Limited Edition Cover Art by William Russell and Colors by Patrizia Comino
Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter allows me to reach a broader audience then I have been able to on my own. My first Kickstarter was highly successful and all backers received their product on time, if not early. I believe in making quality horror comics available to the masses, and this is the perfect platform to reach as many people as possible, AND have more control over rewards making it out on time.  
 All funds from this campaign will go towards production of the third issue, and printing the second issue. 
Artwork from Issue #2
Page 1 of Aeonian #2
Lettered and colored page 1
Page 2 of Aeonian #2
Page 3 of Aeonian #2
Page 4 of Aeonian #2
About the Team
Stefani Manard, Writer and Creator
 I am a writer. I love animals. I wear onsie PJs and binge-watch Black Books. Follow me on Instagram @stefani_manard for pics of my Rotties, conventions, project updates, and other random happenings. Previous projects include Secrets Best Kept, Psycho Path: The Collected Series, The Last Heist, Aeonian #1, and stories in both Cafe Macabre from Source Point Press and Space Copz Origins from Behemoth Comics.  
 www.stefanimanard.com 
Stan Yak, artist extraordinaire
Robert Nugent, colorist of worlds
 Hello everyone, I am Robert Nugent, the crazy colorist of this intense book. I’ve been working in comics for 8 years and I hope to do this for many more years to come. I’ve worked with many independent publishers including Alterna, Source Point Press, Vulture Comics, Broken Icon Comics, Forge Creation, Advent Comics, among many others. In 2016 I won The Best Colorist award at Alternate Showcase of Animation and Comics poll awards. 
Robin Jones, Letterer to the stars!
 Rob Jones is a Letterer and writer of comics. He has worked for Image, DC Thomson, BHP Comics,  Humanoids, and multiple small press and indie comics. He is a member of Madius Comics, a UK comic collective and can often be found shouting madness into the digital void at @RobJonesWrites on twitter. He is often mistaken for a Yeti, wandering the Yorkshire dales and enjoys various flavors of crisps. 

REWARDS!!

$3000: LOCKED!
MORE TO COME!

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
I wanted to shoot out a quick note to let you know that the third issue of Aeonian is coming to Kickstarter tomorrow. I will add the prelaunch url so that you can be alerted when it goes live at 10am. I hope that everyone is safe and I appreciate your time!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/aeonian3/aeonian-3

Hey guys!
I hope you all had a great holiday and that the new year is treating you well. I just wanted to let you know that art is rolling in for Aeonian 3 and it is looking great! I am hoping to have everything ready to go up on Kickstarter in February. We are running a little behind and as you all know I do not put my projects up until they are almost finished, so that I can get them to you by the end of the campaign. 
I just wanted to give you a quick update and let you know we are moving along and everything is looking great! I will let you know the launch date as soon as I am approved and ready.

updates.update_userinfo: Only a Few Surveys Not Received
updates.update_content:
There are just a few people left that I'm waiting on addresses for to make sure I get everyone their rewards. If there were many problems with your package please let me know and I will take care of it for you!
Thank you all again for your support. Enjoy your Sunday :)
Much Love,

I just finished up the last packages and they are headed to the post office. I am still missing 5 surveys so I can't mail those rewards out until I get the addresses. Please check your email as I have messaged you :) If anything is missing or damaged in your package please let me know and I will make sure to replace it. I appreciate you all so much and can't wait to hear what you think of issue 2! Have an amazing weekend :) 
Much Love,

I have all rewards in from the printer and as I type this have already dropped a batch off at the post office! All packages will be mailed out by Friday, so expect your package in the mail next week at the latest. I appreciate you all and look forward to hearing your thoughts on this issue. Have an amazing Wednesday!
Much Love,
Stefani Manard

Good morning! All digital rewards have just been sent out so please check your email for a message from me! The Dropbox link for your rewards will be attached there. I truly hope you enjoy the comic/comics, and thank you again for backing the project.
Physical copies should be in any day now, and I will begin mailing them our as soon as I pick them up from the printer. We are at the end of road, guys! I can't wait to get everyone their rewards and hear your thoughts on issue 2 of Aeonian :)

Check you email as all surveys have been sent! The sooner I get your response the sooner you get your rewards :) Thanks and have an incredible weekend!
I will be at Capital City Comic Con in Lansing tomorrow. Hope to see some of your faces :)
Much Love, 
Stefani Manard

The order for all the product has been placed and will take 2 weeks to get in. As soon as I receive it I will send another update and will start mailing packages! Surveys will be sent out by tomorrow as well, so please check your emails and get those in for me. Aeonian #2 is almost to you!!! so excited to get the physical copies :)
Much Love,
Stefani

updates.update_userinfo: Almost ready to go to print!
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update to let you know where we are at. Lettering is finished and I will be sending the issue to my editor to make sure everything looks good tomorrow. Then I can place my order for books! It should take 2 weeks for them to get back to me, after which all packages will be going out. I will update you when I have received the comics and be sure to keep you in the loop. 
Thank you all again for being amazing! Have a great week :)

updates.update_userinfo: Funded and Third Stretch Goal Reward Reached!
updates.update_content:
You guys are incredible! We pulled off the third stretch goal reward just before the end of the campaign! I want to thank each and every one of you for your support on this project. Without you, this wouldn't be happening. So THANK YOU!!
What Now!
I have already received the stickers, but have to place the order for the comic and the prints. As soon as the funds are released I will place the order for everything and do another update! I will be mailing them out as soon as I get them, which should be by the end of the month as long as printing doesn't run over. At this time you can expect your physical reward by the first week of October, just in time for Halloween season :) All digital rewards will be sent as soon as the PDF is put together, which should be within a week or two.

campaign.story:
Hey there! It's Lucia! I have recorded my sophomore album, Best Friend Forever, and want to get it mastered and release it for all of you, with enamel pins (of me and my cat Penny!) and beautiful hand-painted cover art! I have a new band and a bigger sound... Let Me Into Your World and I'll Be Your Best Friend Forever!!
Hi! I'm Lucia Fasano. I'm a singer-songwriter who also acts (Portlandia, HBO's The Deuce, Hulu's Dollface), an improviser and stand-up comedian (UCB, All Jane Comedy Fest), and I write for comic books (Image, A Wave Blue World) and draw! 
I love making art so much-- if I didn't, I would truly have no creative outlet and would channel everything into something like miniature golf or collecting rare coins. 
Here's my latest single off my new album-- "Spend the Night" an ephemeral, emotional power-pop song about loving something and not wanting it to end. 
me (by joy newell)!
I released my debut solo album, Radio Silence, through Kickstarter the summer of 2016. Ah, what a time that was. Thanks to a lot of the people reading this, I was able to put out that album, go on tour with The Doubleclicks (of my label, Doubleclicks Records), sell my CD in record stores and streamed it on Spotify, make some adorable t-shirts, make new friends and fans, launch my Patreon, and move back to the glamorous and sweaty city of Los Angeles. In the midst of that I wrote and recorded a bunch of new songs, and now I'm back with a new album full of them!
Best Friend Forever is an album about all things friendship—the sunny sides and the sacrifices, our friends as family, our family as friends, and what happens when a friendship ends. Compared to my first album Radio Silence, this album has less mandolin and more rockin'. The album also features timely themes about the state of the world— what it's like to read about an international tragedy on twitter in the middle of the night, or being cat-called on the streets, or dealing with scene drama and other toxic catastrophes. What I'm saying is this is an album of our TIMES!
The album has been recorded, and it's just waiting for your help to be mastered and printed.
Listen to a track from the album by clicking here!!!
The incredible sound is co-produced by Jessica Boudreaux of Summer Cannibals, with additional production by Kasey Clark, it's an infectious and relatable indie pop-rock record (with a hint of folk!). 
I'm also debuting my new backing band, with Kasey Clark (of my former band Shady Characters) on drums, Kyle McCormick on bass, and Rick Wood on guitar!  With your funding, I can pay for the artists and recording I've done... and maybe we can get matching suits?  
THE ALBUM: "Best Friend Forever" is available in digital and physical CD form! And I'm happy to sign it for you! 
Album art by Jennifer Houston (@spcecadet)
ENAMEL PIN: Check out this Best Friend Forever Exclusive Enamel Pin by Mel Stringer ( one of my fav instagram artists)! THIS IS ME AND MY CAT PENNY! It's a uni-kitty! A penny-corn! I love it SO MUCH! Let's match!
FRIENDSHIP BRACELET: I will make you a special friendship bracelet! BY HAND! This ain't no Claire's at the mall! 
Some friendship bracelets by Lucia!
LUCIA'S FIRST ALBUM: A signed copy of "Radio Silence" (2016) will be included in certain tiers! An indie folk-rock album with songs like "Radio Silence", "When my Eyes are Closed" and "Nerd Boy". 
DOODLES: I will draw you a one-page picture based on a few-words request from you, and dang, it'll be cute!  
Doodles By Me!
I want to thank my campaign manager Laser Malena-Webber, my bandmates Kyle McCormick, Kasey Clark and Rick Wood, my artist extraordinaire Jennifer Houston, my mom and brothers, my producer Jessica Boudreaux, my Doubleclicks Records support Aubrey Turner, Larry Crane for taking me on for Radio Silence, my cousin Ali and bro JC for singing on "The Doom", Mel Stringer for rad pin art, all the people who broke my heart, my Radio Silence backers and Patreon patrons, and all my friends & famiglia! I cannot wait for you to get this album in your hands.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fortunately for all, the album is DONE! This Kickstarter will help get it to you all, but mastered all shiny and new, and with all the art and things that it needs. The merchandise has been priced out, and the project is ready to order and then ship. My campaign advisor, Laser of Laser Campaigns/Doubleclicks Records, who managed my last successful Kickstarter, has shipped many successful projects in the past and we feel confident in our ability to do this once again. I will be as transparent as possible regarding any shipping or manufacturing delays, and am thankful for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: It's time to download the album! Info in this update!
updates.update_content:
"Best Friend Forever" is out 12/25 and now available for pre-order! 
THANKS TO YOU! so please, fill out your Kickstarter survey (that's when you give me your info so I can send you your rewards!)
Go to kickstarter.com on a computer, log in and see if there is a banner at the top of the page asking you to fill out the survey!

updates.update_userinfo: GIVE ME YOUR INFO! ALBUM OUT 12/25! AVAIL FOR PRE-ORDER!
updates.update_content:
Today at 6 pm we wrapped the campaign at about $5300. I am so grateful and so excited to get the record mastered/printed and in everyone’s hands! It’s really good I swear!
it means a lot to feel so supported. It can be super scary to share my art and reach out, and I’m so glad I did.
Shoutout to some backers who really kept me going— the Cagan’s, Jonathan Gould, The Ouimets + co, Sarah Donner, labelmates PDX Broadsides, Carlos, Sara Schaefer, Chris Khatami (my 100th backer!) and the Khatami family, the great folks at Big Bud Press, artist Shane Hosea for being the funder that got us to $5k, then Bill Beats for being my final backer (I sing the beats on his summer hip hop song Ray of Sunshine! https://open.spotify.com/track/7pSzoQW990EO3Eg2hLnsTQ?si=DJZiC8lFTUW-jLmKU4JRdg)
Less than an hour left to up any pledges or grab your friend and have them pitch in a dollar! THANKS EVERYONE WOOHOO BFF IS HAPPENING!!! much love!!
I am graciously happy to announce that my kickstarter has funded. With 2 more days to go.

updates.update_userinfo: WE FUNDED! WE DID IT! 2 DAYS TO GO!
updates.update_content:
Thank you all so much, everyone supporting me in these last 3 days of the campaign. We are about $460 away from funding :). 
I, like many are, am disturbed and heartbroken over another mass shooting this time in an El Paso Walmart. I've been racking my brain about the looming fear of violence so many of us experience. Last year, feeling helpless, I tried to name that feeling, and wrote this song. It is not the only song on the new album that deals with these issues-- it's hard not to make art tinged with it. The song is in honor of the victims and survivors, and in memory of a time before you first felt The Doom.

updates.update_userinfo: New Single, "The Doom". 3 Days Left of Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Thank you so much for getting us this far!
I feel like I'm typing this weird because I nicked my thumb on a zoodler (y'know, when you make noodles out of zucchini?). ANYWAY:
It's the final countdown. We are a little under $800 away from our goal of $5k. It's been quite the campaign and you all gave me a lot of hope, which has really helped a lot. I've changed the custom song reward to only $100-- it makes a great gift!

updates.update_userinfo: 4 More Days! 4 More Days! New Music Videos!
updates.update_content:
My Interview with Paste! "Lucia Fasano Premieres Two Music Videos And Discusses Her New Album" 
Hi folks! What a week! 
We broke $3k, I shot a commercial, went to San Diego Comic Con and got to meet/talk with Matt Groening (creator of The Simpsons/Futurama) and old and new friends, and then Paste published an interview with me by Brock Wilbur!

updates.update_userinfo: Interview with Paste Mag & Two New Music Videos!
updates.update_content:
HI! OMG, we broke 2k this week and are making great progress. We did a livestream concert with my full band, which I've posted on youtube here as individual tracks with the best audio.
I was the guest on the latest Doubleclicks Live show, and played A preview of THIS SONG! 
"Spend the Night" is a luvvvv song but of course since it's by me it's also about ANXIETY! FOREBODING! etc etc-- just that feeling when something is so good and you're afraid it'll go away but isn't that impermanence that makes it special? ISN'T IT? Who knows! Listen! Thank you again for bein' on mah team! xo Lucia

campaign.story:
ALL PROS, NO CONS! Top-notch writers and artists share hidden talents from the practical to the peculiar in a collection of 1-page comics. 
Each story is part personal “how-to,” part “how-so.” Learn new skills or hone the ones you’ve got from “How to” use a knife like a French chef, create a talisman (& then destroy it), talk to a celebrity and more! Some of our 1-pagers will also illuminate aspects of the comic book storytelling process like writing, drawing, lettering, coloring and editing. 
HEY, AMATEUR! originated as the final page in our BLACK CROWN QUARTERLY anthologies. And, as you can see below, it demanded to be expanded. 
  With over a quarter century of experience, award-winning DC/Vertigo and Black Crown editor Shelly Bond will wrangle an inventive assemblage of writers and artists from veterans to newcomers including Michael Allred, Gail Simone, Simon Bisley, Jill Thompson, John Allison, Liz Prince, Mark Buckingham, Magdalene Visaggio and others to be announced throughout the 30-day campaign.
The goal of HEY, AMATEUR! is to create a 128-page exclusive hardcover of 1-page stories that entertains, educates and empowers while saluting the artform we love. The plan is to give each story a spread of real estate so we can include the creator bios and a bit of extra info. The remaining pages will allow us to procure an introduction and an afterword from comics pros and experts from other disciplines. We also plan to run some process pages.  Our ultimate goal is 100 stories/224 pages so with any luck we’ll get there.
 NEW REWARDS PACKAGE! AMATEUR CLEAN UP!
 AMATEUR MONKEY BUSINESS!
It was all our intern’s idea.  Once he was given a suitable moniker, it went to his head.  Presenting, The Monkeys of Amateur SKETCH LOTTERY Level!
50 artists will donate a 4 X 4 signed sketch of their version of Doctor Tork in their own inimitable style. Since it’s a lottery, there’s no telling whose work you'll receive. But know this: It will be cool. And collectible!
For $75 this level includes: the hardcover + one random sketch of Doctor Tork + signed bookplate + digital copy
Mark Buckingham turned in his sketch already which is no surprise. As his former editor of Fables for 15+ years, I know he's a deadline cruncher and I expected no less. Cheers, Bucky, for your superb flying monkey intern, Doctor Tork!
 Caitlin Yarsky also decided to jump on the opportunity to put Doctor Tork in a very refined state of mind...Remember you can upgrade your pledge at any time!
 BUDGET
STRETCH GOALS
Unlock 60K and every hardcover gets a bookplate by artist Philip Bond and other contributors. Plus: We add more how-tos in the story pages!
Unlock 75K and we increase the story count from 50 to 75 stories! That’s 25 extra stories and 176 pages!
Unlock 90K and we'll embellish the cover with a spot gloss and add a ribbon bookmark.
Unlock 100K and we increase the story count from 75 to 100 stories! That’s 50 extra stories and 224 pages!
Unlock 105K and beyond and we include all the stretch goal bonuses and give proportional page rate increases to the creative talent. You'll sleep better at night knowing that our extraordinary writers and artists will receive a fair cut of your contributions.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Producing a large hardcover book with many contributors from different time zones requires a lot of coordination. Editor/curator SHELLY BOND has a proven track record that spans nearly three decades, editing beloved comic book series Fables and The Sandman in addition to anthology titles. Bond edited and co-curated her last Kickstarter, FEMME MAGNIFIQUE, which contained 50 stories by over 100 writers and artists from around the globe. It funded close to 100K and was delivered on time to 1,733 backers. 

FEMME MAGNIFIQUE was nominated for an Eisner Award for Best Anthology for the softcover that was published through her imprint, BLACK CROWN/IDW Publishing. If HEY, AMATEUR! is funded as a hardcover, BLACK CROWN will release the softcover with a different cover in summer or fall 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, Everyone!
I hope this note finds you safe and well.

If you’re a fan of ‘80s music, you might enjoy my latest Kickstarter, HEAVY ROTATION, a love letter to college radio. It’s a 48-page anthology of comics, single illustration, and prose featuring all-star artists Jill Thompson, Michael Allred, Sanford Greene, Mark Stafford and so many brilliant newcomers.

Hello, 777 Amazing Backers!
Happy Friday! I hope you're all enjoying the weekend already.
I've been spending much of the week making corrections and preparing the digital files for print--including designing/assembling the bio page that shows off our amazing 150 contributors and how you can find more of their work. Here's a screenshot so you know I'm not kidding.
WIP:

Hey, Amateur! Backers,
Happy end of August. I can’t believe it’s been a year since the HEY! Campaign ended and over 5 months since I sent out your rewards (at the beginning of a global pandemic that continues, sigh…). I’m thrilled that so many of you received your books, art prints and loot bags. Thanks for sharing your joy on social media. It’s really made the past five months bearable. For those of you who have not received your books etc, I wanted to give you my latest status report, as I promised in last month’s update that I was going to do everything in my power to revisit the packages pending delivery by the end of summer.

Hello, Backers!
Starting off the day with great news -- Paul Pope's signed art prints have arrived, have been packaged and are awaiting my postal person for pickup. So with any luck, the ten backers (you know who you are) will be receiving your prints in the coming weeks/month.
I have an update on the packages that were sent out in early March. Apparently it’s now public that the new Post Master General is slowing the mail on purpose. It’s some system that’s meant to reduce labor costs, but it wasn’t tested first and no one seems to be monitoring it as it goes terribly wrong. It looks like there might be a congressional investigation. This seems to coincide with the other information I've received, which is that much of the mail -- domestic AND international -- that was sent out in early March was immediately stored in holding containers to be sure that it was not part of the Covid spread.

Hello, Amateur Backers!
Hope you're all safe and well. 
Wanted to let you know that the quest for a reasonable delivery time from the West Coast to anywhere other than the domestic US during a global pandemic continues to frustrate. A number of you have reported in over the past month that you've received your books and rewards. That makes me beyond happy! But many overseas backers have still not received their goods.  FWIW when I check the tracking numbers of the packages that are still "pending" on my side of the pond, there is no further update; that said, I have not received any returns for the past 6 weeks.  I'd like to believe that's a positive thing, but I'm as dubious as you guys.

Hi, Everyone,

I just spent a few hours checking on the packages again. I only received a small handful of returns from people living in countries that are not accepting any outside mail. Otherwise, it seems that so many packages are still en route but just getting delivered so incredibly slowly. For instance, my father-in-law, who lives in the UK, was a backer of the Random Monkey Sketch Lottery level; he just received his package and it was sent on March 12.

If you haven’t received your book or rewards yet, please know that you are not alone. This pandemic has done a number on a lot of things including mail deliveries.  

 The good news is that every few days, I’m delighted to see that backers are receiving their HEY, AMATEUR! books and rewards.

 I know it’s frustrating but please hang in there. Everything in the world is still topsy-turvy.  If I resend any packages now, we run the same risk of them getting lost. And I have so little stock left because I was unable to print extras based on giving everyone free shipping. I am confident that you will be receiving your books soon and massive apologies again.

 One final note: If you’re expecting the Paul Pope signed art print, I’m still waiting for Paul’s package to arrive in L.A. I’ll be sure to update you when it lands on my turf.

First, I'm truly sorry some of the HEY, AMATEUR! backers are still waiting for their books to arrive. I've been in contact with both the US Postal Service and Stamps.com (who we used to facilitate shipping) and there are few definitive answers.
We do know the books are still out there though, taking long, circuitous routes with many pit stops. Every few days we hear of books finally arriving at their intended destinations. (Yay!)

Greetings, All!
Just a quick note to report on some progress. A package from my British Liaison arrived the other day so I was able to send out the John Allison signed art prints. This means that I'm just waiting for the Paul Pope signed art prints to arrive from the east coast.  I have it on good authority that I'll be seeing this package next week so please do me a solid and keep your fingers, toes and knees crossed.

Hey, Amateur Backers,
I hope you're all hanging in there in your respective parts of the planet.  
Many of you have received your books and rewards, but sadly, many of you have not. It seems to be roulette in terms of what takes the reasonable 2-3 weeks domestically/3-4 weeks internationally and what is stuck in a weird limbo at an international California holding station.

Hello, AMATEUR Backers!
I hope everyone is safe and well.
Wanted to update you on the last leg of the HEY! mail outs.  As of this typing, most of the hardcovers and rewards have been posted or are en route. However, there are still a percentage of you who have not responded to the survey or my emails with your mailing address.  If that’s you — please check your e-mail,  your junk folders, and your spam. You’ve already received a few reminders from my e-mail account  with the subject header "HEY, AMATEUR! — Your Mailing Address is Needed!" Of course, I will hold your goods, but I’d much prefer to complete this mission and have 1257 happy, satisfied backers ASAP.

project_data.project_name: HEY, AMATEUR!

campaign.story:
“I woke up here, and whatever memories I had no longer mattered. All that mattered was this...place.”
Someone wakes up on a beach, memory of their past life intact but unimportant. All that matters now is this place. They wander a decaying beach piled with giant bones, a bleak place where lighting strikes and dark hermits warn of painful transformations to come.
The Bones of This Place is a 48 page, 9x6, hardcover graphic homage to loneliness and unwanted transformation. Originally created as an INKTOBER project for 2018, with your help it can become so, so much more.
Why?
In 2018 something happened and my body started becoming something new. It did this without my permission, without caring what I needed or who I believed myself to be. 
You’re trapped in your skin - even if you don’t want to be. There are things you can do to change yourself, but there are parts of you, deep down in the dark, that shift without your control. You’re bound to these dark places, unable to escape. I became acutely aware, and troubled by this knowledge as my skin and bones started to twist into something I didn’t set out to be. It consumed, consumes, me still. 
Page 2.
In 2018 I went to my partner’s childhood home in Seaside, Oregon. 
He had grown up as an army brat, moving from place to place, but he always talked fondly about the wreckage of the Peter Iredale, the skeletal remains of a ship that went aground in 1906. The beach surrounding the bones of the ship was littered with large pieces of driftwood, whole trees practically, that had washed up on this stretch of lonely shore. The starkness of the water, the dull sand, the pieces of wood that breached the sand like broken vertebrates, it all pulled at me. It almost felt like an ache in my spine. It was beautiful and frightening. 
This combination of the beautiful loneliness and unknown pull of the wreckage and beach twisted around the unwanted transformation I was undergoing and ARE, the hooded figure who wanders the stagnant beach, was created. 
Are and Was
This is a different path than other Kickstarters I’ve done. NOSFERATU! was irreverent but kind hearted, Casket Land was a game that brought people together. THE BONES OF THIS PLACE  is a move to atmospheric eldritch fiction. I want it to be a beautiful artifact that draws you in and leaves you beautifully empty. 
With your help, I’m hoping to bring you a 9x6 48 page hardcover piece - the main story, as well as concept art and explanations of what exactly, ARE and WAS are. 
Art not final.
"This isn't something you can escape from. You can run and run, but your body will continue to betray you. Why fight? Why not just let the changes come peacefully?”
Rewards.
The setting of THE BONES OF THIS PLACE is stark and simple - and so are the base rewards for this project. Depending on what level you choose to support at - you can get:
A digital edition of the book.
A hardcover copy kickstarter edition
Original art from the book
A sticker of ARE and WAS
An embroidered patch of ARE
The original pages from the book (black and white ink and halftone)
A hand knitted wool (by Marie) hood based on the hoods worn by ARE and WAS
Our STRETCH GOALS are officially here, priced, and ready to be met. By backing and sharing, you bring this labor of love closer to the vision I've always had - a beautiful, spot gloss, foil stamped, and...well...you'll see. 
Spot gloss for the title on the front cover.
A foil stamp on Are's hood for the front cover.
At $9,999 a vellum tip in page will be added. See below for an example.
PLAY

Risks
SHIPPING WILL BE CHARGED AFTER THE CAMPAIGN ENDS.
All shipping fees will be charged AFTER the campaign ends, just before we ship the books. By doing it this way we can ensure you are paying the lowest possible cost for shipping. 
We will ship the books in bulk to a series of warehouses around the globe. Final surveys will then be sent to each Backer requesting their address and calculating an accurate shipping charge. We're going to do everything we can to keep these rates as low as possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all Kickstarters - there is risk. I have run two successful Kickstarters in the past, and I don't anticipate this one going haywire. However, there are always slow downs when you deal with printers and manufacturers. My schedule is busy with cons and other work but, because this project has been done for almost a year and is already formatted, the only thing we need to wait on before sending it to print is for the funding to clear.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: BONE OF THIS PLACE has finally arrived, after a grueling year filled with art problems, production problems, shipping problems... pretty much any issue you could imagine going wrong with this relatively simple little book absolutely did. But now it's here and ready to ship!
PLAY

I was given time.
In the time I was given, nothing has changed
I’ve found that with the time I was given
I’d forgotten what it was like to

It's a lot less fun living it day to day than writing about it, if I'm being honest. 
I hope you all are keepin' as well as you can. Everyone on my end is doing their best to stay safe, taking extra precautions and being careful. Right now that means we're setting up backerkit via the power of the internet! 
The books are still at the printers, which shut down due to COVID - but when they're moving towards us? You'll know! They're the last thing we're waiting on before we're able to ship all physical rewards out.

Hey all! 
I'm still blown away by all the support for THE BONES OF THIS PLACE (which...look, it's gonna be double sized now - 12x8)! I want to write my update all somber - like Bones was written, but I'm really excited that this book was able to be funded and I can't be a sad sack about it.
I also wanted to remind you all that I'm part of a studio in St. Louis called HEK (Hurtt (as in Brian), Enger (ME!) and Kindt (as in Matt) - and we're kickstarting a book RIGHT NOW.

We funded. 
We funded when I was at Gen Con. Right before the show ended and we started to pack up, Tavis turned and showed me his phone. 
I can't believe it. I'm grateful, I'm so grateful for this. I'm so grateful for your support, understanding and excitement for this project. It's special to me! I'm glad it's become special to you as well!

This post is a bummer - but it’s important to me that you understand why I made this book. Why, when some of you who’ve seen me at shows have noticed that I’m not the same person I used to be. I promise, I am seeking medical help and I have an amazing team helping me get well. 
But I want to warn you before reading any farther… this is a post that talks heavily about blood, illness, and food related maladies.

campaign.story:
SPOILERS, SON! Yo, this is volume 2 of the saga of Metalshark Bro. So if you haven't read the first volume, you should totally not read any crap below this and just get on that big dog tier to get volume 1 and 2. You'll thank us later.
STRETCH GOALS? Always a possibility. Variant covers? More stories? New rewards? Only with your help and our hustle can we get there. Have ideas for stretch goals, let us know in the comments.
Team Metalshark Bro is back with a brand new Metalshark Bro adventure. WE couldn’t just say goodbye to MSB, IRA, and the rest of this world of bloody madness!  We’ve got more tales to tell! 
I know what you’re thinking, “Wait, last time I saw Metalshark Bro he was swimming off into the sunset as a regular shark. What else do I need to know?” Well, it’s not that simple. Yeah, Satan kept his word and transformed our main man into his true shark form after snuffing out Beelzebra, but straight up murdering Beelz is where all of Metalshark Bro’s troubles REALLY begin! That douchey old demon has a lot of admirers and they are SUPER PISSED Metalshark Bro iced their leader, so these gross, mutated fools have vowed revenge against Metalshark Bro!  
And that's a brief summary of Metalshark Bro 2: The Island of Misfit Bros! You can expect more action, more side-splitting hilarity, more gory deaths, and waaaay more weird ass demon creatures! 
Why are we back? Metalshark Bro started off as a weird idea in the weird brain of weird Bob and it has flourished and grown into something that has found a special place in all of our hearts. The book is all about fun and having a good laugh...and intense, over-the-top demon slaying action. We can't walk away from that.
GROCERY LIST ADD-ONS
Want more copies? Want to create your own custom reward combinations?
It's simple to do. Just add the amount shown below to your pledge to create add-on rewards. We'll finalize your items when we send out surveys after the campaign is over. Let us know if you have any questions.
Metalshark Bro Volume 2 - $20. Volume 2 reward tier adds $5 for shipping. Add-ons do not need to add shipping.
Metalshark Bro Volume 1 - $20. Volume 1 reward tier adds $5 for shipping. Add-ons do not need to add shipping
Enamel Pins - $10 or $30 for 4. Buy 4 get 1 free!
MSB High Quality T-Shirt - $20
T-Shirt Design
KS Exclusive art book - $25
 Special and exclusive reward tiers - All kinds of unique goodies. Some that you can only get via this kickstarter campaign.
KS exclusive bookplate numbered and signed by all creative members - $55 * Not final design
Metalize your pet. Image is added to the Gallery of Misfit Bros in the back of the book - $125
Gallery of Misfit Bros. Not final design for frame
Animals love MSB!
Original 9x12 commission from book artist Walter Ostlie. One to two characters, minimal background. instagram.com/walterostlie for more samples - $200
Cameo in the book - $225
Be an Angel or Demon beat up by Ira or Metalshark Bro in the book
The original art from the voume 2 cover - $500
The original art from the volume 1 cover
Cover original art
Original Art from Brian Level - $200
Brian Level Art - $200
Art samples from the art book
We're asking for a crap ton of money to make this book.  Comics ain't cheap.  We're not going to get rich off this Kickstarter. This money will allow us to produce the book, print the book, buy merch, ship the book, and slide a little green to Kickstarter.  That's it though.  No hair metal mansion or Whitesnake Jaguars here. 
Money breakdown
Breakdown
 Production - Art, Letters, Design - Keep us fed and clothed while making this book - $12,500 
 Printing - Gets the art printed on real-life paper and shipped to MSB HQ- $5,000 
 Shipping to backers - This is for packing supplies and postage to get these bad boys to your house - $4,000 
 KS fees and dropped pledges - KS's pound of flesh and declined credit cards - $3,000 
 Sacrifice to the Metal Gods - Metal Gods get theirs - $166 
The entire Metalshark Bro team returns! If you think we blew your face off last time, you better get more face, because we are gonna blew it off again but like even more. So get more face...to be blown off.
Bob has been self-publishing comics since 2008 starting with the release of 41, a gritty/post-apocalyptic western with collaborators Pablo Peppino, Alexander Singleton, and Hoyt Silva. In 2014, he switched gears and created the all-ages romp Monty the Dinosaur with artist and friend Jean Franco. Bob has stayed busy with the 2016 release of The Elvis Adventures with artist Rachel Ordway and letterer Micah Myers as well as 2017's Full Moon Fredo with artist/co-creator Angela Sprecher and letterer Shawn Greenleaf. 
Kevin is a Williamsburg, Virginia based comic writer. Kevin has worked in comics since 2014, releasing the self-published, fantasy/western Oathbound with artist/co-creator Paul Gori. Kevin has also co-written/co-created The Elvis Adventures with artist Rachel Ordway and letterer Micah Myers and Full Moon Fredo with artist Angela Sprecher and letterer Shawn Greenleaf. Kevin's work was also featured in the If Anthology from Alterna Comics and the public domain anthology Not Forgotten. 
Creator, writer, and artist. He's created the properties Haxor, Shiver Bureau, and Cubicles.  Not only did he self published Shiver Bureauand Cubicles, but Haxor is being published by Webtoon and Shiver is being re-published by Scout Comics. Walter has also worked as an art-slinger for hire on Is'nana, Small Favor, Alter-Life, and Descension. When he's not all up in the comics, he is spending time with his wife, son, dog, and cat or attempting not to break his wrists while skateboarding in the hot Florida sun. 
After spending the majority of his twenties working in video production, he discovered that writing was his true love. Chas dropped everything, went back to school, and in October of 2013, he graduated from Full Sail University. There, Chas received a Creative Writing Masters MFA with a focus on comic scripting. He was dubbed Valedictorian and received the Advanced Achievement Award (the highest accolade the school offers—only one student per graduating class receives it). That counts for something, right?
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When you are playing around with this much metal, there is a chance things can get heavy. Heavy metal.

But we have all the tools needed to fight back the tidal waves of lame.

We've collectively launched several kickstarters, printed thousands of books, and shipped a crap ton of books all over the world. Yup, our stuff is worldwide.

We hate being lame and wieners, so if something does go wrong, we don't go in the corner and cry. NO. We come on Kickstarter and cry... I mean, we tell you what is going on in a professional manner with little to no tears.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey hey hey!

Hopefully, you are safe and happy and doing okay in these crazy times. The books went out on time in November and I couldn't be happier. If you are reading this and haven't received your rewards, make sure you've filled out your survey.

updates.update_userinfo: Ninja Nuns Bad Habits Die Hard live on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hello Team Metalshark Bro!
Thank you for allowing me into your inboxes. Hopefully, everyone has received their rewards for backing Metalshark Bro vol 2! If you haven't make sure you've filled out your survey. 
I am also asking for your support on a new project, the Metalshark Bro spin-off entitled Ninja Nuns: Bad Habits Die Hard! Team MSB is working with some of the best up and coming artists in comics to expand our wild and crazy universe with an action-packed 40-page romp full of crazy fun you'd expect from the weirdos that brought you Metalshark Bro.

updates.update_userinfo: Hopefully you have your books....If not
updates.update_content:
You need to fill out your survey. I want you to get your reward! Fill out your survey, please. 
After almost a month of shipping, everyone who has filled out their survey should have their book. (if not, the book is on the way)
PLEASE FILL OUT YOUR SURVEY!

Alright, everyone! We've started shipping books! Keep an eye on your mailbox cause there is awesomeness coming your way. Also, a big shout out to the fine clerks at the Mt. Washington post office for all of their hard work! If you've already received your book feel free to post on social media! We'd love to see your satisfied faces!

updates.update_userinfo: The books have entered our plane of existence
updates.update_content:
Great news! The printer has completed the printing of Metalshark Pro volume 2 and the artbook. They look amazing.
Currently, the books are on the way to Bob's house. He'll be tackling the shipping this time around. He's already loaded up on shipping labels, printers, packaging. So he's going to be slamming them out. We should have them out as promised for June delivery even with all the insanity going on. Though things keep getting crazier. Murder hornets may steal the books. Nothing is outside the realm of possibility anymore. I hope everyone is staying safe.

Hey! Hey! 
Things are taking place despite all of uncertanity. 
books: printed. Shipping soon
pins: delivered!

That's right, er'body! Check your KICKSTARTER registered email to find your survey. 
Due to the Covid-19 related shutdowns, we are uncertain of our printing time table. That being said, we are in constant contact with our publisher/printer. Once we have more info we will pass it along to you, our awesome backers! 
Be safe and take care of yourselves.

updates.update_userinfo: Metalshark Bro V2 is DONE! Here's issue 4.
updates.update_content:
Yo yo yo, Team MSB! 
Walt is making magic happen with his might stylus! Working day and night to bring da ruckus to Metalshark Bro vol 2! Hopefully you've seen our updates and scored those single issue PDF's we've been releasing! 
If you are waiting to see the whole story in all of its demon slaying glory, the time draws near. So you know what that means? In the next week or so, we will be sending out the surveys so you amazing supporters will get your rewards!!!

project_data.project_name: Metalshark Bro: Island of Misfit Bros

campaign.story:
The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast #2 continues the story of Lark Leraar, who is both a powerful sorcerer and the owner of the Arcanist Bar in San Francisco. When Lark realizes that dark magic has crept not just into the drinks but has infected the new guy Bill, she and her best friend Naomi undertake a dangerous mission to save him. Meanwhile, Bill meets a member of the Arcanist's house band with a mystical secret of his own.  
We made our goal, but there's LOTS more amazing stuff to come from The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast. We're announcing the first few stretch goals here, but there are a whole slew of them planned, and we'll release info on them as we get closer to each one. 
New Pin Design added!
The Chimera from issue #1 of The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast!
If we hit $5000 before we get to the end of the campaign, we'll add the Chimera Head Enamel pin to every rewards package that features the Logo Pin, as well as making it available in the Add-On Store, coming exclusively for backers at the end of the campaign. These super cool pins really bring Davide's work to life, and we can't wait to share them with you!
Stay tuned to the project for more stretch goals in the final week, as well as additional limited rewards tiers, and the launch of the Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast Add-On Store!
This first easily unlockable reward will add some great art to all reward tiers. We'll add an All-New 4th sticker design to the Sticker Pack, and add the pack to ALL PHYSICAL REWARD TIERS. This new sticker image is a spoiler for issue #2 so we won't show it here, and it will come in a sealed envelope to prevent giving away the secret!
For Digital only rewards tiers, we'll add art from both the sticker pack and the comic to a the new Digital Download Rewards pack including desktop wallpapers for laptops, tablets and phones with original art from the comic!
The A.C.E. #2 Sticker Pack. Sticker 4 is a SPOILER for the story, and all stickers come in a sealed envelope marked SPOILER WARNING! DO NOT OPEN UNTIL YOU'VE READ ISSUE #2!
The first of our awesome bar swag stretch goals, every PHYSICAL rewards tier will include 2 matchbooks from the Arcanist Bar itself. While Lark and the Arcanist Bar don't allow smoking of cigarettes on bar premises, these are also perfect for lighting candles for eldritch rites, or illuminating your way through secret passages or darkened ancient shrines!
The Arcanist Bar Matchbooks. Final design may vary. "Wild Bill" likes to doodle in these when he's not playing in the house band, so some matchbooks may feature a surprise!
If we hit this goal, every backer receiving physical rewards will now get The Armadillo Jackal short story as a physical print mini-comic! That's a whole extra book in every reward package. 
Those who backed digital only rewards tiers will get a second totally free comic from Cloudwrangler Comics as part of their digital packages. Everyone wins! 
from the cover for The Armadillo Jackal, by Jeff Rider, Keith Grassmich and Micah Myers
This very special goal will unlock a SECOND Exclusive Print from artist Blacky Shepherd! Blacky is an old friend of the Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast team, and has worked on some stellar comics like Vampirella vs ReAnimator  and Pumpkinhead with Cullen Bunn. If we hit this tier, his art print will be available in all tiers that include the Don Nguyen art print. Not only that, but at this level we'll add the Don Nguyen print to ALL physical reward tiers. Digital reward only tiers will get a digital version of BOTH images to add to their desktop and tablet wallpaper rewards. That's a ton of great original art added to every backer's rewards! This are may also feature on exclusive alternative covers of The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast #2, stay tuned after the campaign for the limited availability of those books.
Check out some of Blacky's work at his portfolio page : https://www.cqshep.com/

Read on to learn all about The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast!!!!
Featuring stunning full-color art from Davide Puppo and Anthony Lee, and written by Jeff Rider, Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast explores magical worlds the mystical peoples, flora and fauna that Lark, an expert mixologist and wizard, uses to make our world's most unique libations! It's all ages adventure and excitement that not only explores enchanted places but current themes around respectful treatment of the environment and sustainable and ethical food practices. Plus, for the aspiring home mixologists, each issue contains a unique cocktail recipe straight from Lark's grimoire that, with a simple earthbound substitution, you can make in your home bar! (Ingredients, magical or otherwise, not included.) 
Check out some sample pages below!


Jeff Rider is a writer living in San Francisco who publishes his comics in print and digitally at CloudwranglerComics.com and on ComiXology. Jeff has been telling stories since he could talk, loves collaborative art in all its forms, and believes passionately in diversity and inclusion in storytelling. In addition to Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast, he’s the writer of the period thriller Major Holmes & Captain Watson with Ismael Canales and the sci-fi adventure Gravity Matters with Sean Dillon, and many more comics to be collected in an anthology of shorts coming this year.
Davide Puppo is an illustrator living in New York and working as a freelance cartoonist. He was born in Italy and he inherited the ambition of the Renaissance masters, but he focuses more on comics rather than boring paintings! He is firmly dedicated to drawing stories that make readers smarter, open-minded, charismatic and highly imaginative. He has recently graduated and can’t wait to immerse himself in the world of graphic novels.
Anthony D Lee is a British colourist. See the "U" there? He's classy. The extra U stands for "upscale quality," which Anthony delivers with his rich, vibrant tones. Anthony has worked on books for Image, IDW, Devil's Due, and another Cloudwrangler book "Major Holmes and Captain Watson." When asked how he approaches colouring something like A.C.E, he replied "Ummm... how did you get past my security?" Anthony lives in the wilds of England with his cat. They probably have adventures. Those whacky Brits.
Cardinal Rae letters comic books, graphic novels, and other comics related things. She is the letterer for the 2019 Eisner nominated book Crowded from Image Comics and a long time Cloudwrangler Comics collaborator.
Noah Sharma is a freelance comic editor located in Brooklyn. A former intern for Papercutz comics, he's worked with us at Cloudwrangler Comics, Gnosis 33, & more. He has also written for 6 years at Weekly CBReview & Comicon.com.  
 We're stoked to present some amazing rewards for this campaign.
All New Bonus short comic!
One of the things we're MOST excited to bring everyone is the exclusive new short comic The Armadillo Jackal from Jeff Rider and Keith Grassmick with letters by Micah Myers. It's a story of magical retribution for a beloved Texas icon that refuses to be hunted for sport or profit. While Lark's mission is to protect the magical creatures and peoples of this world and beyond, some of them end up taking care of themselves. 
This exclusive new story (which may or may not be set in the A.C.E. universe...) will debut with this campaign, and every backer who gets a copy of Issue #2 will also get a DRM free digital version of this comic. Stretch goals will include PRINT versions of the mini-comic as well! Check out the preview pages here.
Armadillo Jackal cover art by Mark Alvarado
Monstrous Art print by Don Nguyen
We'll feature an exclusive art print from artist Don Nguyen (Pablo the Gorilla) with art coming soon. Don loves to draw creatures, and he's been excited about tackling ours since Jeff and Davide hung out with him at Wondercon this year!
Killer Bar Swag
Naturally, there'll be some killer swag from the magical Arcanist Bar itself. Our enamel pin features Davide's Arcanist logo design, for those who want to subtly show they know the Arcanist's magical secret. There are also some new designs to the ever popular Cloudwrangler Comics sticker collection, check out the art from Davide and Keith Grassmick below.
The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast Logo enamel pin, show the world YOU know the secret of the Arcanist Bar!
The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast Die Cut Sticker pack!
Everyone knows that comics don't get made cheaply. When I created this book, I wanted to make sure that the artists got paid for their work up front, and at a fair rate. 80% of the money raised during this campaign goes to cover costs, cash that goes straight to the talented folks who made this story so awesome to read and look at. The rest are costs associated with the physical production of the books and other rewards like enamel pins, prints, etc.
Risks? WHAT risks?!?
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
So far the risk and challenges to A.C.E. #2 are very few. The full-color artwork is 100% complete, lettering is also complete, and the only thing left is book layout and the time required for printing and shipping. The additional digital and comics perks like prints, cocktail menus and enamel pins are all currently in production.

These orders will come in the heart of what creators and printers refer to as "Con Season" so there can sometimes be print delays, but we'll be as open and transparent as humanly possible during that phase. However, we're working with a printer we trust, and this is unlikely.

This is also our third Kickstarter and is similar in scope to our previous project. Those projects funded quickly, and all digital and physical rewards were shipped within the promised deadlines, less than three months after the end of the campaign. I learned the value of making sure that the comic is almost entirely complete before launching a campaign means a really quick turnaround time and rapid rewards delivery. The few hiccups from our earlier endeavors became teachable moments for this one, so I expect even more smooth sailing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

This tier will also include all the physical and digital rewards, plus a full case of custom Arcanist glassware for you to keep!
