updates.update_userinfo: The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast is returning soon! Plus, Jeff's in more books!
updates.update_content:
Get Ready for the Return of The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast! 
The pandemic put Lark, Naomi, and Bill's magical adventures in mixology on hold for a bit, but they are returning soon, and the stakes couldn't be higher!
Last year, Lark shuttered the Arcanist Bar in SF as the world went into lockdown, for everyone's safety. Davide and I meanwhile spent a month selling copies of issue 1-2 of The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast to help benefit service industry workers affected by the pandemic, and we were grateful for all the support. Now, Issue #3 is almost ready, and we're gearing up to release it this summer. Check out a quick preview below, and follow both me and Davide on social for updates regularly!

updates.update_userinfo: Take a look at our latest project, Major Holmes & Captain Watson #1-4!
updates.update_content:
We've got two new issues of the series for you, and the whole story is available for first-timers.
First off, hello again to all our Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast backers. A lot of you probably know about this already BUT, the next two chapters of the Major Holmes & Captain Watson saga are here! You can back the campaign for issues #3 and #4 today on Kickstarter! Just follow the links here and get the final two thrilling chapters of Sheffield Holmes and Imogen Watson's first big adventure! When the villain known only as "The Scholar" wreaks vengeance on the Holmes family can the next generation of Great Detectives stop him before he pushes all of Europe into war?
Get some awesome Halloween comics for just $3!

updates.update_userinfo: Our Latest Pre-order Campaign is in its Final Hours!
updates.update_content: Last Chance to back Major Holmes & Captain Watson!

updates.update_userinfo: Check out a new project from Cloudwrangler Comics - Major Holmes & Captain Watson, live NOW!
The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast Service Industry COVID-19 Relief Sale!
updates.update_content:
So let me say this: I LOVE bars. Love them.
Because of that, and because so many bars and restaurants are closing right now due to the effects of COVID-19, I am announcing that profits from ALL SALES OF ISSUE #1 of my comic book The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast between now and April 30, 2020 will be donated to the UNITED STATES BARTENDER’S GUILD’S NATIONAL CHARITY FOUNDATION. Obviously, most of you have some form of the book already. But this is a great time to pick up an extra copy for a bartender friend, a comic book lover, or to grab some of the swag from either campaign you may have missed out on!

updates.update_userinfo: The last hurdles and delays are just about cleared!
updates.update_content:
NEW REWARDS ARE IN!
Hello Everyone! Thanks so much for your patience as I work to get your rewards to you. Things with the big cross-country move turned out to be... a bit more daunting than anticipated, but at last, the rewards are rolling in. We received the books (which is the important part, of course) and now, we have these babies in hand!

campaign.story:
The Game is a new comic book series from Charlie Stickney and Conor Hughes, the creators of the Kickstarter hit (and soon to be Scout Comic sensation) White Ash. This time around we’re joined by the amazing Tríona Farrell (West Coast Avengers, Black Panther, Crowded)  on colors as we do our spin on science fiction —think Quantum Leap, if Sam happened to jump into the body of The Highlander,  and then got dragged into a sexy noir thriller.  (Note: for those born after 1990,  sub Joss Whedon's Dollhouse for Quantum Leap and keep on reading).
It's an ambitious combo, but around here it's go big or go home if you want to have a chance of winning...  
This campaign is to raise funds to print the 32 page The Game: #1 and hopefully hit a couple of Stretch Goals along the way.  We've been fortunate enough in the past to reach  several in our other campaigns. Hopefully we can do that together again and run up your winnings on The Game.
So just what is The Game? 
That's the question about to rock Eli Tanner. It's also a question that's hard to answer without giving too much away.  And if you've read White Ash, you know half the fun of the series is finding out the next big reveal.  So in a "Break Kickstarter" kinda way, rather than tease anymore we're just going to let you dive right in and read the first 10 pages of the book.  Right now.  
Ready...
Set...
GO!  
Yep, The Game roars out of the gates with a bang (sorry, too soon?).  And we're just getting started as  Eli's day is about to get a lot more complicated.  For instance, he still hasn't met Iris...
Or Paul.
But they're coming.  So is the Sci-Fi.  (There's an epic game being played out over centuries... ) But you'll have to back our campaign to find out exactly where The Game goes next.  
Aaaaand, to make things more fun, as part of #BREAK KICKSTARTER month, we're going to PLAY A GAME with you.  (Details are somewhere on this page...).
But for now, as Paul would say, "let's get the lead out" and get on to the...
To start with, there's THE BOOK. 
One of the things we love about Kickstarter is there's no publisher dictating that to save money we need to squeeze our story into 20 pages. (Yes, Marvel, I'm looking at you).   The Game #1 clocks in at 32 pages of story, no adds or filler.
And that kind of content deserves a premium paper weight.   
Like with White Ash, we print The Game on a heavy 85 lb glossy paper stock with a 105 lb glossy cover. When you pick up one of our books, you'll feel the difference.  A heavier stock also makes the comic less likely to be damaged in transit.    
 AKA Variant Covers. And this campaign we are lucky enough to be able to offer two.
The first is our IRIS COVER VARIANT from Image/ Dynamite/ Boom Studios superstar,  Jenn St-Onge.  This will be a exclusive print run of only 250 copies.  This variant will not be sold in stores.  They only place you can get it, is right here on Kickstarter. (If we don't completely sell out,  we may bring a copy or two to conventions. But I wouldn't count on it). 
 And in honor of our second trip to SDCC, Conor whipped up an exclusive CON-ONLY 16 PAGE ASHCAN of The Game to sell at our booth and let people know about the Kickstarter.  Since we know not everyone can make it to San Diego, and we didn't want to leave our loyal backers out in the cold, we'll be "buying up" some of the copies at the Con so we can offer them directly to you. This is an incredibly limited print run. We only made 100 total copies of the SDCC variant and each one will be signed by Conor and Charlie.
If you're a collector, you're not going to want to miss out on this.  
And to commemorate The Game's launch on Kickstarter, we're giving every physical backer a 6x11 print of Conor's gorgeous "Welcome to The Game" illustration.  (All backers will receive a digital copy).    
New to what we do? Along with The Game, you can snag a copy of White Ash:Vol 1 a 200 page hardcover,  in a wraparound dust jacket by Conor Hughes and Fin Cramb, that collects all four of our over-sized issues and includes an ALL-NEW BACK UP STORY that reveals a bit of White Ash's hidden history.  You can select this in one of our bundled tiers or grab a copy as an add-on post-campaign.
And for those looking for the ultimate "The Game" collectable, get a pair of custom carved, The Game branded wooden dice and draw-string dice bag.

Want a piece of The Game or White Ash original art?
Conor Hughes will sketch you a 6x9 drawing of a character from The Game or White Ash. Choose from The Game's Eli, Kimberly, Iris or any of White Ash's extensive cast of characters.

Really play The Game and have your likeness drawn into the book. 
Under Conor's careful eye, a background character will be designed to look like you. 
(NOTE: These are probably not speaking roles, just cameos. But every now and then, if we find the right person, we'll make you an actual character in the comic. So be forewarned...)
STRETCH GOALS
STRECH GOAL #1,  How To Assemble The Game (UNLOCKED).
Every backer will receive a behind the scenes PDF.  This PDF will included concept sketches, process breakdowns showing the pages from thumbnails to finished colors, the script and more.
STRETCH GOAL #2 - An Eye on Iris. 
If we can reach $14,000 we'll be giving a textured 6x9 print of Jen St-Onge's amazing variant cover to all of our backers.  
$17,00 (to be revealed when the preceding goal is unlocked)
$20,000 (to be revealed when the preceding goal is unlocked) 
We know what it's like to open up a package and find a mangled Kickstarter comic inside. We pack our books with care that we used in making the book and the love that we have for our backers. 
Each comic is bagged, boarded front and back and sent in stay-flat packaging. Made in White Ash means everything from the content, to the mailer we use, meets our standards of quality.  
Add-Ons will be handled post campaign by our friends at Backerkit.  If you want an extra copy of the comic/ want to add a White Ash hardcover or some of our swag from previous campaigns (Trading cards, post cards, prints, etc.) you will be able to select add those items for purchase after you confirm your shipping information.  If you have a specific question about an add-on, please don't hesitate to directly message us. 
And who's us?
Meet the team.
Charlie Stickney is a writer/producer residing in Los Angeles who's been fortunate enough to work for companies including: Sony Pictures, Revolution Studios, Universal Pictures, Hulu and Scholastic Productions. He's developed and created animated shows like Cosmic Quantum Ray and Horrible Histories. While in college, Charlie interned in the editorial offices at Marvel. And were it not for a job offer in LA, the plan after graduation was to move to New York to write comic books. About two years ago Charlie brought White Ash to Kickstarter finally fulfilling that dream and hasn't looked back.  #comicsarethebest
Conor Hughes's breakout work has been the popular Kickstarter comic White Ash. Previous to that he was one of the winners of the Millarworld art contest as well as being published in the Anthology Graphic Canon and Twisted Savage Dragon Funnies. 
You can troll him on twitch at twitch.tv/conorhughes where he can often be found making comics as well as Hopewell NJ, with his amazing wife and giggle monster baby girl. 
Triona Farrell is a colourist from Dublin, Ireland. After coming out of college with a Masters in Visual Critical Theory, she began working as a colourist and has since exploded onto the nerd scene. She has worked for many companies such as MARVEL, IMAGE, DARKHORSE, DYNAMITE and VAULT as a colourist. Notable works of her include WEST COAST AVENGERS, CROWDED and TERMINATOR. She loves her cat and nerding out over everything.

BREAK KICKSTARTER!
You made it to the bottom of the page!  Congratulation, you've passed the first challenge. Hopefully it was easy, but it's going to get a little tricker from here on out.  
We need you to tweet out this campaign.  And when you do, tag either @CharlesStickney or @conorhughes on twitter. 
If you do that, we will reply to your tweet with a clue. Throughout the campaign, we will have more instructions on how to play our game.  Collect all the clues, solve the puzzle, and you will have an exclusive GAME WINNER reward added to your package when it arrives.  (If you're a digital only backer of the campaign, we'll have a digital version for you).
So good luck and may the best players win. (Yes, everyone who solves the puzzle gets a reward, we're not monsters... at least Tríona isn't).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our SIXTH Kickstarter. At this point we've worked out most of the kinks. We've hit our scheduled delivered date on our last FOUR Kickstarters (The White Ash hardcover is shipping now). 

If you look at our backer numbers and comments, you'll see a happy and growing bunch. While there are plenty of things we're not good at (just ask our wives) when it comes to comics on Kickstarter we know what it takes. To that end, we're just wrapping up the last couple of pages of art now. By the time the campaign is over, we'll be ready to send out the PDF’s to our backers and the book off to the printer. 

And sure, things can ALWAYS go wrong. But if they do, and there are any problems or delays, we'll be in touch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: More of The Game is coming soon
updates.update_content:
Happy New Year, Players!
We can't believe it's almost been a year since we posted.   Pandemic Time moves in strange ways.  We hope this update finds you and your families in a happy and safe place.  We wanted to give you a quick update on a couple of things.  First of all, the long awaited The Game #2 is in production.  As promised (and we did promise) all backers will still be receiving a PDF of that issue (for free). We're hoping to have that for you by end of May at the latest.  And shortly after that, we'll be launching a Kickstarter for anyone who would like a print copy of that issue.

updates.update_userinfo: White Ash: Chapter Five is LIVE
updates.update_content:
Hello Players,
White Ash Chapter Five is now LIVE.

Hello Players,
Shipping is now complete.  If you live in the United States and you don't receive your package in the next week, shoot us a DM.  (FYI, 99% of all shipments also have a tracking number you can see in your Backerkit account).  If you live outside the country, it may take a couple of weeks longer.  But rest assured, they have been mailed.  
We can't tell you how much we appreciate your patience and support. The feedback we've been getting on the first issue has been tremendous.  So we're going to try and get out The Game #2 quicker than we were planning.  We've bumped it up in the cue and we'll hopefully be looking at a late spring release, instead of late summer.

Hello Players,
Hope everyone is having a fabulous weekend.  I wanted to send you a couple of quick updates on our progress here.  While I'd hoped to get everything out by Friday, I was waylaid for a couple of days with two kids home sick from school.  That said, we're nearly done with the shipping, there are less than 50 packages left to go out.  The plan is to have those ready for drop off when the post office reopens on Tuesday.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping almost done and prize reveal.
updates.update_content:
Hello Players,
I just wanted to send out a quick update... or THE UPDATE that many of you were waiting for.  The comics arrived in Los Angeles yesterday and I got right to work sorting, packing, etc.  I'm happy to say today, the first 167 packages were mailed this afternoon.  While I won't be able to keep up that pace (a man should eat and sleep occasionally), I'm confident that all packages will be mailed by this upcoming Friday.

Hello Players,
Happy New Year!!!
We here at The Game HQ are very happy to finally put 2019 and all its unexpected delays behind us.  '19 fought us all the way.  But now that we've turned that page into 2020, things have started clicking into place.  We just blasted out the link to the PDF of The Game.  As long as you filled out your Backerkit survey, you should be getting (or have got gotten) a download link imminently.

Hello Players,
Sorry for the limited updates, I wanted to be able to give you some tangible benchmarks before I posted again.  So here's where the project is at.
After many kafkaesque delays, the pencils and inks are done. The book is now with Triona, who is wizard with colors.  She's promised that we'll have the final pages back shortly.  After that, it should only be a day to prep the PDFs before those are on their way to you. EXPECT a PDF by the end of next week (at the latest).

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you everyone for your patience.
updates.update_content:
Hello Players,
Thank you again for your patience.  We'd really hoped to have the book to you by now.  But the Gods of Health and Happiness have been conspiring against us.  Without getting into the details, Conor has been beset by a series of family emergencies and life events that have continued to delay him.  The good news is for the last couple of weeks, the shadow of misfortune that had been hanging over him, seems to have finally lifted. (KNOCKING ON A TREE-SIZED PEICE OF WOOD)  As such, he just has a couple of pages left in the book and should be finished in the next two weeks.  After that, it should only be a week or so for Triona to finish the colors and get the PDF off to you. In the interim, we've started distributing some of the other rewards.  If you pledged at the "Get To Know US" tier, you should receive your hardcover shortly. On the digital side, you should receive a notification for the White Ash PDF later today.

Hello Players,
Thank you so much for filling out your surveys promptly.  As of this update, 92% of you have responded.  We really appreciate the quick turnaround as it make it easier for us to plan things.  Because sometimes life doesn't go the way you think it will.
Speaking of, we're unfortunately going to be slightly delayed on delivering the PDF's.  Conor got conscripted into doing a bit more childcare than anticipated over the last month, which severely curtailed his ability to get work done.  So he's a little behind in finishing up the issue.  The bad news is the PDF won't be out till middle to the end of October.

project_data.project_name: The Game #1 Break Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"I'm a guy who loves anthologies, and what could be better than a collection that hits the nail on the head--or, in this case, punches Nazis in the face?' -- Howard Chaykin
"Tough to argue with the sentiment! A good read full of passion and craft." -- Mark Waid (about Vol. 1)

WHO WOULDN'T PUNCH A NAZI ... AGAIN?
Everybody knows who the Nazis are. More so, if you saw a Nazi, you would want to punch that Nazi right across his face. ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS is the next best thing to actually punching a Nazi.
This 66-page anthology addresses the Nazi-like racism that has been growing in America. The creators of Always Punch Nazis focus on the rising issues in America and how to handle bigots who want to oppress the country's citizens. This satirical anthology tells stories inspired by an evil that, although defeated during WWII, continues to fester today. You will learn lots of effective ways to deal with a Nazi, what happens when super-heroes fight for what they believe, how a certain comic book creator handled the Nazis when they knocked on his door (which you can preview below), and many more fun tales about standing up for what is right.

Always Punch Nazis Volume 2 Cover by Chuck Wojtkiewicz

WHY DID WE RETURN?
The first volume of Always Punch Nazis garnered an incredible amount of attention. Word spread about Pilot Studios' mission to share stories and inspire people to battle against racism. Creators from various mediums approached the studio about contributing to the cause. That was the moment the creators realized we needed to continue producing Always Punch Nazis. Thus, Volume Two was born. 

"What's Better Than Punching a Nazi?" story included in APN Volume 2

OUR MISSION 
These anthologies are not about earning money. They are about spreading the word and educating people about racism, which continues to grow in our country. With a small goal, Pilot Studios can guarantee that you will receive the anthology that you so eagerly support. That bodes the question ...
WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO? 
Every Always Punch Nazis creator donated his or her time and talent to this book in exchange for copies of the book. The reward tiers are priced to cover the cost of printing and shipping the books, both to backers as well as over thirty contributors. The price also covers the Kickstarter fees. Any extra money raised will go to the production of Always Punch Nazis Volume 3. 
CREATORS 
Cover Art and Colors by Chuck Wojtkiewicz
Back Cover Art by Hilary Barta and Colors by Jim Nelson
Front Cover/Back Cover/IFC Design by Chas Pangburn!
APN Logo by Kenneth Matthew
Created by Silas Dixon and Ben Ferrari

MISSED OUT ON VOLUME ONE???
Hey, that's not a big deal. Every tier of Always Punch Nazis Volume 2 comes with a PDF of Volume 1. If you're like us and prefer a physical copy of the anthology, we got you covered. Pick up one of the APN Volume 2 tiers that contains a physical copy of Volume 1. Every physical backer will also receive an Always Punch Nazis sticker. If we manage to surpass the first volumes total of $5,646 each physical backer will receive a Pilot Studios sticker as an additional thank you. If we surpass $6,000 we'll produce a BRAND NEW APN print for everyone.
WHAT IS ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS 2 ALL ABOUT? Read on for one of the many stories included in this anthology.
"A Marvelous Act"
WRITTEN by CW Cooke 
ART by Kevin Norman 
COLORS by Christopher Sotomayor 
LETTERS by Micah Myers

Pilot Studios prides itself on publishing a wide variety of stories in their Always Punch Nazis anthologies. Below are a few more examples of the types of stories you will find in the second installment.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The entire Always Punch Nazis Volume 2 anthology is complete. This minimizes the risk to the consumer. We are currently making final changes to the book in order to ensure this anthology meets Pilot Studios' high standards. Once the Kickstarter is complete, we will place the order. From there, it's in the printer's hands. 

Unfortunately, there is always a little risk. Since the funding is mainly going to the printing costs of the book, there may be a slight delay due to certain uncontrollable circumstances from the printer. Ben will keep you updated on the this once the campaign ends. This will allow you to know exactly where the books are and when orders ship from Pilot Studios to you.

Sometimes books can be damaged in transit to your house. This is another uncontrollable risk that we at Pilot Studios do our best to eliminate. In the event that your book arrives damaged, we will happily send you a brand new copy.

That's it. The book is complete and ready to go, eliminating many of those production risks that occur when you're supporting comics on Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Pilot Studios Present - The Carriers #1: The Croc King
updates.update_content:
Hey guys, Jay Huwer here for Pilot Studios.
I wanted to give you an update on Pilot Studios's newest Kickstarter, THE CARRIERS 1 - THE CROC KING. 
The Carriers is Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles with a Muppet Babies twist told through the eyes of CARRIER PIGEONS?!?!?!
This book is the first of five that make up season 1 of the series. In The Croc King, four weaponized pigeons search for a mysterious foe who is pulling New York City's many strings from the sewers below.Check out the first of five connecting covers by Elias Martin. I also included an image of the five connected covers for you to enjoy. If you're interested in learning more, click the link below.

We're LIVE.
http://kck.st/2DatoRu

Ben

On July 4th, we're launching Always Punch Nazis Vol 3!
We've been able to surpass the quality of the first collection of stories while maintaining the quality of the excellent second book, so this is not an issue of a quality drop as the series progresses, happy to report!
Here's the cover:

Hey!
You thought you were just packing an anthology about punching nazis, right?! I pretty much thought that's what we were making. Little did I know the impact from this series of books would be far reaching and change the lives of so many people and possibly, change the course of an entire industry.
Making APN has set off a chain of events that has led to the first tech company unionizing, something extremely important to me as a union-man of sixteen years in the electrical industry. Kickstarter, as of today, is a union, called Kickstarter United!

Good evening Always Punch Nazis backers. Jay Huwer here with a huge announcement from Pilot Studios.
It's been a little while since APN wrapped, but we at Pilot Studios not stopped working on the next book. APN 3 is in production. That Kickstarter is looking like a summer launch. In the meantime, Pilot Studios just launched the next huge adventure ... ZION WARS.
This book is a major crossover pitting the entire Pilot Studios universe against a foe too big for one of them to handle. Zion Wars tells the story of a ragtag group of misfits that must act fast to save the heroic son of Hitler before a demon claims his soul. This team is not friends and they don't like each other much. In fact, the only thing they have in common; they're all heroes.

What you're looking at is the final packages getting wrapped up and sent out in today's mail! We're done! Thanks again. It's a long slog to send out 150+ packages, but worth every second. I'd love to hear thoughts on the book either here, on FB or to my email at benferrari44@gmail.com.

3/4 of the books have shipped! I'd LOVE to hear reactions, good or bad and how it compares to Vol 1! I personally think Vol 2 is an improvement on the first, but that's just me!
Find me on Facebook (Ben Ferrari) and tag me with pictures and thoughts, please! I'm on Twitter and Instagram, but don't EVER look at them... so take your chances there.
Anyway, I hope you're digging the book if it's arrived!
Yup, it's now THAT time! You'll start seeing books arrive in the mail in the next few days and weeks! The book looks great, super proud of this volume! It's bigger AND better than volume one!

The bad news is I've run into a problem with my final PDF for the printer. I anticipate it will take me a couple days to rebuild the file, which, believe me, I am sorry about. Delays the book a bit, as well as takes me away from all of my other projects. Sorry about this.
The good news is... here are the PDFs! Below are Always Punch Nazis Vol 1 and Vol 2!
Don't read them if you'd rather wait til the print versions arrive... obviously.

project_data.project_name: Always Punch Nazis Vol. 2

campaign.story:
Back by popular demand!
1988. Friday night. A meteorite falls down on the waters of a river in the dockland of a big city, bringing a dangerous alien parasite inside. 
Preview!
Struggling to survive in an unknown and hostile environment, the sneaky visitor will take control of an eccentric tramp called Luis, a former quantum physics professor who left all behind and went off to live in  the streets after the death of his family.   
More previews!
The tramp, known as Professor Apocalypse, will become the perfect vessel to give the despicable guest from outer space both power and body.    
More previews!
Disguised in Luis’ body while gestating inside him, it’ll go around the  dark streets of slums, where tramps and other social outcasts dwell, chasing its new victims to carry out its sinister plan of survival.   
Page 11 & 12
The book is not just an exciting story but much much more! In the back of each graphic novel here on the Kickstarter, there will be a good amount of extras and back matter in the form of behind the scenes looks at early concepts, penciled pages from Sebastian, variant covers, and more!  
Page 13
Also available in the campaign is your option to pick from multiple prints! 
Print options A & B
Print options C & D
The soundtrack is a great fusion of 80s electronic and modern synthwave/darkwave. Currently comprised of three artists and 40+ minutes of music! The music is 100% inspired by John Carpenter and his incredible soundtracks!
The cassette soundtrack!
These shirts are available in sizes up to 2XL! 
T-Shirt Design 1
T-Shirt Design 2
There are two separate T-Shirt designs to choose from. Can be chosen once the campaign ends through our payment processor. 
Each T-Shirt design is available in black and other colors upon request. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions! 
A behind the scenes look!
The Gatherer is highlighted by its strong film influence and the almost exclusively visual narrative resource used to carry out the story. The intention is to pay tribute to the cult genre movies of the eighties both from the graphics and scripting standpoints. Through the pages, clear references to the aesthetics and narrative work of John Carpenter, David  Cronenberg, Andrzej Zulawski, and Stanley Kubrick are found. 
The Gatherer is targeted at a young adult audience (18-45 years old) who loves horror and science fiction, mostly horror and sci-fi films from the late seventies and the eighties. Some films which clearly define the comic’s style are Prince of Darkness (Carpenter, 1987), The Thing (Carpenter, 1982), Invasion of the Body Snatchers (Kaufman, 1978), Possession (Zulawski, 1981), The Fly (Cronenberg, 1986), Scanners (Cronenberg, 1981) and The Lords of Salem (Zombie, 2012). 
Preview!
STORY: Emilia Pedrazzoli & Emiliano Pinto
The Firstborns, Official selection Festival Sitges 2016.
Watch their short film here! 
ART: Sebastián Cabrol 
Hungry Ghosts #3, Dark Horse (2018) 
Falcon #6, Marvel Comics (2017)
Caliban, Avatar Press (2015). 
COLOR & LETTERING: Omar Estévez
Death Of Love, Image Comics (2018)
Lil Charlie, John Bivens, Heavy Metal Magazine #284
Mythopia, Grant Morrison, Heavy Metal Magazine #285     
Our payment processor!
Based  on past experience and our research with some of Kickstarters top  campaign creators, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter  concludes based on what the exact cost will be to ship your tier. Each  tier is unique as is each backers needs so once we get with you after  the campaign ends, we'll give you a short survey and funds will be  collected by our pledge manager. This process is being done via the  well-known platform, BackerKit! This platform also enables the backer to  easily attach any add-ons they might need and provides an easy  communication avenue.
If you have questions about this or if you would like us to provide  you with an estimated cost of shipping to your address based on live  shipping rates, don't hesitate to contact us via the message button  above!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Behemoth has been a part of 8 successful campaigns and have solely run and distributed 6 successful campaigns so far. We go above and beyond on the package as much as possible while keeping shipping costs as low as we can. We've taken care of backers as situations have arrived on their end and we've made it a staple of ours to hit the estimated shipping date. You can expect that when you buy something from Behemoth that you're getting a product that a ton of care and thought went into.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Last of the shipping is out the door!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
I just wanted to give a quick update! We have already shipped out 75% of all orders.  I have also noticed that a lot of packages are bouncing around on tracking. It seems like shipping is taking a lot longer than normal, unfortunately. We still have a few backers that have not been shipped out yet, we need a few more cassettes made for these tiers. They are coming out really awesome.

Hey everyone! Once again sorry for the delay we wanted to confirm a few things before the update, we have added 12 more pages to the graphic novel! We want to make sure we deliver a great piece of work into every backer's hands. As of this moment, all pages have been inked, and the color is almost complete. We have been told the book should be ready to send to the printer within one to two weeks.
Also here a few more work in progress pictures, until the next update!

updates.update_userinfo: Pictures of physical books (printer shipping to us Monday 3/9)
updates.update_content: Hey everyone! Sorry for the delay as I know we stated September 12th everything would be completed on the art side with the book. We didn't receive a response to our email with the creative team until September 15th. The artist, Seba was hit with an unfortunate family emergency and that set back his art deadline until October 5th. We have received updates regarding progress with penciled pages and more so we are confident that he will hit that deadline as we're nearing the end of completed pages and his family emergency has cleared up thankfully. We're ensuring that this will be the final time the deadline is set back as we're hearing your concerns. A couple penciled pages have been added below. I'll have another update October 5th.

Per request, here's another update! The BackerKit store is almost finished. This is where you'll be able to get your surveys and finalize your order. Also update your address or add on anything you'd like. This should launch in conjunction with Seba's art deadline for all of the pages. That's been moved back a few times but we're absolutely confident Seba and crew will have everything ready September 12th, 2019. That's when you'll see another small update from us confirming the pages have been completed. Then we'll finalize the pages and have them to sent to the printer. Lots of work going forward but we're so close to the finished line. Very very very excited for you guys to see the finished pages. The book is turning out incredible. I'll add pages minus the color/lettering from here on so that the story can't be given away.

campaign.story:
ABOUT
96 people are killed with guns in the US every day. We know some of the things we should be doing to prevent this, but many solutions are still to be found, because politicians and lobbyists block research into gun violence. Organizations like the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence and the Community Justice Reform Coalition are working to change that, and you can help.
SHOTS FIRED is a comics anthology that will raise funds for the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence and the Community Justice Reform Coalition to help end gun violence in America. This Kickstarter campaign will pay for printing and shipping of the books themselves. Once printed, all proceeds from additional book sales will go directly to the CSGV and CJRC.
SHOTS FIRED is being published by Comicker Press. With this 28-day campaign, we've capped the size of the book to 168 pages, and are offering a Kickstarter Exclusive limited-edition hardcover, which won’t be made available after the campaign.
"5-4-3-2-1" sample by Kelly Thompson & David Lafuente
REWARDS
SHOTS FIRED is available in three formats: Digital, Trade Paperback, and Kickstarter Exclusive Hardcover, with CSGV Limited Edition and Retailer tiers available as well.
Comicker Press is also offering its previous trade paperback books in the Complete Comicker Collection tier and as Add-Ons. These include THE CASEBOOK OF RABBIT BLACK: Volume 1 by Kate Sherron, LOST ANGELS: Volume 1: Paradise High by David Accampo & Chris Anderson, CHIMERA: Book 1: The Righteous & The Lost by Tyler Ellis, and WAKING LIFE: Book 1: Pleasant Places by Ben Humeniuk (who is also drawing a comic in SHOTS FIRED).
See below for how Add-Ons work and pricing (including ordering additional copies of SHOTS FIRED).
CREATORS
The talent donating their time to SHOTS FIRED include:
 Emma Beeby (Judge Dredd, Mata Hari)

 crank! (Rick and Morty, Curse Words, Grumble)

 Alex Segura (Archie Meets Ramones, Down the Darkest Street)
 Scott Snyder (Batman, Justice League, American Vampire)
Lilah Sturges (Lumberjanes: The Infernal Compass, Lazarus: Risen, Jack of Fables)
 Hannibal Tabu (Scoundrel, Waso: Gathering Wind, Ricanstruction)
 Dalibor Talajic (Deadpool, Old Man Logan)
 Kelly Thompson (Captain Marvel, Jessica Jones, Sabrina the Teenage Witch)
 Anne Timmons (GoGirl!, Graphic Classics)
 Paul Tobin (Colder, The Witcher, Made Men)
 Matt Triano (Grimm Fairy Tales, The Devilers)
 Fred Van Lente (Archer and Armstrong, Action Presidents, Comic Book Comics)
 Shannon Wheeler (Too Much Coffee Man, Sh*t My President Says: The Illustrated Tweets of Donald J. Trump)
 Eva Widermann (Star Wars Rebels)
 Kelly Williams (Creepy, Metaphase)
 Doselle Young (Star Trek, The Authority, Creepy Comics)
And more!
The book is being edited by Dark Horse alumnus Brendan Wright.
"Guns and Boys" sample by Neil Kleid, Huseyin Ozkan, Josh Jensen, and Zakk Saam
“We simply couldn’t just watch anymore as our fellow human beings are senselessly killed on a daily basis,” said Brendan Wright, editor of SHOTS FIRED. “96 people per day. That would make every single day the worst mass shooting in the US in modern times—by 38 people. To put that into another perspective, as of June 10th the Washington Post has counted 1165 people killed in mass shootings in the US since 1966. So between suicides, accidents, crime, law enforcement, and other causes, there are more people killed with guns in two weeks in the US than in all the mass shootings over the last fifty years combined.”
“Consistently, over 90% of Americans believe in common sense gun laws such as background checks,” Wright said. “But the gun lobby, the NRA, and Mitch McConnell have kept them from passing. Mitch McConnell hasn’t allowed a vote in the Senate on gun control since 2015. That’s over 140,000 people who have died by gunfire in the U.S. under McConnell’s watch. That’s the equivalent of the entire population of Dayton, Ohio.”
"Notes from the Other Side" sample by Trina Robbins, Anne Timmons, and crank!
Acting as a companion to volumes that have raised money for victim funds, SHOTS FIRED focuses on the prevalence of gun violence in everyday life in the United States and supports advocacy groups working with communities to reduce gun violence, seek criminal justice reform, and enact common-sense regulations.  With these goals in mind, Comicker Press has partnered with the Community Justice Reform Coalition, a community-based coalition that sponsors intervention programs to prevent violence in communities of color, and the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence, a data-driven advocacy group focused on passing legislation at the state level.   
"Dung Control" sample by Roger Langridge
"It’s truly an epidemic facing this nation, and it especially and disproportionately impacts communities of color," said Amber Goodwin, Executive Director of CJRC. “Once again, we want to thank everyone for their support to make gun violence rare and abnormal,” said Chelsea White, Director of Development and Events at CSGV.
We are using backerkit and comiXology for our physical and digital fulfillment. 

ADD-ONS:
How do you add an Add-On? Simply click the "Manage Your Pledge" button, then add in the amount of the Add-On you want to add to your pledge. For example, say you backed for an SHOTS FIRED trade paperback edition, but want a CHIMERA trade paperback as well. Simply add $20 to your Pledge, and once we're funded, we'll ask you which Add-On you wanted in a Survey. It's that easy! We're using BackerKit as we did with our previous Kickstarters, to make it even easier! (First additional book ships free, add $2 for each additional book beyond that.)
SHOTS FIRED Trade Paperback - $20
THE CASEBOOK OF RABBIT BLACK Trade Paperback - $15
CHIMERA Trade Paperback - $20
LOST ANGELS Trade Paperback - $20
WAKING LIFE Trade Paperback - $15
 COMICS COMICS Hardcover - $25
 COMICS COMICS SIGNED Hardcover (Patton Oswalt, Jackie Kashian, Sara Benincasa) - $40
SHIPPING
Due to ongoing increases in shipping costs, we're shipping books via USPS Media Mail domestically.  For international shipping, costs have risen exponentially to the point that we can't offer to include it as part of the campaign.  If you're outside the US, your best option is to use a domestic/international shipping service like Shipito - we haven't used them ourselves, so we can't vouch for them.
COST BREAKDOWN
Since all proceeds after the books are printed are going to charity, we've built in a slightly larger contingency than we normally would, to cover any unexpected expenses.  If unused, this contingency will be used to print more books.
ABOUT THE ORGANIZATIONS
CSGV 
The Coalition Stop Gun Violence (CSGV) develops and advocates for evidence-based solutions to reduce gun injury and death in all its forms. Our role is to formulate bold new ideas, assume the risks of innovation, and lead by example so that other groups can learn from and adopt our successful tactics. In recent years, we have: 
Organized more than 20 of the nation’s leading mental health and public health professionals to make evidence-based recommendations to address the difficult issue of guns and mental health. In December 2013, under the name “Consortium for Risk-Based Firearm Policy,” this group of experts issued detailed policy recommendations for both state and federal lawmakers. The Consortium has met four times and will meet for a fifth time in 2019. 
In 2014, with CSGV’s assistance, California legislators passed one of the Consortium’s recommendations, the Gun Violence Restraining Order (GVRO) policy. Since then, CSGV has led the implementation process for the GVRO, which went into effect on January 1, 2016. To this end, we worked with the California Judicial Council to develop the forms and processes necessary to initiate a GVRO, held a press conference about the GVRO’s implementation, hosted a pro bono attorney training in California, and launched a campaign to inform the public about how to access a GVRO. 
Worked with stakeholders and advocates in 11 states and the District of Columbia to pass Extreme Risk Laws, which are modeled after the GVRO. 
Created fact sheets, presentations, and other materials to make Extreme Risk Law policy recommendations accessible to the general public. These materials helped us educate and activate a network of stakeholders and grassroots supporters to advocate for innovative policies. 
CJRC 
The Community Justice Reform Coalition, a collective action fund of Tides Foundation, addresses the intersection of gun violence prevention and criminal justice reform in urban communities of color. 
COMICKER LLC
Comicker LLC was founded by Saori Adams and Sean E. Williams, and launched in 2015 with its Comicker Digital imprint. Comicker LLC is designed to bring diverse creator-owned comics series to readers any way they want them (as ad-supported webcomics, collected as digital issues, and in print as trade paperbacks), and to give creators the flexibility to tell their stories exactly how they want to. In 2016, Comicker LLC began bringing its digital series to print as trade paperbacks via its Comicker Press imprint. 
Diversity Focused. Digital First. ComickerPress.com
NOTE: List of creators involved and sample art may not be final, and may be subject to change.

updates.update_content:
Hi All,
The hits behind the scenes have unfortunately kept coming this year, but we have some good news for you all:
We've begun finalizing the book in preparation for sending it to the printer!
We had one story we weren't able to find an artist for, but the writer has agreed to include the story in script form. We're excited to be able to still include it in the book, and to accelerate the final phase of getting this project into your hands.

Quick update: We're incredibly excited to announce that Sheilah Villari has come on board to edit SHOTS FIRED in our home stretch!

Many of you know her, but for those who don't, Sheilah has edited some of my favorite comics, and was the Managing Editor of Geek.com for a number of years.

Hi Everyone,
We hope this update finds you safe and healthy! It's been way too long, and we appreciate your patience. The world has turned upside down since our last update, so we wanted to get you up to speed. 
We’ve had several setbacks that have slowed us down, but we have continued slowly making progress, and we wanted to share the final cover with you all:

Hi All,
We've got a big update forthcoming, but we've had a couple people messaging asking for info, so we thought we'd say something in the meantime:
1) No word on if our printer has been affected by the coronavirus. We'll let you know as soon as we know.

updates.update_userinfo: SHOTS FIRED and Brendan Wright Update
updates.update_content:
Hi All,
We've all been hard at work at putting this book together - from the charities who are benefiting from it, to the creators making the stories, to us behind the scenes; it's been a busy few months! Some folks have dropped out and some folks have come on board (which is the nature of an anthology like this), and we're very excited with the book that's coming together! We've got all the stories nailed down finally, bringing the book in at 152 pages, and are waiting for the last of the art to come in before we finish putting it together and sending it to the printer.  In the meantime, here are some sneak peeks that we wanted to share with you!

Hi All,
Thank you again for all your support!  How is it fall already???
Wanted to shoot you a quick update.  We're in the process of finalizing the book, and crunching the numbers on how these new tariffs are going to affect things (we should be okay).

campaign.story:
About the Story
Acceptable Losses is a one-and-done, self-contained 32 page comic detailing the last official mission of the USA's sole superhuman military operative, the US Eagle. On this fateful mission, Eagle finds himself at the mercy of enemies in the field and callous and careless superiors at home. 
After the mission goes spectacularly wrong, we see the greedy and power-hungry Senator that caused the devastating failure face a horrifying attack on US soil. An act of revenge? But by whom?
Cover by Danny Flores and Moose Baumann
Acceptable Losses tells a dark, poignant and action-packed superhero revenge fantasy, focusing on grim action and looking at the cycle of violence in the war on terror and those fighting it on both sides. Think Black Hawk Down meets Captain America, with a touch of John Wick meets Eye in the Sky. 
About the Cast
The US Eagle a.k.a. Corporal Sam Tyler is a good soldier. Always following orders, he believes in what the ideals of America mean and that they have a duty to help the rest of the world. Being the only subject of the US's controversial human augmentation program, Tyler gained enhanced strength, speed and stamina from the process, and became a symbol of America's might in the world.  
US Eagle Pin-Up by Carlos Pedro
 Private Deshawn Krinsky is the US Eagle's eyes in the sky and handler from home base. A young but incredibly bright officer, Private Krinsky has become an indispensable aid to US Eagle and his missions for their country. Idealistic and loyal, Krinsky has become a good friend to the US Eagle as well as his ally. 
Kinsky Character Sketches by Danny Flores
Senator Robert McKeen is a man in his mid-50s who has never seen a single day of active duty in his life. And yet he has found himself the political liaison to the US Eagle Program. A life-long politician and spokesman, there has rarely been a motion he couldn't schmooze and massage it's way through obstacles. A man of words and who values others opinions of him and the image of power above all else, McKeen can be quite brutal in his single-minded focus on his goals. 
McKeen & Forley Character Sketches by Danny Flores
General Michael Forley has been working ops all his adult life. A proud, gruff military man to the bone, Forley is in charge of the US Eagle Program and is a no-nonsense leader. A stickler of protocol and chain of command, Forley nevertheless holds his own strong opinions on the missions they run.
About the Campaign
We're looking to run a simple, straight-forward campaign with the majority of funds raised going to pay the production team for art, colours and letters, thus keeping costs down by being a digital first comic. The last time we tried this campaign we didn't get to the amount needed for a full print release but would have raised enough for digital. We still really want to tell and share this story, so we're focusing on a digital comic release to keep required costs down. 
However, should we far exceed the goal amount by a margin that would allow for a print release too, we would love to do that as well. 
For now, however, the main focus is getting this book made and produced. Almost all the campaign total goes straight to the art team, with a margin kept for posting items that require postage too. 
About the Creators
Joe Glass is the writer of Acceptable Losses. The creator and writer of The Pride and The Pride Adventures, that has been part of numerous very successful Kickstarters. This is Joe's first solo written, self-published comic that is not connected to The Pride and shows a whole new side of his writing. 
Danny Flores is an up-and-coming illustrator in the field of comics. Having only illustrated a few short stories here and there, this will be his first book published. He hopes to one day enjoy illustrating comics as a full time job. 
Interior page by Danny Flores and Moose Baumann
Moose Baumann is a colourist who has worked on a large number of titles, including DC's Green Lantern, Seven Soldiers of Victory, and Nightwing, and many more. 
Michael Stock is a letterer and long-time collaborator with Joe Glass. Michael has lettered numerous comics across the UK independent scene including The Pride, The Kill Screen, Samurai Slasher and much more. 
 Why Acceptable Losses? 
There's a reason I want to make Acceptable Losses. 
For me, it's about showing what I can do outside of The Pride. The Pride is an incredibly well received series, and I could not be prouder of it, but it is very much just one of the stories I have in me. Acceptable Losses is a chance for me to show off something completely different and even unexpected from me, that I think can be enjoyed both by fans of my existing work and also by people who've never read anything by me before. It was also a chance to work with the amazing Danny Flores and Moose Baumann, and my long-time collaborator Michael Stock once again.
For Danny, this is his first full comic to get produced, so it will be a great chance to show off his work too. I'm very excited for people to see what we can put together. 
Finally, it's a story about the consequences of our actions, as much in our world as in this fictional one. It's a story about where exactly an 'eye for an eye' gets us, and how rushing in headlong to get the job done without thinking through all of the angles can result in disaster. It's about seeing the shades of grey in even the most black and white of situations, and our responsibility for whatever we decide to do with that information.
But most of all, Acceptable Losses is about an entertaining, superhero revenge thriller with depth.
Interiors by Danny Flores
 About The Project
Since the last time we ran the campaign, work has continued slowly, while we decided when to re-approach this. The pages are almost all drawn, colours have begun too. With the backing financially that Kickstarter can provide, we'd be able to put full focus on the issue and get it finished and out quickly. We have allowed time in shipping estimates in case anything comes up, but generally should be able to turn the book around quickly. 
We're all very excited and proud of this project, so really look forward to bringing it out to you all. With your support we can make this happen, so thank you so much in advance for your help.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Generally, delivery dates are an estimate as sometimes work takes longer to complete, however we will endeavour to stick to the planned completion and delivery dates.

As ultimately we're shipping any physical items ourselves, please bare that in mind as items that require shipping might be later than estimated depending how many backers we wind up having to ship to. As such, making sure the address you provide after the campaign ends is valid for a while after the campaign is important.

Postage tends to often be the major trip up in Kickstarter campaigns, and it has certainly caught me out before. As such, we are focusing on making this a digital release first. If the campaign proves very successful, we could possibly add a print component, but to begin with and to ensure we can finish making the comic and sharing this story with you all, we're focusing on digital and keeping costs down.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Now About Those STRETCH GOALS…
Unfortunately, I will have very limited internet access on the last day of the IMPOSSIBLE JONES Kickstarter since I'll be flying to Spain for the Metropoli Gijon Comic Convention! I will check in when I can, but here's the game plan:
You've already added coolness to our Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition of IMPOSSIBLE JONES! Thank You!
Endsheets— like bedsheets— can seem boring, but they're that extra touch that really brings everything together.
Now this is swanky! And an Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition deserves no less!
Given Imp's uncanny ability to alter her appearance, Paper Dolls are a natural! Not only will she have different outfits (since she can shape-shift her uniform, too) but different arms, extra arms, etc. A quick and easy way to explain Imp's powers to people you meet at cocktail parties.
$50,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
Probably the IMPOSSIBLE JONES logo. But maybe a nice shot of IMP herself. Tell you what— this gets unlocked, you can vote on what the pin will look like!
$51,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
How are you going to tell the good guys from the bad— especially in IMP's world— without Trading cards?!
$52,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
I would love, love, love to do this. We just have to be able to pay for the privilege.
You worked hard getting the word out about IMPOSSIBLE JONES— and succeeded by sharing, posting, and re-tweeting images like this:
Thanks to several successful re-tweet campaigns every Backer will get IMPOSSIBLE JONES DIGITAL WALLPAPERS and this special KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE IMPOSSIBLE JONES STICKER (PDF for Digital Backers; delivered upon successful completion of the campaign, of course):
NOT TO MENTION (Since we are funded, after all):
We now return to the IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY Kickstarter, already in progress…
A thief gets powers, is mistaken for a superhero— and runs with it. Why not? Comes with some great perks. Of course, she has no intention of reforming— with these powers? Are you kidding?!— it's just sometimes there's no better place to hide than in plain sight.
IMPOSSIBLE, you say?
EXACTLY!
Imagine Harley Quinn meets Plastic Man in the Marvel Universe with a little Dick Tracy thrown in. Kind of. 
That's IMPOSSIBLE JONES! 
IMP in her native habitat.
I first thought of IMPOSSIBLE JONES as a monthly comic— but the first "issue" became 27 epic pages, so now it's a 132-page (or more!) Graphic Novel collecting what would have been the first 5 "issues" of her comic— the irrepressible Imp's entire Origin Story!
And IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY isn't just any graphic novel, but an Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition Graphic Novel! 
Working design only. But still— pretty cool!
HARDCOVER!
 OVERSIZED! (7.5x11 inches!)
 110 PAGES OF STORY! (if not more!)
Introduction by the impossibly generous and talented GAIL SIMONE! 
 PIN-UPS by AMANDA CONNER! HOWARD CHAYKIN! TOM GRUMMETT! PETE WOODS! And others!
 BEHIND-THE-SCENES sketches and stories!
PLUS (if the Stretch Goal Gods smile on us):
 SPOT GLOSS on the cover!
FULL-COLOR ENDSHEETS!
SWANKY RIBBON BOOKMARK!
Of course, IMPOSSIBLE JONES is a new character. You know nothing about her. Let's fix that…
A SHORT TIME LATER…
Want to see the MISSING PAGES from this mini-adventure? Support this project and you get the whole story in UPDATE #1— for Backers only!
The amusing-if-somewhat-morally-ambiguous adventures of IMPOSSIBLE JONES are brought to you by:
Karl loves his job far more than he has any right to. He has written, inked, and occasionally penciled: Superman, Superboy, Harley Quinn, Spider-man, Suicide Squad, Fantastic Four, Captain America and many others— although he has an inexplicable fondness for obscure characters no one else remembers. His current obsessions are his creator-owned comics with Tom Grummett— SECTION ZERO— and David Hahn— IMPOSSIBLE JONES (you may have heard of her)! Waiting in the wings: SAINT MAYHEM! Karl lives in Portland, Oregon with his wonderful wife Myrna, their energetic son Isaac, and cute-as-a-bug daughter Eliza. He really can’t complain about much.
David's work is decidedly contemporary and reflects his eye for crisp detail. He has illustrated Marvel's Spider-man Loves Mary Jane, and Marvel Adventures: The Fantastic Four, DC's Batman ’66 Meets Wonder Woman ’77, and Vertigo's Bite Club, Fables, and Lucifer, as well as The Batman Handbook. David was nominated for both an Eisner Award and an Ignatz Award for his creator-owned comic series Private Beach, published by Slave Labor Graphics. An avid … who loves video games, David has somehow found himself living in bear and cougar country in the backwoods of western Montana.
AIDING AND ABETTING THESE TWO: 
Tony Avina— an American comic book colorist. Born and raised in the South Bay area of Los Angeles, he began his career working for Wildstorm Production in 2001. Since then he’s worked for DC Comics, Marvel, Image, Dark Horse and Dynamite Entertainment. Some of his notable projects are The Boys, Happy, Sleeper, Richard Dragon, Suicide Squad: Hell to Pay and Batman ‘66 Meets the Green Hornet.
ALSO: The crafty COMICRAFT gang on letters.  
No, the book is not done.
The first chapter/issue is totally complete. The second chapter/issue only has letters, colors and some inks left to finish. There are still three more chapters/issues to produce.
With your support, David and I are confident we can finish that over the next handful of months.
But to make the wait a little easier, we do have some lovely Reward Levels to offer you…
YOU GIVE. WE GIVE BACK. ONLY FAIR.
I will hand-deliver these to any shop within *REASONABLE* driving distance of Portland, Oregon. So for those lucky ducks: NO POSTAGE!
NOTE: Both books will be shipped together, once IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY has been printed.
NOTE: All three books will be shipped together, once IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY and SECTION ZERO 1959 have been printed.

YOU IN THE SPOTLIGHT!
AWESOME ART OPPORTUNITIES!

Here's where things get fun(ner). Stretch Goals will alternate between something that makes the book better— spot gloss on cover, full color endsheets, etc.— and something for everyone who has pledged at THE GOODS— BUT BETTER! level or above— trading cards, stickers, cloisonne pins, etc.
So the more money raised, the more cool stuff you get— at no extra cost to you! (As long as you've pledged at THE GOODS— BUT BETTER! level or above.)
It is impossible to show how much coolness spot gloss adds to a book's cover. For an Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition, it's a gotta-have.
Given Imp's uncanny ability to alter her appearance, Paper Dolls are a natural! Not only will she have different outfits (since she can shape-shift her uniform, too) but different arms, extra arms, etc. A quick and easy way to explain Imp's powers to people you meet at cocktail parties.
$50,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
$51,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
$52,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
NOTE: Until actually unlocked, all Stretch Goals may be changed or modified as new, cooler ideas come to me!
If you followed my SECTION ZERO campaigns, you know I vowed to get a tattoo to commemorate every successful Kickstarter I run. I stand by that vow! I now have two SECTION ZERO tatts, and would love— LOVE!— to add one for IMPOSSIBLE JONES.
Only YOU can make that possible. Only YOU can get me to decorate (or desecrate, depending on your view) my body— by getting IMPOSSIBLE JONES funded! Whatever ends up on my arm (or leg) is in your hands! (So to speak.)
First: DON'T PANIC!
Approximate postage costs will be:
UNITED STATES: $8
CANADA: $15
THE REST OF THE WORLD: $25
Fingers crossed, those numbers won't change much.
Postage will be charged after the campaign ends, when the survey goes out and we know exactly how much it will cost.
This way we don't end up with an under-estimated postal bill that cripples us, and you don't end up with an over-inflated postage charge based on assumptions and guesses.
Our surveys will be handled by BACKERKIT, who has done this many, many times before. The process is simple, safe, and painless. You will be glad we're doing it this way. Trust us.
Truly and sincerely, I am constantly amazed and humbled by the power of people like you to make, well, the impossible possible. Making comics— and specifically making creator-owned comics like IMPOSSIBLE JONES— is what I want to do most in the world, but I can't do it without you. It doesn't even exist without you, without your support and belief. Thank you for that, and so much more.
Thank you for BELIEVING IN IMPOSSIBLE.
 IMPOSSIBLE JONES and related characters © TM 2019 Karl Kesel & David Hahn
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've run three Kickstarters— two of them very successful. I learn from my mistakes, and try to make each campaign better and run more smoothly than the last one. I have every reason to believe IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY will be my best-run and most quickly fulfilled Kickstarter yet.

That said: stuff happens. And if/when something does happen, I will let you know details and solutions as quickly as possible. I want this book done and in your hands— without sacrificing quality, of course— as much as you do. With my persistence and your patience (if needed), that's exactly what will happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
You've probably already gotten (and are hopefully enjoying!) your IMPOSSIBLE JONES book. 
According to BackerKit, 97% of the books have gone out. If you haven't gotten yours, it means you're one of the last, lingering 3%— there's about 30 of you.
IF YOU HAVEN'T GOTTEN YOUR BOOK— I'm working hard to change that.

In Case You Missed It:
IMPOSSIBLE 2— teaming IMP with Holly Daze…

updates.update_userinfo: Time To Do The IMPOSSIBLE— AGAIN!
updates.update_content:
IMPOSSIBLE 2 Launches on March 9, 7 AM PST!
Mark your calendar!
BETTER YET: sign up to be notified the instant IMP 2 goes live! Just click here:

updates.update_userinfo: Time to do the IMPOSSIBLE— AGAIN!
updates.update_content:
First Things First:
A handful of you have not received your copy of IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY yet. My deepest apologies for that.
62 OF YOU HAVE NOT RESPONDED TO THE SURVEY. You don't respond, I don't get your mailing address, you don't get the book. That's simply how it works, I'm afraid. I just sent out a new reminder to the people who I'm still waiting on. If you get one of these reminders, respond to it.

Hope Everyone's Staying Safe and Warm Out There!
Here at Epicenter: IMPOSSIBLE! we're working hard on the next IMPOSSIBLE JONES book— a 28-page, stand-along comic featuring IMP and Holly Daze! I think I've got Page 1 around here somewhere…
AH! Here it is— !

BlackBox has shipped all the IMPOSSIBLE JONES orders they have!
I am thrilled to tell you that, and hopefully you are (or soon will be) just as thrilled when the IMP book is in your hands.
Many people got emails notifying them their book was on its way. Many did not. I have no idea why this happened— possibly because BlackBox is in transition (see below)— but everyone was supposed to be notified, with tracking numbers.

updates.update_userinfo: FUNNY THING HAPPENED ON THE WAY TO THE KICKSTARTER…
updates.update_content:
Remember how I said the Kickstarter for IMP 2 would launch on January 19th?
Plans have changed. 
All for the better, I'd say.
This happened because late last week I got an unexpected royalty check from DC Comics. For a substantial amount. Enough that I took a step back and thought about what I really to do with IMP— what would benefit the character most?

project_data.project_name: IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY! A Graphic Novel

campaign.story:
WRETCHES is gritty sci-fi epic about a brother & sister who must fight against all odds to be reunited. 
This is a story about family. About loss. All Shea and Sean have is each other...until they don't even have that.
Cover Art by Ben Bishop
WRETCHES - Volume 1 is a sci-fi graphic novel perfect for fans of movies like The Fifth Element & Blade Runner, and shows like Battlestar Galactica & Firefly. At over 150 pages (140 of which are story), readers will get thrown into an action-packed universe filled with beautifully drawn pages and cutthroat characters. In addition to the six-issue tale, backers get to see cover art, pin-ups, script excerpts, and all sorts of other behind-the-scenes content.
I started writing WRETCHES back in 2015. The story and it's characters truly grew with me as a creator these past few years, and thanks to all of YOU, I'm excited to finally be able to put the full story out into the universe! 
 (Click the picture below to ENTER THE IMAGE in 3D on Facebook)
Line Art by Salo Farias. Colors by Ander Zarate.
 SHEA & SEAN 
On the rough streets of an alien planet, far from the one they'd called home, Shea and Sean were forced to grow up with nothing but each other. Forever outrunning the horrors of their past, they survive the only way they know how: by hunting and killing robots for profit!  
Line Art by Salo Farias. Colors by Ander Zarate
When they were just children they watched the war between humans and robots destroy their planet and kill their mother and father.
Interior Art from Issue 3
Now, when Sean is kidnapped by the enemy, Shea has no choice but to tear the entire galaxy apart to find him!
Line Art by Salo Farias. Colors by Ander Zarate.
THE BOTS
The goal of the robots now is simply survival. After fleeing their home, other planets looked at them as lesser life forms. They were given no aid and left without the resources needed to survive, effectively giving them a death sentence! 
Interior Art from Issue 3
Now, on the verge of finding a cure to their newfound mortality, some want to bring peace to their kind. While others threaten to rebuild and destroy those who turned their backs on them!
Interior art from Issue 3
Here's a preview of Wretches - Issue 1.
Since writing issues 1 and 2 several years ago, I've grown as a writer. I took my red pen and did a rewrite to much of them to sharpen things up and give readers a more fleshed out look at the world and it's characters. Below is the opening scene from issue 1, re-written and lettered by the series' new letterer, Chas! Pangburn.
In the never-ending hustle these past years to promote and get Wretches out into the world, we were able to get Issue 1 published in serialized form in China! This was very cool news when it first happened and it's still a great feeling to see your work translated in another language, and published in another country.
 •Every backer of a physical reward will receive this special, Kickstarter-exclusive print.
Kickstarter Exclusive Print
New LIMITED Reward added - only 18 left.
 Click the image for a better look at the prints and their numbered, signed bottom portions.
(CLICK HERE FOR MORE DETAILS ON THE BELOW REWARD AND THE STORY BEHIND US 'GIVING BACK WITH THE 4TH MONKEY')
James E. Roche (creator/writer) - Born & raised in Brooklyn, NY, James now lives in NJ with his wife, 3 kids, 2 cats & 1 goldfish. Self-publishing since 2015, with published work in several anthologies, James co-created, published and edited THE 4TH MONKEY: AN ANTHOLOGY FOR AWARENESS (funded on KS in 2017) featuring the work of 30+ comic book creators. (Imagination House) 
Salo Farias (artist) - Residing in Curico, Chile Salomon is a lifelong sketcher and professional comic book artist since 2011. (IDW. Lakefront Comics) 
Chunlin Zhao (colorist) - Has worked professionally in comics as both a colorist and artist since 2012. (Outlander Entertainment)   
Chas! Pangburn (letterer/editor)- Puts words in balloons... Okay, so that's his cheesy way of saying that he's a comic writer, editor, and letterer. He lives in Northern Kentucky with a chubby corgi and spends far too much time playing video games. (IDW. Heavy Metal. Action Lab: Danger Zone)

Why Kickstarter?
For myself, like so many other creators, Kickstarter has been instrumental towards helping our projects see the light of day. Our work and social media posts caught the eyes of the folks at Scout Comics, who will begin publishing the individual issues in the direct market, hopefully by the end of the year.  Our goal is to put together this Kickstarter Exclusive trade, do a one-time print run, and load it with as much content as we can!
I've already invested thousands of dollars into completing much of the artwork from Issues 3 to 6 (this way the book is completed and into your hands sooner), and the funds raised here on Kickstarter will go towards completing the artwork, coloring & lettering on the remaining pages, as well as funding the print run, shipping & packaging.
Funds raised above and beyond our goal will go into stretch goals for our backers as well as be invested back into the series.

On behalf of the entire creative team, thank you so much for checking out our Kickstarter!
- James
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks when publishing comics and fulfilling backer rewards, as there are multiple parties involved and unforeseen issues cop pop up at any waking moment! As long as we stay on schedule and the printer fulfills their parts without any hiccups (knock on wood) you WILL get this book in a timely fashion once the campaign succeeds.

This is my fifth campaign, and I have delivered on every single successful one thus far. I continue to learn more from each of my campaigns, and will carry that experience into this one.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: Wretches - Volume 1: A Gritty, Action Sci-Fi Epic

campaign.story:
Cursed to become zombies whenever they play their music, the members of the punk band Toe Tag Riot use their "zombie powers" ethically, only murderizing and eating bigots, homophobes, transphobes, sexists, and racists.  
  Toe Tag Riot formed in the 2000s, devoured and digested scores of Nazi skinheads, sexist dudebros, and even the Westboro Baptist Church (see volume 1 for that tale!), then broke up, to the dismay of their legions of fans.  But now they're back with a reunion tour sure to be even bloodier, funnier and a little more queer than ever before!
  And yes, fan-favorite guest stars Teddy Mercury, and Andy Hurley from Fall Out Boy, are back!
 Return of the Toe Tag Riot is a digital-first 4-issue series, collected to physical trade paperback.
Issues 1-4 covers and the classic punk albums they're homages to. Issue 1 cover by Jonathan Brandon Sawyer and Josh Jensen, others by Sean Von Gorman, Gab Contreras, and Tim Daniel
Pinup by Bobby Timony to be included in issue 1 and the TPB
Matt Miner (GWAR: Orgasmageddon, Lab Raider)
Sean Von Gorman (This Nightmare Kills Fascists, Love is Love)
Gab Contreras (All We Ever Wanted: Stories of a Better World, 2000 AD)
Taylor Esposito (Red Hood and the Outlaws, Fresh Romance)

Kickstarter video features a sample of "EAT YOUR FACE," the new Toe Tag Riot* single that's been burning up the charts ever since the band reunited!

* IRL recorded by TTR's buddy Rene Rosa - full version available along with the band's previous hit "Toe Tag Riot" on the cassette single reward tier.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Let's be real: Kickstarters are a beast, and there are always going to be challenges, but between Matt and Sean, we've run 6 successful Kickstarter projects in the past —so we know where the pitfalls are, we know how to hustle and how to promote, and we feel absolutely confident we can bang this out and make a very very cool book in the process.

There is a great publisher onboard to publish Return of the Toe Tag Riot, as long as we can pay the art and creative costs with the successful Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Only 5 days left on DEATH TRAP! Don't miss out!
updates.update_content:
Hey all, I thank anyone who still reads these updates and please know that I love you.  Building a career in comics, when you're an opinionated loudmouth with something to say, is especially tough.  It means I have to reach out to you folks, and sometimes, like today, I have to reach out for maybe the third time?  I'm not sure.
What I do know is that DEATH TRAP is in the home stretch, but we only have 5 days left.  Please check it out?  Please pledge.  I swear to you, this is a beautifully illustrated book with a ton of heart, a lot of bananas fun, and just enough of my point of view that you'll be like "Ah, he snuck that in there, nice."

updates.update_userinfo: Hey TTR 2 backers! I launched a new Kickstarter - DEATH TRAP! It's f'n bananas!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers,
While we wait for the world to be less "nightmare a day" to relaunch Return of the Toe Tag Riot, might I direct you to a new comic project I just launched called DEATH TRAP?  I swear, this is right up your alley, TTR fans, and it's so. damn. much. fun.
And, thanks to everyone who sent well wishes re: my Dad.  He's OK and, in his mid 70s he's decided to get married again.  Life is weird and I guess he realized he's not immortal and he better put a ring on it before it's too late.  :)

updates.update_userinfo: An update, a delay, an explanation and apology - TOE TAG RIOT will be back another time.
updates.update_content:
Friends, 
Matt here.  I want to thank you all for backing this project and believing in the vision - wanting TOE TAG RIOT to return in this new age of awfulness to lay waste to (and make fun of) the absolute scum of the Earth.
But, we're needing to cancel the project for now, and we'll bring it back another time.  Some of you may know, but for those who don't:  My Dad was taken to the hospital about a week and a half ago, and my head has not been in the game for promotion, press, and the like.  I've not been able to focus on much aside from immediate deadlines, my dogs and the rescue, and the overwhelming worry and stress over what's going on with my Dad.

Hello everyone!
First of all, THANK YOU! We are well past the first day of the campaign and we are THRILLED and MOVED with the response from Toe Tag Riot fans who have welcomed us back to bring you more of the same!
Matt and I would like to take a moment to thank all 69 of your reading this. That's right, 69 people have committed their hard earned cash into helping Matt and I make another comic where a Zombie Punk Rock Band eat the worst humanity has to offer. What an fitting milestone to commemorate!

campaign.story:
La Voz De M.A.Y.O. #2 Cover by Eva Cabrera *Not Final Cover
Last year I Kickstarted a comic book biography about great-grandfather, Ramon Jaurigue, and his work with the organization he co-founded: Mexican, American, Yaqui, and Others. He and M.A.Y.O. helped the Yaquis and the community around them stop the City of Tucson from displacing the native people from their land, and help establish their tribal recognition with the help of Congressman Morris K. Udall. I worked with J. Gonzo, Claire Napier, and Bernardo Brice to help make this possible. I couldn't have done it without them.
The support was overwhelming. We received help from all over the world. It was a gratifying experience and the question on everyone's minds after reading the last page was "what happens next?" We're back to publish the second chapter of La Voz De M.A.Y.O. This will be a full color, 32-page comic book. 
The official story
 La Voz De M.A.Y.O. is the true story of Ramon Jaurigue, an orphan and WWII veteran who co-founded the Mexican, American, Yaqui, and Others (M.A.Y.O.) organization, which successfully lobbied the Tucson City Council to improve living and working conditions for members of the local Pascua Yaqui tribe. Largely due to Ramon’s activism, both in M.A.Y.O. in and with Model Cities Program, Yaqui were successfully integrated into the expanding metropolis of Tucson: families bought property, roads and sidewalks were built, and sewage systems installed. Ramon and his colleagues even founded a night school to help adults learn English and established the region’s first low-cost clinic to offer birth control. 
Utilizing newspaper clippings, interviews with surviving MAYO members, and Ramon’s authored articles, La Voz De M.A.Y.O. dramatizes the remarkable life and achievements of my great-grandfather—and in so doing, tells the story not just of a single man, but of a family, a tribe, a nation.
Preview
La Voz De MAYO #2, Page 1 (Barajas, Gonzo, Brice, Napier)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
La Voz De MAYO is not only about my family's history, but, this is the history of a tribe of people and my hometown: Tucson, AZ. My graphic memoir is about people of color; specifically, Native Americans and Mexican Americans that are finally getting documented in the history books. It's important to me to publish something that will inform and empower people that look like to look like me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: La Voz De M.A.Y.O #3 Kickstarter is live!
updates.update_content:
¡Hola!
I was going to quit making comics in January.
I hit a milestone in life that everyone will or has reached. I realized that I had spent a majority of my twenties in the comic book industry. The question was am I ready to give it my thirties?

updates.update_userinfo: Download & Read LA VOZ DE M.A.Y.O. Tata Rambo #2
updates.update_content:
I was worried.
I’m sitting in a hotel in Houston. I’m updating with my phone so forgive the grammar and misspellings.
It’s raining. My shoes are soaked. But I’m grateful. It’s because of you. I didn’t think we were going to make it. I thought the first issue might have failed the first backer’s expectations. But it’s obvious by the numbers that most of you wanted to continue this journey. Thankfully, we picked up new fans in the process.
