campaign.story:
WHO ARE WE?
Adam and Makana Wallenta are the creators of PUNK TACO. Along with our friends Gabriel Mayorga and Lea Jean Badelles, we are artists who love to tell fun stories that inspire the imaginations of young and old alike.  Adam has been working as an illustrator and professional comic book creator for more than 20 years and this is Makana’s 2nd book. 
Adam and Makana are the creators, writers and co-artists of PUNK TACO.
WHO IS PUNK TACO?
Punk Taco is a lovable sentient taco who rocks out across the universe with his band of misfits, fighting evil and helping those in need. Punk Taco believes in peace and love but has no tolerance for bullies and tyrants, so when he sees an injustice, he can't resist helping and joining in the fight. 
He loves his friends and considers them family, and will do anything for them. His empathy and compassion for others and his willingness to sacrifice himself to help the downtrodden is legendary.
 Check out the official PUNK TACO Theme song. Written and Produced by Adam Wallenta and ICBM. Performed by ILLUS and RoXXXteady. Wouldn't PUNK TACO make a great animated series? 
PLAY

VOLUME 2: THE STORY
Punk Taco and the band were on their way to a gig when we last saw them in the Volume 1 Epilogue, when a giant hand reached through a mysterious portal and whisked them away. Volume 2 picks up immediately after that and thrusts our hero and his friends into a dangerous new adventure to save a planet endangered by a greedy syndicate that is mining not just the resources, but also the very life essence of the planet itself. Punk Taco must join forces with a coalition of tribes to prevent an environmental disaster, but the problem is, they are the size of ants compared to the giant that threatens their planet. What’s a taco to do? 
THE MISSION
Punk Taco Volume 2 is a continuation of Volume 1, and picks up where we left off in the epilogue. The book is penciled and we are inking and coloring each page now. 
We need to raise a minimum of $5,000.00 to print the book. This will cover the cost of printing an "8.5x12" hardcover with spot varnish and full-color interior pages, as well as shipping costs. We have a lot of great Stretch Goals including bonus stories, sticker sheets, coloring books and even PUNK TACO Volume 3! So let's get this funded on day 1 and make PUNK TACO a huge success!
International customers - The cost of shipping PUNK TACO Volume 1 from the previous campaign cost me between $28-$40 for a single book. I apologize for the high cost of shipping but it is not something I control. When I originally shipped Volume 1, I had to come out of pocket for a lot of the cost. Because of these high shipping costs I will be including some extra rewards exclusive for international customers including original sketches in each book.
THE ART
Check out these sample pages of PUNK TACO Volume 2! 
Alien Tacos! Robots! Monsters! Cute Cuddly Furry Friends and one punk rocking band! PUNK TACO has it all!
PUNK TACO is all about making new friends.
PUNK TACO and the Band are about to go on a great big adventure with their new friend.
With new friends come new mysteries.
PUNK TACO and the Band aren't the only ones making new friends.
The Dance of the Evocajas!
REWARDS
We have a lot of great rewards including stickers, bookmarks, enamel pins, buttons, magnets, T-Shirts and original art. There is something for everyone and we will post more as the campaign progresses.
The First 200 Backers to support PUNK TACO Volume 2 and pledge $25 or more, will get a FREE Copy of the official PUBLIC ENEMY Trade Paperback collecting issues 0-5 by Adam Wallenta and Chuck D.

REVIEWS and INTERVIEWS
Ghosts of the Stratosphere April 9, 2019  https://gotstratosphere.com/2019/04/09/comic-bookworm-from-the-kids-shelf-punk-taco/ 
Outright Geekery March 25th 2019  http://www.outrightgeekery.com/2019/03/25/punk-taco-interview/  
The Besotted Geek Podcast April 10th 2018 https://besottedgeek.podbean.com/e/95-bruce-vicki-batman-1989/ @BesottedGeekPod
Four Guys and a Comic Book Podcast April 14th 2018 Issue #93: Adam Wallenta, Punk Taco/Sin City https://www.podbean.com/media/share/pb-wk5te-8f4068 @4GuysAndAComic 
So Wizard Podcast April 16th 2018 http://sowizardpodcast.com/comic-book-review-punk-taco/ @SoWizardPodcast 
Super Hero Speak May 8th 2018 http://superherospeak.com/wp/review-punk-taco @SuperHeroSpeak 
QUOTES FROM INDUSTRY PROS WHO LOVE PUNK TACO
“Punk Taco is a sci-fi infused punk rock anthem of a graphic novel, celebrating positivity, empathy, and – perhaps most importantly – nachos. It harkens back to the adventurous cartoons of the 90s, updated with frenetic energy and a few knowing winks sent toward adult readers, without losing its warm-hearted nature.”
- Pat Shand 
Writer of Afterglow, Destiny NY, Spooky Girls
“Punk Taco is childlike fun at its best! Full of tacos, nachos, aliens and rock ‘n’ roll!”
- Franco
Eisner and Harvey Award-Winning Writer/Artist of Tiny Titans, Itty Bitty Hellboy, Superman Family Adventures
“Punk Taco is like the dream you’d have after passing out from a great Mexican feast while bumping 90’s Hip-Hop through your headphones. Its psychedelic weirdness and social activism could only come from the combined minds of a kid and his dad, cracking up at a joke and then turning it into an entire galaxy. From radio station WKRS to the junk food villain’s plan to “Make the Galaxy Great Again,” its hidden gems sparkle bright. Throughout all the juvenile, hyper-colored fun, you can dig the central theme that love, art and being cool to one another make up the infinite power that runs this mothership we all happen to be traveling on, and that greed, selfishness and fear are all headed for self-destruction. Long live Punk Taco and his secret nachos!!!”
- Secret Agent 23 Skidoo 
Grammy Award-Winning Hip-Hop Artist for Best Children’s Album and Author of Weirdo Calhoun and the Odd Men Out 
“Punk Taco is a fun, intergalactic action-adventure story full of the kind of love and optimism you’ll definitely want to upload into the brain of any kid you care about.”
- Chris Giarrusso
Harvey Award-Nominated Artist/Writer of G-Man, Mini Marvels, Encounter
“Adam and Makana Wallenta’s Punk Taco is a lush, sumptuous spectacle for both adult and children’s eyes, coupled with a crazy-fun story that wraps itself around important social issues... and nachos. It’s delicious!”
- Mark McKenna
2012 Inkwell Awards Hall of Fame. Writer, Penciller, Inker of Banana Tales, Combat Jacks, Batman
“Truth, justice and the quest for perfect nachos! Punk Taco is a fun-filled comic book burrito... an important tale of optimism wrapped in candy-colored art. Adam Wallenta created Punk Taco with his son, Makana. The result is a rockin’ all-ages book that can be enjoyed by parents and kids alike. All that’s missing is a side of guacamole!
- Bill Walko
Writer/Artist of The Hero Business
“At the same time it’s a kind of Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure meets Axe Cop, Punk Taco is also a book that validates childrens’ emotions in these turbulent times. It's okay to be upset and angry over the injustices of the world, and channeling those feelings into something active is a good way to manage them”.
- Kelly Sue DeConnick 
2014 Eisner-Award Nominated Writer of Pretty Deadly and Captain Marvel
“This Taco goes Hard (shell)! Here’s an intergalactic space adventure that feels foreign and familiar simultaneously. Punk Taco walks that same hero path I grew up admiring in my youth. With some incredibly beautiful colors, very unique character designs and an unpredictably building storyline, Punk Taco is an all-ages Sci-Fi comedy adventure that has a little something for everyone."
- Marquee Mark,  Markellus Ragans
Host of So Wizard Podcast
Just a few photos of some of our many awesome PUNK TACO fans.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are no risks. If we do not meet our goal- you will not be charged a penny. If we meet our goal- the book will be completed and you will get your rewards no matter what. 

There are delays at times and unexpected events that occur. So the delivery date can change but I always deliver. I have a solid 100% track record and I always openly communicate with everyone and keep everyone up to date on progress and delays.

I respect your hard earned dollars and I appreciate everyone that supports what I do. I will never betray that trust or support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Friends and Supporters,
How are you all doing? I hope this finds everyone healthy and happy. It's been almost a full year since the pandemic and our world changed. I hope all of your loved ones are also safe and you haven't been affected too badly. We have been very lucky overall, but have a lot of our close friends affected by this virus, some losing family members and friends, others just fighting the virus and many struggling with the realities of the economy due to everything shutting down. My family actually got extremely sick around February before everything started to really explode but we were never tested. We stayed home as instructed by our doctors and have been isolated ever since. I'm not sure if it was the coronovirus or something else but it was horrible and scary at time. My littlest one and I had it the worst but we pulled through.

Hello Friends and Supporters!
I hope this finds everyone safe and healthy during this Thanksgiving holiday. I know it's been an extremely difficult year for many of us and I wan to let everyone know that I am working hard on Punk Taco Volume 2. It's more than 3 times the size of Volume 1 now and the coloring is looking amazing. I still do not have a definitive date but we are working hard to have the printed copies in hand for early 2021. I know we have had a lot of delays due to our family move and Covid, but we are catching up and making a lot of progress. I really appreciate your patience and support as we work to bring you the best book we can possibly make.

Dear Friends and Supporters,
I hope this finds you and yours all safe and healthy and managing well during these uncertain times.
I have been busy working on Punk Taco 2 while taking care of the kids an preparing the new school year at home. This new reality has slowed down my production considerably and I apologize, but I promise you we are working hard to get the new book done.

Hello Friends and Supporters! 
I hope you are all staying safe and healthy and maintaining your sanity in this new world of ours. I've been meaning to post an update but, while working from home is nothing new for me, it is a new experience to have the family home at the same time 24/7. So my productivity has really slowed down and I apologize. But we are working hard on completing PUNK TACO 2 and I even have 9 pages of Volume 3 penciled.

Hello Friends and Supporters! 
I hope this finds you all happy and healthy. Just a quick update to show off some new colored pages of Punk Taco Volume 2. 
If you loved Volume 1 please consider leaving a review on Amazon. It's a great way to help spread the word and we need more 5-Star reviews. There's only 7 copies left on Amazon. If you need a signed copy with an original sketch, I have 5 copies on PunkTaco.Com. Thank you for all your support!

Hello Friends!
I hope this finds you all happy and healthy. Just a quick update to show off some new pages we have inked and colored. We are back to working full time on Punk Taco now that we are settled in after our move and the convention season is done. Stay tuned for more regular updates.
Also- if you know anyone that would like a copy of PUNK TACO Volume 1 or 2 please let them know we are running a new campaign to keep Volume 1 in print and Volume 2 can also be pre-ordered as well. Here's the .  We only have 57 copies of teh first print of PUNK TACO Volume 1 left. Thanks for all the support!

Hello Friends!
I hope this finds you all well. I apologize for not posting in awhile but the recent comic con season and our family move across country has been quite overwhelming and put me behind on a lot of work. But I’m working hard to catch up and wanted to update you on where we are.
First off some great news- PUNK TACO Volume 1 juts won a very prestigious RINGO Award for “Best Kids Comic or Graphic Novel”! I am still in shock and a bit overwhelmed by it all. The award ceremony took place this past weekend at the Baltimore Comic Con and I was able to share the experience with Makana so that made it extra special.

Dear AWEsome Friends and Supporters,
PUNK TACO Volume 1 was recently nominated for a prestigious RINGO Award for "Best Kids Comic or Graphic Novel" thanks to all of your support. This is a huge honor and Makana and I can't thank all of you enough.
We are the only self-published, independent book in our category and we are in the company of some amazing talent and big publishers so we need all of your support if we are going to have a chance to bring this one home.

updates.update_userinfo: PUNK TACO Volume 1 Nominated for a RINGO Award!!!!!
updates.update_content:
Dear Friends and Supporters,
I hope this finds you all well and enjoying some sunshine and warm weather.
I just wanted to send you some quick updates.
I have been hard at work on PUNK TACO Volume 2 and it’s coming along great. I will start uploading new art for you to all see soon. My family and I are also in the process of moving, so things have been a little slower than usual and I apologize.

campaign.story:
Books with Pictures is a comic book store in Portland, OR. We were built from the ground up to prioritize inclusivity and diverse representation. We want to be the shop where we can say YES! to anyone who walks in and asks "Do you have any stories with someone who's like me?" Our staff listens closely to each customer's interests and curiosities to help open new doors.
In early 2019, Books with Pictures owner Katie Proctor worked with a group of friends and supporters to purchase an historic building in SE Portland to serve as the new, sustainable, expanded home for Books with Pictures. 
THIS ONE!
Now, we need to finish the space and move in! Help us raise money to pay for building renovations and repair, new shop fixtures, moving expenses, and more, while getting yourself some amazing new art and merch. 

 NOW UNLOCKED!
 ATTENTION FRIENDS!  This campaign will be supported by Backer Kit!
In this pin, by Kory Bing, the open pages interpret the distinctive street grid of our new neighborhood in Portland, Ladd's Addition, as a rainbow-colored comics spread, with a glitter star calling out our new location. Behind the center spread of streets are pages that will be produced in many different colorways to represent the amazing diversity of our community. Pick one, two, five, or get all nine!
Rose City Comic Con Tickets & Con-Kit
Go to the Northwest's greatest comic convention, Rose City Comic Con, in style. Choose this tier and get a 3-day Pass to RCCC, a Tote (Color of your choice), an Enamel Pin (Color of your choice), and no con is complete without a survival kit which includes: 1 11x17 Top loader for your art prints you pick up, 10 bag and board sets for those signed comics, gum & mints, hand sanitizer, 3 packs of Emergen-C (don't get con-crud), and 2 bottles of water. 


Dr. Sketchy's Tickets
The world's sexiest figure-drawing event comes to Portland, Oregon. Live models in costumes with rotating themes, cocktails and food provided by friendly neighborhood queers, and prizes donated by some of Portland's best businesses! The last Sunday of each month, 7-10pm at Crush Bar. 

Oddville Tickets
Every second Sunday of the month at The Steep and Thorny Way to Heaven. Oddville: A New Vaudevillian Tradition is a monthly showcase of light-hearted and comedic work of all disciplines. One part vaudevillian comedy show, one part 60s variety-hour, Oddville brings together a wide range of artistic disciplines and focusing on ambitious new work and polished short pieces from our thriving clown, circus, music, and alternative performance communities right here in Portland. 

SEANCE Tickets
A rotating monthly event at The Steep and Thorny Way to Heaven. A music series like you've never experienced before. SΞΔNCΞ is an ongoing concert series in which the midnight stars of the Portland music scene come together in an intimate setting to transport you outside of time and place, haunted by the ghosts of inner SE industrial. 
 *Tickets will be delivered to Books with Pictures. Can be claimed at the new store location with I.D.* 

This SIGNED EDITION comes with a HAND-DRAWN, UNIQUE BOOK PLATE. Did you know that Kickstarter editions are about the only way to get original Erika Moen art these days?
The first volume in a planned 3-volume sex-education series.
Have you ever had a question about sex, but didn't know who to ask? Well, Erika and Matthew have spent years learning, talking, and creating informative comics about all aspects of sex. Using comics, jokes, and frank communication, they're here to demystify the world of sex and answer your questions—including ones you might not even know you had!
For one month, you run our recommendations shelf! We will feature a picture of you, along with your personal descriptions of why these 6-8 titles are especially awesome. Promote yourself! Yell about your amazing friends! Create new fans of the best series ever! The choice is yours. You and your selections will also be featured in a spotlight on our social media platforms. Plus, you will receive one of our new TOTE BAGS!
Program begins in June 2019/Names will be selected randomly and assigned a month. 

 *Pending stock and availability of books. Books with Pictures will reject curated books that don't align with our mission, or that we are unable to get at wholesale pricing. 
These beautiful prints were created especially for our campaign, to reflect all of the things that comics can be. Get one, two, or a set to dress up on the walls of your dining room, reading nook, book store, library, or classroom.  
Similar to our Enamel Pins, our tote bag design reflects the Ladd's Addition street grid, with the reading girl from our logo calling out our new location. Use it to find us, carry your new comics home, and then brag to everyone about exactly where you got them. 
Curated Tote Bags
These personally picked packs come with signed copies of each creator's favorite works with stickers and of course our fabulous BwP tote bags. There are a limited number of these rewards, so don't miss out! 





 Stuffed Tote Bags
Get one of our gorgeous totes stuffed with one of our favorite comics paperbacks, along with stickers, posters, patches, and other great geeky content. Featuring content from our friends at Silver Sprocket Press, Oni Press, Solid Comix , Books With Pictures and a bunch of our comic creator friends!
 These Oregon artists have come through for us again and again, and now they have original pages that they are ready to part with and send home with you. These are spectacular pieces of one-of-a-kind comics art, and you need them in your collection. 







(This one will also be available as a stretch goal print.) 

A custom Captain Marvel jacket so you can punch the sky! Made-to-order by Gayle Francis Moffet (https://www.etsy.com/shop/icrochetedthething/). Sized to fit your measurements. You can get your Carol Danvers on and look super rad at the next con, costume party, or the next Marvel movie!
Books with Pictures' owner Katie Proctor is a queer single mother of two who has lived in Portland since 2009. Katie has worked and volunteered in bike advocacy, literary administration, education, and tech. She has been running Books with Pictures full time since Free Comic Book Day 2016. She loves Bitch Planet and The Wicked and the Divine and Squirrel Girl and A-Force and Die and My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic and Hickman's Avengers and is built of enthusiasm and nurturance.
The other face you'll most often see at Books with Pictures is Nick Orr. Nick received his BFA in Illustration from the College for Creative Studies in Detroit, Michigan. After graduating he moved to LA and worked as a freelance graphic designer and artist. He spent his time fine-tuning his craft and figuring out how best to convey a story. Nick moved to Portland in 2007. After years working at Barnes & Noble, he joined Katie's team to open Books with Pictures in 2016, first part-time, and then full-time. In 2018, Nick completed the Helioscope Studio mentorship program for artists, and in 2019 will be an invited artist at the Lake Oswego Festival of the Arts. His print "Take Me Away" is one of our backer rewards. 
Nicole Hawthorne is from Reno, Nevada, and moved to Portland for school and friendship. Currently she’s working on establishing herself as a freelance artist, but for now she spends most of her days selling, reading, and talking about comics. She also works at an escape room guiding people through puzzles and making sure they don’t break things. When she is not at either of her amazing jobs she’s home with her spouse and two cats watching cartoons. Some of her favorite comics are Snotgirl, Crowded, and The Wicked + The Divine, and she could talk for hours on end about the web comics she reads.
Seaerra Miller grew up in central Wyoming and moved to Portland to attend the Pacific Northwest College of Art and Design to study illustration. Since graduating in 2017 she has worked with with clients including Snapchat, Oni Press, and the City of Portland. She has also illustrated three books for Flying Eye and is currently working on a series of middle grade comics for them. When she’s not reading, selling, or drawing comics she likes watching bad movies and listening to sad 80’s music. Some of her favorite comics include Blue Monday, Giant Days, and Kiss Number 8.
  Katie and the BwP Crew!
The building at 1401 SE Division St was built in 1927 to hold the Crucciola family's grocery store and butcher shop, with an outbuilding for keeping chickens just behind. Patriarch Antonio Crucciola passed away in 1946, but the neighborhood grocery carried on. By 1964, the building was in the hands of J.P. Wilder, who started advertising for shop workers and delivery personnel for his business, J.P. Wilder Company, repairing automobile brakes and clutches. The chicken coop became a machine shop, and the dirt lot was paved. The last ad for shop workers ran in 1968. By 1975 the building was tied to ads in the Oregonian for "BOOKS BOOKS BOOKS." Since then--nearly half its life--this two-story wood-frame live-above retail shop has been a spot for literature.

                             In 1976 the shop, Serendipity Corner Books, was purchased by Jean Bader and her friend and “silent partner” Frank Barst; it was already a “cluttered old bookstore, then filled with empty soda bottles and sloppy stacks of musty books and magazines,” Jean told the Oregonian. Serendipity sold used books, as well as both used and new comics, until 1986, when Jean moved to Lincoln City to manage a bookstore there.

                             From 1985 to 1991, the shop was leased to Pegasus Books, the multi-branched comics chain that would eventually become Things From Another World. In 1991, Jon Hagen bought it and moved his decade-old store Longfellow’s Books and Records there from its Moreland neighborhood location on SE Milwaukee. Longfellow’s specialized in rare and antiquarian books, and also carried extensive runs of old magazines and rare folk records collected on Jon’s scouting trips up and down the Oregon coast. For the past decade, Jon’s son Nile had been helping him run the business, especially its online presence. In 2016, the Oregonian voted Longfellow’s a “uniquely Portland experience,” and their “favorite bookstore.” Jon died on Jan. 25 of last year, at the age of 80, and Nile put the building up for sale in the fall.

                             Katie first spoke with Nile about buying it on November 6, Election Day: “When Nile told me he was selling the building, I thought, ‘there is no possible way I can do that.’ And then I rushed home and called a bunch of people to figure out how to do it.” She wound up forming the limited liability corporation Building for Books LLC, and bringing together about twenty friends and supporters to help make the purchase. Her plans for the space include not just a bigger, better Books with Pictures, but also a record store in the basement and a food cart pod in the parking lot. The new plans for this Building for Books touch on many of its roots: food, comics, books, music. But most importantly, it will bring new life to this beloved neighborhood corner. And the apartment above? Katie is thrilled to get to live there, with her two kids and their old-lady cat, Pixel.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of our rewards are either already complete or in process; we have contracts ready to go with silk-screeners and pin-makers. However, managing fulfillment at the same time as completing our move will make for some tricky time crunches-- we expect we won't be able to start serious mailing parties until late June or early July, and depending on how many supporters we get, it may take a while to get all of those packages out the door. It is important to us that your art, pins, and bags reach you safely, and we hope you'll be patient with us as we get everything packed and mailed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, friends and supporters,
I'm writing with relief and gratitude: with one last package going out today, reward shipping is complete.

Thank you all so much for your support. I'm so grateful for all you've done for us, and I love seeing more and more of you come visit the new space.
Rewards are making their way out, but slowly, and with errors. I learned yesterday that one package arrived postage-due, in spite of the assurances of my mailing software. I am SO sorry that this happened-- I'm taking steps to avoid it on future shipments. Other packages have been returned for one reason or another, and we're reaching out to people as this happens. 
38% of rewards are shipped. This means, if you still haven't gotten yours, you are in the majority, but we are making forward progress.

updates.update_userinfo: For Halloween: A Problem of Missing Guts
updates.update_content: Hello! Here’s a spooky trick: we somehow set up our fulfillment software such that it isn’t distinguishing between those of you who ordered just a tote bag, and those who are expecting totes filled with exciting random goodies! If you receive a bag in mail in the next few days that is distressingly guts-less, don’t fret: we’re working out the glitch and will make sure you get your treats as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience! Katie
The first set of packages are going out today. Thanks so much for your support and patience. I’m so delighted to start putting these rewards into your hands!! With love and gratitude, Katie

...and so are our pins! 
Hey all, sorry for the delay in an update. We are SO close to having all the pin in our hands. That is the last bit we need before shipments out rewards. We have the bags, the prints, and everything else, but the pins.
On the other side of things in you've been following us on Facebook the new space is more beautiful than what we could have imagined and things are rolling along.

Greetings Friends, 
We are in the final stages of collecting all of the wonderful goodies that you folks are anxiously waiting for.  So far so good. 
We are a bit behind schedule but rest assured that we are on task and putting together packages.  We expect shipping to be a bit delayed; most likely in September.

Dear Backers,
Well this has been one heck of a month. We closed the shop for just seven days toward the end of June, during which we, with a TON of volunteers, packed, moved, installed shelves, unpacked, shelved, and sorted. And were open again for events with Leila and Rosa Del Duca, Dylan Meconis, and more, the very next week. We have been LOVING the neighborhood welcome and improved foot traffic in our new digs, and had a hopping opening party last Saturday night. If you haven't been in yet, you should definitely come see us soon, and be PROUD of what we've accomplished together.

We cannot thank you all enough for the love, kindness, and support.  Your generosity throughout this campaign has been truly astounding. It brings us to tears (in a good way).
Look out for your backer kit surveys that will be hitting your inbox in about a week's time. There you will be able to solidify your order AND add on ANYTHING else that we have available; totes, prints, enamel pins, and art.
Again, thank you so very much! ❤️

In our last few hours, we have been able to add some great new rewards. Check them out!!
TWO original watercolor pages of Janet Lee’s adaptation of Jane Austen’s Emma.
Just THREE curated tote bags STUFFED with extremely limited, out-of-print, not-for-sale Man-Eaters comics and swag from Chelsea Cain and the Man-Eaters team.
Spread the word! Just six hours left!

project_data.project_name: Books with Pictures Great Big Move!

campaign.story:
Welcome to Dead Beats!
"..if you're looking for new or used vinyl, cassettes, CDs, gear, or merch, Dead Beats has the best selection in town. Of course, everything we sell has a story and our friendly Shoppe Keeper is happy to tell you all about it. All sales final..."
Dead Beats cover by Lisa Sterle (Long Lost, Submerged) featuring The Shoppe Keeper
THE BOOK
Dead Beats is a 160-page full-color anthology of music-themed horror comics centered around the curiosities for sale at one peculiar record store by its enigmatic Shoppe Keeper. Edited by Joseph Corallo (Oh S#!t, It's Kim & Kim, Mine!) and Eric Palicki (This Nightmare Kills Fascists, All We Ever Wanted), Dead Beats features more than twenty comics stories and more than forty up-and-coming creators and industry veterans, as well as cover art and interstitial narrative illustrations by Lisa Sterle (Long Lost, Submerged).
From the Dead Beats introduction, illustrated by Lisa Sterle
From the Dead Beats Introduction, illustrated by Lisa Sterle
From "Vanishing." Illustrations by Sally Cantirino from a script by Matthew Erman.
From "The Cursed Saxophone of Skasferatu." Illustrations by Dan Buksa from a script by Matthew Summo.
THE STRETCH GOALS
Because we hit our initial funding goal well ahead of schedule, the staff here at Dead Beats is proud to announce our stretch goals! Just don't tell the Shoppe Keeper. She hates it when we give stuff away for free!
$30,000: Premium Cover Stock with Spot Gloss
$35,000: Two Mini-Prints Added to All Physical Book Backers and Up (Lisa Sterle’s cover image and Jen Hickman’s image)
$40,000: EXCLUSIVE Kickstarter Edition available ONLY to backers. It will have its own logo color and a “Kickstarter Exclusive” stamp (Not Available in the Direct Market)
THE CREATORS
DEAD BEATS features a broad range of voices from new and established talent selected from across the medium. Notably, the book includes a reunion of Doom Patrol alums Rachel Pollack and Richard Case, working together for the first time in more than 25 years! 
Rachel Pollack and Richard Case (Doom Patrol)
Brent Schoonover (Howling Commandos) and Cameron DeOrdio (Josie & The Pussycats)
Jen Hickman (Moth & Whisper) and Joe Corallo (She Said Destroy)
Matthew Erman (Long Lost) and Sally Cantirino (The Last Song)
Eva Cabrera (Kim & Kim) and Kwanza Osajyefo (Black)
Eric Palicki (No Angel) and Liana Kangas (Black AF: Devil's Dye)
Steenz and Ivy Noelle Weir (Archival Quality)
Rafer Roberts (Grumble) and Daniel Kibblesmith (Santa's Husband)
Vita Ayala (The Wilds, Submerged) and Raymond Salvador
Marie Enger (Fhtagn & Loathing) and Danny Lore (The Queen of Bad Dreams)
Eli Powell (InferNoct) and Mark Bouchard (Everything is Going Wrong)
Sweeney Boo (Eat and Love Yourself) and Nadia Shammas (Care Bears)
Chris Peterson (Grindhouse) and Tony Patrick (X'ed)
Ayşegül Sınav (Loved and Lost) and Tyler Chin-Tanner (Broken Frontier)
ALSO FEATURING: Ren "Renfamous" Cooper * Caroline Autopsy * Alexis Sara * Christine Hipp * Tres Dean * Kyler Clodfelter * Christof Bogacs * Giles Crawford * Matthew Summo * Dan Buksa * Regine Sawyer * Y. Sanders * Sabs Cooper * Claudia Aguirre * Magdalene Visaggio * AND MORE!
REWARDS
A wide variety of rewards are available to backers of the DEAD BEATS campaign, including the book itself, tees, physical and digital bundles of material from A WAVE BLUE WORLD's extensive catalog, and more. In addition, all backers at the $5 tier and higher will find their name printed in the 'THANK YOU' section of the book!

A WAVE BLUE WORLD
Founded in 2005 by Tyler & Wendy Chin-Tanner, AWBW is an independent publisher of high quality graphic novels, anthologies and art books with a focus on originality and cultural relevance.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The most common challenges for an anthology is to get all the creator work in time, but considering this is our 6th anthology we've Kickstarted and all the previous anthologies came together beautifully and were delivered on time, we feel we have a pretty strong track record.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Eight Days Left! New Reward Tier Added!
updates.update_content:
Hello, Dead Beats faithful!

We continue to barrel toward the end of the campaign and we still have quite a lot of ground to cover. Nevertheless, Eric and I and all the contributors are putting our hearts and souls into making this book an incredible follow-up to the original Dead Beats. Behold! New art from Salvador Velazquez for his collaboration with legendary scribe Ron Marz, "The Instrument."

updates.update_userinfo: 12 Days To Go For Dead Beats 2: London Calling!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,

First off, we want to thank all of you again who helped make Dead Beats: A Musical Horror Anthology happen as well as those who have backed Dead Beats 2: London Calling so far. We're closing in on 300 backers and over 40% funded for DB2. We're in a good position, but as we're approaching the finish it's important we really get the word out and get more backers on board. This is also a great time to utilize our add-ons to add this campaign's t-shirt to your pledge, or upgrade to the book and t-shirt tier or signed bookplate tier.

updates.update_userinfo: DEAD BEATS 2 Update: Exclusive Previews and New Rewards
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Just wanted to let you know that there's a new DEAD BEATS anthology funding on Kickstarter right now:
DEAD BEATS 2: LONDON CALLING is going to be just as exciting as the first! I'd go on more about it, but all the information you need is on the campaign page, so head on over! bit.ly/DeadBeats2

updates.update_userinfo: NEW DEAD BEATS! The sequel is now on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Just wanted to let you know we've launched our new anthology on Kickstarter.
MAYBE SOMEDAY is the sequel to our previous anthology, ALL WE EVER WANTED, and is filled with even more stories of promise and visions of hope.

updates.update_userinfo: Our New Anthology launches on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
All digital rewards have gone out! This includes the pdf of the anthology itself, the digital sampler and the process book. Sorry about having to take the link down the first time it went up. Please let me know if you weren't able to download anything that you had coming to you. We'll get it taken care of.
The physical books are in the process of shipping out. We're going through it as fast as we can, but just so you know, it will take some time.

Greetings, Dead Beatniks! 
As we at A Wave Blue World HQ wrap up the prepress and design work, we wanted to share with you a peek at the final table of contents for the book. At this time, all stories are completely written, illustrated, colored, lettered and slotted into the line-up, and the design team has done a stellar job with this T.O.C. Click HERE to see a bigger version.

updates.update_userinfo: Dead Beats Is Off To The Printer!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Wanted to drop you a line to let you know that production is right on schedule and that surveys will be going out tomorrow. Please get those in right away so we can make sure we get your name written properly in the back of the book.
Don't worry, you'll still be able to update if you find yourself having to change your address in the next month and a half.

project_data.project_name: Dead Beats

campaign.story:
LITTLE GIRL WILL CHALLENGE EVERY GHOST STORY YOU'VE EVER BEEN TOLD!  
When a cursed stuffed penguin is given to an unknowing victim, the spirit of Abby May, a vengeful little dead girl, lashes out blindly at the living. However, as Abby’s bloodlust leads her back to those responsible for her death, she begins to piece together the truth about how she died and how she lived.
 LITTLE GIRL is a ghost story from the ghost's point of view.
Hey Kickstarter community! PAT SHAND here. I'm back with my 11th Kickstarter, and this time, I'm teaming up with artist OLIVIA PELAEZ and publisher DEVIL'S DUE COMICS to bring you the graphic novel collection of our horror comic, LITTLE GIRL. We previously published it as a series of four single issues, and now we are here to raise the funds to print it as a paperback! It totals out to 88 pages of full-color comics, and it's ready to be printed!
We can only make this book happen here, with you! 
This is also a personal tale for both me and Olivia. I've always been terrified of ghosts, since childhood -- and that fear was tripled when the ghost in question was a child. From The Ring to The Grudge to all manner of horror movies, I found myself so terrified by the idea of small, cold hands grasping at my throat... that I knew I had to explore that fear with a story.
Our story is as terrifying as any of the previously mentioned tales, but we've added an emotional core to the traditional haunting narrative to explore death, loss, life, religion, the power of love, and the irresistible lure of vengeance. We've created something both cathartic and horrifying to appeal to classic horror fans, as well as those looking for a fresh new twist on the genre.
Now... enough talking. Take a look at some more of Olivia's beautiful art.
This campaign also offers by far the most stunning original art I've ever been able to offer. I didn't even know this until recently because in my 8 years of working in comics with over 300 issues published... I have never seen an artist do this. Olivia traditionally drew AND colored the covers, and wants to offer them to you, our readers, through the Kickstarter!
The comic is completely DONE. It's written, drawn, colored by FRAN GAMBOA & JC RUIZ, and lettered by JIM CAMPBELL. We are ready to print it! Our delivery date is set in October just to protect ourselves if we have a printer or customs delay, but we fully expect to beat our delivery date by FAR. 
This will also be shipping to comic shops by Devil's Due if we get funded, but all of the other rewards here are exclusive to THIS campaign. 
Keep reading to check out our other amazing rewards, including:
the graphic novel itself 
original hand-knit haunted penguin doll by Olivia Pelaez
art cards
buttons, a signed bookplate, other books by me, and more... 
Read more about BREATHLESS here.
 Read more about SNAP FLASH HUSTLE here.
 Read more about PRISON WITCH, funded on Kickstarter, right here.
We also offer many items as add-ons, if you'd like to manually adjust your reward level! In addition to every individual item from the campaign, we're also offering EVERY BOOK I HAVE EVER FUNDED ON KICKSTARTER as well as some older favorites. 
 Learn more about each of these books here:
 Destiny, NY Volume One,Two, and Three 
Clonsters Volume One
Modern Dread
Prison Witch
Afterglow
Gangster Ass Barista
Spooky Girls
As we hit our goals, we will reveal more of these!
If you have any questions or would like to add any of these items onto other pledge levels, please feel free to message me.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between this and the projects I've funded over at my personal page as well as our collaborative Space Between company page, this is my 11th Kickstarter campaign. We have a well-oiled system and are happy to announce that the book is 100% COMPLETE! All we have to do is print it.

Because we're done, the only possible challenges would be delays in printing, considering we ship from overseas. However, any time that has happened in the past has been minor -- I have successfully Kickstarted multiple projects before as creator AND as a team like this, which has given me the utmost confidence that we'll meet and exceed your expectations. When hiccups are hit, we send updates. When we receive our shipment, we get them our to backers immediately without delay. I mean, why would we want to hold onto the books when we're so eager for YOU to read them?

One thing that we can't control is customs charges. We pay more for international shipping than we charge (and I wish we could charge less!) but some countries will charge an extra customs fee based on the prices of the items included. Our advice there would just be to be aware of that! We haven't had problems in the past, but I thought it'd be worth mentioning!

Our backers deserve the absolute best, and we promise to deliver the highest quality, the best communication, and all questions answered within 24 hours or less -- ALWAYS!

MUSIC CREDIT - Tragic Story by Myuu
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #15: Shipping COMPLETE! Thanks so much!
updates.update_content:
Hey Little Girl backers,
I'm thrilled to announce that as of tonight, all of your rewards have shipped*. Thank you all for supporting this book and, for those who haven't received it yet, I hope you love the book when it arrives. If anyone has any problems with their order, please email me at PatrickEShand@gmail.com and I'll resolve your problem right away. Thanks again for making this book a possibility.
*With the exception of one backer who has not supplied an email address. Please do, I'd love to get you your book!

Hey Little Girl backers!
SHIPPING UPDATE
We're 75% shipped! We've got more packages going out now, and I've sent the bookplates out to Olivia to sign. Once she signs those and they're back to me, we'll be in the final stretch. I did 11 campaigns before this using bubble wrap, 2 cardboard planks, and an envelope, which served us well for the time, but now we've upgraded to hard cardboard mailers with bubble wrap to better protect your books. If anyone has any issues with their post offices inflicting any damage, remember, we will ALWAYS replace!

Hey Little Girl backers,
There was a little hold-up getting the books to me, so Josh from Devil's Due and I decided that the best plan would be if I pick them up at a convention we were both doing. I'm happy to let you all know that I hung out with Devil's Due at Cincinnati Comic Expo and picked up all of your copies of  Little Girl.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #12: Audio Commentary Up + Books Passed Customs + Final Call for Address Changes
updates.update_content:
Hey Little Girl backers,
A lot to share this time! I'll keep it brief as possible, but first things first:
FINAL CALL FOR ADDRESS CHANGES!
The great news is that I have heard from Devil's Due, and the books have cleared customs with no issues. They'll head to their office, and then the Kickstarter copies will be sent to me. I expect to ship these in early-mid September, ahead of schedule. I'm still waiting on a few merch items, but most of the rewards are ready to go.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #11: Advance copy looks great + SHIPPING UPDATE
updates.update_content:
Hey Little Girl backers!
The books have been printed! Devil's Due Comics needed a few boxes early to queue this up for retail, so they sent me and Olivia a few early copies to check out. I'm happy to say, they look incredible. Take a look with me.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #10: Digital copy updates sent, print news!
updates.update_content:
Hey Little Girl backers!
FINAL DIGITAL COPIES SENT
Check your messages! We just sent the final digital proof with design elements and the Thank You page added. If you received an earlier version, you can disregard. There were a few names we added outside of the backer surveys, so the version you have now has everyone included.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #9: Surveys are out, due by May 13th!
updates.update_content:
Hey LITTLE GIRL backers!
Reward surveys have been sent out! Two things to keep in mind here:
1 - I generally don't like to send these out so early, because people sometimes move, so I've kept the addresses editable. Please complete yours and, if you move, please update a week before shipping begins! I'll keep you all up to date on that here.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #8: Advance digital copies sent (final to come) along with Vampire Emmy!
updates.update_content:
Hey Little Girl backers!
Just a quick update here. To start...
1) WOOOOH!
We did it! We're funded and the campaign is complete. We didn't quite get to our second stretch goal, but we did manage to add my favorite bonus feature of , conversations with comics creators about their true supernatural experiences. Also, you unlocked a free digital copy of for all backers -- more on that below.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE #7: Stretch Goal UNLOCKED! Less than a day to go!
updates.update_content:
Hey Little Girl backers!
This is my last pre-wrap update. I'll pop back in when we're done, because since the book is already drawn, I want those reward surveys sent out within the week.
Now, big news: we've had a REALLY nice surge of backers come in for the last two days. That means...
STRETCH GOAL #1 IS UNLOCKED!

project_data.project_name: LITTLE GIRL - collecting the horror comic series!

campaign.story:
HOPE is a story that is unlike any other, so we feel like it deserves a release that's unlike any other, too!  You've probably seen the cover to issue number 1 of this series floating around out there already. It looks like this:
Watch for the first issue of HOPE on Free Comic Book Day!
As you can see above, in conjunction with Source Point Press, we're doing something pretty cool with HOPE by releasing the full first issue on Free Comic Book Day, which is a huge event that takes place at nearly every comic book store in the United States on the first Saturday of May.  Free Comic Book Day is EXACTLY what it sounds like: You go to a participating retailer (which is most of them) and you get FREE comics!
That's right, we're making the entire first issue HOPE Volume 1 FREE to comic fans just by heading to a comic shop on Saturday, May 4th while supplies last. It's not a preview and it's not a #0 issue.  It's the real, bonafide, actual issue #1, and if you like what you read you can then ask the shop to pre-order you the rest of the mini-series, which will then be available for pre-order monthly! We are honored to have this opportunity and look forward to the millions of people who attend Free Comic Book day discovering our work in HOPE for the first time.
But you're here now, though, and it's probably because you know that we, the creators, have cut our teeth in the world of Kickstarter. Maybe you're a fan of PLUME by K. Lynn Smith, or maybe you're a fan of NIGHTMARE WORLD and TALES OF MR. RHEE by Dirk Manning. If you're familiar with our previous Kickstarter launches you know we love Kickstarter, as it has allowed us to build our readership friend-by-friend and pledge-by-pledge via offering our Kickstarter supporters Kickstarter Exclusive versions of our work that are never again made available after the campaigns end...
And that's exactly what we're doing here with this Kickstarter Exclusive Edition of HOPE Volume One: "Mother" from Source Point Press.
The book we're offering through this campaign gives backers the entire first mini-series (Issues #1-6) collected in one gorgeous Kickstarter Exclusive edition of HOPE Volume 1. Through this campaign, you can pre-order the entire first arc almost two months before we begin releasing the series in a monthly single-issue format! 
The number of Kickstarter Exclusive upgrades this book receives (hardcover, wrap-around cover, UV spot gloss, extra pages of content, etc.) is completely dependent on how many Stretch Goals we unlock, so pledge accordingly and tell your friends about this campaign too! Remember, the more people back this campaign, the more everyone gets in Stretch Goal bonuses!
(For those of you wondering, that's why we're not showing the cover yet... because, hey, the amount of support the book is going to get will determine how fancy the cover, for starters, will be!)
Julie Lavelle enjoys a secret life moonlighting as an unregistered Ultra known as Hope… until a car accident with her husband and daughter changes everything in an instant.
Co-created by K. Lynn Smith (PLUME) and Dirk Manning (NIGHTMARE WORLD, TALES OF MR. RHEE), HOPE offers readers a story in the superhero genre unlike any other, taking an unflinching and uncompromising look at parenting, heroism, the law, the media, and even womanhood through the lens of heroic fiction in a new six-issue mini-series published by Source Point Press.
Combining powerful storytelling with dynamic art, HOPE offers readers a story of unrelenting emotional resonance and explosive action about a hero whose life is changed forever when her identity is exposed to the world at large, including both all those who adore her as well as those who would seek to do her and her family harm.
Combining the gravitas of comic series such as SAGA with the instant accessibility of films such as THE INCREDIBLES, HOPE is a comic series that will feel both familiar yet fresh to anyone who reads it.
Here's a peek at the first five pages:
T SHIRT IMAGE!!!! Available in sizes up to 4X with a $25 addition to your pledge or as it's own reward tier with a copy of the book!

 Dirk Manning is the writer/creator of series including NIGHTMARE WORLD, TALES OF MR. RHEE, LOVE STORIES (TO DIE FOR), TWIZTID: HAUNTED HIGH-ONS and more as well as the author of WRITE OR WRONG: A WRITER’S GUIDE TO CREATING COMICS.
When not relentless sampling ice cream across the country as part of his seemingly non-stop presence on the comic convention circuit he can be found at www.DirkManning.com or across almost all social media platforms @DirkManning.
K. Lynn Smith is an artist and writer from the Mid-Michigan area. Her artwork has won the Michigan Press Award, as well as the Helen Victoria Haynes World Peace Cartoon Contest She is the writer and artist of the western comic PLUME, and has been involved with projects such as GARFIELD, the Strength in Numbers Studios's video game, TUEBOR, AFTERGLOW written by Pat Shand, and HOPE, co-created with Dirk Manning.
Find more of K. Lynn's work at www.klynnsmith.net, or follow her on Twitter @KLynnTweets.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
K. Lynn Smith, Dirk Manning, and Source Point Press all have A LOT of experience with Kickstarters, including dealing with unexpected delays caused by hurricanes, printer malfunctions, etc. We have factored every imaginable scenario into our production and delivery schedule and will be personally involved in making sure that, as always, everyone gets what they have pledged for. Furthermore, we understand the importance of communication and transparency, both of which remain of the utmost importance to us as creators and publishers. We will keep everyone informed via routine but not overwhelming updates and will remain accessible for specific questions throughout and following the campaign. This ain't our first rodeo, and we're ready to make sure that everyone who pledges will be happy they did so when they get their "Big Box o' Hope" delivered to their front (or back) door!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

FACT: Dirk Manning’s Kickstarter campaigns for creator-owned comics have raised over $100,000 to date. FACT: He’s also written over ten full graphic novels to date! FACT: Pledging here will get you a one-hour personal Skype consultation with Dirk Manning in which he can help you design your Kickstarter campaign *or* he can help you flesh out that story you’ve always wanted to write, reviewing/editing a script you’ve already written. You’ll also get a signed copy of WRITE OR WRONG: A WRITER’S GUIDE TO CREATING COMICS *AND* a copy of the HOPE Volume 1: "Mother” Kickstarter Exclusive Collection to boot! After all, that’s why you’re here in the first place, right?
INCLUDES:
Digital Hope Volume 1: Mother
Hope Volume 1: Mother physical book
Dirk Consult
Write Or Wrong Physical Copy

support.title: I WAS THERE THAT DAY...
support.descp:
HOPE to be extra famous? At this level YOU will be drawn into HOPE Volume 1 in a small, supporting-yet-speaking role. You’ll even get to decide if you will live or die in the story! You’ll also get everything at the LOOK THAT'S ME level, too, because, hey, you’re famous, as well as a hi-resolution copy of the page upon which you appear (and speak) on to print and/or frame as you see fit! (Note: We pick the scene and the dialogue – but we’ll make it good!)
INCLUDES:
Digital Hope Volume 1: Mother
Drawn in + page file
HOPE enamel pin
Hope Volume 1: Mother physical book

A picture is worth a thousand words...
And also three "lost" updates in a row! *weeps*

Hey all! Dirk Manning here! While everyone else I know is at a convention this weekend (go see K. Cool? Cool! Let's do it!

campaign.story:
To quote Hamilton: 
AURORA & THE EAGLE #1 is a deeply personal project.  Series creator Ashley Victoria Robinson has had this tucked away as a passion project for a long time. It was always intended to by an Original Graphic Novel. However, this year, as Ashley enters the final stages of becoming an American Citizen, she decided to write a comic about a Canadian Superhero experiencing a similar journey.
Ashley has brought a team together to give life to the first chapter of AURORA & THE EAGLE in the hopes that you would want to invest in Aurora’s story, her story, and their shared future. The funds raised by this Kickstarter campaign will go to cover the production costs of the issue and rewards.
 Meet AURORA & THE EAGLE #1 a 20 page YA comic book issue encompassing the first chapter of what will be a larger graphic novel written by Canadian-immigrant-to-America, Ashley Victoria Robinson. You’ve probably seen Ashley on the internet, often speaking about her Canadian identity on shows like Collider Heroes, Movie Fights, Comic Boo NOW!, Geek History Lesson and Jawiin. This is her first solo-written comic book following 2015’s Apollo IX #1 for Top Cow Productions. Prior she has co-written two graphic novels with her writing partner (and husband), Jason Inman, including: 2018’s Jupiter Jet from Action Lab Entertainment and 2019’s Science! through Bedside Press (also owned by a Canadian!).
Both Jupiter Jet and Science! came to life through the power of Kickstarter and more than doubled their original goals.
She is joined by fellow Canadian Emmanuelle Chateauneuf (Queen Street, Saint Anthony’s School for Misplaced Children), former DC Comics letterer Carlos M. Mangual (Nightwing, Batman and Robin, Action Comics), and digital artist Sa Vu (a.k.a. Lightning Strikes). 
(If you want to know more about Ashley’s previous comic work check out the Jupiter Jet IGN review!)
What if you were the biggest superhero swimming in your small pond, until you suddenly got dropped in the ocean of the world’s most elite heroes?
Aurora Borealis is Canada’s best superhero. She harnesses the powers of the Northern Lights to do everything from taking out maple syrup thieves dressed in hockey gear to preserving Natural Resources and her nation’s cultural identity from high-level political villains. Things are going swimmingly for her in the Great White North, until she is invited to become something more.
The Eagle (The United States’ best superhero), shows up in Canada one day to recruit Aurora to The Unity League - which is only the greatest superhero team in the known universe. Each nation is represented on The Unity League and, like Aurora, their unique power sets reflect their respective national identity. Since the death of Canada’s previous representative (Ed Fitzgerald, who possessed impressive water powers), there’s been a power vacuum. The Eagle was placed in charge of training Fitzgerald’s replacement. Who wouldn’t want to go train under a big, strong, scary, American stranger, right?
Aurora’s training is set to take place at The Eagle’s home in the United States, which marks not only a change of scenery, but the very first time Aurora has ever left her home country. Her mentor isn’t exactly the kindest, softest teacher and in a completely new locale Aurora is forced to define just what it means to her to be Canada’s best superhero.
Will Aurora come to a working balance with her identity, her powers, and her new partner? Probably. Is she worthy of replacing Ed Fitzergerald on The Unity League? Maybe. When she learns The Eagle is more fallible than he first appeared will they grow to a new understanding? You bet! It’s not until Aurora is forced away from everything she has drawn strength from that she will truly come into her own.
This Kickstarter is about a comic book telling the story of a bright-eyed Canadian girl moving to America and growing into the woman she was destined to be. Aurora is going to have to do some serious leveling up if she wants to make it out of the book alive!
Aurora’s story is an exploration of what it means to embrace dueling identities (girl and woman, civilian and superhero, Canadian and American), and the struggles that come along with such a monumental change of scenery at such a young age. Ashley was 20 when she first moved to the United States - she’s not 20 anymore.
Chateauneuf was a happy addition to AURORA & THE EAGLE who joined the project after a round of enthusiastic emails. She brings dynamic and whimsical art to the page rending the story in ways Robinson could never have imagined. Mangual is a friend of Robinson’s she has wanted to collaborate with for a long time who, fortunately, was able to step up to the plate and lend his expertise and precise workmanship when he was most needed.
Want to know something awesome? AURORA & THE EAGLE #1 is already COMPLETE! That’s right! The grey-scale art, the letters, the cover, and the formatting is 100% done. This means we are looking to fund rewards & shipping out to you. Since this book is 100% creator-owned, there’s no publisher financing. We, the creators, are responsible for all costs involved in making this first installment of AURORA & THE EAGLE. Due to the unique nature of this Kickstarter, Ashley will not be taking a wage, but everyone else who has collaborated with her will be paid for their hard work.
Our goal is to gauge audience interest in the full story of AURORA, THE EAGLE, ED FITZGERALD, and the rest of the international crew of THE UNITY LEAGUE. With this in mind, if you’ve enjoyed any of Ashley’s previous projects (Science!, Jupiter Jet, Terrific & Thief, Love is Love Anthology, Geek History Lesson, The Red Shirt Diaries), please support this unique step forward into creator-owned comic book creation. 
AURORA & THE EAGLE #1 will only come to life with your support, we have some fantastic rewards for you, AND REMEMBER: you’re only charged if we make our funding goal. As of right now, there are no solid plans in place about where or when AURORA & THE EAGLE #1 will continue. This Kickstarter is the only way you get get this issue. Make sure to not miss out on Aurora’s first flight!
Money earned will go to covering fees, production, postage, printing of the collection. All Kickstarter funds are to support our artist, letterer, cover artist and more! Any leftover money will be used to continue making the AURORA & THE EAGLE Graphic Novel ...maybe some back-ups by other creators? A variant cover? All money will go back into the book, period. 
LOOK, MORE ART!

AURORA & THE EAGLE #1! You get AURORA & THE EAGLE #1! in digital form with it’s full greyscale glory crammed full of country-specific jokes and Golden Age inspiration for you to dive into! All the POSTCARDS comes signed by Ashley V. Robinson and the PRINTS are Exclusively Numbered!
 EXCLUSIVE PRINT! You can get and EXCLUSIVE NUMBERED PRINT from internet phenom Sa Vu (Lightning Strikes), and DC Comics artist George Kambadais (The Vampire Diaries, The Double Life of Miranda Turner).
ADVICE FROM A COLLABORATOR! You can have your comic script reviewed by writer Jason Inman (Jupiter Jet, Science!)!
ADVICE FROM A YOUNG ANIMAL WRITER! You can have your 20 page comic script reviewed by writer Magdalene Visaggio (Kim & Kim, Eternity Girl)! 
ADVICE FROM AN EDITOR! You can have your 20 page comic script reviewed by writer Heather Antos (Marvel Comics, Valiant Comics)! 
ADVICE FROM A TV WRITER! You can have your 20 page comic script reviewed by writer Lamont Magee (Black Lightning)! 
ADVICE FROM A WONDER TWIN! You can have six pages of your artwork reviewed by DC Comics artist Stephen Byrne (Mera: Tidebreaker, Wonder Twins)!
ADVICE FROM A TV CONCEPTUAL ARTIST! You can have six pages of your artwork reviewed by DCTV artist Andy Poon (Arrow, The Flash)!
ADVICE FROM A MARKETING GENIUS! You can have a 60 minute marketing session with new media star B.J. Mendelson (Social Media is Bulshit, A National Story of Minor Significance)!
ADVICE FROM THE GREEN LANTERN! You can have six pages of your artwork reviewed by DC Comics artist Liam Sharpe (Wonder Woman, The Green Lantern)!


JOIN AURORA IN THE FUTURE! BE IN THE GRAPHIC NOVEL! Your likeness will be drawn into the full AURORA & THE EAGLE Graphic Novel. The Damsel Level offers you a chance to be saved by Aurora, herself, out in the field. Lastly, The United League Member level will get you your choice of remaining countries to represent as a member of The Unity League who will join Aurora in her final fight. (countries to be assigned first-come-first-served according to the date of donation) You could play a pretty important part to this series as a whole!
Ashley Victoria Robinson is a Canadian hobbit now living in the United States. Her comic book writings have been published through DC Comics/IDW, Top Cow, Action Lab Comics, Bedside Press, Not Forgotten Comics, and Colonial Comics. She is the host of the Geek History Lesson podcast, any number of shows for the youtube channels including: Jawiin, Nerd Alert, Geek Bomb, Collider, Screen Junkies, DC All-Access, Comicbook.com, Geek & Sundry, Hyper RPG, Major Spoilers and many more. She is the co-creator of Jupiter Jet, Science!, and The Red Shirt Diaries (alongside Jason Inman), and has been featured in several international commercial campaigns including Intel alongside The Big Bang Theory's Jim Parsons. Follow her antics on Twitter & Instagram @AshleyVRobinson
Emmanuelle Chateauneuf is a passionate old soul who cares too much, is genuinely eccentric, and is on a whole, a general weirdo. With one foot planted firmly in her subconscious and the other kept sufficiently skimming the ground, the fresh-faced creator lives merrily alongside her mannequin/roommate, Kyoko, in their mystical flat of no name. Her work includes features in The Feathertale Review, Captain Canuck, her online comic strip series, ‘The Daily Comics’, and her first graphic novel, 'Queen Street'. Emmanuelle is currently imagineering her second graphic novel while working as a freelance comic creator and educator in the arts.
 Carlos M. Mangual Originally  born on the tropical island of Puerto Rico, Carlos M. Mangual has been a  lover of all things comic-books, video games, and sci-fi for the last  three decades. He’s been lettering comic-books for  almost 10 years now. Eight of those years were spent at DC Comics as a  member of their in-house lettering department where he honed his skills  as a narrative production artist as well as the department’s  supervisor. 
As  well as a being a comic book letterer, he’s also the creator of A Self  Portrait Comic, a slice-of-life autobiographical romantic comedy, which  he both wrote and illustrated.
Carlos now takes on freelances lettering and design gigs under Social Myth Studios. He currently resides in Glendale, CA.
Sa Vu (Lightning Strikes) is a freelance artist and designer in Sydney who works predominately in digital art. She holds a B. degree in Visual Communications from the University Technology, Sydney. She is recognised for her loose and expressive line art and sunset-inspired colour palettes.
Her work has appeared at a number of conventions, festivals, and advertisements with clients including SMASH con, Klasse14, Toranoana, and Fairfield City Council.
When Sa isn’t drawing, she’s amassing a collection of potted plants and binging Netflix cartoons.
Our biggest thank-you for all your support. We tip our hats to you if you have read this far. You're a superstar. 
 Email us at auroraandtheeagle@gmail.com for any questions or inquiries.  
NOTE: If you contribute to this project you acknowledge that the comic and any other perks you receive come "as is", and may not look exactly as presented here as some designs may change over the due course of production.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of the creators involved in this project are professionals with years of experience and excellent records in making tough deadlines. The best part? The entire issue is completed! All that remains is for the funds to clear and rewards to be sent out. Of course, unavoidable personal mishaps, acts of God, global disruption, or the death of National Superheroes could throw us off schedule, and we will keep Kickstarter backers updated if we do encounter any delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Datura is as if Jyn Erso from Star Wars: Rogue One was a bounty hunter and had an annoying kid sister who insisted on tagging along and causing havoc on every mission. Datura is a sci-fi action adventure comic with a blend of the film Blade Runner and Tokyo Ghost (Image Comics). The world is inhabited by humans, aliens, and animal-human hybrids. 
My name's Trevor Talbott (writer) and I co-created Datura with Diego Olortegui (pencils/inks) back in late 2015. I currently have three successful Kickstarters under my name for comics Child Number Four (one issue) and Eclipse (three issues). 
Diego Olortegui is currently working on Marvel's X-23. He's also provided pencils on What If? Spider-Man, Slapstick, Ms. Marvel, She-Hulk and Infinity Countdown: Captain Marvel and others.
Gab Contreras is the ever so talented colorist on the book and provides the logo and graphic design throughout the issue. She's also worked on the 2000 AD Sci-Fi Special 2018 (2000 AD), All We Ever Wanted: Stories of a Better World (A Wave Blue World Inc), A Princess of Mars (webcomic), and many others.
The letterer on the book is J Wright, who's the writer/artist for his creator owned series UnDead End and currently is providing the pencils on Cullen Bunn's new series titled Super Clean which was recently picked up as a TV series at The CW.
Datura #1
Currently, Issue #1 of Datura is inked, colored, lettered - DONE!. This Kickstarter will assist with getting the book into as many hands as possible as well as printing and shipping costs. 
Most importantly, it'll provide the funds for the pencils/inks/colors/letters for Issue #2! 
Some of the rewards we're offering are digital and physical copies, sketches, and the opportunity to be drawn into issue #2 as a background character! Another cool reward will include an UnWrapped edition of Datura #1 which is an all penciled version with character designs in the back of the book! 
Sketch Examples by Diego Olortegui
Datura is a bounty hunter for her handler, Winema, who helped guide Datura and her sister, Dahlia, after the death of their father. The pulse of the story is the relationship between sisters. Dahlia insists on tagging along her big sisters jobs and helps out the best she can. This causes a huge rift between the two as Datura doesn't want her dangerous lifestyle to be Dahlia's too. She must come to grips with Dahlia becoming her own person and allowing her to make her own decisions without pushing her away completely. 
Datura and Dahlia interfere on a bounty and in turn become the target of rival hunter, Kerivoul, and his handler and mob boss, Mr. Behr. Datura must rely on her sister in order for both of them to survive the wrath of an enemy who can attack freely and within the laws because he has judges in his pocket who've built this newly developed criminal justice system.
Behr & Kerivoul
I started toying with the story of Datura in early 2015 and began posting to message boards late 2015 with the general concept and outline for Datura. I really wanted this to be a collaborative effort and didn't want to be too set in my way of thinking on how this story or the world of Datura could work. I also had no clue I'd be so lucky to have gotten a response from such a talented creator and artist such as Diego Olortegui. 
Diego was one of the first artists to reach out and I remember being totally blown away by his DeviantArt page. We exchanged some ideas for the main players and he went to work on a few concept designs. In my experience, when I've been provided with concept designs they're typically a lone body shot with the characters name scribbled somewhere on the page. Here's Diego's:
Datura Character Design by Diego Olortegui
 Umm...yeah. My mind exploded when these started making their way into my inbox. It was at this moment I knew there wasn't any other artist or creator working on this book other than Diego. You can tell he loves what he does by how he provided multiple incarnations of the character and the all out presentation.
Datura #1 : Pages 1 & 2
Datura #1 : Pages 3 & 4
Thanks for your support and don't forget to follow the project and their creators on social media:
Twitter:
@DaturaComic

@TheJWrightStuff

updates.update_content:
I want to again thank you all for believing in this project like I did. You all gave me the opportunity to try to bring one of my story ideas to life. I'm sorry that I haven't updated you more often as we worked on the project. 
As you know, Diego has been working for Marvel throughout this time. Unfortunately, at this time we do not think we'll be able to complete the project. I can not tell you how disappointed I am that we wont be able to bring this project to life for you like I hoped. 
I've reached out to Kickstarter to see how I can go about getting you all refunded. As soon as I hear back from them I'll be sure to let you know. If you haven't already, I recommend updating your Kickstarter profile payment options so that when I do hear from Kickstarter we will be able to get you your refund without any errors.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for all of you support

campaign.story:
You wrap your bandana around your mouth as you bolt towards the general store. The dust is coming hard and fast, and today is not the day you drown in it. You burst through the doors, slamming them shut before the loud blast of dust blackens the windows. 
Something is wrong. More wrong than usual. As you cough and spit mud, your dry eyes scan what’s left of your settlement. The Grave Diggers, the stench of decay clinging to their clothes, huddle together next to the Undertaker and their own sharp, chemical stink and sallow skin. The Preacher eyes you and mouths empty prayers. The Barber, Drifter, and Gambler surround the Barback, drinking as though the poison they swallow will be the last liquid to ever pass their lips.
You grab a seat - and though there are more empty chairs than filled ones Loam, the Wrapped Madman of the Northern Hill, claims the seat next to you. 
Your skin itches and burns. Loam’s heady scent of brush sage and secrets twisting your thoughts and memories. He reaches impossibly deep into his poncho and removes a tattered black book. The journal of Loam. His brittle fingers struggle for purchase on the page - the wrappings that cover them long since rendered useless by the air and sun - but he finally finds the prophecy he’s been searching for…
“It will get worse.”  
- The journal of Loam, wrapped Madman of the Northern Hill.
Cover art not final.
Casket Land is a bleak occult western RPG game meant to be played with friends in just one session. The game is Powered by the Apocalypse engine and focuses on making difficult decisions as a group.
A brutal cross of Southwestern Gothic, the Dust Bowl, Mad Max and Vampire Hunter D, Casket Land centers around a dying town cut off by rows of caskets and vicious monsters unearthed by extreme drought and brutal winds. You are not valiant heroes in Casket Land - you are just trying to survive of the end times. 
Casket Land zine features everything you need to play including 32 pages, stapled with a cardstock cover and filled with thematic character classes, unconventional weapons, brutal monsters, darkly beautiful illustrations, and the pre-written adventure FROM OUT OF THE NEST. 
Interior Page
“They were gathered there, the few whose lungs could stand against the onslaught of screaming and the debris that would soon fill them. Their task lead them through the blackened, pine-pitted earth. Bringing back survivors of The Sage Hen and her Flock was secondary to their main task - reclaiming access to the ley lines and the water sources attached took precedence” 
Unsavory survivalists and vicious monsters inhabit Casket Land. Every player will choose a class to represent them during the game, each with its own skill... and weakness.
Character Classes
Stretch Goals
STRETCH GOALS. 
We survive together, or not at all. Casket Land exists because you want it to. The more souls we convince to tread here, the more options will be made available to us all. Some of our stretch goals are social, some are monetary. All can be had if we work together.  
 As campaign goals are met more art will be revealed! My hope is that through continued support, Casket Land can grow over time from a single zine into many tomes, complete with more adventures, monsters, atmospheric illustrations, and character classes.   
Risk.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Printing delays and delivery errors are the two biggest risks we run with this project. The art and campaign are completed but in all things what is outside of our control poses the biggest risk. That said, we are working with reliable stateside printers at Pinball Publishing in Portland, OR and hope to deliver this project promptly upon campaign completion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
