campaign.story:
HI, I'M BEN BISHOP.
You may know me from the original AGGREGATE Kickstarter campaign back in 2015, or DRAWING BLOOD with Kevin Eastman, or my book, NATHAN THE CAVEMAN, or my work on the TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES, or maybe you don’t know me at all!
I came to Kickstarter in 2015 with a dream to once again get back to writing and drawing stories that were all my own, and you all showed me with your support that you wanted that too. The amazing part was, because of Kickstarter and the crowdfunding structure, so many of you helped shape what the story actually became, lots of you, and your CATS, were actually IN the book. I didn’t want to just make my comics alone... 
I wanted to make them with all of you. ♥
With your support, through Kickstarter pre-order pledges and social media shares, I’ll be able to once again, hunker down to draw, print, self-publish and ship out this epic 200 plus page sequel, THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2. 
Check out all the awesome rewards and ways that you can not only get the book, but be a part of it, by being one of the very first to help make THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2 a reality.
Here are some of my favorite...
 See all the guest artist originals and prints HERE.
I’ll never be able to adequately thank you all enough for once again helping me to tell this story, but I CAN use your enthusiasm, and support to make the best damn book I’m capable of and deliver it directly to you, the ones who showed up to the party early and made the whole thing possible.
To add...
◊ AGGREGATE ISSUE #0  --- Increase pledge by $10 USA / $20 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 1 --- Increase pledge by $25 USA / $45 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ ISSUE #0 & BOOK 1 DIGITAL PDFS --- Increase pledge by $10 EVERYWHERE.
◊ ADDITIONAL AGGREGATE BOOK 2 --- Increase pledge by $25 USA / $45 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 2  CHRIS JOHNSON COVER --- Increase pledge by $40 USA / $60 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 2 MATEUS SANTOLOUCO COVER --- Increase pledge by $40 USA / $60 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 2 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE COVER --- Increase pledge by $50 USA / $70 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ ANY PRINT --- Increase pledge by $10 USA / $20 EVERYWHERE ELSE PER PRINT.
◊ A SHIRT --- Increase pledge by $30 USA / $40 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ A PUZZLE --- Increase pledge by $50 USA / $60 EVERYWHERE ELSE PER PUZZLE.
◊ A MINI FIGURE --- Increase pledge by $90 EVERYWHERE.
◊ MP3 SOUNDTRACK --- Increase pledge by $10 EVERYWHERE.
◊ KEVIN EASTMAN METAL PRINT --- Increase pledge by $20 USA / $40 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is technically my 4th Kickstarter, my 1st being THE AGGREGATE, my 2nd, (although it wasn’t under my name) DRAWING BLOOD, and my 3rd, NATHAN THE CAVEMAN. I am very responsive to messages, comments and questions and will make myself available to answer any concerns whenever they arise.
 
DEADLINE: 
I believe I’ve given myself a realistic amount of time to draw over 200 pages, hire a colorist, put the book together, print, and ship the book and all rewards. I greatly underestimated the budget and timeline on THE AGGREGATE BOOK 1, but still found a way to bring it to life. With BOOK 2 I’m being careful to not do that again, and to be realistic with the time and money these books take to make. That being said, sometimes unexpected things happen, and I am very appreciative of backers that understand those situations. I was lucky to have had zero complaints from AGGREGATE BOOK 1 supporters, as they understood I was working on the book every single day. I promise to NEVER leave anyone in the dark as to what’s going on with the progress of the project. If something comes up, you will be well in the loop. This estimated deadline of March 2021, of course doesn’t factor in the addition of any possible unlocked stretch goals like added pages, variant covers, or AGGREGATE APPENDAGES, which of course could potentially extend the workload.
 
PRINTING: 
Over the last several years, I’ve developed a great relationship with an amazing printer right here in the USA, who I’ve used many times now, with a mind blowing quick turnaround. Once the book is completed, I have no doubts about the quality of the printed final product.
 
SHIPPING: 
Shipping is going up every single day in different areas, and the rules are always changing. I’ll be shipping books media mail when possible to keep the domestic prices as low as possible. Unfortunately media mail is not an option for international packages. Here is the cold hard (sad) truth. A single copy of this book will weigh at least 2 lbs. The minimum cost for a single book to go first class outside the USA is $23, 2 books is $48, and 3 books is now priority at $68! So my shipping costs are real. I lost a lot on previous campaigns by underestimating shipping costs and am trying really hard not to do that again. I want to make the book available to all you international supporters though, so the option is available for almost every reward tier, but I felt I needed to let you know that the high shipping costs are the actual prices.
 
Please feel free to reach out to me with any questions you may have. I take crowdfunding very seriously and would never risk ruining my reputation on a project I didn’t believe in or didn’t 100% think was possible to fulfill. 
 
Thank you for being a part of THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2 and making it possible for self publishing creators like me to JUST MAKE COMICS and deliver them direct to the readers with a platform like Kickstarter.
 
-Ben Bishop
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
No one ever expected it to last this long, or that it would be this bad... But the human race is now  entering the second dreadful year of a global pandemic. Our algorithmic overlords attempt to help us cope by spoon-feeding minute by minute sponsored ads in an effort to heal our minds with "retail therapy"... But the relief is temporary.

Blockbuster films and live concerts from our living rooms, the Golden Globes in pajamas, bubble tent breweries, elbow bumps for the rest of your life and even snowstorms in Texas...

Hi everyone, Ben Bishop here.
I hope you are all doing as well as can be with everything going on in the world right now. Writing and drawing books about the apocalypse is way more fun than living in one...
Apologies for the long gap between updates, that’s not how I like to operate, and I’m going to make it a point to bother you all much more often. Hopefully most of you follow me and the book on social media ( @bishart , @theaggregatebook , @splitdecisioncomics ) and know that I haven’t disappeared and am still squeezing out as much work every day as I can.

updates.update_userinfo: LAST CALL FOR DRAWING BLOOD VOLUME 2!
updates.update_content: LESS THAN 2 HOURS!

updates.update_userinfo: A BEHIND THE SCENES LOOK AT MY SCRIPTS & DRAWING BLOOD VOLUME 2!
updates.update_content:
Hey there Aggregators!
Ben Bishop here! As some of you know I also draw this other really cool book called DRAWING BLOOD! It's co-created by none other than one of my absolute heroes and biggest inspirations of my whole life... Kevin Eastman, the co-creator of the TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES!

updates.update_userinfo: What’s up, what’s up, what’s up?
updates.update_content:
Hey there Aggregate fans. 
Apologies for the lack of big updates lately, I always feel bad for my massive social media spamming during the campaign, so once it ends I figure we all could use a break from the emails! 
But honestly there hasn’t been much to show visually. Although the BOOK 2 script was written when I wrote BOOK 1, it had been a long time since I’d gone back and read through it. So I’m doing so I found a lot of areas I could re-write to make better, or areas where I could actually add in some SPLIT DECISION threads and write those. There’s even a whole new arc that I’ve written that comes from one of the early TO BE CONTINUED endings in BOOK 1 because that particular ending was never actually written! I forgot I had added some stuff WHILE I was drawing the pages, and they never even had a script to go with them. So BOOK 2 is shaping up to be even bigger and longer than I thought it would be.
That’s it!
Good morning! Happy Sunday!

Holy guac! We did it!
The $50K STRETCH GOAL is now UNLOCKED!
This is it folks! Down to less than 24 hours left!

project_data.project_name: THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2 - The Split Decision Comic continues

campaign.story:
How does a nation struggling with a history of racial inequality cope in a world where only black people have superpowers? 
THEODORE MANN, whose family exploited empowered blacks for centuries, is now President of the United States. Mann’s administration has exacted controversial measures to deal with the empowered he’s deemed terrorists and is stoking national tensions to win public support for MANN FIRST, a cybernetically-augmented soldier program led by his son, THADDEUS.
The main person standing in the President’s way is X –  once known as Kareem Jenkins – who has become a symbol of resistance against the Mann Administration. X’s one-man opposition has thwarted Mann’s efforts both public and private, drawing attention away from X’s teammates in THE PROJECT so they can save empowered blacks from government capture.
Thaddeus wants X dead by his own hands in order to destroy the spirits of empowered opposition and win the favor of his father’s support base. Taking down his perceived rival would finally allow him to step out of his father’s shadow and usher in a new era of the Mann dynasty – under his leadership. 

 BLACK could not have happened without all of our backers, and Kickstarter was essential. The experience was awesome, afforded us amazing opportunities, and taught us some valuable lessons. Our goal remains to tell entertaining stories from black perspectives that increase authentic representation in the comics industry. 
Strides have been made and we're happy to see a burgeoning black renaissance in media. However, there’s still much to be done about having agency in the black narrative. That means challenging the structure and examining what upholds inequalities and holds humanity back from our ideals in comics – and in reality.
We saw how those opposed to BLACK reacted to the idea of black people authoring how we are portrayed in media, which is why we think WHITE is an important part of the overarching world we're building. 
We’ve been lucky to build our world with full agency at Black Mask Studios, but to continue telling stories the way we want, we need to keep challenging ourselves, and publishing paradigms, by making these special variant editions of WHITE, and all six issues at once, exclusively available through this crowdfunding campaign. (If you are a retailer, you  will be able to order standard-edition periodicals directly from Black Mask once rewards ship.) 
That’s right – the ONLY way to get your hands on these copies of WHITE is through this Kickstarter.  
During our previous campaign and over the course of making comics, we learned a lot – about what readers want, about what we want, and about how to get it to people. So, we decided on four very specific and very limited rewards for fans, collectors, bingers, and retailers.     
That’s it! We felt very strongly about focusing solely on comics in formats unique to backers, readers’ preferences, and retailers’ needs. With your support, these will be very special editions. The only other people who will have a few copies are the creative contributors who helped make them. 
 Because the campaign for WHITE  is all about providing fans with actual exclusives, we want to sweeten the rewards by offering additional Issue One periodical variants as we reach specific backer milestones. Each stretch goal will add a new cover to the mix and divide the number of covers, making issues rarer.    
 Some amazing artists – whose names you might recognize – Ashley A. Wood, Jamal Igle, Jeremy Love, ChrisCross, Sanford Greene, and the LEGENDARY Denys Cowan have each offered to do a bespoke cover for issue one. Each stretch goal will add a new cover to the mix and divide the number of covers, making books rarer. So please spread the word to back us and increase the rarity of your cover.
*Distribution of variant periodicals will be random. Backers will not be able to choose which cover they receive but variants will be split evenly among backers. 
Now, we know we have some superfans who are going to want to get their hands on everything. Once all the variant covers are unlocked – we will offer two more rewards that include the original rewards.


 Kwanza Osajyefo, Tim Smith 3, Jamal Igle, Khary Randolph, Sarah Litt, Derwin Roberson, and Dave Sharpe return to produce the graphic novel, WHITE – the second part of the trilogy that began with the critically acclaimed graphic novel, BLACK. 
The original team of creators from BLACK are returning, along with our terrific toner, Derwin Roberson, letterer extraordinaire David Sharpe, and new to the team, Juan Castro! 
 Our production timeline is already underway to ensure that we get books out to backers with minimal hiccups. Your support will make certain that our team can concentrate on bringing you a jaw-dropping sequel to the comic that asked, “What if only black people had superpowers?”
 Issue One variant of WHITE is estimated to be delivered to backers October 2019. The limited edition variant of the graphic novel and retailer bundles will ship to backers in February 2020.  
 A majority of the funds are for production, printing fees, shipping and fulfillment costs, plus taxes.
We’re super excited to welcome our fans back to the story, and welcome aboard new readers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of our returns go directly back into making more books that reflect an authentic black experience through comics. Our goal remains to foster agency in our narratives and increase the representation of black characters across the diaspora, and it’s only through your continued support that we are able to do so undeterred.

We learned a lot from our previous campaign, mainly that readers just want a book above all other rewards – so that is all we are focused on with this campaign. Feedback made it clear that a simplified Kickstarter with a limited run of exclusive editions would give backers rewards no one else will have.

Additionally, though a lot of planning went into our last campaign, we couldn’t anticipate the enthusiasm that would result in having two people mailing out not hundreds, but thousands, of books. To that end, we’ve revised calculations and thoroughly researched successful campaigns and Kickstarter-recommended fulfillment partners to ensure logistics are seamless. 

This will also allow us to focus on making comics and engaging with our supporters. WHITE is already in production and we want to make sure our collaborators are compensated fairly for their dedication to the project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I want to express my support for Kickstarter staff, who are working to form a union. The success of this and so many Kickstarter projects is due in part to the hard work of the company’s employees, and I believe in their right to unionize.
At this time, union organizers are not calling for a boycott. Instead, they’re asking supporters to raise their voices and make our solidarity known. Here’s how we can help:
email Kickstarter’s senior leadership:
kickstarter-sot[at]kickstarterunited.org

“With a world divided who do you turn to? If this is the end, who will you be?”

August 28, 2019, Our pals Stranger Comics launch an opportunity on Kickstarter to get the exclusive copy of THE UNTAMED: Still a Fool issue #1. This the third Volume in the series, which is in development at HBO with creator Sebastian A. Jones co-writing and Executive Producing (with Prentice Penny of INSECURE), as part their Asunda library deal. Also available on the campaign are beautiful hardcovers for THE UNTAMED: Killing Floor, NIOBE: She is Death Volume, and all previous titles.

campaign.story:
Hey there, Comics Party People (and other non-comics people who still like to party)!  
Comics creators Claire Connelly and Erica Schultz are known in both indie and mainstream comics circles as the second coming of Kirby and Lee. Maybe not, but at least in their own heads. They've partnered MANY times to bring the world such delightful stories as The Unauthorized Biography of Winston Churchill: A Documentary and Cheese: A Love Story, as well as "Bishop Takes Rook; Knight Takes Pawn" in the anthology This Nightmare Kills Fascists and Space Man (available here).
Well, they're collaborating again for STRANGE TAILS, starring the sci-fi space opera Eve: The Immortal Lobster!
 Eve is an oversized tale of alien lobsters fighting for freedom! YES! Lobsters and Freedom!  
Art by Claire Connelly
A Captain in the Jastogian Navy on the normally peaceful planet of Uisce, Eve's life is turned upside down when the warmongering Beurre invade her planet in search of Asin (salt). Eve assembles a small group of rebel fighters that make a last ditch effort at survival. The losses are many. Was the price of freedom too high?   
Art by Claire Connelly
Art by Claire Connelly
Claire and Erica are asking for help to fund a print run of Strange Tails, a book not only collecting the brand new, colorful comic Eve: The Immortal Lobster, but ALSO including new TECHNICOLOR editions of the popular favorites The Unauthorized Biography of Winston Churchill: A Documentary and Cheese: A Love Story . 
From Cheese: A Love Story, Art by Claire Connelly, Liana Kangas, and Matt Emmons
You heard that right! Claire and Erica have enlisted the help of Liana Kangas, Matt Emmons, Gab Contreras, and Cardinal Rae to give these stories the Wizard of Oz treatment! (Minus the flying monkeys.) 
From The Unauthorized Biography of Winston Churchill: A Documentary, Art by Claire Connelly and Cardinal Rae
That's 94 pages of full color awesomeness from these two incredible creators, rounding out what is lovingly known as the "Tail Trilogy."  
Cover by Claire Connelly.
A better look at Claire's INCREDIBLE cover! 
Art by Claire Connelly. Not commission for this Kickstarter.
Art by Claire Connelly. Letters by Cardinal Rae.
Art by Claire Connelly. Letters by Cardinal Rae.
Art by Claire Connelly. Letters by Cardinal Rae.
Claire Connelly (Co-Creator/Artist) is a cryptid that roams through the suburbs of New Jersey. She is best known for her off-beat mini comics and zines. Connelly has written, drawn, and published the mini series Black Eyes, Down with the Ship: A collection of Comics, The Long Year, and Bird Song, and is the artist on the series Animals written by Eric Grissom. Claire has illustrated several short stories for mini comics and anthologies, as well has drawn several covers and pin-ups for comics floating in the comic-verse.
Erica Schultz (Co-Creator/Writer) is a comic book writer and editor best known for writing Xena: Warrior Princess and Charmed for Dynamite Entertainment, her participation in DC Comics' first Talent Development Writers Workshop, and the award-winning, creator-owned crime series, M3 with artist Vicente Alcázar. Her latest work includes the Daredevil Annual for Marvel Comics with artist Marcio Takara and Twelve Devils Dancing with artist Dave Acosta for Action Lab Danger Zone. She just might be the Jersey Devil.
Liana Kangas (Colorist) is a freelance comic artist and a self proclaimed edgelord dog mom, working in both digital and traditional formats. With a lifelong love of comics and a professional background in marketing and outreach, she combined the two to pursue a full time career in comics; including being published in 2000 AD's 2018 Sci-Fi Special, Comic Mix's Ringo Award Winning anthology graphic novel Mine! to support Planned Parenthood, Black Mask Studio’s Black AF series Devil’s Dye, and Image Comic's Where We Live.
Matt Emmons (Colorist) is an up and coming comic artist and writer based in the Boston area. Raised on a healthy diet of 80s sci-fi and horror movies, these genres became an integral part of his work. Matt is currently a freelance illustrator that also self publishes his own comics, primarily Gardener,  with several shorter self-contained comics. He also runs a small clothing brand under the name Second at Best, using illustrations for screen printed and embroidered apparel.
Gab Contreras (Colorist) is a graphic designer, colorist, and illustrator from Lima, Peru. She has worked on several books for various publishers, most notably All We Ever Wanted: Stories of a Better World (A Wave Blue World), 2000 AD Summer Special 2018 (2000 AD), A Princess Of Mars, and others. She is also the layout artist and letterer for Editora Vuk, a Peruvian publisher of the Spanish editions of U.S. comic books such as The Walking Dead, Locke & Key, Invincible, Hellboy, and Star Wars.
Cardinal Rae (Letterer) is a letterer and graphic designer with Fenix Works, Inc. in New Jersey. They've worked with Image Comics (Crowded, Rose, Where We Live), DC Comics (The Coming of the Supermen), Dynamite Entertainment (Xena: Warrior Princess), A Wave Blue World (This Nightmare Kills Fascists), Dark Horse (Once Upon A Time Machine), Oneshi Press (Pack, Tracy Queen), and other publishers. They also designs logos for comic books and other comics related things. 
QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS?
You can reach out to Claire or Erica. 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND SUPPORT!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As of this launch, all the line art for Eve: The Immortal Lobster is completed, and both The Unauthorized Biography of Winston Churchill: A Documentary and Cheese: A Love Story are completely colored. There could be unforeseen issues that come up during fulfillment, but we believe we've budgeted enough time to deal with anything that might arise. Should issues arise, all backers will be notified as soon as possible. Claire has run several successful Kickstarter campaigns on her own, and Erica has been a contributor to many others. Between the two of them, they're prepared to get this book out when promised.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The Deadliest Bouquet Kickstarter is Live!!!
updates.update_content:
Hey, Party People!
We hope you're doing well. The Kickstarter for The Deadliest Bouquet is LIVE TODAY!

updates.update_userinfo: THE DEADLIEST BOUQUET COMING TO KICKSTARTER MAY 11!
updates.update_content:
HEY THERE, PARTY PEOPLE!
We hope you're doing well in the craziness that is 2021 so far. 
We wanted to reach out to let you know that Erica is doing a Kickstarter for a new book called The Deadliest Bouquet. 
IN 1998, THREE ESTRANGED SISTERS TRAINED BY THEIR NAZI-HUNTING MOTHER REUNITE TO SOLVE THEIR MOTHER'S MURDER…AND TRY NOT TO KILL EACH OTHER IN THE PROCESS.

Strange Tails is eligible to be nominated for a Ringo Award!
Hey, again, Party People!
We hope you're doing well in these dark times. Claire and I are hunkered down in New Jersey, and Claire is the REAL hero as she continues to work in a grocery store. WE LOVE YOU, CLAIRE!

Hi all, there's tons of stuff to let you know…
First off, there's a new book that comes out next year called The Silver Spurs of Oz. You can pre-order here: https://www.amazon.com/Silver-Spurs-Oz-Graphic-Classic/dp/149659195X
It's a western take on The Wizard of Oz with cool characters along The Yellow Dust Road.

Hey all!
Thanks for the support on Strange Tails. Erica has a new project that came out earlier this month from ComiXology Originals. 
Forgotten Home is an 8 issue urban fantasy series about a Sheriff's Deputy in Montana investigating a rash of child abductions…the one thing all the crime scenes have in common is magic!

Hi all,
We hope you're well, and thanks again for helping to make Strange Tails a reality.
Just to make sure, everyone who is supposed to pick up their rewards at NYCC and Baltimore Comic Con are still on track to do so. If you have a change of plans and are NOT attending the show, please send us a message so we can mail our your rewards.

Hi all,
With the exception of the people we will see at conventions or will hand deliver to, all the rewards should be out and in your lobster claws. If you have NOT received your reward and will NOT be attending a show that Claire and I will be at to pick it up, please let us know!
Thanks so much for all the support!

The long awaited story is here!
Strange Tails is being sent to the printer TODAY! The digital version of the book will be emailed to you.
Now, if you responded to the survey, you'll get the digital link in the email you indicated. If not, it's going to the email you used to register your Kickstarter account.

updates.update_userinfo: OFF TO THE PRINTER NEXT WEEK!
updates.update_content:
EEP!
Strange Tails is off to the printer, Keness, next week! This is terrific news!
Those that pledged for Strange Tails digital rewards and the book will have the digital rewards in your email next week, too!

campaign.story:
The Baboon is the wholesome, pulpy, technicolor, adventure-of-the-month comic you forgot you were missing.
The Baboon is my love letter to the pulp stories of the 40s and 50s. The tone light, fast, and fun. Keeping the vein of the wish fulfillment that runs through the stories of Batman and Robin, Johnny Quest, and Terry and the Pirates. Stories made for all ages. And in this lighter approach tackling some heavier themes, such as: death, adoption, and family life, without having to get too realistic. The Baboon and his team are a family and they act and deal with problems accordingly. They may butt heads, but at the end of the day they love each other. 
The Baboon preview pages
To the world at large, The Baboon is a nothing more than a government myth. A figure of the shadows taking down evils wherever they lurk. To his crew -three of the greatest heroes of their time- he is a man of daring and compassion, who will stop at nothing to defend the world from the greatest evils known to man. But, to his adopted nephew, Jamie, Barton Marlow - The Baboon- is the coolest guy in the whole world. And now in his new life of adventure, Jamie wrestles with being the regular kid he once was and living up to his uncle's expectations. A man whose fantastic exploits are unequaled for narrow escapes, fantastic  adventures, and endless thrills.
 The Mustelid Menace- While in search of the Jackal formula -a super soldier serum that could change the dynamic of the entire world- the baboon is captured by the nefarious Professor Weezal. His only hope of escape is with the help of his amazing crew. But, things are strange on Mount Mustelid and the Jackal formula may be in full effect. Time is of the essence as the Baboon battles his way through armed men and hulking, carnivorous monsters. Let's just hope they never have to go back. 
All this and more in The Baboon's first full length adventure (60 pages of comics awesomeness.) 
The Baboon preview pages cont.
 WHY A HARDCOVER BOOK?
The Baboon is an ongoing series of stories and presented in the European album comics format. Nice, fun, digestible comics for all ages. Like Tin Tin or Lucky Luke. In keeping with this theme the book is going to be presented first in Hardcover. This style of comics gives me the ability to tell a story and not be confined to a traditional comics page count. Also, a pretty Hardcover always looks great on your shelf!
JAMIE is a cartoonist living in Saint Petersburg, Fl. He loves old pulp comics from the 40s and 50s and Dungeons and Dragons. He is so excited to finally get this passion project out into the world. Other works include: Joey Ryan: Big in Japan, Lucha Underground, The Whisper, Dodger, and KICKING ICE! 
more to be added as we get there!

The Last day of Tales of Monkeys Fighting Robots
updates.update_content:
Hey gang!
We are in the last few hours of Tales of Monkeys Fighting Robots Kickstarter! The book is funded. The first stretch goal has been met. But, the more people get on board with this one the better. This book has been so much fun to do and I am super proud of the work that I have been turning out week in and week out. 
CHECK IT OUT! Back if you can. And support indie comics.

updates.update_userinfo: I have a New KICKSTARTER out now!
updates.update_content:
Hey there everyone! Thank you for making the Baboon a great success. If you follow me on social media you may have seen that I do a weekly webcomic with Matt Sardo for monkeysfightingrobots.com.
Matt and I are now doing a Kickstarter to collect the first 20 pages (the first issue) of the strip into one collection. It's gonna be super cool and there are some really fun rewards. Please give it a look if you get the chance and help fund my next Kickstarter project. It's a really fun book and I've had a blast doing it. Hope you dig it!

updates.update_userinfo: NEW PROJECT LIVE ON KICKSTARTER NOW!
updates.update_content:
Hey there gang!
There is a super cool Kickstarter Anthology running on Kickstarter right now that I am apart of. I think I'm good for 6 or 8 pages of the full 64 page book. From the team that brought you the Eisner Award Winning and Diamond Gem Award nominated Puerto Rico Strong Anthology  (Marco Lopez, Derek Ruiz and Neil Schwartz).
Strange Encounters is a 64-page Full Color Trade Paperback Anthology about magic, mystery and the Strange Encounters that happen when you meet beings of the supernatural kind.

If you follow me on the social medias you may have seen me talking about the superbly great funny book, METALSHARK BRO! Well, Walter, Bob, and Kevin are at it again and bringing you more of your favorite demon scored shark man and the second volume of METALSHARK BRO is on Kickstarter now! Go check it out, and if you like what you see back the project. These guys are Kickstarter Veterans and I know personally that they will deliver a great product!
 https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/637571649/metalshark-bro-island-of-misfit-bros?ref=project_facebook&fbclid=IwAR2vof-aXrX9i71ZPX37fv8aFmGI9hNXTQ1qgbzh89NNEIdOFTZyMzycqnk

If you are in the Florida area this post is for you!
I am going to be doing a couple of signings in FL this month. The first is this Saturday, July 6th at Bull Street Comics. I'll be there all day.  Link to the facebook event is:
https://www.facebook.com/events/452921565279517/ 
And I'll be back home at Big Dog Comics (Ft. Pierce) and Famous Faces and Funnies (Melbourne) at the end of the month, July 19th and 20th. Link to the Facebook event:

First off, let me say thank you all that came out to Heroes con and grabbed your copy of the Baboon there. I have been doing Heroes con for 6 years now and this show blew all of the rest out of the water. I met a lot of new fans of the comic last weekend too. Hopefully they will join us all for the next one. 
The books are here Yaaaay! And I am working hard on fulfilling all of the sketches that I have to do in the books so I can still get them out in July as projected. So far, I am still on schedule! There was a slight mix up with the pins (all solved now) and with the mini comics (again all solved now, just waiting on the printer). I hope to start getting books sent out in the mail in the next week!

Hello hello Baboon Crew!
Some very exciting news. The books are almost all done with printing and should be getting to me once I get home from Heroes con (which puts us a little earlier than the July shipping date.) HOWEVER, It looks very likely that I will be getting some of the books shipped early to me for the convention. So, If you are at Heroes in the next couple of weeks you can pick up your copy there! YAY!

Hey there gang!
Sorry for the radio silence. I am currently working hard on a project that has not been announced and I can't talk about, but it is going to be super cool and I can't wait to share it with ya'll.
Not much to say that wasn't mentioned in the previous update. And Kickstarter has taken down their Kickstarter Live feature, so that has thrown a monkey wrench in connecting with this particular outlet.

The time has come friends,
After a little hiccup with getting the money from Kickstarter (completely due to user error...:\ ) the money is in my account and the book has been sent to the printer and we are going to have a comic book! I will be sending out your Kickstarter surveys to get all of your mailing info soon. If you got a sketch with your book the info about who you'd like sketched in your book will be there too.

campaign.story:
Throw Throw Burrito is what you get when you cross a card game with dodgeball. Try to collect matching sets of cards faster than your opponents while simultaneously ducking, dodging, and throwing squishy airborne burritos. The cards you collect earn points, but getting hit by flying burritos loses them. So clear some space and put away the antiques, because you’ve never played a card game quite like this before.
Since we created Exploding Kittens four years ago, we've been making games that bring friends and family together around a table, away from their screens. We brought this game to Kickstarter because we believe that adding a bit of physicality to game night is what comes next.
So, if you're into the idea of party games and weaponized Mexican food, please help us make this game a reality. We think you'll love it as much as we do.
Hugs and missiles,
-Elan, Matt, and the Exploding Kittens Team    
HOW DOES THIS WORK?
No Funding Goals, No Backer Goals, instead we want you to enter the Burrito Bowl! 
Compete in a series of incredible events to test your burrito themed prowess and we’ll upgrade your games for free!
Throw Throw Burrito started when our friend, Brian Spence, pitched a new game idea to us and we immediately fell in love. Over the next eight months, we worked closely with Brian to tune the game, design the cards, and destroy most of the fragile items in our homes.
The game went through many versions.
First, there was the "Mangoes with Animal Heads Phase":
Mango Pug
Then came the flying animal ideas: 
Then fruit: 
Then so many Mexican food ideas:
After finally choosing a name, Matt got to work on the cards: 
Character Exploration
Style Exploration
We wanted to put this project on Kickstarter because it's the fastest way for us to get the game into your hands and make improvements as a community. We think this game is great, but we need your help making it even better.
So if a world full of weaponized Mexican food is a world you want to live in, please back this project and help us build this game. 
With love and mad strafing skills,
- The Exploding Kittens Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge for our team is building the throwables. Since our Exploding Kittens campaign in 2015 (followed by Bears vs Babies, and You've Got Crabs), we've learned a lot about making cards and have shipped over 8 million decks of our games worldwide. But throwables are a new challenge. We're working with the finest toy manufacturers in the world to make sure that we deliver the best materials that are fun to throw (not too light) and don't hurt when they hit you (not too heavy).

It's also very important to us that everyone gets their game on time. We don't want this to be a campaign where you spend the next two years getting fifty emails about production updates and delays. If you back this project, we want you to start throwing burritos at your friends as soon as possible. This is why we're not offering t-shirts or other non-game related reward tiers that would make the distribution process take a lot longer. We're keeping it as simple as possible: support our project and in return we'll send you the game.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp:
Everything in the $20 reward plus a second pack of cards and throwables exclusive to Kickstarter. Each card in the Kickstarter Exclusive Pack features new artwork by The Oatmeal. We will never produce this version of the game again, so this campaign is your only chance to get this exclusive collector's item!
- 2-6 players
- Ages 7+ (Combine any two decks together to double the number of players!)
Free Shipping to the US
- To order multiple bundles, just add $35 for each extra bundle you'd like (extra shipping charges may apply).
INCLUDES:
1 Throw Throw Burrito - Original Edition
1 Throw Throw Burrito - Kickstarter Exclusive Edition
All applicable unlocked Stretch Goals/Upgrades

support.title: Original + KS + Extreme + Prototype
support.descp:
Everything in the $85 reward plus early access to the Throw Throw Burrito Prototype. We'll send you the prototype game we are testing with months before the production versions are ready. We'll need your feedback to make the final version of the game as great as it can be. The prototype game is yours to keep as proof that you were on the team that made it happen (we will ship the production versions of the game as a second delivery).

updates.update_userinfo: Something new for our quarantined backers
updates.update_content: We know a lot of you are backers of Exploding Kittens, and therefore might have already gotten this announcement. We hate sending you an email twice, so here's the super short version for our Throw Throw Burrito backers:

updates.update_userinfo: Throw Throw Burrito was nominated for TOY OF THE YEAR! (and now we need your help!)
updates.update_content: Throw Throw Burrito is an official nominee for TOY OF THE YEAR!!

updates.update_userinfo: SHHHH, THIS IS A SECRET INVITATION JUST FOR YOU!!
updates.update_content:
Hey Burrito Backers,
We are hosting a gaming convention called BURNING CAT!
Burning Cat is the tabletop conference we’ve always wanted to attend.
We rented out the Oregon Convention Center and plan to fill it with new games, new game designers, experimental prototypes, the infamous Exploding Kittens Vending Machine, vendors showing off the newest and greatest games and accessories, and a massive arena in the center to exhibit ludicrous stunts and insane spectacles every hour on the hour.

updates.update_userinfo: Throw Throw Burrito has been nominated for an award and we need your help to win!
We have an important shipping update.
Prototypes in the wild and a schedule update!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
We have so many things to say!

Playtesting
Now that most of the prototypes are in your hands, we've started receiving the first round of playtest feedback!

Hello, backers! 
Please don't forget that if your pledge included a prototype deck of Throw Throw Burrito, you MUST complete your BackerKit survey/form by 11:59 PM PST on Wednesday MAY 1, 2019 for your feedback to be considered in the final version of the game.
To quickly find the form, search your email inbox for “Response Needed -- Get your reward for Throw Throw Burrito.” If you still can’t find it, feel free to email support@explodingkittens.com and we’ll take care of you!

Today's the day! You should have received an email from us via BackerKit prompting you to fill out a form (or in BackerKit terms, a "survey"). In order to ensure you get your cute but mighty lil Burritos ASAP, please fill it out so you can make changes to your initial pledge, add additional items to your order, and verify your shipping address (make sure to check your spam and promotions folders for this email!).
The completion deadline is MAY 31, 2019. If you fill it out late, you'll still get your games, but they might be delayed!

updates.update_userinfo: The Campaign is Over! Now what?

project_data.project_name: Throw Throw Burrito

campaign.story:
When super-villains like Galactoid, Dron the Conqueror, or Professor Kill are defeated, they're sent to a government maximum security facility. But what about small-timers like Phileas Frost, The Grappler, or the random jump-suited agents of H.A.R.M.? What happens to the bank robbers, jewel thieves, and anonymous henchmen? 
They post bail. 
And sometimes, they skip town afterward. That's where Lucy Chase comes in. Keeping super-powered lowlifes in line is a dangerous job; especially when you don't have super-powers yourself. Bounty hunters who specialize in supers are few and far between, keeping Lucy in high demand.
 NEW REWARD LEVEL ADDED—ORIGINAL ART!

Who will love The Catch? 
• Fans of super-hero crime comics, like Gotham Central, Alias, or Powers.
• People who like heist or caper movies, or TV shows like Justified, Better Call Saul, or Sneaky Pete.
• Indie comic collectors looking to get in on the ground floor of a new book, filled with action, clever dialogue, and great visuals.
Sounds good. What's in it for me?
The Catch #1 is a 32-page standard-sized American comic, printed on high-quality paper.
The extra-sized first issue includes 24 sequential pages of action. But we plan to tell a bunch of stories with Lucy and Jack.
All backers will also receive TWO digital versions of the comic: digital versions in English and Español, as well as being listed in the print and digital editions of the comic (as a "customer" of Tilman Bail Bonds).  
The comics industry is buzzing about THE CATCH! 
 "THE CATCH is the kind of gleeful, clever deconstruction of a genre that can only be pulled off by creators who secretly love it. The freshest take on super-heroes and super-villains in the "real world" since POWERS. I'm mad I didn't think of it myself!" – Phil Hester, cartoonist
“THE CATCH is a superhero crime caper that blends the best of both genres to create something wholly new, engaging and memorable. Bryant, Canales, Surroca, and Murrin expertly weave a story that evokes greats like Elmore Leonard, Greg Rucka and Ed Brubaker without feeling like a carbon copy. As someone who enjoys all things noir and super-powered, THE CATCH is a perfect match.” - Alex Segura, acclaimed author of BLACKOUT
“THE CATCH is a great looking book with a fun premise. The team of Bryant, Canales, Surroca, and Murrin have a winner on their hands.” – Jamal Igle, co-creator of THE WRONG EARTH from Ahoy Comics.
“A little bit sci-fi, a little bit superhero, and a little bit good-natured procedural on top of it all, THE CATCH is such an obvious idea, I'm mad I didn't come up with it myself! Engaging, fun, and with a ton of potential -- you're gonna like spending time with Lucy Chase.” – Erik Burnham, IDW’s GHOSTBUSTERS
"Lucy Chase is a new era Karen Sisco in this action-packed and thrilling take on bounty hunting super-villains. Full of finesse and suspense, you won't be disappointed reading THE CATCH!" – Shawn Pryor, CASH + CARRIE
“THE CATCH is a fun, sexy caper in the style of 70s classics like THE THOMAS CROWN AFFAIR. Sleek and slick.” – Wendi Freeman, DOUBLE PAGE SPREAD

Your support on Kickstarter will help us:
• Print more books!
• Take The Catch to conventions and build the audience!
• Make cool new swag and merch!
• Tell more stories with these fun characters!
 The Usual Suspects...  (our creative team) 
STEVE BRYANT (writer/letterer/variant cover artist)
Steve Bryant is the Eisner, Manning, and Harvey Award-nominated writer/artist of Athena Voltaire from  Action Lab Entertainment, and the writer/co-creator of Ghoul Scouts,  also published by Action Lab. He has also completed projects for Dark  Horse Comics, IDW, Boom! Studios, Ape Entertainment, and others, as well  as extensive work in the roleplaying game industry.
ISMAEL CANALES (artist)
Ismael Canales was born in 1980 in La Roda,  a small town from Spain; he was graduated in Fine Arts in the  Politechnique University of Valencia, majored in Drawing and Animation.  He has completed work for Spanish horror anthologies and magazines, as  well as comics for U.S. publishers ECV Press and Action Lab  Entertainment. He lives with his girlfriend in his hometown and still  wears geek t-shirts.
ROGER SURROCA (colorist)
Born in 1990 in Lleida, Spain, Roger Surroca studied in different  art schools of Barcelona such as Illa art school, Escola Joso and Iboix  school, and is now a teacher at Center Berenguer. Since  2016, he has worked as a colorist for comic book publishers iPlaneta, Petit à  Petit, Editions du Long Bec and the magazine Spirou, as well as The Moon Men from Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc.
CHRIS MURRIN (editor)
Chris  Murrin has been writing and editing comics and prose for over  fifteen  years. In addition to working with Steve Bryant on both Athena Voltaire and Ghoul Scouts  for Action Lab, Chris edits numerous titles for both Arch Blue and  LawDog Comics. When he’s not pestering authors with his notes, Chris  works with the marketing team at FX Networks, editing promos for both  movie presentations and shows such as Archer, It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia,  The Simpsons, and You’re the Worst. You’ve probably seen his work go by in a pixelated blur on your DVR.
 How about a Preview? 
And the Español preview:

Okay, now let's take a look at the rewards! 
"PICK 3" (below) ships anywhere! Great for International backers! Get a variety of covers, or split shipping costs with a friend or two!
"PICK 6" (below) ships anywhere! Great for International backers! Get a variety of covers, or split shipping costs with a friend or two!
A closer look at those covers...
Only the best shipping materials!
It's important that your comics arrive in great shape!      
All comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.
Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection.
And our Collector Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks and unforeseen issues. With that in mind we're applying lessons learned from past campaigns.

We're committed to delivering the best possible experience to our backers, so we're investing in top-of-the-line shipping materials, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house. This will eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition. Most importantly, I'll address every question personally. The buck stops here.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: THE CATCH issue 2 is live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone! 
Thanks again for backing issue #1 of The Catch! By now, I hope you're received all of your rewards (actually, I hope you received everything couple of months back) and that you're taking care of yourselves during these uncertain times.
Back when we were finishing fulfillment for the issue #1 campaign, Ismael and I targeted March 23 as the launch date for the issue #2 campaign. Little did we know how the world would change in the months between choosing a date and the launch.

Hi, everyone!
By now, all of our US backers should have received their books. If not, please let me know and I'll sort it out immediately.
I have a couple of quick recommendations, and I apologize to Karl Kesel for cutting this first one so close.
Karl is doing some fantastic trading cards for Section Zero and Impossible Jones (and previewing the intriguing Sam Hell, too) as a part of Kickstarter's Make 100 initiative. The campaign is in it's final hours—7:00 pm TONIGHT, so get on it!
PLAY

Hello, all!
Running a crowdfunding campaign invariably involves addressing unforeseen contingencies. Regardless of how well you plan, things come up. Sometimes they delay the project, sometimes they don't. But each bump along the way offers the opportunity to improve next time.
Going into this campaign, I applied what I had learned from my previous campaigns (Athena Voltaire and the Volcano Goddess and ), as well as what I learned from the Action Lab-facilitated campaign for the ongoing series.

Hi, everyone!
The last of shipments went out today. I have a few messages out to folks who haven't responded to their surveys, but otherwise, everything is either in your hands or on its way to you as I type this.
The bigger ticket items were the last to ship, along with international shipping. Given the cost of shipping, my inexperience with Stamps.com (which was much easier than I anticipated), and the anxiety of the shipping budget taking big hits right off the bat, I chose to send these out last. This was a mistake. Your rewards should have been shipped first, folks. I apologize.

updates.update_userinfo: Update: Books are coming, downloads are here!

updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone!
After I sent the books to the printer, I received a ship date of October 21 from our print broker. It was a longer than usual turnaround, I'm told, because we were up against New York Comicon deadlines. They didn't sound confident in the date, so I didn't share it.
On the 21st, I reached out to get delivery info, and got a response today. There was a 3-day delay at the printer and they will be contacting me shortly to coordinate delivery next week.

Hey, everyone!
I meant to send an update last week, but grad school got the better of me. The Catch #1 is finished and at the printer! I don't have an estimated delivery date yet, but it looks to be mid-to-late October. Once the books reach me, I plan to draft some family and friends and ship everything out within a week of the books reaching me. 
Of course, that means that we're missing our original delivery estimate. I apologize for that. I've handled production for my comics for years, but this is my first time doing all the vendor stuff (getting quotes, etc). Since print quotes are good for 30 days, I should have gotten the quotes when Ismael finished drawing, and we'd have been able to send the book off immediately after Roger finished coloring it. That's on me, and I'll do better next time.

updates.update_userinfo: Last Call for Credits in the Book!
updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone!
Thanks for filling out your surveys! I have a few people who still haven't responded. 
If you haven't filled out your survey yet, please do so in the next couple of days, so I can list your name correctly in the back of the book!
I'm still waiting on a quote from another vendor, but the book is ready to go (with the exception of the names in the back).

Hey, everyone!
Yesterday was my birthday—and I got the coolest present! Roger turned in the last of the colored pages, and it looks fantastic!
To celebrate, I did what anyone would do: I sent out a Backer Survey, of course! If you didn't receive your survey, or if you're having trouble accessing the survey, please email me at SteveBryantArt@gmail.com. Use the subject line BACKER SURVEY PROBLEM.

campaign.story:
My name is Ryan Cody, I'm a professional comic book artist and podcaster from Arizona. I make my living telling stories, and The Long Way Home is one I've wanted to tell for a long time. 
When I was 14 I moved to Okinawa, Japan. This was before the internet, before social media. I was dropped into the deep end with no idea what to expect. Within days I ended making lifelong friends and forming a bond that could only have happened in that unique way, in a place halfway around the world. The Long Way Home will be a documentary that will follow us as we return home together, for the first time in 25 years. It will explore the relationships we have because of that time and that place. It's a personal story but one I think everyone can relate to, going home again.
Alongside the documentary project, I'm also producing a 60 page Manga called The Ronin and the Shisa which is an action adventure story that takes place in a future version of Okinawa.
There are reward tiers for every level of support and I urge you to check them out and see which one suits you best.
*NEW 03/15/19 - Stretch Goal #3! At $6,000 The Ronin and The Shisa manga expands from 60 pages to 75 pages for all digital and physical backers!
*NEW 03/03/19 - Another stretch goal has been added! At $5,000 all backers will have access to behind-the-scenes process videos and posts for both the documentary and the comic.  
 *NEW 02/24/19 - A new stretch goal has been added! If the campaign reaches $3700 then the cover to The Ronin and The Shisa will be pencilled by DC Comics and Image Comics star artist, Scott Godlewski! Scott is the artist of Copperhead and has worked on Superman, Super-Sons, Batwoman and Batgirl among many other titles! * UNLOCKED!
I'm asking for your help in allowing me to tell this story. All the funds raised will go towards logistics, equipment and post production on The Long Way Home, and printing on The Ronin and The Shisa.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk is that if this campaign is not successful the documentary and comic may not be able to be produced. I've been an artist on numerous Kickstarter projects before and have never failed to produce the work.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Advance PDF Edition of The Ronin and The Shisa Now Available to All Backers
updates.update_content:
While I put the finishing touches on the cover, credits and bonus material, I thought I'd offer up a PDF of the book to anyone who wants it as a thanks for sticking with me through this last year. This is the complete book, just without the finished cover, credits and bonus material.
If you plan on waiting for the print edition, or final PDF edition, those should be available soon. I'll post more updates when the book goes to print. Thanks again for your patience.
ADVANCE PDF LINK HERE

Hi everyone, as we approach me being a year late on this project, and at the nudge of a backer, I'm here with a new update. The comic, The Ronin and The Shisa, is progressing towards the finish line as I'm trying to tackle at least a page a day this month. It's going to clock in at about 90 pages and I'm drawing page 78 today. I hope to get the digital copies out by the end of this month.
The documentary will move forward immediately after that, with me doing the last of the filming and editing next month. Both projects took unexpected turns and I hope that when you see them, the year-long delay won't seem as egregious.  As always, I truly do appreciate your support, especially over the last few years. Here's a page of of heroine, Hanma, getting ready to handle some business.

About 5 more pages to pencil, about 12 to ink and then I'll do the final lettering pass (most pages are already lettered). Monday I'm picking up the original pencil cover from Scott so I'll post some inks on that next week as I work on that and continue working on these pages, while coloring an issue of Family Tree and an issue of another job.

Hey everyone, I'm still behind. I'm working diligently but 2020 has it in for me. I'm currently car shopping after an accident (I'm fine), but I feel terrible about yet another delay. I'm close! On Wednesday when I get back to my main computer I'll post a contact sheet with the 60+ pages I have completed (only about 5 more to ink and 5 more to pencil and ink). So I'm hoping it'll be about the middle of next week. For those comic fans of mine, the next volume of "the Ronin" story after this will be available for free to you digitally and at cost in print, as a way of saying thank you for sticking with me. I really am hard at work on this, I just have incredibly bad luck. Hopefully you'll enjoy the amazing pencilled cover by DC Comic's artist Scott Godlewski while you wait. Scott really did a great job on this and I'm proud to call him a friend. I'll get this inked and colored and post up the final cover on Friday. If you like comics, check out Scott's work on his book Copperhead, that's available from Image Comics.
PLAY
PLAY

campaign.story:
Professional wrestling is real. So are werewolves, vampires, and really greedy promoters that will stop at nothing to make a dollar.  
Jimmy “Resurrecter” King, is a third generation wrestler dealing with the curse of his family – every time he is killed in the ring, he comes back to life. As if that wasn’t bad enough, now the Resurrecter must fight not only for his life, but also for his family, as he is forced to compete in the deadly Continental Gauntlet.
ONE FALL is loaded with action, drama, dark comedy, and tons of wrestling.

One Fall #1 Mock Cover (not final)


One Fall, Page 2
One Fall, Page 3
 WHAT ARE YOU FUNDING? 
This campaign is funding the first issue of ONE FALL, a five-issue series written and published by David F. Walker and drawn by Brett Weldele. This will be a full color, 32-page comic book with 24 pages of main story, and a back-up feature by writer Ted Pirro. 
Our goal will cover the following:
Production - Comics and Art Prints
Supplies - Pages, etc. 
Shipping/Shipping Supplies
Marketing for One Fall and Solid Comix

WHY KICKSTARTER?
We wanted the freedom to create a series on our own terms, and at a pace that works for our schedules. The first issue of ONE FALL is drawn, inked, and partially colored and lettered. By the time this campaign is over, we will have the first issue 100% in the can and ready to go to print. The money raised from this campaign will go to fund printing of the first issue of ONE FALL, production of other rewards, and shipping. Any money raised over the target goal will be used to help offset the cost of creating the first issue (which we all did for free), and as seed money for the second issue. In addition, we are hoping to continue to spread the word about SOLID COMIX!
PLAY


WHO WE ARE
David F. Walker -- writer and co-creator of ONE FALL. David is co-creator of BITTER ROOT (Image) and NAOMI (DC), and has worked for Marvel (POWER MAN & IRON FIST, NIGHTHAWK, LUKE CAGE), Boom (PLANET OF THE APES: URSUS), and Dynamite (SHAFT).
Writer David F. Walker
Brett Weldele -- artist and co-creator of ONE FALL. Brett is the artist and co-creator of THE SURROGATES (Top Shelf), THE LIGHT (Image), and SOUTHLAND TALES (Graphitti). 
Artist Brett Weldele
Ted Pirro – writer and creative consultant on ONE FALL. Ted is writing all of the back-up stories for the series. 


SNEAK PEEKS FROM THE LOCKER ROOM

Brett Weldele 5.5 x 8.5 inch Art Prints
 "Bitter Root" (2nd Print) Issue #1 & "Naomi" Issue #1 

"The Army of Dr. Moreau" & "The Light"

STRETCH GOALS!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every creative projects has risks, but thankfully with One Fall we avoided the biggest risks of all by waiting until we had most of the book done. As of right now, the first issue of One Fall is completely drawn and inked, and Brett has colored almost half of the pages. We will be 100% done with One Fall #1 by the time this campaign ends, which means the first issue will be going to press no later than April. We have set the targeted release date for June 2019, though we are hoping to fulfill most rewards by May 2019.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: If you haven't received your reward yet, please take time to complete the reward survey. We need the completed surveys so we know where to send you rewards. Thanks.

Most backer rewards have been shipped. The exceptions are foreign order, retailers, and anyone who hasn't filled out a reward survey. Retailers and foreign orders will go out within the next week or so. An email has been sent with a link to the PDF of ONE FALL #1. 
As always, thanks for your support.

There was a delay at the printer, and then I was out of town for a convention, but as of right now, ONE FALL #1 is done! I'll pick up the books from the printer on Monday or Tuesday, and start processing orders later in the week.

ONE FALL #1 is ready to go to press. We're just waiting for some of you to finish your reward surveys, so that we know what name to put on the "Thank You" page (as well as where we need to send your rewards). If you haven't filled out your reward survey yet, please do so. Thanks.

Thanks to all of the backers and those of you that helped spread the word. Here's a quick update, so you know where things are... 
Brett and I are finalizing the back-up pages for ONE FALL #1. Brett is leaving for C2E2 on Thursday, March 21st. I'm leaving for Wondercon the following week. Our plan is to wrap up all the last minute production stuff by the week of April 8th, and have the first issue off to the printer shortly thereafter. We're looking to have the first wave of rewards in the mail by late April or early May.

Several retailers have reached out to me and pointed out that the RETAILERS PACKAGE Tier is a bit cost prohibitive. I'm still figuring out the magic of Kickstarter, and want to make sure that I do right by retailers. Because of the way Kickstarter is set up, I can't change the reward tier. That said, I will be making the following adjustments once the RETAILERS PACKAGE rewards ship...
- All of the RETAILERS PACKAGE level rewards will be increased from 7 copies of ONE FALL to 10 copies. This will lower your cost to $3.50 per unit.

I'm pleased to announce that Brett has finished coloring ONE FALL #1. We are right on schedule to have the book off to the printer by the end of the month, and rewards shopping by early May. Thank you to everyone who has backed this project and spread the word. We still have two weeks left -- let's keep moving forward. Thanks.

campaign.story:
Destiny, NY is finally back for Volume Three!
After the successful Kickstarter campaigns of Destiny, NY Volume One and Volume Two, we're bringing back the epic love story of Logan and Lilith for a huge, 200-page third volume.
AND WE ARE NOW FULLY FUNDED AND ALL OF OUR STRETCH GOALS HAVE BEEN UNLOCKED! THANK YOU FOR AN AMAZING CAMPAIGN!
We have MANY more blocks of stretch goals, which will even include adding bonus stories, so let's keep these pledges going!
The first two volumes introduced the story of former magical girl Logan McBride and her mysterious girlfriend, Lilith Aberdine. Where we left them and their gang of friends, Logan and Lilith were forced apart by fate, leaving Lilith to deal with her old demons in New York, while Logan copes with her own problems in California.
We're doing things a bit different this time around. You've all been amazingly loyal readers... so we figured why not give you TWO ENTIRE VOLUMES IN ONE BOOK for our third installment?
Destiny, NY Volume Three will have two main features, each as long as a full graphic novel. These stories take place at the same time and overlap in ways both beautiful and tragic.
ACT ONE WILL FOLLOW LILITH IN NEW YORK CITY, AS SHE DEALS WITH THE DANGER AND DRAMA LEFT BEHIND BY HER FAMILY... WHO WERE BASICALLY THE MYSTICAL MOB.
Interior art by Elisa Romboli!
Act One is illustrated by the brilliant Elisa Romboli. Check out some pages here. You'll see all of the familiar Destiny, NY characters in this first feature.
Interior art by Elisa Romboli!
ACT TWO WILL FOLLOW LOGAN IN CALIFORNIA, AS SHE TENDS TO HER DYING FATHER. ALONG THE WAY, SHE MEETS A SEER, TAYLOR, WHO MIGHT JUST HAVE THE KEY TO SOLVING ALL OF HER PROBLEMS.
Act Two is illustrated by the incredible Carola Borelli. Check out some pages here. This feature will include returning favorites as well as brand new characters who you'll love every bit as much as Logan, Lilith, and the gang.
Interior art by Carola Borelli
For the first two volumes, we launched the Kickstarter with just one chapter done. This time, we've been working on the book ALL LAST YEAR! Act One by Elisa Romboli is completely drawn AND lettered. Act Two by Carola Borelli is also well into production. This means that we're sending Destiny, NY Volume Three to print just about one month after the Kickstarter wraps!
This means you can expect less of a wait... because the truth is, we're too excited about this story to keep it from you for any longer.
Every volume of Destiny, NY ends with a chapter of bonus stories by guest creators that shed new light on our supporting character. Take a look at the stories! None of the art here is from the stories, but are just character shots.
Art from the back cover
 BAILEY - The origin story of Logan's ex, the magical girl/MMA superstar! Written by STEPHANIE PHILLIPS (Writer of the Kickstarter hit Kicking Ice as well as Black Mask's thrilling horror series Devil Within) and illustrated by VALENTINA PINTI, who also drew our gorgeous bookplate.
Elisa's art from Chapter One
 AUGUSTEN - Everyone's favorite take-no-bullshit barista considers how life would be if he left behind the Green Bean. Written by K. LYNN SMITH (creator of Plume and artist of Afterglow) and illustrated by SWEENEY BOO (artist of Rat Queens, Eat and Love Yourself, Spooky Girls cards.)
Elisa's art from Chapter Four
 LILITH & SONG ABERDINE: Joined by blood and separated by hatred, Lilith and Song Aberdine's sisterhood conflict is what launched this whole saga in Volume One. In this tender flashback story, we see the one night where Lilith and Song found it within them to just be sisters. Written by series editor SHANNON LEE, illustrated by Doctor Who's IOLANDA ZANFARDINO. 
Carola's art from Chapter 5
 LOGAN & THERESA McBRIDE: This is a very personal story, co-written by myself and my mother, from the perspective of Logan and her mother as tragedy rocks their family. Illustrated by EMILY PEARSON (Artist/co-creator of The Wilds with Vita Ayala, and Snap Flash Hustle with me, both from Black Mask Studios).
But that's not it. We have four more bonus stories ready to be added to the book as Stretch Goals! Take a look down below at what we're going to add, including stories by the amazing artist Skylar Patridge, Charmed superstar writer Paul Ruditis, wily scribe Jeff Massey, original Destiny, NY artist Manuel Preitano, Star-Crossed creator Mandy Robertson, and more surprises!
Together, we can expand this book into our ultimate vision, allowing each of our characters the spotlight for a short.
This is my tenth Kickstarter I've run: Destiny, NY Volumes One and Two, a special exclusive edition of Volume Two, Clonsters, Modern Dread, Prison Witch, Afterglow, Gangster Ass Barista (a Destiny, NY spinoff - available through this campaign!), Spooky Girls... and now this. I have a dedicated team of people that care deeply about the books and you, our readers and supporters. We always, always ship our books and they are always, always top quality. We pay extra at the printing level to make sure these are beautiful physical products.
Check out this video of our books below so you can see the level of quality we ensure.
PLAY

PLAY

The standard version of Destiny, NY Volume Three features a cover by Manuel Preitano. However, we also have a beautiful KICKSTARTER VARIANT EDITION with a cover by series artist Elisa Romboli, and a stunning super exclusive ROSI KÄMPE VARIANT featuring art by... well, Rosi Kämpe. Rosi returns to Destiny, NY for this cover (she illustrated Volume Two) while working as the artist for Marvel's hit series SPIDER-GWEN: GHOST-SPIDER.
If you missed out on the first two campaigns, Destiny, NY Volumes One and Two are both available through this campaign! Volume One told the story of how Logan and Lilith met...
Art by Manuel Preitano
...and Volume Two showed the couple falling deeper in love as troubling truths about their pasts are revealed. 
art by Rosi Kämpe, artist of Ghost-Spider (Spider Gwen!)
Catch up now! And don't miss GANGSTER ASS BARISTA, the spinoff graphic novel about Trinity Klein, one of the fan-favorite supporting characters.
Keep reading to check out our amazing rewards, including:
the graphic novel itself 
custom artwork commissions that will create an original prophecy about YOU!
the chance to get drawn into the book
enamel pin, signed bookplate, prints, holographic art, and more!


We also offer many items as add-ons, if you'd like to manually adjust your reward level!
In addition to all of the individual items from the campaign, we have all of the previous DESTINY, NY books available as add-ons. This way, if you want to get a higher level reward but missed out on the earlier books, just add these on!
We're also offering all previous graphic novels published by my company, Space Between Entertainment, as add-ons. These were all funded through Kickstarter as well! For more on each book, here's a link to those campaigns:
 Gangster Ass Barista: Destiny, NY spinoff!A comedic, coffee-fueled crime thriller about a former gangster who is trying to make ends meet with a day job at a New York City cafe... but soon, a life of crime threatens to pull her back in! 
 Prison Witch: A mystical thriller about the magic that happens behind bars at a women's prison. 
 Afterglow: A post-apocalyptic epic about a girl and her giant, radioactive cat. 
 Spooky Girls: A full-color, graphic novel made up of 4 new monster comics: Jenny the Werecat, Vicky Slime, Punk Teen Demon Queen, & Tarantula Twins.
 Modern Dread: A horror anthology about modern anxieties.  
If you have any questions or would like to add any of these items onto other pledge levels, please feel free to message me. 
MUSIC CREDIT: The 126ers - Staring at the Sun
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between this and the projects I've funded over at our collaborative Space Between company page, this is my 10th Kickstarter campaign. We have a well-oiled system and are happy to announce that the book is almost done! In a creative endeavor of this size, possible challenges could be delays in production or printing, considering we ship overseas. However, any time that has happened in the past has been minor -- we have successfully Kickstarted multiple projects before as creators AND as a team, which has given us the utmost confidence that we'll meet and exceed your expectations. When hiccups are hit, we send updates. When we receive our shipment, we get them our to backers immediately without delay. I mean, why would we want to hold onto the books when we're so eager for YOU to read them? 

One thing that we can't control is customs charges. We pay more for international shipping than we charge, but some countries will charge an extra customs fee based on the prices of the items included. Our advice there would just be to be aware of that! We haven't had problems in the past, but I thought it'd be worth mentioning!

Our backers deserve the absolute best, and we promise to deliver the highest quality, the best communication, and all questions answered within 24 hours or less -- ALWAYS!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
SWEET EUPHORIA is a 4 issue slice of life comedic drama miniseries. The purpose of this campaign is to fund the printing of the first issue. 
Everyone has flaws. Things we wish we could change or improve about ourselves. Sometimes these flaws cause major issues in our lives. SWEET EUPHORIA is four issue series about flawed people doing their best to work out their issues. This campaign is to fund the printing of the first issue. If you’re a fan of Edward Burns and Kevin Smith movies, you should check this out! 
A little background? Okay... 
This is my first real attempt at a comic book. I wrote the initial draft ages ago and ended up sitting on it for a while. It was influenced by the early movies of Kevin Smith and Edward Burns. 
After reading many indie comic (mainly the books of Terry Moore), I revisited, revised and completed the story. It developed it into something else. The first issue introduces the characters, and delves a little deeper into one of the main protagonists, Will, while setting up the second issue (currently being illustrated).
ABOUT THE BOOK
SWEET EUPHORIA is a black and white comic book, coming to a total of 28 pages (24 of story). The digital copies will be hi-res pdfs sent once the campaign has completed. 
The other books offered as rewards are as follows:
SHORTS - a collection of short stories that I created or collaborated with creators Lea J. Zimmit, Dan Amareiles, JR Loflin, Nikki Sherman and Justin Birch. 
POWER-UPS: VILIFIED & ONE COMIC TO RULE THEM ALL - short tales created by the #ComicBookHour community. I worked on two stories with Erik Bitmanis (creator of the HARD WYRED series).
NEWLY ADDED! 
There's a sketch reward where you can get a 5x7 sketch included with your pledge. Also, an exclusive print of Chris Cornell, who the title of the book was named after one of his songs (there's a thematic connection). 
Shorts
Comic Book Hour Anthologies
Exclusive print
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk really comes down to the printing and shipping. The issue is complete so there are no delays in creating it. As this is my first kickstarter I'm giving myself lead time and taking precautions to make sure timelines are met.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Help print COSMIC LOVE, a comic fanthology celebrating love in all forms, inspired by the music of Florence + the Machine.
Postcards are part of the "How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful" reward tier. Backers at $45 and higher can also add-on the EXCLUSIVE KICKSTARTER set by Rachel Perciphone for $25.
Postcards are part of the "How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful" reward tier. Backers at $45 and higher can also add-on the EXCLUSIVE KICKSTARTER set by Rachel Perciphone for $25.
Soon to be released by Red Stylo Press, COSMIC LOVE  is an eighty-page comic anthology first proposed by featured cover artist, Rachel Perciphone, and edited by award-winning author/editor Jennie Wood (Flutter, A Boy Like Me.) 
“Florence + The Machine is one of my favorite bands and particularly inspiring to me.  Their music is ethereal and otherworldly; I can’t help but be taken to new places in my imagination.  I often listen to them while I work in my studio.  Florence’s lyrics are full of imagery that allow for different visual interpretations and storytelling of emotional experiences.” Rachel Perciphone
COSMIC LOVE  is a curated selection of original short form comics and illustrations in tribute to over a decade of music by the phenom performer Florence Welch of Florence + the Machine. Each team of creators was challenged to choose their favorite F+tM song and create an original comic story inspired by the music. Artist, Rachel Perciphone, then created a series of story cover/vignettes  also inspired by the chosen song. The result is an ethereal collection of original stories celebrating love in all its glorious forms. 
A special edition of this collection was released at Flame Con in 2018, and we're here on Kickstarter to give this book much-deserved wide release and distribution. In keeping with the music theme, the book itself will be printed at 7x7 inches to physically resemble a 45 RPM record cover, similar to a previous collection from Red Stylo, Baroque Pop (inspired by Lana Del Rey).
All of the stories and art in COSMIC LOVE are original works in tribute to and inspired by the music of Florence + the Machine. No adaptations, rather each piece is a reflection of the beautiful and secret places of the imagination that F+tM inspires with their music. This book is dedicated to our fellow F+tM fans everywhere!
Cosmic Love and Cosmic Love: Flame Con Special Edition, cover art by Rachel Perciphone
The collection is complete and this campaign is to help fund and ship a full print run. In addition, this book is a cooperative, put together entirely by the donated efforts of the creators. After rewards are fulfilled, the print run will be split evenly among the creative teams, so backing the collection directly benefits the wonderful individuals who helped make it happen. 
Sweet sixteen contributors for COSMIC LOVE
The book features stories and art by:
Rachel Perciphone
Jennie Wood + Josh Segal
Vita Ayala + Kat Taylor
Seth Greenwood + Angela Zhang
Enrica Jang + Y. Sanders + Jan Velazquez + Mark Mullaney
Mario Candelaria + Adam Ferris + Lesley Atlansky + Scott Ewan
Zack Rocklin-Waltch + Taren Beatrice
16 creators, 6 stories inspired by the music of Florence + the Machine
"Sweet Nothing", cover by Rachel Perciphone
"What The Water Gave Me", cover by Rachel Perciphone
"Green Light", cover art by Rachel Perciphone
"Hurricane Drunk", cover art by Rachel Perciphone
"Daylight", cover art by Rachel Perciphone
"Cosmic Love", cover art by Rachel Perciphone
Check out the list for some truly stellar rewards, including:
"Lover to Lover", get print copies of COSMIC LOVE, plus sister-title BAROQUE POP, inspired by the music of Lana Del Rey.
Kickstarter Exclusive! "How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful", postcard set featuring art by Rachel Perciphone. 5 of these 6 images included. Help us reach milestones to unlock more!
LIMITED! "Heartlines" reward includes a 5" x 7" pencil sketch portrait of any subject you choose, by artist Rachel Perciphone.
LIMITED! "Green Light" tier, featuring original watercolor and ink comission (9" x12") by artist, Adam Ferris.
LIMITED! The "Sweet Nothing" reward includes an original, digital portrait of any subject you choose, by artist Kat Taylor!
LIMITED: for the "Cosmic Fire" reward, Josh Siegel (modHERO) will create a digital rendering from a photo of your choice, with the option to be dressed in "Casual Cosplay" of your favorite superhero. Includes physical print and a hi-res JPG, plus a sold-out copy of the "Flame Con" special edition of COSMIC LOVE.
Queen, Tom Waits, 27 Club greats including Jimi Hendrix and Amy Winehouse, plus our Lana Del Rey-inspired collections.

Add $25 to this pledge to also receive the KICKTARTER EXCLUSIVE set of COSMIC LOVE postcards, no extra shipping required!

You provide the subject photo and your favorite F+tM song and Kat will create an original digital portrait (downloadable PDF) just for you.

support.title: Cosmic Fire (Limited Commission)
support.descp: A sold-out copy of our "Flame Con" special edition of COSMIC LOVE, plus a digital portrait (your choice of subject) by "Cosmic Love" title-story artist, Josh Siegel. Josh will create a digital rendering from a photo of your choice, with the option to be dressed in "Casual Cosplay" of your favorite superhero. Physical print and a hi-res JPG included.

support.title: Cosmic Love: Flame Con Special Edition
