Limited Tier! Get a print copy of the COSMIC LOVE: Flame Con Special Edition variant cover featuring the "Never Let Me Go" vignette by Rachel Perciphone. This edition was created and released especially for Flame Con in NYC, and only ten copies of this version are available via this campaign.
Add on $20 to your pledge to get an additional copy of the regular cover (no extra shipping necessary!)

support.title: Cosmic Quadruplets
support.descp: Award-winner contributor/editor, Jennie Wood, has offered a special, limited tier of four books, all signed by her: COSMIC LOVE, "Flutter, Volume One: Hell Can Wait", her novel " A Boy Like Me", and BAROQUE POP comic anthology inspired by Lana Del Rey!

updates.update_content:
Dear Cosmonauts,
We did it!!! YOU did it. We are so happy, so grateful. More very, very soon! For now:

Cosmonauts!
Thanks to a beautiful flurry of shooting star backers this morning, we have just unlocked a new stretch goal for COSMIC LOVE! We have until 5PM EST to see if we can reach it. We promised you beauty, and once again artist Rachel Perciphone delivers:

updates.update_userinfo: Next stretch goal unlocked! And watch the Kickstarter Live replay w/ Kat Taylor
updates.update_content:
Hey Cosmonauts! 
We'll be live with "Sweet Nothing" artist, Kat Taylor, at the top of the hour (8PM EST)! Join us! And don't forget to share with us why YOU love F+tM, too!
It's already been quite a day. We're sitting just $138 away from our first stretch goal! Also, got an RT from one of the Florence + the Machine fans club on Twitter, and then a shout out on THE RADIO in Philadelphia! Contributor and writer, Mario Candelario, caught the last seconds of this mention in his car on the way to a meeting:

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Live tonight at 8 with Kat Taylor! Also, we're radio stars...
updates.update_content:
Cosmonauts,
Read the lyrics to "Sweet Nothing", or better yet, just listen to it; Florence probably understood this feeling too well. The COSMIC LOVE team is extremely happy that we're so close to the end and funded, working hard to keep our trajectory to the ultimate goal. It all ends in a couple of days. At the time of this writing we're about $273 from our stretch goal! Thank you, everyone, for getting us so far. It's sweet, sweet ephemera until it's official, but we're so happy to share this with all of you.

updates.update_userinfo: "Every whisper, every sigh" in the final hours. Tomorrow night, Kickstarter Live with artist, Kat Taylor!
updates.update_content:
Hey there Cosmonauts,
We just wrapped up the session, but you can watch it here:

updates.update_userinfo: Success! Watch the Kickstarter Live session with Josh.
updates.update_content:
Cosmonauts, assemble!
Ha! Our Kickstarter clock has changed from days to mere HOURS and we are counting down our last bit of time for this campaign to pre-order COSMIC LOVE. Still feeling floaty and wonderful to have reached this goal thanks to all of you, but we are also eyeing the clock and wondering if it's possible to hit this next stretch goal. We are about $514 away, and it is a true beauty, so check out the list and see what might tempt you!

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Live tonight at 9 with JOSH SIEGEL (modHERO)!
updates.update_content:
Cosmonauts,
The entire COSMIC LOVE team sends their heartfelt THANKS to each and every one of you for helping us get past the goal line for this book. This campaign to print has officially turned into a PRE-ORDER, and we are so thrilled that you may soon have COSMIC LOVE in your hands (or on your mobile devices of choice. Yay, technology!) Huge thank you, also, to Kickstarter for featuring us on the homepage yesterday!

updates.update_userinfo: Unreal! We are funded, with 3 days remaining. And tomorrow: Kickstarter Live with artist Jeff Siegel
updates.update_content:
Cosmonauts!
Stars align, the cold light shining brighter and brighter as we approach FUNDED. Just $65 away at the time of this writing, we woke up to find ourselves within kissing distance of this goal! Check the dashboard and it seems that Newsarama and Geek.com posted about us on their sites, and we are also Kickstarter's homepage PROJECT OF THE DAY!

campaign.story:
Who's responsible for this mess?
My name is Jules Rivera and I'm a comics and storyboards artist living in LA. I made one of those slapdash slice of life webcomics all these millennials do that piss off old people, except instead of making it about video games or how much I love sobbing in a corner, I made it about mean shit. I pointed the knife outward.
Love, Joolz is a  slice of life  comic that explores the mind of the badass woman. Drawn  by a badass woman for badass women everywhere, Manic Pixie Nightmare  Girl collects the saltiest and the sweetest offerings of the Love, Joolz  webcomic. It tackles subjects like relationships, politics, the legit  Latina experience, and even surfing. If you like more slice in your  slice of life, check out Love, Joolz: Manic Pixie Nightmare Girl.



My webcomic series, Love, Joolz is about all the mean, little thoughts I have in my head about the art life, dating, race, politics, and sometimes surfing and Christmas. Yeah, it's a mixed bag. 
Download your PDF sample 
Also, hey, check it out.  A comic about surfing.  Made by a woman who surfs. Whee. 
Anyway, I've built up a good-sized collection of comics that channel my inner bitch and now I'm going to sell that shit! This is the first ever print compilation of the Love, Joolz webcomic. This Kickstarter is to fund the printing of Love, Joolz: Manic Pixie Nightmare Girl.  The book is 124 pages, perfect bound with spot colors throughout.  And because this ain't the fucking Fyre Festival, you can expect this for your actual money sourced by actual businesses. With quotes. And contact emails. And prior sourcing experience.  This is my third Kickstarter. I got the receipts. Here's what's up. 
This fucking book is like 124 pages long. I made an actual graphic novel out of screaming and surfing. What the hell is my life?
Getcher fuckin' swag
We're not far off from Unlocking Come to the Waves to all Affiliates!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is laid out completely. The only things left to add to the book are the spot illustration chapter images and the acknowledgements/thank you page. In the past, I've had people take a while to get back to me on how to be acknowledged in books, but I try not to let that hold up production of the book. I'll keep backers posted on all important updates like that. In the past two Kickstarters, I've worked with the same printer, PrintNinja, who put out stellar work. So, unless PrintNinja and all other major printers in North America implode and all of China decides to stop making books for us fat, lazy Americans, and I break my wrist preventing me from finishing up the last bits left to do to close out the book, we should be solid.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
🔓 SEVEN STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED SO FAR! Less than $1,000 away from unlocking another! 🔓
Wailing Blade is high-adrenaline fantasy adventure, set in the dark future of mankind. 
When his father is sentenced to death at the hands of the legendary Headtaker, bandit prince Tychon must find a way to save him, or fall to the Wailing Blade himself.
THANK YOU FOR FUNDING US ON DAY ONE! LET'S UNLOCK SOME STRETCH GOALS! 


Who will love Wailing Blade?
Fans of Conan, Elric, Masters of the Universe and other sword & sorcery epics.
People who like Mad Max, The Dying Earth, and other tales of dark futures.
Collectors of high quality modern independent comic books from a world-class team of up-and-comers and industry veterans!
If you like your comics with tons of action, over-the-top weaponry, and mind-blowing visuals, THIS IS YOUR BOOK!
What Exactly Do You Get When You Take the Blade and Back This Campaign?
 Wailing Blade #1 is a 32-page comic in standard American comic size, on printed on high-quality paper.
All physical product backers will get TWO premium standard edition FOIL STAMPED covers -- Wailing Blade #1A: NIGHT (SILVER FOIL) & Wailing Blade #1B: DAY (GOLD FOIL).
The extra sized first issue includes 30 sequential pages of action and mayhem, plus additional back matter taking you into the world of the Wailing Blade!
All backers will also receive loads of additional bonus content in the Tyrant's Cut Digital Deluxe PDF and the Wailing Blade Original Theme Heavy Metal Anthem MP3 by "Making Metal With" George O'Connor!  
At higher pledge levels, backers will access campaign exclusive bags and boxes loaded with limited edition variants, and killer merchandise including metallic mini-prints, enamel pins, custom toys, and more!
At highest levels, limited opportunities to get custom sketches, stories, signed materials, and the chance to be drawn into the world of the series as someone on the execution block!
The Comics Industry is Already Buzzing About Wailing Blade. Here's What Critics & Pros are Saying... 
CHECK OUT THE ADVANCED REVIEWS OF WAILING BLADE #1!
"Wailing Blade is the Executioner Sci-Fi Fantasy You Didn’t Know You Needed..." - Geek.com
"Loved it! 5 out of 5 stars..." - TheNewestRant.com
 "A Bloody, Brutal Blend Of Fantasy & Sci-Fi..." - Comicon.com
"Wailing Blade #1 has a swagger to it... a lot of fun and a strong start." - Omnicomic.com
 Who are the Creators Behind the Wailing Blade? 
Wailing Blade is an action-packed, blood-soaked dystopian fever dream created by Rich Douek (Gutter Magic) and Joe Mulvey (SCAM). 
Rich Douek
Rich is an award-winning copywriter, and the creator of the independent comic series, Gutter Magic. He has worked on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Universe comics for IDW, and has published short stories in the New York Times-featured All We Ever Wanted anthology, for A Wave Blue World, as well as anthologies for Comixtribe and Red Stylo press. Additonally, he is a moderator of the Comics Experience Creator's Workshop, where he strives to help newer creators learn how to create their own comics and navigate the industry.  
Joe Mulvey
Joe made his comics debut as the writer and illustrator of the electrifying super-powered Vegas heist series Scam, from Comixtribe. He is also the writer, artist and creator of the acclaimed children's book Mummy's Always Right, and was pubished in the Where We Live Anthology from Image Comics, to benefit the victims of the 2017 Las Vegas shooting. 
Christopher Sotomayor
Chris has been a mainstay at Marvel and DC Comics since 1996 working on titles like Captain America, Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Nightwing, Detective Comics, SuperGirl and pretty much everything else at one point or another.  In addition to working for every major comic publisher in the business, Chris also teaches a course on digital coloring for comics at http://www.comicsexperience.com.  Stay in school. Don't do drugs.
Taylor Esposito
Taylor is a comic book lettering professional and owner of Ghost Glyph Studios. As a staff letterer at DC, he lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws, Constantine, Bodies, CMYK, and New Suicide Squad. Prior to this, Taylor was credited on numerous titles for Marvel as a production artist. He is currently working on a new batch of creator-owned titles, such as Interceptor: Reactor and Friendo (Vault Comics), Exorsisters and Jook Joint (Image), and Babyteeth (Aftershock). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Acursian, Finality) Dynamite (Battlestar Galactica, Rainbow Brite, Army of Darkness/Bubba Ho-Tep), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).
Why Wailing Blade is a Story We Had to Tell....
Rich writes: 
For me, growing up, my favorite books were the ones that transported me to different lands. Wild adventures I could get lost in as I followed the heroes along on their journey. Middle Earth, Hyboria, The Young Kingdoms, The Dying Earth. To me, it's not escapism to want to dwell in worlds like that for a little while. The wonderful thing about fiction, especially genre fiction is that it gives you a taste of the impossible - a window into another world. And that feeling, that exhilarating feeling of cracking open a book and getting lost in it, even for a moment, is something that I've always wanted to create for someone else. And I believe that Wailing Blade is a book that will. 
It's often said that you should make the comics that you want to see in the world. In that respect, Wailing Blade is everything we've ever wanted to see in a comic. It's got action, it's got adventure. Compelling characters, and a lush, vibrant world for them to inhabit. We couldn't be happier to share it with you.
What Exactly Is This Kickstarter For?
The team has already invested thousands of dollars and hundreds of man-hours into the development of this first WAILING BLADE series. 
The first issue is 100% complete and ready to print.
Soon, our book will compete for attention on the shelves of comic shops world-wide. 
With your support here on Kickstarter, we can fund a larger initial print run for the book and expand the TAKE THE BLADE TOUR, bringing our new series to more comic conventions and in-store signings around the country. 
It will also help fund cool new Wailing Blade merchandise and Kickstarter-Exclusive collectibles for our biggest fans. A successful launch will also help make even more Wailing Blade stories than initial series possible. 
Funds raised above and beyond our modest goal will go into project stretch goal enhancements for our backers as well as be invested back into the series. 
 ComixTribe was launched with the help of Kickstarter fans and we know the only place some of our biggest fans can get our books is here on Kickstarter. So we’re back with another awesome campaign to help make more killer comics! 
Feast Your Eyes on These Pages Inside the Book...
 Want to See Even More Before You Take the Blade? 
If you'd like to read even more of Wailing Blade before you back this campaign, we invite you to download a generous 19 page preview. 
 ⚔️ CLICK HERE TO ACCESS ACCESS THE PREVIEW ⚔️  
What Awesome Rewards Are Available?
 Want a Closer Look at Those Killer Covers? 
NOTE: YOU CAN ADD the KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE Cover to ANY PHYSICAL PLEDGE LEVEL for +$25!
WAILING BLADE PROJECT TIMELINE
The Kickstarter Campaign: Jan 15 - Jan 31
Kickstarter Funds Received: Feb 14
Wailing Blade #1 to Print: Early February
Merchandise in Production: February
Book Manufacturing and Freight: (Late February) 
Extra Buffer Time for Unexpected Issues: (March)
Expected Deliver to US Backers: (Early April) 
Expected Deliver for INT Backers: (Late April)  
THIS BLADE IS SHARP, SO HERE'S HOW WE'LL PROTECT IT IN TRANSIT! 
As Kickstarter fans and collector's ourselves, we know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged. 
After consulting with our backers, we've revamped our shipping practices to ensure your comics and collectibles arrive in great condition. 
All comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.
Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection.
And our Wailing Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition. 
Furthermore, for this campaign, we're handling fulfillment 100% in-house. In the past, we've worked with some external fulfillment companies who specialize in packing and shipping so that we can stay focused on creating the books. 
However, for this campaign, we want to make sure that everything arrives to our backers as quickly as possible and limit the possibility of unforeseen delays, which is why we are rolling up our sleeves and personally overseeing fulfillment for every backer.  
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We would be absolutely thrilled if you're ready to take the next step and join this campaign! 
Will YOU Be the Next to Take the Blade?
If you've made it this far, you may be ready to be the very next person to TAKE THE BLADE! 
If so, we'd like to ask you to scroll back up this page, choose an awesome reward, and pledge to be a part of this campaign today. 
On behalf of the entire Wailing Blade team, thank you so much for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The support of backers on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of ComixTribe since our very first project back in 2012, so we take the trust of our backers very seriously.

We've taken a number of actions to mitigate risk associated with this campaign, including completing the creation of the book prior to launching and establishing a strong relationship with a quality printer who has done great work for us in the past and is established in North America, which means faster printing and delivery times for our backers than overseas off-set print.

Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks, unforeseen hiccups, and lessons learned...and we've certainly learned valuable lessons from every past campaign. 

We're committed to delivering a superior reward delivery experience for our backers, so we're investing in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house, to eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

ComixTribe and the WAILING BLADE team have a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we enjoy so much support from returning backers is testament to that.

So we invite you to back with confidence, as we want to be entertaining you for years to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

And if that wasn't enough, you'll also get the heart-thumping, head-banging original heavy metal Wailing Blade anthem composed by "Make Metal with George" O'Connor! (Included in all $5+ pledges.)

updates.update_userinfo: The NEW WAILING BLADE Trade Collection is LIVE on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
If you woke up this morning with your ears ringing, no need to call the doctor... That's just the WAILING BLADE screaming once again on Kickstarter! 
CLICK HERE TO TAKE THE BLADE (EARLY BACKER DISCOUNTS FOR LOYAL FANS IN EFFECT TODAY!)

updates.update_userinfo: The Blade is Back, Bigger, Better, Launching TOMORROW!
updates.update_content:
Hey friends! 
It's been a helluva year and a long time coming, but we wanted to make sure that you, one of the hundreds of backers who first helped launch WAILING BLADE into the stratosphere on Kickstarter, knew that we're returning TOMORROW with a launch for the collected edition.

Hey, Rich & Joe from WAILING BLADE here! 
For a little over a year, you helped us happily win the belt for the most backed ComixTribe project... but alas, we need to pass the it on over to Ryan K Lindsay and Chris Panda for the killer SHE launch they've dropped on the world.

updates.update_userinfo: Check out this SHE Art by Wailing Blade's Joe Mulvey
updates.update_content:
Hey, Joe Mulvey here from quarantine in Queens, New York!
One benefit of this lock-down is that it's given me some time to rearrange my studio and hook up my ComixTribe pals with some art for the awesome new book "SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known" which is currently funding on Kickstarter!

updates.update_userinfo: SHE is a hell of a ride!
updates.update_content: Hey, Wailing Blade's Rich Douek here with a quick word about the latest ComixTribe title to drop from my friend Ryan K. Lindsay.

updates.update_userinfo: Bonecrushing WAILING BLADE #3 Preview... Available NOW!
updates.update_content:
Hey, there! Did you hear? 
WAILING BLADE #3 dropped on the comic shop shelves this week like a hammer... like a WRACKHAMMER to be exact. 
If your shop didn't get it, there are 100 copies available now at the ComixTribe Shop. 
Here's juicy preview, not for the squeamish!

updates.update_userinfo: The first WAILING BLADE arc is complete + SINK: Blood & Rain ends today!
updates.update_content:
Hey, Wailing Bladers!
Excited to announce that the team has finished up the entire first arc of WAILING BLADE now... and it looks AMAZING!

updates.update_userinfo: The New SINK: Blood & Rain Launch is Live... and We Couldn't Be More Excited!
updates.update_content:
Hey, WAILING BLADE Backers, we wanted to make sure you knew that ComixTribe has an all-new campaign LIVE right now!
SINK: Blood & Rain is a new rain-soaked, blood-drenched 160-page volume of the hit crime thriller comic by John Lees & Alex Cormack.

You know we left you with a DOOZY of a cliffhanger in WAILING BLADE #1... with the unstoppable Headtaker coming straight for what remained of Tychon and his band of Wind Cleavers. 
Well, at long last, the story continues in WAILING BLADE #2, on sale now in comic shops world wide AND at Shop.ComixTribe.com.

project_data.project_name: Wailing Blade #1: Bloody, Brutal Dark Fantasy Sci-Fi Comic

campaign.story:
About the Story
Acceptable Losses is a one-and-done, self-contained 32 page comic detailing the last official mission of the USA's sole superhuman military operative, the US Eagle. On this fateful mission, Eagle finds himself at the mercy of enemies in the field and callous and careless superiors at home. 
After the mission goes spectacularly wrong, we see the greedy and power-hungry Senator that caused the devastating failure face a horrifying attack on US soil. An act of revenge? But by whom?
Acceptable Losses tells a dark, poignant and action-packed superhero revenge fantasy, focusing on grim action and looking at the cycle of violence in the war on terror and those fighting it on both sides. 
About the Cast
Character design sketch by Danny Flores
The US Eagle a.k.a. Corporal Sam Tyler is a good soldier. Always following orders, he believes in what the ideals of America mean and that they have a duty to help the rest of the world. Being the only subject of the US's controversial human augmentation program, Tyler gained enhanced strength, speed and stamina from the process, and became a symbol of America's might in the world. 
Character design sketch by Danny Flores
Private Deshawn Krinsky is the US Eagle's eyes in the sky and handler from home base. A young but incredibly bright officer, Private Krinsky has become an indispensable aid to US Eagle and his missions for their country. Idealistic and loyal, Krinsky has become a good friend to the US Eagle as well as his ally. 
Senator Robert McKeen is a man in his mid-50s who has never seen a single day of active duty in his life. And yet he has found himself the political liaison to the US Eagle Program. A life-long politician and spokesman, there has rarely been a motion he couldn't schmooze and massage it's way past obstacles. A man of words and who values opinions and the image of power above all else, McKeen can be quite brutal in his single-minded focus on his goals. 
Character design sketch by Danny Flores
General Michael Forley has been working ops all his adult life. A proud, gruff military man to the bone, Forley is in charge of the US Eagle Program and is a no-nonsense leader. A stickler of protocol and chain of command, Forley nevertheless holds his own strong opinions on the missions they run.
About the Campaign
We're looking to run a simple, straight-forward campaign with the majority of funds raised going to pay the production team for art, colours and letters, and a good chunk for printing and shipping. 
Chart of the breakdown of funds distribution
With the funds for this campaign, we'll make as gorgeous a finished product for this one-shot comic as possible. If we exceed the goal amount, this will go into making an even better finish on the book. As well as single copy rewards, we also have group rewards options should anyone wish to get a bunch of copies for a reading group, stall or store.
Rewards are kept nice and simple to keep things straightforward, and shipping costs kept as low as possible. 
Some early artwork from Danny Flores
About the Creators
Joe Glass is the writer of Acceptable Losses. The creator and writer of The Pride and The Pride Adventures, that has been part of numerous very successful Kickstarters. This is Joe's first solo written, self-published comic that is not connected to The Pride and shows a whole new side of his writing. 
Danny Flores is an up-and-coming illustrator in the field of comics. Having only illustrated a few short stories here and there, this will be his first book published. He hopes to one day enjoy illustrating comics as a full time job.
Page in process by Danny Flores
Moose Baumann is a colourist who has worked on a large number of titles, including DC's Green Lantern, Seven Soldiers of Victory, and Nightwing, and many more. 
Michael Stock is a letterer and long-time collaborator with Joe Glass. Michael has lettered numerous comics across the UK independent scene including The Pride, The Kill Screen, Samurai Slasher and much more. 
Why Acceptable Losses?
There's a reason I want to make Acceptable Losses. 
For me, it's about showing what I can do outside of The Pride. The Pride is an incredibly well received series, and I could not be prouder of it, but it is very much just one of the stories I have in me. Acceptable Losses is a chance for me to show off something completely different and even unexpected from me, that I think can be enjoyed both by fans of my existing work and also by people who've never read anything by me before. It was also a chance to work with the amazing Danny Flores and Moose Baumann, and my long-time collaborator Michael Stock once again. 
Some early artwork from Danny Flores
For Danny, this is his first full comic to get printed, so it will be a great chance to show off his work too. I'm very excited for people to see what we can put together. 
Finally, it's a story about the consequences of our actions, as much in our world as in this fictional one. It's a story about where exactly an 'eye for an eye' gets us, and how rushing in headlong to get the job done without thinking through all of the angles can result in disaster. It's about seeing the shades of grey in even the most black and white of situations, and our responsibility for whatever we decide to do with that information. 
Page in process by Danny Flores
But most of all, Acceptable Losses is about an entertaining, superhero thriller with depth.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Generally, delivery dates are an estimate as sometimes work takes longer to complete, and the creators are shipping the books out themselves, however we will endeavour to stick to the planned completion and delivery dates. 

As ultimately we're shipping them ourselves, please bare that in mind as items might be later than estimated depending how many backers we wind up having to ship to. As such, making sure the address you provide after the campaign ends is valid for a while after the campaign is important. 

Postage tends to often be the major trip up in Kickstarter campaigns, and it has certainly caught me out before. However, that is why I'm including a fairly big chunk of the goal amount as purely towards shipping costs, and to ensure the book is shipped around the world easily.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi all!
Due to demand, we’ve added an incredibly limited print copy option. This will be paid for by myself out of pocket so we can keep the campaign target the same, and will be the 1st Printing of Acceptable Losses - limited to just 150 copies.
Head over to the new campaign now to get your hands on them while stocks last!

updates.update_userinfo: ACCEPTABLE LOSSES IS BACK ON KICKSTARTER
updates.update_content:
Well, we said we’d be back to try this again, and here we are!
Hopefully, the Fourth of July will be a better time to launch a project than the run up to Christmas :P
We’re aiming for a digital first release this time, allowing us to drastically cut the target goal down so it just covers paying the incredible art team on the book. If we surpass the goal though, of course we’d love to bring the book into print too, so all the support we can get is most welcome.
You can back the project again at our new campaign page here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/joeglass/acceptable-losses-explosive-superhuman-soldier-one-shot

updates.update_userinfo: End of Campaign, Time to Reflect
updates.update_content:
Hey all!
So as you may have noticed, the Acceptable Losses campaign was unfortunately unsuccessful on this occasion.
There are a number of factors, from the time of year not being the ideal time to launch a campaign, the work not being far enough along to have much to show beyond early concept designs and uncoloured pages and perhaps launching something so thematically different from my previous work.

I've just added two new digital tiers!
At these tiers, you can get the Acceptable Losses digital comic, and The Pride volume One Collection (collecting The Pride #1-6, and The Pride Adventures #1-4).
The second new option gets you the digital copies of Acceptable Losses, The Pride volume One Collection AND The Pride Adventures #5!

Hello!
So, I've racked my brain for extra things to offer people who might want to support the project for different rewards, and gone through my existing stock from my last projects, and have added a couple of new rewards. 
These are all enamel pin related tiers of various characters from my previous comic, The Pride!

Hey all!
Thanks for backing Acceptable Losses! We’re now over 25% funded with just over half of the campaign time left to go. So a big step to go yet, but we’re come along loads already so thank you all for taking a chance on the comic!
We’re also at now over 150 of you! That’s a great bunch, so again, thanks so much! There’s been some requests for more sequential art to show, so I’ve added some to this update for you all to see!

updates.update_userinfo: Why Am I Making Acceptable Losses?
updates.update_content:
Below is a post from tumblr, that I thought might be handy to present here too. Obviously, a lot of you seeing this update are backers and are already supporting, and I cannot thank you enough, honestly. The more we spread the word, the more we can get people checking out the project and hopefully we can make this comic a reality for Spring 2019. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
So people who have known me for making The Pride all these years might be asking ‘why is he doing something so different now?’

Hey all!
So thanks to the awesome Danny Flores, we now have a brand new reward tier!
The new max reward will get you not just the comic but an original page of art from the book!
There's just 10 spaces for this reward, the pages will be randomly selected to the backer and sent out, but is a way to get not just the new comic but a piece of original art by an incredible artist!

Hey all!
So, wee update on the Sketch Tier!
Moose Baumann has very kindly offered to add some colours to these too!
As such, those who back at that level will be given a choice at the post-campaign survey on if they'd like their sketch black and white or with colour.

project_data.project_name: Acceptable Losses - Dark, Superhero Military Revenge Tale

campaign.story:
THE GOOD FIGHT is a comics anthology taking a peaceful stand against racism and bigotry.
Originally a reaction to the events in Charlottesville, Virginia, where white nationalists protested the removal of Confederate statues, and to the ensuing attacks, which resulted in several injuries and the death of Heather Heyer, THE GOOD FIGHT has since evolved into a more timeless commentary on the ongoing struggle against hate. Because hate itself will adapt to survive.
The all-star roster of writers, artists, colorists, letterers and editors involved in THE GOOD FIGHT have graciously donated their time and creative energy to the project, resulting in more than 40 full color stories across a broad spectrum of genres. 
Mark Waid (Daredevil, Captain America)
JH Williams III (Promethea, Batwoman)
Greg Pak (Planet Hulk, John Wick)
Greg Rucka (Lazarus, Queen & Country)
Paul Tobin (Colder, Bandette)
Phil Hester (The Coffin, Shipwreck)
Eoin Marron (James Bond: The Body, Avengers Halloween Special)
Erica Schultz (Charmed, Twelve Devils Dancing)
Nik Virella (All-New Wolverine, Hyperion)
Chris Ryall (Zombies vs. Robots, The Colonized)
Matt Miner (Toe Tag Riot, Gwar: Orgasmageddon)

The editorial team at THE GOOD FIGHT is proud to announce the cover of the book will be illustrated by artist Christian Ward (Thor, Black Bolt, ODY-C).
Here is a sneak peek at some of the interior pages as we make progress in THE GOOD FIGHT
"Rise Against the Terror" by JH Williams III and Ryan Burton
The finished book will be approximately 260 pages and will feature more than 40 entries in full color.
From "Statues of Limitation" by Ian Mondrick and Skylar Patridge
From "Boys Night Out" by Adam Ferris and Mark Rahner
Backers will see their names printed in the THANK YOU section of the finished book.
A number of other rewards are available to project backers, including physical and digital copies of THE GOOD FIGHT.
And more...
Unfortunately, Kickstarter does not allow funds raised on the platform to be designated for charity; however, all post-campaign money raised through sales of THE GOOD FIGHT will be donated to The Southern Poverty Law Center, an organization "dedicated to fighting hate and bigotry and to seeking justice for the most vulnerable members of our society. Using litigation, education, and other forms of advocacy, the SPLC works toward the day when the ideals of equal justice and equal opportunity will be a reality."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Anthologies have many moving parts, and the challenge lies in making sure all those parts move together. In order to make sure everything about this book, from inception to delivery or your rewards, comes together as it should, we've assembled a worthy team of comics professionals to guide The Good Fight across the finish line. Project manager Michael Perlman most recently shepherded the Image Comics anthology Where We Live, editor Danny Lore has worked on titles such as The Wilds for Black Mask Studios, and Kickstarter campaign manager Eric Palicki has crowdfunded such anthologies as This Nightmare Kills Fascists and All We Ever Wanted, both published by A Wave Blue World.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Good Fighters!
I wanted to reach out to all of you with a simple message. 
It's been a heck of a year, or rather 3+ years. We've gone through so much civil unrest and have seen the continuation of violent crimes aimed at minorities by our own police, backed by a president that embraces white supremacy and allowing a pandemic to run it's course through the lungs of the very people he swore to protect.

updates.update_userinfo: For readers that want GREAT comic books!
updates.update_content:
Hey all!
Sometimes it's important to unplug, turn off the news and stimulate your brain in other ways. It doesn't mean you care any less, you just have to recover. In fact there's a great story about that in TGF :)
With that we wanted to make our comic book fans out there aware of two Kickstarter campaigns running right now that are from some of our very own creators featured in THE GOOD FIGHT!
First up is METALSHARK BRO Volume 2! (Not issue 2) Made by TGF contributors Bob Frantz, Kevin Cuffe and Chas! Pangburn with hard hitting artist Walter Ostlie! This book is action packed and extremely funny! Definitely not for kids! Check out there campaign here:

updates.update_userinfo: NOW YOUR FRIENDS CAN ORDER THE BOOK TOO! & Delivery Update
updates.update_content:
Hello Goodfighters!
I've opened an etsy store where anyone can order a copy of THE GOOD FIGHT. You all got the cool extras, but here they can order the book. The great thing is all of the money collected from the etsy sales will go to the SPLC!
If you would like additional copies or have someone asking how to get it, show them this link:  https://etsy.me/2L1GGlj

Hello Goodfighters! Books were shipped from the fulfillment center last Thursday direct to our backers. I’ve already heard from some that they have received their package!
They are being sent media mail which claims 7-10 days, but I believe it’s much quicker in some areas. If a couple weeks go by and you don’t have your package please reach out to me and I will find out what’s going on and correct it.
For orders outside of the US, allow a little more time. They have been sent but I can’t say for certain how long it will take to travel.

Hello Goodfighters! The books have left the printer yesterday and are on their way to the fulfillment center! From there they will be packaged with the prints and bumper sticker, nicely boxed up and shipped directly to our physical backers. I hope you are as excited as I am, the book is almost in our hands!
Some people have asked when they will be able to order more books or get their first copy post-Kickstarter, hold tight as we are working on that. I’ll definitely be putting that info here on the Kickstarter page.

updates.update_userinfo: Your digital copy and print news!
updates.update_content:
It’s here! The digital pdf of THE GOOD FIGHT!
Below you will find links to the pdf book. We’ve included both a high resolution file and a lower resolution file just in case your device doesn’t work well with large files.
Better yet, the book is off to the printer! We are expecting a proof next week, then it should take 10-12 business days to print the books and send them to our fulfillment center. The FC will pack up the books, stickers and prints to send directly to you. If you haven’t filled out your survey that gives us your address, please do so asap! Just head to Kickstarter or find the email previously sent to you.

Hello Goodfighters!
We are nearing the end! We had to make a few revisions and I'm expecting to have the final pdf in my hands this week. As soon as we have that, we will send out digital copies for you to read! Or if you are a physical backer and choose to wait you can do that as well.
We also have all additional rewards in hand. They will be sent to our fulfillment center and grouped together with the books to be sent to you.

Hello Goodfighters! A quick reminder, we sent out surveys the other day. This is how we get your shipping address and name for the backer section of the book. Please fill that out ASAP, you’ll have until the 19th if you want your name in the book.
We’ve also been working hard on getting all of the other rewards in, today we received the mini prints that all physical backers will receive. They are beautiful card stock and vibrant!

Hello Good Fighters!
We have built one mighty community of comic book creators when putting our book together. We want to support to a couple of projects that are being created by THE GOOD FIGHT contributors and are currently on Kickstarter! After the 3 books we will talk about, there is an art spoiler for THE GOOD FIGHT! It will be easy to miss as you'll have to scroll all the way down, just in case you don't want to see it.

project_data.project_name: THE GOOD FIGHT: A Peaceful Stand Against Bigotry and Racism

campaign.story:
Cash & Carrie Book Two Cover Art by Caroline Frumento.
Cash & Carrie is about two middle school detectives, Dallas Cash and Inez Carrie. Dallas is an tenacious techie who believes in the supernatural and Inez bases her crime solving skills in realism, and is also captain of the wrestling team.
Together, they are best friends who attempt to solve mysteries anywhere, and anytime. Inspirations for Cash & Carrie include Disney's animated series Fillmore, Scooby Doo, Gravity Falls, and the X-Files. Cash & Carrie is an inclusive series on the page and behind the scenes, and is for readers young and old.
In the summer of 2015, Cash & Carrie launched as a single issue all-readers mystery comic on Kickstarter with success. I put together a full volume (Book One) with co-creator Giulie Speziani that was released in the fall of 2016 from Action Lab Entertainment. 
2015 Cover by Penny Candy Studios. 2016 Cover by Nilah Magruder.
Since Cash & Carrie hopped on the scene in 2015, there's been a LOT of all-readers mystery comics that have emerged, and it's time for Cash & Carrie to get back into the game in all new adventures!
This Kickstarter will help cover production, printing, reward production costs, and shipping and handling expenses for a 96-page softcover edition of Cash & Carrie: Book Two. 
Inez Carrie and Dallas Cash. Super sleuths. Best buds.
Art By Marcus Kwame Anderson. Script by Giulie Speziani. Letters by Justin Birch.
In Book Two, school’s out for the summer and that means it’s time to retreat to a cabin in the woods where it’s always safe, and nothing bad ever happens. Maybe.
It’s all fun and games at Summer Camp Sobol until strange things start happening. Campers go missing, Bigfoot might actually exist, and what's really in the coleslaw? With no WiFi and the mosquito repellant not cutting it, our detective duo will have to stick together to solve these mysteries on their own. Will Cash & Carrie survive this spooky summer camp of supreme superstition? And who will win the Camp Sobol Summer Games? You'll have to read book two to find out!
Additional stories in Book Two include Cash & Carrie taking on a culinary mystery, we get a glimpse into universe of C+C and find out what the other kids in their neighborhood did over the summer, and there's a pinup gallery!
BOOK TWO STORIES AND CREATIVE TEAM:
Big Foot, Small Sneakers, written by Giulie Speziani with art by Marcus Kwame Anderson. Lettering by Justin Birch.
Bull's-Eye! Written by Giulie Speziani with art by Marcus Kwame Anderson. Lettering by Justin Birch.
Lunch Lady Has The Last Laugh, written by Giulie Speziani with art by Marcus Kwame Anderson. Lettering by Justin Birch.
A Yet To Be Titled Culinary Mystery written by Shawn Pryor, Chris Ludden and Ginger Dee, with art and lettering by Chris Ludden and Ginger Dee.
Mason Middle Messenger: Summer Edition written by Shawn Pryor, with art by Tressina Bowling. Lettering by Justin Birch.
PINUPS FEATURING THE ARTWORK OF:
Penny Candy Studios
Justin Stewart
Anntonia Jackson
Alex Robinson
Pizzaface
Corey Fields
Ken Kirk
Sean Causley & Matt Herms
Max Bare
FRONT COVER ARTWORK BY:
Caroline Frumento
BACK COVER ARTWORK BY:
Valentine Barker
Backers have the possibility to not only get the softcover print volume or digital edition of Cash & Carrie Book Two, but can also select additional rewards featuring everyone's favorite middle school detectives. Here are the available tiers:
Kickstarter Video created by Shawn Pryor, using artwork by Marcus Kwame Anderson, Cash & Carrie Logo created by Penny Candy Studios, music by https://www.bensound.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my fifth Kickstarter project. I always make sure that every Kickstarter that I run is properly communicated and fulfilled.

While all creative projects have their share of challenges and issues, I make sure to keep all backers informed if any problems surface. I have a good grasp on what it takes to handle and manage a Kickstarter project and understand that your pledges mean something and I plan on fulfilling them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: International Rewards, and a NEW PROJECT!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! I hope that you all are well.
As of an hour ago, I have completed shipping fulfillment for all US backers. I dropped off the last of the backers packages at the post office, so those who haven't received their packages will get them soon.
So far, I've had only two packages returned back to me, so that's a good thing. 
I will fulfill International Backers on July 18th, and once that is done, all fulfillment will be completed.

Hey everyone!
I just wanted you all to know that I am getting these packages out to you as quickly as I can. It's been a stressful couple of months, but I'm getting your KS packages shipped out to you all a bit at a time.
But, because you all have had to wait, each backer who pledged for print rewards will receive art prints in their packages featuring the Art of Martheus Wade. I've had a batch of his works printed out and I'm bundling them in every package I ship out.

Good morning, everyone!
All digital rewards were sent last night via Kickstarter Direct Message, so check your inboxes for your stuff today. :)
I hope that you enjoy C+C Book 2. We put our heart and soul into this, and it's the best C+C yet.

Hey everyone!
The digital files for C+C Book 2 have been compiled into one nice PDF and will be sent out to backers via Kickstarter private message later this evening.
Backers will also receive their C+C Digital Wallpapers, and as a special treat, all backers will receive a PDF C+C COLORING BOOK as well. The PDF is printable, so you can print and color your two favorite detectives and their friends to your hearts content.

Whoops!
In all of the excitement, I forgot to send out the surveys! 
I will have those to you in the next couple of days, and then I'll have addresses for you all so you can get your rewards. 
Thanks!

updates.update_userinfo: Whoops! Surveys will be sent soon!
updates.update_content:
Hi everybody!
I've got great news to share with all of you. C+C Book 2 has arrived!

campaign.story:
PLAY

 A PASSAGE IN BLACK is a mature readers graphic novel anthology, presenting eleven tales of horror. More than 120 pages of terrifying stories await you in this collection!
As a kid, I often went fishing at the creek with my old man. He had a nice fishing boat, lots of expensive rods and reels, and he often took the family out on ocean fishing excursions. But he still liked taking old fashioned cane poles out to the creek to fish for catfish. I went with him frequently. (One of his favorite fishing spots was near a country club, and we often squeezed through a break in the fence and crept across the golf course to get there.) 
For some reason, I always took a big stack of horror comics with me to read on the muddy bank. House of Mystery, Ghosts, House of Secrets, Creepy, Eerie, Haunted Library, you name it. I never brought superhero books. Only horror tales seemed right while sitting in the eerie, early morning light. 
I loved those anthologies so much. They absolutely played a big role in the writer I would become. Over the past couple of decades, I’ve written many short horror stories. Many of those prose stories were collected in the book A PASSAGE IN BLACK from OmahaBound. That book, if you haven’t read it yet, has some of my earliest work in it, but I wanted to showcase everything so readers could see who I am and where I came from.  
And now—right here!—I’m announcing that my love of horror comic anthologies and my love of horror short fiction is coming together like peanut butter and jelly!  This book will feature comic book adaptations of some of my short horror stories from the prose collection. 
I have brought together an amazing group of writers and artists to bring these stories to life. 
Just check out the list (and the awe-inspiring artwork)!
Cindy Bunn and Baldemar Rivas - “Why Sing the Sirens”   
Kevin Watkins and Adam McLaughlin - “School for the Dead”  
Anton Kromoff and Bob Freeman - “Dance, Dance, Upon the Night of the Ball” 
 Heath Amodio and Daniele Sera – “Last Night of the Fair” 
 Josh Roberts and David Moscati – “Feast of Crows” 
 JimmyZ Johnston and Isaac Crawford - “Piasa Dreams” 
 Jeff Lawler and Fran Strukan – “Still Waters” 
  AE Steuve and Arjuna Susini – “For Her Love” 
 Sonica Ellis and Rowan MacColl – “Someday Dolls” 
 Tim Mayer – “A Passage in Black” 
 And yours truly working with Marcos Marz on something new! A short story (and intro to something bigger?) titled "Dead Vein"
With special appearances by Blacky Shepherd! 
 A logo designed by the Kucharek Brothers! 
And a cover by Kyle Strahm! 
I want this book to represent amazing talent that readers might not be familiar with, and I think these folks have accomplished something beautiful and scary and fun. They took these prose stories and ran with them. They made them their own and did something special with them. This book is a showcase of different approaches to the horrific... and I think you're gonna love it!
OmahaBound is helping with the design and printing of the project, so I’m confident it is going to be a fantastic book!  
And here’s some more exciting news! 
Assuming the Kickstarter is successful, I plan on making this an annual project/event. The next volume, though, will feature all new stories by the various collaborators (and myself). This will be a way for me to contribute to the legacy of horror anthology comics in my own way. 
CULLEN BUNN PRESENTS A PASSAGE IN BLACK is my Creepy, my Eerie, my House of Mystery. We’re on the verge of something exciting here. I hope you will all join me on this journey! 
As we reach stretch goals for this campaign, we will be offering various enhancements to the book. 
$25,000 - When we reach this goal, we will add an introduction/foreword to the book. 
$35,000 - When we reach this goal, we will add five one-page/splash page story introductions/interludes by artist Blacky Shepherd. These pages will be in the tradition of the horror host story introductions of classic horror comics!
$45,000 - When we reach this goal, we'll add a pin-ups section to the book, treating readers to all manner of ghoulishly gruesome horror imagery!
$55,000 - When we reach this stretch goal, all print trade paperbacks will be upgraded to hardcover editions!
$65,000 - To be announced!!!
$80,000 - To be announced!!!
At the end of the campaign, you will have the opportunity to select add-on items to your order. Some of these items include--
A PASSAGE IN BLACK T-SHIRT - $25
This exclusive t-shirt features the logo from the book. 
A PASSAGE IN BLACK PROSE COLLECTION - $15
This collection features 27 short stories and illustrations from Tim Mayer. The stories that inspired the graphic novel collection are presented here, too!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second Kickstarter project. I've learned a lot while running the first project. I recognize the value of working with great folks to make the book come to life, and I have partnered with experts in book production and delivery.

ALL of the artwork for this graphic novel is completed, and the book is being lettered as this campaign runs.

This means that we will be delivering this book very quickly. Digital versions of the book will deliver to backers almost as soon as the campaign funds (we'll need just a little time to finalize the "Thank You" page and any Stretch Goal additions), and the book will be sent to the printer for hard copy production immediately.

My primary goal is getting this book into the hands of our readers, so we're focusing on that! I have a team ready to manage the logistics of shipping the books out as soon as they are ready to go!

I'm teaming with one of the biggest and best crowdfunding companies in the industry: BackerKit. Through BackerKit we'll easily be able to manage add-ons, surveys, address changes, and fulfillment.

There are always surprises and curve balls along the way, but we are positioned to manage those as they arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey, folks! I wanted to give you a heads up on a new project!

BEYOND MORTAL #1, a 64-page comic of superheroes and cosmic horror, is now live on  Kickstarter!  This is an important book for me, one I’ve been trying to get together for a long, long time. Artist Danny Luckert and I have been working toward this moment since 2017, and I’ve been trying to make it happen since long before that. It’s a superhero/horror comic. We’ve created our own superhero universe and our own set of heroes. We’ve also created a pantheon of elder gods set on claiming that universe as their own.   Think of it as the Avengers or JLA versus Cthulhu.   The first issue is a giant-sized whopper at 64 pages! And we’re following it up with two more issues. But we don’t want to stop there. We have numerous tales to tell in this world. We see it as becoming a massive shared universe.

Hey, folks! I wanted to pop in real quick and tell you about a new Kickstarter project that will be launching soon! BEYOND MORTAL #1 is a 64+ page story of superheroes and cosmic horror from Danny Luckert and myself. Imagine if the Avengers or the Justice League went toe-to-toe with the minions of the Cthulhu Mythos. That's the story of heroics, horror, and survival that we're telling here. We're introducing a new team of superheroes, a new pantheon of deities, and a new comic book world that we're very excited about. You can follow the campaign at the link below. We'll be launching officially in about a week!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/cullenbunn/beyond-mortal-1-by-cullen-bunn-and-danny-luckert

updates.update_userinfo: Six new horror stories in CENTRALIA! Now available!
updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone! I just wanted to let you know that CENTRALIA, an anthology of six new horror stories, all loosely connected and part of a bigger shared universe, is now available to order!

This book collects six stories of mystery and horror that take place in various towns of Centralia all over the United States. Writers of the stories include Heath Amodio, Brian Keene, Adam Cesare, Michael Patrick Hicks, Brian Quinn, and myself! Each writer has created a new supernatural detective for the project.

updates.update_userinfo: Passage in Black is mailing out!
updates.update_content:
Look what I've got in my grubby little hands!
Over the weekend, I drove to Omaha and helped the good folks at OmahaBound get the books ready for shipping! We packaged them up, slipped them into padded envelopes, and quality-checked each copy! They are gonna start mailing out this week!
Let me tell you--they look AMAZING!

Hey, everyone! All copies of the trade paperbacks are in Omaha, and I'm driving up there this weekend to pick copies up, sign them, and get them prepped for shipping! I'm excited for you to see this book! It's a beauty!

The books are almost done at the printer! I had originally planned to drive to Omaha on Monday, sign the books, and have them shipped out. However, we just got word from the press that books will not ship out UNTIL Monday. So... I'll be traveling to Omaha after I get back from HeroesCon to sign the books and get them shipped!

Well, we had a hiccup with our original printer. Without going into details, they dropped the ball and let us down. However, OmahaBound immediately replaced them, and our new printer has already turned in the proofs! Here's a little tease of the hard copies! We've approved the proofs and they are underway!

campaign.story:
SEERESS is a horror comic series of self-contained Viking witch tales, on the Southern shores of Iceland, in the late 900s. 
“Seeress #1: Reckless” features pagan sorceress, Qadira. A high-fantasy gore-fest ensues after King Bard’s daughter, Asta, learns that being the object of carnal desire is a weapon to be kept sheathed--especially amongst things at don’t belong to her...or to Qadira.
This campaign is to fully fund the first issue print run and pay the illustrator, Jay Jacot. Simple as that.
PRICE DROP! $25!
PRICE DROP! $55!
PRICE DROP! $200

updates.update_userinfo: KICKSTARTER PACKAGES GOING OUT NOW: A MESSAGE FROM KASEY PIERCE!

updates.update_content:
...and I thank you all for this amount of patience. 
Everything is ready for launch and just as we were getting ready for everything to ship, myself and one of our Kickstarter fulfillment crew members, were coming back from a convention in Virginia--one in which we had a car incident involving a deer in the road. This left us stranded in West Virginia until this could be resolved. As a result, the Kickstarter fulfillment schedule (as the company does many) got behind. I assure you things are getting ready to ship within the next 4 weeks.

I just signed all of the exclusive copies I promised you! I ALSO promised to have illustrator Jay Jacot sign them! I will see him at Cherry Capital Comic Con on May 24th where I’ll have him sign them. After that, BOOM! Shipped out! You’ve waited this long and I would rather make good on my promise than ship you only one signature. Thank you again for your patience! 
<3 Kasey

campaign.story:
I Wrote a Book and it Needs Art.
I have written a superhero novel about a street level (nearly insignificant) hero that is really close to being ready to publish. The book is mostly complete aside from some editing. So, the book is pretty much ready to go.
The thing is, I love comic books.  I started collecting them when I was 4.  So I wrote a book about superheros, but what is a book about superheroes without some comic book art in it?  This book needs some sequential art in it. It just has to.
My idea is to have a different comic book artist or visual storyteller illustrate a scene from each chapter at the end of the chapter. So for my 21 chapter book, we are looking at 21 different artists doing those scenes. On top of all that, those artists will need to see some character designs to complete their pages.  Therefore, on top of the 21 artists doing pages, I have another 15 artists ready to draw character designs for 15 of the characters in the book. 
I have all the artists verbal okay for the timeframe and the project, but I have not formalized anything because I need the funding to do so. So, to get this book published with over 30 artists contributing, I need to get funded. Once the funding is secure, contracts will be sent out and art will be created.
Here is a list of the artists who have signed on so far:
Brett Barkley
Jason Baroody
Tressina Bowling
Chris Burnham
Jeremy Colwell
Van Davis
Penny Devoe
William Grapes
Jim Hazelett
Doug Hills 
Scott LeMien
Brian Mazany
Jason Masters
Dave Meyers
Josie Miller
Yasmin Florez Montanez
Drew Moss
David Newbold
Christina Kraus
Len Peralta
Daniel Puch
Chris Ring
Berk Senturk
K Lynn Smith
Adam Walmsey
Steve Willhite
and many more...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The coordination and logistics to make sure all the artists are fed the information they need to complete their work and then get that art back to me is daunting. 

Because there are so many artists and coordination necessary, there is a strong possibility that the timeline might get dragged further than I am currently planning. That being said, I do think delivery by April is a realistic option.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
There is only one of them available, so you should totally back this project by having Aaron Kuder, one of Marvel's Young Guns,  draw for you.
Aaron is amazing, and his art is always amazing.  At $250... this art is a steal as well.
Come on you know you want to get some of his original work!

There are a few rewards levels that include something called a "Crappy Notecard Sketch." So, what exactly is a notecard sketch?
A crappy notecard sketch is a marker colored pen and ink sketch on a crappy 3 x 5 notecard. The sketches aren't necessarily crappy, but the notecards are.  These notecards are the store brand notecards from the local CVS corner drugstore. The cards have just enough of a tooth on the paper to really work with pen, but still works well with markers.

updates.update_userinfo: So what is a crappy notecard sketch?
updates.update_content:
If we can get to 10% funding, I will be happy to post the Prelude and Chapter 1... 
Only about $1300 away from being able to read some of the book.

I am super excited to have Christina Kraus on board. Who doesn't love insanely high quality fully painted knights and fantasy art.
Christina's art is really beyond the beyond.  I might have her do character illustrations for anything I create from no on.  I found Christina's work though following the #VisibleWomen hashtag on twitter where female artists show who they are and that they have badass art.
If you need character illustrations... she is simply amazing

K Lynn Smith has said she will contribute art to my book once this bad boy funds. Kari has had a few successful Kickstarters of her own. The two I am most knowledgeable about concern her series, Plume.  The first one was to fund the making of the Plume min-series, and the second one was to make that series into one bound omnibus edition. I knoiw she has been associated with some other Kickstarters as well, but those two are the ones I am familiar with.
Kari's has a fun and energetic animated style to her work. It is stylized but grounded. On top of being willing to contribute art to my book, her art is also one fo the reward levels. 2 of her sketches were snapped up on the first day, so if you want art form her... you need to grab it quick.

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS/REWARDS/ADD-ONS!!!
EACH LEVEL WILL INCLUDE NEW ADD-ONS FOR THE PHYSICAL LEVELS, FOR FREE, FOR HELPING US GET FULLY FUNDED AND HELPING US GET OVER THESE THRESHOLDS. 
$5000 UNLOCKED!: Additional 5 pages of story for a full 30 page story now. This story will be an add-on, written and drawn by Travis Hymel, and is FREE and unlocked now. What's this story about? You'll have to wait and see but here's a preview of the art:
$5500 UNLOCKED!!: Jordan Kroeger Variant Cover added to all levels $30 and higher. STICKERS AND EXTRA PRINTS added to each and every physical level and digital wallpaper added to digital only level. ALSO: The $5000 stretch goal of my getting a tattoo will be decided upon by all of you. The money DOES NOT come out of this Kickstarter and will be paid for out of my own pocket as a specific bonus because I love all of you for getting me to this level. 
The retailer level, recently unlocked, has been updated to include something super special: A BRAND NEW VARIANT COVER! Local KC comic creators Damont Jordan and Bryan Timmins are crafting a brand new cover for this book that will only be available in the retailer level (OR as a $10 add on to your existing physical levels). There will be no other place to get this and it will not be available beyond this Kickstarter. Image will be uploaded once the final art is prepared and ready to go, but it will be SUPER RARE! This also opens the variant cover original art level, now with 3 covers to choose from. First come, first served, all available ONLY here.
The other unlocked levels are below: 
$6500 UNLOCKED!!!:  Thumb Wrestlers and Pin-Up Gallery! The Pin-Up gallery will be added, featuring art by Ally Cat, Erica Batton, Jake Booker, and many more. ONLY AVAILABLE DURING THE KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN. The issue one from the Kickstarter will feature the pinup gallery but it will not be available when the book hits stores in 2019. The Thumb Wrestlers are a physical add-on for all physical levels $30 and higher! So keep pledging and pushing! 
$7500 Stretch Goal!: ADDITIONAL PRINTS, BOOKMARKS, AND TRADING CARDS.  ALL from the pinup gallery and original character art from the series. Available for all pledge levels at $30  and up for free!
$8500 Stretch Goal!: MAGNETS AND MORE TRADING CARDS! New levels to unlock!! New buttons level and POP FUNKO LEVEL will be opened. Want a physical pop vinyl of Agente? That level will open if we hit $8500 and above. It will be a specific pledge level while the magnets will be a bonus for all pledge levels $30 and above. 
$9500 Stretch Goal!!!!!: PHIL HESTER AND ANDE PARKS  VARIANT COVER!!!!! This is the big one. I want to hit this level so we can unlock this amazing cover. It will be available as an add-on for an additional $10 to your already pledged physical levels and it will be  available in a very limited quantity. Help us hit this goal and all physical pledge levels $20 and higher will unlock all prints, bookmarks, and everything else. EVERYONE GETS MORE STUFF AT THIS LEVEL AND HIGHER. 
******************************
ADD-ONS TO YOUR EXISTING LEVELS!
Add $10 to your existing pledge level for any variant cover you'd like. Add an additional $25 to your existing pledge level for each shirt to be added (up to XL, add $1 for XXL, $2 for XXXL, etc) and $25 per pin to add to existing levels. Add $50 to include a LUCHA mask! Only works if previously pledged as an add-on to an existing level. These costs cover additional shipping & handling as well! 
Colors may change
Mask styles and colors may vary
BUT WE STILL NEED YOUR HELP TO HIT THOSE STRETCH GOALS!!!!
FROM CW COOKE, CREATOR OF SOLITARY (SOON TO BE A MAJOR MOTION PICTURE):
"Non-stop and full of energy, this book is irresistible!" - Mark Waid, writer (Captain America, Kingdom Come, Doctor Strange)
"Who could resist a comic about a crime-fighting Luchador...and why would you even try?" - Mark Russell, writer (The Flintstones, Snagglepuss Chronicles, Lone Ranger) 
"L.U.C.H.A. is the Watchmen of Luchador/secret agent/monster fighting/absurdly fun comics. Lucha Libre Action! Lucha Libre Excitement! Lucha Libre Intrigue! What more do you people want?" - Ryan Prows, filmmaker (Lowlife)
"Exciting, clever, quirky, and action-packed!  CW Cooke and Travis Hymel deliver full-blast fun and thrills. Cooke's script is fast-paced and original and Hymel's art is top-notch! Two thumbs way up!" - Brian Augustyn, writer and editor (Batman: Gotham By Gaslight, Flash, Archie 1941)
"L.U.C.H.A. has great suspense with tons of actions and very nice and inventive art!" - Mike Deodato, Jr., artist (Infinity Wars, Thanos, Thor)
"It warms my cold cynical heart to see others tackle the wonderful Latinx sport of Lucha Libre in genre comics. This story has mystery, monsters and action. Basically the three things that are best in comics. So do yourselves a favor and check out this fun series. It's worth your time and money." - Marco Lopez, co-creator/writer (he Luchaverse, Puerto Rico Strong and Terminal Anthology #2)
"I liked it...having a hard time expressing why I liked it...It's Bond, Luchador Bond!" - Richard Pace, artist/cover artist (Second Coming, Imaginary Fiends)
"Bombastic and action-packed, Cooke and Hymel's L.U.C.H.A. brings a fun mixture of wrestling and super-heroics while simultaneously introducing a larger, possibly reality shaking mystery in this dynamic first issue!" - Justin Gray, writer (Billy the Kit, Power Girl, Jonah Hex)
"I am LOVING it. I'm a sucker for fluid action and beautiful colors and this comic has both to the extreme. 10/10 do recommend!" - Ren Famous (Cosplayer Extraordinaire, Friend of Luchadors Everywhere)
**************************
Hello! My name is CW Cooke and I've been working in independent comics since 2007. I've worked with companies like Big Dog Ink (Joan of Arc), Image Comics (Spread short story), Devil's Due (hit series Solitary with a soon to be released second volume which began as a Kickstarter), Action Lab (Stillwater), Pilot Studios (Always Punch Nazis vol 1 and more to come), Arcana, Viper, and Bluewater as well as in the self-published realm of comics.
My first series, Solitary (which many of you helped fund a few years back), has recently entered a development deal for film and television. Here's a link to see more about that and follow that progress as it happens: 
https://graphicpolicy.com/2018/10/04/nycc-2018-devils-due-comics-and-cw-cookes-solitary-gets-a-development-deal/
Co-created with artist Travis Hymel and with colors by Jeremy Kahn and letters and logo by Micah Myers, we're working hard to bring our newest idea, L.U.C.H.A., to life. And Agente needs your help! 
A HORROR WRESTLING EXTRAVAGANZA:
L.U.C.H.A. is the story of Agente, a luchador detective who spends his life solving low level crimes and murders, taking on any job that falls in his lap. He just so happens to get wrapped up in a murder campaign that involves vampires, wrestlers, and other notorious figures before the rug gets pulled out from under  him...and the readers!
L.U.C.H.A. is one of the most fun things I've worked on in comics. Born from a simple idea as part of the Kayfabe anthology (a wrestling comic anthology put together by comic creators and wrestling fans alike, with the emphasis on wrestling as real), this story about Agente took on a life of its own because of the incredible working chemistry Travis and I had and the unbelievably insane story we came up with. The first ten pages will rock your socks off and after that it will swerve and take your breath away.
Pin, available at $50 level
I've wanted to make a comic that was this insane for a long time, and I've found the perfect partners in crime. And we need your help because this beautiful work will require a lot to deliver the goods.
By pledging you're helping us see the series through to issue four. We're keeping our rewards focused around issue one, to keep this campaign simple, but we'll be sure to update you whenever new issues are available as well, and try to come up with some extra perks down the line to remember the backers who helped make this book's launch possible.
We have a lot of plans for stretch goals, but before we get there, hit that pledge button please! The rewards are at the bottom of this page.   
 WRITER: CW Cooke
ARTIST: Travis Hymel
COLORS: Jeremy Kahn
LETTERS/LOGO: Micah Myers
EDITS: Shawn Gabborin and Shawn Pryor
SPECIAL THANKS: Jay Huwer, Shawn Pryor, Jeremy Mohler, Kit Caoagas, Shawn Gabborin, Trevor Mueller, Steve Ekstrom, my wife, my wonderful friends, my team, and so many others that I'm probably forgetting that helped keep my mind at ease as I built this thing. 
REWARDS:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The first issue is completely drawn and in the process of being colored. We've begun work on issue two and plotted the rest of the first arc.

The only issues or setbacks that might come up at this point would be in relation to certain rewards and taking a bit of time to get them completed. The book is done, the colors are being completed, so getting it printed and delivered and all the rewards sent out is really the only challenge we face.

I am very open and honest. If something is taking time, I'm an easy person to find and I'm more than willing to admit to my mistakes and to make them right.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
A lot of you will have already received your copies by now, but I wanted to update anyway! 
The only copies to still be sent out, at this point, are some local folks, foreign folks, and y'all with original art levels that are being finished as we speak. And one variant cover situation that is being colored as we speak and is the bonus store variant for Elite Comics. 
Most everyone else will have their copies by now or by this week, marking a major milestone in this campaign. We have an updated digital copy which I will email out with the corrected credits page.

Because I'm a buffoon, there's proper credit missing in the opening. The incredible short story is both written and drawn by Travis Hymel. I believed I had fixed that mistake prior to printing but I apparently did not. 
He and Jeremy did some killer work in this issue so remember to tell them how great their work Is! More to come

Literally everything that can go wrong, has gone wrong. 
Fedex was no help. 
UPS was no help.
USPS has been a big help BUT we can only print 20 labels at a time and my bank has now declined me from printing more due to what probably appears to them to be fradulent charges.

All of the shipping is still in progress and should be completed soon. Because of the holiday you might notice a slight hiccup in the timeliness of the items, but everyone (EXCEPT the original art levels) should be receiving their items very soon.
Mailing and putting the packages together has been another incredibly difficult part only because having the right size packages to ship things in, getting them prepped and ready, and getting everything signed took a bit of time.

Call me crazy, but you would think that an apartment complex would want to NOT hold onto 6 boxes like this for a month, right? They had them in their office for a long time and after checking in with them a bunch of times, boom, there they were, hidden in a corner. 
Thank you all for your patience. So the books are here, so what's next?

The books should be to me from the printers, I'm hoping, this week or next. That has been the final hurdle now, is just getting the physical copies back. The commissions are being finished and everything else is done. So what's next? 
Now that Planet Comicon is in my rear view, I'm sending out the Digital Library Comics TODAY. So check your email for those if you paid $30 or more. Lots of cool stuff inside that library and lots of fun reading to be done.

The physical books are shipping to me this week! Once I receive them, I will be signing and putting packages together for all that I can at that time. Digital library rewards should finalize this week for everyone who put in for that level ($30 and up), and the art pieces for commissions are being worked on as well. 
Beyond that: issue 3 is almost finished art-wise and issue 4 is fully scripted. News will be forthcoming soon in regards to when the book will hit comic shops as well so keep your eyes open! And as always, thank you for your patience.

Digital Copies and Digital Rewards should be out this week!!!!!!!!
So what does that mean? 
It means we have everything but the physical books and the commission art. The shirts and pins and masks and everything else is in, so now we are just waiting on the physical books to come to me so I can get everything shipped out.

As an FYI, and this is totally my fault, we are running a bit behind. We have all of the items for the book except the comic and the shirts. Everything else has been received and is ready to go, just waiting on the book itself and the shirts. 
Again, this is my fault. Work laid a bunch of people off so my focus was off a bit because of that (I didn't lose my job, whether good or bad we shall see but the level of work has gotten insane), but I'm focusing on finishing everything as quickly as possible.

You should all receive your surveys for the LUCHA kickstarter so please make sure you check the emails associated with the funding and we can ensure we get everything to you in a timely fashion.
Work continues on finalizing variant covers and lettering files for the book as the other items are slowly arriving. 
Also, if anyone has any questions or concerns, please message. We are doing everything in our power to hit the January deadline to the best of our abilities.

[Version en español después de las paginas en ingles]
This is: The Shit.
Necesito hacer poco más de 200 páginas para contar la historia de Louie. Por el momento necesito tu ayuda para poder publicar el primer capítulo (32 páginas). Si el video te emocionó, espero que las próximas ocho páginas sellen el trato.
Esto no es el producto final. Piensa que estas páginas funcionan como un tipo de “trailer de cómic”.
Lamentablemente, los gastos de impresión solo podrán cubrir la versión en ingles. Si tu contribución viene de un país de habla hispana, cualquiera que haya sido tu forma de apoyo, se te entregará una versión digital del cómic en español.
La opción $190 incluye: Libro en físico en ingles + un pdf con la versión en español.
La opción $285 incluye: Libro en físico en ingles + un pdf con la versión en español + un sketch (una pieza original dedicada a ti).
La opción $380 incluye: Libro en físico en ingles + un pdf con la versión en español + un sketch personalizado (Tu escoges que personaje quieres que te dibuje).
También en todo México los gastos por envío corren por mi cuenta.
Gracias por tu apoyo y hagamos historia juntos.
