campaign.story:
Interconnecting Cover Art by Bob Rivard
Imminent Press is back with TWO new issues of our hit series, TERMINAL Pulp Anthology. Both of the Standard Editions of TERMINAL #3 and #4 will feature cover art by artist Bob Rivard and they will connect with the artwork from the first two issues.
TERMINAL #3 features "Fausto Colon" by Justin Gray (Jonah Hex, Hawkman) with artist Dan Lauer and colorist Stephanie Chan as well as "Oubliette" by Eric Palicki (No Angel) with artist Ande Rummel.
Interior Art from TERMINAL #3 featuring two pages by Dan Lauer (Left) and Ande Rummel (Right)
TERMINAL #4 features "STEELTOWN" by Vito Delsante (Purple Heart) and artist António Brandão (CREECH) as well as "GEMINI XIV" by Matt Brady (The Con Job) with artist Nikola Čižmešija with colorist Kirsty Swan coloring the entire issue.
Interior Art from TERMINAL #4 featuring two pages by António Brandão (Left) and Nikola Čižmešija (Right)
Much like our first Kickstarter, both issues will also have a Ultra Rare 1:5 Guest Artist Variant. The Guest Artist Variant Edition of TERMINAL #3 features Josh Adams, Jeff Johnson, and a back cover piece by Rafa Garres. The Guest Artist Variant Edition of TERMINAL #4 features Eisner Award-Winning Artist Vasilis Lolos, Richard Pace, and a back cover piece by John Rauch.
Unfinished interconnecting Guest Artist Variants featuring (left to right) Josh Adams, Jeff Johnson, Jamal Igle, Carlos Cabaleiro, Rob G, Larry Watts, and Vasilis Lolos. [Richard Pace art is coming.]
WHY $8000 THIS TIME?
During our first offering, we had the luxury of having our coloring costs covered. This time around, we needed to employ the outside assistance of colorists, Stephanie Chan (Hulk) and Kirsty Swan (Blood Queen). We're also funding BOTH issues fully without the requirement of a stretch goal this time...and we want to make sure we have enough coverage to handle shipping to all of our areas where TERMINAL will be available. Last time, we cut it really, really, really close.
We promise that, just like last time, we will be dumping a ton of digital and physical rewards on all of our backers.
SO MANY FREAKIN' REWARDS!
Much like the last campaign, we will be featuring Reward Bundles that contain physical and digital comic rewards as well as prints, shirts and unique artwork from some of our talented crew. During the first week of the campaign, we will give details on a number of Funding Benchmark Rewards as we approach our goal of $8000.
Upon reaching our basic funding goal, ALL of our Backers will receive a digital copy of the ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS Anthology donated to our cause by our friend Ben Ferrari. Keep your eyes peeled on the Kickstarter page or our Imminent and Terminal Facebook pages for updates on our unlocked rewards.
Completing the funding goal of $8000 unlocks free copies of the ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS anthology for all of our backers.
THE RETURNING SWAG!
We have NEW Exclusive 5x7" Prints featuring the work by Robert Carey (Millarworld), Jerome Eyquem (Heavy Metal), Rafa Garres (Jonah Hex), Aaron Pittman (Grimfish), Valentin Ramon (D4VE), John Rauch (Invincible), TERMINAL cover artist, Bob Rivard.
Plus, we'll be featuring TWO really cool T-Shirts featuring our "MAKING COMICS DANGEROUS AGAIN" slogan and our "#ExpectUs" motto and IP logo.
This shirt was only available to high-end backers the first time around. We want everyone wearing this bad boy.
We will also have EXCLUSIVE One-of-a-Kind artwork from Jerome Eyquem for our high-end rewards where the backer can CHOOSE which TERMINAL characters Jerome draws for them.
AND...last but not least, YOU can become a TERMINAL Cover Art Character on your very own 11x17" High-Resolution Print drawn by one of our artists. There will be extremely limited quantities of these prints so grab those packages while you can.
High-End Backers can also look forward to Signed Copies of HUNTER BLACK trades from Justin Peniston & William Orr, Signed Blood Queen Omnibuses from Troy Brownfield, and Signed Copies of NO ANGEL #1 from Eric Palicki.
RETAILER LOVE!
This time around we will also have retailer-friendly reward boxes that will provide select retailers with copies of ALL FOUR available issues of TERMINAL Pulp Anthology (as well as one copy of each Ultra Rare Guest Artist Variant) along with a couple of prints and stickers to package with each copy of Terminal #1 for one reasonable price. Each retailer who supports us will also have their info featured on a RETAILER SUPPORT PAGE.
We will also feature a "DELUXE" version of this Retailer Package that will partner at least localized member of the Imminent Press crew with their store to host a signing of copies of TERMINAL.
WHY SHOULD YOU SUPPORT IMMINENT PRESS?
Because we believe in making comics for everyone. We are pooling our talent to feature a wide spectrum of talented men and women from across the industry and from all over the world. We're here to reward the people who support our efforts with high-quality comics and rewards befitting their support.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our Vision is Simple:

Promote and Create Quality through Solidarity.

We've worked tirelessly on this project to have most of the production work finished PRIOR to the launch of the Kickstarter.

Barring absolute calamity, we hope to have all of our rewards out in the posted dates 3-4 months after we become fully funded.

It's our job to give you the confidence to purchase and support our projects.

Steve Ekstrom
Editor, Terminal
Publisher, Imminent Press
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Here we are.

It's a Friday. We tried to put together a project that funded two paper comics at the same time and we fell short of our goal.

And here we are...still.

It's still Friday.  And we're going to still try to put together another project that will fund two paper comics at the same time.

And, hopefully, we won't fall short of our goal next time around.

Because we'll be back.

Sometimes, you have to go away to come back.

I know that I need a break. This is a stressful process. We're nearly finished fulfilling the orders from the first KS. And we're hoping to have our website go live in about a month.

We will still bringing the comics to you in the very near future.

Feel free to send me a message with your e-mail address so we can let you know when we put together the relaunch KS in early 2019.

Be well. Keep your eyes peeled for news for other projects from our crew across social media. 

THANK YOU to everyone who backed our little project this time around. 

Without YOU, there is no US.

I hope your upcoming holiday season is out of this world.

Be well.

Steve Ekstrom
Editor, TERMINAL Pulp Anthology
Publisher, IMMINENT PRESS

Hello,

I just wanted to thank each and every single one of you for backing this project whether it funds or not.

We have 8 Days left...and I am not done trying to find ways to connect with people who want to support indie comic book creators.

But it's tough. Really tough. Especially when you have to compete against your peers and you want them to succeed. You have to compete against monoliths like FRANK CHO (I've been following his work since he started Liberty Meadows and I love literally everything he does).

And it sucks when you receive messages like this:

updates.update_userinfo: The Clock is Ticking on Terminal #3 and #4
updates.update_content:
Greetings, everyone,
Troy Brownfield here. 
I'm one of more than 25 creators involved with Imminent Press. In fact, I'm sort of the Editor-in-Chief. I have a story coming up in Terminal Anthology Series #5.  
That is, if Terminal #3 and #4 actually get funded.

JOSH ADAMS.
JEFF JOHNSON.
RAFA GARRES.

updates.update_userinfo: Sneak-Peek: TERMINAL #3 Variant Edition Raw Art
updates.update_content:
Day One. Ground Zero.

We're trying to fund TWO books again but this time we have coloring costs to consider.

We're going to have unlocking funding goals starting with $500 and then every $1000 benchmark.

The $500 Unlocked Reward is just a simple DRM-Free Short Comic from one of our collective.

The $1000 Benchmark will unlock an Exclusive 4x6" Print featuring the cover to TERMINAL #1 that will be added for FREE to any backer who pledges $15 or more towards the campaign. (Digital Backers will receive High-Res art that they can use as Desktop Wallpapers or as Phone Wallpapers)

Every $1000 unlocks digital content or a Print which will be added to your pile of loot at the end of the campaign.

Once we hit $8000? EVERYONE gets a digital copy of ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS from Ben Ferrari and friends. I'm excited about our swap. When he gets ready to campaign for the continuation of APN, we'll be giving him digital copies of TERMINAL Pulp Anthology to share with his backers as well.

The faster we hit these benchmarks, the faster we get to the ridiculous Stretch Goal Rewards that will expand the page counts on issues #3 (40 Pages) and issue #4 (32 pages).

Share us far and wide on your social media platforms.

Use this URL if you'd like to help us promote:



This link won't get buried by Facebook's metric. We're clever like that.

And be sure tp the hashtag #TeamTerminal because you're on our team and they should "Expect Us".

We're bringing the comics...again. Without you, there is no us.

Steve Ekstrom
Editor, Terminal Pulp Anthology
Publisher, Imminent Press

campaign.story:
DEATH OF THE HORROR ANTHOLOGY is a compilation of terrifying short stories from some of the most talented and twisted minds in comics. Curated by Kelly Brack, edited by Danny Lore and published by A Wave Blue World, this book is 176 pages of horrifying tales! Each story will follow the theme of INNER DEMONS.
Cover by Adam Gorham, Josh Hixson and Tim Daniel
"Arsonist" by Emily Pearson
"Old Wounds" by Kelly Brack, Chris Shehan and Dee Cunniffe
"Stalkers" by Cavan Scott and Jeremy Simser
"Goodnight Stars" by Brian Level
"Hallowed" by Stephanie Cannon and Valhalla Halvorson
"Watcher on the Bridge" by Melissa Hudson
"In the Hole" by Pat Shand and Leonie O'Moore
"The City" by Jed McPherson and Francesco Iaquinta
"The Things That Hide In My Shadow" by Cody Sousa and Matthew Hann
"Planet Heartbreak" by Ryan K. Lindsay and Kelly Williams
"Contrition" by John Ward and Ariel Viola
Writer VITA AYALA (The Wilds, Submerged)
Writer KELLY BRACK (Deercatcher, Scancouver)
Writer RYAN CADY (Infinite Dark, Magdalena)
Writer STEPHANIE CANNON (CORPUS, IF Anthology)
Artist CRAIG CERMAK (Red Team, Voltron:Year One)
Writer TYLER CHIN-TANNER (American Terrorists, Adrenaline)
Artist MARCO FINNEGAN (Nick Travers Series, The Devil's Garden)
Artist Valhalla Halvorson (Maluk: Web Comic)
Writer/Artist MELISSA HUDSON (Witchfire)
Artist FRANCESCO IAQUINTA (Croak)
Artist BRIAN LEVEL (Avengers, Spider-Man)
Writer RYAN K. LINDSAY (Eternal, Beautiful Canvas, Headspace)
Writer JED MCPHERSON (The Show, Deadbeat, Jacob)
Artist LEONIE O'MOORE (LORD, Heavy Metal, Mine!)
Writer LONNIE NADLER (Come into Me, Her Infernal Descent, The Dregs)
Writer ERIC PALICKI (No Angel, Fake Empire, Red Angel Dragnet)
Artist EMILY PEARSON (The Wilds, Snap Flash Hustle)
Artist BRENDAN PURCHASE
Writer CAVAN SCOTT (Star Wars, Pacific Rim, Dr. Who)
Artist PHILLIP SEVY (Tomb Raider, Paradox, The House)
Writer PAT SHAND (Breathless, Snap Flash Hustle)
Artist CHRIS SHEHAN (Deadbeat, Prometheus)
Writer DAN SHEPPARD (Sonitus)
Artist JEREMY SIMSER
Writer CODY SOUSA (Croak, Sonitus)
Artist DAVID STOLL
Artist ARIEL VIOLA
Writer JOHN WARD (Scratcher, Lowlives)
Artist KELLY WILLIAMS (The Cabinet, Mataphase, The Dark)
  EDITOR
   VIDEO
-Digital Edition- The PDF Digital file containing all of the stories of DOTHA in its entirety. Will be available when ready for print.   
-Physical Edition- The soft cover graphic novel of Death of the Horror Anthology!
-Thanks- All backers of the Digital and Print copies of Death of the Horror Anthology will have their names printed in the thanks section at the back of the book!
-And more!
"Watcher on the Bridge" by Melissa Hudson
The Dregs 1-4 signed by Lonnie Nadler
Deadbeat Signed by Jed McPherson (Limited to 5)
The Show issues 1-3 signed by Jed McPherson (Limited to 3)
Watcher on the Bridge Page 1
Watcher on the Bridge Page 4
GOODNIGHT STARS Page 1
GOODNIGHT STARS Page 2
GOODNIGHT STARS Page 3
The book has a publishing home at A Wave Blue World, who will cover pre-press and printing costs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With a project such as this, delays can happen, that will not to be the case however with DOTHA. We have left an appropriate amount of time to go to print and to ship to our backers. Also, with the support of our amazing publisher A Wave Blue World, we have a certain level of consistency and credibility to go along with the project as well. 

Working in a project with a large group of creators can be challenging. Many of the creators have jobs, obligations or other gigs that pay significantly better. We allowed ourselves enough of a head start to deliver a book that is of a certain standard and within a designated time frame.

We have very good deadlines in place to ensure quality and completion before we go to print. We are well prepared to handle any and all issues that arise. I will be communicating with all backers frequently and will be completely honest through out this process of this project. We are all very excited to do this project and can not wait to deliver, what we believe is going to be, a great horror anthology.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As much as I would like to write a super formal update for you guys - i'll likely just type everything as if I were speaking to you all in person. 
Unfortunately, the project was unsuccessful on kickstarter. What that means for the project moving forward...I don't know. But that's not the purpose of this update. 
This is my second go at this thing. It's been a very large part of my life over the past year and a half. I could speak of all the work I have personally put into this, but I think that's not what this project was ever about. It's not about the efforts or passion of one person. Every single creator was just as responsible for how special and significant this book was. I couldn't be more grateful of having spent countless hours working along side creators I respect and admire. This is their book.

Hey everyone! We have a new cover to the project that I have posted online and would love to share with you all here too. I won't ramble too much - even though I am incredibly tempted. I will say my thanks to the incredible team that worked on this beautiful cover though. 
Adam Gorham, who is one of the greatest artists and overall nicest guys in comics. He calls me sweetie sometimes and I won't lie...I like it. If it wasn't for Adam's horrible taste in beer, and the fact he lives in a rival hockey province, i'm sure we would be best friends. Regardless, Adam is the greatest.

Thanks to you all for supporting our anthology and continuing to spread the word about the Kickstarter. We really appreciate it. As we approach the final week there's still a way to go, but I'm confident we can hit our target - so please continue to tweet and comment and share this campaign with your communities.
I thought I'd kick off this update with a question: what scares you?
It's a seemingly innocuous question but one we seldom analyze in any great detail. Fear is one of those emotions we typically go out of our way to avoid, and in our everyday lives we often avoid doing the things that scare us, except when we're certain the fear can be controlled (such as when watching a horror movie). When viewed this way, fear is a barrier to the unknown. While fear has a clear (and perhaps necessary) evolutionary origin, in some ways it constrains us.

I absolutely did not know Jed was going to say such kind words. Made me tear up a little. He’s the best, and that’s exactly why this book is so important to us. Just wanted to say though that I didn’t put him up to it. Emily did.
Kelly

Guest backer update; 
Ok, so I’ve been staring at a blank page for the better part of an hour wracking my brain trying to work out what I can write that could possibly get you to back DOTHA if you haven’t already. I mean I could go on about the insane quality of creators that Kelly has somehow managed to put together but honestly all you need to do is hop over the campaign page and scroll down. If you don’t see at least one name there you like then why are you even reading comic books.

Hey,
So, I’m a little late to the fact - but I realized I haven’t given a proper introduction of myself to you all. Simply, we can say I’m weird and I say weird things and happen to live in Canada - and that would be a quintessential explanation. “I like to think there’s more beneath though.” - likely said by Batman at some point.
I’m not going to go into childhood memories or what my favourite book is (Swamp Thing), but instead I think the best introduction is the “why?” Why did I get started in comics? Why is a project like DOTHA so important to me?

Hey Death of the Horror backers!
My name is Stephanie Cannon and I'm a comic writer and creator (It Came Out On a Wednesday, CORPUS, IF Anthology, InSymmetry Creations) with a story in the Death of the Horror Anthology titled "Hallowed". I was fortunate enough to work with the talented Val Halvorson, who brought the art in this story to life in ways that far surpassed what I had envisioned. Zakk Samm lettered the pages and title, and completely captured the creepy vibe I was hoping for.

Hey everyone,
Like all projects, Death of the Horror Anthology started as a simple idea and subsequently evolved into a passion project predicated on creating something with friends and peers. Friends and peers that have become an extension of family in many ways. Friends and peers that I was fortunate enough to collaborate on a short story with called OLD WOUNDS.
OLD WOUNDS is a subjective tale that, although references popular horror tropes, finds its own identity early on. It’s steeped with ambiguity and metaphors - but can also be however simple of a concept as YOU want. Reader interpretation will surely vary - and that was always the initial goal.

Hey!
SYFY editor Jeff Spry put together a very thoughtful and humbling article regarding our Kickstarter for Death of the Horror Anthology.
It’s such an honour to be featured on their site and I’m very grateful to Jeff for his time, encouraging words and for his love for the medium.

campaign.story:
The Comic-est anthology of 2018! Comedians love comic books, cartoonists love comedy, and our idiot editor always mixes up comics who tell jokes and comics that have pictures. Now his perpetual confusion has led to the creation of Comics Comics, a quarterly anthology teaming comedy’s best with funny books’ brightest!
Comedy meets Comic Books in this eclectic anthology featuring such voices as Patton Oswalt (MST3K, Happy!), Paul Scheer (How Did This Get Made?, The League), Sam Jay (SNL), Jackie Kashian (The Dork Forest), Quinta Brunson (Broke, Up for Adoption), Megan Koester (Coming to the Stage, Corporate), Sara Benincasa (Real Artists Have Day Jobs), Eliot Rahal (New Comic Book Day), Rose Matafeo (Funny Girls), Nick Giovannetti (Bad Guys), and more. 
Patton Oswalt, Jackie Kashian, Quinta Brunson, Paul Scheer
Teaming up to make these stories into comics are such hilarious cartoonists as Troy Nixey (Vinegar Teeth, The Black Sinister), Robert Hack (Chilling Adventures of Sabrina), Evan Dorkin (Milk and Cheese, Bill and Ted’s Excellent Comic Book), Tania Del Rio (Marvel: Now What?!, Sonic the Hedgehog), Brent Schoonover (Gregory Graves), Sarah Burrini (Nerd Girl), Rick Altergott (Vice, Cracked), and more, with double threats like comedian/cartoonist Carolyn Main (Pitch, Please!) writing and drawing!
Issue #1 Main Cover Art by Troy Nixey, artist of "Real-Life World's Finest," written by Patton Oswalt
Issue #1 includes 48 pages of brand-new stories written by a wide array of stand-up comedians, including headliners, cult favorites, and newcomers, and drawn by artists from every corner of the comics world, from alternative to underground to superhero. 
Comics Comics’ comedians got the freedom to write whatever they want, in any genre—with comedy or not—and they took us up on it, delivering slices of life, flights of fancy, and journeys into genre, all with the unique worldview of people who stand in front of crowds and dissect the world into a microphone for a living.
Kickstarter-exclusive hardcover art by Richard P. Clark
Testimonials
But don't take our word for it. Here's what some of the comedians in Comics Comics have to say:
Why Kickstarter?
SBI Press is a new publisher, and we need your backing to help spread the word, show stores there’s demand, and get us access to the top talent in both comedy and comics, so we can share them with you. The book is underway, but we need funding to finish it and get started on issue #2. By backing Comics Comics, you help us hire comedians from all over the world and reaching all the way up to the A-List, as well as cartoonists ranging from the most indie voices to veterans of DC and Marvel, and you allow us to print, ship, and promote it, so we can keep making Comics Comics.
About The Team
The biggest comics nerds in comedy team with the biggest comedy nerds in comics!
Issue #1 is:
 Real Life World’s Finest, by Patton Oswalt, Troy Nixey, and Michelle Madsen
 Unlikely Patriot, by Jackie Kashian, Sarah Burrini, M. Victoria Robado, and Sal Cipriano
 The Pill and Stuff, by Sara Benincasa, Tania Del Rio, Jio Butler, and Taylor Esposito
 Popular Fiction, by Eliot Rahal, Evan Dorkin, and Sarah Dyer
 Poop Knife, by Carolyn Main and Crank!
 Sassy Best Friend, by Rose Matafeo, Robert Hack, and Micah Myers
Future issues will include:
Comedians Paul Scheer, Nick Giovannetti, Sam Jay, Megan Koester, Quinta Brunson, cartoonists Brent Schoonover and Rick Altergott, and more to be announced soon!
Sample pages from this issue:
Real-Life World's Finest, by Patton Oswalt, Troy Nixey, and Michelle Madsen
Unlikely Patriot, by Jackie Kashian, Sarah Burrini, M. Victoria Robado, and Sal Cipriano.
"Sassy Best Friend," by Rose Matafeo, Robert Hack, and Micah Myers
"Popular Fiction," by Eliot Rahal, Evan Dorkin, and Sarah Dyer
"The Pill and Stuff," by Sara Benincasa, Tania Del Rio, Jio Butler, and Taylor Esposito
Poop Knife, by Carolyn Main and Crank!
Rewards
By pledging to our campaign, you can get:
The 56-page digital edition of Comics Comics #1, fulfilled through Comixology.
The 56 page print edition of Comics Comics #1.
The Kickstarter-exclusive "underground" edition Comix Comix #1, with black-and-white cover and a Tijuana Bible written by Dino Stamatopoulos (Community)
The Kickstarter-exclusive hardcover edition of Comics Comics #1.
Starburns Industries Press Comic Pack, featuring Comics Comics #1, Gregory Graves vol. 1: Interview with a Supervillain (by Dan Harmon, Eric M. Esquivel, Brent Schoonover, Ted Naifeh, Rebecca Nalty, Rob Leigh, Philip Bond, and Paul Mounts), Hellicious #1 (by Alan C. Medina, Mina Elwell, Kit Wallis, Jio Butler, and Micah Myers),  and Oddwell #1 (by David A. Clarke, Walter A. Bryant III, Acacia Torres, and Micah Myers).
Prints of the cover art on beautiful paper, plus a copy of Comics Comics #1.
Starburns Swag, including an enamel pin and T-shirt, plus the Kickstarter-exclusive hardcover edition of Comics Comics #1.
Custom commission drawings of the comedian of your choice by artists Robert Hack or Carolyn Main, plus a copy of Comics Comics #1.
A one-day job shadow and tour of Starburns Industries, plus all three editions of Comics Comics #1 and the rest of our swag.
Original cover art from Comics Comics #1 or Starburns Presents #1, by artist Troy Nixey. Both covers tie into Nixey and Patton Oswalt's story "Real-Life World's Finest," and the Starburns Presents art features Patton on the cover. Comes with a print of the cover in color and the Kickstarter-exclusive hardcover edition of Comics Comics #1.
Starburns Presents #1 original cover art by Troy Nixey
Comics Comics #1 cover art by Troy Nixey
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The stories for issue #1 are all written, and art has begun on each one, with a few already completed. Distribution to comic shops is set up, and we are partnering with Black Box for fulfillment of Kickstarter rewards. SBI Press's previous Kickstarter, for The Crawling King, produced a gorgeous book which made it to backers and is currently available on Amazon. So our only real risk is not funding.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello, Comics Comics family,
Here's that additional message I promised about the Shots Fired Kickstarter, the gun violence prevention comic I'm editing to benefit the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence and the Community Justice Reform Coalition.
We're in the final week, so if the project has sounded interesting, or you are passionate about the gun violence issue in America, and you haven't had a chance to back Shots Fired yet, please take a look. Just $20 for a paperback or $35 for a hardcover—or even $10 for the digital edition—will make a huge difference in getting the book made and getting proceeds to the CSGV and the CJRC. We also have a variety of other art rewards, signed comics, and add-on books.

campaign.story:
La Voz De Mayo Cover by J. Gonzo
A resonant, neglected slice of American history is told for the first time, in graphic-novel format. Featuring art by Jason “Gonzo” Gonzalez, edited by Claire Napier, and script and lettering by me, Henry Barajas: journalist, comedian, author, native Tucsonan, and great-grandson of the story’s main character, Tata Rambo, aka Ramon Jaurigue. 
La Voz De Mayo (Page 1) by J. Gonzo
La Voz De M.A.Y.O. is the true story of Ramon Jaurigue, an orphan and WWII veteran who co-founded the Mexican, American, Yaqui, and Others (M.A.Y.O.) organization, which successfully lobbied the Tucson City Council to improve living and working conditions for members of the local Pascua Yaqui tribe. Largely due to Ramon’s activism, both in M.A.Y.O. in and with Model Cities Program, Yaqui were successfully integrated into the expanding metropolis of Tucson: families bought property, roads and sidewalks were built, and sewage systems installed. Ramon and his colleagues even founded a night school to help adults learn English and established the region’s first low-cost clinic to offer birth control.
La Voz De Mayo (Page 4) by J. Gonzo
Untiring in their efforts for equal rights and opportunities, Ramon and M.A.Y.O.eventually secured official U.S. government recognition for the Pascua Yaqui tribe. Local government didn’t give up their plans to bridge Tucson to the west coast and taxpayer dollars to the Old Pueblo’s indigenous people without a fight. The Carter Administration was skeptical of the Yaqui’s eligibility, so it took compromise from Ramon and the tribe. While trying to keep 12,000 families together, Ramon struggled with taking care of his own family life.  
La Voz De Mayo (Page 9) by J. Gonzo
La Voz De Mayo (Page 23) by J. Gonzo
Utilizing newspaper clippings, interviews with surviving MAYO members, and Ramon’s authored articles, La Voz De M.A.Y.O. dramatizes the remarkable life and achievements of my great-grandfather—and in so doing, tells the story not just of a single man, but of a family, a tribe, a nation.
It's an honor to follow in my great-grandfather's footsteps. He was a writer in his own right by documenting what was happening in the community and trying to do something about it. I wish I could've finished this before he passed away last October. But I'm confident he was proud of my and my family's effort.

The Kickstarter exclusive 32-page comic will be printed for the backers and for the creative team.

updates.update_content:
¡Hola!
Many of you may have read La Voz De MAYO, or it's still sitting on your reading pile. But it has been a year since the trade paperback was released to book stores, comic book shops, digital retailers like Apple books—and the Smithsonian American Art Museum and the Renwick Gallery thanks to you!

updates.update_userinfo: 10 Days Left for La Voz De MAYO #3
updates.update_content:
La Voz De M.A.Y.O. Tata Rambo #3 is sitting at 51% to goal!
We're cutting it close.
But I'm not worried. This is our last crowdfunding campaign for the series. Thankfully, the creative team worked tirelessly to finish this well before the Kickstarter launched, so we're not waiting to get everyone their rewards. I want to get them paid and publish the final chapter.

¡Hola!
We are only $391 from our goal to publish the second chapter. Thank you if you’ve already pledged your support! My campaign ends Friday 11:59 P.M.
Here’s the link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/hbarajas/la-voz-de-mayo-tata-rambo-2?ref=created_projects

12 hours left. Let's finish strong. Here are some podcasts where we do a lot of talking:
Comadres y Comics: these gals are hilarious, they drink beer, and don't give AF.  
Paper Robots: Logan's con experience was working my booth at Phoenix Comicon years ago. I'm proud of that guy. 
Cafe Con Leche Nerds Podcast: Armando and Beatriz came to my NoHo apartment to record this one. I was on the verge of catching a cold.

updates.update_userinfo: La Voz De M.A.YO. #2 Kickstarter is LIVE!
updates.update_content:
Hola!  
Kickstarter has recognized our project and listed it as a staff pick and project they love. We appreciate their support, but we're still going to need all the help we can get over the next two weeks. La Voz De M.A.Y.O. was established to inform and help the community of Pascua. My great-grandfather believed that an informed citizenry is a dangerous thing for the local government. Their political activism is what kept the thousands of families—that were there first—from being displaced and on their own. Sadly, the U.S. is detaining and sending migrants and asylum seekers back to Mexico, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras and beyond even now. That is why we the creative team has pledged to donate $500 to from future sales of the first issue.

campaign.story:
THE SERIES
A widow seeking revenge. A champion hellbent on losing. An assassin second-guessing her contract. With over 100 pages of story and many more pages of extra features, Dead Legends is the martial arts throwback series that hits harder than a kick to the skull, brought to you by a group of dedicated comics pros who are prepared to deliver excitement with every turn of the page. 
Yan
With brutal martial arts battles and an action-packed tale, Dead Legends starts with the story of Yan, who enters a martial arts tournament to avenge the murder of her husband. Her plan is to infiltrate the tournament grounds, eliminate the killer and make a speedy exit. But quick revenge isn’t in Yan’s future, and soon she’s facing down the most hardened challengers the tournament has to offer, cracking heads and moving through the ranks as she fights her way toward her main target.
For an idea of what we'll be creating, check out this preview:
As the story progresses, we're introduced to a cast of characters that make Dead Legends more involved than your run-of-the-mill bracket & tier fight tale. From Damon, the champion who has grown tired of winning every battle he fights; to Red Death, the assassin who must enter the tournament to reach her target; to Stalk and Ward, two tournament fighters who get caught up in the struggles that Yan faces, each character in Dead Legends adds a little more to a story that has as explosive an ending as each of the battles that occur throughout the series. 
Blind Tiger Logo
This series has been at the forefront of James' and Gavin's minds for over a year, and while other projects have come and gone, Dead Legends has always been a story they both knew they would tackle. Now that day has come. With your backing, this labor of love will have the focus and attention it deserves from an extremely talented list of professionals. 
Beyond that, you get to experience the journey of the creative team through updates, from the happiness as more of the series gets completed to the successes gained as wider recognition for a story that we all feel so passionately toward begins to ramp up. Your help in creating this series will be  appreciated more than we can say.
FINANCES 
Finances for this book are the main thing that have kept us from moving forward on our own. While Gavin and James are happy to forego upfront payment, they wanted to make sure that the talents they were bringing to the project didn't have to make that same sacrifice. Because of that, the bulk of the money brought in through this campaign will be used to pay for coloring, lettering and editing. The rest of the funds will be put toward printing and shipping costs, fees, reward fulfillment and taxes.
In this way, we will be able to create a visually and narratively amazing series while generating both a lot of buzz and a substantial readership that far surpasses what we are able to attract during the campaign. 
We love this series and these characters, and can't wait to create a comic that will live up to the vision we have for it and them. 
THE DEAD LEGENDS TEAM
• JAMES MADDOX - Writing
With titles that include Metaphorical Her, Dead Legends, Clown, The Dead & Eccentrix, writer James Maddox has created a range of the most dynamic stories in indie comics. Maddox lives in Huntington, WV, is the bass player for the rock band Qiet, and enjoys good bourbon--usually in an Ewok flask.
• GAVIN SMITH - Illustrations 
Gavin Smith is a freelance artist who lives in Indianapolis, Indiana. He is the artist for "The Accelerators" for Blue Juice Comics, Ghost in the Shell for Kodansha/Penguin Random House, Gregory Graves for Starburns Industries. He recently completed a story for "68" for Image Comics. He also worked on motion comics for AT&T, A horror adaptation of "Pop Goes the Weasel" for Line Webtoon, "Charge" A prequel comic to the independent cult movie "All Superheroes Must Die", cover artist for "Action Lab Entertainment, and has provided ghosting duties on backgrounds and inks for several other comic books. In 2012 created and self published his own comic book "Human City". He is also a 2011 graduate of the Joe Kubert School.
• MARISSA LOUISE - Colors
Marissa Louise is a colorist who's adaptable style can be found in comics from Marvel, DC, Image, Dark Horse, IDW, Vault and more. She resides in Oregon with two cats and a dog.
• RYAN FERRIER - Letters
Ryan Ferrier is a Canadian comic book writer best known for the acclaimed original series such as the D4VE trilogy and Hot Damn for IDW, and Kennel Block Blues and Curb Stomp for Boom! Studios. Through Dark Horse Comics, September/October 2018 will see the release of Criminy, his original graphic novel with co-creator Roger Langridge, as well as Death Orb, an original five-issue mini-series with co-creator Alejandro Aragon.
• SHEILAH VILLARI - Edits
Boss Editrix at Geek.Com. Dog Mom AF. Practicing Ravenclaw. Winter Soldier Influencer. Asset to the War Department. INTP. She can be found pursuing your local coffee shops, record stores, and comic emporiums.
CHECK OUT PINUP ART FROM FRIENDS!
We've asked a collection fo friends to give us some of their takes on our characters--mainly to show how much we love these creators and their work--and whoa, did they deliver! There are more to come, too! Be sure to click on the images to find more from each creator!
Jorge Corona's take on Yan Nakamura
Jen Hickman's take on Red Death
Tony Gregori's take on Barbosa (Colors coming soon!)
Ali Cantarella's take on Ushi Nakamura
Matt Lesniewski's take on Stalk & Ward (Colors coming soon!)
Dan Dougherty's take on Red Death
 REWARD TIERS
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
And that's the campaign! Thank you for taking time to check out Dead Legends. We hope you have enjoyed our push to get this story created and look forward to the journey that will see this series finally to print. 
Once funded, we will include stretch goals that include Tournament Coins, Enamel Pins, and Blind Tiger Hoodies! But for now, we're just hoping you'll help us in contributing to or sharing the project.
Thanks again! We love you for helping us create a story we believe in, and we can't wait to rock your sock off with Dead Legends!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Everyone involved in Dead Legends has been working in comics for quite some time. We know how to meet our deadlines, be it with personal projects or with published work, and we know how to produce great work while doing so. 

As of launch, we have the first issue complete with inks and awaiting colors and letters, and we have half of issue two complete with inks. That means we have a little over three issues left to produce. This will take time, but this series is at the top of our list to get done and ready for readers both here and out in the rest of the world. 

That said, life happens to the best of us (just ask James about his recent wreck on I-78), but there are no foreseen obstacles that would delay us more than a few weeks in the production of this book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone!!!
Last year, we canceled the Dead Legends campaign and after we talked to Tyler Chin-Tanner from A Wave Blue World, who enjoyed the story we were proposing, the art, and the drive we put into making this book happen. Now, a year later, the trade paperback for Dead Legends is up for pre-order in Previews! 
We wanted to let you all know and say thank you a million times over for being the first to throw support toward this series.

Hey, everyone!
I'm back from NYCC, but I've barely had a moment to consider my feelings of what happened with Dead Legends on Kickstarter.  
As you may have noticed, I went ahead and cancelled the campaign for Dead Legends. My first instinct was to defend the decision to cancel the project, but instead, I'm just gonna say I'm very proud of the campaign and what we were able to accomplish with it. 
Though we weren't able to bring it all the way home, when I look at the amount of backers and the money that was raised, it makes me happy to know that we pulled in so much awareness and received the support of so many quality creators and fans to help us along the way. Just because our goal wasn't met doesn't take away that we raised almost $9k and collected almost 200 backers. That's a big deal because each one of those votes of support keep us pushing to do the things we do.

Gavin's Got A New Con Banner!
And if I may say so, it's a solid improvement.

updates.update_userinfo: Gavin's New Banner at NYCC & Cons
Jen Hickman Dead Legends Pinup for Red Death & Other Stuff
updates.update_content:
Wow! What a killer first/second day! 
While I've been at Rose City Comic Con, the updates of new backers and friends/fans sharing the campaign has been a boost to an already boosted experience. Also, Gavin hitting me with texts regarding new developments on the series has put me over the moon.
Before I get too far into this, I definitely wanted to say thanks to everyone for giving our project such a great spotlight.

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Justin Gray and I've written hundreds of comic books for some of the most recognizable characters and publishers in the world. I've also created and backed many Kickstarters. 
Billy The Kit is a supernatural comic book set in the old west that follows the epic saga of an orphaned rabbit hunting down the tornado god that killed his family. You can read more about it in an interview Barry and I conducted with COMIC FRONTLINE BY CLICKING HERE
I know, I KNOW, how the HECK is a rabbit going to kill a Tornado God? What even is a Tornado God? Talking animals in the Wild West? This concept is bonkers! Yep, we know and that's why we created it. 
Once a reader (that's you) takes this comic into their lives, they enter a world of active imagination, and go on adventures featuring what is sure to be their favorite new character BILLY THE KIT! 
Meet the profanity-spewing martial arts master; Luther the Goat! Meet poor Billy Langam, the sole survivor of a vicious attack that claimed the lives of his entire family. 
Why was this sickly, skinny rabbit prone to infection spared such a gruesome fate? What makes him so special?
The answers lie within this 32-PAGE FULL-COLOR introduction to the fantastic world of Billy The Kit, where a bunny relies on faith, firearms, and Kung Fu to wage war against outlaws, desperados, and the pagan gods of a bygone era.  That sounds like fun right? Well, it is a lot of fun! There's even a FaceBook page for it HERE: @billythekitcomic where you can get updates and see a bunch of behind the scenes video of Barry illustrating and inking the book! 
Also included in this book is the 8-page teaser trailer developed to show at conventions. 
BE WARNED, Billy The Kit might look all cute and cuddly but is not a book for children - this is for MATURE READERS. The language is salty and the blood is red...and also, salty. 
It might also be what might happen if you put equal parts Bugs Bunny, Django Unchained, and a dash of Jack Kirby into one comic book. 
IMPORTANT NOTE! 
The book is finished. Pencils, inks, colors, letters and all that great stuff!  That means if we are funded we move directly to printing, packaging, and shipping, which could take 6-8 weeks. However, if it takes less time then that the books will ship to you as soon as they are ready to be mailed! ALSO, and perhaps more importantly, this is the only comic where you can see a gory Goat V.S. Sasquatch deathmatch!
WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?
Illustrator Barry McClain Jr. and digital painter Slamet Mujiono are compensated for their hard work in bringing this comic to life on the page and screens for all of you amazing people to enjoy. 
After that, the funds are allocated for printing, packaging, shipping, and supplies as well as Kickstarter taxes and processing fees. Not surprisingly those expenses add up quickly.
If we're fortunate enough to raise more than our goal, we'll use what's left over to make more Billy The Kit comics! Ideally, the long-term goal is to take the book to a publisher and tell stories for years to come. First things first though we want to make issue #1 a success.
 Check out the reward incentives on the right and images below for details. 
Super Deluxe 52-PAGE Kickstarter Exclusive Variant
We're only going to print 75 of these with this cover and the additional print material: The Script, Character Designs and this Alternate cover based on the reward print and original art! 
Billy The Kit Color Mini-Print
A Gorgeous Mini-print in full color by series artist and co-creator Barry McClain Jr. With colors by Matt Northrup. 
 Jonah Hex Paperbacks & Issue #1
Jonah Hex Trades
One of the most feared bounty hunters in the West... 
Jonah Hex has spent his entire life roaming from town to town searching for his next paycheck and earning it with a fierceness that's earned him a reputation for being a stern dealer of frontier justice. But behind that hard exterior exists a man who longs for the same comforts as any man - including love. 
 FEATURING ART BY Tony DeZuniga, Darwyn Cooke, Jordi Bernet, J.H. Williams III, Rafa Garres, Giancarlo Caracuzzo, Vincente Alcazar, Phil Winslade, Brian Stelfreeze, C.P. Smith and more! 
Bullets Don't Lie sample Darwyn Cooke.
Jonah Hex Tall Tales Jordi Bernet
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I use Kickstarter to raise money to compensate the art team for their incredible work and for the printing, packaging and the shipping costs involved with Kickstarter. For that reason, there are no actual risks for backers. If the funding goal is met, you get the rewards sent to you. All of my production and shipping challenges have been ironed out and solved over the course of a dozen successful Kickstarter campaigns either on my own or with a creative partner. Of course, there are always unforeseen events such as dogs eating packages, the Post Office shenanigans, there have been past backers whose packages were taken from their front porches, the world is a turbulent and uncertain place. For that reason, tracking numbers will be used to make sure I know what happened to your delivery should some gremlins get to it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: BILLY THE KIT RETURNS IN APRIL
updates.update_content: It has been a long wait, and I am excited to say we are finally done with the five issue miniseries. The book is drawn, colored, and lettered including extras, tons of covers, and a lot of crazy kung-fu monster hunting fun. This book started as one thing and with the addition of Barry on art and Slamet on color we went in unexpected directions that surprised even me. If you haven't seen the landing page yet you can sign up to be notified of our April 6th launch right here: BILLY THE KIT RETURNS!

updates.update_userinfo: What Happened to Billy The Kit?
updates.update_content:
Howdy folks, 
I hope this update finds you well. It has been an age since Billy The Kit #1 rode into your lives, and because I've been locked up at home for nearly 2 months, I figured the least I could do was address what Barry and I are up to. As of right now 4-issues have been drawn and lettered. That's right 4 full issues written and drawn and all together we have roughly 100-pages of kick-ass mature readers talking animal horror western ready to roll. Here's a rough cut of one of our new pages.

updates.update_userinfo: Good Morning, Billy The Kit Backers!
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone!
I wanted to let you know that Barry is hard at work drawing the next chapter of Billy the Kit. Updates can be seen on our FB page if you're so inclined. At some point, I'm sure Barry will be doing videos of work on the pages and those are always great. https://www.facebook.com/billythekitcomic/  It is the holiday season so on behalf of Barry, Slamet, and myself have a safe and happy December and a great New Year! We will be back in 2019 with more!

updates.update_userinfo: Good morning Billy The Kit Backers
updates.update_content: Howdy, folks! I wanted to let everyone that has filled out a survey know that all of your books will be in the mail tomorrow if they aren't already on their way or in your hands. If you haven't filled out a survey please do so when you can.

Good morning and happy New Comics Wednesday backers! The books arrived yesterday, which is awesome and I'm already signing and packing them up to send to you. Sure that is great news by itself BUT as you know Billy The Kit is about a gunslinging rabbit hunting down and killing TORNADOS. So that explains this alert on my phone:

campaign.story:
WHO WOULDN'T PUNCH A NAZI?
Everybody knows who the Nazis are. More so, if you saw a Nazi, you would want to punch that Nazi right across his face. ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS is the next best thing to actually punching a Nazi.
This 44-page anthology addresses the Nazi-like racism that has been plaguing America for many years. The creators of Always Punch Nazis address rising issues in America and how to handle bigots who want to oppress various citizens. You will learn the most effective way to punch a Nazi, a historical adventure about what happens when you continuously turn the other cheek, how fighting for what's right can be passed down through many generations, and many more fun tales about standing up for what is right.
Final Cover
Join the Always Punch Nazis creative team by picking up a copy of this satirical graphic novel anthology. 
Printed Books!
WHO IS BEN FERRARI?
After the horrific events in Charlottesville, Ben Ferrari, the CCO of Pilot Studios, approached his team with a challenge. He and Silas Dixon wanted to do something to help battle the growing racial divide in the United States. This mission led to the birth of Always Punch Nazis. "Who wouldn't want to punch a Nazi?" quickly became the motto for the book you are purchasing. 
WHERE DO THE FUNDS GO?
The creators of Always Punch Nazis donated their time and talent to create the book you are purchasing. The funds to this campaign will go to Kickstarter, the printing cost of the books, shipping supplies, and postal fees.   
A one page story from Kurt Belcher and Luis Rivera!
 HILARY BARTA
Hilary Barta joined the Always Punch Nazis team, contributing the artwork for the back cover of the book. Here's a little information about this fantastic artist. 
Cartoonist Hilary Barta writes and draws comic books. In recent years he has contributed to SpongeBob Squarepants and The Simpsons line of comics, including The Simpsons’ Treehouse of Horror. His art and writing have also appeared in Garbage Pail Kids, Heavy Metal, Creepy, Fear Agent, A-1 and The Goon. He's probably best known for his humor and parody comics, such as What The--?!, Plastic Man and Stupid, and as the co-creator of Splash Brannigan with Alan Moore at America's Best Comics. Barta began his career as inker on many comics for publishers including Image, Marvel, DC and Dark Horse.
Hilary Barta Back Cover. Not final art.
Instruction manual included in comic and as a print for all physical backers!
Sample Interior Page
Interior Page
The "Who's Who" of Always Punch Nazis. 
Inside Front Cover
 Free sticker now included for ALL physical backers:
A neat sticker to put on your nearest street sign, your car or anywhere people need reminding that you ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS!
Sticker going out to every physical backer!
Sample art for the Luis Rivera reward. This image is not included in Always Punch Nazis.
Sample art for the Kurt Belcher reward. This image is not included in Always Punch Nazis.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The 44-page Always Punch Nazis Anthology is complete with samples in hand. This means supporting this Kickstarter has very little risk.

Unfortunately, there is always a little risk. Since the funding is mainly going to the printing costs of the book, there may be a slight delay due to certain uncontrollable circumstances from the printer. Pilot Studios wants to make sure your copy of the book is perfect and we refuse to send out a single issue before it meets our high standards.

Sometimes books can be damaged in transit to your house. This is another uncontrollable risk that we at Pilot Studios do our best to eliminate. In the event that your book arrives damaged, we will happily send you a brand new copy.

That's it. The book is complete and ready to go, eliminating many of those production risks that occur when you're supporting comics on Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Pilot Studios Present The Carriers #1 - The Croc King
updates.update_content:
Hey guys, Jay Huwer here for Pilot Studios.
I wanted to give you an update on Pilot Studios's newest Kickstarter, THE CARRIERS 1 - THE CROC KING.
The Carriers is Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles with a Muppet Babies twist told through the eyes of CARRIER PIGEONS?!?!?!
This book is the first of five that make up season 1 of the series. In The Croc King, four weaponized pigeons search for a mysterious foe who is pulling New York City's many strings from the sewers below.Check out the first of five connecting covers by Elias Martin. I also included an image of the five connected covers for you to enjoy. If you're interested in learning more, click the link below.

We're LIVE.
http://kck.st/2DatoRu

Ben

On July 4th, we're launching Always Punch Nazis Vol 3! 
We've been able to surpass the quality of the first collection of stories while maintaining the quality of the excellent second book, so this is not an issue of a quality drop as the series progresses, happy to report!
Here's the cover:

Hey!
You thought you were just packing an anthology about punching nazis, right?! I pretty much thought that's what we were making. Little did I know the impact from this series of books would be far reaching and change the lives of so many people and possibly, change the course of an entire industry.
Making APN has set off a chain of events that has led to the first tech company unionizing, something extremely important to me as a union-man of sixteen years in the electrical industry. Kickstarter, as of today, is a union, called Kickstarter United!

Good evening Always Punch Nazis backers. Jay Huwer here with a huge announcement from Pilot Studios. 
It's been a little while since APN wrapped, but we at Pilot Studios not stopped working on the next book. APN 3 is in production. That Kickstarter is looking like a summer launch. In the meantime, Pilot Studios just launched the next huge adventure ... ZION WARS. 
This book is a major crossover pitting the entire Pilot Studios universe against a foe too big for one of them to handle. Zion Wars tells the story of a ragtag group of misfits that must act fast to save the heroic son of Hitler before a demon claims his soul. This team is not friends and they don't like each other much. In fact, the only thing they have in common; they're all heroes.

We've crossed our threshold to make this book happen, so thanks to all of you who have decided to support APN Vol. 2! For those of you who havn't, you've got FOUR days left in the Always Punch Nazis Vol. 2 campaign! This volume beats the first by a mile, in my humble opinion... and I am extremely proud of APN Vol 1.
Here's the link to the APN Vol 2 campaign!
http://kck.st/2ZcSmoQ

updates.update_userinfo: Always Punch Nazis Vol. 2 is LIVE
updates.update_content:
Hi. 

Around a year later, we've got Volume 2 finished and have proceeded with a new Kickstarter campaign. I won't assume you're all onboard for Volume 2, but if you enjoyed Volume 1 and thought it was a solid effort, I believe Volume 2 is a better book, not gonna lie.
Returning for Volume 2 is a back cover by Hilary Barta. We've got Chuck Wojtkiewicz on the cover and writing a story.

Hey!

We're planning a launch for next Monday for Volume 2!

More later!

Hi everyone! I wanted to share some things we've got coming down the pipeline for APN Volume 2! I jhope you all enjoyed the book, feel free to let me know your thoughts on it!
Check this out, a early version of the cover to Volume 2!

As of yesterday, all backers have had their orders shipped! If by the end of the week you haven't received your book, please contact me!
I've now got the book available on Etsy if you know anyone wanting to grab a copy:
https://www.etsy.com/PilotStudios/listing/666199410/always-punch-nazis-original-graphic?utm_source=Copy&utm_medium=ListingManager&utm_campaign=Share&utm_term=so.lmsm&share_time=1549146268165

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Terry Mayo and I'm the writer and creator of The Wicked Righteous.
The Wicked Righteous is published by Alterna Comics, is distributed by Diamond and ordered by comic shops from all around the world. 
This journey began in August 2017 when The Wicked Righteous was released on classic newsprint as a 6 Issue Limited Series... and there has been no looking back since!
The response from readers has been humbling, to say the least, as fans from all over the world shared their love for the story but one question kept popping up from the fans...when and where will the collected Graphic Novel start? 
The answer is - HERE & NOW!!!
The funds raised by this Kickstarter campaign will go toward producing a REMASTERED 170+ page Graphic Novel. This Graphic Novel will include the first SIX issues of The Wicked Righteous, FOUR Wicked Righteous short stories originally published in "It Came Out On A Wednesday", a handful of Awesome pin ups... and it will ALL be printed on PREMIUM MATTE paper!! 
Lucas Romero, Chris Hall, Brandon Destefano and I poured our hearts and souls into creating this wold, and I look forward to sharing it in its entirety... as it was meant to be experienced!
The Wicked Righteous Vol 1 (Graphic Novel)
                    THE WICKED RIGHTEOUS Vol 1 (Graphic Novel)
(W) TERRY MAYO
(A) LUCAS ROMERO
(C) CHRIS HALL
(L) BRANDON DESTEFANO
In post-apocalyptic San Diego, four teenage brothers rescue a young girl from a brutal gang of psychopaths and spark a chain of events that attract an onslaught of unspeakable evil. This is the world of the Wicked and the Righteous... and the children will lead them all.
The Wicked Righteous

The Wicked Righteous
The Wicked Righteous
The Wicked Righteous

Every project comes with its own unique risks and challenges BUT rest easy - the entirety of The Wicked Righteous has been completed with single issues available on Comixology and at comic book shops around the globe. The goal of this project is to fund the graphic novel edition and have it ready to ship by November 2018.
